v5c6EWhNaZpcr-NyU4Y5iA.text: Food was very good and the portion size is huge so try sharing the dishes. I had teriyaki chicken plate

vH7mIcfxj257Mqnl7iXIqA.text: I've been here a couple of times now and the food, while having huge portion size, is just okay.  If it wasn't super convenient to my house, I would not eat here.  The loco moco items are just too heavy and greasy for my taste.  There is often literally puddles of grease throughout.  The kalua pork is alright.  At least they actually drain it, unlike Ohana up the road.  The proportion of meat to cabbage is good.  The teriyaki chicken is too overcooked and rubbery.  Their desserts are yummy and have a homey taste and is really what keeps me coming back here.  Honestly those huge portions are just too big and I would rather have the option to do like a "mini" or half-order for half the money.  I don't want to eat this unhealthy food for three meals in a row.  Vegas is really bad about getting more money out of people by giving them huge amounts of mediocre food.  Although, I occasionally go to a wide variety of the many Hawaiian fast food places around this part of town, overall, Rice Trax is the best. And L&L at least is very consistent.  They all have dishes that are a lot better or a lot worse though, so depending on what you like, you should just try them all once and see what works for you.

Uif4cGZnmG-Z4RbWe5az-g.text: As a Hawaii resident, I believe in supporting our local community.  I am here in Vegas at least half the year as I also have a residence here and...dont know why I have never come to eat here before but today was the first.    Started with the Pork Won Tons as an appetizer.  I loved it - but I love deep fried stuff. Nuff' said.  I had the Furikake Chicken which was awesome.  The portions on the plates are worth your money.  I barely finished one third of my plate and took the rest back home.  The chicken is boneless and smothered with their Furikake sauce. My husband had the pork chops. 2 big chops topped with onions.     Service was great - with Aloha.  Decor is okay. Not too "tourist" looking but you can tell from Hawaii.    Left with a takeout menu as we will definitely do take out as well as dine in again.

OdTsrIm_lISLYI9fGwlUog.text: I came here with my parents after we went to look at a house in a nearby neighborhood off of Durango. It's about 15-20 mins off the strip, so I would only come if I were in the area.  Upon arriving to the complex, it looks dark and like everything is closed. Once you open the doors to the restaurant, there's so much light and space!  When we came in, the two waitresses were busy with other customers, so they told us to sit wherever. We also had to get our own menus since we were in a hurry. I'm used to the type of service where they pamper you and can get annoying by asking you too many questions. This was the complete opposite, but the waitresses were super sweet so I can't complain! Plus since I told them that we were sharing, they brought out an extra plate. Some places you have to remind or specifically ask for a plate.  The portions are HUGE and extremely filling! We got the Teriyaki Beef (I'm not sure exactly the name) and the Chicken Katsu Moco Loco. It came out relatively quickly. Each plate came with the respective meats, two scoops of rice, and a scoop of macaroni salad.   My mom and I shared the Chicken Katsu plate, which had chicken that was deliciously crunchy and well-made and came with some sort of BBQ sauce on the side. The macaroni salad was also good; it is light and a good complement to the flavorful food. My dad's Teriyaki beef was good and reminded me of Korean BBQ. It was slightly salty and too flavorful for my liking, but if you mixed it in with the rice, it was much better.   We saw some other people get the Korean short ribs, which looked awesome so if we're in the area, we're definitely getting it!  The prices were relatively cheap! It was around $9-12 for a plate with meat, rice, and macaroni salad. I'm not sure what the poke was, but it was listed three times on the menu, each time ranging around $17-20, which deterred me from ordering it.  Summary: Good (tasty food and pretty good service) Bad (far from strip and not too visually appealing building)

94KQBP2tKELfDGQwgge0wg.text: Island Flavor.. Hmmm I don't really know what to say about this place...  Ambiance: Total FAIL. It feels as if they just put some chairs and tables in a empty lot. No color on the walks but they did just put some random potted plants in the corners..  Food: portion wise they give you a TON. I love loco moco's so I have this one a try. The gravy was too thick and the worst part... My meat wasn't cooked. I didn't complaint to the server since I didn't want to wait again while my partner was finished with her food already.   I don't know if I would go back for their loco moco but I've heard good things about the other plates. So maybe ill go back and try something different... But not anytime soon.

cBFOAYy2J79iOsQ4o37lGQ.text: Great place to go if you're craving Hawaiian food while in Vegas. The portions are ridiculously large - two could get away with sharing one plate. Highlights of eating here would be the furikake chicken, kalbi short ribs, and their mac salad. I'm a fan of the traditional loco moco with hamburger meat, but the chicken katsu loco moco was worth trying. Make sure to order it with the egg cooked over-easy!   Overall, the service was friendly and the food was delicious. Would definitely come back again!

RW7BvRzUdwgSfXqqqFJ5qw.text: The best hawaiian food ever!!  My husband and I have been religiously coming here just about every weekend.  Their portions are so big that we usually order one entree and share it and we still can't  finish it.  Our fave is their Lau Lau which is usually served on Fridays and they do run out pretty quickly so I recommend going early before its all gone.    This place is definitely on top of my list!!!

JXNunIiikltMwFS36WZcpg.text: Great place! Great customer service, they obviously care about what people think! Which is rare these days!

NI1ZFfG6IQUKNOI8FXjR9A.text: I had the Kalibi Ribs and oh my goodness!!  Amazingly tender and the flavor was phenomenal.  I also had the Ahi Poki, which was ono-licious.  The Ahi was fresh and seasoned perfectly.  We went there on a Saturday night and there was a live band playing island music.  A very casual restaurant with amazing island flavor with huge portions and the staff was equally great.  You definitely feel the aloha here!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix Plate: Kalbi Ribs and Furikaki Shrimp $10.50
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix Plate: Kalbi Ribs and Roast Pork $10.50

KVAL_BKqi4tEel2KoklMVw.text: *updated* been here a few more times...off and on.  Food is still great as always! Flavors are closest to home cooked "Hawaii" food.  Most times we get take out because service wise we just don't feel totally comfortable eating in -- service is hit n miss at times.  Like I reviewed before, they are not rude--just not very friendly/welcoming.  Dishes we love are the roast pork loco...super good gravy and the Teri steak or kal bi is very Ono.  Their kal bi is not those skimpy kine you get from L&L or Ohana BBQ...it is big juicy pieces.  They now offer brown rice and their toss greens is so good with homemade sesame dressing and sweet potato! Bumping up a star since last review since the food is on point.  Thank goodness this restaurant is close by and take out is available.  Tip: Friday Hawaiian plate always runs out early so call ahead....they also don't let you substitute.

7fwK8WdwQSJl27WfYVzxNQ.text: Wow, I am VERY impressed!  I just got back from 2 weeks in Hawaii and have been craving some ono Hawaiian food.  L&L just didn't seem like it would hit the spot, I wanted something more authentic, and this place really hit the spot!  We got the chicken katsu, burger steak, furikake chicken, and kalua pork with cabbage.  I HIGHLY recommend the furikake chicken and the hamburger steak.  The flavor of the furikake was amazing, and the burger steak was perfect and juicy with delicious gravy.  Get the combo plate with those 2 items for $11, and you will go home fat and happy!

mEMi5o9UiSik7Qc8Qh3_1g.text: I always get the chicken katsu loco moco. I get into a food coma and end up in pregnancy. I have no regrets.

KXZtw4E37FnSvCKS50b1qQ.text: You really get a lot for your money here. Prices are cheap and portions are massive! 1 order can seriously feed 2-3 people, so I always have leftovers to take home. Food is delicious and fresh. My favorites are the chicken katsu and kalbi. I also tried the cocoa puffs which are 6 for $5. Service is pretty fast and the staff is always friendly and helpful.  I live for the chantilly cake they serve. The best!

AXlGUCYzuMbsAU56_4RT6A.text: I was not disappointed.    Had the Loco Moco, and it was an extremely hearty portion.  The gravy used to smother it all was very tasty.  Even the beef patty seemed high quality.   I will be back!

zVSv0AzZy96ol2CL6mIyPw.text: Service is bad!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Especially the cashier!!!!!!!!!!! The girl gave bad looks while I was ordering, and she purposely/intentionally took the orders of 3 customers who werent there yet when I arrived... She constantly interrupts my ordering while continuously prioritizing other customers who just got in. Very rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!

yDGdFsFrCUf_I0_3VSZwww.text: The place is packed with islanders every time we go. I love everything I've ever had but my main favorite is the mix bbq meal which gives you more meat than anyone should consume. I also get the spam musubi.  Always have leftovers and save the musubi for a snack. This food makes me happy and full in the best way. Sooo good.

e1O_5JZmChkjv2GwLpeB0Q.text: It's been a while since I've had True island home food and this place was amazing. I had the special fried omelette with Portuguese sausage and don't expect a huge portion. Was so good but couldn't finish it all. Also had the Korean chicken and oxtail soup, so delicious! Server and service was execellent! Reminded me of back home in Hawaii the aloha spirit. And to top off a great brunch my family and I shared the guava cake and the Chantilly cake. Omg was so good! Love this place and will definitely come back when we visit the family in Vegas again.

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chantilly Cake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Soup

DjOSonGAxe23KAc3ieH_KA.text: Bad ass food. Crappy ass host/servers. Placed in a take out order. I knew it was going to be a while so I got there 25 minutes after placing the order. Gave them my name when I got there. Another server asked for my name which I gave. They attend to some other customers. Few to go bags brought to counter. Servers asked for my name again. At this point we are at 15 mins. Waited another 15 minutes after that. Same server asked for my name again... waited 10 mins. Another server comes out and ask for my name then asked for my order. She looked at one of the bags and there it was; sitting right on the counter all nice and cold. Told her how long it's been out. She grabs the bag and brings it to the back. 10 mins later... nothing... I left... don't normally write reviews unless it's a constant occurrence. Third time this happened. Too bad they can't handle the rush. They're good but not good enough to be constantly messing up like this. Other places around that's just as good or even better

FaeJu5JQWhuB4hZR55RV-w.text: This was my first time trying Hawaiian bbq, and I must say, that while I enjoyed the flavors and tastes, I felt the execution was rather poor.  While we didn't have to wait for a table (party of 2-myself and my boyfriend), we did wait an extremely long time for a server to come take our drink orders. They seemed very understaffed for a Friday afternoon/early evening. Our server was very nice, and she even brought out a sample of their special stew for me to try, and she gave me props for even trying it, considering I'd never had Hawaiian food before. I ended up ordering a combination plate with chicken katsu and beef teriyaki.   After the waitress took our food orders, a rather large party of 10 or so people came in, and she asked us if we would mind moving to another table to accomodate the party (pushing the tables/chairs together), so we moved, and she said she would give us dessert on the house, which I thought was really nice of her.  We ended up waiting around 40 minutes for our food. I was starving at this point. They must have been short staffed in the kitchen as well. I dug in to my food the second I got it. Their macaroni salad was divine. I have never had macaroni salad that tasted that good before; it was this creamy and salty sensation that hit all the right taste buds. I wish I had more of it. Their rice was just as amazing. I felt like I could have eaten 4 scoops of it instead of 2.   The entrees weren't as good as I hoped. The chicken were cut into huge pieces, which I thought was a plus, but that katsu sauce was extremely salty and potent. I only put a dab onto each piece and it still overpowered the chicken completely. I didn't care for the sauce at all. It was so salty and meaty tasting (probably loaded with MSG) that it made me dislike the dish. I had better hope for the beef teriyaki, but that let me down as well. It was again, extremely salty, almost to the point of where I couldn't eat it. The meat wasn't cooked uniformly, some pieces were immensely rare, and others were extremely well done. The meat was also very fatty, and I didn't enjoy having to constantly cut off the fatty parts from the meaty parts.  The meal was really saved by dessert. Their mud pie was so huge! I have never seen one like that before. It was covered in whipped cream (yum), nuts, and a duo of caramel and chocolate sauces along with a drizzle of honey. It was perfection. I wanted to eat all of it, but alas, my stomach is only so big. I savored the parts with the crust the most, but this was definitely one of the best desserts I've ever had the pleasure of eating.  Overall, the service was good, the wait times were atrocious, and the food was hit or miss; thus, deserving of 3 stars.

aMQVhIl2HzwJukDc_DiyJg.text: Easy to find, lots of parking.  Excellent service, great local menu and the portions were large and tasty.  We'll be back for sure.

nuxOaWMdue1D1rpijEkevg.text: Yum... had the mixed plate!  The furikake chicken was delicious and crispy, and the teriyaki chicken was really tender and it tasted like it was charred on a grill, it was surprisingly really, really good!  The mac salad was good.... got a side salad instead of rice, and my friend got the fried rice with her mixed plate (she had furikake chicken and katsu chicken - super crispy!)   The portion was huuuge... the amount of meat was so generous as was the fried rice.   And of course we had to get a slice of Guava Cake... I purchase that huge cake from Andrea's World of Cakes a few doors down whenever birthdays come around...sooooo goooooddd..... they didn't have decaf coffee :( but the cake was delicious!!!

6XUtyOG6CV2MBzyP2Wu0og.text: Food & Service is Excellent. 10/10 would HIGHLY recommend! The loco moco here is unmatched and the serving size for the guava juice is great! The whole environment is so friendly and welcoming I love this place. If you're craving Hawaiian food make sure you stop by and pay a visit!

4YHWYo230h64MPH-ZPhSDw.text: Very disappointed in the new ownership.  I certainly can't speak about what the financials were when they took over, but either things were good, or not good.  Something there made them make the changes they did.    One day I walk in and all of a sudden, my favorite dish, the Kalbi Short Ribs went from $11.99 to 16.99.  I bit the bullet at the time because one thing they were known for was their generous serving.  They usually have gave you 5 strips of the short ribs. I told myself $11.99 was a steal, $16.99 is a huge jump, but I guessed the portion was worth it.   When the dish came, they now only give you 3 strips of short ribs.  So I can't blame anyone but myself.  I just ate it, and left. L  I will say this, their service was, and still is one of the friendliest in town.  The cooks are still doing a great job as the ribs still tasted good.  This where the 2 stars come in, it's one star each to thank to them for their hard work.  I simply can't give these new owners any more of my money.  It's not the prices, I spend a hell of a lot more at other establishments, but the way they did it was not smart.  It's the principle.    My quest begins for a new Hawaiian BBQ place...if anyone has any suggestions, please let me know!  Response to owner - I trust that you know the quality is even better.  Quality of beef was never an issue for me.  That's why I always went in the first place.  The quality is still great.  You asked an earlier reviewer what dish changed portion.  Well, the Kalbi Short Ribs is one of them.  Higher price, and lesser quantity.

7T8ELPaWWYuaWrwfcVvvVw.text: This is one of my favorite Hawaiian Spots in town. Good deserts too. If you order take out on the weekends around dinner time though plan to wait for at least 30-40 minutes. But overall great place and they just remodeled it recently too.

iVynqkrTbLoHOPy3AV_UxA.text: Always come here with my family when in the mood for some Hawaiian food. The chicken katsu is my go to. When here a few days ago and it looks like they are in the process of expanding which is good since it wasn't a big place to accommodate the crowd that they get.   I would say that the workers were not on top of their stuff. They seemed to be all over the place. We had to ask for our drinks after 20 mins from when he took our order because he forgot them.   Other than the workers the food is very satisfying.

mv6pX8FvR50SUNyT82N68w.text: The food is unbelievable BIG portion for my Big Belly POKE IS the BOMB and our waitress TINA she gets 5 STARS keep up the good work.

vGb0QopC2XWpnT5khJzl8Q.text: I need to preface this by saying, this was my first time dining at a Hawaiian restaurant.  So, I don't have a previous experience to compare.  Having said that, I can comment on flavor & overall experience.  We went in the evening & it was quite busy.  However, the wait was a short 10 minutes.  Our server was nice, but seemed a little too busy to give us the attention "first timers" might need.  My wife got the Kalbi Short Ribs.  Flavor was good.  However, they seemed over cooked and there was more bone than meat.  I ordered the Furikake Chicken.  I didn't enjoy the flavor of this.  As I mentioned above, the place was packed & there was also a band playing.  So, the noise level was way above comfortable.  At least for us.  We will give it another try & update as necessary.

RcG4HSXQmDLPhKXcUukbag.text: As a local from da island this does remind you of home. The food is as authentic as you can get. My kalbi plate was just perfectly made. Mac salad and all.

nVJXl65CSbX4U9TcNumV2w.text: The service was slow and most of the food came out cold. The avocado fries appetizer was the only thing good about my experience.

JSbDwvuOVh3nQGKnoP-95w.text: Had an amazing meal with Ohana today, especially with our server Shawn from Guam. He was so kind, attentive and such a bright light during our visit. I had the monster combo with 3 meats and it was delicious. Thanks Shawn for the great service!

Ey5ZtDqap2V_PquQZCLU3Q.text: Just a small spot filled with aloha dishing out some great Hawaiian food!   Definitely the best plate lunch in the city but be careful, you'll probably have leftovers!

MG6XP7jswb7joA6jlGAO-Q.text: I've always came to this restaurant, ever since their new management it looks waaayyy better! As much as I miss their store, it was a smart decision to close it down & connect it with their restaurant. They get super crowded so that's was a smart move. Waitress was extremely nice, I wish I asked for her name. Poke was BOMB, their lau lau was on point like usual. No matter how busy they got, they still made sure you were satisfied! Most likely bringing my family that's visiting to come enjoy some of their food! Btw I've been coming here for almost 3 years now , they never let me down!

Nysi2U8AXT41cFfdGIvHrQ.text: The whole family stopped by here for brunch and we were all completely satisfied! The staff was super friendly, the restaurant was clean and the vibe was very inviting! The portions are huge and that's saying something coming from a Hawaiian!! Surprisingly, the Kona coffee they served us was beyond excellent! My brother and I had three cups each and both of us commented how good it was. I also got the Haupia ice cream pie and I was reluctant to share it! But the portion to give you is so big we would have to skip the meal in order to finish that whole piece. Everyone at the table took a bite at every single one of us loved it! I wish they had a location here in Los Angeles!!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haupia Ice Cream Pie..... I HIGHLY recommend it!! Huge slice, it&#39;s a Must Share!! The slice is huge!

ZYTivVF-58gsLlM97IYdhg.text: Being from Hawaii, I tend to crave Hawaiian food! I ordered the Laulau special at Island Flavor... They never disappoint!! The Laulau plate came with 1 huge and tasty Laulau, Lomi Salmon, Haupia (Hawaiian dessert), Mac Salad, and rice. I requested brown rice with my plate.  The brown rice was the sticky brown rice, it was perfect!  I also ordered a cup of coffee.  They used Kona Coffee, which is one of my favorite coffees.  The restaurant was busy, the wait staff was friendly and attentive. All in all Island Flavor deserved the 5 stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

btZuNfYHxpEI3pOe_j4piA.text: First time in this location and really excited to eat here but unfortunately they missed my order.. Staff are very nice though and they apologized ... I will still eat here but hopefully no one will forget about my order next time  Time and date of visit 7/17/18 12:05 when I ordered  12:39 when they served my oder  I physically came in to order (for to go) and for some reason there was a mix up that happened (i guess i got lucky). I believe you can ask your team to give you the details of what happened  during this time since they're very aware about it. I know that it's an isolated mistake but I hope that this will help you and your team to streamline the process of your service going forward.

rjIodrJSsk_Q9JQMwpBr5w.text: 4.5 stars  The Hawaii withdrawls brought my family and I here this past Saturday after shopping at the outlets. We haven't found any decent Hawaiian restaurants in LA but Island Flavor hit the spot! Didn't get here until about 1:30pm but there was still a lunch time crowd. The plates come with two scoops of rice and your choice of side - large portions! We shared 4 dishes between 5 people and had leftovers. All for under 50 bucks!   Chicken Katsu ($9): Crispy chicken katsu served with katsu sauce (blend of soy sauce, tomato paste, applesauce, onions, carrots).   Furikake Chicken ($9): Favorite! Bite sized pieces of chicken deep fried and coated in furikake sauce. Can you ask for anything more, seriously? Must try!   Kalbi Short Ribs ($11): About 4 pieces of short ribs on the plate! Marinade was on point and the short rib was nice and juicy.   Saimin ($8.75): Noodle soup dish served with scrambled egg slices, fish cake, wontons, and char sui. Interesting, but not my cup of tea.  Definitely coming back the next time I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EZZaGaVBSv7p3czYP50lBg.text: Dined in and had some incredible food! The portions were large. The food wasn't overly sauced or oily. The flavor was wonderful and foods weren't so heavy (as I normally feel after eating Hawaiian BBQ).

__ljUK0FKpfVPUz_o3yxag.text: I've been back many times since my last review in 2013 and the food is still delicious! I've tried their Kalbi, Loco Moco, Saimin and many more and I've never been disappointed with the quality and taste of the food.   The disappointment is in their customer service. I remember dining in with a friend who knew one of the servers and the service was absolutely amazing even at busy peak hours! But other times dining by myself with other friends, the service was slow and even unfriendly. The aloha spirit should be with every customer, not just people you know. They will really go out of their way if they know you or if you're a regular there but for someone who dines every now and then, customer service is not always the best.  For example, I was looking forward to dining in today during my lunch break but our server's sassy attitude just killed it for me. Subpar service has happened in the past but today has been the worst so far. We walked in & no acknowledgement from anyone. They'd look at us but then look down or start talking to other customers instead. Not even a smile or "I'll be right with you!" I remember they used to do that a few years ago.  After several minutes of waiting, they sat us but no menus so I grabbed them myself. Our server took our orders with a stink face. Auntie, if you're having a bad day, excuse yourself and don't bring that attitude to customers! I said thank you when she set the food down, but didn't get a "You're welcome." she literally just walked away. A customer she knew walked in few minutes later and her attitude changed--she immediately smiled & was talking in a peppy voice! My friend even said "Oh, there you go, there's her smile!"   Don't get me wrong, I'll probably still come back for the food but maybe delivery or take-out from now on. Like some people on here, I've noticed that the service has gone down hill over the years. It sucks cause I absolutely LOVE the food but today's visit will be memorable for the wrong reasons.

CPeq4s_1Y06K-YKy6WNk3g.text: Always a go to when visiting Vegas! Food is fantastic and service is great. I always get furikake anything. Til next year!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IvVBrMDGJZtbepz-_IiNwQ.text: Amazing food, me and 3 other family members went, ordered TWO plates and left very satisfied. Only con about it was that our server messed up someone else's order and it almost 40 minutes to get our food. Honestly the only reason I'm not complaining is because of how good the food was. The ambient was calm and peaceful, everyone's very friendly and welcoming.

EVHbuz7h94IyNspux24j3g.text: We used to go here all the time. Food has always been good, servers are really nice and environment always warm. Price is about right. Recently, the place expanded and I think all their staff has changed. The place is always busy now because of the good comfort food that they serve. But lately, the wait is ridiculously long. We waited 30 minutes to be seated, we waited another 15 minutes just to be served water and get our orders, and another 40 minutes to have our food served. All the servers are in a hurry, they do t even come back and refill our drinks or give napkins. The food is really greasy, rice is way over cooked, dishes are clearly not as good as before. Maybe because the place is too busy and every are in a hurry. The quality of the food and the place is gone. It's sad to see see this place like this especially they used to be really good and worth the wait.

lpLZ7exow2IMqu7D8zDejQ.text: One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas hands down I am from the Islands and i moved to Las Vegas hoping to find some good island food and their was absolutely none  until I landed on island flavor the Korean chicken is everything with their fried rice man oh man keep up the excellent work the food here is amazing i mean AMAZINGGGGGG!!!!!!!!

S3qA1-Z1ffp9wRigtatswQ.text: First time here, very nice ambient, extremely nice server ( i forget her name) they will explain everything to you if you first timer. The lady who offers sample of sweet hawaian bread was very nice. We had a poke salad, luau, loco moco. Portions are huge i couldn't finish my luau, it was ok but not something that i would order again.  Once again portions are very big

GiZACH_1MsblZtwQ2Ibw7w.text: Finally tried this spot since I moved here 3 years ago and after recommendations from Hawaii friends...including friends visiting from Cali who orders plates to take on the drive back...this place is legit! When I'm craving some home style local cuisine like loco moco, furikake chicken, katsu, etc. go here! Skip the "hawaiian" food chains for some authentic island flavor made by islanders.

R3-RCGV7CNQfGRoEHhBuWg.text: Awesome restaurant. Great food here. Plenty of tables to sit around.  Tables and floors always clean when I come. Servers are nice and bring my drinks right away. I ordered the loco moco and it came to me in an excellent amount of time.  Portions so huge. Huge bowl of white rice. Thick beef patty and beautiful sunny side eggs on top!  Thanks Noah for the great customer service and hospitality

W0HxW5DU3sfrq95cWHBXzw.text: Well, looking at my pics of Hawaii got me thinking of all the good kines of food. So me and my hubby are enjoying  a lunch date at Island Flavor on the south end of Vegas.  We are having shoyu poke. Then, I am having a plate lunch of Adobe, brown rice, and mac salad.  Hubby is having loco moco with Mac on the side.  Just love this place with Hawaiian style music in the background.  The poke was delicious! The Adobe was tasty and I wanted more.  My hubby's loco moco was pretty big and looked delicious too.  It's a Monday and not crowded for lunch.  Service today was spot on and quick.  Definitely will be back again.  Aloha!

6yYDVd8pPY2SOMUhuDxWjg.text: I had an order of furikake chicken! Received a large portion for like three people for less than 13$ I think. Very tasty! Would go back to get some more.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken

uSBW316uzn4XFnhLOvpnUg.text: WHY DID YOU LOWER THE PORTION SIZE AND INCREASE PRICE???????? After the new owner took over, Island Flavor lost its magic. This used to be the best place to go to for Hawaiian food. They were always so generous with their portion size which made me ALWAYS come back. To the new owner: YOURE DOING IT WRONG and you're losing so many customers. Stop changing things, nothing was wrong. I'm so disappointed because this was my favorite place to go to whenever I was craving something. Bring back the OLD island flavor!  Edit: to the owner who replied: the cost of losing customers outweighs the cost of business. Get it right

nXiValkSJJNOSNSx2RLIBg.text: Literally standing in here for 5 mins now not a single person has said hi, I have been completely ignored by all 3 people walking by...just trying to pickup a To-go order and everyone is just too busy to help the person just standing in the front of the store. And finally got my food it was sitting there the entire time the whole restaurant ignored me....I have gone here probable twice a week for 3 months since I found it and I will never ever come back after this

SVjf_lXPyWKHG7BKJLz2hg.text: This is my second visit and i have to say that the food did not impress me the first time and I'm hoping that it would impress me the second time.  I started off my taking one star off for the crappy service. Ok sure i was kind of greeted right away, by a surly guy asking me if i was dining in. When i said yes, just me. He asked how many.   I used my hand and held up my index finger and said just one...me... Then he proceeded to lead me to a table and dropped off the menu and asked if i wanted anything to drink. I said water for right now and he looked so annoyed that i didn't have my drink order ready to go. He didn't bother asking if i had any questions on the menu just stalked off... When he dropped off the water, i asked him if he had coffee, he said yes and since I'm diabetic, i had to make sure that it would be just black coffee, i confirmed that info with him and yup you guessed it, he looked freaking annoyed that i was confirming that it would be just black coffee. Started my meal off with a very bad taste in my mouth. If the place had been crazy busy i would almost... And yes i said almost... Understand his surliness, but when you are in the food industry it doesn't matter what kind of day that you had or are having, you paste on a fake smile and smile to you guests. Maybe I'm overly critical as i am in the industry and i have days where i felt like crap but you know what? My guests never knew that i was having a crappy day.  He did improve towards the end of the meal... He was not exactly friendly but he did touch my table a couple of times to refill my coffee and to ask if i liked my food. Service(2/5)  Now onto the food.  After reading all the reviews, i was excited to try them again ...i thought that maybe i had gotten them on a bad day last time. So totally not. I was not impressed. The chicken katsu was just average. Nothing special about it. The furikake shrimp was very crispy and had a great texture but flavor was just decent. Nothing to write home about. I had to dip it into the the sweet chili sauce to get any better flavor. The fried rice that was $2 up charge was just too salty. And if i had a better "relationship" with the server i might have mentioned it but since he was the king of surly...i didn't say anything. The macaroni salad was just that. Nothing special about that either. :/ Food (2.75/5)  So overall, i won't be rushing back. I might stop by to give then a third try.. maybe third times the charm who knows? Being a little generous...i rounded it up to a 3 star.   And the kicker, i did want to order cake but he didn't ask and after the attitude and surliness...it was too much effort on my part to ask for the guava cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The damage... For the price... Not impressed with the amount of food that i got.. Maybe i was feeling cheap today. Lol
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu w/furikake shrimp w/fried rice! Chicken average. Furikake shrimp Decent. Fried rice ($2 up charge) Very salty. Overall(2.75/5)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam musubi #2... Seriously where is the spam?? :( 2.5/5

6VKlJeL5SD6ENEpVjkm7hg.text: Had the furikake chicken and it was delicious! Kalbi wasn't all that great, it was a little tough, but will come back for the chicken and to try other things on the menu.

phvVWy0xamQRUECwuIg63g.text: This place is great the food is amazing and service can't be better. If your looking for amazing Hawaiian food and great service go to island flavor!!!!!!!

LMPBVnrz-VKHscjiUENvjA.text: Excellent food.  Yummy and big portions. I am from Hawaii and these guys do a fantastic job with flavor.

hwnoQu59L-Def7pxB0XjdA.text: One of my most favorite places to relax and enjoy hawaiian food! The environment feels exactly like Hawaii. My go-to is the chop steak & roast pork combo! Prices are very reasonable and they give perfect sized portions! Staff here is always friendly! Superb service!

4MJD9LqqtGVJDLrT37GrSw.text: This was my first foray into eating Hawaiian food other than just trying some of these items from a buffet.  Three of us came here to share plates and try a number of different things.  Items ordered:  1/2 portion poke furikake style Chicken katsu and kalua pig mixed plate Kalbi short ribs and shrimp mixed plate Roast pork loco moco 1 musubi  Banana bread pudding Chantilly cake Guava cake Haupia cake Kona coffee mudd pie  There were three standouts in the savory items ordered--kalua pig, kalbi short ribs, and roast pork loco moco.  I've been a fan of kalua pig and this did not disappoint.  The meat was juicy and flavorful.  The short ribs were grilled perfectly with the meat being very juicy.  I thought the marinade was a little sweet and I didn't care for the flavor of the small container of sauce we got in a small container.  The loco moco was good as far as the pork was concerned and the gravy was good.  There was just so much rice that everything else got lost in the rice.  The two combination plates we got both came with two large scoops of rice and one large scoop of macaroni salad.  There was just an overwhelming amount of rice.  The macaroni salad was quite good.  I enjoy poke but this was different than other poke I've had.  The tuna was crunchy in texture and not soft like other times I've gotten poke.  I don't know which is the way it's supposed to be.  The furikake flavors were good.  I'd skip the musubi.  A whole lot of rice with only a small piece of spam inside.    For the sweet items, we got smiles from the server when we started ordering.  At one point he said, "You do know we have large portions?"  With a laugh, our order continued until we had four slices of cake and a banana bread pudding.  Standouts here were the banana bread pudding and the guava cake.  My favorite was the guava cake.  The Haupia was nothing special and the chantilly was a bit disappointing.  Understand that I would not turn down any of these if offered to me, but I wouldn't order those.  I found the Kona coffee mud pie disappointing.  Stick with the guava.  Now I know why my friend, Candace C, says in her review that ..."this is grubbing, stick-to-your-ribs, need-to-wear-pants-with-elastic-band-before-coming kind of food."  Service was OK.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haupia coconut cake.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chantilly cake.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first plate of some of almost each item.

1tLeSVk48z7llqyW1R18-A.text: Island Flavor was my favorite Hawaiian restaurant until a few months ago. With the new ownership, their food has changed completely. Furikake chicken was too spicy and the hamburger patty was dry. There is no more authentic hawaiian style gravy sauce taste but only strong pepper flavor. Very sad.

OoJrYaQUanSWzOh0qrxB4A.text: Looking for a Culinary Adventure...Las Vegas is the city!  Wanted a Hawaiian culinary adventure and Island Flavors came highly recommended.  Have to say, thinking this is my Fav restaurant in Las Vegas, so far.  Ordered the Mixed Plate Combo which comes with your choice of 2 meats, white or brown rice and macaroni salad.  I had the Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Short Ribs.  Furikake chicken are boneless chicken pieces deep fried and tossed in there special Furikake sauce. The Furikake chicken was out of this world!  No words can describe this soooo delicious, scrumptious culinary Flavor!  Island Flavors knocked it out of the ball park with this chicken!  Also, had the Kalbi Short ribs which was so delicious, 2 big scoops of brown rice and Mac salad.  Portion sizes are  very generous here...they definitely don't skimp on portions.   Prices are very reasonable, especially for the generous portions you get.  As you walk into the restaurant you're greeted by the Waitresses who are very friendly with lotsa aloha attentive love and beautiful smiles.  The Restaurant decor is Hawaiian and clean.  Can't wait to come back...Keep thinking about the Furikake Chicken...they're as addicting as the Senorita Bread in Sacramento...Best Hawaiian food if you can't be on the island. Island Flavors represents!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kim Chee Fried Rice with Furikake Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert! Best MUD PIE
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is so Amazing!

fVNEQ8v4kgLhcQhIP8E3cA.text: Furikake chicken and loco moco are my go-to dishes when I come here. GET THE CHANTILLY CAKE! Best chantilly cake I've had in Vegas so far. Amazing. Food comes in large portions and you get what you pay for.  The food here is usually good and the servers are friendly. However, I feel like every time I come here, there is some sort of long wait i. e. to be seated, for food to come out, or to get the check at the end of the meal. It's usually just one out of the three listed above. I mean, you can't rush perfection (lol), but it's especially frustrating when you're waiting for your check for about 15-20 mins.

3pwryp-_wQMizrNCxlzONw.text: i've been here twice. the first time was during lunch.  the food & service was great!  the second time was on a fri night and we waited 40 mins for our food.  this place does get busy but they should be able to accommodate that more and not have their guest wait this long for their food.

joNZcNTI4o5w9O1D3kZE7w.text: First time here came with a small group. Great stop for your island fix. I ordered the mixed plate with ribs and teriyaki steak.  My GF would always make a point to stop here before she would leave Vegas . Definitely would come back again

r1N1dj8ojea8Q3fJ5usNeQ.text: On the way to our volleyball tournament and stopped here to eat. The food here is onolicious! The portions are good. The food is very tasty. You get what you pay for.

fNTjLosIG0gLJGtFDV1A2A.text: GOOD FOOD, LOTS OF IT & FRIENDLY SERVICE: My GF and I went on a Saturday evening and it was packed. We had to wait about 10 min to be seated. I recently went on a low carb diet so my selections were limited. I went with the Kalua Pork & cabbage with a tossed salad. Very savory and I could have easily hurt myself eating if there was 2 to 3 times as much in my bowl. Pork was super tender as was the cabbage. Will be trying the Oxtail soup next time. And there will be a next time. Oh! BTW: The Kona coffee was nice and strong.   This is a small setting in a strip mall and if you're not the laid back & patient type you may be put off when the servers get busy. It's a regular folks kind of place so don't expect strip resorts level of service. But you will see an honest effort. Respect begets respect.

GetuefypKV9Ga0IqrHy-cg.text: Best Hawaiian food in town. Great portions. The seasoning on the spam musubi is so yummy.

c2FiXY0mgb6f6Xvm9W6HlQ.text: Traveling around Las Vegas, there are plenty of options for good eats. Most are geared towards tourists and the standard fare, but it isn't easy to stumble upon a place where locals frequent and gets packed just before dinner time. Island Flavor gets excellent reviews and they are definitely warranted. I'm only here for a couple more hours, but I wish I can sample all their delicious authentic dishes and juices. Come in and have a seat, then you'll see that you made the right choice just by looking at all the happy and eager-to-eat local groups of friends, family, and the occasional non-Hawaiian customer like myself. Highly, HIGHLY recommended!

oHnSsuc61OOQ_O-XKbSFhw.text: I don't eat Hawaiian often,  but when i do ;)  i come to island flavor.  This place has great service,  great food and the price is right.   I got the furikaki chicken and their short ribs and when it came out it was massive!   I knew i was in trouble.  The taste on the ribs was smoky and delicious and the chicken with the glaze was on point.   I definitely recommend this place!   Will be back to try the poke!

wSfioI5cRlgMHjqIvzYvNg.text: My family and I use to come here a lot when they first opened up. We moved out of area and haven't been there in over a year so for my brothers birthday we decided to come back there because the food was really good. We were so disappointed when we left.... The cooks weren't the same, the servers weren't the same and the food wasn't the same. Rice was like paste, teriyaki steak was salty, and the Katsu wasn't breaded like before. I noticed other people's plates around us left their rice on their plates as well so I knew we weren't the only ones.   The only positive thing that night was the server giving my brother a free desert for his birthday.

-oe8REjq1L-oVWaOTPEPgg.text: If I could give thus place 10 stars I would they have the best customer service  ever I am so happy with the food and dessert it's so warm and welcoming coming in this place....be warned u will be full half way through the meal I can never finish my plate I have to always  take it home. I love u guys thanks so much

m0AXKW4xu6sNZ4naVkEeRw.text: There is a damn good reason why I have been going to this Hawaiian joint RELIGIOUSLY for the last 4-5 years or so that they have been open. It's not just the friendly/attentive staff, nor the delicious, never bland flavor of all their dishes, or the generosity in which they choose to portion their food, or the overall amazing atmosphere in this blessed eatery. It's the culmination and perfect balance of all those things.  Their spam musubi is to die for. Add a bit of Sriracha and you've got yourself a whole meal. All their entree items are a dream come True for a foodie like me. Beef teriyaki isn't the skin thick kind you get from L&L (smh), but rather steak like cuts of the cow. Katsu is perfectly fried and dont even let me get started on the Loco Moco.   If you haven't, check this place out, if you have, then what the hell are you reading this for? Better be on your way to island flava!  Edit: Been 2014 since I last reviewed it. Just wanted to reassure everyone that they have kept True to their winning formula. Expect a great meal.

zUJ7cp9gH2EIVUl1ciZ2Qg.text: Haven't been to this place for a long time order the short ribs and teriyaki chicken and for dessert the Kona coffee pie. Getting the food to go so once consumed I'll let you all know how the food was.Well, I ate the whole thing lol and it was really tasty.  Short ribs have a tendency to have more fat than meat but this place gives plenty of meat, nice flavor, tender...perfect. The Kona Pie was really good but the crust was a little too sweet for my taste. Chicken teriyaki was pretty good also. This place is the real deal so if you want more of the authentic Hawaiian food flavor come and give this place a try. Have a wonderful day and happy yelping  your fellow yelpie xoxox

Everyone is friendly and on Friday and Saturday they have a live Hawaiian band.  There mac salad, chopped steak and onions, teriyaki chicken are to die for! The mud pie is also amazing.

-EjPNIi6iUZ1Kg8nAfQ8EA.text: My friend is in the hospital and she said she wanted food that was like home.  Well off I went to Island Flavor.  Truly amazing each time I visit this place the food is always the same.  Truly delicious.  Took it to my friend and the Kalbi was ONO.  I had the Chicken Katsu.  Not greasy, cooked perfectly and that is how it always is each time I visit.  At least 2 times a week.

o5vVUiLpyih3sPOD5tVSDQ.text: Best Hawaiian food in Vegas. Futukaki chicken and beef plate is what I think about at least once a week. Never tried anything else because I know I'd be so sad if I didn't order this every time. Maybe if I go everyday I'll get sick of it and try something new.

yy6BaICHTXBEXh0tTsMmxA.text: Lived down the street for 2 years and never knew this little place was here untill a friend took us. It is now our favorite place :)      Huge portions, a beef teriyaki plate will feed my two year old, my fiance and I for only 9$ but we order our own food and fight over the leftovers hehe.      As for the decor, it could be a bit nicer but it makes it more comfortable then a big fancy restaurant.      Also the service, you don't really have a server when someone walks past they check on you and who ever is available takes your order. Sometimes it's better then others but normally service is amazing.      I highly recommend this place to anyone who likes Hawaiian food.

_7i2BJHlMlsAYN0EHUrHCQ.text: The poke salad is the only thing I have eaten here because it's so good I can't order anything else. The salad dressing is the best! I would recommend this place to anyone.

NTQQ1j0_YHhuXVibSMgaWA.text: Island Flavor has become a once a week stop.  The specials are off the charts-will large portions and hearty ingredients.  The Beef Stew is my dad's favorite-and the girls there always know what I'm there for on the weekends. Service is great-nice weekend entertainment too!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu with Brown Gravy and Pork Potstickers.

EPwszXF1AOV9ozMbwv4nLQ.text: Been here a couple times and they never dissappoint.  The food is always great, great portions and the staff is very friendly.  Glad it's close to home.  Way better than most of the other Hawaiian places in town.

ECfTkJ295yChza0ob6gV1w.text: Love that this is a local spot with live music. Very simple place nothing fancy. For the amount of food they serve, the prices are very affordable.

sxquEM0iWLAF9K-dLNWAmg.text: I love the Kalbi Short Ribs. I get this order 9 out of 10 times coming here. I only try something else if I happen to go here 2 times in a time span of a few days.  The furrikake chicken is AMAZING, but as my friend says "stairway to heaven", it'll probably give you a heart attack if you eat it too much.  The teriyaki chicken might be a little plain/bland for my taste buds BUT! try it in the teriyaki chicken salad and the flavor really comes out! Somehow the rice really zaps the flavor away on the teriyaki chicken.  The coffee mud pie dessert is awesome. Yummy! A huge ice cream pie slice that's enough to feed 4 people (that's if all of you already have leftovers from the entrees haha)

2LtxKH6qppPjO5DfNN1C-w.text: Stopped by Island Flavor as I heard it was Aunty Maile's Hawaiian Food's location while she was in Vegas.  I ordered the Hamburg steak and the Furikake chicken, and expected the same thing. The Hamburg steak was similar but less juicy, I was glad that the Gravy still tasted the same, but was charged $1 for a small cup of additional gravy where as Aunty M provides with no questions.  The Hamburg steak and gravy serving was also a bit smaller.  The service provided reminds me of how a Japanese restaurant nickle and dimes you and not the family style hospitality that a Hawaiian restaurant normally provides.   Next the Furikake chicken, was an utter disappointment.  The chicken used is the standard Chinese/Teriyaki joint chicken that is utilized and overly saucy.  The sauce tasted the same, but the quality of preparation just wasn't there.  The portion of the chicken that I expected to be provided was also half.    I visit my friends here in LV probably once a quarter, and probably won't find myself coming back.

NndEldDoTwkzyziYiYM0Eg.text: Very roomy, clean, cool temp, Hawaiian / soft reggae music softly playing, tv to watch, tables are not shoved together,  polite server, tasty food.  Price is up there, but not crazy. Vey clean bathroom.

01tQxCliwHp5V2gRAaZ21Q.text: Came here for dinner, they had live music! It was dying down as the earlier dinner go-ers were leaving.   I got the furikake chicken and wow it was absolutely delicious. I wasn't sure what to expect with this dish but talk about perfection of mouth-watering proportions.   The food came out pretty fast. The staff was also very friendly. We were here during a pretty nasty monsoon storm and for whatever reason the tiles on the ceiling began to fall (randomly). There were bits and pieces that would fall and we were scared that it would fall into our food.   They were so nice to re-make our food and had it to-go.  Island flavor not only gets 5 stars for their delicious food items; they also get 5+++ for quality, friendly service to their customers. I'll be back to probably try almost every single item on your menu. Challenge accepted right?  :)

6EAxBml9tvl-VCstPWjthQ.text: First time at Island Flavor and it did not disappoint.  Huge servings and great value.  Ordered chicken katsu, pork loco moco, and the mixed plate.  Gravy was yummy and the hamburger steak was tasty.  For dessert you must try the kona mud pie!  $5 for a ginormous slice...one of the reasons we're coming back next time we're in LV.  Very clean and prompt service!

gXWv6TfQOXLuxBDLwXlbBA.text: 04/06/19 family of 6 came here to eat some local foods. It took us an hour to be seated. I think there should be a time limit cause we hawaii people like to chill and talk after eating.  This time around our portions were small. Flavor is still on point tho. We ordered the combo furikake chicken and kalbi... kalbi comes in 5 pieces not 6. I guess they trying to cut down. We also ordered korean fried chicken and that was a bit salty. Well, they need to step up there game cause Zippys will soon be here. They will see a change. Just a word of advice! Happy eats everyone! Oh btw, we loved our waiter. Hawaii workers makes the best employees at this joint.

rj-6DmKNImU-queXZngtoQ.text: I love Hawaiian food. It's usually very affordable and the portions tend to be generous. The flavors are suitable to my tastes as well.  I don't remember anything particularly standing out about this Island Flavor, but overall it is a solid Hawaiian food establishment.

You know how it is... get a bunch of locals together and we have to talk about food.  They said it got better so we begrudgingly tired.  Thank goodness it's good again.

vSTMh0GDuVjNPzMSTDZypg.text: What happened to this place? They can't even take orders properly and the service is terrible. I don't even want to post any pictures, it's so disappointing. This is literally the third time and no longer coming back.

kLo_fLyJ1NoGr3DhnAdHkg.text: Surprised to see all the negative reviews.  Well here's a real one the food is delicious and service was great. This is the first time I've been here since their most recent renovation and wow... it's spacious and bright. If you came here about 8 years ago you know they're doing it right to have expanded this much. I wish I took a pic of the food but it look so delicious we just dove right in. Must try the avocado fries, they are different and yummie!

nkmy2OlUu0Url2h5ojCHIQ.text: The food here is great. Generous serving sizes too. The guava cake was huge!! The poke was super fresh and the avocado fries were to die for. Mom had the chicken katsu with gravy and said it was good also. There was a lady giving out free samples of the malasadas they sell and it was tasty. PqLh3CMmUYtkbx669cUWwg.text: One of our fave spots to get our local taste on! Born and raised in Hawaii and now living here in Las Vegas im so glad Island Flavor has a way of satisfying our needs.  Located in the SW area of Las Vegas on Durango.  One tip if you are going for dinner be sure to get there early. The seating is very limited inside and gets packed real quick especially with the large ohanas coming to eat, we tend to take up a few tables. Lol! The menu is exactly like back home, traditional white rice and mac salad with every entree plate. Us Hawaiians Love our rice! Got some local classics to choose from...Saimin, Chicken Katsu, Oxtail Soup, Hamburger Steak and cannot forget Hawaiian plate!!!! Every Aloha Friday stop by to get your hawaiian plate fix. Laulau, lomi salmon, haupia....mmmmmm so ono! The laulau is by far the best ive had since moving here. Plenty meat and real good size for what you pay. No manini action over here ( manini=small, tiny)  If you ever wanting that local taste or missing home stop by here. All the workers are from Hawaii and full of the Aloha spirit thats what keeps us coming back. Prices are reasonable, big portions and Ono, Ono, Ono! They have a marketplace next door if you wanna snag some goodies to take home. Poi!!! Pocho Sausage!!! Hawaiian Sun!!! Cuttlefish!!! Soda cracker!!!!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Up close and personal! Chili peppah, green onion, raw onion and shoyu. Simple and ono!

O37aAZK9-0faZ-9i4I0tjg.text: This place sucks! It took an hour and a half to bring out one plate out of three AND the food tasted like charcoal and I'm positive rat turds taste better than what was being served at this joke of a place. I would give negative five stars if it were possible. This piece of garbage is future dirty dining worthy. This place USED to be excellent but clearly the quality has sorely declined. No hostess greets you; just an overwhelmed girl behind the Take Out register ignoring you and a sad clipboard to write your name down. One server and no hostess and another one or two clueless bussers for the entire restaurant is just ridiculous...but I guess cutting business costs is more important to the owners than having an adequate number of employees and making sure customers are happy and want to actually return.

n4II1zmv7Io3MivFlfcmpA.text: This was probably the worst dinning experience I've had in a long time! My husband and I went on a Sunday afternoon and I got the Sunday Korean wings special. They were very salty and super greasy! There is a difference between juicy chicken and oily chicken and this was just oily. I bit into it and the oil ran down my chin and fingers. It was pretty bad. We also ordered poke which was warm and that was an instant turn off because sashimi is usually cold. I wasn't a fan of that. The fried rice was bland and also salty. I basically left there feeling like a slug that just got salted. Not to mention I ordered a coffee and had to check on it about 3 times and they told me it was brewing and still never got it. I then had to ask them to take it off the bill. I didn't like the food or the staff attentiveness. I definitely will not try this place again.

bk1zWsBwzFSHWNlJfyZEHg.text: We came for lunch. Our server forgot our drinks. Our poke came out first. It was excellent until I found the avocado peel in it. The Mac salad was disgusting . It was over cooked macaroni and just mushy. The furikake shrimp was excellent. Service really sucked. We had to keep asking her for things and remind her. She said she was bringing boxes and we waited around for 15 min and she still didn't come. We will not be returning.   Dear owner,         Your servers have been working their for a while. They weren't new. Looks to me like you're way understaffed. Maybe instead you should've came in and helped out and not sit on the computer lying about a "new server"

yyY4WNr1PRXD31mxTLv9Gg.text: I only wish there was one in Henderson (where I live). Shameless plug, I'll just have to stick to Ross J's unless I'm on the other side of town. If ever I'm near by though, definitely going!

6MkU0lqO8khTOB9T_jhqYw.text: Food is exceptional, especially the Kalua Pig, which is the best I've ever had. Service is usually the issue. Go when it's slow and all is gravy, but today (Sunday) they only had 2 servers on for the whole floor and one poor guy manning the phones, doing Togo's, running food, etc.... Seriously. What kind of business owner staffs their FOH so thin? Is it really worth losing future business so you can save eight bucks an hour? My to go order took an hour and everyone else who was waiting was in the same boat. The place was packed, food looked and tasted good (although my order was incorrect) so there's that. Staff your business!  Dear Business Manager. I cannot believe you actually said you staff appropriate. As if one extra body on the floor would have corrected your service and to go issues. You should be embarrassed and overly apologetic for how your restaurant failed the hard working kitchen instead of insisting you're staffing appropriately. This isn't the first time there's been Togo/delivery issues. You had many, many people absolutely frustrated waiting for online orders alongside guests on a wait.  The two ladies who were serving were running around like crazy, bussing their own tables, running food, boxing orders and everything else that servers do. On a slammed busy Sunday you don't have server assistants? No host/hostess? Just one overwhelmed guy on the phone? Where were you?!   I'm sorry you don't seem willing to grasp this concept.   Aloha.

VEutHC1i9TMrcWe5wrpnpg.text: I came here after church. I've been dying to they their fruikake chicken. I came in cashier/hostess was very friendly. Food took about 10-15 mins, but it was worth the wait. Portion size was huge for a single person. I love the sweet and savory taste along with that crunch when you bite into it.  I will definitely be back this time to sit in and maybe try other dishes on their menu, but I will most definitely order the furikake chicken again!! Who knows maybe it will be a thing after church

s1xaDIv6OYrgTIsw4GZSAw.text: Poke = Fire  Ive been keeping my eye on this place for a while but have found other restaurants until now.  They close at 930 p so we got there at 8pm.  The restaurant was packed, but we were able to find a seat (party of 2).    Once we were sat, our server gave us menus and took our drink orders.  We couldnt decide what we wanted to eat because we were craving everything.  We started kff with poke, Hawaiian style.  It had inamona (kukui nut), onions, ogo, and soy sauce.  It was so good!!!! The best poke ive eaten in Vegas so far.  We both decided to get the mixed plate ($11.50) but you add $1 if you choose a mixed plate with Kalbi.  It comes with 2 choices of meat, 2 scoops rice, & 1 scoop mac salad.  The portions were humongous!  We decided to get the katsu/kalbi, & korean chicken/furikake chicken.  We enjoyed it.  For dessert, we shared a guava chiffon cake.  I believe it came with a guava coulis and a lilikoi coulis.  It is a F A T slice of cake with a lot of whipped cream.  It was also good.   I suggest this place if you want poke because the poke was really good.

After almost a year of living five minutes from this restaurant I finally went!  The food was absolutely fabulous and I am so glad I finally tried it.  My only qualm with it was we went kind of late(7pm)...on a Tuesday night, it didn't seem that busy but with all the call in orders we waited 50 minutes for our food!  Thank goodness it was good or I would have been way too hangry! Lol!

zyi6Cl_DVDcYoBTgPbgG0Q.text: We have been coming here for years.  They have redone the place and new owners.  I really like the remodel and the vibe in here.  The owner was very friendly.  The food was all still the same, however they have new plates and presentation.  I will definitely be back.  Always like a nice local place to go to in Las Vegas

Hg_1de8zrvWYGDYMpv13iA.text: I havent gone back here in yearsss until today. First thing i noticed was the restaurant got bigger and from what i was told from the waitress its a new management. The vibe for some reason was just a little different from the last time i visited years ago, they were playing country white music which didnt felt like i was in a hawaiin restaurant lol but it didnt matter. My friend and i ordered the hawaiin poke which was good and the chicken katsu, though the mac salad didnt taste so good, im not sure if they changed the way they cooked it. Our waitress was super friendly and was on top of her game refilling our drinks and making sure we were doing ok. Overall i like it but i miss the old vibe when island flavor first open. :)

fG-T569PHUNs58wDQPF-hQ.text: I had no idea Vegas was the ninth Hawaiian Island but now I know! What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas! What everyone should do in Vegas is enjoy some Island Flavor!  This place is incredibly awesome! The service is enthusiastic and friendly and literally everything we've eaten has been amazing, plentiful, affordable, flavorful, and worth coming back for!   Cucumber Kimchee! Zowie! A veritable taste explosion! Hawaiian Poke! Super fresh, perfectly salty, and delicious! Kalbi Short Ribs! Sweet, savory, moist, and memorable! Guava Cake for Dessert! Light and huge, and something we've never had before or since!  I could list every item on their menu but what's the fun in that?! Instead, you should just go there and try it yourself! We'll be back!

UdOd0LXCLaj7Zm7fhtMf8w.text: We've lived across the street in Rhodes Ranch for 14 years. We were there the day Island Flavor opened their doors.  We've seen all the changes in ownership, cosmetic and quality of food. For many years we frequented Island Flavor weekly and many times we'd bring huge parties after a basketball games, football games and family events.  Our visits have drastically slowed down because we have seen a consistent decline in food quality.   Last night we brought a party of 25 for a family event.  Several of us orders poke.  I took one bite and literally spit it out and so did my husband, 2 cousins and 2 friends.  I would chalk it up to a bad batch but it wasn't the first, second or third time.  It's been consistent since the new management.  It was mushy, was not fresh and had a smell that turned my stomach.  The other thing I've noticed a huge change in is the saimen; it's half the size of the previous portion.  My family (my husband and 6 kids) have opinions of how their favorite plates have change is portion and taste. To be fair, there are many items that still tastes the same.   Additionally, it was really stuffy and warm in the dining area which made it uncomfortable to enjoy my food.  Lastly, I love the fried avocado dish, good job!  Most importantly the service still has that aloha love! KEHAU is amazing!  She did a wonderful job handling our big party!  She was so attentive and expeditious with all of our orders! Love her!   Over the years, we have spent thousands upon thousand of dollars at Island Flavor, I'm hopeful that you take my food quality concerns and address them.   The extended dining room was s great decision and Friday night kanikapila is a wonderful touch.   Make some changes on several dishes and I think you'll be fine...  Aloha, Lei

_uIWi8IHuznqzDQhx9_A8g.text: I have been a regular customer here for over 3 years and it use to be our weekly date night spot but in the last year we have gone less and less due to quality of food and service.  Yesterday we went and it was busy when we arrived, there appeared to be only 2 people working so it took about 15 min to be seated which we understood because she was busy trying to process tickets for people.  There were no clean tables, so we had to wait for her to clean one off.  Once seated we waited another 15 min for her to come and take drink orders and another 15-20 to bring them back.  We ordered 3 orders of Loco Moco, an order of Korean chicken wings and a shrimp furikake plate.  40 min later we got 2 of the locos which were cold and the hamburger was dry and so salty it was hard to eat.  The eggs ordered over easy were over hard. 20 min later the other loco came out and we were told the shrimp and chicken were on their way. We had all finished eating and the other 2 orders still weren't out.  She finally stopped to check on us and we asked and she said oh it will be just a minute.  Another 10 min and she brought out the Korean chicken thighs (we ordered wings) and said they made them in error but would get us the wings.  Finally the shrimp showed up.  My daughter ate them and still no chicken.  Our drinks had been empty for a while by now as well.  We got up and got a box that was sitting on the counter for the loco moco we had left and finally had to get up to ask her for the chicken to go because it was now close to 2 hours we had been there and had places to go.  There were 2 tables that got up and left because they hadn't been waited on and the people next to us were complaining about service and the food quality.  We stopped going because of these issues but decided to give a final try but it was definitely the final for us and we won't be back.  Sorry to see such a great place go downhill.  I miss the nice juicy hamburger in the loco,  I am not a fan of the pork belly/hamburger mixture now.  Since the new owners took over 2 years ago and expanded, the food quality has slowly gone down and the friendly island atmosphere is gone.  We love the desserts but were afraid to order anything more because we didn't want to be stuck for another hour waiting.

DVSbRS46wZV72uo63LtREQ.text: Great local style food. The furikake chicken and the pork tinono is always a go to for the wife and I. Customer service and ambiance makes me feel like I'm at a restaurant in Hawaii.

oH7gkBrEnlnk2hCECz8dxA.text: This place is good. I always get the furikake chicken and Hawaiian roast pork. And then I wrestle myself to not get a dessert. Their Mac salad is nice and peppery. It's a tucked away gem!!

vuXyQuwcP4sTKgq7fty3Mg.text: Island flavor is always yummy! It has a great price for what they give!! We always sit with Edna! She's a great server and always treats us well! :)

hnQy8rwHJXV45mWEvX77JA.text: Food here is very delicious and feels like you're in hawaii, my favorite hawaiian restaurant in town, and they have a live band while enjoying your meal, also the malasadas are the best, and good customer service...

KSX1-FPvFvixfcoZR27Nxw.text: Amazing live band, and hawaiian kine grindz, what can go wrong with that? Amazing portion of food and totally island flavor worthy, mahalo for dinner

OUG6em4qLNm6h-Tdffa3HQ.text: When I ordered chicken katsu Togo we got no katsu sauce for it, it basically ruined my day.

3B9cAWvfdnSmxG_caVqQ4A.text: When you walk in, you feel like you're in Hawaii. Very lively with people eagerly awaiting the appearance of food. Started with the Ahi Poke which was very flavorful and refreshing. Also tried the Portuguese bean soup, Korean chicken wings, and the Loco Moco. Portuguese bean soup is basically minestrone soup with tiny pieces of sausage. The Korean chicken wings had a dull flavor. Usually Korean chicken wings carry a robust kick of ginger and garlic. Not so with this version. The Loco Moco was so good! Giant portion that could easily be turned into two meals. Friendly service in a great atmosphere.

Am3cH13ddZi9TfomE--Qfw.text: After reading the reviews and looking at the pictures of the island, local grinds served, I convinced my work to order lunch for pickup, boss to pay for it and so glad I did.   I ordered a katsu chicken loco moco which was infused with great island flavors, which consist of plenty steam , katsu chicken seasoned well with a nice breaded crunch, topped with 2 over medium s and indulged with rich, carmel gravy along with tasty mac salad on the side. Like Whoa! Did I enjoy every bite, food coma if eaten at one seating but worth it, OH YEAH! Don't know what eveyone else ordered because I was focused on my food but I know everything was a hit since everyone ate what they had ordered, leaving no leftovers for me to pick on the next following work day.  Dont know about the in-dining experience yet but the ordering was easy, pickup was fast and the food was a hit. Can't wait for another Island flavor food experience.

UMX7pIjVdBpfExZ2LDuElw.text: I eat here every Sunday. The food never fails me and Noah is so nice and genuine when taking my order and helping me decide what to get! Superb customer service and good food!!!

VpIj9k-_-0RNp98L6phMFQ.text: Food, service always da best.  Portion of food is huge.  Always will return.  They normally have live music Fridays.

dEhLapuvWi2Xs7RQd2hdug.text: This is probably the best hawaiian food that I have ever tried. Im from San Jose and we have alot of L&L type Hawaiian bbq places that generally has the same menu,  but different flavors,  so when I was going through Island Flavors menu I was really excited. The portions of food are big and share friendly. We sat down to eat and the customer service was top notch. The atmosphere is really laid back with island reggae music in the background. You know that the food is good when you devour everything on the plates and don't even talk to the people you came with at the table. We had the furikake chicken, the kalbi short ribs, fried rice, and spam musubi. It was all so flavorful and would definitely recommend those items if its also your first time here and you are debating on what to get. The only thing about the spam musubi, in my opinion, is that its made with too much rice and not much sauce, but despite that, this place is amazing. Next time I come to Vegas I'll be sure to tackle some more items on the menu.

85v5jwgNe4XQzttRjz27Eg.text: 1st visit here had the Chicken Katsu Moco and it was delicious.  This time I felt like an Oxtail Soup to help soothe my cold.  I like that this establishment offers brown rice, other Hawaiian restaurants here don't usually offer this healthier option.  I had that with my oxtail soup and I enjoy it very much. Only thing that set it back a bit was it was really busy tonight and 2 girls had to take care and cash out the entire restaurant but that didn't bother me too much. It was a good experience overall. Mahalo!

HRnQv4nedcuE6qtjPDVBeQ.text: Yelp 365 Challenge #150/365 (Operation Rice / Las Vegas Adventures)  FOR THE WIN!!!  In my previous review, I shared that we had an all day that was busy at the Adventuredome then watching the Fountains at the Bellagio. By the time that we reached our vacation rental it was past 8:00 and I asked everyone what did they want to eat for dinner?  Everyone replied, "Anything with rice"  So, of course, I opened up my trusty Yelp app and typed in local food.  Well, waddaya know...there was a local food restaurant, "Island Flavor" RIGHT DOWN THE ROAD.  If I wanted to weep with joy because I didn't have to drive very far!  I wanted to weep further because their menu made our stomachs growl happily.  I called up the restaurant to place a takeout order. I shared with her that all the plates were all rice instead of salad. She was really friendly and then asked if we ate brown rice too? I though they ran out of white rice and it didn't bother us to where I shared her that we did. But, she said, "No, I'm going to give you that in a container on the side too."   After placing the order, she shared that they close at 10 and if I got there before then and the door was locked, I could just knock on the window and they'll open up for me.   If you live near Durango, this place is very easy to find.   Sure enough the door was locked but they let us in. After we paid for our food and was loading it up in the car, she came out and told us to wait because they were also including haupia with our plates. YES!!! I didn't win no jackpot but we got some good eats from Island Flavor!!!  When we brought the food in the kitchen, everyone just wanted to swoon not only because there was rice but the portions were HUGE.  Loco Moco: The hamburger and eggs practically filled the entire plate oozing with gravy.  Kalua Pig and Cabbage: This plate was HEAVY because it was loaded with kalua pig and cabbage.  Kalbi Short Ribs: Oh my heavens...if you were ordering this plate in Hawaii, you would have three regular size pieces that were cut on the thin side. But, Island Flavor didn't give me three...they gave me FIVE THICK PIECES.  Along with these plates, they included shoyu and whatever brings warm fuzzies to a local person who loves local island food.   Breakdown of Island Flavor:  Food: The menu is extensive. Poke maybe on the pricey side BUT since this is the desert, you have to expect it. Overall, the menu caters to everyone who is visiting or moved to Vegas from the 808 state. I thought it would be like L&L or Loco Moco but nope, their flavors are more of the homecooked style that makes you miss your family back at home in Hawaii.  Customer Service: FILLED WITH ALOHA  Prices: Reasonable especially because the portions are HUGE  Location: Easy to find  Restaurant / Ambiance: Just right, clean and family friendly  Recommendation: FIVE STARS...it is a must go-to for anyone who never tried but wants to try local food from Hawaii, 808 visitors or 808 people who moved to Vegas and just misses the food from the islands.

P5ZGKMbT_c4gd_0EuKlFig.text: To start off we've been here many times before and haven't had a bad experience but this one left a lot to be desired. Our server was good and the place was pretty packed when we left but when we first arrived I waited about 5 minutes so that a table could be bussed so we could sit at it when there were a couple others open and set. This ended up being horrible as everytime someone opened the door I was crippled by the blinding sunlight and as I said it was busy so I was blinded a lot.  The Furikake chicken was amazing as always and we always get it but the poki however was very inconsistent and some pieces were down right bad. For a pound of poki we are about 1/4 of it and I decided it's better to waste it then to get sick. Overall a disappointing experience that could've been fixed with a little more quality control and attentiveness from the staff.  2 stars because I know they could do better.

JhDHvNNbmu5jUeCCWUNBAw.text: I REALLY wanted to like this place. I even tried it twice to make sure they weren't just having an off day or something. I'm actually pretty annoyed that furikake chicken is under their "review highlights" because that must mean it's a popular dish, which is weird to me. I LOVE furikake. Seriously, if you put furikake on anything, I'm bound to love it. I was really disappointed with this chicken though... Again, I tried the same dish twice.   Both times I tried the chicken, it was overcooked and dry. This is why I don't understand how it's such a popular dish. You must all have pretty low standards for food, I guess.   I'm from Hawaii and I love finding all of the Hawaiian places around town to try, but this place did NOT satisfy. Maybe I should try some of their other menu items??? A little scared though because any restaurant that can't cook chicken properly is automatically sus to me. This dish just isn't right and they need to re-evaluate the execution of it. I was expecting something more similar to the Garlic Chicken at 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate. Now THAT is some ono chicken...

vyWjbeqNvW4uKkdKCNLazA.text: Good food, generous portions, friendly staff and a nice environment. I thoroughly enjoyed eating my Chicken Katsu plate lunch while island rhythm music was playing throughout the restaurant.
