iWZyEj0AZsImvk-AgGkhYw.text: Dis place is da bomb..great customer service all around..aslo they serve sum fatass plates..well worth your money......

K2ofGdo2Ma46CHbCrtB-Jg.text: Favorite, favorite, favorite, favorite, favorite, favorite restaurant in the entire world! Well, maybe not if I go to Hawaii but as far as Hawaiian food on the mainland goes, this is absolutely the best I've ever had! I live all the way in North Carolina but I've seriously considered getting a we can flight to Vegas just so I can come have this amazing food! I like the relaxed Island atmosphere and diner feel! Everything about this place I love!

s6f5pxNDhcRmPkCqb4U8NQ.text: Best Hawaiian food I've ever had! The portions are huge and it always tastes fresh. Mac salad is the best I've tasted. My go-to is the mixed plate with Furikake chicken and teriyaki steak, and to switch it up I'll get the Kalua pig and cabbage with salmon lomi. Every time a plate passes by me even though it's not what I ordered it looks amazing. TRY THIS PLACE! And the staff is always friendly. I can't say enough good things about his place, except I wish it was closer to me!

bHyL14a1drATMAy5hhzVyQ.text: Stopped in to pick up my order. I ordered kalbi ribs and chicken Katsu. It comes with Mac salad and steamed white rice. The Katsu was, as always, tender and amazing. The ribs had amazing flavor but were very fatty. If you've never had them before and you don't like the fat, you should skip out on them. But the flavor is top notch. A little mix up with our order being sent in, but not the restaurants fault. Super amazing staff.

C7aJAtYZ54HzdKeMzBgjfw.text: Being a Kona girl living in a Cali this place made my soul & belly happy!  The staff was full of Aloha!  The music feels like home.  The food portions are huge!  My husband had the loco moco & he loved it.  It was served in a huge bowl smothered in gravy & an egg cooked to perfection!  I had a cup (cup was huge too) of the Portuguese bean soup & it tasted amazing!  I also had a mixed plate of chicken katsu which was delish & furikake shrimp. The shrimp was a little on the dry side, maybe over cooked.  The plate had 2 scoops of rice & a scoop of mac salad that was perfectly seasoned.  Will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas!  Gotta try the guava cake!!!

0BpwUJ5euCl8iAkicNsvyQ.text: LOVED this place!!!  Great food, really nice employees, no Las Vegas strip attitude!  Loco Moco: BOMB Korean Chicken: BOMB Roasted Pork with gravy: eh, OK. (wouldn't get it again) Katsu dipped in Korean Chicken Sauce: BOMB  Too bad they didn't have Poke when we visited. :(  Would I go back here again? HELL YEAH!

M7M1mCRE85V265MHLaoMaQ.text: Yummy Hawaiian food, spam Musubis are really good. They have POG & cakes that actually taste like the ones in Hawaii, maybe even a bit better.

tYjkX36lkDj7H1wpDCSWBA.text: I've tried eating here 3 times but only got food to go once.   First time i stood at the entrance waiting for someone to acknowledge me and eventually seat me. I stood there for 5 minutes while people whisked past me without so much as a smile. I left.  Second time I was more patient, I waited the same 5 minutes being ignored, then got sat at a "dirty table."  I guess it wasn't filthy but the tabletop certainly wasn't wiped very well (sticky). I waited 10 minutes before any server came to say hi, she wasn't very pleasant. I asked if it was a long wait for food ilke BBQ mix and she said it depends. She was called away and didn't return for another 5 minutes so I left.  Third time I decided I just HAD to at least try their dang food but I won't go inside. I ordered Ahi Poke and Loco Moco to go. Poke was pretty good, gigantic chunks and a lot of it, better be for $20. The Loco Moco was horrid. Plain, bland, no flavor at all, hardly any gravy, it was just plain bad.  I won't be attempting a 4th visit here. I'll just go to O'hana BBQ down the road.

lL2bkNWDiPKKD41_V024tQ.text: They have amazing korean chicken here! If it's your first time and you're not sure what to try, go with the korean chicken. The girl behind the cashier recommended it to me and it's crispy and comes with a fantastic dipping sauce. The chicken katsu is good as well and though not as good as the ones in Hawaii, they'll do. I can't wait to go and try their loco moco next time; i miss Blaine's!  Note that Yelp has incorrect hours, but I unfortunately can't remember the right opening hours to share :( So call ahead and ask them!

hLHs1h8FHsJcDJ6l06utcQ.text: We went here on the recommedation of a friend of ours. She's originally from Hawai'i and she said it was close to what it tastes like "Back Home". I've been to Hawai'i but don't remember the cuisine so I had to go on her word lol, whoops!  We Ordered: 1. Poke (Shoyu) 2. Saimin Soup 3. Loco Moco 4. Kona Coffee Mud Pie  Poke is very flavorful and it being an appetizer, we were expecting it to be very small, which it was not. It was enough for me and the guy I married to share.  Saimin Soup, man, there was a lot of flavor that I was not expecting! First off it was a large bowl, and there was so much in the soup by my standards. Wontons, the pink & white fish patty thingies (I don't like 'em but they're always in Saimin), and the noodles. The broth was so tasty! I was expecting it to be bland, considering the broth was very clear, but it was so flavorful, yummy!!!   Loco Moco, gees, this thing is huge and yummy! Enough said.  Kona Coffee Mud Pie, OMG... I love coffee ice cream and this is so MUCH better! Topped with whipped cream, macadamia nuts.   The service is also a thumbs up! They're all so welcoming, very attentive and always really sweet when we come in.   Yes, I'd recommend this place to friends and fam. Yes, we would go back, and have repeatedly.

Fvc631BK1Aj0Mw0GEcJQvQ.text: Been here twice. The new guys have a lot of customer service skills to learn, but the ladies are awesome & very friendly. The food was great both times so far. I love the way they make their mac salad, creamy. The flavors of their dishes are delicious. You really cant go wrong with whatever you order. Save room for dessert, their cakes are so soft & yummy! We are definitely returning customers & recommend this place to others.

f8PJlzOT72W5FMAFQOZZpg.text: Their glazed beef ribs is the best! It's affordable and big servings. I often visit here after we go hiking at red rock canyon. Absolutely satisfied my cravings and hunger after an intense workout. The ambience feels like I'm eating by the beach especially when the band starts to play their hawaiian music. It was such a very "chillax" place! :)

ujiN_KGWgpMrNsVtKju3zA.text: This family run locals spot is a gem! Nothing at all like the Hawaiian barbecue chains with boring mayo noodles and canned brown gravy on frozen fries.  This is home cooked island fare with a touch of love and happiness....in a portion large enough to put you in a coma!  I've actually converted 2 Hawaiian barbecue nay-sayers in their 1st visit here.  Mmmmmm summarizes.

ZmG8EfPhrMCPyZ0yX5k7cg.text: This place is on point with their food! They definitely know how to make that authentic island food that only Hawaii can give. I went in with a few friends and was surprised to see how much food you could get for under $10. I had the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco and it was hands down the best I've had anywhere in town.  They give you a large bowl filled with rice, a huge piece of Katsu, and 2 eggs cooked how you want, all of this is covered and filled with gravy. I highly recommend this dish.  No doubt about it, I will be back here again, and again.

pMIDgk56JtJl-XRlPYGp-w.text: This is where I'm going now on for my local Hawaii food cravings! The best local food on the mainland for sure.  IThis place outbeats any in LA. It's only been opened for 14 months. I think I'll be eating here at least couple times a month while I'm working out here in Vegas.  I had the portuguese bean soup (very generous with their ham and portuguese sausage), kalbi (onolicious) and furikake shrimp(I'm not a fried food fan but this was pretty good). I'm not a fan of mac salad either but this place makes a good one.  Then I ordered the chantilly cake to go. It's pretty close to the Liliha bakery one which btw is my favorite cake of all time.  I was pretty amazed I ate more than half my plate because mixed plates are pretty big in size. The owner and people who work there are from the Big Island. This place made me miss home....

hjTzGUBRcsOvE0QhYNAWrw.text: Great food, great people... Great place!! Probably the best Hawaiian food I've had in Vegas!

k8FF99hmi5eDgQJkBS6YWA.text: I come here more often now that I moved nearby and all I can say is I'm a regular.  All staff are awesome even for picky eaters like me!  Consistent food consistent service always clean chill atmosphere what more could you ask for?  Spam musubis?  R A J A H

Uy43mWXwgJpN5k_NWRmZ7g.text: Aright so I moved to Vegas recently, but so far this is one of my favorite places to eat.  I came here for lunch yesterday with My T. and Thao T. and I have to say it was pretty dang awesome.  I haven't had lunch yet, so I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.  Aright, I'm going to give you the low down.  The portions are big here, so I would suggest you go with a couple people, and you guys all try each others' stuff.  These are the 3 things we got, and I'll probably get them again.    1.  Korean Chicken - I have had wings like this once before in my life, and it was called Dry Fried Chicken at a restaurant in San Francisco called San Tung, and they are legit.  I wouldn't make a meal out of this, that's why I'm saying share.  Juiciest wings ever, and that Korean sauce is wicked  2.  Kalbi Short Ribs- Again, it's a lot of food, so most people would die if they had this whole plate.  They are so tender, you can pull them off the bone.  I want it now.  3.  Baby Back Ribs (can't find on menu for some reason, maybe new item) - My least favorite, but fantastic in the least.  It just doesn't compare to the top 2 items I mentioned.    Owner served us, he's a great guy.  So humble, very chill vibe in the place.  You can tell it's really Hawaiian.  I will come back.

lbOPJQTIS6uxaKgc8DAerg.text: Seriously yummy Hawaiian food with very large sized portions.  So much fresher than other local competition.  I love chicken katsu loco moco and the Chantilly cake.  The poke is really good too.  I always do take out and my order is ready and waiting right on time.

_9YstQaNvCcbWJXvu433yw.text: Great food.   My favorite Hawaiian food so far!   Love the furikake chicken and fried rice!!!

2ylN6YksAWvEU73oDRO2Ow.text: By far the best Hawaiian restaurant I've been to so far; delicious and authentic. I loved the service, the food and the atmosphere. I don't normally write reviews, but this place deserves a good one. I had kalua pig and cabbage, and some poke, they were delicious. If you want good authentic hawaiian food, this is the place to go to.

TEUrx853t_uDuwCmQ3ClIQ.text: Seriously, I have hit the jackpot of all Island gourmet!   I cannot even begin to explain how good everything is that I have had here.  Even the regular chopped salad is amazing with that dressing, those freshly fried wonton chips, the slice of TARO! Yes, fresh taro. Ughhhh, I have been back  multiple times and they are on point EVERY time.  I have had the hoisin baby back ribs (TWO RACKS OF RIBS, SO TENDER THEY FALL OFF THE BONE!), sweet & sour spare ribs (JUST THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF TANGY-NESS AND SWEETNESS), the Korean Chicken (DRUMETTES WITH A LIGHT SAUCE), the Furikake Shrimp (DEEP FRIED AND SIMPLE)... and my boyfriend is extremely fond of the Hawaiian Style Roast Pork. He also bragged about how juicy their laulau was, and oh, i almost forgot, the portions are HUGE.   They have great daily specials. The Smoked Meat is amazing. NOT Pipikaula, but it's DEEEELICIOUSSSS.  MAKE SURE YOU'RE HUNGRY and don't plan any heavy activity after you eat here. You will probably have to sit for longer than you were eating in order to make a safe exit!

DGmDO-h9TyB83cXvDANjpw.text: While we were visiting Vegas, we wanted to venture out of Strip and found this lovely restaurant.  Everything is here is huge, so prepare to share or come very hungry :)  If I am on a diet, this is a very dangerous place to be since I would push myself to eat them all, because foods are all that good.  Service is friendly and excellent, it's not just foods but their hospitality reminds me of our vacations in Hawaii, too.

gTpEAMVXx6AXF1YSMXbfUA.text: Generous portions and excellent food. I had the Kaluha pork and sesame poke, yum!!!!!!

0rlTpzGK9j2RD0hcxOyUuA.text: Two year's ago when my Family and I first ate here it was decent, nothing crazy amazing, but decent for local food with big portions and good mac salad. We didn't frequent here much after two years cause its a ways from where we live and like I said, the food is okay, not worth the drive for us. Last weekend my cousin ate here and said their poke was ono and we should give this place another try; so we did!   The service was awful from the minute we walked in, granted it was a Fri nite, we didnt know they played hawaiian music on the weekends so they where busy. The cashier/fill in server (heavy set girl) was rude as hell! Chomping a mile a minute on her gum, no smile, no greeting and says "you guys got reservations?" I said "No", She then tells us "I gotta check if we can serve you guys den", and walks off. Wow!!! Local kine style would be...No worries, we goin make room for you guys, not to mention the fact that I don't know of any restaurant that would turn customers away! We immediately felt unwelcomed/uncomfortable from the get. I'm local, born and raised in Hawaii, so the lack of Aloha ecspecially from a Hawaiian place put me off even more!  She comes back tells us kay can, as she's seating us I tell her "sorry, I didn't know we needed to make a reservation", she tells us "no you no need, but mandatory that you do"... Huh?!?. As Im looking around, there is 3-4 tables with reserved signs. The table we got sat at, the one next to us(customers sat about the same time we did) and other tables with people already sitting had no reserved signs. Not to mention the fact that no customers came in after us for any reservations, just a couple people coming in to pick up their takeout order, so I don't get why she needed to ask if we could be served in the first place. The vibe I got was like, who you? You not our regulars, hurry up eat & get out!   She seats us, right off the bat not letting us even look at the menu ask, "what we wanted to drink". I remember two years ago they had p.o.g . Was not even sure if they still had it? Wanted to at least ask my kids and Husband to see what they wanted to drink, we didnt even get the chance! Her attitude was hurry the f* up!, we ended up just getting waters after being rudely rushed. She brings us our waters and is ready to take our order, I was unsure of what I wanted so I asked if we could get a minute more. She looked irritated and walks off. She comes back 10 min later, giving me dirty looks. I'm trying to order and she's cutting me off while I'm talking, "you cant order it like dat, what you said? On da side?" Her attitude was just plain rude, again, like hurry the f* up!   We get our food and it was not good. The lau lau plate was a chunk of dry, tasteless pork wrapped in one thin layer of luau leaves(luke warm in the middle and shaped like a rectangle loaf, looked nothing like lau lau) bummer it had no butterfish either. Worse part, as I'm eating my rice I find a short black hair in the middle...ewww! my Husbands terri beef meat was chewy and burnt, my daughter said her korean wings where dry and bland. The poke was ono and the mac salad was still as good tho.   We already felt uncomfortable and just wanted to leave. Since we paid $50 for our food, we didnt want to just throw it out and thought we could give the leftovers to our dogs. We asked for boxes and got no bag for our 5 boxes, before we could even ask for a bag from a server (not the rude one) they ran off! You would think to give a bag if the customer got that many boxes no?   Needless to say, we will not be returning here again. Rude unwelcoming service and subpar local food!

t1C3VSdGtf3VgJMFa0vITg.text: 2nd visit..Find a designated driver when finished!! Looking to find a chaise lounge to recover (food coma?)....One of the better Hawaiian style home-cooking plate lunch locations so far. Too bad location is over 300 miles away & the outskirts of Las Vegas. Real good tasting with balanced flavors (not to salty/sweet), outstanding portion sizes ( like L&L BBQ used to be), several choices on combo plates, very good desert choices & passes the test of a good eating Hawaiian plate lunch?.. Sample the side "Mac Salad".. s/b Cool, Not too salty or watery ...A must visit before your food bill doubles a few miles away,,,,

NLPIiDCc1xuYJp85M0lnsw.text: The owner have reach out to me and appreciate your time boss! He invited me and my family back much Mahalo.  THANKS for an awesome dinner experience today!  It was a pleasure phone communication with the Boss Man thanks.  Mark, Joseline & the other guy server (SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT).  To the cooks (Food was cooked perfectly today)  MUCH MAHALO ONCE AGAIN EVERYONE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona Coffee Mudd Pie  SO GOOD! Mark recommendation and HUGE!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly cooked Kabli ribs (one more didn&#39;t make it tot the picture it was demolished already by me lol ) MEDIUM
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hoisin Ribs so good meat fall off the bone! So good  with white rice and mac salad

VDPAq-j_ZvrbHhj3nruT1A.text: Great food and so tasty, a lot better than those fake Hawaiian places! I tried the Teriyaki steak and Furikaki Chicken with macaroni salad.

z8nRzmekP3t1rrQTRxpuog.text: Incredible food for an even better price. Always so delicious, and everyone I introduce Island Flavor to falls in love as well.   The portions are great (large) and you will always want more and more. Wish they would expand the restaurant a little bit since it does get a little tight, especially at the entrance, but overall, the food and service are great.

pD0TLCThrvcOtfAnC713Fw.text: Love this place oxtail soup and furikake chicken are my favorite !!!! i always suggest this place to all the people i know i come here atleast 2x a month maybe even more sometimes !!!!

SDTachAADktxf5UuNbThjg.text: Ordered take out for two, good food, and large portions decent prices so overall a pretty good experience   Got the short rib plate which was really tasty and came with rice and mac salad   And got a combo plate of chicken katsu and furikake chicken, I didn't care for the furikake- not that crispy cause of all the sauce, but my boyfriend liked the seaweed flavor. The chicken katsu was good.

jAHq1UC9qFsqp5lIQ2mcGQ.text: So good. I recommend the short ribs. Everything is great though. One of the best restaurants in town. It's so good that I don't mind getting treated a little like a 2nd class citizen for not being Polynesian.

ZZ6qpApHfBeYAJFio9Uu4A.text: Food is fresh and delicious! Furikake Chicken hands down my fav. The Kalbi Ribs were great, tender, with a delicious flavor. All the staff was super nice, great fast service. Lots of food for the price, will return to try other items.

We4TJWCtKL8bOXfdNbwfHA.text: Awesome food and service!! They were very kind and attentive. The food portions are big at a great price. Very satifsifed with the food as well as the service

1YezHPLdqkteKRBL_i3bxg.text: Place has good food but the wait for take out is ridiculous. I wouldn't even be mad but they told me 14-20 min and I'm on 35 min already. Not cool.

Xhij1u1ffRIIgLTBMzCZKg.text: Ordered kalbi to go the other day but Kalbi portions got way smaller than usual. What happened?

bZiv9KcNapnWDaTTH7BUKw.text: This is the best Hawaiian food in the Southwest.  My kids love the Loco Moco and I am partial to the chop steak with onions.  We pick up and take out or have Grubhub delivery, either way it is yum yum.  Even my dad won't go any where else and he grew up on the North side.

OgZfJxVPrItNp8EFIEI_AQ.text: The workers always greet you with a smile on their face and a very welcoming, "aloha!" I've never had to wait for a table. They usually seat you right away, but that doesn't mean they're never packed.   The food is amazing!! The price is reasonable since their portions are so huge. I love love love a good spam musubi. Their flavor is just right, but sometimes I wish they would lessen the rice. The fried rice omelette is good! I think they use sticky rice for it butttt I'm not sure. The oxtail soup is also really good. The chantilly cake is sinfully amazing. If that stuff wasn't so fattening, I would probably eat a whole cake to myself.  Their customer service is always on point. My water is refilled almost instantaneously. I will definitely keep coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice omelette

WanMXWwN_4fmKvvcv9flZA.text: Damn good food. Fresh made to order.  Taste of the islands at its best.  Popular spot for live music on Friday. Friendly staff and wait help.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-KShNPDycdf6V7S-e6xFaA.text: Did an order for pickup off the EAT24 App. First time trying this place. 2nd time trying Hawaiian BBQ.   I ordered the chicken Katsu and teriyaki steak. The steak was JUICY and delicious! The Katsu is really good but the app didn't let me opt for gravy instead of the Katsu sauce. I would have preferred gravy. So that's my ONLY minor complaint.  My boyfriend ordered the furikake chicken and the chop steak. The furikake chicken is BEYOND delicious! The steak was juicy and amazing.  Next time I won't order the Katsu but everything else I will order again! I highly suggest the two meat plate, get the furikake chicken and the teriyaki steak and you will be soooo happy you did!!   I'll be back! The woman who gave us our order was kind and the order was ready for us when we got there.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FURIKAKE CHICKEN IS THE BEST! and also the chop steak :)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki beef and chicken Katsu

UHG7xixir3VmeH7iMinULg.text: Awesome!!!  Makes missing our home in Hawaii a little bit less... The food is delicious and the prices are great and all of us loved it from the youngest 5yr old to the teens and on up to adults!

EsLhfU5ek1wLBh1yWgtg8w.text: I have been to this location a handful of times. All of which were pleasant experiences. Servers were friendly and very attentive all of the times we visited. Please don't get me started with the food. Oh.my.goodness! My personal favorite is the Furikake Chicken. It's so flavorful and delicious! Huuuuge portions for a small price. One plate can feed two. Chantilly cake is to die for. Definitely must try! Best Chantilly cake I've had. Only downside is the small, cramped space. I don't like sitting and eating next to strangers. It's weird. It's always busy so there may be a wait. But other than that, I can't complain. I'll definitely recommend this place to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portion of Furikake Chicken!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Rice Omelette with Portuguese Sausage! (Bf&#39;s plate, he enjoyed it!)

c7pm9ulw-xwD6U06dxZtMA.text: Took my family here who's in town for the big kahuku football game and they loved it here! Hands down great island food. Wonderful poke and chicken.. yum try this place you'll love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4njOuj9Cao0FklEj5Bk-jQ.text: Love the pork the most. Authentic Hawaiian. Great staff!  My friends took me here for lunch, and this is my favorite spot now. Cheap, cheerful, fast service, and great food!

wJAJ8W_aFaHJ1k3iEMPwCg.text: Big portions and awesome food!! We ordered furikaki chicken, chop steak & kalbi, soak musubi, sesame poke, and the kona coffee mud pie.   They also play Hawaiian music which I love!! Makes me feel like I'm back home! Our server was friendly!! We will definitely be back!!

O8YGedEnclMH-Ut08MOpVQ.text: Wow, the portions here is HUGE is all I have to say.   I ordered their special of the day which was: Kalua Pig and cabbage, ahi poke, rice, macaroni,  salsa, and some kind of coconut dessert and man was it delicious. The Kalua pig was cook perfectly, soft and not salty at all. The ahi poke was fresh and very well marinated, the macaroni was good  love the big black pepers in there, and their dessert was the icing on the cake for me. I wasn't the fan of the salsa but that's just b/c I'm not an onion peron.   I also shared the oxtail soup with my boyfriend and it was good, too much ginger flavor for me though but other than that I would totally come back here to eat if I'm ever in Vegas again.

3AzGhBCbDxqr6IF5cze5fQ.text: I'm from Hawaii so when I crave Hawaiian BBQ it needs to hit home. The location is perfect since I live in the area. A plus is that this is a family owned business so you see the same friendly faces when you go in.   My personal favorite the loco moco. The beef patty reminds me of a well seasoned and cooked meatloaf. My second favorite is the teryaki chicken the marinade isn't salty and its actually cooked on a grill. I hate those Hawaiian "barbecue" place that cook their meat on flat tops. The flavor profile of meat cooked on the grill is irreplaceable. The desserts here are delicious and huge so order one for the table and share away.   Highly recommend  this place. The only downside is that they are closed Sunday and Monday but I guess they need days off too :)

VKHMjMoz7JCQh7jCyPz-qA.text: Give this local grindz a 4.5! Pretty authentic Hawaiian food here with big portions. Of course the price goes along with it, but I must say....tastey!!! Don't waste your money on the guava cake, when u can have the kona mud pie. The guava didn't taste fresh. Must try their combo plate roast pork and kalbee! Oh and also their furikake chicken, Ono! Fried rice was a no go as it's too dry and best when using non sticky rice. Chicken katsu loco moco almost gave me a heart attack as it was so huge! Friendly staff and lots of memories of the islands.

ByLXjQ4II2BRNyTpIMaeMg.text: Loooove the furikake chicken!!!! The chicken katsu loco moco is not bad too. Portions are huge.. Could feed 3 women. But i dont mind, im looking forward to taking my leftovers to go. Definitely coming back!

B1oRdUp6EcJAh7u6ENdx_Q.text: I gave this place a try on my way home from Las Vegas.  Awesome kalbi short ribs!  The staff was nice and efficient.

LC4OCw51nuT1_HfUFrVw5g.text: The food here is wonderful!  I had the mixed plate of Kalbi and Chicken Katsu.  The Katsu was moist, crunchy and not oily.  The Kalbi was tender.  The mixed plate had three huge pieces of Kalbi, 10 pieces of Katsu, macaroni salad, and I paid extra to get their pork fried rice.  I took home a little more than half my food and it barely fit into the to go box! The servers were friendly.  But the reason I didn't give them four stars was because the service was SLOW!  We waited over 30 minutes for our food.  Granted they were busy but... All things considered, I'll definitely be making the drive to try more of their food. If you are in the SW definitely visit Island Flavor!

Lt-Wbk2d7FcfLiqJzvtXtA.text: I had never been to a place that served Hawaiian food before. My coworkers have been talking about this place for a while and i was finally able to join them.   Being that it was friday they had a special "Hawaiian Plate" which has :  - Two large scoops of rice - Macaroni Salad - Lau Lau ( Only after 3pm )  or Kalua Pork  - Ahi Poke in Shoyu - Haupia - Lomi-lomi salmon  My coworker recommended it as a way to be aquainted with the tastes of hawaii.   Let me tell you the food was AMAZING.  The pork was tender , flavorful and definitly a repeat. I quite enjoyed the ahi poke , mac salad.  Im not a huge fan of salmon , so i ate very little of the lomi-lomi salmon.    I detest coconut , but the Haupia was amazing as an end to a terrific meal.   The wait staff was attentive and for the price i was stuffed.     I will definitely be bringing my wife here to try it out.

PRk1IjiR4M8FUuteewRvdg.text: Their food is pretty good here. Big portions.    My favorites in this restaurant are the ahi poke & chantilly cake.   Last time I went here, I was craving a loco moco because a couple days ago I tried one from the Fukuburger truck & couldn't stop thinking about it so I figured I'd try Island Flavors.   When I got it, it was really big like twice the size of Fukuburgers, but to be honest it was good but not as good as Fukuburgers. It didn't have that special ingredient or something. What can I say, I'm spoiled by fabulous flavors so maybe I'm just being picky.    All in all, I'm giving this place 5 stars because the food is good, they serve big portions, there's a nice welcoming feeling as you walk in, they're friendly, the place is clean & fast service even with it being busy.

Z0lnP_wL2adllDQgo34_Yw.text: thank you yelp for this awesome find! its a lil far off the strip, but totally worth it.  being from the south bay, we are starved for good local food. yes theres a ton of places, but nothing every lives up to your expectations!  this place was pretty good and reminded me of my moms home cooking.  if im ever back in vegas ill be coming back here! its definitely worth the trip off the strip!

N3lhWTnBaEfGKR1Mu4EQUg.text: GREAT FOOD. LOUSY CUSTOMER SERVICE. Their foods are SO delicious & are worth the price based on the portions they serve.  Although my boyfriend loves eating here,  I'd rather take out because of the terrible service. I would say the only nice employee there is the only male server. Overall,  it would be a great restaurant if the employees were trained to provide great customer service.

4O-uscMdPJDcT9Sgyrnxdw.text: I have been coming here for a while since this place opened up a few years ago but finally got around to writing a review. Everything I've had has been delicious and the servings are huge even for me. This last visit I had the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco. I was very good but the brown gravy need a little more flavor. Downside they ran out of Spam Musubis and they are closed Sundays and Mondays.   On a previous trip I tried bringing some friends from out of town here but they were closed Sunday :(

h_F05QPzEIBbyYeve9XXzw.text: I had the chop steak excellent food great price large helping the best service,  right from the big Island of Hawaii can't get any better than that.  My hometown I recommend this place to eat, any time your craving  Hawaiian food

x8g3ALc4pAH_-1EQaAM56Q.text: I've eaten at many Hawaiian food places in Las Vegas, this my favorite. Great food, big portions the food is not half assed like other food places.

0Sr-GiNThuUe596wMKoAJA.text: Love the kahlua pig.  So much flavor. Short ribs are super tasty and the mac salad is delish. I always get the guava juice so sweet and yummy. Would give 5 stars if the musubi was better but hey I can easily make that at home. Haven't stepped foot in L&L since finding this place.

Tzmm9b65kgI8gPzvORWabg.text: I found this store through Yelp. They have lots of reviews so I tried. I tried mixed plate and kona coffee pie for my dessert. It is pretty good except little salty for food. Large portions and nice servers are good enough to recommend this restaurant .

k6kfZyjJ3eAYfHstwyIY5g.text: Love this place!! Great staff and food! Generous portions of tastiness, love the pork chops, yummy :)

gJU_FIjpLWUN21HZIaHYug.text: Finally!  We found the place (opposite side of the Strip, not Henderson) that reminds us of home the most!  This place has been around for over a year or so now, opened by a Big Island guy!  So, you'd better expect BIG!  Expect to bring home some leftovers for dinner/lunch/breakfast the next day!  Every time we come here, we feel like we're back at home again!  For some reason, food (and music) will always take us back to the islands...  *smack!* the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco!  First time ever trying both local favorites - together!  MmmMmmm!  Aaaand, leftovers to take home!  OHH!  And you should try their Fried Rice and Omelet!  I think it's on their Specials Menu!  That fried rice is soooo tasty, with huge pieces of sausage in it, and so very moist and perfect!  They serve it with 3 slices of Portuguese sausage, I think it's the Maui or Big Island kine!  HUGE!  And ONO, too!  Other goodies to try, Korean Chicken (saucy!), and their Kalbi!  If you are from Hawaii, and you live here in Las Vegas now, forget about L&L for your local fix!  Summerlin finally has a place that serves up one of the best local foods I've tasted since living here!  Broke da Mouth!

flacSh86UNd8m5zhb0z40w.text: I love this place. Everyone from the server to the cooks in the back are very friendly. When we got there I ordered the terriyaki chicken plate (to compare it to the other terriyaki chicken plates) oxtail soup, chicken katsu, and I believe some type of pork. I can't really remember much about the pork because of all the other food I ordered but let's just say from the several bites I had it melted in your mouth.  Let's start with the terriyaki chicken. I have to say that this is the best terriyaki chicken at a Hawaiian restaurant. L&L's is too fatty and chewy, Aloha Kitchen always requires you to remember to ask for it with no skin, and there are a couple other places that weren't so memorable. It sounds strange to say but the chicken tasted like ... chicken. Real meat, not covered up in fat and that chewy gristle, just meat, that might not make any sense but if you've had that chewy gristle you know what I'm talking about.  The same goes for the chicken katsu. The chicken was solid meat and the breading was crispy and clean, not soggy and greasy like some other places. Same goes for the oxtail soup, while the oxtail was extremely fatty (I never knew ox carried so much fat in their tail) the actual soup was not greasy but crisp and gingery. It tasted a little bland at first but once you start eating the oxtail and bites from a couple other dishes the soup actually complements the flavors.  If I'm craving some Hawaiian food, this would definitely be among my top choices. However it loses a star because believe it or not I'm a fan of the canned mystery meat known as spam. They don't have any spam dishes and their spam musubi is pre-made and sits out on the counter which means first come, first serve and if you get there at night then you're SOL. But even if you were to get it, you have to eat spam musubi that's been sitting on the counter for awhile, for some reason it's not made to order, kinda weird but all in all a good spot.

dPpNE_qEjsUG22fbNM72TQ.text: The best Hawaiian spot in the sw area! Mixed plate and ribs are the bomb! The staff is super nice and the portions are huge. Definitely gotta check this place out.

6KdlTAeMUCGRclUwyx7dkA.text: We stopped by this place for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  We ordered the furikake poke and mixed plate of kalbi ribs and Hawaiian roast pork. We ate all of the poke and had a misubi and our plate of food still did not come.  The waitress gave us the bill, that's when we realized that our waitress didn't get our order right and thought we only ordered the poke. So after waiting another 10 minutes, our plate of food arrived.  It was big, just like other yelpers said.  There was enough food for both my wife and I to share one plate for lunch.  There were three pieces of kalbi ribs and a decent pile of roast pork with gravy, two scoops of rice and macaroni salad. But one piece of the kalbi ribs was all fat, with very little beef on it.  I was not too impressed with this plate, as the whole plate was lacking in flavour.  The kalbi ribs could have been marinated longer, the roast pork was not that tasty and there wasn't enough gravy for the two scoops of rice.  The macaroni salad is standard fare just like any other Hawaiian cuisine restaurant.  The misubi wasn't fresh, rice was on the hard side.  I do like the big portions of the mixed plate though and their poke was fresh and quite tasty, so I will come back and try some of there other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hawaiian roast pork and kalbi ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. furikake poke

JajiBmdit_bwYipeonGKgg.text: This is their spam musubi. Rice is extremely dry and still raw and the spam is nearly nonexistent

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Instead of calling it spam musubi call it rice musubi

CAv-Pksto4oxO8zDKVp1AQ.text: On Friday my hubby was craving some Hawaiian food...we were driving around town and out of the corner of my eye I saw Island flavor Express on Eastern. We saw the reviews and turned around and went in! We were met at the register by a friendly guy who took our order. My husband had the special, a chicken dish with the fried rice upgrade and I had katsu chicken also with the fried rice upgrade. It was incredible. Enough food for 2 with one order...we took almost an entire two meals home with us. The fried rice was AMAZING...the katsu chicken cooked perfectly and my husband's chicken special was so tender it fell off the bones! So here it is Sunday afternoon and my husband says...I want to go try the kalbi ribs so we ventured to the Restaurant...on Durango. The place was packed!!!!! There was one table open when we got there! The waitress we had was incredible, super sweet! We ordered the avocado fries, deep fried avocados with 2 amazing sauces drizzled over the top. The batter that they fried it in was super crispy and the avocados were soft but not mushy! Yummmmm! My husband had the kalbi ribs and the furitake chicken with the fried rice upgrade and I had the terriyaki chicken and katsu chicken with the fried rice upgrade and I love their Mac salad so I ordered and extra scoop. The furitake checked was crispy and the sauce was yummy. My husband said the kalbi ribs were really good, great flavor. My terriyaki chicken was so tender and the sauce was sweet and just enough added...not too much! Again, we walked away with a ton of food! They are not stingy on their portions!!!! We will definitely be back as there is more we want to try and with the fantastic food and wonderful service this will become a regular place for us!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2JR9YNzNCcByKyy2qXM48A.text: When it comes to Hawaiian Food, this is the place that represents AUTHENTICITY. The restaurant name speaks for itself! ISLAND. FLAVOR.   I've been here multiple times and I can never get my eyes off the Furikaki Chicken. Highly recommend this one just because of the savory taste of the sauce, the crunchy skin but tender insides and the macaroni salad topping it all off!   In addition to that their potions are fairly big! Along with the pricing of these big portions--worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken

zHeAGOThdNdbzeZweWjt_Q.text: Unfortunately many of the poor reviews are True. I've been dining here for many years and this place has gone totally downhill since the new management change.   Portions have shrunk significantly compared to before. We ordered the furikake chicken and not only was it way smaller in size, the chicken was not fresh. It was not hot like before and was very chewy. The rice and mac salad portions have shrunk as well. Food is not as good as before unfortunately. Also, the table next to us took one bite of their cake and left after saying that the cake has a "vomit aftertaste". It makes you wonder just how old their desserts are.   Service is unbelievably slow. We had to ask for dishes when we were not given any with our appetizers. On top of that, the server dropped some of the food from our plate onto the table. We didn't really mind because we just wanted to eat after waiting sooo long for our food. The service is extremely slow.   Island flavor used to be our go-to place for Hawaiian food. We are never coming back.

MHahGNCvHRSqheO8UvFtKA.text: We always eat at Island Flavor when we visit Las Vegas!! Some ono!! Just like home!! This time my wife and I shared the Monstah Mixed Plate and a house salad. So much food!! Then we topped our dinner off with a malasada - chocolate filled of course! We'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monstah Mixed Plate - Teriyaki Beef Steak, Furikake Shrimp, and Korean Chicken.

D_COq0UVOsWwO6VCf2uISA.text: Couple months ago we came here and left wanting more. Today we came in, left and told ourselves it's time to find a new Hawaiian restaurant. As we entered, we noticed new renovations and how much bigger the restaurant now was. No music playing, just people dining in, and voices of what I believe is upper management? The ambiance felt like shit if you ask me. When you walk into a local restaurant you want to feel welcomed with island music and workers with aloha, this was not it. But it was a couple months ago...   Ordered saimen and furikake chicken with fried rice. Honestly the saimen was not worth the $9 price at all/ Halfway filled bowl with 2 wonton, probably half a package of s&s noodles topped with egg, kamaboko and char sui. The broth was super salty and wished it came with hot mustard on the side. The furikake chicken was hard to chew, dry and felt over fried. The only good thing was the fried rice which tasted the same.   Our server was nice but looked as if she felt stressed. Don't blame her at all since we read new management took over. Sigh*.

CXOk19nSNbSH4g7MT_-Ajg.text: Went in for lunch today OMG I had no idea what I was missing the food was amazing . Great service fast and friendly. We went on a Sunday at lunch time it was busy but the service was outstanding and served with a smile. I would highly recommend this place . Definitely coming back probably sooner then I should

RKeA6xRXeanjpOgXk7YWVA.text: Had dinner with the family since it's been recommended by a friend. We're visiting from CA, and wanted to try something different than what we get at the specialty in California hotel. Meal is good. However, the reason I give it a two star is that we had ordered a to go item 10 mins before we payed our bill. Server had came to inform us that it was missed after 20 mins and had the kitchen do it immediately. Waited 30 more mins till we got the to go item we've ordered. Wouldn't be bad if they gave some kind of incentive like a dessert. Apologies is good but some kind of extra incentive for making us wait especially having 2 kids who are being restless for waiting.  Addendum: We went in to dine-in at 1800, 6/18/19. Ordered to go meal at 1900 and paid the bill at 1910. Didn't get the to go till or close to 1950.

2t63NoZGH6kC1dIe7OHBuQ.text: I LOVE ISLAND FLAVOR!! I been going here since my high school days and the quality of the food has always stayed the same. Whenever I'm super hungry, I know I can go here and leave full and satisfied. The portions here are huge and I've never eaten anything here that I didn't like.  My go to is usually the Katsu Loco Moco, I cant finish this by myself even if I didn't eat the whole day. It's HUGE. The furikake chicken is really good too and the spicy avo poke is freakin delish!! Service is so nice, Lei is the BOMB! Seriously, she makes me feel so at home.  Oh and they just renovated and expanded their space! Woohoo!

YzPqUy68-oYsB-h9hVawiw.text: This place is a hidden gem in the southwest part of town. Absolutely delicious. My husband I have been driving past this restaurant for years! Each time, we'd smell the amazingness coming out of this restaurant, we swear we'd try it. Fast forward - we are celebrating a job promotion and decided to do is at Island Flavor!  Best choice ever. Food was everything I imagined and more. Flavors are mouth watering! Plus we decided to treat ourselves, being a special occasion and all, we ordered their famous mud pie for desert. Yummy!!!! Kind of like a ice cream coffee flavored cake. It was sooo good. I definitely recommend and I will definitely be back for more!

CHsbUXjXDvlf8hHSX-yYrQ.text: It's been a while since we last visited, the place is a lot bigger, with a new modern look.  We noticed that the menu changed, I didn't see our fave poke salad.  Midway through lunch a little boy approached our table and offered samples of malasadas. I felt bad that I already ordered a chantilly cake and didn't have room for malasadas. We'll probably be back again being that my other half loves this place.  I got the saimin and loved it, i appreciates that there were wontons in the soup. However, I wish the meat in the wontons weren't so sparse. The food came out quick even for being there at lunch hour. It took a while for our server to get my hot mustard, I was already midway through my meal but still wanted it and it came pre-mixed with soy sauce which I didn't like. My fault I guess, I didn't ask for it to be separate - I'm accustomed to  getting the hot mustard on its own since there was already soy sauce on the table. I thought that was weird.

_NE7kJam6RpX4V9VoVNzqQ.text: Tyler is the best server! No homo! Plates where Samoan size! Mahalos for the food!  I gave it 5 stars because not only are the servings big, they all have great flavor!

4XxSF0Mn146xE4pA0ItXrg.text: I ordered thru Chow Now since I'm on a lunch break to have the food ready.  Once I arrived I get a greeting from some lady feeding a toddler on one of the tables (I guess owner or boss) but coming from a customer I think that is unprofessional.  I'm thinking "who are you, a customer or a worker"? Once I get help, they ask me what I would like to order and I tell them I ordered online thru Chow Now.  I was told that they do not have an order but find out that there was a system error or something and they would make my order right away.  Once I get my order I bring it to my car and check to see if everything I  ordered was there.  Find out I am missing a side salad that I paid extra for instead of getting the mac salad.  Go back and let then know.  I get my salad and I'm on my way.  So now on to the food review....  I think something changed, the prices went up with the food portions went down.  I ordered a mix plate - furikake chicken and tinono pork belly with a white rice and side salad.  Coworker ordered cobb salad.  Furikake chicken was good but tough.  Tinono pork belly could of been a little crispier but maybe that's how the dish is prepared but taste was ok.  I think it was trying to be like pork sisig but no way near the flavor.  Side was excellent as always.  Cobb salad - meat was terrible, removed the meat but the rest of the salad was ok, upside the greens were fresh.  I want to give a better review but with so many issues I can't.  Overall experience was terrible and I think that is the last time I visit this place since there are so many other Hawaiian One eats here on the 9th island.  TRY PAINA CAFE!!!

4hAOpXerSEMqwQ_nQvN1OQ.text: The food at Island Flavor is absolutely amazing!!  I've heard from numerous people just have flavorful their dishes can be, and now I've experienced it for myself.  I had the Poke, and a chicken salad, while my friend had another style chicken dish.  The poke was so fresh and tasty. The chicken on the salad was so flavorful, I was blown away.  The only opportunity for improvement is with their service. The servers were inattentive and in too much of a hurry to pay attention.  Otherwise, a perfect dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-p5HxFwBPXIPBKQVBvp08g.text: In summary: I've been here prior to the remodel and it was a good experience. Yesterday's dinner however, was awful.  What I got: Two mixed plates - one plate with Furikake chicken & Kalbi short ribs and second plate with Korean chicken & Hawaiian style roast pork (takeout)  Would I recommend to others: No.  Would I eat here again: No. My Furikake chicken was soooo dry that it couldn't even pass for chicken jerky. The short ribs were less dry, but lacking in flavor. Roast pork was salty and greasy. Korean chicken was packed together with the roast pork so it was just covered in the same salty gravy...  If I lived any closer to the restaurant I would've taken the food back... at least the inedible Furikake chicken. Looking at the photos on Yelp I would've thought the chicken was their specialty.  Of all fried/battered chicken I've ever eaten (including Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai, Hawaiian, etc.) this one was the most disappointing.   One extra star was for the nice lady working at the register.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It would&#39;ve been nice if they had separated the fried chicken with a piece of foil so it doesn&#39;t just taste like salty gravy.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extremely dry Furikake chicken

oNiZ833XZKcSMXiRrSXJAg.text: Update:  Same great food,same portions,but they lose a star because it's a lot harder to place a pickup order now.   They pulled their Yelp! ordering (now have to go through their website) and you cannot call and place an order for pickup without going through the hassle of giving your credit card over the phone -- which is cumbersome for those ordering on the go (like me).   On the flip side,the new interior is gorgeous and they have taken more space to house more tables,making the in-dining experience much better (less wait time).   I do wish they had a separate counter for food pickups and one to help seat guests and take orders,because there can be some lag time if you are just there to grab your food and go,and it must be frustrating for guests to wait to get sat when there are empty tables all around while someone orders to-go.   Other than that,it is a fine establishment and one of the best Hawaiian spots in the city,with great portions and good tasting food.

z1eQc_-lYLAI-zmPJ04VVw.text: The best Hawaiian place to eat in Las Vegas! Shareable plate, fresh food to order, and tasty menu. You won't regret it. We kept coming back!

DWMX_cIlJRU9XNdTVZdi-w.text: Love coming here! It definitely reminds me of home. Today we ordered the furikake chicken and chicken katsu. Both were so yummy! will definitely continue coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken Chicken Katsu

_3rOi4u1eQ8gqhunXCTqXg.text: Not the same as it was prior to new management. Very disappointed in the quality of food, price, and the fact that they serve fake "malasadas" . Which are basically buns with sugar. What they sell here are not malasadas.  Please do not expect real malasadas when you come here.  Plate and food portions have significantly decreased , much smaller, since the new owners took over. I feel like the prices have also gone up (for less food)  Thankfully zippys will be here soon.

AHyb8ek36dJRn3la7I0KCA.text: First time here since the whole new change. Our waitress was very nice. However, the food was definitely not what we're used to. The furikake chicken was beyond hard and so salty my mouth and tongue were NUMB! If I was pregnant I'm pretty sure I would have swelled up. I'm about to go home and drink some hot tea hoping it'll flush all that out. The pork belly on the other hand was good. They made it extra crispy for me just how I like it. Hubby said his dish was overly salty as well. And the funny thing is, he loves salty foods. So for him to say it was too much for him must say something. We both didn't finish our furikake chicken which made me very upset because we both do not like wasting food at all. But this was something we both couldn't just suck up and finish. Sorry to say.. but This will be our last time coming here.

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken way too hard and so salty. Pork belly was good though

CuEIcOC2swDJwEDmU741pg.text: We went here for lunch and was extremely disappointed. Many things have changed when Island Flavor was bought by new owners. The atmosphere is nicer however the food changed and it wasn't a good change. One of the top sellers was their furikake chicken. I ordered that today and it tasted completely different. It didn't even look like there was furikake on the chicken. I have attached a picture of the furikake chicken before the new owners and after the new owners. In addition my kimchi tasted sour and watery, nothing like Kimchi or spicy. We also ordered the chefs special loco moco and the patties tasted dry and bland. It lacked the basic seasonings like salt and pepper. On top of that our food took over 1/2 hour just to come out and it wasn't busy at all. We asked the waiter how long does it usually take for food to come out she stated 25-30 minutes usually. We asked to speak with the owner however she was too busy and just said to refund our meals. Thankfully we were able to get refunded. Sad to say Island Flavor will no longer be an option for us.

em_54lfqx78LTyyP5BpKKg.text: Bomb food, great service and bomb food.... this place is amazing! Real authentic Hawaiian food, I recommend the furikake chicken and Kalbi but try everything it's sooooo good..

XStf_UGjV8VfnnYEc4Gubg.text: If Rikishi says it's the place to eat, I can't question him. Food is A+++ Roast pork is amazing.  Great service all around. Don't know how to give 10 stars so 5 will have to do. I'm full and need a nap.

uTqFsswVx1dCkxFKPDwv5w.text: Love love love this place!  Food and atmosphere is always amazing. Las Vegas is the 9th island   Authentic and delicious! Spam musubi? Yes musubi! Ohhhhhh myhhhhhhh!!  Take your tastebuds on a day trip to the islands!   Yum / yum/ yummmmmm

ftripS8ACNC7XrUaNg02xg.text: This was my first time eating at this restaurant..I wonder why it was pretty busy..it's because the food was authentic,  the portion was so much for me and was delicious!! I have to take out so much left over..The price was so reasonable!! The waiter was so nice..He always apologized for the wait..I will surely recommend this place..

BkY63FUlvVH4-mKKc033zw.text: I don't think I've ever had a more delicious Hamburger Patty with a scoop of rice and macaroni with gravy all over East of the Rainbow Drive-In in Honolulu! Worth leaving The Strip for a Hawaiian Letter from Home!

roZr8_Uy_43nIXLGl45ing.text: Researched on Yelp for some good Hawaiian food and found this little gem within 2 miles from our home. Who knew it was so close and had such great food.  This place was poppin, even at 8pm. About 10 people outside and two couples in front of us. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table and was pleasantly surprised to see live music  being played inside. They have live music on Friday and Saturday evenings between 6-8:30pm.   We checked out the menu and ordered the furikake chicken 5/5 with fried rice and veggies and the chicken Katsu loco moco 4/5. The servings were extra large which meant plenty to take home for leftovers. Overall delicious Hawaiian style food.  I wanted to try the spam musubi but they were sold out. Will have to give it a try on my next visit.  The desserts also looked very delicious but we were so full we didn't save room.  The service was great and very nice 5/5. And the 10% Yelp cash back made everything a little better :-)

sko4oaX-VxbXZe5mX3qTCg.text: Best hawaiian food in Las Vegas. Very flavorful and good. Great service, very nice and friendly. Have been coming here for years and it is still very good!

rEmxX3LMI0cQaMtqUguo6Q.text: My go to place for Hawaiian style food! Huge portions and great flavor. Only negative is sometimes service can be very slow. Especially when busy. But, I always leave full and happy!

93WnHZhtOK7ltbt99hrTKQ.text: It's so nice to be back! We havent eaten here in awhile. We were very shocked to see the renovation, its beautiful. We ordered so much food from the oxtail soup to furikaki chicken to the mocha mud pie! I am so happy! All so good! Will definitely come back!

PSDSWVVonQbSF8jqwTxQtA.text: This place has really good service and all of the people are extremely nice. The food is good although some dishes have very basic and strong flavors but they are still good. The portions are huge so it is worth the price.

ddFNFmBEmlmqjuw9La0mlg.text: I came here today for the 1st time and it's literally so yummy. I would recommend this place.

UmoEf6hx1hE4m20-HHS7mw.text: Probably the best Hawaiian food in Vegas.   Ordered furikake chicken. Very flavorful! It's a little sweet and salty, but gets toned down from eating it with rice.   Mac salad can be a lot better though. This Mac salad is pretty generic: mayo, mayo, and more mayo. Tastes like a takeout from L&L's to be honest.   Biggest Tip: When ordering takeout, make sure the lid is open so your chicken won't get soggy!

npBZhUWknH3qkgee-HiLpQ.text: Awesome service! Ono food!!! Had to take out a dozen malasadas, for latter.  Thanks Edna for the best service eva!!!

MJ6d0g_yxsVz4qNnMZG5SA.text: Great service, delicious food!!! Edna was very sweet!  The music made us feel at home!

qQP2B-qp-g_qiFbOnYKv3Q.text: We had the boneless Kalbi ribs and the moco loco, both were delicious ! The portion sizes are very large . Definitely worth the price .

7dczvBulwxX3Izi8tGiXNQ.text: Awesome Food, just like home! Our first time here and definitely not our last. Portions are Ohana Shareable  We tried a little bit of everything.   Our waitress was Silvia whom provided us with outstanding service!

C8d-TeiZPcABRj1vMd2LhQ.text: OMG. We love island food, and this was the best ever - ridiculously good and served in ridiculously gigantic portions. My bowl of roast pork loco moco (a special) could have been breakfast, lunch, and dinner for me. So good! Everyone in our group of four loved the food. This is the place! (The guava cake looks astoundingly good but needless to say, we didn't have room.)

8bQxb2_aOhKRVyNeHatq6g.text: Holy moly this place brings back memories of Hawaii. They serve large portions of all the local  favorites for a great price. We came here looking to get our poi fix. We ended up ordering way more than we could fit in our stomachs but happy to have enough leftovers for dinner. I had the mixed plate with kalbi and roast pork with gravy. My girlfriend had the loco moco. We shared the shoyu flavored ahi poke as an appetizer. And of course the order of poi.   The roast pork is very moist with great pork flavor. The gravy on top makes it all the more savory. Smothered over some rice and bam! Just a good ol' fashion local kine meal. The loco moco is similar to ones I've had in Hawaii but that is exactly what we were looking for. The ahi in Vegas is not as fresh as it is in Hawaii so the poke wasn't all that great but that isn't the restaurant's fault. Fresh, medium grade ahi for a reasonable price in Vegas has eluded me so far but I'm still hoping to find some. We will definitely be back!

V3XVCo2ES9ip_reGSV8oMg.text: Island Flavor is without a doubt one of the best local spots in town. They have a menu with a wide variety of options and huge portions. I usually like to get a combo plate and mix it up every once in a while. It's a nice quaint restaurant that makes you feel like you're definitely in Hawaii. Service is friendly, and I've never had a bad experience when calling in orders for pick up. This place is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona Coffee Mudd Pie
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco

edSNEw1LmZquh6U2FvklPg.text: Taste like home :) Reminds me of The Cookhouse on Molokai. The food is always delicious, has a good portion size, and the staff are very friendly.

exRLRWri6gvI73etE6NBxg.text: One of my favorite (if not favorite) spot in LV. Very homely feel with great serving sizes and friendly service. The furikake chicken is killer! The mixed plate is definitely the way to go.

6EspL-WIywbvxP4Pf2v54g.text: FURIKAKE CHICKEN! I'm sure tons of other reviews have said the same thing but let me say it one more time, FURIKAKE CHICKEN! Honestly, I can't speak for anything else on their menu because I always get this when I'm at Island Flavor, but it's worth the trip and delicious, crispy local goodness here in Vegas.  I'm sure they have many other delicious items on the menu but why bother with something new when it's pretty much guaranteed that you're going to enjoy the furikake chicken? I can attest that it is on par to some of the best plate lunches/chicken dishes that I've had back at home in Hawaii. Now, that's kind of BIG deal considering when it comes to Hawaiian/local food here in Vegas, I'm kind of a snob comparing it to real thing.   Enough said and I think I've already said furikake chicken 10 times in this review already. Go out and get yourself some! The parking is no problem here. And the staff are pretty friendly from what I've experienced. They also have a smaller 'Express' location off Eastern/215 if you're in that neck of the woods.

O4Cj344WTyrGUMuioVAncA.text: A bit out of the way, but extremely worth the trip. The wait staff was extremely friendly and willing to work with us considering that most of my family did not try Hawaiin cuisine. Although I can't confirm the authenticity of the meal to Hawaiin cuisine, the meal was extremely satisfying and tasty. I ordered the Fresh Made Ahi Poke Plate with spicy mayo and avocados, and I can safely say that it was phenomenal. The cubes of tuna melted in my mouth leaving the umami of their shoyu and spicy mayo on my tongue. Mahalo.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh made poke plate with avocado and spicy mayo

I_ZSrahK_uCAKomZ9VvOIQ.text: Tellin you know...I'm not even there as I post this but we have been there many times and we are planning on going there this week from LA for the day and we are planning to definitely make a stop.  I am havin a hard time to recommend what to order cause everything is sooo good.  But if I had to choose it would be the combo furikake chicken and ribs plate....I can taste it already all the way from LA!!!!  ... oooohh the loco moco...mmm If you are in the area you need to stop by ... and oh by the way the portions...forget about it, wear stretchy pants....it's a lot!!!!  Oh!!!  Gotta give a shout out to the staff...very nice!!!  They do a great job taking care of you!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. See!!!! I told you we were gonna stop by...can&#39;t go wrong with island flavor...I think I&#39;m gonna tell Guy about this place!!!

0BA_un5vl7lMmXRRtCtf0A.text: This is probably the closest thing to 'Local Kine Grinds' without having to get on a plane to the 808.  Definitely the best in Southwest Vegas.  My go to plate is the Furikake Chicken.  So flavorful!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken always puts a smile on my face :)

O_MywxGpw_M81kBUbRz8tQ.text: Best Hawaiian spot in town. My boyfriend loves the Korean chicken. My friends' and I's #1.  I always am down for their poke and teriyaki chicken salad. The avocado fries are new! You can't go wrong with Island Flavor. Thank you for the service!

bs4uX01ry93aEoNeiW3weQ.text: Cute mom and pop shop that caters to Vegas locals. I hadn't had Hawaiian food in awhile and one of our friends had never had it before so our local friend took us here.  I ordered the mixed plate of kalua pork and furikake chicken. Omg the chicken was soooo good. The seasoningnof the cjicand the crispiness were on point. Unfortunately the kalua pork missed the mark entirely; it was wicked bland and way too chewy as if it had been overcooked - utterly flavorless.  My friend who had the mixed plate with kalua pork and roast pork had the same complaint about the kalua pork as well but she was happy with the roast pork, especially the sauce it came with.   We also had the spam musubi which was good: sauce was appropriately sweet and not overbearing. I do wish the spam slice was thicker.   We also ordered the ahi poke which they forgot and ended up coming at the end of our meal. The servers apologized but that was it. We couldn't really enjoy it as it came well after our entrees and it seemed like they rushed to make it - the seasoning tasted off.  For dessert, we took home a piece of chantilly cake. The cake and buttercream were soooo creamy and smooth. It's pretty sweet so if that's not your thing, steer clear. It's delicious both warm and cold.   I would say for a Hawaiian place, I was really surprised that they screwef up the kalua pork. The only saving grace for me was the furikake chicken and spam musubi so 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chantilly cake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu plate
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate: kalua pork and roast pork

zMKajRzalL3YGspvG6q62w.text: OMG. Too much food!  Friend from LA told us this was the best.  Wow.  So good.  Enough food for 2x the number ordered.  Very nice people to go along win the great food.  Worth the pretty expensive cab ride from the strip.  The roast pork, delicious.  The macaroni and fried rice even better and whatever they did to the chicken and beef was delicious.   Did I mention the nice people?

-2jexnq-eg1nBm7FGzoK-A.text: Still my favorite place to get Hawaiian food!  Everything about this place keeps me coming back because this is how any authentic Hawaiian joint should be: super friendly service (they treat you like family here), big portions, great poke & desserts.  I remember since my first time here, I've been hooked.  Some of my favorite include:  - chop steak - loco moco - furikake shrimp - shoyu poke (so fresh!)  I love their guava juice here and for dessert, they have awesome guava cake!  Even the mac salad is better than most places.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice size piece of guava cake. Delicious!

kEGovWdHs4RJ7ygT1VSNMg.text: The hawaiian food here is great with generous portions. The teri beef is great because they use better quality beef. The loco moco is top notch and I forgot the name of their fish dish but that also is good!!!!

5EHlGFJmW99gHSja2EgAeA.text: Whoa!  What a find!  We were just searching for some decent hawaiian food outside of the cal and we decided to check this place out.  We got a bunch of things so we could all try and we were all blown away with every dish!    Hoisin Baby Back Ribs: Skeptical at first but dude, these rival the best baby backs that I've ever had.  Perfect crispiness on the outside.  Moist, fall-off-the-bone meat on the inside.  Perfect sweet glaze.  I think this was my favorite thing we tried.  Furikake Chicken: Wonderfully flavored.  Moist chunks of chicken.  Just good.  Kona Coffee: Yep... I'm putting the coffee on here cause it was good.  Another one I was skeptical of cause it came out of a typical diner style 'dennys' pot, but it was actually flavorful.    Chicken Katsu Loco Moco: Probably had overly high expectations on this one, so wasn't as much of a fan as other people, but its still very good.  Gravy is flavorful and the egg just makes everything better.    Guava Cake: We were all pretty stuffed after our meal so we were gonna pass on dessert.  We decided to share the guava cake though and OMG... so good!  Very light.  Not too sweet.  Perfect ending to a perfect meal.  More coffee please!  The only thing I would complain about is the service.  Dude that waited for us was slow and didn't seem to care.  Yeah, you could call him laid back, but it was almost like he knew he was getting an 18% tip cause we had a party of 6 and didn't even try.  I'm not gonna bash too much, but that could have been improved.   Overall this was a great find and our whole party loved the food here.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava cake.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona coffee. Hoisin baby back ribs. Chicken Katsu loco Moco. Furikake chicken. All excellent!

XgHwRzZHpiP6ny_8eadUiA.text: Two words too describe this place, BIG PORTIONS !!! This place is really famous for their furikake chicken that I always go here to die for. I can usually finish their food here which is a place so I can bring it home to eat. Lol anyways always order a side of Poke and Kim chi cucumber is really good A+ in my book. !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poké !!!!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our dishes for brunch.

ghyGlcn1xayVN-FtR_mlRQ.text: 100% if you're ever off the strip this is the spot for some bomb Hawaiian food. The portions are huge and the food is so

PLNVvq4mnQW1kXX4z3IIkg.text: Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas! This place is amazing.  Their portion sizes are great and their poke is the best I've ever had.  I recommend getting the fresh made ahi poke.  Spicy avocado style is my favorite! The beef teriyaki steak is also great especially if you get it medium rare.  I've also had the poke salad but I think the fresh ahi poke is better. Definitely check this place out if you want fresh, authentic Hawaiian food! I recommend it to everyone looking for a go-to Hawaiian restaurant.

k3vLgPg8RDrvRijW0obgyA.text: We are so glad our Hawaiian friends introduced us to this local fave.  We ordered * Kalbi beef - enjoyed gnawing the meat around the bones  * Chicken Katsu - perfectly crispy outside  * Pork Moco was drowned (in a good way) with gravy yumminess * Chicken Teriyaki - love the simple, charbroiled flavor.  We wished the place was bigger as it is hard to accommodate more than 3 families of parry larger than 5ppl.  They are equally busy with their to-go orders, so try callimg ahead if you dont have time to wait.

yeQCYlXttAwlfr0jTaryyw.text: I decided to use the order pickup button on Yelp to pick up some delicious furikake chicken! The wait for the order pickup took a long time. The app said it would take about 20-30 minutes and they were right! The food is made fresh so obviously it was going to take about 20-30 minutes. However, when I finally got my furikake chicken I could not wait to eat it! As soon as I got home, I ate that chicken real quick! It's so flavorful and they give you a lot of rice with it! It also comes with Mac! I would highly recommend this place! I saw food coming out from the kitchen and it looked DELICIOUS! I recommend calling in an order instead of using the order pickup button, but other than that the food is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken

0IQa7WrscdfmGIoEYpbrEw.text: This place is awesome. Great food, great price and great people! Must try! Brought family from Texas 1st time eating Hawaiian food and all love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!

MJdB3ws3ibWGD2B7QYXASg.text: Just moved here from Hawaii. Enjoy the plate lunch places (L&L) but this was so much better. I got the chicken katsu loco moco for lunch, yes they serve da breakfast grinds all day. Exceptional portions, great service and nice atmosphere. Would recommend to locals and anyone who wants authentic Hawaiian cuisine. As a haole myself I knew I was in the right spot. Has the local feel through and through. Thanks Island Flavor!!

sRK72XZjNcAYv8HM9RFtdw.text: Two words: FURIKAKE CHICKEN.  Also, their poke is by faaaaar the greatest in proportion, taste, and freshness. But definitely order their furikake chicken, and if you're a small gal like me, definitely bring a friend to share it with because they will give you a look if you dare try to box something up. Haha. The only downside I can think of is that it is 25 minutes away from my house and not open late enough! I love this place and I love bringing people here!

Wzhj7Y599N1qXCr9cYcV3g.text: Never on this side of town, so when I was hungry and deep SW, I figured it was time to put it to the test!  Typical Hawaiian restaurant vibe, so how's the food compare??  Kalbi Ribs...very good! Tender and juicy, not as fatty as 808 Plate (much cheaper though!), but still a great rendition.  This is my go-to dish that I compare all other Hawaiian spots...they are a solid #2 in my book so far :)  Shoyu Chicken...good stuff! This was a daily special...very tender and flavorful. Quite a bit more sweet than I was expecting...not too much soy taste.  Grandpa ate up every bit!  Spam Musubi...just the right spam/rice ratio, with a little bit of furikake like seasoning! Yum!  It's actually one of the best versions I've had...so easy to mess up such a simple staple!  Guava Drink...yes please!  These are very tasty and hit the spot while eating all the great food here.  I'll definitely be back... the location is the only holdup for me!  Pics :

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava Drink...yes please!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Chicken...good stuff! This was a daily special...very tender and flavorful. Quite a bit more sweet than I was expecting.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Musubi...just the right spam/rice ratio, with a little bit of furikake like seasoning! Yum!

IWmGbKvU2tsthLXXdf-bWQ.text: Simply the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas and Henderson. The gravy on the Loco Moco. Homemade. Potato salad. Just the best

RRFpH9C4GOwxZS9pnLkNdg.text: In from Ohio ..local family members suggested we try Island Flavor for the best Loco Moco. Tried the pork Loco moco... was not disappointed!!! Portions are HUGE food was awesome! Next time we are in town we will be back! Mac salad was the best asked about the ingredients but no secrets were given.  Awesome staff and food!

0hiMvEDmiE_xq3eqhHG1FA.text: I love coming here when I'm in Vegas. The portions are so big and the food is delicious!  Definitely a spot off the strip.

kAN3UOvOJeKBoQCjasYA2A.text: This place is awesome! The food is flavorful and the prices are right, the ribs are the best!!!... we bought sheets of food for a party once and everybody were asking for the food because was a hit!! I recommend this place to everybody!

yvYykqg0_zHXVeViDQQm9Q.text: Nice people but food is not good. Everything was over cooked. We tried the pork katsu, fried chicken with Korean sweet soy sauce, poke, kalbi, chicken teriyaki, beef teriyaki, pork chops, and more...over cooked and dry!!! We were really looking forward to this place too. Unfortunately they did not meet our expectations. Sorry.
