Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G3QLrO78zHvsYhb0H6FLoQ.text: Chicken katsu is my usual dish. I have only had it as pickup so can't speak to the service. Portions are huge and it definitely hits the spot. Macaroni salad is also great, not to mention larger than what you receive at other places.

BNeFVCW76sO2AfI8Ry3c3Q.text: If your homesick or just looking for some Good hawaiian food, this place is your home.  I travelled to Hawaii a few years back and this place brought back a few memories of a few local eateries I use to visit. The staff are friendly and have no problem answering any questions you might have.  I order the boiled sweet potato and the katsu chicken. Both dishes came out in a fairly decent time frame and were presented in a local style cafe. I will say This business isn't about how it's presented, it's about the food and it was all cooked to perfection.  Recommending here will be no problem for sure!! They are great with kids, so a family setting is assured!  My only knock was we did wait a little while for our server to come take our orders, but I think she was pretty slammed, so I can't fault her

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boiled Sweet potato

4YQ4LW-qTvhRuSRoWCSQqQ.text: Always prompt and excellent customer service. I've probably ordered most of the menu by now and never been disappointed. You know it's good when you ask someone from Hawaii where to get good Hawaiian food and they suggest Island Flavor!

TH63AJ80_iD0AiTtZ2NDMQ.text: Originally from Hawaii, my husband and I have our cravings of local food. We found Island Flavor among other plate lunch places and it has been one of our favorites. The staff is great, always welcoming, and their food is delicious. Very large serving sizes, enough to share. This goes for their desserts as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Opakapaka special
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate with kalbi and furikake chicken (with brown rice and mac salad)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava cake

gYp8roDrmmhtYkTPxREHgw.text: Small joint that has a long wait. The service is rather slow, then again they only have 2 cooks, and like 2 servers, even if the place is small, they do make a lot of things on their menu, so you have to be patient if you want to eat here, especially if you have a moderate to large size party.   As for the food, I ordered the roast pork loco moco. When I think of roast pork, I always think I am going to get some charred to crispy pork skin to go with the meat, I didn't, but what I was treated with was some really tender pork meat in a relatively large bowl. It might be the most tender pork I have ever ate. The bowl is large, and they do give you a lot, when I say a lot, I mean that you can probably share with a friend, there is so much rice in the bowl, it is overwhelming. The gravy was decent, nothing too special, you can order the egg however way you like it. I thought overall the roast pork loco moco was decent, needed some seasoning, it was a tad too bland. I obviously didn't finish, so I had it packed up for the road home.  I tried some of my friend's chicken katsu and I thought that was pretty delicious, right amount of crunch, great flavor, chicken wasn't overcooked. I felt like I probably should have ordered that instead, it was also a good size for one person.   They also have several juices, I tried their guava juice, it was a good drink to cleanse the stomach from all the bad toxins incurred from the previous day.

HRfEk-aHvFEwkcr0vhhS0A.text: Came here with my girlfriend the other night and we got Kalua pig and cabbage and a mix plate of the furikaki shrimp and the furikaki chicken. The chicken was my favorite.  This is one of the better Hawaiian food places here in town.

WZWRyIiqu90nKOKyZ4F7nQ.text: FURIKAKE CHICKEN.  Just try it. Don't even hesitate to order when you see it on the menu. You will thank me later. You're welcome.   This is Definitely a great place for local Hawaiian food. They serve humongous portions so you can actually split an order between two people and still be full. Nice and friendly staff. Great place to go when you're craving Hawaiian food without having to fly out to the islands.

jJrmH2574AQCFi0V-MqkpA.text: We love Island Flavor. My boyfriend and I discovered it about a year and a half ago on our anniversary. Being from Hawaii, I wanted something that could really replicate the island food choices. There are so many good things about this place.   First, their food is excellent. My boyfriend said it's even better than local food in Hawaii. We've had a variety of different things so far. My boyfriend has tried almost everything that can be chosen for the mixed plate and he has liked all of them. He always upgrades to the fried rice, and I always steal some of his because it's so good. I've had the lau lau (special days only), which was excellent. I like the standard Portuguese sausage, eggs, and rice, and their sausage is really good. The only thing I haven't been super impressed with is their saimin. It was ok, but nothing super spectacular. Last night, they had friend saimin on special, and it was the best fried saimin I've ever had. Their poke is also good. I like the furikake style.   Second, their portions are HUGE. I mean, we have a friend who can eat A LOT of food, and even he had to take half his mixed plate home. We always have more than two meals when we order their mixed plates. Seriously, it's like a pot of rice when you upgrade to the fried rice.    Third, the people here are always super nice. Coming here really does feel like being back home at a local restaurant. Very local feel, and they always have some local jams on. They also had live music there once when we were there.   Fourth, their prices are so, so affordable. For the quality AND quantity, they are ridiculously cheap. Yesterday, we got out for about $50...for 4 meals, 4 spam musubi, and 2 drinks.   Bottom line, you won't be disappointed. They are so, so good. They do get busy sometimes, so try to get their early, but seriously, go try them.

7JQssxEEByYJr7jCaiUIpQ.text: Absolute terrific. I never miss an opportunity to stuff my face with their big island goodness! Love it! Bring your appetite because it's all good! Ohana Island Flavor and Island Flavor Express.

9QmqCK6emqIUJvNDtEU2gg.text: BIG SERVINGS.. The portions are huge! 1 entree alone can feed 2 people! My boyfriend & I came here for lunch. We ordered a pork loco moco, 1/2 lb. seared poke, kalbi short ribs & jumbo shrimp.. way too much food for only 2 people to eat, but it was worth it. Everything we ordered was yummy.   The staff is friendly too. They were on top of checking in with our table to see how we were doing & kept refilling our water. Definitely a spot to go to, if you're craving Hawaiian food.

gi32YYLj3KmuYG6PtqMqKw.text: I just moved here from Florida and my girlfriend took me here. The food and portions are excellent!!! Put that with great service and on Friday nights they also have a beautiful family perform live and well ... what more can I say!!! This is a great spot to take your family to! Be sure to try the Furikake chicken and a slice of Guava cake ... sooo good!!!!

fotD_Rzl3805-LdT7fkMsw.text: Best place to go if you're craving some kind of Hawaiian comfort food. The portions are big and the service is great. Can't wait to go again!

bn5HMXmGTzLe2m0ilTigOQ.text: Ive been eating at Island Flavor since they first opened when there was a bar in the center.  So, Ive seen it go under many changes.  I understand that a restaurant must raise prices over time to compete with rising food costs and Ive gladly paid for it.  However, it is terrible when a restaurant  reduces the amount of food given AND charges more.  Plate lunch food has always been about value and taste.  I can no longer justify eating at Island Flavor if I have to pay $15 for a plate lunch, which, to me, is no longer a value.  It was a surprise when I looked at my recent bill and saw upcharges that were not there under the previous ownership.  For less food and $15, I'll save my money and eat elsewhere, especially, if I walk away after a meal feeling like I didnt get my money's worth.  BTW, I take pics of most of my meals at restaurants and the difference is drastic.  As a business person, I wish all the best to the new owners but as a patron, Ill be eating elsewhere.

oQ8HTJiFenxd4cGesBpWog.text: Came here after sema show. Ordered the furikake chicken w/brown rice. My friend had the same w/white rice. They have a Chile sauce that u put over your rice. Very good!!! I'm very picky when it comes to food. Now I know where to go when I'm in Vegas. Great food!!! 5star fosure. Aloha!

nziVRdekLnAPCWuTaN_u_A.text: If you like authentic Hawaiian food look no further! We had the Kahlua Pig and cabbage with steamed rice and Mac salad... And the oxtail soup.... The pork was so tender and juicy and the cabbage was perfectly cooked.... The Mac salad is a MUST... So creamy... The oxtail soup had the right balance of fat and ginger flavor... So good! Portions are huge... Sorry about photo quality, the presentation is much better than this but we had already begun to dig in.... Restaurant and restrooms are nice and clean...Staff is exactly how you would picture a Hawaiian establishment, friendly and laid back....

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side for oxtail soup
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail soup, presentation was much better... I forgot to take a picture before I started eating
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pig and cabbage, dish looks way better when presented... We couldn&#39;t wait to dig in...

ERZ3JCVPwE-McMA6_uHzRg.text: They have been consistently great! The food, hospitality, and atmoshpherel. My dad and my family are starting to become here and there regulars, lol.  They've been so accomadating to my 1 and 2 yo boys. Thank you for a consistent, understanding, and kind service!

uPz9LfVoqZh-Cz4_siygBg.text: First off, I just wanted to mention how great the service was here. More than one employee came to check on my fiance and me throughout the meal which was really nice.   Most importantly: the food. Let me tell you, the food was incredible. I had a combo furikake chicken and chicken katsu plate. I've tried both of these at a few other places around town and Island Flavor is easily my favorite for both. If I can make a suggestion, get some sesame dressing to dip your chicken katsu in, it's delicious! My fiance had the teriyaki chicken salad and that, likewise, was great. The teriyaki sauce wasn't overpowering and tasted great.

jF0Fas2s5ZFvlplOgRR07w.text: Holy mother of God, if you do anything with your life, make sure you go here and get the furikake chicken!! I don't really remember what else we got because it was THAT good. I think we got some combo stuff with katsu, probably kalua pork, and maybe shrimp? I remember it was all good though. Got the mud pie, honestly it was meh, only ate a quarter. BUT, will most definitely be back to try the guava cake (knew I shoulda picked that one instead!), along with their other delicious looking menu items. Atmosphere was great, cashier nice, and before we left, half a dozen Metro officers came in to eat, so you know this place is legit!!

ikHWuU75PkcDcZv1cOUEWw.text: I have driven by Island Flavor several times. Today I wanted to visit a new restaurants, so I visited Yelp to help me decide. We decided on Island Flavor, and we're so happy we did. The chicken katsu is great. We also had pork hawaiian style with gravy. It was thin cut and very moist. We took home a slice of guava cake as well. The two ladies waitressing were very helpful and friendly.   Keep in mind that the portions are huge. I would advise sharing. We will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu plate. Chicken katsu/hawaiian pork combo plate, and fries. All were delicious !

CW4jfdbbpfx_W9Tus1bzcg.text: I'm a huge fan after only two visits! The people who run this place always make us feel like family. I highly recommend the furikake shrimp, furikake chix, opakapaka misoyaki style and the poke with furikaki! So ono! Broke da mouth kine good! Beware the sweet potato is not the american sweet potato. Also leave room for dessert, though it may be hard because the servings are huge! But the mud pie is delicious and huge. You could share that between 3 people. It's actually a good thing this place is far because i'd be here all the time!

aV9zXx3RocmVKFLkl4PVFg.text: Ordered a mixed plate with the teriyaki steak and fudukaki shrimp. We have come here for a few years and over the year the food is either salty, but they always gave plenty of food especially the meat. Tonight it looked alittle skimpy on the meat and the shrimp was tiny.  Of course they give you the two scoops of rice and a scoop of mac salad.  When we go we always split a plate as it gets kind of costly and we come for the delicious Chantilly Cake! Service is alway friendly and awesome when we go there.  They do there best when you go there. ALOHA is always there, service with a smile!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Chantilly Cake we LOVE!

rHFyoUh0hR5QWVQZ6SQCsw.text: We come here every time we visit LV from So Cal. We have a zillion poke restaurants here, but we love Island Flavor because it's the real deal! It really reminds of Hawaii and I love that it's so much more than poke. The plate lunches are also delicious...we've never been disappointed. We usually stop here on our way home so we have something to eat on the long drive back. I love that there's a little market now next door that stocks some great Hawaiian foods, like sweet bread and Hawaiian Sun drinks. The service is always very friendly, if you love Hawaiian food you won't be disappointed!

32f0f16vzBxUFal0QTOnSw.text: Growing up on an island, I was so stoked to try out this place based on the reviews!   Island flavor is a friendly casual environment that has a  lot of diverse to it. Their chicken wings is yummy! The proportions of the food is very large but growing an appetite ever since I moved out to Vegas, I can finish the whole meal that was served :) I also loved their fried rice with eggs on top and sausages. A True Hawaiian plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice topped with eggs and sausages nom!

Q-_eowpn0rTLlmooCKmj7w.text: Hands down the best Hawaiian food in Vegas. Everything on the menu is so Ono! It's hard to choose just one option, but they have mix plates too. The prices are inexpensive and the quality and portions are awesome! They even have live music on the weekends. Make sure you save room for dessert too!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken only $9

bij_3rU3s_tihO7bCIQpXg.text: I come here all the time and you can say I'm somewhat addicted to their food. If you want really good Hawaiian food then this is the place to go. It's just so good every time. I always ask my Hawaiian friends where is a food place to eat Hawaiian food at and they always say Island Flavor.

Ju-a5kAWMNwORfpre0lzlA.text: My husband went to this Island Flavor restaurant in S. Durango location & ordered 2 plate dinners & oxtail soup to go. When my mom was about to eat her oxtail soup, she noticed that it was only soup & vegetables inside &   it doesn't have any oxtail at all. I WAS SO MAD & called them back & this lady named I think it was Tiare or Tiana said that they just realize that there wasn't any oxtail after my husband left. How can you possibly forget to put oxtail in my oxtail soup. Don't you need to scoop it & put it in the container. They charged my husband $11 for just soup & vegetables w/out oxtail.  I WON'T BE COMING BACK TO THIS RESTAURANT ANYMORE! Yeah they said they'll put credit for me. I might just get a refund.   They don't have the owner there anymore, the older lady that used to be in the cashier. When she was there, they're not making this mistake. Now that she's not there anymore they keep messing the orders. Last time my husband ordered loco moco w/ over easy eggs they over cooked the eggs. Then on my husband's birthday I want to order haupia ice cream cake. I called they said we don't make it here it's next door Andres World of Cake. So my husband called there to buy the whole haupia ice cream cake. Then when he went to pick it up, it was just haupia cake not ice cream cake. Then after I finished work I stop by @ Island Flavor & told to Tiana that one of their worker told me that they have the haupia ice cream cake next door that's why my husband ordered it there. Come to find out that it wasn't haupia ice cream cake it was actually haupia ice cream pie that they serve at Island Flavor. I told the lady that "you guys should just corrected me that it wasn't a haupia ice cream cake, but a haupia ice cream pie." Told them that my husband was so mad on his birthday because of their mistake. We ended up still bought the cake & I bought 4 slices of haupia ice cream pie because I know that my husband wanted that haupia ice cream pie.

gGSL-DtKfZszzYHVI0AZeQ.text: I ordered catering for my sons 1st bday party and the food was great and ready to pick up on time, easy to order. When we come and sit at the restaurant to eat sometimes the service can be a little off but that's when they suddenly get busy and there's only a couple people on the floor. Musubi's are bomb, I know it's easy to make but seriously the best in town. They're double the size of the other places and just fresher and tastes better. I guess the only thing I don't care for is the roast pork, many rave about it but personally I don't care for it, it's like flavorless unless u add all that gravy, I'd rather eat kalua pork instead. Beef stew is awesome, just like grandmas and any of the chicken dishes are good too. Don't forget to order dessert ! Cakes like theirs are hard to find here in Vegas. The bakery next door can also make a custom cake for you too.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best musubi in Vegas!

4yOEj0BBjQNV9ZmP-khC2w.text: Holy freaking big ass plate of food!  Had a 30 minute drive all the was down south, but it was definitely worth it though.  Had to try their Ahi Poke Furikake style.8 Standard Teriyaki chicken.8  Their Katsu was overcooked and meat was pretty dry. Im hoping it was just a bad batch because i really love Chicken Katsu.6 Those Kalbi ribs though.. ugh! (Rick Ross) I thought was going to die eating those. They're the entree size for a baby dinosaur and really really tasty.10  Jump on this spot, because you will liike.

_UAc44ytJWTTIMp8usnYbQ.text: Ono grinds... Especially if you want that BIG Island Flava from back home! Maile and Bruce do a good job of bringing you memories from da islands!

GQTKhdNwlohqdVW_2WaFIQ.text: This was our first meal in Las Vegas.  We figured this would be the only time to actually go off strip and sit down for a meal.  We got the poke here and it was delicious! We also tried their special chicken and it was just OK.  The short ribs were decent also.  But you should come here for the POKE!

MCzqu6KyNsKl3jf04MBmHQ.text: I've been in Vegas for a week now and I've already eaten here twice.  Each time the staff has been friendly and quick, even when the restaurant is busy.   The portions are enormous so my fiance and I share the mixed plate with short ribs and furikake chicken (both delicious), and we always leave full.  I highly recommend the tropical iced tea, which is refreshing and flavorful.  My only problem is that everything on the dessert menu sounds delicious, so I cant avoid ordering dessert, and at the same time, I have a hard time deciding what to have. There are a variety of cakes and ice creams that sound wonderful. Last time we split a Kona Coffee Mudd Pie. The Oreo crust and coffee flavored ice cream were perfect.  Definitely trying the banana bread pudding next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YzTelMHGb52lggweiRDf1A.text: If you ever want to get that authentic taste. This is the place to do it. Great music, great service, and great company. If you go here don't leave without trying one of their desserts. Delicious!

GRkwkS6WiZy93BZiExW7dA.text: Definitely my favorite Hawaiian food place to eat! Their food is pretty darn good and the portions as most Hawaiian places are generous for great prices. They do take out as well as dine in. They have one of the best chicken teriyaki dishes I've had, and their amazing chicken furikake is pretty unique in itself. They flavor it very well,and I recommend for anybody to give it a try and find out for yourself. On top of all the good food they have live music on Fridays and Saturday's if anybody wants to feel like you're closer to the islands. I'd recommend this place to anybody to give it a go! You won't be disappointed!

2zP6mNv0c7m6PsCMoxImVA.text: The people and the food were great. I'm glad it tastes just like the food back home. The restaurant is newly renovated and expanded for larger crowds.

GSOsF6picOnRc9YC-DjSaA.text: I thought this place was like any other Hawaiian place. Although there was dishes you wouldn't normally find at the other places I still think it was good but not great.   What we had were Furikake poke Oxtail soup Corn beef hash w eggs over rice And for dessert chantilly cake  The cake was the bomb!! I'll definitely come back to try other things and maybe the review could change

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. furikake poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash and eggs

2dUD8KslfdKn6jnIBlhHlw.text: Island Flavor is my go-to spot when I am craving some Hawaiian food (which is seriously all the time). I love it here so much that it's near/at the top of my go-to eating spots when friends and family visit town.  It can take awhile to get seated, due to the small amount of tables and seats available, but the wait is completely worth it. When you're seated, your server will be quick to get you your drink(s) and take your order. Never has my order taken more than 15 minutes -- they're really quick with your order, small or big! Speaking of big, their food portions are huge, especially for the price you pay! Most of their dishes are less than $10, but you'll feel that you are getting a $20 meal, portion and taste factored in.  My go-to meal is usually the furikake chicken. If you love breaded chicken and you love it sweet, definitely try this dish! You might even get carried away by ordering one for two people.  Food tastes amazing, and the staff there are just as great as the food! And let's say you prefer to take your food to-go, they're really quick and easy about that. I've ordered from their website plenty of times and had my food ready in about 15 minutes. Mahalo Island Flavor, and see you folks (again) very soon!

PmGqEcXrF5t4amKB4L71lA.text: Went to island flavor on an aloha Friday, da music was jamming. Short wait for a table, of course we found this place by ohana raving about Ono grinds . You get island flavor, island  hospitality, and island portions ! This was my first visit but no way my last.

F4Bhj_kMAUFGYGcsSwORYg.text: Definitely feel like a glutinous slob after this meal!!! HUGE portions, friendly staff and delicious food. What more can you ask for?  Feeding my Hawaiian food addiction, we finally ventured to Egypt to eat here. I've eaten here before, but it's been years and wanted to see if it was as good as I remembered. After looking at pics prior to our visit, we opted for sesame poke, furikake chicken and kalbi short ribs. When our food finally arrived, we both knew there was no way we were going to eat all of it.  The poke came out first. They offer different flavors; furikake, shoyu or sesame. We opted for the sesame and it was delish.  Lots of onions for crunch, fresh fish and a good amount of seasoning. 5 stars.  I ordered the furikake chicken which comes with macaroni salad and I opted for brown rice. For everyone who doesn't know what furikake is, it's a seasoning containing bits of seaweed, sesame seeds and salt. The chicken was fried to a good crisp and the furikake added that extra flavor. The mac salad was good and creamy, a bit heavy on the mayo but it was still good. The only  thing I didn't like was the brown rice. It was just too mushy. It was like normal white rice but brown. I like the pieces of my brown rice not to be stuck together. Had to drop this to 3 stars cuz the rice was a huge disappointment.   The bf ordered the Kalbi ribs. These ribs were like Kalbi ribs on steroids. (Only saying that for description.) They were huge, thick pieces of meat, not the thinner pieces you are normally used to eating. Good char on the meat and good ratio of fat. 5 stars for this.   All in all, solid Hawaiian food joint. I will definitely be back if I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sesame poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bf&#39;s short ribs

pYCfHddY3I29vY-GtqhiMg.text: One of our go to spots to eat in Las Vegas. Always fast and super friendly service. The Kalbi short ribs are amazing!!! Do yourself a favor and try this place

4BMdnILa9PjpZ3wLAsywKw.text: The portions are huge! It is likely that you will leave taking leftovers. We had the Kalabi Short Ribs and the Furikake Chicken. Both were very flavorful. The both come with a side of white or brown rice and a scoop of macaroni. The kalabi short ribs were marinated in a Korean sauce and the furikake chicken was crunchy white meat.

vi1uLipqG-Sx--g2T0VF0A.text: Love the look made more space for the busy days always love the food never fails!! The best spot for some Fresh Poke!

lqnye1i5dwfWvq_G3Wvcdg.text: The Food is amazing. I repeat the food is amazing. But the service is about the worst thing I've ever seen still. Came back to see if the service was better and guess what it wasn't. Drinks never refilled once, no napkins, waiting 15 minutes just for a box. Like how do you have 4 runners and not 1 gets it. But damn is the food good. Sadly I live in Rhodes Ranch and would rather pay for delivery to never have to sit in there. Get someone to fix your FOH .... it's still horrible.

UOUOiqUdQTDxMYvwY5KgWw.text: The food here is better than some of the Hawaiian restaurants in Oahu.  We ordered the Aloha Friday Special with Kalua Pork and Lau Lau. Both dishes were delicious. The pork in the Lau Lau was very tender and cooked just right.   They give you good portions of food which is more than enough to satisfy your appetite. We couldn't finish all of it so we took some home. Our waitress best described the portion of food as "Go Big or Go Home". I think she was right about that.  The staff that work at the restaurant are very friendly and have a great sense of humor. They are very attentive to your needs.   We would definitely return here again the next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aloha Friday Special - Kalua Pork

Tdb-vCeRAoLwNJxSaxalow.text: This place is a little out of my way but it was worth the trip because the food was delicious! I had the Ox Tail soup on a hot day and it was so good! The broth had a savory taste and it was filled with meat and veggies. I like that the rice and mac salad was also included. I like eating rice with my soup because it reminded me of Sinigang . I don't know if I spelled that right but it is a Filipino soup that my mom makes. The mac salad was awesome I could have easily ate two scoops!   I had the guava cake for desert because it was pink ..that is my favorite color . The waitress also recommended it .  The cake was nice and moist and it wasn't overly sweet. If I'm ever near this location  Island Flavor would definitely be on my list!

9mFf88piIxtBB_DhG4RyDg.text: Finally a place that serves a bombness Portuguese Bean Soup! The cup is a perfect size for this manly man. Portions here are legit. Also ordered Kalua Pork; Very enjoyable and not salty like other places we've been to. And We've been all over Hawai'i and here in LV. Friends know I don't play when it comes to food. The Furikake Shrimp comes with this amazingassness dip, but always tend to ask for lemons for any shrimp I get, it's a Texas thing, or it just me?! Anywayz... the shrimp, lemon and the sweet tangy dip is Onolicious. Don't come here trying to stick to a diet . Enjoy and share the Aloha

gEpY0fHFfYRbHczKTKQD6Q.text: Excellent little place! Fish not on the menu but man, can they make a mean snappah.   Very good!   Def happy the beautiful island girl here recommend.   Thanks,  Aloha :)

rJIps21oRWqyj3iLwkvESw.text: As authentic as it gets!  Huge portions... HUGE guys.. Plenty of flavor and island hospitality  I don't live by this area but if i'm around for work, i'll definitely be stopping by for some good grub

bHUnHfHzQAy8tTvcQ2GQaA.text: Always great food! This is the only Hawaiian restaurant I go to now. The service is okay, but the food makes up for it. The portions are big and the prices are very reasonable.

UM2eSxZA27c5Z7Tnt6DMRQ.text: We were in the area and decided to visit Island Flavor after reading several rave reviews and checking out pictures on Yelp (mostly just looking at pics). Everyone seemed to praise the furikake chicken, so we ordered that. We also ordered sesame poke and the beef teriyaki after the waitress suggested it as a 2nd entree.   The furikake chicken was described by one reviewer as "life-changing." Well I'm writing this review the morning after and I can tell you I feel like the same person I was before dinner and it truly wasn't all that. The breading is thin and crisp, with a strong sesame oil aroma and sweet flavor. They use a combination of light and dark meat. Furikake chicken is a solid 3 star dish- nothing more or less. The beef teriyaki was teriyaki... the sesame poke was great, though. The cubes of tuna melt in your mouth. Probably could have marinated just a little bit longer, but still delicious. Huge portions!  We also ordered the guava cake and it was both beautiful and delicious. It really doesn't need the whipped cream dollop, though! It mixes oddly with the flavor of the sauce. Our slice of cake was huge and was the best part of our dining experience.   The restaurant was clean and I noticed they have received an "A" from the health department. Kinda funky lighting, but still a nice aesthetic. All of their tables have pull-out chairs, no booths. Service was friendly, but it took a very long time before our water was refilled, we were offered dessert, or we received our bill. We probably won't return before trying other bookmarked Hawaiian spots.

z6TithOcw-8uE0dsscMNig.text: This place is great. I always get the furikake chicken with a side of their sesame dressing. Their portions are huge and I always have left overs. I recommend getting their combo plate so you can try two of their entrees for a smaller price! The wait staff is also very polite and quick!

9WwSIrGOGzlmCcPv83JaTA.text: This place is amazing!!! I've been ordering the grilled chicken and rice and my man has been getting the beef with rice and everything is cooked well. It's delicious, I really recommend this place.

GlO7OK7fgIoO53JD0A7YTA.text: Auntie Edna is amazing! The atmosphere was family friendly and the food is worth the wait!! Came from Monterey just to enjoy some great Hawaiian cuisine!! Highly recommend this place. Lots of leftovers for later :)

DkTOnkQBb7j4vZsRrgAItA.text: Never a let down :)))! the only spot i know who sells the thicker kalbi then those thin ones. Wait is sometimes long but worth it!

hXcIRWEhpU6oj7dIDLosTg.text: Stopped in before we headed back home to San Diego. Everything we ate was amazing! So glad we found this place, definitely gonna make a stop every time the service was awesome and food was perfect!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chefs Loco Moco

7yMC7EwK3v1KnfUWVTc44w.text: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing portions, amazing everything lol. This place good a must try if your in the area.

-qw1lDzRPmec-3rUZZOxCg.text: Their furikake chicken is the best!!! Some pieces are a bit harder to chew, but other than that, it was very flavorful and they gave me a large portion. Great macaroni salad, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sS02hWiZIG-soN3HuMLHSA.text: ALOHA!! Best Hawaiian food in town.  Nuff Said!!

GIJ3e8ndbDEZV29jM-6Udg.text: We ordered the ox tail soup, kalbi and roast pork, furakake chicken and kalua pig. All was delicious. Our favorite was the kalbi and furikake chicken. We also ordered hawaiian poke which came out a little late.

yEXOBGpOlPB3w2vU0vNTGw.text: Finally made it back after nearly 7 years. The food is just as good as I remember it. In fact better and more refined.  Poke sampler over fried avocado was a first. The chef's loco moco is the equivalent of a volcano made out of mouth watering meats and rice, topped off with three sunny side fried eggs. The umami mushroom gravy is to die for. So glad we made it back. Come to the 9th island and find time to get away from the tourists on the strip.

IsCeSe8CtOaTD0HZ97autg.text: We were very excited to see they feature new desserts to their menu. We were really looking forward to try their new Chantilly cake and their Long John donuts. The presentation were AMAZING! It was a double layer cake and the Chantilly frosting was thick. However, I could not taste the flavor of the Chantilly. It tasted more like a sugar frosting instead. Then, I tried the Long John's loved it. The donut was soft sprinkled with the powdered sugar. The cream filling tasted quite similar to the frosting they put on the cake. It's best not to do short cuts. The demands are high especially when you are serving people who are from Hawaii. It's very hard to beat the first baker who made their Chantilly cakes. It takes time to Master a Chantilly frosting.

aojtNCF5Qf4dUzugb806uA.text: There are times in this life when a plate of food just touches your soul. The furikake chicken plate at this joint IS that plate.  I was down the street looking for lunch and was about settle in to Cafe Rio, but couldn't find a parking spot in the crowded EOS parking lot. I got frustrated and stormed out towards Island Flavor because my buddy ate here earlier in the day. It looked good so I figured, why not?  On his advice, I got the furikake chicken. It's bite sized (a bit larger than bite sized) chicken that's fried, and doused in some sort of furikake sauce (google it so I don't have to explain it), served with Mac salad and rice.  Do yourself a favor and mix a little rice with the Mac salad. It's the gangsta move.  All of this for about $10.  Thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z5juoSaLgqA5vE3IhG40Xg.text: No surprise, I got the Roast Pork Loco. Really flavorful, tender pork, with brown gravy. What isn't there to love?  Heard many things about this place and they live up to the hype. The restaurant is on the small side so go early to avoid the wait! But the cozy atmosphere makes you feel like you're in someone's home. This compliments the great service and family feel.  Back to the food though - Roast Pork Loco & Sunday's special Kimchee Fried Rice w/ Korean Chicken. Portions here are HUGE! We had leftovers for dinner and even had some for lunch the next day.  Roast Pork Loco - the pork reminded me of kalua pork, but less salty. Tender, succulent, and when mixed in with the signature brown gravy and some egg yolk .. I can't even. Words escape how amazing this dish is. Each bite delivered an intense pork flavor with egg and rice playing a supporting role. I would recommend getting a side of their mac salad as well to help cut through the richness of the dish.   Kimchee Fried Rice w/ Korean chicken wings - The plate came with a mountain of fried rice, 5-6 wings, and a hefty scoop of mac salad. They make some juicy wangs here! Crunchy exterior, juicy interior, with a sweet kick taste. The fried rice also had a healthy amount of kimchee. They do not skimp on anything here!  Definitely got a taste of island flavor here! I cannot wait to come back to try their other dishes like the Chicken Katsu Loco and Furikake Chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday special! Kimchee Fried Rice with Korean Chicken.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast Pork Loco with some yolk porn.

owrFOaf5OMFzrCAPiqOxZA.text: Went in around 11 am and the place was dead there was many table open and somehow it took 15-20 mins for our order to be taken. Nevertheless that was the only bad part of my experience here. The food was great furikake chicken is a must try if you like that honey glazed texture with a hint of spicy. The staff is unbelievably nice as we were walking outside the place an employee, what looked like the manager, went out and greeted us off! Overall a very nice place with very big portions!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zCglTpu1_i9BSM6e6vU8iQ.text: Vegas is the 9th Hawaiian island for a reason. So many good Hawaiian restaurants, so little allowed calories in a day to eat them all. Island Flavor has 2 locations, this one being larger and more of a restaurant than the other location (other location is more for takeout).  Furikake chicken. Furikake chicken. Think of wet, sticky, juicy fried chicken with some furikake flavor. Favorite thing on the menu.  The chicken Katsu is better than some of the other places I've been to in the city, but the meat to fried portion is still lacking.  The Yelp takeout menu doesn't have the mixed plate option on it that they have in restaurant. Definitely the best bang for your buck!

VZkoHQV57DeEA_GVNgIMoA.text: Had the monstah plate with kalbi, teriyaki chicken and chicken katsu. It was delicious!! The chicken katsu wasn't at all dry like other places! The servers were very friendly and welcoming the moment we stepped into the door. I really liked how they expanded the restaurant. Great place to check out! Unfortunately, we didn't take a picture before we ate it, the food was just that great we had to dig in so quickly!

tfyLO_ll79lbNSAQXtnohA.text: chicken furikaki, korean chicken, chicken katsu, calby short rib. we ordered for pick up and we said no rice for all the orders. and we got home and checked the orders 2 orders has rice and sides. the manager refused to change our order, saying that she cannot change it, but my point is the order they gave us is wrong. they do not  want to correct the wrong behavior their empolyee is doing. You cannot correct a wrong doing with another wrong one. This is a bad customer service for tonight. 2 days ago we ordered 2 orders of chicken furikaki itself no sides, correct order but when we ate the chicken, 1 order tasted like old batch of chicken, the other one is good. hope they do better in their customer service. God bless! not a happy customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FwzMWmFV1KNGErzTzK6-vA.text: Best Hawaiian around! We started with the avocado fries, which were bomb. We weren't in a rush or anything & never said anything about waiting to our server, but they took it upon themselves to send us out a free app when the food was taking a little longer than usual. Super cool of them! Christine was awesome, took great care of us the whole time. When our meals did come out they were huge! We all got boxes to go and were excited to eat them for lunch the next day

NkNVrqVn40jjXtxPR-cSXw.text: This is probably one of my favorite Hawaiian places in Vegas. The first time I came, they had a live Hawaiian band (which just reminded me of when I lived on the islands). The food is amazing and the customer service is great! Definitely a must have if you're missing the island or just want some ono kine grindz.

6fqmT9VvrPyGTVUxZJkjeA.text: Really good food! Store is really clean. Vibe is really nice. Staff are friendly. Massive parking lot, fast service

SghvhO-GMeepugUoHb-KDw.text: Love the food here. The Kalbi fried rice is the bomb!!!! Super yummy! Huge servings too! The guava cake is a must have too!

p0CRUnLEbQvrrLI7FqEBjQ.text: The food was awesome the staff was amazing the best Hawaiian food I've ever had in vegas!

FNARH6Hrdn76IEzk_xVnHg.text: I happened to be driving in the area and pulled in. The place was empty considering they just opened. Looks like it's newly renovated. Looks very clean and nice. Hawaiian music playing in the background.   I got the Portuguese sausage eggs and rice. I ate it at home. Very disappointed because it was thinly sliced like bacon. Most places cut it thicker.   Was it good? Yes. Was it worth the price? No. Will I be back? Maybe . If they skimped out on the sausage I'm afraid to try their other plates. I'm willing to go back and try a lunch or dinner special

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qsG3hdmJn1e_61JAcQkCQg.text: Whenever your craving Hawaiian food this is one of the best spots to come to. I usually order the furikake chicken and that's a 10/10 all the time. Crispy saucy and hot. And the Kalbi is amazing here too. This time I ordered their 9th island bombs. It's a fried avacado with poke and spicy taco on it. It was good but a lot of avacado. I give it a 7/10. And their kona mud pie is amazing! A few people can share it on the table and be satisfied. I'll always come back. Would definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9th island bombs

iWugWHzZQgU1LfUR8sx56A.text: I do have to say i never knew Island Flavor was big. I thought it was smaller, tbh. They are newly renovated. It was nice and spacious inside. This was our first time there and I have to say that the food was great but the service was not. It was not horrible but I definitely think the servers could have been more friendly and helpful. We felt rushed ordering, no recommendations and she was irritated when we asked for extra plates and etc.   Oxtail soup: YUM! I no longer need to go to California Hotel during their midnight special. They gave us lots of meat in the bowl, the broth had great flavor. Only 2 suggestions for this was to give a side of soy sauce and ginger (like Cali Hotel) and give more broth  Kalbi Ribs: WOW! Just Wow! So delicious! Their Kalbi ribs were the BOMB! It was charred with such amazing flavor. Some Kalbi ribs you get just tastes like soy sauce. This was more than that, it was a sweet flavor to it but it was not over powering.   Mac salad: soooo good! It was thick and flavorful.   Chicken Katsu: eh, nothing special. Just like any other chicken katsu on the block.   BTW, their portions are HUGE!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l3l90TO8xzAPCRqX2x2Qzw.text: Went back to this place after talking to the owner. She was very nice and responsive. No rude servers this time.  Food was great, the way I remember it Service was chaotic, but they were all very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shrimp thief ate half my shrimp before I got there

eJvyLl8sky4TikmHDG23LQ.text: We are obsessed with Island Flavor! So far our favorite item is the Teriyaki Chicken, but the rest of the food is good to. Especially the guava cake! I'm almost drooling thinking about it. The only menu item I didn't love was the roast pork because it was super salty. We usually order to-go, but we've eaten inside a few times. The restaurant is a lot nicer inside than the shopping center will show you. While the servers are all so nice and wonderful, we've had had some slow service (but only because it was packed, and not at the fault of the staff). We've already eaten here 4 times this month....and it's likely we will be coming back for more soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki Steak

k1p2YhMr02c7ugJTqsF0GQ.text: Great Friday night entertainment. Good local flavor with friendly local service.  in the evening, and as expected it was a bit busy. But, we were surprised to be seated with relative ease in due time. Was greeted by a friendly server who immediately got us drinks. Shortly thereafter, are official server greeted us and provided menu service. Menu consists of local classics but, perhaps their most favorite item is the furikake chicken. Ono stuff.

BmzsYJnp3TYoLAacFl6F6w.text: I usually order from island flavor express location on Eastern and I always get the furikake chicken. Always cooked perfectly.   But the Durango location in regards to their furikake chicken has been very dry and oily for the last few times I've ordered it. I always say, maybe it was an off day for the kitchen and give them another try. Disappoints time and time again. Nothing about it is "crispy" as it's described on the menu.  Not very happy with the Durango location. Just not on point like before.   The hamburger steak on the other hand was good. Loved the gravy.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry furikake chicken

UI0BhTDfnNZ2Y8J3fq8-FQ.text: This place use to be the spot. It's been over a year since I last visited, looks like the quality of everything went down hill. The furikake chicken was disappointing; flavor was super subtle... if you're looking to get watered down chicken. Check this spot out. The portioning of the Kalbi was mediocre, I ended up leaving half of it on my plate because it was all fat and bones.   You'd think a spam musubi is impossible to butcher, not today. You're better off opening a can from your pantry because it doesn't look like they cook it or add any sauce to the musubis.  Yikes, all I know is I was smart to stay away that year and so should everyone else.

1KdwzG2iVENxRUmeMQQEMQ.text: An Uber driver, brother Jerry told my sister and I about Island Flavor so we just had to check it out as he couldn't stop raving about how Bomb the food is. What we didn't know was he was beyond wrong it wasn't the Bomb it was much more than that it was STUPENDOUSLY FULL OF LOADED DISHES LIKE ITS NAME ISLAND FLAVOR THAT WAS BEYOND DELICIOUSNESS. TOTALLY A MUST STOP FOR GREAT ISLAND SPECIALS...Everything we ordered tasted just like home plus the portions were so big we couldn't finish them. #IslandFlavor will be the first and last stop we make every time we go to Las Vegas for sure. Ms.Ally the owner is such a great lady and super sweet and full of choke love and aloha. #IslandFlavorOurNewFaveEateryForLocalkineGrinds

6C4vGvbWGJtFfCKQGp-8EQ.text: I stand corrected as the owner responded to me indicating they do indeed have an app (Chow Now but look up "Island Flavor" in Play Store!)  I understand some shlepps out there order and don't show up, but am excited to know we can securilely order ToGo items anywhere we happen to be.  Well done Island Flavor for responding kindly. My Aloha Spirit was indeed lacking!

IQ7o9KdYMp0DtZ3RvffKNA.text: Ok so needing a fix of island flavor, we ordered takeout on the fly and I have to say, what an amazing quick process, the hostess was so sweet and it made the ordering process so easy  And of course the food was yet again   It is a must to try

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Steak Teriyaki
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice and chicken Katsu and yummy steak
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and Furikake Chicken and white rice

ZiGZro9ts4cj4ISlPATe1g.text: Reply to Darcy unfortunately not we both needed to head to work and just wasn't having it. I've been coming here since I moved in 2017 and it's always been ono but today was just something else.   Very disappointed into what this place has become. After new management I was iffy about coming here but you know what I came anyways and continued to enjoy my food. Certain days it was ok and other days it was awesome. Today just wasn't the day for me and it's lost my business I got the chefs loco moco and my patty just tasted burnt was not enjoyable at all. My girlfriend on the other hand isn't really a heavy eater she barely finishes a Teri steak plate. Today she got a mix plate with the steak and kalbi. Portion was so small she almost finished it, she would've ate it all but the kalbi was just all fat barely had any meat on it. When she complained to Tina one of the waitresses all she said was sorry with no meaning into it. I am no longer gonna eat here service is horrible Tina should be fired she has no personality or humor I shouldn't even have tipped her but I'm not that type of person. Honestly if you want good local food just go to ohana bbq island flavor is pau no more coming back.

-LruOnOwCGN4N7IBc4BbAQ.text: Visiting from out of town, this was our first visit to Island Flavor with recommendations from friends.   The restaurant is located in a strip mall. The doors and windows are darken black. At night, we didn't know if it was open or not! But we saw people exiting and as we approached closer, we could see the lighted interior. Whew! We really wanted to try the food and they did not disappoint!  I ordered the mixed plate with their known Furikaki Chicken and Kalbi Ribs. The chicken is lightly coated with batter and deep fried and then coated with a light sweet honey glaze (my guess!); the pieces were good mouth size and moist and tasty.  The Kalbi Ribs were marinated in teriyaki sauce and then grilled, so tasty!!!  I requested veggies and the Mac salad as my sides. They do offer white rice, fried rice and French fries, too.  My hubby ordered the Oxtail Soup.  The serving was quite generous with 5 good size pieces. The broth was delicious with shredded carrots , chopped celery and slices of ginger.  This is definitely a repeat dish on a cold night!   Our friends ordered Kona Mud Pie to share. It was HUGE and it was perfect to close the end of the meal.   We will definitely come back again to try the other offerings!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YFbDHS13arMP0O5kHqh3_w.text: Heard Island Flavor expanded as well as went under new ownership, so we had to visit.  Glad to report it's still as good as it ever was!  The fam & I were driving on the SW side of town that night thinking of what to eat for dinner.  It had been a while, so I think it was me that said, "Let's go to Island Flavor!"  And off we were!  Got to the parking lot and all looked to be the same outside.  But upon entering - we noticed the place is now much bigger!  Island Flavor knocked down the entire wall to the business next door (which used to be their Hawaiian mini mart of sorts), effectively making their restaurant nearly twice the size!  Lots more room now for us hungry locals, and lots less wait!  We got easily seated in 5 minutes.  But then my anxiousness started because I had to wonder - was the menu under the new ownership still the same??  Fear not my Hawaii friends, the menu for Island Flavor is pretty much intact!  All the usual favorites are still there, and thankfully the size portions are still there too!  Don't be shy...eat all your rice!  Poi too if you got it!  Make you big boys & girls!  We were hungry so we ordered BIG:  -Mixed Plate ($11.50) with Chicken Katsu & Teriyaki Chicken -Mixed Plate ($11.50) with Furikake Chicken & Hawaiian Style Roast Pork -Loco Moco ($9) - 10 oz. homemade burger patty, over rice with 2 over easy eggs & smothered in gravy  Eh!  Still taste the same as I remember!  Glad they didn't change up the recipes too much if any at all - still ONO!  Brok da' mout!!  Island Flavor makes some damn tasty chicken katsu, and thankfully the katsu sauce has flavor too!  Furikake chicken was salty & sweet at the same time, and the Hawaiian Style roast pork was tender & savory with the gravy.  The Loco Moco - who can say anything bad about that?  Great grilled hamburger patty (need those burnt edges), a runny egg, rich gravy...over a Mack truck portion of rice!  Definitely drool worthy!  Aloha spirit is still there at Island Flavor too, gotta love the service for us kama'aina!  Pleasant, fast, friendly, but at the same time no rush for us to get in and out.  Probably could have stayed to talk story!  Island Flavor no worries, you guys still doing good.  Keep it up, we'll be back soon!  Shakas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GqtEweulokXUqa6YQdL1bA.text: Island flavor is ono.But prices are high.People from Hawaii will come to island flavor. But please don't take advantage with the prices.They came to Vegas for a cheaper place to live.Mahalo!

_EYuUbw2g0sXJGhH2FyyQg.text: The Korean chicken is one of the best and tastiest I've ever had. Chicken cooked perfectly and sauce to die for!! Chop steak was not what I expected. More like a beef tomato. Will order Korean chicken again...won't order chop steak. Great local flair.

BvJv4mRmO3fXNT5NXVFpvA.text: Island Flavor located in a small center on Durango, near Blue Diamond, right across from Rhodes Ranch.  They expanded the restaurant to be bigger, so more tables are available to dine in. Their windows are very dark tinted. In the evening, it's pretty hard to see if they are open or not.  I almost didn't stop by, almost kept driving. I thought they are closed. No open sign on the door or on the window either.  Well, I liked everything we ordered.  I got the Short Ribs $15.99 plus Kimchi $2.99. My friend ordered the Chicken Katsu $9.99. All orders come with two scoops of rice and one scoop of macaroni salad. If you like fried rice, that's extra charge. Our server was very attentive.  I asked if I can taste the kimchi before I order it, because I don't like very spicy food, and I didn't want to NOT like it. So she brought me a little sample, so I could taste it. And I really liked it! I ate a piece of chicken katsu from my friend's plate.  It was very fresh and tasty with the sauce. The short ribs were marinated, very flavorful and delicious! We also had guava juice, and a soft drink. Just for your information, there are NO refills on the drinks.  The restaurant was very busy, but everyone got seated quickly.  I will return to try other menu items in the future, especially some dessert too!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi short ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi short ribs with kimchi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu

jCW54HPLpa2jaXPHEG27tQ.text: Used to be my favorite place for Hawaiian food but the new owners have made it mediocre. The food doesn't have quite the same flavor and the portions have been made much smaller. Not our "go to place" anymore.

_4P-ybiZFDuODxPZc7wsRw.text: Island Flavor on Durango and Windmill is the original restaurant. When you come on Saturday between 6pm to 8pm, they have live music. I was here for dinner and two gentlemen were performing a beautiful acoustic of "You Look Wonderful Tonight." It definitely got me feeling good. The sound of Hawaiian music brings me back to a time when I used to live on an island and everyone is so friendly and pretty laid back. I was told they had finish renovating the restaurant. It has more open space with simple table arrangement. I like the nice layout, it is a clean look, and the atmosphere feels calm, relax, and serene. They do have wonderful and friendly service and treat every customer like one big family. Joslyn took good care of me. She came to my table with a smile and I really appreciate her attentiveness.   For dinner, I start off with a cold drink and got the Unsweetened Tropical Iced Tea ($2.00). The lemon in the iced tea makes it taste a lot more refreshing especially on a hot day and they do give refill on fountain drink. I especially love Guava Juice ($2.50) and the fruit's natural sweetness. It's like the perfect tropical summer drink that I cannot get enough of. I opt for the Mixed Plate ($11.50) with Furikake Chicken and Korean Chicken. This meal comes with two scoops of brown rice and a macaroni salad and I added a side of sauteed veggies ($1.75).   At the Durango location, this restaurant serve generous portion. I heard that Furikake Chicken was good but when I tried it, the flavor just didn't appeal to me, it taste too sweet. Also, the brown rice taste like it has too much water in it. On a happier note, I did enjoy the Korean Chicken, this has a nice crunch and good savory flavor, and I like the macaroni salad and sauteed veggies with the yellow squash, zucchini and onions, these are good too.   Now my absolute favorite is the Guava Cake ($5.00). They make the cake soft, there's amazing guava flavor, it has a light frosting, it's not too sweet, and it's the best kind of dessert that makes me go "yum!" Seriously, it's so good I want to buy the whole guava cake and bring some of that Island Flavor home with me for real.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate With Korean Chicken, Furikake Chicken, 2 Brown Rice and Macaroni Salad
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed Veggies: Yellow Squash, Zucchini, Onions and Carrots
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava Cake With Drizzle Of Mango and Raspberry Sauce

OuBCz5CpOypruw3lhkWikA.text: Where do I start? It's my wife and I's first time here. And o my. The portions are huge! We're going to have to share. My wife had the Spicy Avocado Poke. And I had the Chef's Loco Moco with loco moco and sausage and spam and 3 eggs. Will definitely be back back over and over again...

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6AQmNnyKidDZOnzH8lm3wA.text: Such a good hawaiian restaurent. Ive tried many and this far is thebest in vegas. The fried rice omelette was very good.. also the loco moco

VOHKweghiq6QVQJZAY-VDQ.text: Ono grindz!!!! Food makes me miss home so much. Take out or eat in is always delicious. Staff is always very friendly & they even play live music! Definitely a favorite spot to eat. Everything we have ordered here is delicious.

Fa5K29lrtoMLB2w5KsEqNA.text: The plates are huge. I usually share or take home the rest for another meal. The hoisin rubs fall off the bone you don't need a knife. Wish they had the cookies because they make the best cookies but they say it's too busy lately :(

lTiypji8Tqb6Bu-43LGudg.text: There's just so many things that I love about this place on a personal level because i'm an islander as well and this just reminds me of Carson, CA.  The interior decor nothing great but there's just something about it that makes you feel as if you were in someone's kitchen which is nice to me.  The staff and cooks are real islanders so they really know the True island flavors when it comes to cooking what we like.  Most of them even have the pigeon accent, a rarity to find people in vegas that are really from the islands.  The music they play really True to the culture, not no Jack Johnson like what other island theme restaurants choose to play.  The lady serving me was so kind and reminds me of my lola (grandma).  They are not selfish here with their servings. This is the first restaurant where I couldn't finish a loco moco (beef patty, eggs, rice, and plenty of gravy).  I only finished halfway and was already full with no room in my tummy reserved.  It was good because they made it just the way I like my loco moco, heavy with gravy baby.  Can't wait to come back and try their ox tail soup.  Only regret about this place is that it gets you so full that you get very sleepy after.    Another restaurant I'm glad to live near by.  Southwest Vegas really has plenty of hidden treasures.  I did this review on my iphone, now my fingers are cramped and sore.

krxUxvCtjdY7mpDimHN15w.text: My first time trying Hawaiian food and I was not disappointed. Ordered the Kalbi plate and it was delish! And the serving was huge! Also had lau lau, flavor was good but it was a tad salty, but from what I'm told it's  made like that. They have guava juice and other tropical drinks that were really yummy. Their servings and prices were good too. Definite food spot added to my list!

ZlHuXmJTnn6yyd3chJL7Aw.text: Went with my family during spring break. The family enjoyed the food - portions are huge! The staff was friendly to us and appreciated that they were on our must try list while on vacation.  Thumbs up on the Korean Fried Chicken (loved the flavor, would have loved it more if it was boneless white meat used instead of the wings - like they do in Hawaii). The Hawaiian roast pork was on point! The Chantilly cake was good - satisfied the craving. I still like Liliha Bakery's Chantilly cake better.  Will definitely come back if I'm in the area again.

TVyBDUrWoLyBPTblpE97xQ.text: Visited more than a dozen Hawaiian suggestions via Yelp. Island Flavor is the best place for local grinz hands down. The furikake chicken, the sweet sour spare ribs, and the roast pork are all very good. The deserts are HUGE. Bring your appetite!!!

m_mgrlwHrwAccvO53YpRFQ.text: Each time I come here, I continue to love it more and more. Maybe I was too enthralled in all the great conversation with my fellow yelpers, but I could find little to fault in last nights UYE at Island Flavor. It was a great evening in celebration of a really nice guy.   This was my third time here and the third time I had ordered the hoisin baby back ribs. Do I regret ordering the same thing and not deviating? NEVER! I did however shared the love and was shown some back when my companions offered me some of their plates. If they didn't, I would not know how good some of the other stuff was. The steak was delectable. The Korean chicken was perfection in taste and crispiness. The galbi was a disappointment. It was tough and chewy, unlike my amazing ribs. When I lifted one to take a bite, the meat slid right off. My plate was one of the few that went back bare, but I swear I shared.  The sesame poke was amazing and the serving is generous for $9.95. I might eat that when I am craving a "light" meal. We ended the night with some dessert. The banana bread pudding was good, but so dense. One bite and I was done. Then again, I did inhale a whole piece of the kona coffee mud pie. Sorry guys, you handed me a spoon and turned your back. I cannot resist ice cream. I still remember someone turning to point at how big the slice was and found a sliver left over. I ended up finishing that too. Both desserts are a great deal at $5.50. Just be careful who you decide to share them with.

hyle2bfDIGkukXw1_6nDQA.text: Great food, huge portions, and great prices!  Just was there again a little over a week ago.  The roasted pork with gravy is wonderful, as is the loco moco with hamburger patty or chicken cutlet.  My brother in law ordered the fried rice omelette, which was enormously huge!  and quite tasty.  Not the healthiest place to eat everyday, but when splurging on calories definitely a must stop!  Can't wait to go back.

AA-VfZgqxafP7fjI5zWccQ.text: This place blew our minds. From the entree and BOMB macaroni salad, to the amazing mud pie dessert and absolutely amazing and friendly staff.... This place is 5 stars all around. We'll definitely be back!!!!

KHboy4k2wi0URpb-ovsaeQ.text: I love hawaiian food. I used to work at a hawaiian BBQ. Nothing beats Island Flavor here in Vegas! I am so happy I live close to this place. First of all, the portions are HUGE for what you pay. I always have to box up my meal because I can't finish it in one sitting. I usually get the katsu moco and the gravy is incredible - bar none. It isn't the fanciest place, but the staff is always hospitable and the food is always amazing. That's enough to keep me coming back!

KbZg9tuy9xSFsZ6lzAPDEQ.text: Great place for authentic Hawaiian food.  Service staff is also very good and friendly.  The portions are huge and great for 2 people. As for the food: - Loco Moco - very tasty.  Probably the second best after a dish I ordered at a Cafe in Hawaii - Fried Rice (one of the specials of the day) - good but probably would order something more authentic Hawaiian next time.  I would definitely come back here again and want to try more of their Hawaiian dishes and will post another review next time I visit.  We also ordered an order of the spam masubi;however, it was pre-made and pre-wrapped.  I would have given this place 5 stars if their masubi was made fresh

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PYmhrCcKYuwbbv5fD5tOrg.text: This place is great, the Loco Moco is my favorite. I love chicken breasts, and I believe most of their chicken is rib. (That sounds so dirty). We've tried every dessert here... and hot damn they are all delicious. You can tell this is True Hawaiian cuisine when you walk in to the restaurant and it is loaded with Island natives. I always feel like the record scratches and all eyes are on use each time we walk in though. My friends love the short ribs, and daily specials. Make sure if you come here you save room for dessert.

IsQnd9mpZod8UAKPa0EQoA.text: Went here for the 1st time on my birthday. Food was really good, I had the Korean Chicken (wings) and they were very moist and tasty. I love chicken wings and these were in the top 10! My husband had the Hoke Poke, and it came in a huge bowl full of rice, a large hamburger patty on top of the rice with 2 over easy eggs on top of that and drowned with brown gravy, a meal for 2 easy. Of course he ate it all.  Beings it was my birthday we ordered dessert, it was a hard decision between the Guava Cake and the Mud Pie.  We chose the Mud Pie, and it was awesome, a huge peice.  Oreo cookie crust, with coffee flavored frozen ice cream like pie with whipped cream drizzled with chocolate & raspberry.    Here we thought oh boy we are packing in the calories & fat tonight when the waitress came over and asked how we liked it and told us that is was carb & sugar free!!  Wow, so we ate the whole thing right then and there!  The staff was very friendly and attenative!! We will be returning again!!

hcwPJQqGn4nESvASBJITDQ.text: I don't give 5 stars to many restaurants simply because everything must be perfect for a 5 star rating.  This place is very very close to 5 stars cause their food is so delicious.  I live exactly 2 miles from Flava but have never been there.  I've driven past it a million times and judging from the outside it certainly doesn't look like anything special. It even could resemble a cheap take out place from the outside but it's certainly not.  Never judge a book by it's cover.   Anyway, I had visitors from NYC coming to Vegas.  For some reason they chose to go this place which they said they go to every year when they come here.  When they invited me to go I was simply happy that I didn't have to go the strip to meet them.   Well, the menu is very large and varied. The staff was excellent towards us, constantly refilling our drinks and all that good stuff.  Since we had 7 people I was able to taste many different dishes. The raw tuna is excellent and you get a pound of it cut up into perfectly bite size pieces.   The burgers, steak and onions, wings, pork were all excellent.  I ordered the Snapper and I got 3 large pieces of fish of which I could only eat one. So, for 14 bucks I had dinner and brought 2 big pieces of fish home with me which was another complete meal for me.  I then finished up with the Mud Pie and as others have said it's not really a mud pie but still very very good and huge. I took half of that home as well.  Now that I know of this place and it's so darn close to my house, I may become an addict.  Especially with the takeout and they do have a delivery service that will deliver for them but I forgot the name of the service but you can just ask them and they will tell you.  It's very well lit up. Maybe a bit too bright but the minute your food arrives you forget about everything else and simply dig in.  I'm so happy my friends found it or I may have never walked in to the place.  Plenty of parking as well. If you live in the S.West this is a must go restaurant.  It will become a once a week gig for me at the least.

iaH3X_Cvw94fokqFx3A6xA.text: Probably the best Hawaiian I've had in town..the Korean chicken was my favorite until I tried the furikake chicken!..yum!..I've had the short ribs also which is pretty good..I just wish it had a little more flavor!..but I just ask for extra sauce on the side to make it tastier!..great place!

kdTDHJgQlbiIE0V45H2cHg.text: Going here on a Sunday for a late lunch was probably not the best time. It was pretty busy! I ordered a mixed plate with kalbi and chopped steak. The flavor was delicious, but the kalbi was quite chewy. I love the macaroni salad! The dessert portions were large. We ordered a guava cake and banana bread pudding. The guava cake was moist and sweet... But not too sweet. The bread pudding was yummy but a bit burnt. Overall, I would go back and try it again.

zeJ6z8Ncq0D8kS6-lMf9Pg.text: I wouldnt give you a five star yet, just because you have a little piece of heaven in kona coffee mud pie.   The food here is humongous. I ordered one item for the two of us just because we are asian and dont really eat hawaian portion kind of food.  So far, we ate the katsu loco moco, the korean chicken wings and the kalbi. Nothing over the top. Loco moco is huge with lots of gravy, chicken wings to sweet and kalbi too chewy.   Their dessert though is probably the best in the desert. Absolutely must try.

zyKcds0TACOW1656lmhekg.text: usually i go to vegas talk about casinos but no i go home talking about island flavor. simple place is too good to not go everythime youre here. but get there early you will wait because of the popularity

WG42wn4mI32LdZ4DMU8l5Q.text: My uncle and I were on this side of town and decided to stop in and try this place.  The waitress was very nice and helpful in helping my uncle decide what to order.  I ordered the chicken katsu and it was some of the best I've had along with their macaroni salad.  I wish there were more of the macaroni salad as it's the best I've had!  My uncle had the kalbi and it was delicious as well.  I can't wait to come back again and try some different dishes on the menu.  The desserts that were being brought out looked just wonderful!

1H3HjO9G5rvnQzd5rYe64g.text: Everytime I come the food is on point. Flavors are definitely there and are so good. The Kalbi spare ribs were so amazing and the Furikake chicken was perfect. The staff was so nice. My 2 year was worn out from a long car ride and the staff was so nice to her while she tried exploring the restaurant. It is well worth your time to stop by! So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4eJU9f8oNpSDvICDlGuFEw.text: Love this place! Definitely authentic food from home. Hits the spot every time. The oxtail soup, loco moco, and poke are a few of my favorites. But call in advance to place an order if you aren't dining in. This place is always poppin.

dAm5NZ8lK1sbOl4sPpVZfA.text: This is an amazing restaurant, with quality service and food. The servings are pretty big at a great price. I highly recommend the furkake chicken it's a sweet glaze and has amazing taste. The macaroni salad is hands down the best I've tasted.

te3yYq12m1YVUoE2jQb3dg.text: This is where the real locals come to eat.   I've lived on the west side for about 6 years now and never ventured here because it was "too far" for me. Your spoiled in Vegas do anything more than 10 minutes away is too far... I needed to check this place out as my beloved Kauai Cafe is now closed so I needed to find a new spot to satisfy my local grindz.  My default order here has been the kalbi and Korean or furikake chicken with fried rice. I suggest that you washit all down with a POG or lilikoi juice for the "local" feel cuz that how we do it on the island.   Just be warned that the plates here are massive! Just look at the pictures of the massive mountain of Ono-kanack food. Always get leftovers. You want to save room for the Ono deserts like the Kona mud pie or chiffon cake.   This is the must eat place I recommend to all my 9th island ohana.   Kanack action  Eat with confidence.  -P

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Default order #2 Korean chicken and kalbi with fried rice

GYdu0NH8Mc_46ZMivxblbg.text: I came to this location months ago. The lady up front was beyond helpful.  I usually go to their other location on Eastern, as it is closer to my work.  I always get fried rice with the kalbi. Kalbi is seasoned so perfectly. I have had kalbi at other places and it always too overpowering with ginger, or too rich, or too heavy. Here, it is tasty and light.  Fried rice on point. I only ever liked my mom's....but this is yummy. Not too salty, but flavored enough to not be so blan.

nzQ5X0upmwudoPYcQemx6Q.text: Great reviews so we decided to give it a try and I'm so glad we did.  Price is great. Portions are large. A lunch plate will cost you an average of $11.   The food is great. I'm from Hawaii and I can tell you this is as close as it gets in getting authentic Hawaiian lunch. And they also sell bags of Poi here!!  The staff is so sweet too and always checking to see of your okay. I'd recommend this place :)

eyy3TrUuYeuJermaLTCvQw.text: Hats off to the chef or chefs at this location! Our dinner was flavorful and delicious! Come hungry because you will get big, and I do mean BIG hearty portions, well worth the money you spend. The owner definitely cares about the quality in the dishes being prepared and from the first bite, you can taste the TLC the chef has placed in every dish. It's worth the upgrade for the Charshu Fried Rice and the Shrimp Furikake was simply delightful. We love this place and we will continue to come back with our friends and family! Keep up the great work!
