SUcfdkA73WQp-sB2zKnTMQ.text: For someone who's moved from Hawaii, this is as close as you can get to local food. Prices are decent and portions are huge! Friday's they have Hawaiian plates with Laulau, Lomi Lomi Salmon, and Haupia!  Our go to place when we're a little homesick

q_bbMAOUjM2dcGXNT5ItbA.text: WOW!  Best hawaiian island flavors for sure!  Reminds us of Big Island where we once called home!  Much mahalo Island Flavor!  We will definitely be back & will highly recommend this place!  Much aloha & mahalo!!!

vWcu-aHuK235K3Fmr6KheQ.text: This restaurant is one of my favorite Hawaiian restaurants in town. It is a sit down restaurant in a casual atmosphere with island music playing in the background. There is one server who is always super sweet, quick, and she is very attentive. Unfortunately, some of the other servers,  not so much.  Come hungry! The portions here are HUGE!   My favorite dishes are: - Furikake Chicken (not the same on the shrimp, would recommend chicken only) - Kalbi Short Ribs - Fresh Made Ahi Poke (2 sizes, half and full) - Macaroni Salad

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of Shoyu Ahi Poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate with Beef Teriyaki Steak and Furikake Chicken

C12EvhuKXK_5wUi0WMrmRw.text: Can't get enough of this place. The vibe here is amazing and the service is great. Closest food we have to home    I recommend them to everyone that ask where to get the best Island grinds!!

Aa5ANa-PG8jYfSseUGO0ww.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas, hands down. I lived in Vegas for a few years and still miss this place to this day.  With all of the culinary experts and great restaurants in the 702 area code it can be difficult to set yourself apart. This place does it by combining top of the line taste with comfort and a casual ambiance.   Must trys: Kalbi ribs (personal favorite), Poke, furikake shrimp.   Grab a spam masubi to go if they have any left by the time you get there.

WmGyYkGoq0cbjP485hgfEg.text: Aloha! I know it's odd getting Hawaiian food in Vegas but apparently, they do have a huge population of Hawaiians, thus the good restaurants you'll find here. Island Flavor is one perfect example.  We started with their very fresh shoyu POKE for appetizers. Half an order is half a pound for $7.25. It's hefty so it really is a steal! Color, taste, and texture of the tuna passed our standards with flying colors.   With so many good things on their menu, it's rather convenient that they offer you the option to order a MIXED PLATE ($11.25) with two items and a side of rice (white or brown) plus salad or macaroni salad. Kalbi is an extra $1 but trust me when I say it's money well-spent. FURIKAKE CHICKEN and KALBI were my two choices. The chicken had a beautiful sweet and sour glazed exterior with seaweed flakes drizzled on it. Each bite had a good crisp and could make you work on a chew, but in a good way. The Kalbi beef was marinated and grilled to perfection pleasing my tastebuds while getting envious looks from others on the table who didn't order this. I looooove their macaroni salad here so don't be like my sister who opted to get a salad of greens and regretting it shortly after having a taste of my side order.   The ROASTED PORK are shreds of meat doused with their own version of gravy that is out-of-this-world delicious. The taste reminds me so much of eating "lechon", a Filipino dish which is literally, roasted pork. In addition, their CHICKEN KATSU is remarkably right on the money. The breading was great in all aspects and how everything held together execution-wise was simply perfection. Our server messed up our order and gave us Korean chicken wings instead of the katsu in the beginning but she fixed it right away without even taking back the wings. Their KOREAN CHICKEN WINGS was bone-in with crispy skin outside and juicy meat inside. Flavor profile was good but I've had better. Bottom line, it's free so I can't complain.  It seems like the CHICKEN KATSU LOCO MOCO is the deal here so we also ordered that to share. An order is ginormous just like everything else we had. We only consumed half of it and took the rest home but the rave reviews on this dish is True to its words. A specialty not to be missed indeed!  Their GUAVA CAKE ($5) however was easily almost everyone's highlight on the table including those without a sweet tooth. Pair with it their refillable Kona coffee because there's just no other way for you to end a meal here. Ahhhfreakingmazing! Not only is it pretty in pink but the cake itself is moist and each layer of icing and guava syrup delivered its purpose giving you that tropical flavor you thought you could only get from the islands. Easily the best thing I ate here!  Service was a bit spotty, almost like on island mode but nonetheless they were friendly. With onolicious food, generous portions, and reasonable pricing, it's worth the little drive off the strip. 4.5 Stars!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken wings and roasted pork mixed plate

DeRHPRzbDVrnaxtWqajw7g.text: Amazing Hawaiian food !! The best Hawaiian food outside of Hawaii hands down.  I visited Las Vegas from Los Angels and after experiencing most of the restaurants in the hotels and the strip...this one was the highlight of the trip and def worth the drive.  The portions are huge and the prices are great ! I had the poke which was unbelievable. The Hawaiian fish Was incredible with a side of the sweet purple potatoes.  We tried their chicken and the tried rice which was great.  And for desert - guava cake - yum !! Put it on your must try list when you are in Vegas next time and you would not regret it !:)

AfNbRQ5_rgySOrRsvzQRAw.text: This place is so incredible!! Best food I've ever eaten and the owner is the best looking person I've ever laid eyes on. I'm going to start eating here three times a week!!

9Pc9WEfM-IYP09qTY8b2zA.text: So yummy! I love Hawaiian food, and this is the best place I have been to in Vegas so far. Very authentic and delicious. Service was good too. Will be coming back for sure!

2R99zmzWKUKsOCc5gLSbNg.text: Right up the road from where I live this place never let's me down when I'm craving local food. Big portions like back home  2 scoops rice and 1 scoop mac salad cant go wrong. Service is outstanding. It gets really busy during lunch and dinner time so be prepared to wait.

CPLYQtge32XWYT1qXS1UFg.text: We used to come here when they first opened years ago when my son was just 8. Moved to CA and make sure to stop by everytime we're in town. The same great old food and warm island hospitality. Kalbi.. we love you!

1SDOMM6AYTk20W-7fg9yCw.text: Order over the phone 20 mins before arriving to island flavor. Walk in and was greeted. The store looks new and modern. Doesnt have a feel for island style you know da kine. Waited for another 30 mins for my order. There was another customer waiting for her order that seems she has been waiting for awhile. Got my order food was good. Hope they change how the operations of orders go. Will come back just for food hope that won't go down hill.

hhc5xDClVT6LYC3IsZi7Zg.text: I have a hate love relationship with this place. I love the food so much, which is why I keep going. I hate the take-out service, they have the worse phone service and heres why. A lot of the time they will not even answer their phone, other times they will answer and instantly hang up, and the worst is when they answer and put you on hold indefinitely. Food wise this is one of the best Hawaiian resturants I have been to, and believe me I have been actively searching for a place to replace this one. I would give the place 2.5 stars but not 3 because the service is a headache its like I have to bother them to take my business.

RQSRekh88-B_-yjgAeWMsQ.text: Best authentic Hawaiian food in the US.  I am going with this bold statement because I have not had anything close to the food at Island Flavor.  The pulled pork, the ox-tail soup, and the loco mocos are awesome.  These meals come with a side salad(including macaroni salad) and rice.    The prices are great and one dinner can feed two people.  The portions are super huge.  If you can still muster up some more, their desserts are a good compliment.  The mud pie is super good!!  Enjoy!

dwoFGCfIT-l4njhptvvV8g.text: Two stars because their mac and cheese was really good - was really light and fresh. the place it self was really cheep and run down looking. No Alcohol license, so they dont even serve bear.. we felt really out of place, menu has no pictures or explanation that someone that never lived in HI would know what they are ordering. We left hungry.

X3xJbdzHBaGleep2Wx210A.text: While in town we decided to give this a try for lunch...we ordered the ahi tuna poke, oxtail soup, Korean fried chicken wings, kalbi short ribs w/fried rice Mac salad & chantilly cake. Ahi poke was bright & tasted very fresh, the oxtail soup was just ok not to crazy about big ginger, the Korean fried chicken wings was so tiny & very salty, The kalbi short ribs was ok but also tasted salty the bbq pork fried rice was also salty i was hoping for spam fried rice like hawaiian style the mac salad tasted good had a small amount. The chantilly cake was the best it tasted so good!!! I give it 3 stars cuz food was ok & service was ok. Mahalo!

EhE4jRfIAuVHXitnM7swGA.text: The food is good!! the owner is a nice man. but that's ware the good ends. our family will naver go back. 3week ago we went for dinner. there was only one other table with costomers.we seated ourself because waitress was talking to the other waitress. the waitress looked at us many time for the next 10min. but naver brought us a menu or smiled. when she finley the came we ask why take a long. she give us a mean look and said because you seated yourself i made you wait. all in a all our experance was almost the same as luisa c review date 8/21/2012 our waitess was a large hawaian women who walked so slow like a gangbanger in a closswalk.. I feel bad for the owner but this business will fail unress he upgrade the quarity of the waitress. we left with out eating because we feared she may my mess with our food.

IqdttdH17MiBUVmAeczDlw.text: I absolutely love Island Flavor! My family lives in Hawaii and I've been to many local restaurants on Oahu. Island flavor definitely is up to par with those local restaurants. I would recommend a favorite dish but it's difficult because they are all exquisite! Definitely recommended!

Mx6LYn6nGmXuqudQuJTQ6Q.text: Love this joint! Very fresh and has gotten better every time! Huge pieces of poke and the kalbi too!! Very good prices too! Just a gem of a place... They could work on their customer service skills tho... And actually refill my drinks once or twice.. But overall very delicious food....

TZHiZcIE5v01G2JZP_zweQ.text: Grabbed some take out from here tonight... Overall very good meal.  Had the combination plate with chicken furikake and kalua pork and an order of fried rice.  First off, portions are big, which was nice.  The fried rice and chicken furikake were excellent... will order both again.  Pork was OK, but not on the level of the other two dishes.  Definitely will be a return customer... just will try to find a different third item to match the fried rice and chicken.

hyoCXPpW1RvZXfg1L6hx_Q.text: Definitely like eating on the Big Island.  Super nice and friendly service, huge portions, quality food!  Great place in Las Vegas to get Hawaiian food.

2mXP__5XKPj5zGPVTXCDeg.text: Excellent everything food and service were great, best hawaiian food ive had here in vegas. I just hope they open one a little closer tobme with a bigger location but till then I will keep going there

yytUwUdNlKiEkDQg_y88tg.text: Fantastic food! We got the teriyaki beef and chicken katsu plate - the katsu was ok but nothing special. The beef was super tender and juicy! The mac salad and rice were good too. The best thing we ordered was without question the furikake chicken! so flavorful and great texture. We couldn't get enough of it. Would def come back for the furikake and also to try out their yummy looking desserts!

D4SVoRhvOlV_eOnZ_vC-Bg.text: After you eat here you will not eat any of Hawaiian theme style restaurant in town blows everything out of the water definitely is the king of Island food local Mocho is amazing come to think of it anything I've had  there is out of this world seven stars for me

zYwMovtCFbInUcWQXNmv9g.text: This is the closest thing I can get to getting food like in Hawaii! I feel like I am actually back on the island. Everyone there sounds like they are from Hawaii and the atmosphere is just like it as well! The food is so good and the serving size is so huge. The prices are freaking awesome! My favorite Hawaiian place to go here in Vegas!

Ammu83u-W9YlMLUiTpg7gA.text: I am not a big fan of Hawaiian restaurants outside of Hawaii (shocker huh) but after trying their fried rice omelet I have slowly changed my mind. their portions are also ginormous and the Delicious.

t9KOro9154h14_EugmQ5OQ.text: Don't know why everyone likes this place. Ate here three times in hope I was wrong. I was right, this place is over rated. Their ahi poke was salty. You can't have hawaiian food and mess up poke.

T1-e7c4-993RGAiAgxs8gw.text: Food is delicious! Only reason I'm only giving 4 stars is the service could be better. But even with so-so service I'll still keep coming back for the food! Love the combo plates. The Kalbi ribs and furikake chicken and shrimp are so good! Love love love the food! Oh, did I mention that I LOVE the food??!!!

juPIOfaUwyupwiw1IbS2yg.text: The service is great the food portion is huge and everything taste so good! I cant wait to come again. For hawaiian food this is the place to go.

5tXFcx90D_dnzLqczgkjyg.text: Came here with my buddy and his wife.  I thought it was decent for lunch on a friday.  Cheap deals (lunch special).  Portion is very generous and the roast pork is amazing.  Reminds me of Hawaii.  Service was wonderful and the place is clean.    Parking is great, big lot.

mU7DxmY_O_0aaN7xgu523A.text: Service was great! Food was delicious . We ordered the oxtail soup, furikake chicken and chicken katsu. Will definitely return when back in Vegas

A20Kun9RDVFFxfqHmaRfUw.text: Love this place it has the best customer service everyone makes you feel right at home and the food is on point my new go to spot in town prices in comparison with the portion size is the bomb guarenttee kanack attack and they get live music was awesome

HbCzlK2FUK311JuLaTcYdA.text: I can't say I am an expert at "eating local," but when a place is rated as highly as Island Flavor, I have to check it out! I stopped in for a late lunch. I was actually surprised to find a sit down restaurant with waitress service. For some reason I had always imagined this to be a counter service place. Clearly, I was wrong!   I ordered the Portuguese bean soup and the Kalua pork and cabbage. Given my limited experience with Hawaiian food, I had never had this bean soup before, so I wasn't sure what to expect. The taste was yummy, but I was surprised to find lots of sausage. Probably a bonus for some and expected by those familiar with the soup. The sausage was flavorful, but I only ate a couple of pieces. I confess: I was hoping for more beans!  The pork was super tender, and I adore steamed cabbage, so what's not to like? I found myself wanting to pour BBQ sauce on the pork and make a sandwich like the Southern girl I am, but I was pretty sure they would look at me funny if I asked for BBQ! If anything, the pork could have used a little more salt, but I was impressed at its smoky flavor.   It may be a sin, but you are able to sub the mac salad with a green salad, which I did! I really appreciate this healthier option. The green salad is huge and comes with a couple slices of a sweet purple yam, delicious!   Service was super sweet. I can see why people love this place the way they do!

b4sjKh9lVIC9dg16V31LgQ.text: Ok let's start off by saying I'm prejudice to this place because I'm Hawaiian. After my favorite Hawaiian restaurant closed (Hawaiian hale)   I was feeling kinda bummed out. But low and behold I heard about this Hawaiian restaurant that opened up and they come from the big island. So u know what that means, had to come and try it.   I was expecting L&L style cuisine the norm for most Hawaiian dubbed restaurants. But was greatly surprised to to see the menu. It still has some classic L&L dishes u would expect. Kalbi ribs etc.   But it's the non L&L dishes the caught my attention. Portugese bean soup (one of my favorites), Aloha LauLau Fridays, hoisin baby back ribs, Korean chicken and roast pork loco moco to name a few.. I have tried all of these and they are delicious.  You must come and give this place a try..

Wro1mQTHKCIrh4vfyK7YGw.text: So Ono! Try their furikake chicken, Korean chicken, Hawaiian pork, and Kailua pork! Their max salad is also solid! Great great spot! I look forward to coming back!

m0w_9l2o0V2PfIE5CTwZdA.text: Simply put....Service is on point, portions is BIG time and food is crazy good. Reminds me of home every time I walk in. Mahalo Island Flavors for representing Hawaii, the food and the Aloha Spirit.

wOXBNcrzo2pS1H8-PfZwRQ.text: Came here 1 year ago, Loved it. Came back many times to Vegas but never had time to make it back!! Finally, the Rock has come back to "ISLAND FLAVOR"!  Hands down the best local grinds to come from the island to the mainland.

D1kzYIEHAvXsK-GW-6YGpg.text: Recommended to me by a Hawaiian friend, I came here for the first time with the family for lunch. The staff is real friendly, the atmosphere is relaxing, and the food is AWESOME!!! We tried a few different items off the menu such as the sesame Ahi Poke, melt in your mouth goodness, we had the Kalbi ribs which were cooked to perfection, flavorful and juicy, the Fruikake shrimp which was crispy and seasoned just right, the Saimin which was full of many wonderful goodies and a flavorful broth, the grilled steak and onions, delicious sauce and tender, fried rice, macaroni salad, and guava cake for dessert. The plates come FULL of food so you won't go hungry and perfectly priced. The Chantilly cake was recommended but the family wanted guava cake, 3 layers of moist, fruity goodness. It's about 20 minutes from Luxor but totally worth the drive. GO HERE!!!

Qjwcx6gYCLl6laE4QrCl0g.text: The best hawaiin food in las Vegas belive me  This restaurant give You more the what You  Expect for the price. MY favorito is the oxtail soup And the ribs

t5KCfcRlGEzwkmk0iwRzMg.text: I recently used Island Flavor for catering a luau for work. All our guests were ranting and raving over the food the whole party. Everyone enjoyed it. Ordering and picking up the food was also a really easy process as Bruce helped me through it all. I would definitely look to use them again and recommend them to anyone looking for Hawaiian BBQ.

toiq7YLf7w8OHOyfNj72Iw.text: Wasted my night. My friends and I ordered food from here. The girl on the phone said it would be 20 min. We arrived 25 min later. When I got there I heard them call my name. Another man claimed the order. I asked was there two orders with that name. She said no. Fast forward 45 min a total of 1 hr and 10 min of waiting still no food. The hostess and a waiter also kept peaking out from the back and giggling while looking in my direction I believe because I had complained about 40 min into waiting. I think they had intentions on messing with our food. Extremely rude and creepy!I buy food here at least once a week and now I will never buy from them again.

fYXi_EnrK1xU-tTXf7QJTQ.text: We were recommended by a friend to come try this place. It was billed by the same friend as the best Hawaiian food in town. What she didn't say was that it was some of the best food in town period. We started with a little cucumber kimchi which was mind blowing (we ordered another). Some shoyu poke followed which was also mind blowing. Hoisin ribs completed the food-gasm that was this restaurant. Coming back next week for some sweets.

6gC0OzsuccRXQVwysXGVQA.text: I dragged my dad all the way out here for lunch on Friday..  He was a total skeptic!  He works by the airport, I live in Rhodes Ranch.. he could not understand why we were both driving further from town to have lunch.  The answer is simple - Yelp reviews!  Because of this restaurant, he opened his own Yelp account.  So, we enter.  My dad looks at the menu, I have already stared at all of the pictures on the iPhone app and know exactly what I want.  My dad is quite perplexed by the menu, so I show him the Yelp photos.  When the waitress comes up, he lifts up my iPhone, shows the waitress a picture and says "I want this".  The waitress, without missing a beat, responds, "the pork (something) and beef spare ribs".  To me, this is the beauty of Yelp.  It brought 2 new customers and gave one exactly what he wanted based on a posted picture.  It was sooo cool!  Our food promptly arrives, and it was everything we expected!  My Beef Teriyaki was incredibly tasteful, savory and tender.  The Korean Chicken was basically buffalo wings with a kick ass flavor.  Any other restaurant, I'd ding one star and recommend they do boneless wings - I hate buffalo wings, but the taste was still so overwhelmingly good that I did not mind!  My dads food was perfect.  He let me try his, I let him try mine.  No wrong choices.  He almost got a full steak attached to each of the 3 spare ribs.  He could not stop raving about the flavor and taste.  Service was swift and meaningful.  I have nothing to say bad about this restaurant.  The check came (less than $25 for two huge lunches),  the portions were so huge that I could not fit all of the leftovers from two starving adults into one box!  Great food, great service, great family run business.  Thank you, Lord... it is right down the street.  I will be back - hundreds of times!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki Beef and Korean Chicken combo.

3VfbHwQI_UpPFYZh3R6rJg.text: This place is so good, I feel like I should write another review on it. Whenever I want some comfort food, this is the place to go. The staff makes me feel at home and the food never disappoints. It was my first time having POG here and it's so good.   You can also find little Iron Man here with hulk hands. So cute. lol

vsXB6vwwYYRyzsmUz3rt2g.text: GIANT-SIZED PORTIONS!  Thank goodness my sis-in-law and I split our food because the portions are seriously large enough to feed two people.  We ordered their chicken katsu loco moco, which I have never seen on a menu back in Seattle. Everything in this dish was perfect! I love how the katsu had the right amount of crispiness to it. I definitely would order this again for my next visit...and come on an empty stomach.  I also ordered a side of their mac salad and I wasn't a fan of it. It had a little bit of a sweetness to it and I personally didn't like that.  For dessert, we and two other people at our table split a piece of their guava cake. So GOOD! I'm glad we ended dinner on that note.

You're just too good to be True Can't take my mind off of you Haupia cake so creamy light Guava cake a delight Opakapaka salad so fresh Brought goosebumps to my flesh You're just too good to be True Can't take my mind off of you   I love you 'Flava Your food is outta sight I need you 'Flava On a hot Vegas night I love you 'Flava Trust in me when I say Oh Island Flavor You beat all the buffets Oh Island Flavor You truly do amaze And so I Yelp! you 'Flava Let me Yelp! you...

EyYaLORxOCZqu_2utH_SLA.text: Furikake chicken. That's all you need to know. SUPER DELICIOUS!!! Also love the super friendly staff!

GYitz3gMHvsCmyDCQrZUIA.text: Favorite spot for Hawaiian food in Vegas. Although it is pricier than other Hawaiian spots it is well worth it for the quality of food you get! Great service, amazing food!!

C4tMOQLAu-bRc6tpIdTjkw.text: With my fiance from the islands, I've pretty much adopted Hawaiian food into my diet and trying every single Hawaiian restaurant in town has become a requirement for us. Being that we both live in the west side of town, we usually don't stray too far from our frequent traveled routes, UNLESS it's to fulfill a foodie adventure. On this particular day, we decided we'd finally pay a visit to Island Flavor.   When we arrived, I was immediately drawn to a plate of pre-made, saran wrapped musubis that sat on the register counter for 2 bucks a pop. I thought to myself, how brilliant is that?! We were seated and my eyes were drawn to one flaw-- Several teriyaki and sriracha sauce splatters on the wall. I know, I know... Trust me, I HATE being a stickler for something like that, but it made me feel like a saw remnants of a booger flinger on the wall. ANYWAY, back to the good stuff.  My fiance and I ordered two mixed plates. One beef teriyaki steak and korean chicken and one chop steak & onions and korean chicken. When the plates arrived, we were pleasantly surprised by the big portions. Two scoops of rice, one scoop of macaroni salad, and MEAT GALORE! The food definitely tasted delicious. However, as a fan of thinly sliced beef, I had expected my teriyaki steak to be sliced thin as described on the menu, but it was not. It was actually the opposite of what I had expected--The chop steak was sliced thin and the teriyaki beef was more "chop[py]". Nonetheless, I ate it.   I hope to visit them again soon to try a few more items off their menu. I think maybe next time even consider sharing a plate to leave room for some of their desserts that I watched longingly pass my table.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki beef and Korean chicken mixed plate

iRI9IqXPLH3sCiAYb9LYjA.text: Never had a bad meal at this place never left hungry foods cooked to order so be patient! Service is great quality Hawaiian hospitality! I recommend the furiaki chicken & the Kalabi short ribs R  as well I prefer them well done! Then we end the meal with a slice of guava cake or kona coffee cake  after all this food u may not eat for 24-48 hrs lol but it's well worth it! Kind Ono grinds brahdah

ABU3omuA60GQONYHhAqDUw.text: I got the mixed plate . teriyaki beef and chicken katsu. Portion size is important to me and this place definitely fulfilled that aspect for me. the food was delicious, the service was quick and i would recommend this spot for Hawaiian food any day.

fPP8LaHBsj5y8dkWDId5lQ.text: Came here for kona coffee mudd pie and loved every bit of it! Reminded me of kona :) Really enjoyed the music and aloha spirit! Mahalo!

9n4YfO3ytPVxl3IToHCmTQ.text: I had to come back to bring my family (6), on a wednesday evening. I ordered the mix plate: short ribs and roast pork. My family had all sorts of things..I remember it being pretty cheap, 70?  - This place doesn't FAIL. GREAT FOOD! - It was still sunny outside, no curtains. sun beaming on face. tinted windows aren't tinted enough. lol - short ribs were tasty! some fat. 3 huge pieces. - I take that back. the Roast pork was a fail. tasted like roast beef. It had gravy on it. tons of fat.. - My sister had another pork dish. Now that was really good. I recommend that over the roast pork. she also had, i think, fried chicken. very crispy! - My dad had the Ox tail soup. it was delicious. it reminded me of nilaga, a filipino soup.  - My brother-in-law had the loco moco and the patty was HUGE!!! He's like an MMA fighter, big appetite, and he still couldn't finish that. lol. - I shared my meal with my gf. SHARING IS CARING! taste everyone's food :)

XftsRxjj1EhAD4Y-KK729Q.text: Ordered takeout, ready when I got there! This place is my favorite hawaiian spot in Vegas. Food comes in huge portions and flavors are all there that remind me of home. They have poke here, I recommend getting an order of it. The furrikake chicken is delicious. Nice and crispy and enough for lunch and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rti85yB58tASc3n-V1hd-A.text: My Partner and I have been coming to Island Flavor for a long time. The food is always amazing and the staff is always friendly. The remodel looks good and has an inviting feel to it. The owners really did a great job. Miss seeing some of the old staff but the new faces are constantly smiling so it's fine.

2SKpl6jIFLmbzRihabiX2w.text: A really great restaurant. The poke and spam musubi were tasty. Our entrees were great. And I was really impressed that they had chili water to offer as a seasoning. We live in the NW but would definitely consider a trip to the SW to visit this 9th island gem.

3jqWeD0FbqO6_uU0t1BwDQ.text: I always love eating here and getting my local hawaiin fix!! It's close by my house since I stay on Durango too.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu with Katsu sauce. My personal favorite!!!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Loco Moco

twJFmVFks_HsmczKkHcdBg.text: Island Flavor has great food but awful service. The restaurant was extremely busy with only 3 servers who had no help. They were not only taking orders but they were seating guests, processing payments, running food and taking phone orders. We waited 20 minutes before we got our drinks and waited another 25 minutes before our orders were taken. We than waited another half hour and still did not receive our food. I approached the server to see how much longer until our food would be delivered and she said about 20 minutes more. So unfortunately, we needed up leaving.

1c9nn-5gYiknGR4tBcRUvg.text: Man, I pull up every other week because the food so fire. Great service as well yes indeed. Well renovated and extremely spacious

u763IWHM3jm8vRI6F-B-gA.text: I've always went here ever since I moved in Las Vegas when I was 13 and never had a chance to leave a review. This has been my go-to hawaiian restaurant every time I acquire the cravings. Anytime anyone asks me for a hawaiian spot I ONLY recommend this place. Anyways if you put the menu on a dartboard and play darts blindfolded, guaranteed anything it lands on it will be amazing. But furikake chicken, burger steak, and the roast pork are a must.

bULVriRDqLjymjETL6aa6A.text: Love this place! It's as authentic as you can get when not on the mainland. There are SO many "Hawaiian" and "Ohana" restaurants in Vegas but this is by far, the best. The food is fresh, so tasty, never over-fried or greasy, and always cooked to perfection. My hubby and I have been coming here for 3 years and we bring our families here whenever they visit. The waitresses are so personable; they remember your name and your order. I'm impressed with the modern upgrades that the new owners installed as well. My fave is the chicken Katsu, and the avocado egg rolls. My hubby LOVES the mixed plate with furikake chicken and teriyaki steak. The loco moco is huge and the oxtail soup is amazing. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

dSwbkkEcQV-8-8lMZ5MdQg.text: The Korean chicken was more like Korean wings.   The sauce was heavy with soy and the wings were overly breaded to give it crunch.  Taste was not that great.  Oil still oozing out after each bite.  They definitely looked better than they taste.  The roast pork was definitely better. Not as salty.  The gravy was very good and complemented the pork.  Rice is okay and mac salad was very good.  I would say this place is a hit and miss.  Also it wasn't crowded but still had to wait to be seated.  Servings are large for price.  I think there are better Hawaiian places, but not necessarily in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken

lPnZLVfbEgJE0Xy3O-jK5w.text: I almost feel bad about not giving this place 5 stars. It *absolutely* deserves the 4.5. It's absolutely the best hawaiian dining place I've been to in Vegas. At other places, things are a but too dry, a bit too chewy, a bit too small. This place hit all the marks.   My only gripe was the wings were a *bit* too salty. Just a bit. They've got just the right amount of breading, crunch, moisture, sweetness, and savoriness. They're just a skooch too salty. The Kalbi was the real surprise here. I always feel like Kalbi's a gamble. This kalbi was a good one. Not too sweet, not too chewy, not too fatty, and they give you a nice meat-cuttin' knife just to make it that much easier on you.   This place is dope. I was in a hurry to get back to work, had a brain fart, forgot to leave a tip while paying at the register, I'll be back at 5:10, right after I get off work PLEASE DON'T BE MAD AT ME. FIVE STARS.  Also, they have daily specials on their physical menu that I didn't see online. Peep those

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Daily specials

i1LK-bhENkHyqclLhtPOwA.text: insult to injury. decided to give you guys one more try. Macaroni Salad was bland. Loco moco meat was bland. still super slow service.   Final straw? on the pushbar to the entry and exit door is a nut and bolt close to hinge side of the door... yea it left a nice cut in my arm. Perhaps i shall send someone over to inspect your establishment. That nut and bolt is the same height as small children's head and face area. I would hate for a child to get injured due to your establishments negligence.   Tonight was indeed the LAST time i ever go there. Things were 100 times better with the previous owner. You literally took a go-to establishment and sunk it quicker than a boat with a huge hole in it.   I'd say thanks for the memories but bad food and a bleeding arm isn't something anyone should be thanking you for.

mIH4kysE4Tr5L0_VTftp8g.text: The best ISLAND FLAVOR in the valley. Mahalo for the KANNACK ATTACK! Everything reminds me of home on the islands!

L067UEVV1-bcTyo_xrW5dg.text: We've been coming here for many years now. We always have to stop here before going back to Cali. Food is really good! We love the Poke and Kalbi.

dHYCQFjgd07N8wbewnxGuA.text: The best  Hawaiian food in town, they occasionally play live band music. We always bring our family members from out of town and they enjoyed the food. The waiting time today  is longer than usual but  we  highly recommend this  place.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monstah mixed plate

fsZRbWkz-3cSCOOsOsIUIw.text: What can I say? Love it love it love it!! I visit this place at least once a week, this is one of my favorite restaurant in town.  The items are price friendly, super tasty, and satisfying amount.  Appetizer: Poke with avocado sauce is the best option, make sure you have 2 or more ppl in the party for this, it's  too much for one person and it's not a good idea to take it home since it's raw fish.  Main dish: I love the mixed plate options in here, teriyaki steak is a must for me every time. If you are a meat lover, I recommend you to try Kalbi short ribs with teriyaki beef steak. It just like in the heaven. (Honestly additional $2 fried rice taste just ok) They also have special food item of the day, beef stew is my favorite, it might be on Saturday (not sure).   Dessert: lava cake taste so good! Usually after my mixed plate I can't have dessert right away because I was so full, i just order it to go instead.   Overall: Taste good, great amount, good price!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki beef steak with kuala pork and cabbage. Love it!!!!

ghb8hNWchB5IdgjDeGiRzg.text: We're on a vacation .... & stopped by to get some morning breakfast .... no wait time we got seated right away ... the service was great .... we ordered food it came out in a timely manner .....but no refills on drinks during our meal .... food was ono-licious (yummy) like back home (HI) ....check out time we waited a bit ... but over it's a place to go if u craving some local foods ....

RcBfzrpfXIAN4ByKOdZdVQ.text: Great island food and ambiance. Nice extensive menu and friendly customer service. Would recommend the kalbi and fried rice omelette!

jkfWQZZA19GkjnudpVdbbg.text: This place reminds me of back home (Hawaii). As soon as you walk in you are taken back to the islands. The music, the food aroma and the aloha. We started with the Furikaki Fries and the Hawaiian Poke. Both were excellent and a must have. I had the combo plate with Furikaki Chicken and Kalbi. The Kalbi was tender and well flavored and the Chicken was great as well. My only mistake was not ordering a double Mac salad instead of two scoops of rice. My wife got the Kalua pig plate. The haupia that came with her plate was a good portion as well. Most places that serve haupia only give a small taste but this was enough for two people to share. Island Favor is a great place to come for great food with large portions. Great waitstaff too. They were very nice helping us with whatever we needed. The waitress even got my wife some chili pepper water for her kalua pig.   If you are ever hungry for local food with big portions this is the place.

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MiFckRq81LBfMVXTSRrKRA.text: Good food and service! The portion was very big I couldn't eat the whole thing. I would recommend who ever love Hawaiian food to try this place out.

qpyh9I-zP9IXzv9zDq5OIg.text: Island flavor was one of my favorites until last night. I ordered from yelp, 1/2 lb Hawaiian style poke and a mud pie for dessert.  I noticed the poke to be way too salty figured the cook had a heavy hand. But woke up 4 times throwing up because I had food poisoning.  Ended up missing work today.  Just wanted to let management know what happened. To be clear I've been going to the restaurant since day one and everything has been great until Last night.  was the second time I ordered delivery and now I'm feeling very sick.  It was probably a one off happening but still a terrible thing to go through in the middle of the night

KxLViQaA1qedmbtNTNULRg.text: This place is absolutely amazing. We ordered for the first time a few days ago and was so happy with our choice. Living in the Mountains Edge area, there are not a lot of great solutions for quick food so I was pleased to find a new place that had great food that was quick and definitely worth the money. I ordered grilled chicken and rice and the portions were so nice I was able to have left overs. Will definitely be going here again :)

hxAoB_vZtySuY4aMpN2Iew.text: This place works! If you're in the mood for Hawaiian cuisine in Las Vegas, stop in. This place is definitely off the strip, which is always a plus in my book.   Our party had the Korean ribs, Chopped steak, Roast pork, Kalua Pig, Korean chicken, Fried rice omelet, and Fried poke salad. I did sample all of the dishes and would say they are all great with the exception of the pork dishes. I am a big pork fan, so I am particular of pork dishes. Having had Kalua pig in Hawaii I would say it did not meet my expectations. It wasn't as smoky as I would have liked to be, and it was lacking a bit in the flavor department.   Other than that, it was a good meal.  Will be back again.

eFvycl0PbigvCQimZtmCCQ.text: Best Hawaiian food on the 9th island! Big portions and fairly priced! The plate lunches can honestly be 2 meals for some people.

MAY-t8tao7bv8YBzoT4w3g.text: Decided to try Island Flavor again and I'm glad I did. Lunch was delicious and more than plentiful. The staff were all kind and attentive offering plenty of genuine smiles that made for a pleasant memorable experience. Can't wait to return and try the dessert. Highly recommend if you're in the mood for home style Hawaiian cuisine.

VdCZcMyAJoI0FRNNrgaFug.text: Me: "That's the closest Hawaiian restaurant by our house." My mom: "What is Hawaiian food?"  Me: "Umm. It's a lot of Asian food you've had before. Except there always seems to be macaroni salad on the side." My mom: "What do you mean?" Me: "You know! Like kalbi. WIth macaroni salad." My mom: "What else?" Me: "Uhh, chicken teriyaki. With macaroni salad." My mom: "Is that it?" Me: "Well they have some unique things. They have something called Kalua pork. It comes with macaroni salad too."   So I'm going to be completely honest. I don't even totally know what Hawaiian food consists of. I stopped by once to get lunch to go and ordered a 2-item combo with Kalua pork and tonkatsu. I really appreciated that you could substitute white rice for brown at no additional charge.   The joint's in what looks like a deserted strip mall and the windows are extra tinted to the point where you're not sure if you're in Detroit or southwest Las Vegas, so I'm not ever sure if it's open or not. Either way, it's good to know we have some dining options in our neck of the woods.  P.S. Oh! I forgot to mention there was macaroni salad in my to go order. ALOHA.

FpVuINv7FhBYVjodOfVHEQ.text: Great food , great service , we had oxtail soup and roasted pork , the portion was huge and both dishes taste delicious , we will definitely come back again

qbj7N0GkuLjYLsiNDB_hKw.text: Most delicious fried rice !! And the moco loco is the hangover cure of the century !!! Love this place anytime I hang with mom this is what we order huge portions

Te3rdDvzWLONQYO4mYimig.text: What is that you hear upon walking in.....locals speaking pidgin (FYI if you don't know what this is, google it!)..yup this place must be the real deal =)  Having lived in Hawaii for a brief period of time...the food here definitely compares to the plate lunches from the island.    My personal favorites are the korean chicken wings/drummettes and the fried poke plate!  Now, how do you fry poke...isn't the point for the fish to be raw?!....normally that is True but they serve a seared poke that I would describe as mini ahi tuna steak nuggets...served with a huge portion of rice and mac salad.   They offer to cook the poke all the way through, but don't do it unless you want to ruin your meal...just a light sear is all you need for the fish to have a melt in your mouth feel =)    I've also had the katsu loco moco (katsu covered with a fried egg and copious amounts of gravy) and this is not for the faint of heart....I believe my take out box felt like it weighed 5 lbs...this order quickly puts me into "droopy eyelid mode".....in other words food coma...so be forewarned.

xkFeJAavoR28Y23dYA8s-Q.text: Me: Came here for Hawaiian food and got a better version of every dish I've ever ordered before at any other Hawaiian place.  Really, the execution of each dish and it's components were just done more skillfully. If you want outstanding Hawaiian food, come here. (And free refills on POG!). Also, portions are huge.   Him: I like spam musubi. This place had the best musubi. The chicken (furikake) was amazing. It was as delicious as the chicken I had in China! I would come back here for the chicken [says the lover of spam musubi].

GOD-3odfZjPkPKMIHLEjZQ.text: This place is the worst restaurant i have ever been in, the service was completely awful the food was cold when i got it. On top of all of that my silverware was dirty.

nG55bw6-SiYHQ4y0FId1VA.text: First time here and I was disappointed. Must have been an off night though. My husband and I ordered a combo plate and spam musubi. The waiter gave us the spam musubi still wrapped in plastic while eating in. Cmon! You can at least take off the Saran Wrap for us so it doesn't look like you just slapped it on the plate.   Our meal took about 45 minutes to come out and it wasn't even that busy. I got tired of waiting and wasn't even hungry anymore by the time it arrived. We ordered the kalua pig and furikake chicken with fried rice. The kalua pig and cabbage tasted really odd as if it had been cooked then microwaved. The fried rice was saturated in soy sauce and not thoroughly dispersed. The chicken was good but overcooked.  I just think they forgot about our order and then half assed it.   We do love Hawaiian/island food so we will try again, but maybe not this location. My husband felt sick when he got home too so that didn't help. I do want to note that they did offer a free dessert for the long wait but we were over it by that point. They knew something was up though because we never complained and they just kept asking if we were ok.

6n-BCidEd90yBN6ynH0SLQ.text: If you're missing Hawaii, this is the place to go. Ono Hawaiian food & big portions! Nice atmosphere with Hawaiian music played in the background, friendly service backed up with Aloha. We like the Korean chicken & kalbi ribs. We tried the oxtail soup but we've had better. The meat was a bit bland & the broth was plain chicken stock. All in all, we'd definitely dine here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup. Just ok.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken &amp; kalbi combo

R9qlVonuNUbBVp-Y_b68Tw.text: The place has the ambiance and feel of a real Hawaiian lunch spot.  Don't expect fancy decorations, over-the-top service, etc.  But do expect fantastic food, lots of rice, and delicious macaroni salad.  Any of the regular lunch plates literally is loaded with ~2+ pounds of food.  Given the quality and quantity, this place is an absolute bargain.  And it is ALWAYS tasty.  Everything is cooked fresh to order.  I love it here.

7fKMGN7cEm2lLN-0AXLzPw.text: This was the worst Hawaiian food I've ever tasted! I'm not sure if I just ordered the wrong food or what happened since there are such high reviews here. I ordered the poke shoyu and the mixed plate with chicken katsu and Kalua cabbage. The poke was okay the sauce was very salty to me compared to what I've had before but I was able to eat all of it. The chicken katsu didn't have any sauce I'm not sure if it's suppose to come with it or not but the breaded chicken itself tasted like chicken nuggets you'd get from a banquet frozen dinner and the Kalua cabbage had No flavor no smokiness or any seasoning and was SUPER dry. I gave this place 2 stars because the macaroni salad was pretty good.

opOFXsOhHmACdFTJfauW-w.text: I am not a big Hawaiian food fan, because so many of them butcher kalbi (no pun intended). Island Flavor has the best kalbi I have ever tasted from a Hawaiian joint, and their portions are huge! I got like 6 big pieces of meat! Also, I chose their salad instead of the mac, and shut the front door, the dressing was divine! And the craziest part is that they are known for their chicken and mac... If their kalbi n salad are this good, the chicken and mac must be way too killer!!! First time Hawaiian foodies, go straight here -- skip L&L!!!!!

SZ__gZCqXkqYQfB7AOcAUg.text: Only in a Hawaiian restaurant is it endearing (and not tacky) when your server comes around, holding her baby while taking your food order ;)  Seriously though, Island Flavor is legit! True Hawaiian food at its best!!! I found this restaurant through Yelp and it is worth the (less than) 20 minute drive from the strip.   My boyfriend & I split the Furikake Poke, while he opted for the Fried Rice Omelet with Portuguese Sausage and I got the combo with KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) and Teri Beef.....Omgaaaah, so delicious (or should I say "ono"!) The portions were monstrous, but most importantly, the food was amazing.  I have been craving REAL Ahi Poke and I'm so glad I got to have my fix here! Huge chunks of fresh Ahi Poke sprinkled with Furikake mmm, it was perfect. I have also been on a Korean Fried Chicken kick recently, and Island Flavor definitely got it right. So crispy, juicy and garlicy! The Teri Beef was great quality (not thin or stringy at all) and the sweet sauce was the clincher. No lie, everything we ate was amazing....even the Mac salad and Guava Juice!  I am definitely going to try to come here next time I'm in Vegas :) Now seriously, can we get a Hawaiian joint as good as this in So Cal? Enough L&L, I want an Island Flavor haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. korean fried chicken &amp; teri beef combo
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GIANT fried rice omelet with portuguese sausage
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ahi poke with furikake

5H2Vu3xt0kJhg2ePEkGafQ.text: This is a great place to go for island food! The place is like a little hole in the wall. When I walked in I didn't expect to see so many people. The place is literally just a small square. The girl that seated us was very nice. I ordered the chicken katsu and the teriyaki beef. It was very good. The quality of the meat seemed to be better than other island style restaurants around town. The chicken on the other hand was on the soft side. I guess you can say I like my chicken a little more "well done". (Hey, you can't please everyone! ) After I ate I ordered the "huapia cake". Unfortunately they were out of it. I was disappointed because my friends dessert arrived and then they told me they didn't have mine :-( I ended up ordering the "huapia ice cream pie". The cake was cheaper than the pie so our waitress charged me for the cake for the inconvenience of not having it. Let me tell you the pie was amazing!!! The creamy texture of the ice cream was so nice and rich. Is was really really good. It comes with nuts, honey and raspberry sauce drizzled on top. Over all, I like this place and would recommend it to my friends and family. I can't wait to go back and try the cake! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu and beef teriyaki
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huapia ice cream pie

-JWra-lyO-adZsnqE_U4dw.text: Since my previous review I've been there at least once a week, because the food is fantastic and I've had little to no issues. There have been some new faces meaning they have hired extra help to keep up with the high demand this restaurant has. If there is a long wait, they have given me advanced notice. I am very pleased with my positive experiences since.

uDOcLjswgF066OxQuFsUJQ.text: Portions are great and they offer brown rice :) I especially love the furikake chicken. Can't wait to try more!

VH3VqjNlB2O6Uq-vMqwRhg.text: Coming into this joint, and expecting to eat healthy is a definite no no. Small portions? Forget it. The Hawaiian moral code to eat plentiful, and well is sure to meet those standards here. I did decided to get the chicken teriyaki salad. One word. AMAZING! The portion was huge!!! It had these huge slices of purple yams which were fresh, sweet, and oh so delicious. The sesame dressing? To die for! And it makes a great combination with the greens on the salad and the chicken teriyaki on it.   The service was great, and our waitress was very friendly. Our waitress did slide a few witty jokes here and there. She also enganged in starting small talk which I think was very nice and hospitable of her. The place is small, but I feel that the envorniment and homely atmosphere makes it appropriate for the place to be small, and decorated with very small and simple paintings and decoration.  I see why it's a five star dine in experience. Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu!

eYahKvGdd1i8pJuYPwUCrw.text: First time trying it and it tasted sooooo good!!! My fiance and I both got mixed plates so we got to try a lot of everything. The portions were huge for a really good price. The dessert was amazing, I'm drooling just thinking about it (we tried the chocolate chantilly cake and guava cake)Our waitress was so sweet and we felt so comfortable as soon as we walked in. The atmosphere is very relaxing and I really like the decor.

Q4RkcD6VHmnP4qWrsd-WBw.text: On the weekends expect 30 minute wait time.but it's totally worth the wait. The poke is amazing and the Avocado fries are really good.

oqD50D0xqFw8LKF_WNwwhg.text: I love this food it soo yum to have almost had everything I have never had something I didn't like! The mac salad is where it's at it's like crack you can't get enough of it!

emioDh301JOf1b5zVJDHeA.text: Thanks for the invitation but I'm going to pass, we we had to stop by a store after leaving because there was no forks or anything to eat with, Which didn't really matter because all 4 plates were either luke warm or cold meaning the food was ready but nobody was bringing the food out. Rude tyler made a comment about friday & Saturday takes a minimum of 45 mins for food which is fine but maybe a heads up when being seated & ordering around 7:30 & not being told that till after 8:15 after we needed to leave & asked to have it to go.

sK8nytVF6roCYcw-hCSw2w.text: I haven't been here in a while and the place is so different inside now. It looks amazing and the feel brings me back to Hawaii. When we came today, the service was a little disappointing. I felt like we waited a while to be seated because it seemed like there was only 1 waitress. When we finally got seated, we waited more longer for the waitress to help us even get our drink order. As it started to get even more busy, she became less attentive. When she would come over to the table, she was very short with us. At the end of our meal, it took us a while to even flag her down for the check too. She was extremely busy with all the other 14 tables she was waiting on by herself.   Aside from all of that, let's get to the food rating.  Spam Misubi 10/10. Can't go wrong with the misubi, my kids love It! We ordered the mixed plate with Furikake and Kalbi. 11/10!!! This plate was VERY VERY flavorful. My husband and I loved it so much! My kids both killed their Kalbi short ribs plate.  This IS the entire reason why we came back. I don't know what went wrong this morning, maybe someone called in sick and they were short staffed. If the service is like that all the time, I would rather just take food to go instead.   Even though the service was not as great, she was still nice and friendly. The food was BOMB! Will def come back either way.

RJaYAiEzWof977gsfcBkqA.text: Ordered the Furukaki Chicken, Chef's Loco Moco and Tinono pork. This place did not disappoint!! Took me back to the islands!!!

9JHz-N-P4WiGekQp01qzpw.text: Great food and ambiance. Server was friendly and informative. Love their chicken katsu with the Korean sauce!!

LDqdgo4N6ZpMZrqyFF0AYw.text: This week I've been always eating here, I ordered khalbi fried rice and spam misubi which was great. Then today I ordered khalbi fried rice which way tasted different than I had and the spam misubi was lack of sauce and the rice was little hard. YOU SHOULD BE CONSISTENT ON THE TASTE. Disapointed specially with the khalbi fries rice. What happened with this place? I hope the new management read my comment.

yU4k5NhFXm3qIsCR4Y9PnQ.text: Comfort food - although for me personally any kind of food has the comforting effect, there are some particular cuisines that instantly make you feel ultimately cozy, like as if you came back home from a  long business trip and you are about to savour that dish you've been long craving for.  Island flavour is just about that - from the moment you are greeted warmly and ushered to your table to simple, yet delicious comforting food. It instantly makes you think of home, family dinners, peaceful feeling of safety.   We had three dishes - each one of them was equally skilfully cooked:  1. Hawaiin roast pork, cooked local style with Hawaiian salt, cracked black pepper, sliced thin, topped with rich brown gravy (9 USD) 2. Lau las, served with haupia, Friday special (11.25 USD) 3. SPAM musubi (2.25 USD)  The portions are great, we had almost have of what we've ordered packed to go. The pork was melting away in the mouth like butter.   We'll be back for sure.

czIcZ4MlcxL0LfIb-o-tpw.text: Wait .. wait .. wait .  One hour after, we finally got half of our food order served . Granted the food is good, but the wait was ridiculous!  We asked the server twice and she said she also at the mercy of what comes out of the kitchen first . While waiting , we saw at least 20 to go orders got completed.  Definitely could use some improvement!

irz0KN4x4OVUiW7QFyDmnA.text: I've ordered here before and recently found their online ordering for instore pickup. I liked the ease of it but shortly after placing an order I got a call saying I can't order what I did. I got a mixed plate with furikake chicken and fried poke. I was told I can't order the fried poke for a mixed plate. Online it was very clearly a choice. I said to give me the hamburger steak then. I typically love this with the gravy and mushrooms but my hamburger was definitely burnt. I tried to eat a few bites but definitely had to toss it out. I'm a little disappointed I couldn't try the poke, I was excited to try something new.

0LyCusT-aB1fFQNdcBRr_w.text: This place used to be my favorite restaurant. It is obvious that this place is under new management, as it is not the same as it once was.   I spent $50 here on a Tuesday night. This usually means that I'll get tons of food. But, the prices are the same and the portion sizes have dramatically decreased.   Furthermore, I feel like the quality of the food has decreased also. I know that I have read that most of the staff has stayed the same, but they are definitely under new direction.   The furikake chicken didn't have any furikake on it. The pork was dry. The kalbi ribs were smaller. The loco moco meat was not seasoned well. My nephew liked the Korean chicken and I thought the teriyaki chicken wasn't bad.  Overall, I'm just really sad that this place isn't the same anymore, since it was my favorite restaurant to order from.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 mixed plates &amp; the Loco Moco All Day Breakfast

qZzjIZlK8gj9ajjecEqF5A.text: New Ownership. I knew something was terribly wrong when the KALBI OF ALL THINGS!  The KALBI went from four THICK meaty slabs that covered the large oval plate to...  Ultra thin slices of W T F ? !  Bones were thicker than meat and fat. Aaarrrgh!!!  Huge expanded dining area is a grand space to no longer have live entertainment. It's okay, really. More room to fake aloha. Did your consulting agency recommend that, too???  This not just a kalbi complaint. This more. You faking it. You selling junk to people who know the difference and can properly pronounce items on menu.   Another hard hit. Like a stone to eye. Monkey miss Auntie Maile, her wonderful staff and the quality home cooking that helped me and brought families together.  ***Thanks to Alisa P. of new "owner, Allie.  No more Auntie Maile." for correcting me with shady tone. Terrific response in private, really. And we see you've deleted all your defensive responses to all other unfavorable reviews.***  "Kalbi from exact same vendor."  Sure, same vendor, but instead of 4 slabs of short ribs that cover plate, you cut 1 slab into 4 pieces!  Monkey not only one. Many know. Many have come long time. Many can tell difference, can spell and say menu items correctly. Monkey no manini. You fired good people and cut so many corners, you change direction.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey do: One pound Poke(Furikake), brown rice back when Aunty Maile &amp; Uncle Bruce founded this place.

pkRxU_yl2KyB0HkiEvMeXQ.text: New owners so they have now expanded and took over the small store that used to be there next door. Twice the size means more room so hopefully not as crowded during peak hours. Looks like it's been remodeled as well. Menu is different with some items being the same and some new items. Great service from friendly waiters and clean inside the restaurants, always a plus!

uMeuDNN7qZ3XbtxPALwv5A.text: Decided to come here for the first time to this location after work recently. I think I've been to their sister location in the north? (off craig and something by poke express) but correct me if im wrong xD   I had put the order in on yelp prior to leaving work, but since it was so close to work, I still at to wait at the restaurant.   Located just south of the Rhodes Ranch entrance on Durango, by windmill, it sits in a small shopping strip with some other places (totally looked but don't remember whats near by)  The restaurant itself is a decent size and was pretty busy, considering it was dinner time anyway.. Lol the kitchen was pushing out food really fast but it still took another 10 minutes or so for me to receive my food. Coincidentally saw Melissa because she was picking up food too xD   I had ordered the "Furikake Chicken" to go w/ fried rice and mac salad. The Furikake Chicken is a deep-fried boneless chicken tossed in a furikake glaze.   Let me be not the first person to say this, but to some people, me saying this may have more of an effect... HOLY THESE PORTIONS ARE HUGE ! Even with a fairly empty stomach after work, I barely ate half. The other half was saved for the next day.   Not only was the amount of chicken a lot, even the fried rice portion was larger than expected. I'm not complaining about the amount of food. Its a great thing for the price you're paying. For me, it was two meals. For some smaller eaters, this could easily be 3 maybe 4 meals.   I was a bit scared in the beginning because a friend of mine went to another location on eastern and said this chicken was bland. Mine was nothing but bland. sweet and savory sauce covering huge chunks of deep fried chicken, its like the Hawaiian version of orange chicken? XD ok not really...   The fried rice was filled with ingredients. good size pieces of Chinese bbq pork.   Not much of a fan of mac salad overall. It seemed like a normal mac salad.   Overall, food was good. Overly stuffed from it. Wonder if other stuff is made to these sized portions as well?? time will tell... until the next time I work nearby :P

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken w/ fried rice to go. Oh also a side of Mac salad

1QERJOifjKkNLLCrSnsdUA.text: I am a regular customer of Island Flavor Durango location) and was very unhappy the other night with one of their recent changes. ( FYI, since the news owners have taken over the business many of us "local Hawaiians" have been irritated with the new "rules.").  For the past 3 years I always order 1/2 pound of poke to go. I usually order the fried shoyu poke and the kitchen has always been accommodating until the other night.  I was told that I could no longer order the 1/2 pound of the shoyu poke if I wanted it fried?!? I had to order the fried poke plate which consisted of 1 lb. of poke, rice and Mac salad.  Shoyu poke is shoyu poke fried or not!!  To the cooks...let's get real. Your grill is on and it doesn't take more than a minute or two to sear the poke.  What is the problem? To the owners...is $16.95 for the plate the reason for this recent  change? I happen to order the 1/2 lb size because my husband is not able to eat that.  I'm sure that you're making a "killing" monetarily but watch out...Us local people from Hawaii stick together and many of us don't want to return. There's a lot of us here and we sure are spreading the word. You've lost so many of the original staff members, some of your portions have gotten "manini" (smaller), your prices have increased and you have too many "chiefs" in the kitchen.  When Uncle owned the restaurant we never had these problems because he truly believed in the aloha spirit.  Thank God for Edna and Kehau who are so kind and know what they're doing.  To the owners:  be humble and learn the True meaning of aloha! ..

ZBWLWkoI9zTDFB3UcytJVA.text: I will not go here again. My friend and her mom just went there to eat and placed a to go order for me. Theu watched 5 tables get seated AFTER their order was in, and then watched those 5 tables get their food first. And my to go order was waiting for 20 minutes. Horrible!  Today. 312/19. Granted, i am going by what they told me, but they are not prone to exxageration

ZePX-OMnIcJ24hPYxA9ELg.text: So yummy! Everything  was awesome. We got two monster plate and one chefs Loco moco. The meats we got were katsu, Kalbi, Korean wings, and furikai chicken. All of it was yummy. I preferred the wings and katsu. The Loco moco was off the charts! Def will be back!

Lhu7bIdY5U77zmIYrqI5Xw.text: Overall: Island Flavor serves up some good food, and the service is great.  Food: 4  Mixed Plate with Kalbi Short Ribs and Furikake Chicken: For the price, this dish was very worth it. There's enough for at least two people, maybe even three if you don't eat a lot. The kalbi short ribs had a nice char, and it had the actual smokey taste of being cooked on a grill. The furikake chicken was crispy, and it had a really tasty glaze. It might even be better than orange chicken.  Sweet & Sour Short Ribs: I know a lot of people who would absolutely love this dish, but it wasn't for me. The short ribs were tender, but they were drowning in a bowl of sauce that was too sweet and too sour without any balance.  All orders come with two sides. The usual is white rice and macaroni salad, but we subbed the macaroni salad for stir fried veggies in both. The white rice is pretty good and similar to Korean rice, so its higher starch content makes it a little sticky. The stir fried veggies was mostly zucchinis and it was well-cooked.  Service: 4  The servers were really nice and they even thought to bring out extra plates for us to share. They were pretty attentive, and they stopped by frequently to ask if we needed anything. Although the thought was nice, I would have actually preferred if they didn't ask quite so often (~4 times in a one hour lunch). The shop is small enough where I can flag one of them down easily if I needed anything.  Ambiance: 4  The restaurant is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. It isn't a super large restaurant, but it has plenty of tables and it doesn't feel cramped and it's pretty clean.

DvK02JVyENpQl0fJcbbU-A.text: Mean da "Aloha"... Was sat down by the hostess and a braddah came out and took my order. Was looking forward to eat as I hadn't eaten all day. I watched 3 groups get seated and thought nothing of it. As I looked up from my phone, one of 3 previously mention groups was finished and paying their bill. I went up to the hostess to explain that it had bee at least half an hour since my order was taken. He came back more than 5 minutes later saying that there was a mistake. At this point I'd be waiting 45min. As a customer and someone from the islands. There was no "aloha" here. Customer service put a bad taste is my mouth.

EYT7rDxBT5ABBEW5EqNCTA.text: food here is great.  the personality of the people that work here is awesome.   little crowded at times but it shows how good this place really is.   one of if not the best hawaiian / plate lunch places in las vegas.

5ECd2sbzDFn9aEP9XFh_zQ.text: Everything on the menu is delicious! It reminds me of home. The service is always friendly. Best Hawaiian food restaurant here in Las Vegas by far.

cElZ1TjTN6iq_HWQTwOOXw.text: Starting my review before I eat the food. Pulled up to the business which was located in a little plaza. Not the most appealing from the outside but once you walk through the door, you feel so welcomed by the nice host. The place is spotless. So quaint and tidy. Floors are clean. Bathroom was very clean. Tables are cute and modern. Very comfortable. Makes you feel that island hospitality. We sat down and ordered our food. The food came out so fast. We waited maybe 5 minutes. Order the Furikake Chicken. You will not be disappointed. The only critical thing I have to say is that the food was warm. Not hot, but so delicious. I will definitely be coming back to Island Flavor again soon for more. Thank you for making chicken taste like candy.

TH64wHrcZX_p7K5VKhWLUQ.text: Training in the area and was looking for something to eat ... spam musubi sounded good ... I yelp and the pics of the food were quite tantalizing ...after sitting down I decide to get the furikake chicken ... please please please ... do me a favor and get the furikake chicken .. generous portion of food (I swear they gave me 3 servings of chicken) 2 scoops of rice and a scoop of mac salad for $9. Best meal I had this week.  As a side note I did try the musubi and it had a little more rice than I usually like but the chicken was so good .. I'm willing to overlook it ..  if you're on the south side give this place a try for your Hawaiian fix!

6U6knGpqM39rnt0o5y0upQ.text: Best local grinds in the Vegas Valley! Teri beef is off the charts(real thick steak, not fatty shredded thin slices), furikake chicken and furikake shrimp broke da mouth!   Will be a loyal customer of this establishment forever. Thank you Island Flava!

B7CfpfXwAmrPaN1c5Wudyw.text: Great food. Excellent service!! I usually order the mixed plate with the furikake chicken and short ribs! Bomb food every time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They gave us some yummy musubi!!!

Nelr9G1Pw__Z-Rc-e9lYaQ.text: Love this place!! Our go to Hawaiian BBQ!  Spam musubi is delicious. They make it with the spam in the middle with furukaki sprinkled on it & a light terriyaki sauce. We always order extra to keep for snacks later.   Terriyaki chicken is super flavorful, thin pieces of white & dark chicken.   Chicken katsu is very tender & perfectly fried every time. Nothing's worse then getting over fried hard katsu.   Furukaki chicken is so delicious but very rich & salty. I can only eat a little, but it goes so well with rice & mac salad. Fried nuggets of chicken tossed in a furukaki glaze.   Saimen is traditional saimen but they add wontons to it so it's like saimen meets Chinese wonton soup. I get it without egg bc it's little pieces of scrambled egg, not thin strips so I'm just not a fan of the egg.   The portions are very large so we usually order 3 full plates & a musubi for everyone (3 adults & 2children) and it's more than enough.   They deliver on bite squad but if you call in for pickup yourself it's usually ready in 10-15 min, even on busy weekend nights.   They have a small store next door that sells Hawaiian food to make at home.

HvrBUxuS7FXPP-N1KS9CpA.text: I love this place! Big servings and great flavor. I love their spam musubi and combos!

e6q5QnGXJgU5HoWJMks42Q.text: Have been here countless times and I don't know why I haven't written a review yet!!  I've been coming here since it first opened a few years back and will continue coming here again and again! If you are craving Hawaiian food for ribs, this is the place to go.   Huge potions, awesome flavors, quality has been consistent over the years, very friendly and effective service!   I have tried different dishes but usually always go for the combo with kalua prick and kalbi ribs! This is my go-to dish! And their macaroni salad is awesome!!   Oxtail soup is also really good, loco moco, and their specials are also usually on point!

ThGs2QAhGkukDvbdwAYRLg.text: The service was awesome. The food portions are crazy large! Definitely shareable foods! I didn't even finish a quarter of my plate. I got the plate with two main items and two sides. The kalbi beef and the furikake chicken. Our group also got the oxtail soup. My buddy got the roast pork which was my favorite. Reminded me of comfort food I ate as a kid. Hawaiian dishes in Vegas and they did a great job. If you're hungry then I definitely recommend this.  Recommendation: Roast pork, furikake chicken, and oxtail soup

tpBjS45oKLiD6OhCWUePSg.text: 07/07/18 Arrived right at noon and was seated right away. Friendly male server. Ate Furikake Chicken and shrimp, Kal Bi, hamburger steak, sauteed veggies, Saimin. All still very ONO even with the new owners.

Wzf_z5rEZxJoMNYb5xcsiA.text: Newly renovated, bigger and spacier. Always friendly staff and host. A must go when you ever drive by southwest of the valley. Poke, furikake, kalbi, opakapaka, katsu, and all other hawaiian dishes, all are a must try! Im sure you will keep coming back for more.

K6pCresYVaZSv_zdJUiOqg.text: Ordered catering.. for time specific .. they didn't know we had an order  until we arrived and they had to revise the menu without having comparable --  had to wait an hour and a half to get food ready - and we had had hungry guests -- DONT ACCEPT CATERING ORDERS IF YOU KNOW YOU WONT BE ABLE TO FUFILL IT !!   Chicken Katsu as a substitute for sweet and sour spareribs is not comparable ! Not even one star ..

2z1k61GlSYz8FLDDI_V23w.text: I love this place, we have been going since a little after it opened. Granted it was always a little busy, but that's good right? You'd think it's because it has awesome food. And you'd be correct. The thing is even after they expanded it's gotten worse on the wait times. We try not to go at peak hours. Last time we went, we were there for about 10 mins, seated about 20 mins and no one even got a drink order or anything yet. At that time we walked out. It seems their staff may have been hit with a flu bug going around. So we waited about a week and it was pretty much the same thing. Craving great Hawaiian food we decided to get a all in order. My fiance ordered it on her way out of class at can Charleston. Took her 40 mins or so to get there with stopping to get gas. She still had to wait another 30 mins, and even though she tripled checked with the guy when she got there, our order wasn't exactly what we wanted. Close enough but not perfect. Still the food was great. If they could get their wait times down to an acceptable range this place would be perfect. BUT if you have time to waste and want to hang out with family and friends. It fits perfect. I've done that more then a few times here..

zQOYs8IKNzA6-SDuKaq7ww.text: Kids loved the Teriyaki chicken and Katsu.  Kayla Pork was nice and tender but needs a little more flavor. Nice size portions.  Will definitely come back.

2mfkjGlQHrOiLLoNdWNSTA.text: First time here and the service is prompt Food is absolutely delicious, by far the best island meal I've had my whole life. Will have to visit again , next time I'm in Vegas!

vhF2zOfZOYg4jEwdg88rDw.text: Tried their spam musubis today & it was a huge let down! First off, there's way too much rice. Secondly, it tasted spoiled and it was mushy

vfML3m7k9DL2hFQwmM30Vw.text: I'll start off the review by saying that I usually enjoy Island Flavor and their food. However, I was extremely disappointed by their service a few days ago for a catering order I was picking up. I placed the order two days before, and the lady helping me was extremely nice. However, when I came to pick up my food on Saturday, the manager was very condescending when I asked where the plastic utensils were. She was extremely snappy in saying that utensils were not included (even though I confirmed with the other girl 2 days before that utensils were part of the service). Instead of working with me, the manager questioned me about who told me they were free by pointing around the restaurant to see which server to blame. I placed a $450 catering order, I'm sorry it's hurting your sales that much to provide me with $5 worth of utensils. She offered me 10 utensils with hesitation (even though I needed 30). She then asked me why I couldn't just buy my own???? Probably because you already promised me the utensils would be included 2 days previous? She finally gave in. NOT ONLY THAT, but I was stuck tugging along the entire catering order by myself to my car without being offered help by any of the staff. I won't be bringing my money here any longer. I was thoroughly disappointed at something that could so easily have been mended!

cdSyFsXVSKo07U22kvaLxA.text: This is by far the best Hawaiian spot in vegas... from the options to the flavors to the portion size and friendly staff, no others place can compete

iq6N6BMNgJ3IbQtoT3t6Lw.text: My favorite Hawaiian food place in Vegas  Must try the mix plate it's a lot of food!!

cwu1uYTCgL1rH0CjV51Arg.text: I've been going here for years. This is the first time coming back since the new owners, wasn't too happy.  Everything is less portion from before. I felt like I got ripped off.  If this was my first time going, I would love it. But, I wish the old place was back.

Wi-NrWR1Or2aeLOASaRp6w.text: This is hands down me and my family's favorite Hawaiian food fixes. With a family of 4, we love having big portions to share and try different delicious entrees. My go to is the furikake chicken which is always consistently delicious and the hamburgah steak is thick and tons of gravy and mushrooms and onions as it should be. :) always coming back!

NG0rNTQSBjShfRn6PxjHRA.text: First time at this location but I've been to the Eastern location numerous times. I didn't know that this place was a sit-down restaurant which it makes sense to me now that the one on Eastern says "Island Flavor Express" in their store front.  My boyfriend and I were craving fried chicken so we decided to dine here for their well known furikake chicken. It was pretty busy for a weekday night but didn't expect our order to take so long to come out. It took over forty minutes to arrive to our table from the time we placed it. We thought this place would be a quick eat. Although we didn't really have a designated server (I think) , I wish someone like our server who took our order would've told us that their kitchen was backed up or something at least. Most of the workers didn't look so happy to work there especially the hostess/cashier in front had the most annoyed look on her face whenever people came in & she was walking them to their tables. The only server that was actually friendly to us & the other tables around was the guy server. As for the food itself , furikake chicken was tasty and large portion to share for 9$. I love the food at both locations & think that it's way better than other Hawaiian establishments around Las Vegas. It's probably just better to just order to-go or for takeout here. Other menu items I recommend that I tried from their other location: THEIR SPICY AVO POKE (worth ordering by the pound) , chicken katsu , kalbi short ribs , and all of the desserts (their chantilly and guava cake slices are bomb).
