li6nczXVLpQI8WkadyVXZA.text: The mac here is ONO! Still looking for better mac around town here on the 9th island and hands down this place got the mac closest to home. Loco Moco! Hooo, raised the bar for sure...gravy was different but so good! The only reason why I give this place 4 stars because it's far from where we stay. Had to drive 30 mins to this place but well worth the drive!

UK8wXyudiXe5pIu-RNYpfQ.text: Always great hospitality and aloha here. Great portions and consistent every time. Love their roast pork and gravy !

QrGXaIeatw-0CzVECN7c2Q.text: Love Island Flavor! Always delicious, hot, and large portions at a great price. I moved to Las Vegas a year ago and I eat here two or three times a month. I also bring guests visiting from the Big Island of Hawaii and they love Island Flavor too. The remodel of the Durango location is beautiful.

6k-65-FyU-7CuAU2tl_Jhw.text: Plates was really big can feed more than 2 people per plate.... the salad was very good with the homemade salad dressing

nHRk4wSjsPMHO2C_ZPvXzQ.text: Have picked up from here delivering for UberEATS and it has smelled amazing every time! Today we decided to give it a try! My wife ordered the hamburger steak with rice/Mac salad and a side garden salad. She loved it! The gravy was very tasty and she said it was the best Mac salad she has tasted. Gunnar has the Teriyaki chicken and fried noodles, we all tried it and loved it. I ordered the Korean chicken which my only complaint was it wasn't as hot as it should have been! It seemed like it had been sitting for a few minutes and was warm when it should have been piping hot. The flavor was spot on just wished it was hotter

_8fcLx6RwsZKPpMNNxVeFw.text: This place is legit! One of the best Hawaii food restaurant in Vegas. For starter definitely try out their Ahi Poke, then for main course combination - Fried Rice, Short Ribs, Chicken & Pork Belly..all are excellent! Just be prepared this place gets busy, give your self some time for the wait.

-oxAMYG62chiWhfRSDbX0Q.text: I absolutely love this place. Great food, great portions and super friendly staff. This is my families go to place when we come to Las Vegas. Keep up the the good work and great food!!

xgWdwdZRuKjCADPnoDrXFQ.text: Fabulous food and service excellent on the pricing and they refused a tip.    Must make a reservation at peak times it gets pretty busy.

Wq2sqpjQ0rk29aP8qCoGoQ.text: Ordered oxtail soup and had it delivered via Grubhub.  Delivery was prompt and food arrived hot and looked tasty.  However, the oxtail soup was sooooooo salty I could not take more than two bites!  I was so disappointed as there were so many good reviews on the soup.   It was too salty so if you have high blood pressure, don't come here! I won't be ordering again.

evSyr2uE1v6R7nhg9CZ9cw.text: Crack! The Furikake chicken should be illegal! This thing soo damn addictive! It's flavorful, crispy, juicy, sweet, and sticky - this should be a song :) I've also tried the Kalua Pork and Kalbi Ribs. All are really good. The winner for me however, is the Furikake Chicken. Who created this wonderful thing???? The double meat plate is enormous, it lasts me about 3 meals. Oh, the coffee mud pie is really good too. The only downer is that this place is soooo far from me. Maybe it's not such a bad thing since I'm trying to be skinny :) I ordered to go and dined in, both experiences were great. It looks like this spot is pretty busy, no matter what time. No surprise.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi and furikake combo

YVDtxLIdxOXWMmzuCryhnQ.text: Visiting Vegas right now and my friend told me to try this place, the best in Vegas definitely! Tried their poke tuna and you can just taste how fresh it it! Service was very welcoming and so sweet! Will definitely recommend to all my friends and family if they ever visit Vegas!

rELSDEWB-J764AYc_QMLTA.text: The vibe is very relaxed.  All the food looks amazing.  We will certainly be back.  Trying the da fluffy.  Will will be back for the loco moco to try.  The ribs look good as well.  Plenty of choices.

TKGb5-209YsRYETr0Fvk0A.text: Live Hawaiian music...brings you back to the island with great food and friendly people Aloha Oxtail soup is good for the soul

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5DOP9l03S27xAUHfj19ajw.text: This place is absolutely amazing. I've eaten at a lot of Hawaiian restaurants but this place wins over all. Service food everything. 5 stars from me.

E0JlaO2Z3UnTOBkenRDKoA.text: Came to island flavor yesterday for an early Mother's Day celebration. Food was great but our server, Christine, was rude. Our food came, my sister was in the middle of explaining what was missing from her order and our server quickly cut her off and said, "I'll tell you what you ordered." My sister was missing an extra order of macaroni and it never came. She didn't check on us or refilled any of our beverages. When it came to paying the bill I really did not want to tip her, but she was hovering everyone that was paying and I did not feel comfortable. She needs to fix her sh*tty attitude cause that b*tch didn't deserve any tip.

EgYuxqqsq6MteA_LdbScBA.text: Went here with a few friends for the first time and it was a great experience. Food portions were big which was awesome and the atmosphere was nice. One thing that would have given this a 5star was the service. Got seated and wait about 10-15minutes just for the drinks and another 10-15minutes for the food order. Other then the service I would recommend this place to others.

lYRky4O6Vp7x8NCUKAjU0Q.text: Never disappoints!  Can't stop thinking about the Ahi Poke. Maybe add Poke bowls to the menu?  Prices are also very reasonable with the amount of food you get.  Overall, they not only bring the island flavor they also give you the aloha feeling you want to come back too.

mWUA1m02alFS51kxwepjeg.text: My favorite Hawaiian restraurant in Las Vegas :)) good service, good food!!! Onolicious deserts!!!  live Hawaiian music

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa puffs, haupia cake, guava chiffon, Kona mud pie and green tea ice cream jus some of the onolicious deserts

HlYx7Sc7sBR9RHkw1DDyHA.text: This and ross J's are my favorite 808 restaurants in Vegas! I especially love coming when they hire this guy to sing! It makes dinner fun! It's a small place, but it's homey and you can tell they love their customers. Service is the best you can get here in Vegas. And the foooood!!!! If you like loco moco, brown gravely, Mac salad, any kind of Hawaiian food you can't go wrong by coming here. This will soon be your new favorite place! They do take out too! And prices are pretty decent!

PSd9aj4NANY-WiupfVcwtA.text: What more could I say about this place in leu of all other reviews? Well for one, I can say is this: For the price, the large quantity, taste and quality and great customer service gives this place a 5 star and no less.   My new years resolution is to try EVERYTHING on the menu by the end of this year.  Yeah, it's that good!

bP9xvWeL2Yd042bnvgqiZA.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this small mom n pop restaurant, four of us went in about 3 in the afternoon, the place was packed with Hawaiians, first good sign, second we ordered their 3 juice mixture, delicious, we ordered the cucumbers w kimchi, the correct amount of heat for us :) yummy appetizer. we ordered the barbecue  ribs and roast pork were cooked perfectly, with yummy spice, the macaroni salad was very  creamy and just like homemade. The furikake chicken was very tender , their flavors are  traditional and you will not be disappointed :)

a8B1ERUsMNdwy3uP9wd5og.text: Love love love the food here. Loco moco and chicken katsu! They also had sweet potato haupia pie that was out of this world!

c2o-JNhxB0qKgEP4vcSJxQ.text: We just moved here last week but we've been here several times already. Will definitely come back for more...

AMLNGNrFnrpE5yvh6Pvs8A.text: Awesome food! Recommend this to anyone and quality is great! Guava cake was brilliant and loco moco, ask for gravy on the side because it's sort of overwhelming with their gravy. service has always been pretty prompt even when picking up. Korean chicken wings are off the hook, truly recommend on those bad boys!

ki_zVR7O1oywqjYMHCSNOw.text: I got a fever for the flavor all the time.  I absolutely love this place.  It is insanely cheap and and great quality.  You can even get spam musubi to go.

khIVyCgpP9mHhlXLGfat7Q.text: Great food, best Hawaiian food I've tried so far in Vegas. Excellent portions, very flavorful. Everyone is very friendly and makes you feel welcomed. My fav dessert is the guava cake.

H7ct6AWTve_aHVPbb9t58w.text: Updated review: I still love this place. Here's what we order on the regs: Furikaki poke, furikaki chicken, furikaki shrimp, shoyu chicken (Thursdays only and don't show up too late or it will be gone) and I always go double mac salad no rice.  I'd give them 6 stars if I could.

cuXL2bJ-8kdbr6SykWlsUw.text: After going to Oahu this summer for a conference, I was super excited to find a good Hawaiian restaurant near where I live here in Vegas.  For those of you that know and have been to Rainbow Drive In on Oahu, you will surely be a fan of this place.  First off I have to say that the portions here are HUGE!!!! So come hungry or be prepared to share or take a doggy bag home.  The mixed plate comes with your choice of two items off the menu, along with 2 scoops of rice and a scoop of mac salad.  I've had the Portuguese bean soup, the Kahlua pork and cabbage, the Hawaiian style roast pork, and the chicken Katsu, and all were delicious.  Both times the pork has been done perfectly, tender and still juicy, which was a nice surprise.  I also liked the brown gravy that they served the roast pork with, it added just the right amount of richness to the dish.  I've also tried the lomi lomi salmon, and it was tasty too, but I'm just not a huge fan of salmon so I didn't think that much of it overall.  The service here is great, and the ladies, when they're not run off their feet, are happy to chat with you, and play do we know anyone in common from back on the islands.  Prices are great considering the amount of food you get here.  Overall, I say go go go if you want a taste of real Hawaiian food.

wEbBBOvhuRhUOmigwdf48w.text: I have eaten here a couple times.  Their food was delicious and if my boyfriend was able to like it (he is a picky eater) then obviously the food must be amazing.  A lot of my family are from the islands so their input was very important to me.  They loved the food there which can add to the authentic feel to it.    I give it 3 stars because of their  service.  Though they were friendly when we first walked in, their untimely manner upset me.  I am a huge water drink and when they didn't refill my water it irritated me a bit.  I had to wait approximately 15 minutes just to get my water refilled.  Maybe it was just yesterday when I went.  I will come back again and hopefully the service will be better.

KtIF0ziDS9aI7qAdQ0VYKw.text: So a bit late in reviewing. Oopsy! Was in LV in May and decided to read reviews on Yelp, and find me some Hawaiian food.  It was a toss up between a couple but decided on Island Flavor. So, glad we did!    Very large portions, great taste, waitresses were very friendly with locals,  ours was pleasant- no complaints!   We had the biggest portion of Poke' ever,  pork with cabbage, and a mixed plate.  We had  2 to go boxes left over,  Can you say, cold cabbage and pork for breakfast.  Lol   I ordered the cake for dessert, nothing compares to Saimin Says where we live...so that's why I deducted the star. Would have done a half star..but not an option. lol It wasn't great it was ok!    Overall we made our family jealous with pics of our food and prices were fair for the portions.   Definitely going back in Nov with family.  :)

bMsmJIjFsTUo-kb5SJSi6w.text: Big portions of that island flavor.  BUGGAH IS WINNAHZ.  Deserts are home made and broke da mout.

YBWmAV7M704ahwKM5PhBiw.text: This lil hawaiian eatery just a lil bit on the side of vegas have awesome Ahi Poki! Theres a live guitar accoustic too! Even though it is rated #33 reason to visit vegas, for me it is top 5!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b1SJESz8xhKO-7OdD98eEg.text: Amazing food good service big portions! Love their loco moco! And their chicken and teriyaki!

aJ_6Xi14SS6e38yDQFE20A.text: Hey guys it's me Hungry Panda at it again.   This time a shorter review than usual, sorry.  You know how i always mention Love, it's because I believe Love is an ingredient in amazing food. Also in life, but thats a story for another time :)  Hands Down, The fried stuff the grilled stuff and idk maybe the baked stuff.. MADE WITH LOVE. If your looking for healthy, good luck finding that here, but this place makes food to make your taste buds pop.   MY FAVORITE: the chicken wings, extra crispy, with the sauce on the side. I do that so that when i get my chicken wings i can still have the fresh crispy wings and not let the breading get too soft and moist. LOL! i said soft and moist, of course were talking about breading on the chicken wings, and thats a big NO NO.  THIS PLACE, PERFECT! service, food, seating, price. maybe a better bathrom but hey i can pee before i leave the house :)

lpFOovfaX8-HJm9YAQtGUQ.text: My family and I wanted to try this place after reading the reviews on yelp. When we got there, there was a little bit of a wait. Not too long. Once we got seated we ordered our food. We waited for quite a while before our waitress came by to let us know they ran out of white rice. She gave us the option of waiting for the white rice or changing it to brown rice. Since our kids were really hungry we decided to change to brown rice. We were assured that our food will be out right away. We continue to wait. We thought we would get our food right away since we decided to change to brown rice. The table next to us came in around the same time we did and were also given the option of waiting for white rice or brown rice. They opted to wait for white rice. They received their food before we did even though we had opted not to wait for the white rice. We received our food about 10-15 minutes after them. We had to ask about our food multiple times. The food was ok. I really wanted to like this place.

0AWpJjCuJFr9Ufn2a2gm5Q.text: Not so very impressed with Island Flavor. The Kalua pig was bland, saimen was sort of gummy,fishy and bland also. The chicken Katsu was chewy and gristly and lacked in flavor as well. My husband and I agreed the Katsu sauce was yummy, but the food should have been better. Don't think we'll be back.  I was so excited to find a Hawaiian place with such excellent reviews, but don't see what all the hype is about.

OdaW0-MGkn17Z3lZ7a2cjA.text: Man, their portion is HUGE~! So definitely, bring your appetite. And this place certainly has the "Island Flavor" all around, with very friendly service too. Terriyaki beef was my fav out of 6 other dishes we had on our table. However, I kept thinking..."man, were the dishes made by chef school drop-outs?" (Not to offend the "chefs" there, but dont expect high quality or eye-applealing presentation here.) Overall, cool place and I would go back there again for sure. Wish they just "clean up" all the clutters tho, esp. the dirty rug that was covering a long table in the corner X(

l9xNb3BNS9LXleke0uLV7A.text: I would give them a 3.5 if I had the option. We split the teriyaki steak with rice & macaroni and also the furikake shrimp with rice & side salad. We phoned in our order and were a little disappointed that they didn't have mashed potatoes as a sub for the rice on one of our orders, it is on the menu. I zipped over and picked up our order and shot home to the wife with a bag full of Hawaiian goodies. The teriyaki steak was good but nothing out of this world... maybe I was looking for a tad more flavor from the meat. Don't get me wrong, the steak was good, but could've used a little seasoning and to be less reliant on the teriyaki alone. The rice was good sticky rice and the macaroni was pretty good too. The furikake shrimp was a good size portion, 7 large butterflied shrimp, but was a bit on the overcooked size and a noticeable dark brown was given to the panko crumbs. Again, good sticky rice and my wife enjoyed the side salad. Island Flavor did nothing wrong and we would try them again in the future but nothing really stood out to us as being out of this world. Maybe we should try eating in next time?

r_OXry9rxLwKOXL6K3KL4g.text: place wasnt that great, had the oxtail soup.. i think california hotel was better... ac sucked, was semi sweating while eating... wouldnt mind trying again but diffent foods

QlCBBiwDvtB0KPyQD3oiDA.text: Poke another one of my favorite food and Island Flavor knows how to make it!  They are very generous with their servings and they really give a Hawaiian style atmosphere.  The Mac Salad is another great dish here too.  So, if you are around the area, make sure you try this local restaurant.

ZZH_zRjFWI-CEzpNeR6lhg.text: Soooo delicious!  We always get the mixed plate with Chicken Katsu, and beef teriyaki.  The kalbi short ribs are delicious as well.  Highly recommended!

sLtzW-9zgFajxQTHF6Kxag.text: This place is a freakin joke. The food sucks even if you're Really hungry .Chewy meat with gristles, where do they get this cheap meat? Place sucks . I had like two bites, then tossed it out.

MRKY_r3oPAYX0RC4nVZb4Q.text: Went by for lunch today.  Ordered the roast pork loco moco.  Probably not the healthiest thing to eat but  I was starving.  Probably the most noticeable thing is the gut busting portions.  Holy carp!  The gravy lacked flavor.  The pork was was good but could be a little more tender.  I should have tried some of the more colorful dishes like the korean chicken.  Also, should have ordered a side of kimchee to put on top.  This place definitely has gut busting portions and good prices.  That's why I gave it the 4th star.  I'll try it again but next time it's the korean chicken wings

2fCXsXRLHqFaIia_3tvNoA.text: Decided to try out this place after reading so many positive reviews. After inputting the address realized it was much further than I thought... Just under 10 miles from my house.  The storefront had blacked out windows and I thought they were closed. Went inside and was blown away by the heat! It had to be over 90 degrees in there! Oh well hope my order doesn't take too long. Decided on Kalbi ribs and Teriyaki chicken. Also got an order of banana bread pudding and haupia cake. The portions were large. Both plates came with 2 scoops of rice and macaroni salad. Rice is rice and Mac salad was okay.. Kind of bland though. The Kalbi had great flavor ( I should know .. I'm Korean) but could've been a little more tender and was a little too fatty. I think the highlight was the chicken. They were super flavorful , tender and so juicy!!! The bread pudding was enough for 4 people and pretty yummy. The haupia cake was to die for !!! All in all I was pretty happy and would go again and try some other items on their menu. Just too far to go regularly.

FED5450ak4G_FEd6SVRoZQ.text: This place is almost reason enough to visit LV.  I was taken here by a bunch of 300lb native Hawaiians so I knew it was going to be legit.  It's the kind of restaurant where you really wish that a) they offered a sampler menu, or b) that you could somehow figure out a way to eat 7 entrees.  We had a large group, and every meal was amazing.  This is the real deal, folks.

c9cIJKvxsKPw1qRx_-HM1w.text: Katsu loco moco = End Game FATALITY  They seriously should have an eating contest with these wonderful bowls full of NOM NOMness because id like to see the person who could kill one of these they are so damn big. The place is sort of like a hole in the wall but im not complaining as its close to home which is nice. The decor is sort of like what you would expect of the floor plan of a sushi restaurant with the center wrap around bar section where you expect to see a sushi chef behind serving it up. But its relatively clean and its not like i wanted to dress up to go eat island food.  The good part, the grub! my brother said the Katsu loco moco was where its at so i ordered and maybe not even 10 minutes later the cook in the back who kinda reminded me of tattoo face from "50 First Dates" had my tasty bowl mounded with a heap of food. This bowl had to have at least 4 scoops of rice in the bottom, 3-4 full chicken breasts breaded and well cooked, 2 eggs, and covered in brown gravy and a sprinkle of green onions. Honestly i was overwhelmed by the amount of food as when i saw the $8 and change price tag i thought it was a lil bit much for what i ordered, till i learned that it could feed me for 3 meals. Well made with all the right flavors, my only issue ever so slight was that the eggs were sliiightly under cooked so the whites were still jelly like. Aside from this i was pleased with the food.   Location/ decor - 6/10 would get a 5 but its close so thats a point 4 me Service - 7/10 nice people, nothing special but not bad either Food taste - 7.5-8/10 simple food, simple flavors but well put together Value - 9.5/10 big food for very good price, one order can feed two  All in all this is my go to spot for when island food now. I use to make the drive all the way to Aloha Kitchen previously but now its down the street and reasonable. I will be back without a doubt... come hungry!

Ex9vY0bx23VCpw4Otp0sIA.text: I would give this place 5 stars, but I had to deduct a star because the food is just way too salty for me.  No need for soy sauce.  But I am definitely a fan!  I love their ahi poke!!!!  I just wished they served lomi lomi everyday and not just on Fridays.

5PPdf0SuobLkEDkutDjJNQ.text: laulau today and new this time for me chicken katsu loco moco. excellent. not a ton of chicken but certainly enough!

E2NNKkdyK-Fe850vso5uRw.text: The menu was very extensive for a Hawaiian restaurant. I had Teriyaki chicken which consisted of quite a lot of delicious marinated chicken with huge portions of rice and macaroni salad for just a little over $10.00. I had some left over for dinner another day. The service was good and the ambience casual and comfortable.

7gND_lrX7jD1IRGIM9_fZg.text: Short ribs and Korean chicken wings are to die for. Be sure to check stores hours before going.

I9BBifJwJbATIkTCGCrRdg.text: i went cause i was craving some chicken katsu  i was disappointed by theirs cause it was fried wayy to much for my liking. I like GOLDEN brown not DARK brown. there was a lot of it but thats about it.   The rice was soggy. but the mac salad was decent.   I will try the other items and update if  they are better.

EuPkIaHUoEbohtrN7jLy0w.text: Best Hawaiian food in Vegas.. Hawaiian plate on Friday only, lau lau, poke, haupia, mac salad, rice for under 10 bucks. Big portions!! Roast is another favorite. Friendly staff

ntGUzEwfkLdyuEgx1CtGiA.text: The food was good only small issue was the katsu was different than i have had before. I 1would recommend this place to everybody

x3SH9OWdURjROI1_GN9Uqg.text: Me and the husband love this place. The employees seem like their all related, which makes it feel homey. The portions are big and a good deal. The fried ahi poke salad is HUGE! I think 3 or even 4 people could munch on that. My husband always seems to get the loco moco and he never seems to finish it, trust me he can pack it away. I had the roast pork and I could not finish that plate as much as I tried to. We've also had their fried rice with egg and portuguese sausage. I really like this place and they seem to get alot of people in. The only cons of the place is #1 their closed in Sunday and Monday, #2 the place should be bigger because it seems sorta small and sometimes their people waiting outside or their cars just to eat there.

5VH5lA0urgbx5nD8aCzYJg.text: I've never had the food, but a friend of mine brought over their banana bread pudding and it was soooooooooo good! I'm gonna pick some up tomorrow!  when i do have the food though, i'll be back for a better review!

pS9eNh06EcOAJC7rXOI0yw.text: One of my family's favorite places to go. My personal favorite is the chefs loco moco. 10/10 would recommend for you and your family.

tVBp0VKy8VJaTMIr02FRaA.text: Good Service Clean  Fast  Friendly Come Check Um Out !! Always Enjoyable They Have Music On The Weekends Food Is Good

B0GtHY7VtSgbHq-5GUpreA.text: Visiting Las Vegas all the way from San Diego. Born and raised from Oahu. Gotta eat local and support local. The chef's loco moco was super ONO!!!!

E-S9XBJhKU9l1iOgcSKE9Q.text: Very yummy food! The portions were great and the prices were very reasonable.   We were visiting from Colorado and ate here for lunch 2 days in a row because it was so good. It's sort of a small hole in the wall so if your party is larger than 8+ I suggest getting there earlier or calling in your order. We had to do that on the second day because it was packed but they still got our food out quickly. It was worth having to eat in the car lol   We also had the poke which was bomb  The Guava Cake and Chantilly Cake were also our favorites. We will definitely be back whenever we are in town. And will continue to recommend this establishment to all of our family and friends. Mahalo nui loa

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate. Furikake Shrimp, Chicken, Rice and Mac Salad

Nkhf1sa-QQQ8Q6Fz8svNig.text: This place is very good to me and my spouse we typically want this on a regular! However that's probably not a good idea but from the portions to mac salad taste is just good

-LyqVgESANZdGvYHnssZog.text: Island Flavor is fabulous. The food is amazing and the service was great.   Rey busy restaurant so if playing to order take out I would call ahead. If going to eat at the restaurant be patient. It's worth the wait.

zfsdU7nRYMYEk3WxrsXG5w.text: A really awesome brunch place with insane value! You get a huge portion of something delicious, and it's really affordable for the amount of food you're getting.   I love their classic loco moco and chicken katsu plates! The gravy is savory and not too floury or thick. Their eggs are also always on point! The guava cake is pretty amazing too-- not too sweet but just delicate and fruity enough!

rAwaRIATv09hlUFYjtGc7Q.text: If I had a choice I would not give any stars. Food is bland wait is long and management is rude. I don't know how those other people have give great reviews they must be friends of family. Definitely stay away from here!

bEUHoVWt16uyn5E4G0ypkA.text: The customer service is second to none. I watched how they talked to everyone there. One woman even got a hug when she walked in. Great balance of attentiveness and attention to detail.   This was my third time getting food from here. I have had maybe half the items on the menu too. The one thing that stands out is the portion sizes. You will not get bigger Hawaiian BBQ sizes anywhere. The teriyaki sauce isn't the best but it is still pretty decent. I am not a fan of the breaded chicken and the fried rice didn't really do it for me. But hey, maybe I just don't understand traditional Hawaiian dishes.   It was really difficult for me not to give this place 5 stars, Very difficult. I had to really look at other places I gave a 5 and compare this place to that.  Pros - Customer service, portion sizes  Cons - Location

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs and fried rice
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry cake

bvnTcDPERzS8fyipcS_P5A.text: It was my first time that got me for the second one . I went to a social event , chef did his thang . It was BOMB . The second time . It was just OK .

th7PvIp8-QM3aTVT9sFJhQ.text: If this is what Hawaiian local foods are, then I have a feeling I will love Hawaii whenever I get to visit! We were exploring Las Vegas and heard about this place. The restaurant felt quite homey and the menu was simple with plenty of options to choose from.   I had the Kalua pig and cabbage while my boyfriend got the Furikake chicken. The Kalua pig and cabbage dish was soooo good with SO MUCH MEAT. The meat was soft and juicy and the cabbage made the dish complete. The Furikake chicken was addicting as well. I don't know what they put in the marinade but I love it. Now, both of these dishes were ginormous and we were overly stuffed in the end. Each dish could easily be two dishes.  For how much food you get, the price was well worth it. Come check out this place if you're in the area!

29ghFY7NggMZhxCOuYa5Ag.text: Ugh man the food isnt the same since the new owners.  Wheres my locals? The family restaurant I used to know. The prices went up, now less food. I'm so sad it's not the same. I've placed an order, they tell me 15 mins, I show up 25 mins and food is still not ready for go? Junk now.

-xV7NHdhfP9ENrw41aq5og.text: Had to give this place a try after reading all the reviews.  First, service is awesome with all the servers checking constantly to see if we need anything.  Waters and drinks were constantly filled.  I shared a mixed plate of furikake chicken and Kalbi with a side of mac salad and char siu fried rice.  This is a ton of food.  The furikake chicken was a little sweet for me but crispy and tasty.  The kalbi was tender and the fried rice was very good.  This place is a bit far from the strip.  Their breakfast items are ginormous from what I saw on other tables.  It's quite popular so go before the lunch and dinner crowd.  Highly recommend.

DO8Cd1cP_-SVCyUfXNZBRg.text: Came back 4 months later and told my friend i was hesitant to eat here after my last visit. We walk in to the door and the vibe was amazing and our server Melissa was courteous attentive and awesome. We ordered hamburger and chicken katsu loco mocos. OMG the servings were huge. It was the first time i didn't finish my loco moco plate. Thank goodness for Mellissa and the menu changed too. Some dishes had a Pnoy fusion thing going on. Might come back and try other new dishes

zd7zLNjxg3U0SRqA1B5R7w.text: There food was amazing and the service was great I recommend coming here it's amazing that's why I gave it 5 stars and there servings are huge unless you ask for less food.

DPf79bIhcOwqgYA60LgtHQ.text: First time after renovation and two items we order for take out was below expectations. Teriyaki burger was salty and too much teriyaki sauce, tinono pork belly was terrible because the pork was saggy and looks like it was a left over, so in other words next time I will stick to my loco moco

aTaY0o9BjA8pgwoXFQQXzg.text: Having lived in Hawai'i for a few years, I love the BBQ there!  The Chicken and beef BBQ at Island Flavor brings me back to those days.  And the fried wontons are delicious!!

emf6L2axG8OdDvztOomqXA.text: good food great atmosphere  the plates are worth it especially the japanees poke christine was very good dispite the busyness in the restaurant very professional and prompt

BBO-Z5G7w6eF_ZfuFzR67A.text: Great atmosphere,the vibe is great. They even have a live music inside literally feels like the island! Variety of food selections.christine is awesome,great customer service !

vt0FX6zqV1SiLG-INDDrig.text: We drove all the way from Alicante area to eat at this establishment. My family has eaten there once before and were amazed at the portion size. Unfortunately, this recent visit wasn't as good. First when we entered, the hostess was on the phone, didn't acknowledge us to at least say, "I'll be right with you." She was on the phone for a good 10 minutes and when she was off the phone, didn't greet us with, "Hello, welcome to Island Flavor." Just, "how many?....eating here?" She walked us to a table, left the menus on the table and walked away. No "your server will be right with you"....NOTHING! The waitress had a great "customer service" personality. I was amazed that for $15 and some change for Kalbi, the plate came with ONLY 4 strips of kalbi. Unreal!!! Last time we ate there, there was way more than 4 strips. Also no ingredients listed on menu for those with possible food allergies. Mac salad was a little too "crabby" with crab. The pork belly with tomato and onions had literally no sauce in the bowl. So it was very bland. The Korean chicken wasn't crispy and lacked that Korean flavor. It was really disappointing, especially how far we drove just to eat there.

PSkIQnRWdM0td9x3MKnQRA.text: Probably the best Hawaiian food outside of Hawaii and better than some in Hawaii. The poke is very good and the Kali is awesome. Portions are huge and the whole place has an authentic relaxed plate lunch vibe to it. Better table management and shorter wait times would get them up to 5 stars. The food and service is already there.

Cm6HwuH2kYQwkTISfyw5Cg.text: Food is always bomb! Folks are always welcoming! Little pricey but worth it! All time FAM favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmm!! Fudakaki chicken and Kalbi rib combo! And baby back ribs! Ahhh snap

Qd27FGo_q_-f8IPS5U7Jdg.text: 4.5 stars for Island Flavor! My craving for some spam musubis lead my fiance to pick me up some from Island Flavor! He also decided to get the Portuguese sausage fried rice to bring home too. The spam musubi's were huge!!!! bigger than what I had in Hawaii, but they were delicious. Rice was cooked perfectly and the spam was not too sweet and not too salty. One spam musubi would have filled me up, but since I'm a hungry hippo I just had to try the fried rice. Fried rice was good, maybe a lil too soggy for my tastes, but that's Hawaiian style? It came with 4 big pieces of sausages and there was a huge scrambled egg on top. The rice itself had lil pieces of BBQ pork which was fatty but tasty. Overall, I was pretty impressed and I know I will be returning for more musubis!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Musubi

vXfEy0vv5sRzU4CrS0t8xQ.text: I enjoy tuna very much but nothing like this. So delicious probably the best I've had in a while and very affordable.  The atmosphere is relaxing and music is cool. I also had the ribs, delicious and if you like sticky rice this is the place.  Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bnhtIucqjCjFxpEoWwI9-g.text: A must visit whenever I'm in vegas! This place is bomb. Short ribs, steak, Mac salad, guava juice, pulled pork, fried chicken....basically everything on the menu is good. If you love tuna, try the tuna poke. So delicious! Even the staff is amazing. They're so friendly. I love this place.

Et5zm686lUi683A9ePDAdA.text: I LOVE this place.  We recently moved to Las Vegas and this place is a couple miles away from our house.  We have tried a few different things on the menu, but our favorite, by far, is the Furikake Chicken.  One order is definitely enough to split between 2-3 people.  The Chicken Katsu is pretty good, and their macaroni salad is good too.  Affordable, and delicious!!

mbamSVAsFkguwF0KDkEp1g.text: Hands down to the BEST Hawaiian place in Vegas! The food here is delicious! Way better than L&L or Aloha Kitchen in my opinion. It also deserves extra stars for the amount of food you get! If you enjoy Hawaiian style plate lunches and have a good appetite, this is definitely the place to go. Two words: FURIKAKE CHICKEN. It's definitely a must try!

J7Mo6c6pJGUK41C-UmwKsw.text: If your HUN-GARY then you've come to the right spot. Their portions are HUGE, so HUGE no can eat anymore. You have to try this place on one empty stomach, otherwise you in trouble. The GUAVA CAKE is to die for, you cannot eat here without at least having this cake. Mahalo to the staff, always showing what TRUE ALOHA really means.

eLTkYfYkVaLqgMpP-Uiavg.text: Nice servers, but too slow. This aint hawaii. It shouldnt take 10 minutes get my water. Everything is salty and huge. I think this restaurant is more of a big island style than oahu style. I give them 3 stars not because of their service but because if the taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry chicken katsu and loco.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saltier half steak strip and half frikake chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salty salty frikake and frozen tuna

QnM8AylZaC_XJ4yf-t6ozQ.text: Food was exceptional for the price!  Staff was absolutely superb!!! Desert was good.....tad chilly so make sure you bring a light jacket when dining in.  Atmosphere reminds you of a cafeteria setting.  Overall a must go to if in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chantilly Cake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava Cake.....wooowwww!!!!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs and fried rice....sooo good!

-nyXtm8KneiylzJTeFDLrQ.text: I experienced the worst service I've ever had out of all my years of dining out. Unbelievable. The food was alright, but that won't save it. I've never been to a place where i've felt outright ignored. It was that bad.  Is there no standard knowledge of basic service and etiquette here? Everyone working here seemed so careless and oblivious. No sense of urgency or organization. My friends and I entered and were not looked at, checked on, acknowledged, greeted, accommodated, nothing. I didn't know if I should've sat myself down or just wait and give them a chance (shouldn't have). Nope, just left to stand there like unwelcome guests as some lady at the cash register took care of some payment and then WALKED AWAY without acknowledging our presence. Hey guys, you do know customers enter through your front door, right?  After eating (which seemed like an eternity to get to that point), I raised my hand at least 5 times to ask question about the check, even speaking out to get someone's, anyone's attention. None of the employees looked my way. At this point I was beginning to question if these people were normal. A waitress briefly saw me with my hand RAISED and everything, but then she immediately changed direction and focused her attention elsewhere, striking up a conversation with a table of people she seemingly knew. Are you kidding me?? Fed up by now, I finally had to GET UP from my table to get this stupid little simple ordeal done and to finally pay.  Ditch this place.

3-mZGG5ltIRanSVXfhGFcw.text: When it comes to island flavor, they sure have it.  This restaurant is small, quaint, and fast.  Frank and I stopped by here on our way to check out our new home nearby, and when we walked in it felt as if we were back on Guam at some mom and pop restaurant.  The staff is friendly and helped a lot when it came to choosing lunch.  I grabbed their ribeye steak with white rice.  It comes smothered in grilled onions and mushrooms, just how we make it back home.  It was delicious, but I have to say that they have this adobo-like chicken dish that Frank ate, and the sauce was CRAZY GOOD.  I poured it over my steak and rice after tasting it!  Love the food, love the people, and I will stick with the local fare rather than their American choices, because they do their food the best.  '  Oh, and save room for dessert.  Their haupia cake is HUGE and can feed four people, or two hungry islanders like Frank and I.  Stop by, say hello, and chow down at island flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haupia cake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

uNtqdtmmECINEapQLOFb1g.text: The staff is super friendly, service is fast, and food is delicious! My husband is from Oahu and he says that it's the best Hawaiian food in town. I usually get the chicken Katsu and it's always crispy and juicy, my husband gets a variety of things but he orders the furikake chicken and the chopped steak often. We recommend it but I would call to see if there is a wait time because we have tried going twice and it was super packed.

MJrG7wfaIPCqholTMCY9Qg.text: Been wanting to try this place for awhile now. I pass by it every time I come to Vegas to see some family. Finally had an opportunity to go and this place is LEGIT!!! There was about 6 of us that went and everyone had something different which turned out to benefit me since I got to go all "vulture mode" on everything. I will make this a staple on my subsequent return visits. Sunday's are weird hours but if you want an epic meal you'll figure something out.

zYZbjp6YAtZnYv_qCcZWnA.text: So I've been coming here off and on since they opened and I love it every time, just found out they are open on Monday(they used to be closed) so that makes MY weekend even better.  The portions are always big and delicious and they make you feel like you are back in the islands as soon as you walk thru the door, with their local accents, genuine smiles and the local music isn't bad as well.  Definitely coming back more now that it's open Mondays.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Also known as POG to the locals

2aUqomjKS9wP-aZdp-PdKA.text: Went in on a Thursday evening---it was packed!  Wait time for a table was 20 minutes so we decided to order for take out.  35 minutes later...which was 10 minutes longer than the given wait time, we were on our way home with a couple of food items.   We ordered the loco moco.  Reminded us of large portions we'd order in Hawaii.  Great flavor. Would order this again.  Also got the Korean chicken.  After finishing all the wings, I was craving more!  Really good!    Mac salad was on the weaker side--needed some more flavor but I still finished it anyway.  Took a piece of guava cake home too--delish!

ihSBMeCsThiwmRD28_DIDw.text: This was one of my first times trying Hawaiian style BBQ and I was not disappointed. Dining room was nice and clean. Service was great. Staff was very attentive. I ordered the Hawaiian style roast pork and Kalbi short ribs. Amazing and tender. Melt in your mouth. I got three huge short ribs plus a huge bowl of roast pork. My boyfriend got the furikake chicken and teriyaki beef. The furikake chicken was the best. Nice and crisp. Great flavor. For sides you get white rice or fried rice and macaroni salad. Fried rice was good. White rice and Mac salad was ok.  Prices are cheap for the large amount of food you get. We took most home and had the rest at dinner. I did have Hawaiian style BBQ at another place near the airport but I couldn't finish it, not even in their league. Island flavor is definitely a front runner. Must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam musubi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi short ribs and Hawaiian style pulled pork.

UG-vq935uU3bzQ6wBoop0Q.text: A large group of us dined here to celebrate a friend's birthday. I had heard tons of good things and couldn't wait to get my plate of food. Since we were such a large group it took a bit to come out, but the wait was well worth it! The portion sizes were ridiculously huge, so I had enough for both lunch and dinner!  I got a combination plate with the Hawaiian roasted pork and the Teriyaki beef. The roasted pork is something dreams are made of! It is almost like turkey, but slices of fork tender pork covered in the most delicious brown gravy. This was the highlight of my meal and the white rice just balanced out each bite. The teriyaki beef was also good, a little chewy, but I loved the sauce. I also tried the Chicken Katsu covered in the Korean chicken sauce. It was crispy and delicious! I wasn't a fan of their mac salad, although I tried it a couple of times just to be sure.    Now, Island Flavor really excels at dessert! They get their cakes from the bakery next door and they are seriously out of this world. The Chantilly cake is beyond amazing! Run, seriously run now and get a piece. It is the most moist and delicious chocolate cake. I also enjoyed a piece of the guava cake today! It has the best whipped cream frosting which makes each bite so delicate. This is definitely the pinnacle of Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, you won't be disappointed!

JRlhfgSJdEElKr3MrvIEtA.text: I ordered their ahi poke with sesame oil, and they handed me a mountain of deliciousness.  It's not a coincidence they call it "BIG Island Style."  Humungous!  The quality of the ahi was cold, fresh, and smothered in flavorful sesame Shoyu, scallions, and onions.  I wanted to try their chantilly cake but there was none avail at the time, so we ordered their signature Kona Coffee Mud Pie.  WARNING: This is at least a 2 person portion.  The pie is made up of homemade fragrant Kona Coffee ice cream on top of a Oreo cookie crust.  It comes with a side of whip cream, and topped off with crunchy peanuts, chocolate & raspberry sauce.  You really have to try this place out to see the size yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Poke w/ Sesame Oil
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona Coffee Mud Pie

OPWvPSmq_eAgYmudXRM29A.text: I'm giving Island Flavor a 3 star review because when I went there (only been once) it was a Friday at around 7:30 pm and the place was FREEZING. There was a wait and there is no where for a waiting party to sit, so we had to go outside abs stand or sit in the car.   The decor.....well there's no decor or even an attempt at one. It's a small restaurant in a strip mall and it shows for it.   Food was good, the Chicken Katsu a bit flavorless but still good. The Portuguese Bean Soup tasted more like Pork and Beans from a can, it was just ok.   Eating in freezing temperatures is not fun and the servers weren't the friendliest.   It's ok for a quick or "I'm driving by it" bite.

-YWUm1TJalF8wdKT5bmZnA.text: I'd thought I would suffer from plate lunch withdrawals when I moved to LV. Island Flavor hits da spot! Proper local style food from Big-Island-transferred-folks.  All the other "local Hawaiian food" themed food taste like crappy L&L. Yeah there is a clear difference between non Hawaii raised people trying to make Hawaii style plate lunch food.

nQ7AstCSWkOsis_w96ogGA.text: Had the roast pork and chix katsu mix. Big portions . Roast pork was tender gravy alright , good but just a basic brown gravy. Chix katsu crispy , like it should be. Mac salad good. Also had the chantiily cake for dessert , I  don't think they make it in house , but it was still good . Over all very good, we will b back

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork/ chix katsu mix plate

cb3XXV8MAfcD1W7UDwKkww.text: Korean/Hawaiian restaurant. Everything was ono. Kalua pig w/ cabbage too salty though. Spam musubi was great. Good value.

sGDAV0eAkalHPUZT4_p1qQ.text: I came into this place thinking typical Hawaiian place. Boy was I wrong! The food was awesome! And it came in huge portions! my leftovers lasted for days! I recommend this place for anybody who just love to eat great Hawaiian food. And a lot.

MaXw6sqndNwFKGNESX1VKA.text: Island Flavor Island Style!  Exactly what everyone says... HUGE portions of food like home for a good price!  LOVE IT!

FRDEjGE0b6duv3tVagmd-w.text: Aloha Friday laulau plate with the butterfish was a real winnah. Customer service was down right island style.

zI5gREKNQ7k4sDvx9_sDog.text: This place is so much better than L&L and Ohana.  I live next to a Ohana hawaiian bbq but I would rather trave 15 min away to get my kalbi ribs here... People from Maui this place is now serving guri guri!!  It doesn't taste like the Tasaka guri guri but it hits the spot and takes me back home..

Gq7xgOb1Db802NDMlZjrEg.text: I'm just going to agree with the rest of the bunch. All good. Too bad it is far from where I live... I would eat more often here otherwise :)  I got a combo - chopped steak with onions and furikake shrimp. Steak was tender, onions tasted good and shrimp was crunchy on outside and tender inside. Portion was more than generous so I almost fell into 'food coma' afterward :)

NZm9ZH4nieMDkuFH-QQZDw.text: Best Hawaiian food I have ever had in Las Vegas! Best Poke in Las Vegas. More food than you can eat in one sitting.

Ai1FDBbb04Wb7fWtVyMlzg.text: Best Hawaiian food on the Mainland that I've had.  Came in on a Friday and had one of their specials:  Pork LauLau, Ahi Poke, Rice, Macaroni salad, Haupia..  Generous servings all around, that includes the Poke that came with it!  I was able to split the plate with my husband and both of us walked out full.  Everyone is greeted with a smile and warm hospitality.

Lx98-YNV3z9SpyjfUubZ4A.text: Love the macaroni salad, ahi app, Korean wings, chicken teriyaki oh and the hamburger steak, basically we love everything

Q9Hs8pQqmNhHrjVcyIPj9A.text: There are not many restaurants by my house, so I was pleasantly surprised when I came across Island Flavor! Some of my favorite dishes include their poke and chicken katsu. I especially love that the portions are huge - great for leftovers! This is the perfect restaurant to order to-go and enjoy a some authentic Hawaiian flavors.

dfqNJYGz_ZRnhaW8VZX_tg.text: Ate here during a recent stay in Sin City.  Heard about it through a co-worker and am glad I made the trek out to this place.  Oxtail soup was really tasty.  Loco Moco was a handmade/seasoned patty and portions size was exceptional.  But the Haiwaiian style roasted pork with gravy that a co-worker got was EXCELLENT.  So much that I regretted getting the Loco Moco which was very good in itself.  It does get busy so arrive early or late if you don't want to wait.  It's location is a bit of a drive off the strip but worth it.  As good as it gets for Island food.  5 Stars!!

nPjYhPqnc04ogANx3iafSw.text: It's a local joint with tasty food, huge portions and good service- no dirty looks, no attitude, and I'm not even Hawaiian to be deserving of their consistently good customer service.  The furikake chicken and roast pork loco are excellent.  Chantilly cake is to die for.  Rule of thumb: pace yourself.  Otherwise, you won't have room for dessert that is so worth having.

DLKMLHAt8F0wLc5VC2kp9g.text: The best Ive had in a long time! They treated us like family and the food was wonderful. Finally a place w/ island style portions and recipes! I will be using the service I just received as a model for the restaurant I manage. Thanks Island Flavor

6jMAVqRSE_MCKGhLh9WShQ.text: I really do enjoy this place! I love the Kalbi and the Shrimp! Their Kaluha mudslide pie is amazing!!! Their service is a little slow, and the waitresses are nice but you could tell they are tired and just doing their jobs. When we first started going there they had live music on the weekends and the last few times I have gone they didn't have it & I miss that.

r7c0Q7AAXNlKZ_aqHYpVjQ.text: I'll start and end on a good note. The price is low.  After reading the high praise this place (just down the street from me) got, I was excited to try it out. I ordered the Mixed Plate with Kalbi and Chicken Katsu. One thing many people have said about this place is the large serving size. I figured, by ordering the mix plate (choice of two items), I would definitely be able to bare witness to the large portions. I was mistaken. They made it look heaping, but it was an illusion. All in all, there were 5 short ribs, and 7 small strips of chicken.  It didn't get any better with taste. Okay, the Kalbi was okay, but I have, without a doubt, had better. My wife and in-laws are Korean. It's hard to beat authentic Korean Kalbi. So, I'm willing to let the Island Flavor slide on that. I can't, however, give any slack on the chicken. There was more breading than chicken, and it didn't have ANY flavor, let alone Island flavor. I'm guessing this is why they give you the small little cup of dipping sauce. After taking a bite into the unnaturally crispy strip, you can vaguely see a sliver of chicken.  The fries are good. But I don't visit restaurants just for their fries, except maybe Gordon Biersch.

YwANRHq2sx8c1Bn-Qm3GRA.text: I had their combo. Kalbi + chicken katsu.  The kalbi was little bit salty, and the katsu sauce was salty too. Their service was really good.  HOWEVER, a HUUUUUUGE HOWEVER, their food was really good none the less.  First of all, you're eating the food with rice and their amazingly delicious macaroni salad, so that kind of evens out.  Their  signage is pretty small, and it can be easily missed, as I missed it, and had to bust a U at the Chevron gas station. It's located right next to the gas station mall strip.  Next time I'm in vegas, I want to come back.

oqfBRwjlhYO06ff_-gVhXQ.text: Restaurant has a lot of great local options. Love the kalbi, furikake chx, Portuguese bean soup and desserts.

ANyVIzjEdx2cSk0P565z0Q.text: The food was great, the loco moco was very filling and the gravy was tasty and complimented the dish well, thick burger patty! Once you walk into this restaurant, you immediately get a good vibe feeling that the food is going to be good. The drive from the airport or downtown may seem long, but It's located just before it seems like its off the beaten path...bring your gps

1StJiFj_QWL5zYQgRBhQZw.text: I've never been to Hawaii but I'm happy to eat the food! Came in a couple of times since new ownership took over, and found that this location positively compares to experiences at the Eastern location. Interior has been upgraded, staff have been friendly and attentive, and several new dishes have hit the menu.  Their plate lunch dishes are the focus, and the furikake chicken and shrimp are go-to orders for me. Took a friend, who really liked the teriyaki chicken. All proteins were juicy and not overly sauced, and amply portioned for leftovers. Got to try the new Avocado Fries app and was really impressed at how it maintained texture. Always go with an appetite and/or group, because their desserts can't be missed- the Kona Coffee Mudcake is my favorite, they also offer haupia and guava, all slices are $5 and the size of your head, easily.   Some of the only things I haven't tried yet here are the poke and daily specials- but it's only a matter of time with dishes like kimchi fried rice. Both locations are a bit of a drive for me but this is the one that I prefer, looking forward to returning for the Poke Bombs and spam musubi.  TIP: Order your takeout ahead of time with GrubHub via the Yelp app. Not all dishes are listed (MP items excluded), but all the favorites are there!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona mud pie
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava cake

AjVTTwHuVif1fdmCv0DrbA.text: Pro's: - lau lau, fruit punch, haupia & sesame dressing was delishhhhh - Restroom was clean/tidy - Restroom tile decor was nice (don't know why I noticed that, but I really liked it? Lol) - Updated decor in the dining areas  Cons: - Kalua pig had a sweet taste to it (sooo not the flavor of how Kalua pig is supposed to taste)  - only 1 server for the entire floor on a Friday at lunchtime - Service was slow - Missing items on one of our "Friday" specials (lomi lomi salmon & haupia) - Our salad was forgotten then brought out after everyone in our party got their order - When we got the check we had to wait a while for the server to come and collect the payment, and when she finally did she mentioned that she forgot to add our drinks to our tab.  Not our fault she forgot, but then we had to wait again for her to fix that and bring back another tab.  Too long, she should have just let that go since SHE forgot it, not us.  **Stars for: Lau lau, haupia, sesame dressing & fruit punch that was good and nice looking renovation & cleanliness of the restroom.   The wahines who worked here before under the other owner were so friendly & always had the Aloha Spirit - we used to feel like we were back in Hawaii after dining here.  Not today though - no ALOHA  like it was before

-ICHNeW0je7TLY06RUI19w.text: This a very late review. I would choose negative stars for the island flavor restaurant with Haole owners. The vibe in this establishment doesn't feel so good. The regular staff are there & the quality of the food sucks, Mac salad was spoiled & portions are not the same. I soooo miss unko & Aunty, the True & original Island Flavor. I truly do not know how this restaurant stayed open with the New Haole owners, in opinion they have no business owning a Hawaiian based restaurant. I will not be a returning customer.

o4Fo155HMltq5VYxyZDxTQ.text: Off the hook delicious. Order to go and had the Loco and it lasted me two days, so much food. The Chantilly cake was amazing and they have Hawaiian Sun Lilokoi which is always my favorite drink. My daughter ordered Da Fluffy and she devoured it.  Can't wait to go back

deWLUG41z4pxHKI4D1kVCw.text: I love this place! If you want authentic and delicious island food, this is the place to go. Much better than L&L to say the least. Note that this place gets pretty busy, so expect to wait 10-15mins on weekends and during dinner time, but the wait is worth it. The food here is flavorful and the portions are pretty large. Everytime I come here, I need to ask for a to go box since I can never finish all my food. So if you want to try a little bit of everything, consider sharing with your friends to explore the different entrees here. My favorite go to meal is the chicken katsu with brown  gravy. Make sure you come here hungry! Also, protip get 10% off your order when you leave a Yelp review. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu and hoisin BBQ ribs. Super yummy!

UbliS29cHyhQDjwKMu6aEQ.text: Me and my daughter had dinner there. The food is very good. And the service was great. I have eaten here twice. Both times have be good. Would recommend this place for breakfast,lunch and dinner.

x1HEFzAROLWJY-QVtUHWHw.text: Service definitely improved. Lately I haven't seen that server that like to avoid us, and their staff is better. The lady who served us was very nice, but was very spacey. It's okay though she handled the whole half of the restaurant while it was busy.  Food-wise: can't go wrong for poke as a starter, always good. For the main plate we got the mixed plate with the steak, onions, tomato with the pork roast. Their food is always delicious.

uW4RoGvO6y5KfjwwQS-KMg.text: This review is for last nights experience. Most of my visits to Island Flavor is 4-star. But last night, what you did was shady.   Yesterday, my niece and nephew drove to Las Vegas from SoCal. Because of the Friday traffic and two accidents, they were running 2-hours late. Whenever they come to Vegas, the routine is to have Friday  dinner at Island Flavor for the Lau Lau plate. Because they were running late, they called in their order from Primm as they would make it to the restaurant at about 8:45 pm, 15-minutes before closing.   My nephew-in-law ordered a mix plate of furikaki chicken and Korean chicken while my niece got furikaki shrimp. Both plates they upgraded to fried rice. When they got to the restaurant, the male cashier did show them the plates and opened it up as they got a yuck glance. However, when they got to my house, tired from working, sitting in traffic and a longer than usual drive, I was disappointed to see my hungry niece's disappointment when she said, "really, that's all I get!? Four shrimps!!??" She dug under the over amount of fried rice to see if there were more underneath and there wasn't. I looked on yelp to see how much shrimp is in a regular plate and there's usually 8!!!  My niece shook her head and she said,"I knew there was something up with that guy. That's so shady! If they ran out of shrimp, just call us and let me know or to make up for the missing four shrimp, add chicken and tell me. I would've been okay with that." Needless to say, she was done eating all the shrimp in a matter of seconds because she was hungry. She ate only a fourth of the fried rice.   Please know Island Flavor that my family and friends from out of town frequent your restaurant and make it a regular to visit your establishment. Be honest with your customers. A lot of the foodie picks on this page is from me and my family. Please don't do this to anyone again. There's too many Hawaiian restaurants to go to in Vegas for us to frequent and you know with the coconut-wireless, bad news spreads real fast. I'm embarrassed by this action to late night patrons   #noaloha

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice omelet comes with Portuguese sausage. Good anytime of the day.

zpW-aWw88IHWVK_iFtLAQg.text: This place used to be bomb but since the new owners everything changed it's like they don't care about the flavor of the foods just the presentation! It's really sad being from Hawaii and people ruin Hawaiian food. The only decent thing still is the furikake chicken. Please do better it's not that hard to flavor the food. I sent back the poke sampler because the fish was sitting on a whole deep fried avocado so the poke was hot and nasty there was more avacado than poke smh hopefully the bad reviews help the new owners.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Usually I eat my whole plate but not anymore it&#39;s so bad and tasteless now even the Mac salad isn&#39;t the same smh

G370Cpl0XtRR9nB85IZeyg.text: I used to like this place. My previous review was actually for the times I used to come here.  Since its under new management the service saddens me. The food took a long time to come.   When we received our food it was cold and the lady (manager?assistant?) insists that its not when were the one eating it! There's 5 of us eating and 4 of us our food was cold. Maybe ill come back here to order to go next time but not dine in!  She also said it take 30mins for the food to be ready. Uhhh yeah if you guys are actually busy! It took ours about 40mins to get ours!   The steak we got was overcooked!!(which I will be uploading a picture) overcooked & cold.   They keep getting good reviews for the sake of 10% off discount which Im sure Yelp wouldn't allow.

1eE-AKWGtcCNOqechxzmfw.text: Authentic Island Flavors and good!  Don't bother with the competition this is the SPOT!  This establishment fosters the Aloha spirit!  Come sit, stay, enjoy the flavors and the experience.  You will not be disappointed with food quality FRESH, quantity COME HUNGRY, and atmosphere RELAXED & CLEAN.  Friendly staff .... let's face it, we love to eat!  Get yourself here and enjoy!  For those poor reviewers, there's always people that need to squawk about things.  Coming into a popular place due to excellent food and finding it busy, I can't even LOL, newer staff needing some training LOL, yeah well... I say enjoy the food and be happy!  Remember LV is the 9th island after all.  Mahalo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beyond gracious service
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ono sweets

nISMs8WM5W_KwtzONpPRwg.text: Haven't been to this place since they remodelled it 5 months ago but man, what a difference; it's like night and day! The restaurant looks like it underwent an episode of hells kitchen: everything is new, modern, and more spacious! The look is just simply amazing!  Let's talk about the food. I had a hard time deciding what I wanted because there was so many things to choose from! Chicken katsu to kbbq beef, heck I wanted it all so I got the Monstah plate which entailed 3 proteins and sides. I opted for the chicken furukake, teriyaki beef, and the kbbq short ribs! If I had to rank it: furukake chicken over  kbbq short ribs over teriyaki beef. All were delicious to say the least and pairing them with rice and mac salad... a must!  If you want to try island style food with great customer service and a modern ambiance, definitely check out this spot to hit up!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monstah plate on deck!

gbwoMmzhe2yIV4Gm6NjAZA.text: I've been wanting to try this place out for a long time and I finally got to yesterday after getting a haircut. We tried out one of their specials, the furikake chicken and we also tried their oxtail soup. The furikake chicken is BOMB! They give you a hefty serving. This was enough to feed two people honestly! The chicken was flavorful and crispy. It paired well with the rice and their specialty Hawaiian hot sauces. My personal favorite was the red one. The oxtail soup was pretty bland. I love the oxtail soup at California hotel and the ones they had at the Orleans. They're always full of flavor, this one, not so much. They give you a fairly large serving and plenty of oxtail pieces to munch on. Other than the bland flavor of the broth, everything else about it was good. The oxtail pieces were tender and delicious. Only docking one star for that. Service was great!   I recommend the furikake chicken. I will definitely be back to try their poke!

6f781NG2xktsQcZ2oFME-g.text: I used to live in Vegas and discovered this little gem when I lived there.  I would drive from Summerlin to get Chicken katsu and even took my friend who is native Hawaiian.  My husband and I now plan our Vegas trips from Southern California to always include a meal st Island Flavor.  They have expanded and redecorated, and it is beautiful!  The food is amazing and the portions are huge.  Definitely the most authentic Hawaiian food I've had on the mainland.  Our last trip to Vegas was inspired by wanting to eat at Island FlavorZ. We often order to go to bring back home to Southern California.  Really you have to eat here.  You won't regret it!

tPwbMea6dfS_S6Gz4zCpQw.text: I feel like it could have been better.  The food tastes like they really care about what they make, but every bite of every dish tasted like it wsa missing something.   Our server and all the staff we encountered were really nice. They checked up on us regularly to make sure everything was going well or if we needed anything. Things started to go downhill when my dish wasn't ordered or was delivered to another table. We figured since (1) my husband got his entree before mine and (2) the server appologized and went back to the kitchen and told them he needed the dish expedited.   I ordered Friday's Daily Special. You can choose between Lau Lau or Kalua Pig with Lomi Salmon and Haupia. I chose the Kalua Pig. The flaor was not entirely distributed throughout the pork. I could taste that they marinated it with a sweet sauce but the rest of the pork was super bland and the cabbage was too undercooked for my liking. It would have been bomb if they sauted it a bit and added Hawaiian Salt or Shoyu when cooking the pork with the cabbage to give it some more flavor in every bite. The Lomi... literally, it had barely ANY salmon and it was mainly just tomatoes. The flavor was great but it really needed more salmon! The ratio of how I'm used to Lomi Salmon to tomatoes is like 2:1. The Haupia was the final straw. I took a bite and was shocked at how thick and super pudding like it was. If you ever had the Filipino dessert Maja Blanca. That was its consistency. I'm either very picky because I love the NOH Instant Haupia mix and how it's a bit thin, like jell-o. I really was not happy when we left.   My husband had the Tinono Pork Belly, and he wasn't too happy about his dish either. I tried it and it was super bland also.   I think the only thing I really liked was their Mac Salad. The flavor is perfect!  Would I come back? I would come back here if they changed up their recepies.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tinono Pork Belly
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friday Daily Special: Kalua pig with cabbage, Lomi and haupia.

FK_ascQAvjhc93zoe9f2wA.text: Food was good as usual.  The waitress this time was awesome. She is from the islands and knew the menu well. Very happy with overall experience this time!! Shazette was awesome!

FNFrdyKrlxURr_9jKuk3MA.text: Needing some Island Flavor? This place is my favorite Hawaiian restaurant in the valley so far and I love that it is minutes from where I live. Island Flavor is a nice sit down restaurant, unlike most Hawaiian restaurants in town that are counter service. The hostesses and servers are also friendly whether you do a to-go order or sit down for a meal.  I have actually done both to-go and sit down meals here. As for a to-go, it might be better to call ahead. If not, you may wait a bit because everything is cooked at that time which really is a good thing because you know that your take-away is freshly cooked.   As for the Good Stuff aka The Food, there are so many delicious choices. I personally like the Spam Misubi and the Kalbi. If you like ground beef patties with gravy, they do an awesome one here. The brown gravy is pretty bomb and loaded with onions! Sometimes I have gone with double vegetables for my sides if I didn't want a lot of carbs and they are happy to do that.  So many delicious choices! Like I said, I am glad to have found such a great Island restaurant in my hood! Mahalo!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check in a spam can
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam misubi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 items

Qp3D4SLqLNpjyzstRoxs-g.text: We come here every time we visit Vegas, food is always great and so with the customer service.  Kehau is sweet and we will always come back!  Thank you for always making us feel like we are home!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken, roast pork, furikake chicken, fried porkDelicious!!!

2_PK7A9DDUOyrLMvpgycbA.text: Our 2nd time to our Favorite Vegas spot!  We had Avocado Fries: Get this! Get this! Get this! (drooling again) haha! Avocado with bread crumbs on the its side and then fried. Served with yummy dressing and cabbage  We had Mixed plate of Chicken Karage & Korean chicken: we've been thinking about their chicken karage since we had it first last July!  California has a lot of Hawaiian Restau but they always have the same taste (grilled asian style flavor) but this one is a gem!!!  They even expanded to accommodate more people!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They already extended the place!

bfCGd5jGd7zfiG2vx0by1g.text: I've been coming here since even before the remodel and I never had problems before. Got here with a friend right before the dinner rush and was sat in an empty section. Section starts to fill up with people. An hour passes. 2 groups that got here after us gets their food before we do. My food comes out, but my friend's doesn't. His food comes out a few mins later. He orders the poke, I order the furikake shrimp. Food is good, but the wait is so out of character for this place. I'll be back, regardless.

ZRf892FQ0WVen4syZFVcLg.text: I had my brother pickup dinner to take a break from cooking after work. I ordered a roast pork and hamburger steak mix plate. Sadly they forgot the onions and mushrooms which is like forgetting the egg on a loco moco.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They forgot the onion and mushrooms on my hamburger steak

TQDvhQMhclF3cZw-PjEQ2Q.text: The place to go if you're craving for gut busting, food coma inducing Hawaiian food in the area. They have all the usual items like chicken katsu, teriyaki beef, short ribs, and kalua pig -- but check out their daily specials. Another favorite is their furikake chicken which are boneless bite sized pieces of deep fried chicken tossed in their sweet furikake glaze. I usually get that with a side of mac salad.

STSER0h7hiYkXTp16OuR8g.text: Food is great, staff is friendly  Better than the chain Hawaiian restaurants  Furikake chicken and poke are awesome

GZoWEQ39pEL8qXAevrjpxg.text: The food was phenomenal, well, the food we actually received.  Only 2 out of the 3 of us received our meal. It was a 45 minute wait for the Benedict and it NEVER made it to the table. I was served 1st and advised to start eating without my party. The 2nd one of us received her plate and the French Toast was sooooo good .... but why did we not get our 3rd plate??!!! It was heartbreaking,  how can this food so good come with a wait time/ non-arrival time like this? I was a little upset that nothing was done to rectify the situation.  No discount,  no offer of a meal later ... I may return in the distant future,  but even with the delicious food this left a bad tase in my mouth. Great food, great service person but so confused about the the situation....

NHPLYY7r14JI-qjZeq7W7w.text: The dining room is clean, the service is great, the food is bomb. The prices are a bit steep, but the good food makes it worth it, will definitely be back with friends

nRqTbQ_e7D0oincUIR4Xvw.text: Found this place through Instagram and I must say it was fantastic. I recently got back from Hawaii (Oahu and Kauai) and had the opportunity to try lots of mixed plates there. Island Flavor certainly has the "island flavor" in its food. Really delicious mac salad and a good value for the price.

jinHwbt1mBoYI_g_GvJsRg.text: My rating: 4.5! Big servings! Authentic Hawaiian flavor! The Oxtail Soup is legit. A five star rating is pending trying other menu items. But so far, so good!

HhMmwJp-ZeOxbr1RvmlIvA.text: Excellent service and great food will definitely come back next time in Vegas.   We had some take out from here served last year. Our relatives were at a timeshare nearby. It was do good. We decided to come in and eat this visit to Vegas area. Great Hawaiian music and atmosphere.

kjZTAfRoP0rFYlANHbR4iA.text: Ordered poke here before and it was amazing. I ordered 2 mixed plates to go this time around to try their barbecue and took a few bites on each plates and noticed the beef on chopped steak is rare, furikake chicken is coated with blood because of the rare steak, and kalbi was rare to medium rare. I have never received rare meats from any Hawaiian spots in Vegas and this would be my first. I am very disappointed with the quality of the food and unhappy with the money I spent in this restaurant.

What's a Hawaiian plate without the mac salad at any of the other similar establishments?? Thanks for the notice!! Idk why I left a tip for takeout    Each time I come back, I become more and more disappointed.
