43TO1rR6Fh1qijbQyMFzTA.text: I love coming here, especially on a night with live music. Their beef stew tastes just like the way my grandmother would make it. Miss Hawaii? Come to Island Flavor!

r_eYUlGZeEeKdP0wiN-fdw.text: This is an updated review from last time. I finally visited this place after new ownership. The negative reviews don't lie. The food tasted different but the portions are still there. The Mac salad was good. My complaint ain't about the food though. I was there tonight around 6:30pm. The owner Allie introduced herself to all tables on the left side of the room but our table. She then proceeded to one table on the right side of the room to greet people from California. Skipped our table like we were invisible. Why, cause I'm brown? Or because we locals from Hawaii so you don't need to introduce yourself and be fake to ask us to come back. 1 star only for our waitress from Hawaii, Shazette who was attentive and showed her Aloha. No worry strawberry cause Zippy's coming soon to the Southwest! Take lessons from them.

OTN6hJOt0rV9ji2R2umUlA.text: The food is absolutely delicious and enjoy each meal every time I go. Very affordable for the portion sizes and the restaurant was welcoming and clean. Definitely a recommended place for any meal time

NK_SwI3rKeQNl99dG8ywXQ.text: Total family oriented place!!! Aunty (the waitress) gave my son a kiss when we were seated! Food was great, portion for the price was great!!! Good selection of all the local flavors, U can't chose what to order!! Definitely felt back on the island with the yummy taste from back home!!!

1x-BIUzOHKXruLLpCPvqFQ.text: I ordered the mix plate with Furikake shrimp and teriyaki steak. Steak was really tender and flavorful. Service was awesome. Highly recommended and definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake shrimp and teriyaki steak.

g6DHUwoufDrQDduFcUjq2g.text: Decided to go to Island Flavor for lunch after spending the morning in church.  I feel the need to speak out on how horrible the service was.  First of all we waited a ridiculous amount of time just to get seated.  Once seated our server Tyler was not very welcoming or attentive to our needs.  We waited about an hour for our food.  No apologies for the wait nor did he keep us updated on why we had to wait so long.  A table next to us got up and walked out due to his attitude.  All in all the food is good but the service was unheard of.  Tyler is so opposite of what a good server should be.  Please do yourself a favor and hire good people to represent your restaurant with "ALOHA". Will definitely rethink about returning

AHnF9crAHPn3sUEPY94zWg.text: The vibe is awesome! Live local Hawaiian music! Attentive staff.  We ate here on a Friday night around 6pm and luckily there was no wait.   We ordered the Hawaiian Plate (Friday special - Lau Lau or Kalua Pig, rice, lomi salmon, and haupia $11). And the Furikake chicken ($9).   The lau lau didn't have any flavor. Some salt fixed that problem.The mac salad wasn't that good. The macaroni seemed to be a bit more on the aldente side rather than the softer side. The Furikake chicken was Good! Very tasty. It's fried and then tossed in their special glaze sauce.   I wouldn't cross this place off my list just yet. I wanna go back and give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Plate - Lau Lau, rice, mac salad, lomi salmon and haupia. Friday Special

QPtS5lnFXRjObrqyah5EIw.text: Our favorite Hawaiian must go to spot when we come to Vegas! The oxtail soup is perfect even on a hot day. The meat is so tender and portion is big for a great price. We also like getting the mixed plate with kalbi short ribs and chicken katsu! A must try in Vegas!

8B3wGKHOym6Y-88iJAeBzg.text: First and foremost I enjoy the music playing over head, it has a big island melody, a True feel of Island Flavor!  On the plates: oxtail soup, furakaki chicken, kalbi short ribs with a side of bomb ass macaroni. Dessert called for freshly baked banana bread pudding.  This maybe my first check in however I am far from being a nube! As a regular I highly recommend the oxtail soup every visit! Hats off to the chef! The meat is always tender and the soup is a burst of ginger and beef broth flavor. The other must have dish is the spicy, avocado ahi poke. Somehow I feel compelled to say it makes a statement! I've tried the poke around town and nothing compares. It has the right amount of piscine taste and the avocado gives it the right creamy freshness. The furakaki chicken is a burst of flavor at your first crunchy bite and as you get to the chicken; it is tender and moist. The kalbi ribs are a tasty cocktail of salty, spicy and uuuumaaami!!!   Last but not to say the least, dessert!!! This is my first time ordering the banana bread pudding; it was fresh out of the oven, topped with cinnamon cream pudding. I love how moist the bread was and the banana was not over powering. What a late night delight.   I never dread the bill because the serving size is plentiful and the service is above par.   I always leave with my belly full and an upside down frown.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy avocado ahi poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread pudding

rIf39CbpK7UTEKhPEoFzvg.text: Wait time was 1 hour and staff wasn't making effort to put any tables together. Don't tell me wait is half an hour when it's not. They just let people seat who just came in. Food took a  while to be serve. They even gave the orders to the other table. The waitress Edna made it bearable. Don't tell me wait

bJVNwH8VcaxxxK7u0ITUvg.text: This is probably my new favorite place in town. Great atmosphere with mouth watering dishes! Great service makes it even better!

6fkoLC1Ufq0wg-QztAbGkQ.text: This is where I git my shoyu poke on!! My only concern is, no ogo da poke...but that's ok, I usually have a stash so I add, let rest then eat. My Hawaii taste is simple yet flavorful, don't  care for most poke bars AND I git a 1 stop shop...poi kulolo, slippah, bread, poke...pau!

RcebxP96sSBQQtJoUxwqRQ.text: Great food and prices! Went with my Hawaiian family to this spot that they've been raving about and it was good!  The prices are very reasonable and you get zone much food. Definitely going back!

I was always checked on if I needed anything. Place has been remolded and is looking really nice. Come try for yourself and see how it is.

ez-HsrOkyXn7_b3HvlaE4A.text: Island Flavor is the Best for your Hawaiian Local food in Vegas!!! Quality & Quantity!!

zQBsns3X2ChhTC2sgRWEpQ.text: Best Musabi in town! We stop by to get snacks all the time!!! Great island atmosphere too!

cYlnwIfO65n2WiHKOrsIvQ.text: The renovations look amazing! And they expanded the restaurant by taking over the store next door (plenty seats now). Haha!!   Friendly staff and the food is amazing to eat "Onolicious" .   But my favorite is listening to the Hawaiian Music takes me back home even if for an hour.   We will definitely be coming back.  ALOHA!

C__mCtrnJoo8qe7nHhEMzQ.text: Food is unreal and the service is on point.  Coming back for sure!!!! The Teri beef has lots of flavor and the poke was excellent. Trying oxtail and pork today.

DX1iwiN6M48eg6RMJUAcuA.text: I've been to Hawaii several times and I've got to honestly & say that this place rivals any place on the islands!  The chicken furikake and kalua pork is outrageous!  My wife and son love the roast pork loco moco!  Keep it up Island Flavors....you guys knock it out of the park!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pbhEC9N78z-977mPP4yhbg.text: Food was like always good and service as well just didn't like the whole yelp ordering system has trouble with it but I will be back soon

B6Mf-GJuF7J1beQV6PRmkw.text: I've never really had Hawaiian food before but I definitely want to have it again after trying this place.   We started off with the ahi poke salad, sesame style. The server recommended it furikake style but since we were getting the furikake chicken, I didn't want to overload on that particular flavor. For a half pound of poke, it was only 7.95 which I thought was such a great deal. The sauce was really good but not too overpowering.   We did the two meat special and got the furikake chicken and the roast pork, both of which were really good. The furikake chicken is crispy and sweet. I was hoping that it would be a little more salty but I still enjoyed it. We also got the macaroni salad as a side and it helped cut the richness of the meats.   We couldn't bear to not get the kalbi. My boyfriend left only the bones. The portion was huge and the meat tender and sweet.

DqE1A7llgK2kRYY-yWy8Sw.text: Being from Hawaii, it would seem redundant for us to eat at place like Island Flavor, but one of our friends, who lives in Phoenix was in the mood for plate lunch, so our Las Vegas connection told  us about this place.  It is easy to find in Durango, not too far from Silverton Casino and Hotel.  The place was busy, but we were seated in about 10 minutes.  I could see from the orders coming out that the portions are huge!  Make sure you go hungry! I ordered the teriyaki beef and Korean chicken mix and the chicken was outstanding!  The teri beef was tender and flavorful.  Others in the group ordered, chicken katsu, kal bi, and teriyaki chicken. Each one that came out was piled on the plate and seemed to please all my friend's palates.  Most of the plates were priced below $10. If your a Las Vegas resident, you could take the leftovers home for lunch the next day.  If your visiting, you might want to share your plate with someone in your party unless you KNOW you can finish it.  If you share, you might have a little room left for dessert, which looked and sounded good, but none of us had any room for it.

R2ezTTbDh8LWhIEjkcd4uA.text: Food is great. A little bit pricier than other places but the portion of food is a lot that three of us couldn't finish.  This restaurant cares about what their customers think. Bruce, the owner of the restaurant responded me five mins after I left the review about the long waiting. So that make me change two stars to four.

JsWSAj7R4rXXu1jJL_86pw.text: Been here a few times they are always busy. I love there chicken katsu here. The service is ok nothing special. I'll definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu salad was bomb
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken

mOjLKeaJHqDsTxbtw9YE3A.text: Best local Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. Mix plate with da kine, Kalbi Shirt Ribs and Furikake Chicken add fried rice. Also they get Fried Rice, Portuguese Sausage, with egg for breakfast. Drink, get POG.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Short Ribs, Furikake Chicken and Fried Rice
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_HTOjw_wL4HuZHNswLPA2g.text: Ate here last night and wow it was so yummy! They were pretty busy but the wait wasn't long at all. The price is good for the heeping plates they serve! Its a very friendly place and if ur looking for good Hawaiian Local Food this is the place!

c6GDPqaVJ_cdcE5e9HVMvA.text: I was skeptical about authentic Hawaiian food in Vegas, but Island Flavor proved to be a spot that locals could satisfy their craving at.  Portions: HUGE. One plate could feed three of us had we known they were going to be so big. Kahlua pork is mild, but super tender. I could've used a bit more salt on the meat, but it was still good. Sweet and sour pork ribs were tasty but almost a little too salty. Furikake chicken was bomb. I added Sriracha and it became super bomb.  My only complaints are regarding the rice. Brown rice - too much water so I basically had two scoops of brown rice mush. Fried rice - now this is where I think Island Flavor failed because their version of fried rice is basically white rice with some lapcherng and veggies doused with soy sauce. I've eaten and seen fried rice made enough to know we weren't eating fried rice. The portion was a potful. No joke.  COCO PUFFS = yum. I have no idea what the buttery yellow stuff is on top of the chocolate cream puff but it's ONO. Mud pie = good. I liked the chocolate cacao or coffee nibs in the kona coffee ice cream. Really nice touch. Could do without the flavored syrups on the plate though.  Staff were friendly even though very busy.  Spam musubi was right on. Reminded me of all the musubis we've eaten in Hawaii.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kahlua pork
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame poke

TyS-KKIJgqa5aLpOiUu7Sg.text: We drove from the North end to the Southwest on this cold and rainy night. Did I mention we had to drive in fog. Big deal, right? Well yeah if your night vision sucks, and you've NEVER had to drive in fog, ever...in your life.  For a Tuesday night and all the rain...I was so surprise to see how full the restaurant was. It was busy. We were quickly greeted by Mark, who then became our waiter for the evening. He was such a delight to have. My son spilled water and he literally did not lose his delightful vibe as he was cleaning it up. I felt so bad. I give Mark 5 stars for his professionalism and welcoming feeling.  Tonight between us all, we had  ordered the furikake poke, kalbi, kalua pig and cabbage, opakapaka misoyaki, chopped steak and onions, and the furikake chicken. When you get the furikake chicken...your eyeball will fall out its sockets because of the portion. I saw that thing from afar and was so shocked. More so, this plate was for my 6 and 2 year old son...and it could easily have fed me as well. Note for next time. I gave it a bite and definitely loved the crispy chicken and the glaze used over it. The furikake was definitely evident.  My husband had the opakapaka (pink snapper) and of course he loved it! The misoyaki sauce used over the fish was light, and had a sweet taste to it...it paired well with the fish. I can't tell you much about the chopped steak my 8 year old had, because he literally devoured it...literally. Since I had ordered the kalbi and kalua pig combo, but really cared for the kalbi...I shared my kalua with the hubby. Kalua pig was legit.  Then there I was, with the kalbi I had tried the first time we visited. The one that I said was missing that island flavor I was looking for. Okay, well...Kalbi came out with a vengeance because tonight's kalbi was exactly the flavor with the char I was looking for the first time around. It did NOT disappoint.   Seeing the place a second time around....I say they have a better menu selection wise than 808MP. They offer fried poke, and I slapped myself for not ordering that tonight, but I came for the kalbi. So you know what that means...I will officially be returning. They serve BIG portions and it is definitely worth it for the price you pay. I can officially up the star it deserves.  Highly recommend if you are craving Hawaiian food.

dg83_Fux7Ss928Fz7EtbbQ.text: Furikake chicken is probably the best here.. 5/5..crunchy, sweet,savory and a lot !  Their portions are so big that sharing is good here.  The teriyaki steak is tender and flavorful as well.  I don't really care for the macaroni sides.. it was just alright.  Dessert: guava cake was very moist and not too much guava flavor, just a hint of it.  I don't like the guava jelly.  3/5

g40cpREznX4xWN_R1kbi1w.text: Items Selected: Half-Pound Furikake Style Poke Spam Musubi  Chicken Katsu and Kalua Pig mixed plate Kalbi Short Ribs and Furikake Shrimp mixed plate Roast Pork Loco Moco Banana Bread Pudding Chantilly Cake Guava Cake Haupia Cake Kona Coffee Ice Cream Mud Pie   No doubt a neophyte regarding Hawaiian culture as well as cuisine it was with two friends that I sat down amidst the spacious confines of Island Flavor for dinner Saturday night, and going in with modest expectations based on what could be gleaned from reviews of those more accustomed the results were at times precisely what I'd hoped for, and occasionally far better than I'd originally been led to believe.  Admittedly at least 'familiar' with some of the styles comprising the genre, a number of Asian influences  noted amidst fried and roast meats with rich sauces rarely lacking in salt, it was just moments after 5:15 that I entered the sparsely decorated space and with the room half-filled by a mix of ethnicities that included several island natives it would not be long before drinks were filled and menus were navigated, a three-course feast soon to follow as  light mid-tempo music echoed from speakers overhead.  Well trained in service, the majority of the staff clearly longtime employees of the restaurant and happy to answer questions related to portions as well as preparation, it was with a duo of cultural staples that the sampling of Island Flavors began, and although neither would have been a preferred order if dining on my own both the snappy tuna and  Spam Musubi proved mostly what was anticipated, the former loaded with umami while the later, perhaps fortunately, saw the saline pork product mostly lost within the roll of warm rice.   Warned that portions run large despite costs that hover around $10 per plate, it was onward to three entrees that the evening progressed, and although the fried shrimp were a bit overcooked while the chicken was mostly flavorless without sauce, one would be hard pressed to find any fault in either the smoky shortrib or tender kalua pig, an equally well cooked piece of pork found strewn amidst rice beneath two sunny-side eggs and a rich brown gravy that, on its own, could have likely served a family of four.  Leaving at least four cups of rice behind, along with a few bites of macaroni salad that was actually quite enjoyable with plenty of creaminess packed in each bite, it was with an "all-in" approach that sweets were ordered up, and despite warnings and raised eyebrows from more than one staff-member the finale to follow was almost entirely worth the indulgence, the $5.50 Mud Pie a bit of a disappointment due to gritty ice cream while each cake from nearby Andrea's was presented at a bargain $5 per large slice, the faintly coconut Haupia not unlike something one might find at a wedding while the chantilly and guava came across sweet yet balanced, the quivering bread pudding taking a far less subtle approach with each banana-packed spoonful making a strong case for best in the city, or at the very least a good reason to come back.  Purporting no expertise in Hawaiian cuisine, but hoping to learn more in the coming months and years, Island Flavor represents a tremendous bargain to those looking for something familiar yet different with service and setting far superior to most eateries broadly grouped as 'ethnic,' the desserts a particular strong point even if they are mostly outsourced.

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Short Ribs and Furikake Shrimp mixed plate

QtJ5HHRW2jqzdEECYM5vXQ.text: Wrote a review, gave it another 5 chances and this is my place for my poke!!! At least  two days a week!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I just love this place! Oh and fries I didn&#39;t get the day before

YIGvdAC5MhDp9j7fV7sHfA.text: I don't particularly enjoy writing negative reviews, especially for a place that I once loved and highly recommended.   Because we absolutely loved their kalbi short ribs, we decided to order a party tray from them. (1/2 pan size kalbi short ribs = $80) Imagine my disappointment when several of the short ribs were blackened, as in burned. They sat on the bottom of the tray and went unnoticed for awhile. We were wondering why our guests weren't eating them and that's when we saw the unsightly pieces. My mom went to the restaurant later on that week to let them know. They took down our phone number and said they would call us to talk about it. No one called. A few months later, my mom returned and went in to talk to them and again was told someone would call us to talk about it. We were told that usually the owner would have checked out our order before it went out, but on that particular day, she came in after we picked up the order. Therefore, she never saw the order go out.  Again, no call from them.  Because I was so disappointed with that experience, the food and the lack of customer service, I decided to just not eat there anymore.  After almost a year of protesting, we finally decided to order food from there again. I initially tried ordering Pork Lau Lau on a Friday, but was told they didn't have any. I ended up with the combo Kalbi short ribs and furikake shrimp. My short ribs were blackened again! However, the Husband's order of short ribs were just fine. Also, the shrimp just didn't taste that great anymore. My Mom always orders the oxtail soup and always comments on how fatty their version is. You can see chunks of fat on theirs that probably should have been trimmed a little. (I'm all down for a little fat, but theirs is just too much.)  Their tuna poke salad, both raw or cooked, was pretty damn good...especially the dressing. But it's since doubled in price and not really worth it anymore.   Overall, I'm pretty sad that Island Flavor isn't in our repertoire of food choices these days. Quality and service had just gone down since they first opened and I get a sour taste in my mouth when I think of them now. With their current 4.5 star rating on Yelp, they won't be hurting for business I'm sure.

adysWt2c3Xwwu83yrEQEBw.text: Hands down best Hawaiian restaurant in town. The beef was really tender and tasty and the the furikake chicken was amazballz. I wish it was closer to home so wr can eat thier more often. The portions we're really good to. I'm a good eater and had enough for lunch tomorrow. Can't wait to go back and try something new.

oGku2gmVenlzl_doZRmuKg.text: Came here recently on a gloomy day with the boyfriend because we were both craving some comfort food and this really hit the spot.   The meal isn't too big, but there were definitely many items that caught my eye. I ended up ordering the furikake chicken meal while the boyfriend got the combo of furikake chicken and hawaiian roast pork. Each entree came with two big scoops of rice and macaroni salad. I'm not a fan of macaroni salad, but the boyfriend definitely enjoyed his. The furikake chicken was definitely unlike anything I've ever tasted before. It had the sweetness of orange chicken with the flavoring of furikake seasoning. Both worked really well together and even after I was full, I could not stop picking at it. My only complaint would just be that some pieces were a bit too hard, which ended up scratching the whole roof of my mouth as I tried to eat them. But that's a small price to pay for delicious island flavor!  At the end, the portions were just so gigantic that I ended up having leftovers that made up another meal for dinner, which only made my day better. We ended up accidentally leaving a debit card at the restaurant, but the staff was very helpful in helping us find the card. The service overall was very friendly and I can't wait to come back sometime in the near future.

EgRnBcmr_XL_EtWeWMzioA.text: Drove in from Reno and Even with a group as big as ours (13 to be exact) arriving at 845 at night when they close at 930 the Customer service was still on point.  The servings were huge, we each had to share a plate and some of us still couldn't finish it. Their Furikake chicken is BOMB!!! And their cakes are so Ono you have to try it!!! Definitely coming here again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate: furikake chicken and kalbi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco

tuRuTa9S64AAsBzUAHUVhg.text: I really can't get enough of this place. Although it's way off the strip and out of the way for us tourists, we still find ourselves making a visit to this restaurant almost once every Vegas trip.  The Chicken Katsu Loco Moco is amazing. No other Hawaiian restaurant offers Loco Moco with Chicken, always traditional with the burger patty. The gravy is what sets Island Flavor's Loco Moco apart from everyone else's.. Grandma's secret recipe is the best! I suggest asking for the gravy on the side because they give you a lot where you can take the rest home and make a whole new breakfast with it!  The Furikake Ahi Poke was very fresh and well seasoned. It comes in a half or full order but the half was a pretty good amount as an appetizer for two. The Korean Chicken wings were very flavorful and crispy.. would be even better with a pint of beer. ;) The saimin was just okay, nothing special but still perfect for a cold day.  Great food, great restaurant.. owner talked about opening a location in LA. I'm sure that would make a lot of people very happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Ahi Poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Loco Moco

Hl7i-D4CqhFotekAw634PA.text: My favorite "local" food in the 702.  I usually order the Mochiko Chicken but I just had the Poke and it was really good.  Only thing they lack is sometimes they don't have enough seating.

kuTCHMPc1_vqz8VhCWS_rw.text: This place has great food and the poke is one of the best I've had here in Vegas. Definitely return with the family.

-TJn0_6AqBcGBw50ILL_LA.text: So funny. After a day of Christmas shopping, I wanted to bring my mom to a local spot that we don't get to go to before because it's kinda of outta the way of our usual haunts.  Came here and got their misoyaki opakapaka & my mom got their oxtail. I got the opakapaka bcuz I've gotten hounded by friends to try it; and I loved it but, was not expecting how big the filets of fish were going to be. Granted, I'm an idiot for even trying to complain about the size so I won't complain....it's just a shocker! I swear the fish filets were bigger than my fork. lol  Mom loved the oxtail. She said it made her heart warm. AWWW! lol She said it's better than the oxtail from The California Hotel because the oxtail was all meat as opposed to The Cal's fatty oxtail. I liked how they had bok choy in their soup. Not something I've seen in other oxtails. Def adds to the specialty side of Island Flavors soup.  The workers all loved my mom and kept asking her if she liked the soup. lol Idk what it is about my mom; whenever we go to these fam local style spots, they always wanna make sure my mom is good. Which is great....adds to the family style establishment they got going here =)  Add this to another "MOTHER TESTED, MOTHER APPROVED" places my mom requires me to take her to in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Misoyaki Opakapaka
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail =)

oaFlXE2lhxlMXhWTfhqzQQ.text: We eat every time we're in Vegas. Their Furikake chicken is full of flavor. The servings are huge and the price is affordable.  It's not your typical tourist area, but there's plenty of parking.

eyePlyXvNuUb2Z_QsFnXSw.text: The Hawaiian food here is so delicious! I often come here but I'm actually not a big fan of the restaurant itself. It just doesn't have much of a homely type feel to it & they can get busy, so it can be kind of loud. They have the best furikake chicken I've ever had though, which is why I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 3. The mac salad is great & so is the musubi. I usually just call ahead when I'm on that side of town & pick up my food to go.

eG5CSUCOmBJJDhLURN5nDg.text: Best "local" restaurant outside of Hawaii.  I swear when I am there - I feel like I am at home.  The food is delicious and the portions gigantic.  Spam musubi is made fresh every day!!!  Love the staff!

NScu2f7ktOSdQ2zHU0PX5A.text: Food is basic Hawaiian fare. Not spectacular, but tasty. Servers are slow, slow, slow, but nice as always. Typical Hawaii service. If you like classic Hawaiian music, come on Fridays, they have live music. And because it's aloha friday, they have a Hawaiian plate, choice of laulau or kalua pig, served with lomi salmon, rice, mac salad, and haupia. I usually get the furikake chicken and kalbi. It's a good combo that always tastes great. All in all I enjoy this place, just wish the employees had more sense of urgency. Don't really like sitting in restaurant longer than I need too.

Cju6dx7ZRPbRvtVZ80h36w.text: Oh my Good God.   Thank you for bringing this wonderful, authentic taste of Hawaii to Vegas!  Stop in, you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu and Furikake Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi short ribs and Hawaiian Roasted Pork with gravy
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki chicken and Korean fried wings

sZrDIJxJxHoPSHdttiPu6g.text: The roast pork loco moco alone.. don't know why I gave them four stars.. maybe because I don't want to wait 30 minutes to eat next time we go!

zIk0tMCN-fX8_veIONZ8Cw.text: This is by far the most amazing Hawaiian BBQ food you'll find in vegas. This food is so freaking good that I may name my first born child after it. Flavor Williams.... This will probably be a tough battle I'll have with my future wife, and I'll probably lose, but I'll still try. Anyways eat here, it will improve your life.

azTtuJfoY3pMagLgxIpxAw.text: service was great and attentive. food was mediocre. i would say their best dish is the poke. True authentic hawaiian poke. all the other dishes were ok. HUGE portions too.

DPRkz3MeysB5HFcUyRpFsw.text: VERY HUGE PORTIONS!  You can share a plate with 3 people!!  Food was great. Just the wait was ehh but still, the food was great and delicious.

-rVxcK8RBa-fRevb77VKQA.text: A loooooot of hype about this place has been going on since I have been talking about how I was going to be in Vegas this past weekend. Great local feel!! All the employees were like auntys and uncles (Hawaii slang) and it was as if I was dining at some restaurant at home =]  I had a hard time choosing between chicken katsu and the katsu loco moco. They both sounded SOO SO OSOO OOSOOSOOO good! Not to mention the people around me were eating katsu loco mocos and I might have droooled a little...  But I stuck with ordering the plain katsu because I knew I wasnt going to be able to finish all of my food and so I thought it would be easier to save! Saving a katsu loco moco makes me think of soggy chicken katsu and Idk if I am really a fan of that.  Katsu was ON POINT. I love it when katsu is crispy and their katsu was just that! Omg and their macaroni salad was super delicious too. They have huge pieces of pepper and it really gave your mouth a little kick while eating it.. i enjoyed that. 2 scoops rice, a mound of katsu and 1 scoop mac salad for $9??? WIN. WIN. WIN.   They also give you a nice container of sauce. Im a sauce lover so I NEED lots of sauce :3  Plus the service was so friendly and wonderful! "You need to eat half of your plate to get a take out box!" *jokingly of course. But we laughed. I think all of us were a little beat up from clubbing and shennanigans from the night before so eating a large meal of meat and rice was not high up on the agenda before a 6 hour car ride to LA... Still delicious though and I am actually eating my leftovers as I type this!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oYYrP8zaqG9ri51bhg6_fg.text: Good Lord, another Hawaiian restaurant to review. Luckily, this is one of my new favorite ones in Vegas!  Some friends of mine suggested this place to my boyfriend and I literally RIGHT before we were leaving to Vegas. They had found this place through yelp one day and mentioned it. Thank goodness I'm always down to try ANY food.   This place is located in a plaza that's not hard to locate. The restaurant itself was pretty clean, and a little bigger than the other hawaiian restaurants I've been too. We were seated quickly upon arriving and the employees were all pretty friendly and attentive.   Most of the menu items looked amazing, but thanks to Yelp I narrowed it down to two dishes. To be honest I really wanted to try a little bit of everything. We ordered the Korean Chicken (chicken wings fried Korean style) and the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco. I instantly fell in love with the loco moco. I've never had it in this style before and the gravy that it was covered in wasn't too overpowering. I was told the gravy is homemade in the back by the owner's grandmother (I'm not exactly sure if this is True).   Upon leaving we talked to the owner and he had mentioned he was looking to open a location somewhere in LA. I really hope he does. Because I would absolutely come back. Which is what I plan on doing next time I go to Vegas.

tomAURgXrCtxKtrK98pOJQ.text: Omgoodness my husband and I are mad at ourselves for not coming sooner. This place is authentic, clean and the staff is friendly.  Oh yeah the food is amazing, the dessert was great!!! We got a mixed plate for $11.25 and the plate of food was well worth it. I can't even spell what I got but my husband got the shrimp and the short ribs everything was great!! We will be coming back.

fpyGUIxDSbct3CeVKxVxCw.text: Hawaiian food has alot of flavors.  Mostly sweet and not too spicy. I prefer the spicy side. I ordered the furikake chicken and shrimp.  They were good but too sweet.  The mac salad was ok.  Overall a decent lunch.

a9mZwlEQrVnwv7wxvXi2IA.text: Hands down the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.  Super friendly service.  The places is always packed with people from the islands.  That's how you can tell is for real!!!

X4TAJiwGrdRjJe0zQL7ZMQ.text: Since moving to Utah in late 2009, I hadn't found a restaurant that served ONO Hawaiian food until I ate at Island Flavor. The first time I went, I ate a whole pound of Hanalei Poi with poke, a bowl of Portuguese bean soup, and a plate of braised beef. Even the waiter advised me that they serve big portions.   No Lon L., Aunty ate ALL da food.  Had to hana hou before I returned to Utah. Yes, I had another pound of Hanalei poi with their spare ribs special. It was all ONO. Plus I drank a whole glass of ono guava juice. Bought 4 spam musubis to go and enjoyed 2 when I got home to Utah. My grandson enjoyed the other 2.  I miss Hanalei Poi and all the ono entrees at Island Flavor. It is top of my to do list when I return to Las Vegas. Until then, I'll be dreaming of your ono food.  Mahalo plenty for taking me home to Hawaii with all your ono grinds.

0LjqkhWgXI1A18Frn8kaZA.text: My favorite place to eat for Hawaiian style food. I even like it better than any place back at home. The furikake chicken....the best.

lna0pXobO8QGoUJzrO6lnw.text: I was told that this place had the best Hawaiian food around.  As a fan of L&L, which in my opinion is pretty good, I had to give this place a try.  DEFINITELY WORTH IT.  Service was fantastic.  The waitresses are very friendly.  Food: THE BOMB.  Portions are ENORMOUS.  Most of their entrees are $9, but for $11, you can choose two!  And the way they serve it is like getting two meals for the price of $11.  The best hawaiian food in Las Vegas, hands down.

BO7onKWOX1bEmiNWQiXtsg.text: Right next to rhodes ranch. This place was packed fof a sunday. They have around 30-40 seats... Very nice staff. Buffet (jimmy) was playing... Everyone reallh enjoying food and conversation. I ordered to go... Because the niners were on TV. Ordered the sesame poke (3/4 in cubes) tasted very nice... My favorite thing thus far. Korean chicken, even though talked about a lot on yelp- i didnt love it... Actually, i didnt even like it... Ribs were done ok... There are some other things on the menu i will try in the future. Ill be back and rate again.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korea fried chicken.... Didnt love it.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame poke

7VhXhs7oUX_yU8EA9XnGWw.text: My wife and I came here trying to find a good Hawaiian food place on thus side of town and saw all the good reviews so we decided to give it a shot. Based off of all of the recommendations I decided to try the Furikake chicken and I was pretty disappointed.  The chicken was really overcooked and dry and there wasn't enough of the sauce to make up for the dryness of the chicken,  the fried rice I will say was amazing.  My wife ordered her go to Kalua pork which she said was just OK, nothing that she would come back for.

SycoR900lbE7Ft9EepptHA.text: Oxtail heaven! The only reason I went here was for the oxtail soup. I didn't need to look at the rest of their menu because oxtail was all I cared for. I'm sure their other dishes are delicious but I'm here to talk about that damn soup. I've had oxtail soup at home, at casinos, at other Hawaiian eateries, but none of them were as good as the one here (sorry mom!). It came with four, big, meaty servings of oxtail per order. It also had vegetables to actually eat and not just as garnish. The order came with two whopping scoops of rice and macaroni salad. I honestly couldn't finish it all. For dessert the waitress recommended their new guava cake. At first I was a little apprehensive, but I finally gave in. Thank goodness I agreed on ordering the guava cake since it was THE BEST CAKE I've ever tasted ever!! It was moist and you can definitely taste the guava flavor. It was sweet but not overly too sweet. sigh. It was heavenly. I looked around to check up on other people's food and let me just tell you their servings are huge! This place takes their food seriously. I've tried my friends dish and it was packing with flavor, melt in your mouth goodness. If ever I'm craving Hawaiian food again, there's no other place to go to but here.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava cake is moist
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best oxtail soup!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu poke, Portuguese sausage, and macaroni salad

WIMPoAI1j4ko51AC0701EQ.text: Best food and Paleo friendly for all my crossfitters.  This place is kid friendly as well as ohana friendly.  This place is clean, wholesome, and feels at home.  I wish you guys were in NYC.  I always come back here every time we visit LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CRqA25Ob6avRKQ77iZ6PaA.text: This restaurant definitely has a special place in my heart. The food is ono and reminds me so much of home. The island music and "aloha spirit" shared by the employees is definitely an A+ in my book. The ahi poke was tender and the right consistency. As for my favorite dish, the furikake chicken, it tastes so amazing and very unique. It reminds me of the chicken served at The Alley or Queen Street Cafe back home in Aiea, Oahu. The food is served in good sized portions and you get a good bang for your buck. Easily now one of my favorite places to go to for Hawaiian food in town. I highly recommend this place!

N5yVsaTHMbp-eNiJy6BReg.text: As everyone mentions - portions are really large. For the money, you're getting quite a bit of food. I loved the homey atmosphere and our waitress was very sweet & friendly.   Fried poke salad ($10.25) - I was feeling adventurous. I can't say I enjoyed this very much but I guess it's more just my weird tastes. So I love seared tuna and I imagined it'd be like this. The problem with poke is each piece is a different size so the cooking is really uneven. Some pieces were burnt and grey and dry, some were pink and pretty, some weren't cooked at all, etc. I should have realized this before I ordered but that's my loss !  Hawaiian mixed plate - we got this with double rice, kalbi short ribs and kahlua pork. My husband was so ecstatic - the first place we've found where you can get the pork with no cabbage mixed in! This was tasty but not as fatty and wonderful as the pork in Hawaii. The kalbi ribs were incredible, husband declared them best ever. Delicious!   We'll return - and we'll be getting a big ole platter of kalbi short ribs next time !

qJgZ38xLGS46WQWCIFfWpQ.text: Best furikake chicken, Kalbi and Teri beef you'll ever taste!!!  Portions are large and the service is great.

SlVh45ac1h6uku3U7OJRPA.text: First timers,  we ordered a pound of shoyu ahi poke (fresh ), spam and eggs, combo plate with kalbi short ribs and furtikake chicken.. Everything was good but the furtikake chicken was amazing! We will definitely be back.  Oh and the service was good too!

u_mape_W7PRs7MZZC8_GqA.text: What's an east coast guy know about "local grinds". Not much lol but my taste buds know good flavor. And let me say one word.  Poke! It's damn good. I have yet to try anything else, but I must say that Korean Chicken looks and smells worth checking out. I'll definitely be getting around to it

XSgNLFOpLaE1oNRFlkjnEg.text: Always up to trying new Hawaiian eateries and my latest curiosity brought me here:  Ambiance: a lot of tropical themed portraits and awesome aerial shot of Oahu.  Very nostalgic.  The servers, as you would expect in all things Hawaiian, were really nice.  Food: I wanted to go for the gusto and got the Hawaiian plate: pork lau lau version.  The flavor was there, however, it lacked the moistness that stays in the lau lau when you personally take it out of the ti leaf.   Overall: I will definitely be back.  There's a lot of items on the menu that takes me back to the islands.  Good job!!!!

am-15-Yc9p_efBES7R_HZw.text: Portions are HUGE!!! Like our server said, "Go big or go home!" I barely made it through my roast pork loco moco; only ate 1/4 of it. The loco moco was good but a bit too salty because of the gravy. My boyfriend had the Shoyu Chicken; he loved it. He compared it to Adobo. Got peer pressured to order the Kona Coffee Mud Pie. Liked it! It was huge; my boyfriend estimated it was around 5 scoops of ice cream. Our server was friendly. Would probably be back here with a bigger group.

3Pjtbk7Wk74SNaPiR1k8_Q.text: I am comparing Island Flavors to Zippy (if you are from Hawaii you will be familiar with Zippys). I would rate Zippys 4 stars, but I'd give this place 5 stars.  They have a smaller menu than Zippys but everything they offer is 5 stars.  I've had the Roast pork, Furikake Chicken and the Loco Moco here with the Chantilly Cake.  This is easily one of the best Hawaiian restaurants in Las Vegas. The only issue is limited seating inside the restaurant, because it has become so popular with the Hawaiian transplants in Vegas, the wait could be 30-45 minutes for a table but the food is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Loco Moco, hamburger patty, fried egg on a bed of rice smothered in brown gravy!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken is awesome

iuxSQADLbwgcHzNkWeEnTA.text: The poke as an "appetizer" is very filling.  You can actually have this as your meal for only $9.95.  As for the lunch special deals for about $10 is also very filling.  It's really "Big Island" style portions where you can share one meal with two people.  My boyfriend and I tasted the chicken katsu loco moco and the short ribs.  These two choices are superb.    I'd definitely would come back to this place when I head back to Las Vegas again.  This is the spot to go to if you're missing the island flavors and you want to eat someplace away from the strip.

Of8l4RaMqzCCuWa4PuOkaA.text: Delicious food but a little pricey.  None the less, still glad it's in my neighborhood.

yzP1x1pUt_4SYdLHQ7L1JQ.text: The best Hawaiian food that I've had in the states. It's a little far from the strip, but having lunch there before heading to the airport was perfect plan.   Where to start?  Their fried rice is highly recommended. You can add it to your plate for an additional $2. I tried their chicken katsu loco moco and it was Massive. I can have a big appetite at times, but I wasn't able to finish this monster dish.    For the size, quality, and price this is definitely 100x better than the typical L&L that you'll find in CA.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu loco moco
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu and shrimp combo with fried rice ($2 more)

iqrEM9sq-jQ-1fn6Je5cdg.text: I'm reviewing this place again because of the change in ownership. Having read some of the latest yelp reviews I've decided to eat at this place again really because I was craving my favorite dish from here, Hawaiian Roast Pork. I ordered the mixed plate, my two choices were the Furikake Chicken & Hawaiian Roast Pork, the other members of my party had 1) Loco Moco 2) Chicken Katsu 3) Furikake Chicken. For appetizers we had a full order of Poke Combo the types were 1) Hawaiian style 2) Furikake 3) Sesame Poke and two orders of Cucumber Kimchi. For dessert we had 1) Haupia Cake 2) Guava Cake 3) Coconut ice cream. These are all dishes we've eaten here many times before and we all agree they've remained the same. The amount of food was still the same. The prices to us were the same, reasonable, it's not like we looked at the prices and thought "wow this is expensive". The staff was the same, friendly and welcoming people we've been waited upon in the past. The place was going through an expansion process. Apparently they're going to knock out the wall to make the dining room bigger, which should help because this place gets really crowded. I just hope they also expand the kitchen too because more customers means you gonna need more cooks. So my take on the change in ownership is so far, everything is still the same, but how the new owners go from here is full of possibility. Still a five star and still the place recommended to anybody that asks me "So since you're from Hawaii were is the best place to eat Hawaiian food in Las Vegas?" I'll still say Island Flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All types of Hawaiian Sun drink flavors
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice selections
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate loco moco &amp; roast pork

y8F66JTqTGcQZqYIPNPdxA.text: Island Flavor is a go-to spot for a LOT of my friends during their trips to Vegas so I figured my trip wouldn't be complete unless I went, too! I honestly went in with pretty high expectations because of all the hype built up by my friends and I was not disappointed. My friend and I shared the spam musubi, furikake chicken, and the hawaiian roast pork with gravy.  SPAM MUSUBI. WOW. Honestly one of the best musubi's I've ever had. Everyone talks about how it's so simple to make, but every time I've tried to make it isn't quite as good as ordering from a Hawaiian restaurant. The rice was perfectly cooked and the furikake in the middle was a nice, sweet touch.  FURIKAKE CHICKEN. Okay, the hype for this is definitely real. And I wish they had this in LA. It reminded me of orange chicken, but with a slightly sweeter sauce. The breading of the chicken was really crispy but the inside of the chicken incredibly tender. So. Bomb.  HAWAIIAN ROAST PORK. This was a bit eh for me. I love the gravy that Hawaiians enjoy topping on their meat and I was definitely not disappointed by the gravy. The pork was very soft and tender but it had way too much fat on it and was not that pleasant. It was also a little tooo peppery for my taste.  All in all though, I was pretty impressed by Island Flavor. Especially because of it's cheap price and huuuuge portions  Definitely will be coming by again!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian roast pork

fDBi2KpQKy1_VdmLJLZZBQ.text: Good food, come here to satisfy your hunger. Will be back to try other things on the menu. I had the mixed plate (katsu and furikake chicken).

LZ-0B1G6VDMewRQIDpZUdQ.text: Huge island style portions, great price, good service! The poke appetizer is really large cubes wish they would cut them down smaller to hold the flavor better but overall it's a win especially for families

Da1nmYNmRbFmkQwIuUdd3w.text: I love this place so much! Best Hawaiian food in town! The staff is incredible and the atmosphere is very relaxing! Live music, good food, cold beer.

KBbyoE2F8SllhyL4eTw31g.text: I don't even know where to begin. When I first started coming here, the food flavor and portions was awesome, the service was amazing and the atmosphere was incredible. But now the only thing that remained the same was the damn service from the staff. The food portions keep getting smaller and smaller and it's probably because of the new owner. I don't know if you know how Hawaiian people work, but if we go somewhere to eat, and we don't get full, we don't go back. That was a half portion. To say the most. (I got Kalua pig) it was $9 and it was smaller than half the plate! And that was INCLUDING THE RICE! I don't know what you guys are gonna changed but you need to change it back! ASAP!

ZakzSQdjDWpwLQBjM2togg.text: Fam comes here every time we visit from CA The furikake chicken and spam and eggs and kalbi and cobb salad are yummy good food and nice atmosphere!

5AEr631Cj9yuGqiyBsHHeQ.text: My favorite Hawaiian Food ever, absolutely love the place. Yes take a Lil time for the food but the taste and freshness is worth wait. The service and family vibes are amazing. The prices are great as well, the music and the new remodel is a lot better with more  room.

TxrqyFMOFDD04MhZGHh-4g.text: My gosh! This place has the BEST Hawaiian food I have ever had! Went again planning to try something different & I got the furikake chicken & beef teriyaki again because it that's amazing!  It's beyond delicious!!! My friend had the kalbi short ribs & chicken furikake plate. She loved it! Please open a NW location!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef teriyaki &amp; chicken furikake mixed plate with steamed rice &amp; mac salad! The meats are so tender, juicy, incredible flavor!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi short ribs &amp; chicken furikake mixed plate with steamed rice &amp; macaroni salad. Delicious!

5aeqpiMTY3ur5NNrH2qPkg.text: Our usual server, Edna, helped us out perfectly with our large party. She catered to our needs and was very patient with everything. Water was always filled, and she checked on us regularly. Food was amazing as always and came out in a timely manner! Thank you Edna & Island Flavor for catering to us again.

P6LZHJFwkiAAF63of8rSNg.text: Health code violation- they repackaged a takeout order that I brought back because they gave me the wrong food, they gave it to a guy who came in after me.    This place used to be good. There has been a decline in pretty much everything from service to food since the change in ownership.   I'm very disappointed in the new ownership and staff. I ordered take-out, which included 2lbs of poke. I got home opened the boxes and realized they gave me the wrong food and I only had 1lb of poke. I left the food that was right so my kids could start eating and went back to the restaurant to get the missing poke.    I brought the wrong food back to the restaurant and they asked me whether or not I touched or ate the food- which I hadn't. Apparently they also gave me the wrong poke and asked me where it was at. The girl didn't want to give me the food I actually paid for unless I brought back the poke I "took." The girl even asked me if we started eating the poke and if we could bring it back. I didn't want to argue with her and said just give me one of my poke so I can go.   I saw her take the food I had brought back, re-bag it up, and give it to the guy who came in asking for his takeout just a few minutes later.  I was completely disgusted.  I worked in a restaurant for over 10 years and repackaging food that may have been contaminated is a health code violation.  I won't be eating here again.

IlLlrq2gRpVY9zDRBDlupQ.text: This place is awesome and the food is great!  I love the furikaki chicken and the Mac salad. The staff is always great and food is always fresh and tasty. I would recommend this place to anyone the loves authentic hawiian food!

ED_VOzOdQC_3Lx_TQCHZFA.text: Under new management and I don't recommend coming here anymore. Party of 11 seated. Ordered the mix plate with fried rice. They bring the food out with white rice so waitress brings it back to kitchen to be corrected. Waitress comes back to the table twice to check orders, and the plate that was wrong came out more than 15 minutes later.

ebDNncODGRQUW_vCRGgy7w.text: Stopped by to have lunch with the family and truly enjoyed the quality of the food and service.   The spicy avocado poke was tasty, fresh and plentiful as an appetizer.  The Friday lunch "pork" special with cabbage was tasteful.  The boneless Kalbi was very  well marinated.

3jsZhAri93rVYkOBJ2WNTg.text: My favorite food every time I come to Vegas! Furikake chicken is to die for! Everything is amazing. Make sure to find Tyler as your server because he is not just tall and handsome, but also very knowledgeable of all the food choices.

f3nYbV2x34jDTVLgZKKuYw.text: Out of all the Hawaiian restaurants I've eaten at.. by far, THE MOST DELICIOUS ONE. I got the locomoco and it was massive! Not to mention the absolutely savory gravy, so good that we got another order of just gravy that we used to coat the even better tasting porkchop that is seasoned to perfection!! All in all a great restaurant, amazing experience, and even better customer service! S/o to our server Kehau for making our first time at Island Flavor so enjoyable and nice! She didn't hesitate when she saw us raise our hand for more food and hot water and for being so nice and welcoming

XY6DrO6FCmIElZwEFkU81Q.text: Service with Edna was great as always, food was yummelicious, and we can't wait to come back!

xNYy2xUxYEMSV2xphx4eIw.text: Love the authenticity and the great people who work here!  The kalbi dish is excellent as is the teriyaki chicken!!  I had them cater and event and everybody asked me where I got the food from.  Every piece of food was eaten!!  My kids demolish the spam musabi from here and they would eat it every night if I let them!  If you miss Hawaii, be sure to stop in here!

fq8RpK-xHeuIVvMMxkFlAg.text: Once I landed at McCarran Airport, my friend picked me up and gave me three options for lunch. Island Flavor was the winner! I was craving Hawaiian, after all. Kevin said the place is typically busy during the week, so I'm glad we easily found an empty table on the Sunday afternoon that we visited.  We decided on a half pound of ahi poke and an order of furikake shrimp. The waiter asked if we wanted a half or full pound of poke, and even though I had to resist, I'm glad we said half pound. It was plenty of food for two people. I wasn't a huge fan of the shrimp, but I could tell it was expertly made. The crispiness was on point. I also loved the freshness of the poke. Overall solid meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Poke

COpzGFSxptUT0A0_eXWlHA.text: Ancient Hawaiians ventured away from the islands in great, double-hulled canoes as far back as 900 AD, in search of food, new land, and entertainment, exploring Asia and the west coast of North America. They may have also been homesick, sailing back to their roots in Marquesas and Tahiti.  Back in June 2017, I traveled on double-engine Airbus 330 with Hawaiian Airlines to California in search of food and umm--well--entertainment. After a few days, in sunny Orange County, I drove to Las Vegas to continue my quest. Using GPS like my descendants will, the four-hour sojourn was successful, narrowly avoiding a five-hour delay on the I-15 when an RV blew up a few vehicles in front of me. A week on the Continent and feeling homesick, I searched for Hawaiian food.  My first stop in Las Vegas: Island Flavor off of a recommendation from a friend of a friend. I had the roast pork with gravy, and was thoroughly impressed with the service and quality of food. Heaping scoops of steamed rice, fabulous macaroni salad, and roast pork crusted with black pepper and smothered in silky, brown gravy. It was also a great place to meet other people from Hawaii on vacation or relocated to Las Vegas. Oddly, this was the best and cheapest Hawaiian food I've had, including everything I've experienced back home in Hawaii. Their five stars will help me navigate back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork. The crushed black pepper crust is great.

9byjakyj-WzNbn86SOrElQ.text: If I'm craving Hawaiian food, this would be where I'd go.  I've tried a lot of different food on the menu & it's all pretty good. I switch up what I order & never stick to the same thing, but I like "Katsu Loco Moco," "Furikake Chicken," "Kalbi Ribs," & "Oxtail Soup."  It's a good price for the amount you get. I get so full & have leftovers that could last me two more meals.  I usually call for pick-up & they take around 15 min.

daW_GVa_Jqlv06Z3-JOHeA.text: I'm pretty picky with my Hawaiian food, but island flavor is pretty alright in a sense of portion.  I came in here and tried their furikake chicken and spicy avocado poke.  So lemme get to the good stuff first: their poke is spot on good; fresh and delicious. If you get their 1lbs option it's a pretty good deal and you can share with friends.  We also tried the slightly cooked poke option but to be honest, I didn't care too much for it. It just reminded me of teriyaki cooked fish, nothing really special.  My main course was the furikake chicken, portions were huge! It lasted me that meal and fed me the next day (but then again I don't like to waste food, so I'm a huge left overs kinda guy..) ha!  As for the disappointments though, the flavor of the chicken got boring quick, and the texture was way too tough and difficult to digest. The chicken was also a bit too dry, I think it was deep fried way too long. The sauce was a little too salty for my preference but if you want something to fill you up on a deal, I suppose you're getting your money's worth.   Island flavor is alright if you want quantity over quality, and some decent poke but I can't really see myself coming back here again unfortunately.

ODUtYawmWhDOgJb6MiOhYw.text: Island flavor is our go to on date night. Love the food so delicious! We've been there with the live entertainment which was such a blast. Their new remodel makes the place seem more homey and welcoming. If you want to try delicious and outstanding food look no further! I'm in love with their mix plate of furtikake chicken and short ribs! Yum!

y7-_CahDTP7mjVVEpAPUPg.text: Let me get straight to my points. Ugh, this place is guaranteed to have you leaving with a to go Box. The food is cooked really well, flavorful, and portioned to feed you for lunch and dinner. My favorites are loco moco, katsu moco, furikake chicken, poke, and kona coffee cake. Their Mac salad is made yummyful also. You can tell their recipes or food are made with quality. This is a must try in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love island flavor but... They don&#39;t cut the kalbi for you?

a7USy89EaSu91NFQhceQGQ.text: Friendly and awesome newly renovated as well. Food delicious. Feel like I back in Hawaii.

8jfuuZcMLvfiJ78iYGBDzA.text: OK folks, I just want to let you know that this is not your fine dining, dress up kind of place.  This is where you will be asking for extra napkins, put on some shorts and flip flops and bring a large appetite for some good ole Hawaiian plate food / comfort food.  Stop it, don't count calories when you come here.  Fill up and exercise after...you nap off the great food.  When Island Flavor opened up in Henderson, the owner was telling me to come over to the regular restaurant on Durango.  Today for Grandma's birthday, we came here for lunch!  The place - What is it with all this development south of the 215 between Durango and Jones?  What a great deal of good food places coming from this area.  The parking - No problem in this nondescript strip mall.  Plenty of parking.  The place - This your basic table and chair dining room that is truly basic because it is made to be eatin and not to be fussin.  The menu - Wow,  Ahi Poke, Salads, Fish, Beef Stew, Opakapaka, Oxtail Soup, Chicken Katsu, Pork Chops, Kalbi, Korean Chicken, Rigs, Teriyaki Chicken or Beef, Musubi, Mac Salad, Tons of Rice.  This place is heaven for good ole plate food.  The food  Korean Chicken and Kalbi - This is the mixed plate I ordered and the Kalbi is just right. Yank the meat off the bone and it is all tender.  Not too much bristle and fat just and plenty of good ole flavor. One of the best.  The Korean Chicken is great. Fried and then a wet sauce is added to this that is so tasty with all its oriental flavors. I really enjoy this Korean Chicken. It is basically wings.  Love it.  Plump and juicy.  Korean Chicken and Teriyaki Steak - The wifey had this and the steak was melt in your mouth.  Loco Moco - Hawaiian breakfast over rice.  A huge bowl of goodness is what my son ordered. He can eat a lot but he only ate half as it was so big and he was saving his stomach for dessert.  Island Flavor Salad with Catch of the Day - The daughter ordered this and it was both huge, at least 12 ounces of fish, tons of sald, sweet potatoes and won ton strips. She was starving and could not finish this.  Oxtail Soup - Wow, the soup was good but the oxtails were like soaking in the soup and there was a lot of it.  Great taste, fall off the bone and a lot of it too!  Mudd Pie - Ummmm, that crust is the best ono thing I can ever imagine. Is it a crushed oreo that is made into a crust?  I don't know. It was a large piece of pie and the Kona Coffee ice cream was good but I did not eat most of it. I instead ate all the crust. That was so delish!  Chantilly Cake - An interesting cake that I cannot really tell you if it is good or bad as my mouth was full of that crust from the Mudd Pie.  Chocolate Ice Cream - The daughter was expecting a scoop and she got like a huge sundae shaped bowl full of chocolate goodness.  I did taste it and it was very good for sure!  This place is so good. It is fun, tasty and comfort food at its very best, if you like Hawaiian Plate Food.  GK says, check it out, and if not for the food, for the service because all the people here have the greatest service and make you feel like family!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona Coffee Mudd Pie
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chantilly cake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco

FE73uk9bynBe0R591njLEg.text: What a great find!  So glad it's off the beaten path from the strip.  It looks dark from the outside and judging from the Vegas sun, that's understandable.  Once in, it is warm and inviting on this cold Vegas evening.  When we ordered, I was thinking along the lines of some of the Hawaiian places in San Diego.  The portions here are big!  The partner started with the Portugese bean soup...flavorful and hearty!  He thought the salad was coming on his teriyaki beef plate, but a large side salad appeared as well.  My mom  and I ordered the roast pork....a mound of pork covered in gravy with two scoops of rice and a scoop of mac salad.  I was in Hawaiian food heaven!  I also ordered the special fried noodles, and a large plate came out with char siu pork....very good!  My dad had the oxtail soup and really enjoyed it!    No wonder this place gets crowded because lots of locals were coming in.  I saw two desserts go out, and we ordered the banana bread pudding to go.  This came with a delicious vanilla sauce!  It's good to know there's another alternative to come to instead of eating at the California Hotel...LOL!  The staff was really friendly and our server told us that they've been open for seven years now.  I can't believe we didn't find this place sooner!  This place is legit!  Can't wait to come back!  If you're a haole and do not understand Hawaiian culture or food, please go eat at Jack-in-Box...I think there's one down the street...

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious fried noodles!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup

JmthQ5JN4UdViA2b5VBW3A.text: Being from Hawai'i, this is like eating at home.   Large portions enough to take left overs home for another meal.  Specials that are ono and service with True Aloha spirit.   Cocoa puffs like Liliha bakery and Kona mud pie perfect for hot Vegas days.

DAqWa-SlVwfOBRd88nXPYA.text: Unbelievably good Hawaiian food. The short ribs were fantastic. Order the banana bread pudding, but make sure you share it. Entree and dessert with an iced tea was less than $24. Worth the drive away from the Strip.

Xwh0KWdKj4-QI2PBgm6-OA.text: Felt as if I never left the 808. Food was the bomb.com, live hawaiian music was on point & the workers showed the meaning of aloha. If your missing local kine grinds from Hawaii, I recommend you eating here. This place will not disappoint.

jyztlw5GJxTp9AX38P_kCw.text: It had been a long while since we had been to Island Flavor. We heard it got a renovation with new management and thought why not check it out. We came here on a Friday night at 7:30p, during their busy time to dine in for dinner. It took 45 mins to be seated. After 30 mins our order came out with one meal missing. After 10 mins, we asked any waiter that was available that we are missing a meal. That same server kept looking back at us after checking, but never came back to follow up. They seemed to have avoided a mistake and did not want to own up to it. The order finally came out "rushed". With different management, you can tell it's missing the authentic "Aloha". The portions, presentation and flavors also are not same. Leadership and organization needs work. Only plus side was the live entertainment.

6L_3isLHuNylqVzIG0ByWg.text: This is my second time here and it's really delicious! It just sucks how it's so far from my house.... oh well, distance makes the heart grow fonder right? Lol anyway, the food is delicious and I will be back. Keep it up ya'll!  Aloha!

MGloarGeFF-ODO3c3HydYA.text: The food and service here is awesome! I've only been here a few times since I live in Cali, but I'm always stoked to come here. It's a great place if you're craving Hawaiian food! Recommendations: furikake chicken, kalbi, loco moco... Actually, you really can't go wrong with anything here!

INX8xJghvBVGr8pEWeFWnw.text: This place has been a favorite for years until recently when ownership changed. The menu changed and portions were cut in half if not more. They still have their great staff (reason for the 3 stars) and food is still good, but it's not as good a quality as it was before. My husband's favorite dish the pork chops are now cut very thin and dry. He was not happy. My son says his favorites furakaki chicken doesn't taste the same with lots of chewy pieces (I think he was talking about the ligaments in the chicken). We are now on the lookout for another Hawaiian favorite.

m5DizTmOSYDi0hsRxdRvOw.text: A friend told us about this place. Today we went for the first time.  As my husband and I ate all we could say was oh my gosh. I got the teriyaki beef. My husband got teriyaki chicken.  We also got shrimp and a couple musubi to take home.  Friendly staff,  appropriate music playing, order was quick.  My only suggestion was that they get low salt soy sauce.  We found the menu selection to be interesting and will definitely return to try more. My husband is from Hawaii and he was really happy. Saying the meat was the way his mother made it.

GgBWEBWMfmdzwjYjuKcexQ.text: Absolutely one of the best Hawaiian food I have ever had (other than Hawaii of course).  Randomly came here on a friday night 30 mins before closing. Called in ahead of time and they offered to put our name down on the list. Awesome.  They have plenty of tables for small and large parties.  Everything on the menu sounds delicious and best part? ITS SUPER CHEAP!!!! Each plate is less than or around $10. And oh my lord, SOOOO MUCH FOOD!!!  Each plate can seriously be shared between two people. I opted for the combo plate because I wanted to try more than one thing.  Hawaiian Style Roast Pork & Furikake Shrimp Combo The pork is cooked local style w/Hawaiian salt, cracked black pepper, sliced thin and topped w/rich homemade brown gravy and the shrimp is jumbo shrimp coated with panko and furikake fried golden brown and served with oriental sauce. The pork was VERY tender with a nice ratio of meat to fat. And the shrimp was crunchy and delicious. I definitely recommend both options. I did ask for white rice, but the cook accidentally gave me fried rice instead, which was even better!!! Because it was a super large portion of fried rice and had bbq pork meat in it and a nice subtle flavor. The mac salad was the only thing that was a very small portion, but it was good as well.  We also shared the fresh made ahi poke. It was good as well. Especially with fresh sliced onions.  Overall, great service, great food, and great prices!!
