ujQJP7CUDgZ-j7ulaDqbJQ.text: If you're looking for ono Hawaiian food...This is the place to go!! Big portions at low prices. The staff served us with the aloha mana customer service. We'll be back for more. Highly recommend the furikake chicken. Mahalo!!

7iFTPlXV25ELZ3t0ZzjmDg.text: Fantastic Hawaiian food - especially enjoyed chicken katsu, island salad, Korean kalbi.  Huge quantities so great value.

T-CKPvphVpBGncpM-Cl7eA.text: The best tasting Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. Been to both locations and the food is excellent.  The oxtail stew or soup (depends on how you look at it) is th bomb ! Every time I  come here I try to have something different so that I can say I had everything.  Half way there . You can beat the service. And the prices are affordable. Bring everyone!

3EXBDV_KQMhptowvlm91Uw.text: This is probably my favorite hawaiian restaurant in vegas. The portions are actually large portions! All the other places don't give you much for your buck. I've tried the kalbi, saimin, poke, etc. I love it here and the service is great. You have to get dessert! Love the haupia ice cream cake. Big portion again so you need to share but it is amazing.   If they aren't open then I'm not eating hawaiian food anywhere else. I'd wait till the next day.

npsQChxlPotyuUlKPlr8BQ.text: pretty authentic tasting island grinds!! ordered the saimin for takeout, liked how they kept the noodles & soup in separate containers, and was nicely surprised to have bokchoy - tasty indeed!! fried rice was good but would have been nice to add a few more ingredients to make it even tastier. seeing asian/islander folks in the restaurant made me feel confident that their food was "ono"

AsLsTSbyli2pRD5WTTcBGw.text: If Island Flavor isn't your  #1 Authentic Hawaiian Spot, then its definitely top 3 on anyone's list. This is the spot to go. Hawaiian Food is probably one of my fav things to eat. we can sit here and talk about how good the place ism but I like to rate places  in comparison to others in the entire city. my favorite dish is kalua pork. the taste here is different from the others, not sure what it is, but it's like its cooked fresh everytime, one way you can tell is by looking at the cabbage, and its color.  Second kalbi ribs, amazing taste, I've had it at other places, and this is definitely a cut above the rest. great service, and they make you feel welcome. I don't work to far from the place, so its definitely a great place to go. They have so many other things that they don't serve at other hawaiian places or they're version is wayy better than others. it might just be me, but I definitely recommend anyone visiting vegas to try this place first for hawaiian before any other place

whOvoVtzYoWGwDpOO0Ejhw.text: The service wasn't so good. I had to wait ten min for them to get to me and the lady that was helping me out didn't  seem like she was in a good mood also.   I got a take out(Chicken katsu). When I arrived home, I found out they forgot to put the katsu sauce in there.. Which pretty much ruined a perfect meal.

jg9u_lwdoW6r5yHVUfZMcA.text: my parents and I decided to eat here because we love Hawaiian food. It wasn't our first time here, but tonight was the first time we were disappointed out of all the times we've eaten here... it's a Friday night, I was excited Bc there was live music which I always enjoy. my parents ordered the Aloha Friday special which is choice of pork lau lau or Kalua pig with rice, Mac salad, lomi lomi And Haupia... I ordered the Korean chicken, which was very good -- no complaints about that! However, the aloha Friday special was very disappointing.. Our server told us in advance that they ran out of lomi lomi and for both the Lau Lau and Kalua pig, it would be $7 extra and I told her that's fine.. Soo when we got the aloha Friday special plate, there was Lau Lau + Mac salad + rice and a bowl of Kalua pig on the side.. when we finished our plate, I asked the server if we're getting our Haupia and she said, "oh, we ran out of that too." -__- my only reaction was "WOW!" all I could do was shake my head.. if she told me that both the lomi lomi and Haupia they ran out off, In advance, then We woulda ordered something else but server failed to mention all.. seriously though, you might as well have said that they were sold out of the aloha Friday special instead of serving half the plate.. I basically paid for a full entree, but only get 34 of the order.. That's crazy to me.. for the aloha Friday special, it cost me $18.75 ($11 for the lau Lau, rice, and Mac salad + $7.75 for the bowl of Kalua pig) that was NOT WORTH THE PRICE! Our server should've offered something to compensate what they ran out of OR discount the price of the plate!!! would you pay that much for 34 of what you ordered?! hell no! I will post a picture to reference this review and owners and workers of island flavor, please tell me if that aloha special plate was worth $18.75 Bc I can tell you and others I've shared this with can tell you it's not!!! and then you got the nerve to charge me full price?! Or not even offer anything to compensate for the lomi lomi and Haupia?! I'm not one to complain but that just made our experience tonight, a horrible one.. I still tipped, only 10% because the service could have been better.. Our server didn't even smile once to us or the table next to us.. and she didn't even check up on us, not once.. Island flavor should really take this into consideration.. You shouldn't be charging your customers full price and not give them the full order.. It's not fair.. I left a comment on the receipt as well.. so please take this as constrictive criticism.. the next time we eat here, I don't want to have another experience like this..

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. reference to my review-aloha Friday special plate (on the left-Lau Lau + Mac salad + rice with a bowl of Kalua pig) worth $18.75

2FzBcOewTfmxMu9Ir9tk6g.text: Whoa, a good plate lunch place in the desert!   Its not exactly Hawaii's plate lunch but nothing wrong with some reinterpretation for mainland taste (mashed potatoes as an option instead of rice, or chicken katsu with brown gravy; huh?)  The teri steak, teri chicken, and kalbi are just as good as any back home.  All are deeply marinated, lightly charred, cooked well done, and served messy over rice and mac salad. Win!  The Portuguese bean soup and oxtail soup are also both good but can't top the best back home.    The plates are large.   Prices are EXTREMELY high.  At around $10 per plate, its even more expensive than most Hawaii plate lunch restaurants.  Unfortunate since you can get so much more for your money elsewhere off the Strip.

sRIKjrh-SQYuw7o-LuArJQ.text: Overall food was great.. Furikake chicken was awesome and could probably feed 2.. Teri chix was also good.. Saimin was pretty bland and probably wouldn't order that again .. That's why the minus 1 star. Need more seasoning in the broth, it actually tasted like hot water with my noodles. Can't even compare to frozen S&S.

bEMKBCcp-Bsc5y-nm_sFYg.text: AWESOME food and service!  Brings you back home with their menu and flavors.  Outstanding service....and Chantily cake and Coco Puffs

NUTpZ6qRvlPBAFSefrJxQQ.text: Food here brings me back to vacation in Hawaii! Portions are huge and food is consistently good. Haven't ordered something that I wasn't satisfied with, even the side salad is tasty.  Chicken katsu is crispy and juicy, teriyaki steak is tender and flavorful.  Fresh poke in three different varieties. Daily specials are great as well, I really like the short ribs.

WYDrZ0AEwHqVOHqCknVEFw.text: I had the oxtail soup, to go. It comes with two sides; Mac salad (in a tiny clear plastic cup) and white rice (2 scoops).  The soup was okay, would be perfect for a cold winter day. My personal preference as for oxtail is for the fat to be trimmed off before it is cooked. . But I let inner fat girl have her way and I slaughtered  it. Well, not really slaughtered it-i have left overs as they give you the soup in two cups. It's only three oxtails in the soup, they're an overall healthy portion. Atmosphere, friendly but I don't think ill make it back to this establishment in a hurry. .but you might like it.

3I7xgS3R5v_AMjuCfu1NXQ.text: My son loves the teriyaki chicken plate from here. I usually order their kalua pig and cabbage with extra cabbage. Both comes with macaroni salad and two scoops of rice. I would recommend this place for casual lunch or dinner.

2qd2nGtWwUqN8hXfZIqujg.text: DELICIOUS!! First time have Island food and it did not disappoint. The Guava cake is the $***!!

_Kr_fLdGZ4JBQfMCITCA4g.text: Good food reminds me of home. The adobo omelet is really salty but I guess that's adobo for you.

05srwE7Kp-5_JT6KZZdDgg.text: No joke, some of the best food I have ever had in my entire life! Here's what I tried:  -spicy avocado poke: incredibly fresh! It's not spicy at all but it is very flavorful. I preferred this one over the furikake poke (they have 3 kinds of poke) -furikake poke: also incredibly fresh with much more complex flavors than the spicy avocado poke. This is 100% preference of tastes as one poke is not better than the other...it's just very different flavors. The furikake poke has more of a kick and spice to it but not spice as in hotness...more kind of like how pepper adds a certain heavy spice. I just prefer to taste the raw tuna and the furikake's seasonings are stronger than the spicy avocado tuna. Again, both delicious just your preference.  -fried rice: I only got this as a side but man are they generous! It comes as a pretty big pile and they even add pork and chicken in it which I didn't expect. I thought it would just be like Panda Express fried rice, lol. I love fried rice over steamed. Very good pick! -furikake chicken: one of the best things I have ever had in my entire life. Please skip all other chicken dishes and just do this one. The flavor and crispness is just...OMG unexplainable, lol. Don't read about it...just go eat it, lol. Words don't do it justice! It comes with a big pile of steamed rice and macaroni salad, like typical Hawaiian dishes.  Portions are very big, prices are fair, place is clean but very busy so come outside if their lunch and dinner rushes if you hate that. If not, just prepare for a mild wait.   The only tip I have for management if they read this review  is maybe to direct traffic a little better. There is a sign that says to wait to be seated so people come in and we all end up piling on top of each other by the front door blocking it to other customers coming in and out. After ten minutes of standing, we were all asked if we signed in. We didn't know we had to so about 3 families including us all went to the front desk to sign in. I'm fine with waiting but it is very disorganized. Maybe having a waiting area not right in front of the door and having the sign say to please sign in will avoid the messy traffic jam.  But, you will love this place. I cannot wait to go back!

U3Y0MWYr35CWkxKsPOWRCQ.text: Food is great and worth the wait.  The wait is a result of many repeat customers who are addicted to their food.

rl7rsYmBxWFzNAQoP_kYug.text: My favorite dish: Furikake Chicken - you have to come here simply to have this!  My must have special: Smoked Meat - not sure what day it is on, but this stuff is good!  My ultimate guilty dessert pleasure: Kona Mud Cake or Bread Pudding; both are equally yummy.  My fiance is in love with this place and every time he comes to Vegas, we have to go here at least once. But we have double tapped this joint during our visits many times. You simply cannot go wrong with any dish here. Our ultimate favorite is the Furikake Chicken, but I also like the fresh poke, the Friday Lau Lau serving, and of course breakfast with Portuguese sausage. Some folks rave that the Kalbi ribs here are bomb, but to me they're just ok.

JzUlAdqqkFF_PX7c9LKTiw.text: I really needed to just say that their chicken Katsu loco moco with fried rice under neath and a sunny side egg.. Is definitely my death row last meal.  This place is over 20 miles from my house BUT it's so good!   I got here at about 8 with a friend and after seeing the help pictures, I had to order this dish.  And after my cousins recommendations,  The portion is huge! It's a huge bowl, think pho bowl, with real quality pork fried rice on the bottom. This fried rice is so good! I'd eat it by itself.   Then there's a heaping portion of chicken Katsu, the light brown gravy, and the egg on top.  I like the option of having the egg cooked how you like, although I'm sure a True hawaain may correct me on the style the egg should be cooked.  Everything was such good quality and although my mouth was willing, my stomache was not and I had to take half to go.  The service was super fast and super nice and I overall loved this place.  I'll definitely be back whenever I'm on the south west side of town.

2vBdNxVV8WBNzWEn9a_YKA.text: Food almost always comes out quick. Friendly staff, clean venue with nice Hawaiian ambience. What makes this place legit are the constant island people who always dine here when I come.

Sq_oyy5xVaQ7dc_n7RFLtA.text: My favorite place to get Hawaiian food in Vegas! A must try is their chicken Katsu loco moco over fried rice! The portion is huge! I think it would feed me for 3 meals! Their poke is good. I'm sure everything on the menu is yummy. But make sure to save room for dessert!

CJvz_2LreNSx7Gm_hzaEmA.text: Decided to stop here for breakfast on the way to Redrock.  I had the Loco Moco with a side of fries and wife had the Portuguese sausage and eggs with a side of mac salad.  The portions here are incredible.  The fries came in a bowl that would equate to 8 large orders of McDonalds' fries.  It is the first time I have not been able to finish an order of Loco Moco - it was a huge patty with generous gravy and a "pot" of rice.  With that being said, service was so-so and food quality was average compared to other Hawaiian food out there.  So three stars it is...

LRlSnnkVh_xvVdvbv8cDGA.text: Used to be my favorite place but the prices aren't worth it anymore. Paying noticeably more for noticeably less. Tried to call in my order but apparently they don't accept cash orders for pick up over the phone anymore. Too hot outside for that. Uncomfortable place to wait for 20 mins when it's busy, especially for a salad (which they changed  on me:( . Also take musubis off the menu if you don't make them anymore, always just told they are out every time I order. Time to find a new spot, cutting too many corners now... 2 stars because staff was nice.

BbdBnO9LKXo2blxX9JR21Q.text: 5 starts because of Lei. Although there were a couple mistakes on our order, Lei took care of us and made our visit a great one. So thank you Lei! Love coming here because of the portion size, one plate could feed two people.

WjBe-QahRC20oweU4q6Tgw.text: It's no surprise that I love Hawaiian food to my friends. I have recently been surprised as to the quantity of good Hawaiian places in Las Vegas. Island Flavor was recommended by a colleague and I was game. It's a lot further away from most everything, but absolutely worth the drive. I hope you are hungry when you go, because they give you enough to feed one army and at a reasonable price. Loco Moco was broke da mouth! Will be back fo sho when I go come back to town!

oSDN0VWzW7dgZVJL80i8Jw.text: Came here on a Saturday around 5:30 pm and was able to be seated right away.  For some reason I thought this was a place where you would go up to the counter to order, but it is an actual sit down restaurant.  The place is a little dark, but I think they keep it that way to keep it cool and the shades are pulled to prevent the sun from blinding you.  Anyways service was friendly and the portion sizes are extremely generous here!   We ordered: -1/2 pound of Spicy Avocado Poke ($7.25) - tuna tasted fresh, the sauce they put on top had a nice kick to it, served with raw onions and wontons, the wontons underneath soaked up the shoyu sauce and was a little on the salty side, otherwise super good -Lau Lau Special ($11) - steamed pork served in taro leaf with 2 sides, we picked side of white rice, mac salad and it came with some type of coconut jello dessert, mac salad was solid, the pork itself was pretty good could be seasoned a little bit more though -Chicken Katsu ($9) - deep fried to perfection, crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, came with side of mac salad and rice -Mixed Plate with Roast Pork and Kalbi Ribs ($11.25) - kalbi ribs cost $1 extra I believe, had the mixed salad with a tasty dressing as one side, added on fried rice for extra $2 as other side, both the roast pork and kalbi ribs were so flavorful! -Spam Musubi ($2) - they forgot to bring this out to us so we had to ask another worker to bring it, generous helping of rice inside, the seaweed didn't even wrap all the way around the musubi, regardless it was delicious   Will definitely be back when I'm in the mood for Hawaiian food with generous portion sizes!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Avocado Poke - $7.25
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate with Roast Pork and Kalbi Ribs - $11.25, additional $1 for Kalbi, additional $2 for fried rice side, total $14.25
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu - $9

7yjXOYKvCWLbeKXZewqmcQ.text: I saw some pics on Instagram of Island Flavor and decided to roll up for dinner. In a small strip mall area near Rhodes Ranch sits this little gem. It's a medium size dinning area but it fills up fast.  I ordered a spam masubi to start. A decent sized masubi and flavorful. For my entree I did the combo platter with the Kalbi and Furiake chicken. I definitely made the right choices. Kalbi was some of the best I had in Vegas and Furiake was crisp and flavorful. The plate comes with rice and Mac salad. I upgraded to pork fried rice. They give you a hefty portion so I had enough for a filling lunch the next day. Can't wait to go back and try some more of their selections.

fNqP8QfJiOVexUZMIbhnTQ.text: I know another update? I want share food experience with my fellow yelpers plus there more then couple things on any menu. I tried the kailua and cabbage. It was winnah! The kailua had just right amount of saltiness, moist, juicy, and hand picked/shredded. The thing enjoy about this version at Island Flavor is the cabbage not julienne cut so dig in get best of both worlds kailua and cabbage. Or hell if want cabbage in one bite then kailua all you. Again not emphasis portion size got love LOCAL food best deal under ten bucks lunch or dinner.   I tried the banana bread pudding. Honestly ok. I never really got any hint of banana in the bread pudding and not as dense. That just my personnel preference. Now the haupia cake still reigns supreme out of the desserts had at Island Flavor.   One thing forget mention is only local style they have heat warmer that keeps spam musubi wrapped individual portion ready too go. Like pay the bill and take some spam musubi for late night snack or munchie. Yay!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kailua pig and cabbage action!

zP0fkU58V0M0dsCpvygApA.text: My second time here and I'm not sure if I posted a review the first due to food coma.   We've tried: Kalbi and loved it. Loco moco with brown rice and loved it. Furikake shrimp and loved it. Shoyu poke and loved it. But today's special was hoisin baby back ribs and it was out of this world. Meat was falling off the bone. I really enjoyed this plate. I'm def calling ahead of time just for these ribs. I hope they put it on the menu cuz it made my day for sure.  I made the mistake last time and ordered way to much food. I ordered poke for appetizer last time and I could of ate that for my meal by itself it was huge.   Service is always great, place is always packed cuz the food portions are huge and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi ribs up top. Hoisin baby back ribs today&#39;s special and all I gotta say is I can eat this everyday!

ZbBCcIvdplIUUgc7OlMrhw.text: Came here while visiting in Vegas, and I ordered their ahi poke. OMG I fell in love! I've never had such thick chunks of poke before and I love onions also. They were not cheap about how much fish they give. I have never ever gotten full off of poke where I couldn't finish. Good job!  I also tried their kalbi ribs and it was delicious.   Service was nice and they were always there to fill up our drinks.  My cousin made an order difficult in my opinion and they got it right with a smile on their face.   Everything about this place screams HAWAII !   Whenever I come back to Vegas I will be sure to stop by here again.  I recommend their poke and their kalbi ribs

yNGy-sV6XiCaQ1E4MwPexw.text: What is left to say. This is one of the few places you dont ever have to worry about being dissapointed. The staff is always great, the food is always great and the portions are large.   My favorites include the korean chicken, saimen and steak tips.   I wish they would open a location in the north and expand the breakfast menu. My wife wishes they made malasadas but we are always too full for desert anyway.

E8fJV1QIYDdK38om5DfWnw.text: Best Hawaiian food ever. Service is good and are cool people. Atmosphere is casual and chill. The portion size are massive! Furikake chicken and fried rice is my favorite.

mwC5aQS9ycqCc-dsl6268w.text: This place is our favorite! We love Hawaiian food and this place does it the best. Everything is delicious and they give you huge portions! We love bringing our family here. We usually order the short ribs, teriyaki chicken, steak with onions and gravy, kalua pig with cabbage, rice, macaroni salad and spam musubi. Yum!!

ZTdRWneJY1lvksRXx8mZCg.text: I may have gained most of my vacation weight from Island Flavor. Also, the super friendly staff is even nice to a bunch of unruly tourists. Nine of us came through and ordered a lot of things off the menu, some from our own fat desires and some from the staff suggestions.  Hoisin Glazed Ribs - Good but a little extra saucy. The ribs fell off the bone and is great with the rice. Ahi Poke - Probably the best part of the meal. Order the big big portion and share. If you talk to the staff nicely, they'd be willing to give you portions of each kind they have. My favorite was the shoyu or sesame. Light in flavor but not completely lackluster. Kalbi Short Ribs - The flavor is akin to many of the korean style ribs but a little sweet. Hawaiin Style Pork Roast - Great tender pork. Hands down some good flavor. Loco Moco - It was Hawaiian food and we felt obligated to order this. Would we do it again, maybe but I'd have to reduce how much we ordered. I think since we ordered so much food, I wasn't able to enjoy this meal as much as I'd have liked.  I may have found my far off the strip place to eat. Damn good and worth the drive away from the craziness of the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

44BfDlN3xguYpUAMUeOz3g.text: Always my go to spot for some amazing food and big portions on the southwest side. Seems like it's under new management taste hasn't changed much, but seems like only 2 kalbi strips are given now in the mixed plate instead of 3 for the same $2 extra pricing plus they cut it now though still noticed it's less than before. Also thought it was weird now $1 charge for beef or shrimp on mixed plate.

4xVDYXjqt_GZH95tSUbaFA.text: You Say You're Looking for that "Aloha Spirit" on the 9th Island? Well, Look No More....  This Local Eatery is Definitely One of Many Hawaiian Restaurants to Try on the South East Side of Nevada! The Customer Service is "Da Bomb" or Excellent!  The Establishment Itself is a Little Small, but kept Very Clean! There is a Restroom which is also Maintained Very Well! The Portions are Very Generous- Meaning 2 People can Easily Share a Plate! Prices are Very Reasonable & There is Plenty of Parking!   The One Thing that Made Me Sway More Toward this Eatery is Because they had My Chantilly Cake, Which I Could Not Find Anywhere in Nevada!   The Location is on Durango, Near Rhodes Ranch on the Left Side of the Road!  Guarantee...I'll Be Back!!!  =)  Happy Yelping, Guys and Gals!

xLu6Joi8zw5shhNmr0l5Qg.text: Came here on a Sunday lunch time and it's packed, lucky we only have two people and got seated in five minutes, it's really loud inside as everyone is talking and the kids crying too, (deduct one star for the noise level)...anyway we order the furikake chicken and the seared ahi tuna steak with mango salsa, chicken is crispy outside and tender inside, tuna is fresh, could use a bit more sauce though, price and service is on par, portion is huge, overall both are delicious...will try more stuffs next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seared Ahi tuna steaks with mango salsa... by frank w.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken with rice and macaroni.... by frank w.

a9re_tMvx6iYiPndZ2J7DQ.text: I'm so glad I found this place! Thanks to hubby's auntie who lives locally, she said "food tastes close to home" & she's right! I'm making it a goal to try everything on the menu. However, the short ribs & furikake shrimp will always be my go-to. Spicy avocado poke is hella delicious too! Every time I'm in Las Vegas, I'm coming here.

riOqCfsC0IfLEhS8ck3XyQ.text: Absolutely nothing bad to say about this place. The portions are humongous, prices are miniscule. I never leave hungry or dissatisfied. Every time I come in here it's full or getting full.   Please give their Chantilly cake a try! You won't be disappointed!

RiuhLjcXBwjsTDWQi6x51A.text: Service is superb! Large potions and food is very delicious. Went to Hawaii early this year and food is authentic. Hidden gem!

09nyPT2TkM1iVFDAx8Hqbw.text: This is by far the best hawaiian bbq I've ever had...I love their chicken, I don't even think it needs the teriyaki sauce. I always ask for it on  the side because the chicken is flavorful enough. The macaroni salad is also great...and I just love how convenient it is to order on yelp

asbRwhzYkgY8XFi27Lrrww.text: Great food and good service...you'll get waaayyyyy more food then u can handle well at least for me. Literally more then two days and less then 10 dollars and on Friday's they have a live band

ScDehvNqZdOCVv58DzKIYw.text: I have been here many times, my favorite Hawaiian food.  Beautiful salads, excellent poke, and ribs. I have never been disappointed. The food is tasty, plentiful, and very reasonably priced.

H8HZrV_I5e7qgiVJENqu8Q.text: I don't normally yelp. But today I had tried island flavor for the first time. And it was ONO! Worth yelping.  I ordered  Kalbi, was tasty! Furikake chicken... amazing! Portion size, huge. When I left I had extra food that made another plate lunch. Yes that's how much food they give. Must try!!! Friendly ladies that was working as well! I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9IUOnHQn-NwXarzFKjMQuQ.text: I typically check yelp scores before walking into a new restaurant. I drove by this place SO many times without giving it a chance because I stereotyped it. After getting a haircut at the barbershop next door, I was hungry and desperate so I walked in here for takeout. Boy oh boy this place is pretty darn good. Shoyu chicken is the Thursday special and its a sweet type of adobo that tastes great. The Kalbi short ribs are thick and VERY delicious. As a Korean guy, I'm telling you this is the best ribs in town! I don't think we have had anything we didn't like here. I highly recommend this place.

6gRUgE22BmRy7qaADofPHA.text: Dining in is a totally different experience altogether. My husband was jonesing for some legit Hawaiian comfort food so after church we knew where that destination would be. The fried rice omelet with Portuguese sausage definitely hit the spot for him. That perfect bite comprised of fried rice, egg, sausage and big chunks of char siu was like a time machine bringing him back to his roots. Hahaha it's that good! Also on the line up was Loco Moco, Furikake chicken and shrimp and Roast pork with gravy. All equally good and robust, oozing with flavor in every bite. And for the win, a Chantilly cake to go! Portions seem way larger when dining in, either way we will definitely be back again and again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy for Loco Moco!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken and shrimp
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate: Furikake Chicken and Roast pork

x7BGEVIgbq_gcSPyK51cHA.text: We went in to place our order to go and I got Kalbi short ribs and spam musubi. Both were a bit too salty like what previous yelpers have mentioned. The mac salad is one of the best I've had in Vegas. Reason for 2 star is due to the service. It was my very first time here and the lady taking our order wasn't very welcoming. She was at another table holding a customers baby, laughing and chatting with them but as soon as she went back to the counter, her aloha spirit was gone. She didn't greet us or the other customers when we went in or thank us when we left.

G37cwCAZ0ZBUsq7EHi95ww.text: Always busy, cause the food is great! Portions are good, always have enough for leftovers for the next day even after a full belly. Only time we had an issue with food was when they burnt the chicken to the garden salad. My grandma put it to the side and the server hadn't checked on our table till we asked for the bill (a helper brought the food over and another server refilled out drinks). But our server came back with the bill and mentioned to us then that he took off the meat from the bill and just charged us for a regular salad because he didn't realize how bad the cooks had burnt the chicken and apologized for them and for him not having seen it sooner. I appreciate it!

A7R3AKKPDGzm2TU1n1o96A.text: A must when we go to Las Vegas! The food was delicious, I couldn't decide what to order, I wanted everything on the menu!! I decided on the teriyaki steak and shrimp combo and I Loved it! Can't wait to go back in Feb. Service is a little lacking, that's the reason for my 4 star, but they make it up in Flavor!

bolhSGNwbSz44CpBUwyvjA.text: After awaking from a long first night, we had built up our appetites. Since a couple of my friends were craving spam and eggs, this was the first place I thought of. I had this bookmarked in Yelp for awhile.   When walking into Island Flavor, I felt like I was on vacation! Well, I was already on vacation anyway. I meant to stay vacationing on the big island of Hawaii. The restaurant wasn't busy and accommodated our group of five guys easily. Since I was the only one who wasn't craving spam and eggs, I went for my next best choice. The Chicken katsu loco moco.  The menu offerings looked so tasty, but I wanted to stick with the egg themed entree' at our table. When I got my loco moco, I felt like I was in a eating competition. The bowl that my meal was served in was huge! I had  generous portions of chicken katsu and rice. I didn't want to use the gravy, so I opted it on the side and get the katsu sauce instead. The chicken katsu was nice and crispy from the breading, yet tender inside with the chicken. The egg was a perfectly cooked sunny side up egg.  Mixing the yolk with the white rice is always the best!  The staff here were very helpful and attentive. If your ever in Vegas and craving some authentic Hawaiian food, check out Island Flavor and give them a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu loco moco with gravy on the side and katsu sauce.

GxnW-60IEAb4iptDZmN-nA.text: Not even going to lie, this place isn't close to the strip. If you don't have your own ride, don't bother. You'll spend more for the cab ride then the food itself. However, if you dig that island grind brah, have your own means of transportation, and don't mind driving out southwest of the strip then this is a good spot to try.  We had some peeps meet us up in Vegas from that cold country to the north of us. They requested "Hawaiian" and after some research, Island Flavor was the chosen spot. Most people would've probably said to hit up the Cal hotel in downtown LV, but since I've been there before, I figured a new spot would be more interesting.  Heidi our server was funny and very friendly. She had that legit Hawaiian accent and looked like she can beat me to a pulp if I acted up on her. She suggested the sesame poke to share. A full order is a whopping $18 so we went with the half order for $9. The tuna was surprisingly fresh, the sauce was perfect, and the block cuts of fish were generous. There was enough to share between four people. The full order would've been overkill. I've never found a place that served decent poke except when on the Hawaiian Islands. I think Island Flavor proved me that good poke can exist on the mainland.   The entrees here are no joke ginormous. I had the katsu chicken loco moco. I mean, talk about a heart attack waiting to happen. Fried, battered chicken, over rice, TWO egg cooked the way you prefer it, topped with this thick and rich gravy sauce that dominates the entire bowl. I worked half way into it and instantly ran into a wall. It wasn't even a subtle build up to getting full, it was as if my brain told me, "Stop now, you're done." By no means was this a negative thing. The katsu loco moco gets an applaud by my standards and if you can conquer this beast of a dish, I give you mad props. It can easily be shared between two people.  Got to sample some other goodies from my company like the Korean bbq short ribs, macaroni salad, omelet Portuguese sausage fried rice. All were tasty but every ounce of my concentration was zeroed on my katsu loco moco. In the end, man lost, food won. Togo boxes please. On a side note, we ate the left over cold the following day and it was fine.  Overall, this was a pretty good spot. I'd recommend this little Hawaiian joint for those of you willing to drive a little away from the strip and try something different then fancy hotel food. The prices were decent and the service was great. There definitely was an authentic island taste here. Be ready and bring your Polynesian sized appetite because you're going to need it. Only downfall was that they don't serve musubi!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Short Ribs ($9.25)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Regular Loco Moco ($8.75)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu Loco Moco ($8.75)

I-msZkS2iAAY9gfUm8uOjQ.text: I am afraid to write a review for this place because it's my favorite Hawaiian place. It gets really busy during dinner time as is. If you want real Hawaiian cooking then come here. They even had a live band on Friday night I think. Anyway, they played my in law's favorites including I Miss You My Hawai'i. The lady was pretty good I guess, for she left him and the better half misty eyed. I was gnawing on my food but she had a pleasant voice for sure.  We ordered a bunch of items including kalbi, loco moco, and Kalua pig of course. We also ordered the coconut dessert which is white and gelatinous, served cold. I think it's called oompia? I can never remember the names properly and am pretty ignorant of customs and pronunciation. The first time I went to Hawai'i I thought they were all pretty rude bc they kept sticking their fingers at me driving down the road giving me the Shaka. I am not a fan of the 1 finger salute normally. J/K BTW. It was delicious. I am not a sweets eating person and I enjoyed it.  Don't get this place mixed up with Island Style on Sahara. The last time I ate there to satisfy my Kalua pork craving before a big entrance exam, it was pretty food courtish. The pork was overly done as in sitting under a heat lamp kind of overdone. Flavor was just lacking. Indigestion in bed was complimentary. They give you peanuts at that place but the unwelcomed flies that were fighting me for my food made it less than memorable. You do Kung fu chopsticks with the fly on one hand while trying to eat with the other. This kind of callanetics I don't need. Rest assured you need not worry about them here. The place is very clean.

NH68W6CmZwfgSme90ZeNxg.text: For my island crave, this place is definitely my first pick.  The food are amazing and the serving are huge.  The services are always great. My favorites the bbq ribs and the oxtail soup.  My husband love their Loco Moco.

kmK-sM8YzCKeLjQufF-cVg.text: The food here is delicious. I got the mixed plate which had chicken katsu and the kalbi short ribs with rice. The portions are huge and really filling. Best Hawaiian food I've ever tried. Only downside is that the restaurant is tiny so wait times are a bit long.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xlkk5e5d_HCp9egkIujHyw.text: My husband came here a few months ago and said it was so good.... came here today... the location is about 15 min off the strip... in a nice area... we came at about 11am... not too busy... ordered furikake chicken and hamburger steak combo... the food was so good... staff was nothing but friendly and efficient... about 1130, the place filled up and was very busy...  the chicken, very tasty and crunchy... something different but so good... hamburger steak was huge, grilled to perfection, topped with onions and mushrooms and gravy... everything was yummy!  Also, before we left, we packed up our leftovers, and they even gave us a to-go cup of Pepsi!  Who does that these days?!  Love this place, will most definitely be back!!!

fOJj7TAsrU0WnCxoRjZtcg.text: Food is outstanding, service can be a little slow sometimes. Although I think that's just because they are always so busy!! We frequent them when we want Hawaiian food

MBMxf5hUUVs_Fqs9CVOOEA.text: This is where the locals eat. It gets very busy. There was a lot of food that looked good. But I was craving homey type food so I got the loco moco and spam & eggs. The loco moco really hit the spot with its seasoned beef patty. The spam for some reason was super salty and kind of ruin that dish. The musubi on the other hand was good and not salty at all.

f8GRInq1GTKFarxQA1SIgw.text: When this place first opened, I used to drive all the way from Green Valley just to come here - I was addicted to the amazing haupia cake (freshly baked at the bakery next door). The food was also good, enormous portions and the waitress Heidi was so crazy and fun. Over the years, quality and size went down significantly, so I stopped going a while ago. It's ironic because I now live on the SW side of town, and drive to Island Sushi, which is down the street from where I used to live. Anyway...   I've kind of rediscovered Island Flavor because a couple friends still really like it. I resisted for a while but finally gave it a try, and the quality and large portions seem to be back. I think all the original people are gone, so maybe it was sold, but they got rid of that huge counter that took up the whole middle of the restaurant and added more tables and chairs. New layout is better, and I'm loving their furikake chicken even more than my old fav the off-menu katsu dip (chicken katsu dipped in korean chicken sauce). Even their mac salad seems better, although Island Sushi's potato mac salad is still my all time fav for plate lunch.   The owner of Island Sushi was working in the kitchen last week for some reason (no he didn't buy it) so maybe that's what the change is. Whatever the reason - I love this place again! Although I tried their new to me dessert - haupia ice cream pie. It wasn't very good - tasted like cheap coconut ice cream, smelled like suntan lotion. I'm sticking with the haupia cake.   They're also open a little later and  7 days a week now. Not sure if they still close for about a month around xmas/new years though.

RWUCmCWciZzFq8trM5OKVQ.text: Glad I found this place. Amazing food, great quality and service. Definitely will be back!!

AawLOQv7dWmJHRLmLecIKg.text: Nah mean the grinds. Great place to come to get your hawaii grinds fix. Ono to the max laddat

vSuNSCjilchRr8mE5q_C-Q.text: Amazing service onolicious grinds! We love the big island feeling you gotta try the Haupia and guava cake it's to die for!! Poke salad and furikake chicken was the bomb!! Mahalo Nui loa

i6sx6PMYlmjLl0EtTHnFXA.text: My favorite Hawaiian Restaurant here in Las Vegas.  My go to spot when friends and relatives visit. This is an great find. A very clean and friendly place. The staff is very friendly and attentive.  It is located in a little strip mall but never had a problem finding parking. The Furikake Chicken totally rocks this place.  They serve up some good Kalbi and I love the Saimin.  You can't go wrong with either the Chantilly or the Haupia cakes.  The only weak point, for me, is the Kalua Pua'a. It lacks the smoky saltiness and is a little bland for me.   This is a great find that I think you'd really enjoy and should not miss.

RpaMjX1gqxrRjOMB5XlIXQ.text: This is a casual little spot, not too fancy but nice for a relaxing meal. If you've ever been to Hawaii and are looking for authentic food from the Islands, this is the place. Da best.   We've been here twice now and I have to tell you that the Furikake chicken is at the top of my recommendation list. I've never had it before, but will have it many times again. I suggest trying something besides the teriyaki chicken or beef, only because you can get that anywhere. We tried Guava cake for dessert, thinking it might be too exotic for us but we were feeling adventurous (and they were out of everything else). It was delicious and the moistest cake I've ever had.    Venture from your comfort zone and try real Hawaiian food. I know I was glad that I did.   RECOMMENDED

8oUgYLsSt_KDPLpCv550cw.text: DESSERT!!!!! AMAZING!   Where has this lil gem been hiding! We came here to eat dessert and it was packed! After I saw that I knew we were in right place!   We sat down and ordered the following    Haupia Cake  Bread Pudding Chantilly Cake  Kona Coffee Mud Cake  Not just with the first bite but every single bite was an eye closer! When you put that fork in your mouth with that fluffy Chantilly cake you close your eyes and need a moment of  silence!   We only went for dessert and will be coming back for food! Service is great, casual relax place!   One of the best desserts I have had in my life!    Ps  portions are big! Share with friends we did and still had leftovers!

GQ7lPKPc5VWujhG88j94Pw.text: Got the chicken katsu. All the chicken was awesome, no crappy pieces like you sometimes get at LandL. Really good food!

swlI27Nl28K1yLogzD-PVQ.text: I'm from out of town and was looking for lunch on my way back to the Strip from a visit to Red Rock Canyon. Both Yelp and Google reviews for this place were excellent so we stopped in. Great food, and a lot of it. The chicken loco moco might be the greatest hangover cure in history. Friendly service too. Don't let the bland strip mall exterior distract you.

QMidXO27vQLu8ww2fc6F6Q.text: A bit of a drive, but well worth it. Service was friendly and eager to explain ingredients and preparation. Food was delicious and fresh, portions were huge. We started off with the Poke appetizer. Very fresh, full of flavor, the full portion easily could serve as a filling meal.  Moved on to the kalbi short ribs and furikake chicken, both fantastic. Sides of macaroni salad and rice hit the spot. Coco puff dessert was good, but with an odd butterscotch frosting. The consistency was grainy and lacked flavor. The restaurant is very family friendly, complete with many kids running about. The vibe is very friendly and warm. This style of food is a bit heavy to say the least, and I won't be able to do this weekly, but I am already planning what to eat on my next visit. Hopefully soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke Salad

knWiDLH0fU0ZHNQxJjNRnw.text: Its probably a lucky thing for me that this place is on the opposite side of town, because otherwise I might live here. I spent 20 years in Hawai'i, and I know my Hawaiian BBQ, and this is as good as the best I've had in Hawai'i and by far the best outside of it.  The portions are heavy, they use great quality cuts of meat (not like the fatty gristly cheap stuff you too often find), and they serve with Aloha. My absolute favorite is the beef teriyaki steak which is always perfectly done. My girlfriend loves the fried poke salad, which I often share with her, and is truly great. If you're able to manage dessert after eating all of that, the Guava cake is definitely worth trying.   Now aside from being the best Hawaiian BBQ in town, they truly live Aloha. I wont give all the details other than to say that yesterday I went there, and despite a bad situation (which had nothing to do with the restaurant) the management showed me an act of kindness that blew my mind. I cannot recommend this place enough.

0MBCYUjtEbnN94K_83h_vw.text: Really tasty and authentic food! Not many healthier (non-fried) options on the menu, but this isn't a place you would visit to have a healthy meal! The teriyaki chicken is really great! Awesome customer service, too! Even servers who weren't assigned to us were checking in on us ensuring we enjoyed our experience!

-E38x5pLWEJu_mGToLBG4g.text: Best Hawaiian place in Las Vegas! Deserts are the best! It's out west and I drive clear from Henderson to eat here when I want Hawaiian food.

II5y1iJ3Ff9_sgL7M4Ul_Q.text: I cannot believe that such a place that serves delicious food is brought to one star due to horrible service. I always get the Ahi Poke with a scoop of rice and a scoop of macaroni salad. It's very good, but on September 25 approximately 3:15pm, their credit card system was down. I had called in advance to place my order since I was not going to dine in. When I told the younger lady if I needed to pay with cash since the front of the door had a sign that said "cash only", she said yes. I informed her that I was not told that on the phone. She then proceeded on telling me that I could go to the gas station nearby and use their ATM ..I said no it's going to charge me, I'm not doing that.   The whole time she did not apologize at the fact that I drove far and they didn't tell me it was cash only at that time . She then said, "I'll try" with an attitude. The card went through. She got the receipt for me to print and after I signed it she went to get the food, brought it back, and walked away. The whole time no "here you go" "thank you" "I apologize" nothing.   Sad thing is that I would go very often and witnessed so many other issues. One day a group of three ordered their food and it took forever and they purposely left the food intact as soon as it arrived and left.   The first time I went, they took 30 minutes to serve us and it was the wrong order.   I really wanted to give it a shot because of their food, but trust me, some of the people that work there will not smile or serve you well unless you are Hawaiian.   Also, be careful when you order ahi poke, they don't tell you they have an option of half a pound. They will always give you the full pound.  I would suggest you pass this place unless you like rude customer service and long waits.

FGUMv1KoahBlm3ltmmOWcA.text: I have been here twice, one dine in and one to-go. I am a chicken Katsu addict so I get that all the time from any Hawaiian restaurant. I love their chicken Katsu and chicken furikake. I also ordered some spam musubi that disappointed me. Basically, my spam was covered in between two thick rice. The whole thing was too much rice. It's like a treasure hunt for my spam. I am not going to get any more spam musubi from them. I'd rather go to L&L for that.

L2_wjeis5uCxJ6KFNUOYLw.text: Food wasn't as good as expected, ordered a split plate and brought out a wrong item. Big portions and service was average not attentive.

lAMPHE3iXuQDghXDvppZZA.text: This place is by far one of the best Hawaiian food spots in Las Vegas. All is good but spicy alvacado  poke is by far my favorite.

YRQdT8M4kSqXXnIfU-DN1Q.text: Ahhh!! They forgot my Haupia which is the main reason I got their special.  My lomi salmon was salty too!! I definitely hope this place is not going down hill after the opening of their second location.

hC2Fwrr5BMR6uZSaZDW0PQ.text: Teri beef is the winna!    It is actually a teriyaki steak, cut up.    I had the tossed salad on the side and it was a generous portion.    Definitely recommended!

i8KF1oSEAc8uDbMbbZwIbw.text: Love local food so was happy to try this place. It was a good substitute for local grinds but not quite as good as the real thing. Musubi appetizer was a high point. My husband loved his chicken katsu loco moco-- other reviews were accurate, the portion was HUGE. My chicken katsu was a little plain and the sauce was flat. I didn't find the kalbi as tasty or tender as other reviewers, found it tough and short on marinade time. Haupia cake not recommended, should have tried the ice cream pie. Our companions liked their furikake shrimp and the kahlua pig with cabbage. This place definitely is worth a visit, I just didn't order the right thing this time.

QJ0fgJRtCppiWMwyOwbIHg.text: Finally tried Island Flavor for the first time today.  Been hearing only positive comments and recommendations for this SW Hawaiian eatery in a relatively undeveloped part of town, and the experience lived up to expectations.  The portions are way more than generous.  Sides?  They can serve you a "side", but it will still be entree portion.  Just about everyone who dines here, leaves the restaurant with the tomorrow's lunch pre-packed.  The desserts are just as big as the big island, and the ones I tried (Banana Bread Pudding) was delicious.  I tried the mixed plate with the Kalbi Ribs and Hawaiian Style Roasted Pork (serve with gravy), plus the Ahi Poke (Shoyu) and sampled the sesame and furikake ones as well.  I personally really enjoyed the sesame ahi poke. But I think the Poke Salad (entree sized salad) also looks very delicious, and I will most likely try that in one of my future visits.  Besides the good food, the price is reasonable. You are definitely not going to leave this restaurant feeling like you can have a Big Mac Combo.  It is perfect for a family or hungry & growing teenager, football team, etc.    It is perfect for anyone that wants good food, generous portions for a reasonable price!  The friendly service is added to the package for absolutely no additional charge.  Are you an ahi poke fan? This is the best value and taste for the money in all of Las Vegas.  Sesame flavor is probably the best, but everyone's preference is different, so try them all (just not all at one time, unless you have an army to help you finish it). No joke!  Food:  4/5   Some misses, but most are hits. Definitely worth the drive to this part of town if you are in the mood for Hawaiian food "local" style.  Portion:  5/5  How many different ways can you say the portion is huge?  Each plate is enough to share for two regular people.  Service:  4/5  Friendly service.   Location:  Can be a long trek for some, considering the location, but I think it is worth it.  If you are visiting from out of town, unless you have your own transportation, I would suggest passing this one up (trying to get a cab out here back to the Strip would be a hassle and costly).  Price:  5/5  For the portion, it is definitely worth it.  Ambiance:  4/5  Hawaiian inspired art works adorned the walls, but I didn't pay it much attention when I saw the plates of food at the pick-up window.  Easily a solid 4 stars!

EOwu1Cwc8QXvU5XjiaViZA.text: I've passed this place for so many years. I only tried it last year....so sad :( Their food is really good and well priced. I come here often now :)

iV9QFvdlobOjoLOVZj1tFg.text: This is my go to spot for Hawaiian food. Great classic flavors to chose from and the best Mac in town! Also the Chantilly cake is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aAKTPVXkjMeNjzMp8U2dWw.text: Out of all the hawaiian/local food places here in las vegas,  this is my favorite.  Huge portions of food for good prices. Chicken Katsu loco moco was a huge bowl that I couldn't finish. Good service and friendly staff. Nice decor with Local/reggae music playing inside as well. Definitely be back

wOmgvJl4YzxG8d-TQOhxWQ.text: Love this place! It is up the street from my house and has the best fried rice! They also have huge proportions!

3CJf8ZPVfITY7XczxM6sYw.text: The service is great and the food is awesome!!! I drove 15 miles to get the Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Short Ribs. Don't miss out!!!

VBY9FWLz6YKT4XCRrViRmQ.text: I have been coming here for over ten years . The last 3 times to my disappointment have been the worst ever . The first time  wait a hour for cold food  to get to the table. The second to last super long wait time again  for the food . Again tonight  long wait for food and it wasn't busy. The new owners have done a lot to make the place more modern be the kitchen has drop the ball.

y_SaKjfvFATrtjh4O5VmUg.text: On a Tuesday morning at around 1130am, there was ample parking, we were greeted upon entering and sat right away. The place was about half full and we noticed it was a bit bigger than last time. Apparently, the shop adjacent is now gone and has made way for more space in the restaurant area. My mom had just had surgery up the street and wanted to come here. She had the Hawaiian Roast Pork and it was amazingly soft! Maybe not rich in flavor (but bland), but perfect for what she needed! I had the Chef's Loco Moco and this was the best loco moco I've ever tasted. Born and raised in Hawaii, and they make it better here (where they put pork belly in with the beef patty). Absolutely delicious! The food came quickly and we were checked on while we were eating. When we were done eating, we were given boxes for our food and our check. Prices are reasonable for yummy items that we don't need to travel to Hawaii for, but $14 for a loco moco....? Other than that, everything was amazing. Decor is very aesthetically pleasing, comfy, and not falling apart. They keep it very clean! Service was cordial.

7dqjPbpiWtkQ3coAaDOvgg.text: This is my favorite Hawaiian food place to eat the food was excellent the service was on point and I will certainly be coming back    thank you.

jJYiHeCIlLUUQ8NReorbrg.text: I ordered the mix plate with furikake chicken, kalbi short ribs and fried rice. The furikake chicken was a little bland, you can taste little hint of sweetness. Kalbi ribs were pretty good just a little tough. The fried rice was very salty, I barely touched the fried rice because it was almost like eating salt by itself. Kind of upset how they put rice underneath the kalbi ribs and furikake chicken to make it seem like its alot of meat but it really wasn't. It was my first time trying this place and probably my last. Definitely prefer Hawaiin Bbq over Island Flavor!

rl5Rh_biY5HJJ4EHzi6hYA.text: Pure bliss. I feel like every other meal I've had in my entire life was leading up to this. My first real Hawaiian meal. Now I'm afraid no other place will ever be able to match up.   Appetizer: Fresh Ahi Poke (Furikake style) - Perfect flavor combination. The Ahi was super fresh and the onions. Oh man, the onions.  Entrees: Hoisin BBQ Ribs - That sauce. Just give me a bowl of that Hoisin and a spoon. The ribs were so tender, like they'd been marinating for years. The sticky rice and mac salad sides were excellent. Huge portions. What a plate.   Furikake Shrimp - Crunchy. Perfectly cooked. Delicious, tangy dipping sauce.  Dessert: Coconut Pineapple Ice Cream - We didn't think we had any room left, but figured why not? We received a heaping, refreshing bowl and finished the whole thing. A really nice surprise to close out an already transcendant meal. The real coconut chunks really sealed the deal for me.  Don't be fooled by the humble exterior, this place is the real deal. If you are anywhere in the vicinity of Las Vegas, this is a must stop.

PRY_OyAnvITxaQjNP7UhkA.text: Love stopping here on the way home to pahrump. The food is always good. Leftovers are even better

IwV1e_SUrNW8yB3F41L-ZQ.text: Best place for Hawaiian plate lunch.  Love the localmoco and spam musubi..Awesome place. Happy eats!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monster Meat!!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamburger Steak..awww sooo GOOD
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LocoMoco..yum to da eats!!

KkZ-YUeGHkYIQDJqauTtJg.text: Ohh BRAHHH, KALBI (ShortRibs) Always a MUST get for me when I eat at ISLAND FLAVOR. Kalbi is on point and very good aka ONO. Also their chicken Katsu is good as well. Staff Is so FRIENDLY and very HELPFUL. A Plus about this place is that you can do COMBINATIONS. So if you visiting the 9th island and craving for that LOCAL HAWAIIAN FOOD you gotta check out ISLAND FLAVOR.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ONO FOOD spread consist of, KALBI &amp; Chicken Katsu plate. Also their AHI POKE is shown in this pic.

6HMI7H6YbgVTzBOIJjaXBw.text: This is my favorite place to go! If you haven't been, order the furikake chicken. It's always a hit! Great family environment and live music Saturday nights

9hluX0viVsz9JbbfAnaPdQ.text: Been coming here when I'm on this side of town. This is one of the best Hawaiian Restaurants in Las Vegas! They have real authentic Hawaiian AND Island Style food. They have good Daily specials. Tasty and they give a lot here.   Another good thing is right next to the restaurant they own a store where you can buy stuff from Hawaii. From Hawaiian Sun juice to Mochi Crunch, Candies and more.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Flavor menu
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hlupjBzSLAHbeARF76kfJw.text: Out of all the "808" spots. This place is number 1. Freshly renovated with that island atmosphere.... Ahhhhh just like home

sDStjgYs9xuXTKLE4lV34g.text: Been quite a while since we last ate at this place and now what dramatic changes hit you in the eye when you walk in.  I like the changes but was the food and service altered for improvement also?  NO!  We waited 50 minutes for our food when I told the wife we could have gone somewhere else and gotten way better service.  New menu but same food sort off, some things taken off and the price increased.  Now you gotta pay for toss salad when it was free if you didn't want the mac salad and it's now 1/4 the size of what use to be.  OMG.       Love the Hostess, we've known her for years and she is always a friendly and vibrant person, but the so called chefs or cooks--must have been hired from the slow boat from china cause they are so super slow.       Portion have been shrunk down some and they must be using a smaller rice and mac scooper because not enough rice and mac (way smaller portions). If they were in a five star restaurant (and they NOT) they would have been fired a long time ago.       Why does this place have an Executive Chef who cannot produce only do book work..not a good idea.  Still got foreign cooks which is ok just like the Chinese and Japanese places, cheapo labor I guess.       Changing the decor and menu but not improving on the service is bad for business.  All the old timers are now gone so we gotta wait and see if this place will live up to its reputation of long ago.  I personally will not be back but its up to the public to choose their own path.        Looking for another great Hawaiian home style cooking place, not many left here in the valley...to many impostors.  I am Island Born so I cannot be fooled into seeing and made to think it's HAWAIIAN when it's not.  Where's the ALOHA gone to?

4ZvNBEXXKg17ZegNcBw_Qg.text: Been wanting to try this place out for some time now being so close to wear I work. Ordered the Mixed Plate: Furikake Chicken + Terikyaki Beef Steak that came with 2 scoops of white rice and 1 scoop of macaroni salad. Added a side of "tossed vegetables" (yellow squash, carrots, onions, zucchini) so I could feel better about myself. Unsweetened ice tea was also very good! $16 to-go order.   Staff was super friendly. They knew who I was the second I walked through the door. Food was delicious! 808 Hawaiian Mixed Plate in North LV might still have my heart for the furikake chicken. However, I live and work much closer to this one so I can't wait to try everything on the menu! Will definitely be back.

RAYTWqV_SFv_2fxGegenrw.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! I recommend the mix plate because you get two sides & 2 choices of meat. All the meats are so flavorful and cooked to perfection! Macaroni salad is awesome! I'd get an extra side if I was you!

dMB9V-ihLE6tR2IVw1QENA.text: Hopefully just a miss this last time.  Furikake chicken, hoisin ribs and loco mock were really good but the beef Teri and Korean wings were really salty.  And I like salty food.  But I know Island Flavor cares so they took care of it.  Will still come back.  Just hoping they correct the two dishes cuz want to order it again.

aWLrS54u-kPoLqDeN8wkPg.text: Tasty, and very generous servings. The service was even greater!  Make sure you come hungry.

eKk7QUtkIpujlW8GPev5NA.text: I've been to 6 Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas, and Island Flavor to me tops them all! The food is delicious, and comes in large portions. Friendly staff, cozy atmosphere, and they make you feel at home. =D

u5CGnbBBD6J1yTacFxhM-Q.text: Food and Portions are Amazing! This 1 star is solely based on their customer service. Especially the Haole guy upfront who needs to be either trained on how to multi-task or simply just get replaced. This location and restaurant is by far one of the best Hawaiian spots on Da' 9th isle, but since change of ownership, service upfront has gone downhill. If you are the new owner reading this, please retrain or replace your front person that greets, takes to go orders and cashes people out. Cause he clearly can't multi-task well. I've seen people walk out many times and have heard many complaints that their orders weren't placed and they had to wait an additional 20 mins for their food. Which happened to me right after he did this to another customer. Anyways, if any of you are reading this, this place has Ono'Grindz, but you gotta wait like 20-30 mins sometimes to get your food. Mahalo for reading!

7tj0rk6s9Z7S15UQLpYENQ.text: The food here was really good. No frills decor but authentic food. I'd give the guava cake 5 stars. So yum. I had the loco moco. Tasted like your standard loco moco. I like that you can get your eggs anyway you choose. The fried rice omelette was delicious. Two eggs any way you choose on a huge portion of rice with Portuguese sausage. My dad had the kalbi ribs. Very flavorful. The wait staff was so friendly and attentive. We really enjoyed our meal here and will definitely come back.

V0fZQYy8G8fZYpHQ77lW1Q.text: Have you ever gone on vacation to Hawaii, had the time of your life, then came back home to Vegas and thought "Ugh! What I would give to go back!" Well, this is your chance! The food at this place is the most authentic Hawaiian food you will find in town. With one bite you'll be transported back to beautiful beaches of Hawaii. Beautiful live music and top notch cuisine! There's nothing more you can ask for when you are looking for the one of a kind flavors of the Hawaiian islands. One of my favorite restaurants in all of Las Vegas hands down.

-j-4TqWp9ARbGYkvLSvLqA.text: Island flavor have big serving but the flavor is not as good as other Hawaiian restaurants. The one time I ordered out through grubhub,they were closed. Not sure if the site was not updated of the correct close time or the restaurant decided to close early.

2klDKpmKYnrktxz9g7u8KQ.text: This is our new fave Hawaiian restaurant! Everytime i crave for oxtail soup i would go here or ask my partner to order it over the phone. I could eat their food everyday. My bf loves their combinations. Pokes are so good here too. The staff are so friendly. I recommend this place everything delicious.

yf_TiO-GlVkOQFUu8OOTCA.text: If you're from Hawaii and looking for some real Hawaiian food, I highly suggest Island Flavor. Eating here makes me feel like I'm back home in Hawaii.   ONE Star for the GREAT customer service. From the minute you walk in to the second you walk out. They are very welcoming and very friendly. They sure show the Aloha spirit.   ONE star for the delicious food. OMG!!!! I ordered the kalbi ribs and it was sooooooo freakin good. The meat was well flavored and juicy. The fried rice with Portuguese sausage is a hit as well. I totally recommend these two dishes.     ONE star for the deserts. The coco puffs are my favorite. I mean it's not like the in Hawaii BUT it's pretty close to it. I can't leave here and not enjoy deserts. Their guava & Chantilly cake is delicious as well.   ONE star for the Poke. Man o Man... tasted so fresh and Ono!!!! I can just eat this over and over. You have to make sure you get at least  1/2 a pound... better yet, you'll regret it, get a full pound  you'll thank me later.   ONE star for the humongous portion. Soooooooooo much to eat but I'm not complaining. Take it home, and eat it later for left overs. I did and it was still yummy!   Add up all my stars and I give Island Flavor 5 STARS!!! I RECOMMENT THIS HAWAIIAN RESTAURANT. TRUST ME, YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED.

JpOiV1aOLuoyPbJ9a0kPhw.text: Soooooo, kind of disappointed... took the kids to eat. And spent $75 on 3 plates and 3 musubis....  we wanted the kids combo (musubi and fries with a small drink) when I checked my receipt she charged me for 3 musubis, an order of fries and all my kids drinks. My 5 year old daughter distinctly asked the waitress for a kid cup with lid... but she got her a large cup. Food was OK.. service was bad. And it wasn't even busy. I guess because they wanted to go home already. I did ask before Bringing my family into the restaurant if it was okay to eat (3:45 and they close at 4).. miss the aloha spirit there. Doesn't feel aloha at all, except for one Aunty (i didn't get her name) our hamburger in the loco Moco was nasty. Hard like cardboard.  Ordered all of our drinks at once and had to wait about 10 minutes before she got the water (usually the first to come out) won't be going back. Will see other local food places, even if that means drinking north for Kau kau kitchen! Never disappointed there.

bbHRKt37Is-IJh-MT-JIkg.text: We just moved here from Alaska and I must say this place makes some bomb food, it made me forget how much I miss food back at home. The Furikaki Chicken was oh so GOOD... Hands down the best island food I had in the mainland.  The disappointing part of this is that I bought my leftover food home and as my daughter and I were eating our left over, my daughter notice something blue on top of my Furikaki Chicken, she stopped me from eating and says, mom there's something on ur chicken, she grabbed the blue piece out and said that's gross. She stretched it and said I think it's a piece of gloves from who-ever made your food. I was annoyed. I called and a man answers the phone, I asked him if this was the island flavor by the gas station?, and he answered yes, I then asked if they used gloves? He answered yes. I went on to ask what color was the gloves, and he answered blue and I see everyone wearing it, which is good. They all have gloves on.  I told him about what had happened and what I found, and I told him I can take a picture of it -and send it. He says, I don't know how can I receive that picture, I don't have technology to get that picture I asked him if I could speak to the manager and he says that he the manager can't talk to me right now cause he's the cook, and if he has to take my call then he has to put a hold on everyone else's order, I was annoyed but the way this guys was talking. He did say in a sarcastic way that the manager said to bring it back and he will make me a new plate or I can get a refund. I thought this guy was rude and he needed some customer service training, btw his name is Tai or Thai. And I suggest if here or anywhere always check ur food.

mY6aYtLJ55FHinlHw12bMg.text: So I gotta say some of the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas by far and I've had lots!!! Their Kalbi ribs where beyond juicy and delicious. Great service. Drove half and hour to try it definitely worth it.

HiZ3ICJkHLlD16pwMtv2jQ.text: Love this place, big size portions, very flavorful and has the authentic Hawaii island vibes. Staff is friendly

_GbeC5Z8dCXFJC5fbmoV-A.text: This restaurant used to be one of my favorites.  It was close to home, had huge portions and had a great vibe.  Tonight I decided to make the drive out of the way to pay them a visit again.  We ordered our usual, mix plate with Korean chicken and roast pork, and an order of chicken katsu.  Two plates, $30 total including tip.  The food was ok, portion sizes were smaller than before but still ok.  It tasted ok but to be honest I left the restaurant mad and ashamed.  I noticed that they had issues of the current Kama'aina magazine which was always free to customers, a great resource for local businesses in Las Vegas to support.  I grabbed one copy and was scolded by the cashier who said they were only for dine in guests only.  His tone was crappy made me feel like I was stealing, there was a sticker which said one per table.  One copy for a customer who paid for his meal and he treated me like a thief.  I will be subscribing so that I won't have to go through that same again but will not be returning any time soon.

BBBVeL7ak06fqhLa5Azftw.text: What you need to know:  - My sister used to live in Las Vegas and this was always the one restaurant that I always had to visit  - Island Flavor comes from the lovely Big Island, with a couple of locations still there  - Live Hawaiian music on Friday and Saturdays from 6-8:30pm - this is the time frame when the restaurant gets packed, but it creates the best atmosphere! - Leilani, our server, is the veteran waiter and has been at Island Flavor since the beginning.  She showers you with authentic and joyful aloha - she made us feel like family!   - If you're on Yelp's cash back program, this restaurant offers 10% cash back! ;)  - In short:  Delicious Hawaiian food, fantastic service, live music - perfect!   What we ordered:  - Kalbi short ribs price $11.50 - A full order comes with four delicately smoky, sweet, perfectly cooked ribs (not overcooked, still a tad pink on the inside).  Just get it! All plates come with choice of starch (white rice, brown rice or French fries) and choice of mac salad, sauteed veggies or salad.    - Mixed plate of Korean fried chicken and Kalua pork with cabbage $11.50 - Leilani, our lovely waitress, suggested we try the mixed plate, where you can try more options.  The Korean fried chicken was probably my favorite thing we ordered - extra crispy on the outside, sweet with rich glaze and incredibly juicy on the inside!  The mixed plate portion of the Kalua pork with cabbage was simply perfect.  - Opakapaka cooked misoyaki style $15.95 - The misoyaki style is a wonderful way of cooking the opakapaka - the fish retains moisture and the misoyaki sauce is a mixture of savory and a tad sweet.  The opaka was a little on the dry side though. We ordered this dish with the fried rice, $2 extra, but it was definitely worth it!  Soft sticky rice, with generous chucks of pork, it was very moist and savory.  - Spicy Avo Poke - I refuse to eat poke on the mainland, but when Leilani suggested it, I trusted her and I'm glad we tried it!  Huge cubes of firm ahi mixed with avocado, crispy wonton crisps and drizzled with a spicy mayo sauce.  It was actually very very good for mainland poke!  - Kona coffee mud pie - $5.50 - By the time we finished our dinner, I was stuffed beyond the comfortable level but my friends powered through and got the Kona coffee mud pie.  I only got a bite of the deep rich Kona coffee and dark graham cookie crust.  Let's just say they had no problems finishing it even though we were so stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona coffee mud pie $5.50
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy avo poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix plate of Korean fried chicken and Kalua pork w/ cabbage $11.50

kdkzkiCqJFk6nY7z5VMCXw.text: The furikake chicken happens to be one of the most popular entrees there, but it's not exactly my cup of tea. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad but I just don't see myself eating it every time I visit Island Flavor. Also, it's not really that good as leftovers which is a bit of a disappointment.   On the other hand, I do like the teriyaki chicken, Korean BBQ, and the teriyaki beef. It's so flavorful to the taste that you just want more. Also, the portion sizes are so big that you're sitting here thinking you should probably save the rest for later. With that said, the prices are just right for them.   Often, I get a to-go order because they're quick and I avoid the rush which is fantastic because sometimes it can get so busy there. Not ideal when you're famished.   Overall, I would recommend this place for the taste of their entree, price, and portions.

51maBBzl6MK_CbF1AHK_bw.text: Love Island Flavor!  Excellent friendly servers!!  Large yummy portions!  We bring our out of town guests here!    So happy they have delivery service!

zRJ2e3Zhd1O8qf2faNN9wQ.text: The food is decent ... the service was okay ... the people just looked pissed most of the time . If you don't like your job find another job . I don't like rude service . They even said to one of my friends that's it ?? Just ordering the side of fried rice. Not cool. I'm not coming here again ... the first time was great and even the 2nd time ... now it's just plain fully bad . Treat your customers with respect even though we're not Hawaiian . Don't hire people who treat customers like shit. Hands down don't go here for shitty service . I would go to Hawaiian BBQ at least they smile . I hope they will eventually learn to smile .

HlVfO49qEmHQcNMozKNGgg.text: Alway great service  for the price , the rice was dry on the outside, like they left it out for an hour under heat lamp,  it every thing else was great and lots. Hawaiian should not have dry out rice we are from the islands.

nTHUvgCnLEpI1z-Gahbj2A.text: Have you been looking for a great Hawaiian food? Then you found the right place!   I've been here several times already and Island never fails to serve great Hawaiian dishes in huge portions.  You can get a combo plate and two people can share it.  So far we've tried the kalbi ribs, Korean chicken, loco moco, tonkatsu, opaka paka salad, shoyu chicken and the guava cake and they were all awesome!  Servers were also very very friendly and attentive.  The only con I can think of is the macaroni salad. It was missing something and can't figure it out.   We will be back!

Qn7SB2sM_6PQ_WU5fW2_3Q.text: By far the best Hawaiian food I've ever had in Las Vegas  I ordered the short ribs and my sister had the  the chicken katsu both were extremely fresh and not mainstream tasting and the service was great too will be coming back the next time I am in Vegas.  My only regret is I wish I ordered more spam Musubi before my road trip back to San Diego

xBsfywhbgSKB1eS2cl4q0w.text: Craving for some Hawaiian food and decided to check out Island Flavors.  Big Mahalo Yelp!  You can order a single entree or create your own mixed plate combination for a couple extra bucks.  Entrees are served with 2 scoops rice and 1 scoop mac salad.  Sounds like plate lunch time!  On our first visit, the server recommended the Kalbi and Furikaki chicken.  I decided on a combo of Furikake chicken and Kalua pork and cabbage.  The chicken was crispy and coated with a sweet glaze and Furikake.  The Kulua pork was a bit disappointing.  I didn't think it had enough smoke flavoring.  Hubby had oxtail soup.  The soup was very tasty although a little heavy on ginger.  Portions were very generous!  On our second visit I went with our server's recommendation.  Kalbi ribs and Furikake chicken.  Tummy was very happy.  A small complaint was that one piece was a little grisly.  Don't feel that's the restaurants fault.  The Kalbi was seasoned perfectly.  Hubby ordered the Lau Lau special which is served with Lomi Lomi and Haupia.  Very ONO!  Don't forget to save room for a piece of Chantilly cake

Pw3Dhb0kW2AGXO-MabcnUA.text: the best....the end  o in case you want to know whats good? almost everything, ok not everything but get the roast pork with chopped steak/or kalbi combo and i promise you'll be have weird cravings throughout YOUR LIFE for this

0s4au6BKcKpVUEC6L9ZixQ.text: giving them a 4 star because its my first hawaiian bbq spot and it was good and packed. it ws recommended to me by some big islanders. i had the pork with the brown gravy, beef ribs and friend rice. the guy at the counter was so nice and gave me a combo since the portions are so big. he also recommended the rice wrapped spam. it was good but could have definitely used some more seasoning in it. i would say ill definitely go back and ask try some other dishes.
