jGHzTWjCHgeflsHYHnghfg.text: I have only eaten Hawaiian food about three other times at L&L Hawaiian BBQ. I wasn't very impressed with their food at all but I thought it was because it was more of a fast food restaurant. I read all the great reviews about Island Flavor and was anxious to give it a shot. The restaurant itself is clean and the staff is pretty friendly. I ordered the Hawaiian Special which was LauLau with a side of fried rice, macaroni salad, some fish and tomatoes, and a creamy white dessert.   LauLau is tender BBQ'd pork served in some type of edible leaf. I was told the leaves were edible so I cut it all up and added the house bbq sauce. The leaf was very bitter and odd tasting. It completely ruined the flavor of EVERYTHING else that was in my mouth so I moved as much of it aside as I could. After that, the meal wasn't horrible, but it didn't really impress me either. My friend ordered the saimin which is a bowl of ramen in broth and sprinkled with egg, imitation seafood and vegetables. He told me the broth was incredibly bland. Needless to say, I don't think that we will be keeping this place on our list of incredible places to eat.

kU2gp8LBug-jHb2u-ieLBw.text: This is the place to go for authentic Hawaiian food. We went during peak hours for dinner on a Friday so we had to wait about 20 minutes. Once we sat down, our ears were treated to some live Hawaiian music. The food is spot on and we felt like we were back in Hawaii where we vacation often. I am a huge mac salad fan and this place did not disappoint.

LMplphJIBXjMLjD9I1qcoA.text: Came here with my future bro in law. He highly recommended this place. Its kinda far from the strip, but food was decent. Its kinda nice to venture out of the bright lights of Vegas sometimes. The inside was open and very welcoming. Place was packed so we sat at the bar.   I ordered the roast pork & kalbi combo with the gravy on the side. The kalbi ribs were some of the best I've tried! It was thick and flavorful. Juicy and not dry at all. The Mac salad though, had way to much pepper in it. The roasted pork had little flavor and the gravy wasn't that appealing either. I probably would not order the pork again. My bro in law ordered the kalbi ribs and chicken katsu combo. He let me try some katsu and it was good. Nice crunch but moist inside. Pretty darn good.  I wouldn't mind coming back to try some other items on the menu. I'll read some other Yelp reviews to see what's good and what's not...

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork &amp; kalbi combo

Better to be asked a lot then not asked at all. I also love the food and like everything that ive tried.   Although if you want spam musubi call and ask before 11 am they run out fast!

vc3uLcSYNeMMmdYzjpsQeg.text: Have you ever watched Lilo & Stitch? Pretty good, right? Well, sit your little aloha down here, and come hungry!   Can I just tell you right now that if you like gravy, then you're going to order chicken katsu loco moco. It's crazy good! (You can get el pollo loco after if you want).   Dude, seriously, it's in a bowl! And the bowl is bigger than your stomach!! A heaping of golden chicken katsu on top of perfect (jasmine?) white steamed rice. And to top all off... An explosion of gravy everywhere.. In a bowl! I also forgot to mention, two eggs cooked in any style you want.. In a bowl! Not a plate.. A massive bowl. Like eating cereal for dinner (+5000 more calories) I prefer over easy.. So you split the yolk and mix it with the gravy and it's like a super special moment, nah mean?   Aunty, the waitress, recommend you try da half kalbi short ribs half furikake chicken, brah! Broke da mout! (Which it think translates to hella bomb!!) and I try em wat Aunty say n I tell her .. "Oooh Aunty, it's onolicious!"   By the way, if you think you can finish it all in one sitting, you're going to hell cause you're a liar! You can't. You're not supposed to. You get a box and you take 'em home braddah!  Btw, on aloha Fridays, try the lau lau. & if you have room for dessert, dare you to get the kona coffee mud pie! Good thing 85% of the time it's aloha Friday on Fridays 100% of the time!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A thousand words.

YP5WAe6Miy2aM_88WxfaNg.text: Awww yeah. I meant to go to Island Style but got routed here instead. Located in a nondescript Vegas strip mall. Walked in and the girls that work there are really nice.   After a flight from SFO, we are super hungry. We ordered the stuff below:  Furikake ahi poke...ah good stuff. Came out a bit on the cold side, but the flavor on them cubes were on point. Not so powerful, but just right. Onions, hawaiian salt, fresh cracked pepper, and some oil  Chicken katsu... good but not great. Average taste, on the dry side. But still good when you're hungry.  Furikake chicken...dang! broke da mouth dis one. Geez, so tasty and flavorful and Im sure oh so bad for you but whatever. I'm in it for the taste. Love this dish.  Kalua cabbage...it's good, but the pork that I got was more on the fatty side. I like mines with lean pork. But it was still good, and not overly salty like some other places.   Fried rice....also good, but not great. But I also compare fried rice to my faves at Side Street Inn and Big City Diner in Hawaii.  All in all, this place is really good. Come here for good food. And although we were way too full to eat their dessert, their haupia cake looked friggin amazing.

15RCoDFusOz2KToMyXsngA.text: I came in here on the spur of the moment for some take out and I have to say the customer service was okay.. not great but not bad. I explained I never been before and to make some recommendations and the guy working the front was good but who ever else was working with him wasn't Now they lost a few stars for a few reasons with me because what could've been a 4-5 star review turned to 3. Now you may ask what happen to get the rating right? Well the service and the fact that they basically told me in so many words that the spam masubi that they sold if it wasn't in that little oven in the front then that means there are no more? What kind of place does that though? And an hour before you are closing? I could see if I walked in 10 minutes before you are closing but is that spam masubi that hard to make that you couldn't request one or two more to be made? Yikes! Not good service in my eyes especially when somebody is trying it out for the first time. It's simple things like that, that would steer me away from ever coming back.  My dish I ordered was like a two item combo and I selected the chicken katsu and the Furakaki chicken with double mac salad instead of the rice. No complaints on that! No whether I'll be back or not is in the air but for now...

The staff is very welcoming, upbeat, and always makes sure you're doing okay. Nothing but yummy foods here!

It was authentic, including the pidgin, and was outstanding! I will note that the Kalbi was cut too thick. BTW wife is born and raised in Hilo and I'm from Maui!

JtMvNXIjtA1M9UWhZ3j81g.text: I live 2 mins away here so I ordered lunch!im hungry! I did the yelp online ordering. 30 mins wait I guess it's ok. I ordered fried rice, and furikake chicken with rice. OMG they are both burnt! My fried rice was way too salty and the bottom Part of the rice is all black. My chicken was cooked too much that is was so hard to bite it. Can't even taste the flavor due to over cooked. No sesame seeds, no nothing! I was really disappointed. I ended up throwing both food always which costs me  at least 16$. It was so bad. Don't go here, they rush your food. And the place looks so ghetto and small. Tables and chairs, decor so outdated. Considering they charge too much for their food and they seem busy at times. But anyways, will never go back here. I dnt know why I can't give no stars!!!

I'm from hawaii and I love feeling right at home. Weekends they have a live Hawaiian band playing while you dine. Such an awesome and homey experience. Cheeee!

rf7ur0jUlheStUw4u1JSmg.text: That's some good Island Flavor. Love the Shoyu Ahi Poke and the soup here. Better than the one at CA Hotel. zFWAwrXAF5w0wjy_DLLVUA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally had a chance yesterday. Because of 4.5 yelp rating, I was so excited and had certain expectations. Unfortunately all food was a total disappointment.   Furikake Chicken: WAY TOO sweet. Too much batter. Couldn't eat more than 3 pieces.  Furikake shrimp: Overcooked, dry, salty. Ate only one piece  Kalbi short rib: ALL BURNT! After cutting out burnt parts, not much meat left to eat. It was bland and lacked flavor, but I thought bland is rather better than too sweet or salty..   Chicken katsu: Dry and not so crispy. Katsu dipping sauce is too thick and salty.   Spam musubi: I didn't try so no comment on food but when my husband ordered, he had asked if they have teriyaki musubi as that is our son's favorite. They said they don't but they can give us teriyaki sauce on the side. My husband said ok and surprisingly, we were charged $1.75 for the teriyaki sauce. And btw the sauce was WAY TOO sweet and salty, even my 8 year old son didn't like it..   Plus this place is more expensive than other Hawaiian restaurants. I don't mind paying a dollar or two more per dish as long as food tastes good but too bad we didn't enjoy any dish. =(

wsqWc0RDLUQ_vaAV8aIQVw.text: Wow laulau! This place is off da hook ono to the max! We came here to pick up kulolo and poi to take home to Nebraska with us. As soon as we walked in there was live music playing and pau already we decided to stay to eat. The family playing music had me in tears and their beautiful voices and music made me miss my island home.  So my hubby had the saimin, my son had beef stew and I got the Loco Moco. The place was pretty packed but our food came out pretty quick and yes everything was absolutely delicious and portions were huge! Truly worth the drive and the money we spent. And all the people there from beginning to end was so friendly and polite. Would definitely recommend to anybody wanting local kine food and atmosphere and a perfect place where the aloha spirit is alive and well! I know where we going hit up again next time we come visit. Island Flavor you rock!! Mahalo for a wonderful time. A hui hou kakou mekealoha pumehana! The Ninete Family from Nebraska.

tJS_MildIhCCy7bQuxeRSg.text: I should had wrote this review 5-6 months ago.  Didn't get a chance too.  This place is a hit or miss.  Sometimes the service is great and other times it's like WTF!  The last time coming here was very irritating.  It was the last time we came here.  Never again.  I placed an order online, Yelp, and came to pick up 1 hour later.  They were super busy, when my husband walked in to pick up our food.  He came out and said our order wasn't ready.  Then we waited another 15 minutes outside and then I went in and asked what the hell is going on with our order?  I spoke to the manager to figure out where our order was and he was an a-hole.  He said I ordered off another app, they didn't see my order.  They DIDN'T start my order yet or even try to accommodate us.  He said they're busy.  They deserve a zero star for that.  We didn't pick up any food...you can imagine how irritated I was.  I had to call the app to cancel my order I paid them for already to get my refund.  We came here 3 other times before this incident.  I would say the food is amazing.  Only one time the service was great...the other two times...it was frustrating to flag down someone to take our order.  They don't do well when it's busy and no one looks around to help customers.   Won't be coming back here.

B4siJUqUhCVwcqZ1CdWZdQ.text: This is by far the best kine local grindz in Vegas it feels like homestyle kine cooking in the 808.  The portions are worth the price here the service is beyond 5star no complaints everyone is friendly the ahi poke is so fresh like they caught it somewhere near by....i don't think anywhere can get this close to what they have here to serve u! Chicken katsu and hawaiian style poke is 187!!

HUGujZwkgehvzZ0Y3yjuLQ.text: I had an issue w my initial visit, but the manager reached out and asked how he could make my experience better. I really appreciate this kind of attention, it shows a lot about the character and business traits of an establishment. This was enough to help me give him a second chance. And I'm sure they'll tidy up the restroom and make sure there are towels!

gyV6OIycKP89iYQerv_zeA.text: Amazing!! I crave the food here and I think it's the coolest thing you have bands play on the weekend!

cX67TD25sVNPhpJYLtYJ3g.text: Amazing Amazing Amazing   Look I'm born and raised here in Las Vegas, trust me I'm a huge foodie and all about eating at mom and pop restaurants. THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST HAWAIIAN PLACES IVE EVR EATEN,  after eating here you won't even remember "l&l or aloha kitchen" not that those aren't good but ISLAND FLAVORS IS THE BEST!!!  The staff is very friendly and very helpful to explain the menu. Specials Everyday!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back at it again, furikake shrimp!!!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spare ribs and fruikaka chicken, holy moly was it good and I only eat half which never happens.

Zrr9SVfSRAweHlZDmvjM3w.text: This used to be our to go to island restaurant on the weekends but since the new management took over things were never the same. The ambience of the newly renovated restaurant has lost its welcome feeling. Besides the Hawaiian music playing in the background It still feels cold and empty.  We have been going to this restaurant for many years (since the day it opened) and the portion size was amazing in the past. Lately, we have waited for 45 minutes to get our food only to see that the portion size has decreased tremendously. This has all started since the new management took over. But what's most important is respect. The Hawaiian community is very tight here in Las Vegas and word travels fast. The fact that this new management (Caucasian owners) has disrespected our younger Hawaiian generation who has worked there for years and are amazing children, fired for no reason by a text message & another by yelling in front of customers, I for one will NEVER support this restaurant again. To label Hawaiian people as "you people" is one thing but to yell at an 18 year old girl who did nothing to deserve the disrespect you gave her in front of a restaurant filled with customers by saying "get the fuck out" is beyond me. That is low and of no class. I was always a loyal customer and overlooked the potion size, and the cold feeling I received in this restaurant, but the disrespect this new owner has shown to what she calls us as, "Us People", and the children of Hawaii, they will never be receiving my business nor my Ohana's business again.

QTEROR58xQOkX0QiXYBY3w.text: I think the first time we came here was back in 2011, shortly after we moved to Vegas. Ordered the Kalua Pork and thought it was horrible. To be fair, it's been a constant struggle to find good Kalua Pork in Vegas. The only thing I enjoyed was the Kona Coffee Mudd Pie, which was shared between four people since the slices are huge! Never came back for years, until very recently.   About two months ago, we ate dinner here with friends and the restaurant was very busy. I think we waited at least 90 minutes to get a table. But the wait was worth it because the food was delicious! I ordered the Furikake Chicken, which was very very good. Huge portions, wasn't too salty and they put the right amount of sauce on it. I think I also had enough leftovers for two meals! The Guava cake was awesome as well! I have had bland ones from other restaurants, which basically tasted like yellow cake with whipped cream. But this one had a good guava flavor. Service on this day was great too. Even though they were busy, the servers were attentive and refilled our drinks promptly. After that, I was like "My bad, Island Flavor is pretty good."  Wrong! The husband and I were in the area last week, so we decided to eat dinner here. Everything was pretty horrible except for the Guava cake. They were not as busy on a weekday. I ordered the Furikake Chicken again, and it was not good. The chicken was lukewarm. Ewww. Did they even take time to cook it?? I felt like the chicken was made hours earlier and all they did was warm it up in the microwave, threw some sauce and furikake all over it and called it a day. Yuck! Even the brown rice was lukewarm and cooked with too much water! None of the servers refilled our waters. What happened??  So yeah.....maybe its just luck and it depends on who is working. I'm giving them 3 stars because I know their food and service can be really good. Sadly, its only on certain days.

YKTa-tba2cyrpZtVpw6IvQ.text: Guys at Island Flavor: "Oh, back again, huh?"    Ummm, I totally Yelped this place a week before going to Vegas and came here twice in three days.  So I totally live for plate lunch.  Note that my profile's "last meal on earth" is Hawaiian plate lunch, and my home city is surprisingly short on Hawaiian restaurants. (So short the number is zero.) So I had to get a fix in! Or two or five.  The meals here are so big that it just hurts. There's a reason why 90% of the bouncers at XS are Samoan. They don't get that kind of mass needed to punch creepy misbehaving guys in clubs by eating salad. I've made 5 meals out of my 2.  This is the most legit Hawaiian food I have had in the lower 48. Everything is seasoned well and tastes sooo bombbbbb. SO. MUCH. FLAVOR.   Service - 5/5 All the waiters working here are legit! Either they got island accents or fake them like bosses. Love how genuinely nice they are. Service is not over-the-top or fake. Just nice people being nice and bringing me tasty things. (If you split a plate, don't forget to tip like you ordered two entrees! These guys won't make sheet otherwise!)  Food: Basic menu is on website, but they have a paper insert with daily specials. So if you're calling an order for take-out, ask them if what the specials of the day are! Also, the desserts aren't on the menu. They are listed on the table (see picture).   Aloha Friday: Come early so you can get a seat! This place is jam packed on Friday! They have the most amazing family come out and play bass, uke, and guitar while singing traditional Hawaiian music. I grew up on an island, and it felt like coming home. I didn't realize I was getting my soul healed while eating lau lau.  - Lau lau- 5/5 wrapped in delicious leaves, juicy, and the perfect saltiness when you eat it with rice! - Lomi salmon- 2/5 This was almost all tomato and no salmon :( I guess it counted as my vegetable of the day? - Mac Salad- the guy asked me "Are you sure?" when I said I was fine with the mac salad and white rice. Was he expecting me to sub a vegetable instead? Please, bee-atch. I'm not from California. - Kalbi ribs- 5/5 These are BOMB! Way thick slices and grilled with a nice caramelization on them! They don't skimp, and the pieces are super big!  - Furikake chicken- 5/5 Super crunchy exterior so that it stands up to the glaze and stays super crunchy. You know how Panda Express orange chicken gets all soft if it's been sitting there awhile? No flaccid chicken here, folks. - Haupia cake- 5/5 I used to work at a bakery on island, and we made haupia cake. Theirs here is even better. The cake itself is perfect density, and the flavor is dynamite. - Kona pie- 2/5 Ehhhh eat the haupia and guava cake instead! The coffee flavor isn't strong, and the other sauces they schlepp on the plate overpower any coffee taste.  I'm glad this place isn't in my home city. I'm not looking for employment as a Samoan bouncer at XS quite yet, which is what I would probably be if I lived in Vegas and continued eating here. Fill up on aloha spirit, leave happy, and then go take a nap.

fzHNBtXpB4tSn0Lt3ceiFA.text: Awesome service and great quality food. Lots of food for the money.Bruce is a great guy become a regular you will not be sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tdTkPNrTb-btFO3LXuRJGA.text: A hidden spot serving up amazing Hawaiian food! My friends and I decided to stop here before the drive back to LA after our little impromptu trip to Vegas. The wait was over an hour, but that gave us plenty of time to peruse the menu and decide on what to order.   After being seated, we decided to start off by sharing the Tuna Poke Sampler, which consists of their furikake, shoyu, and sesame-marinated poke. I also ordered the Furikake Chicken for my main. Although the poke sampler was fresh and delicious, the different flavors all ended up tasty of soy sauce and got a bit salty after a while. The Furikake Chicken was great, sweet from the glaze but a little bit salty from the furikake mix, and tender inside and crunchy outside! However, it ended up just tasting sweet after eating it for a while aha.  My only gripe about this place was how understaffed it was. I do not know if it is family run or not, but they basically had two servers on the floor who were not able to fully service all the large parties that were there. A lot of the tables were left dirty for a while until a server had the time to clean it up. But besides that, everything else was great! Great prices for quality Hawaiian food. We all left in food comas, which was not great for the drive back to LA, but we were happy and content^__^ Definitely visiting again the next time I make a trip to Vegas!!

-4ldMRWOXMtAHfNv2GMWlw.text: Some friends and I went here on a early Sunday afternoon and it was insanely busy! This definitely had a mom and pop shop feel, but it's good to see a small business doing this well.   The interior seemed new and still under construction but the lobby was nice and open with plenty of seating.   The menu has a good variety of different Hawaiian foods and drinks. I ordered the hamburger steak with white rice and macaroni salad. The hamburger meat cooked perfectly and well seasoned. Topped with onions and mushrooms and smothered in gravy.    The portions were good for the price and the service was solid as well.   I will definitely be back to try other menu options!

F2vFYFD58pMQK0cY_9VW2w.text: I was craving roast pork and gravy but when I got my food the roast pork was shredded pork which it didn't look like that before. It didn't taste as good as before. I heard this place is under new management and the food is not the same flavor as before.

JyXffpk4KdcDY3IFwqp0Lw.text: The food was amazing the customer service was even better. I recommend the furikake chicken with anything! Definitely coming back here soon !!!  Also the kalbi ribs are delicious !!

Y-G4KvE9cJWmir_kboiBOg.text: Really great Hawaiian options with huge servings. I got a mixed plate, which I highly recommend because you can get 2 meats (or 3 for a larger mixed plate) and rice and it's a large portion. I got the Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Beef and my date got the chicken with Teriyaki Beef, substituting the stream rice for fried rice. Firstly, the portions were huge; neither of us were able to finish the plate. The chicken was amazing, had the right amount of sweetness to savory against the saltiness of the rice. The Teriyaki beef also had great flavors but the Kalbi beef took the cake is definitely worth the extra charge. It had great seasoning nice marbling and was very satisfying. We also got the Chantilly cake for dessert, which of course is also a must have and it was a great choice, not too sweet or too overpowering.  Between the two, our bill was $40 something which was worth nothing given the amount of food we had and we had left over. Definitely coming back to check out more of their local menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken and Tinono Pork with fried rice
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Shrimp and Korean Chicken with side salad
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yelp Special

7aRQmJ34qpLzEC3zbQJdMA.text: Oh my... my boyfriend told me how good this place is. He eats here with his work crew a lot. I was still skeptical. But we've ordered it twice through Postmates and both times it has been amazing!! The amount of food they give is a lot more than I thought I'd get each time! The postmates delivery fee is high but it's soooo worth to eat this deliciousness!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu, teriyaki steak and white rice.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice, teriyaki steak, Chicken Katsu

Wgd4FAMK9l4NVKGHUDhbzw.text: I have had my share of so many island foods but this place had the tastiest food selection. The wait time is a little longer than normal but it truly was worth the wait. I ordered the two item combination plate and the macaroni salad was hands down the most delicious I've ever had.  It's great to come alone or in a group. I will be back for catering.

rSAt9OOxQblxiJ4V0RwhLA.text: Good food in a newly renovated space! The decor has Hawaiian charm and is welcoming. And the service is friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back!!

UazT9L_lZ5pkf0oQ26jlFA.text: If you're looking to eat some authentic Hawaiian food and want to avoid going to the strip then look no further. Authentic Hawaiian food is hard to come by (unless you're on the island) but they do not disappoint here. I suggest coming here on an empty stomach because they are very generous with their plates/serving sizes. Kim was our waitress and she was very friendly and made sure all of our orders were correct accordingly. We also got to sample home made Malasadas by Ada which were amazing. I will definitely be back here!

wEUocJQxn72poUgfkPOOjA.text: Called for takeout and ordered the hamburger steak plate and the loco moco with brown rice. Picked up order and got it home and the loco moco had white rice instead brown also the hamburger steak was just plain hamburger with brown gravy. Don't waste your money very disappointing meal had better food at L&L.

O_ySf7cOh35lWAJrB4D3vA.text: This place is the very best Hawaiian food you can get in Las Vegas!!!  You must try the guava cake it is amazing!!!

lCxqSxIJNVvYA3tMGE3qNQ.text: I have to admit...I've been to Hawaii, but I never really ate hawaiian food until I moved to Vegas.  And until I had Island Flavor I never really knew just how good it could be. I actually stopped in without knowing anything about this place and just went for lunch with my roommate Mason, who has been to Hawaii numerous times so I figured why not give it a try.  As a southerner I am fundamentally pre-programmed to like most of these dishes because they have the same principals of many southern dishes. Slow cooked pork, greens, rice, gravy, fried chicken steak, and a mayo heavy pasta salad as a nice foil to the abundance of savory flavors.  I had the pork lau lau combo which came with 2 scoops of rice a side of the ceviche style ahi poke salad and that coconut pudding that I could happily eat every day for the rest of my life. All of this was $10 and the portion was too much for me to finish and made for great leftovers the next day.  This place has the typical kitschy interior that you would expect with any small hawaiian joint. And the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful with making suggestions based on my limited experience with the cuisine. Although this place is now a bit of a drive from me, and for anybody else who is not in the extreme SW, it is beyond worth the drive.  I would have to pass 3 different hawaiin places on my way to Island Flavor, and to those who have been there...you know why this makes total sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KJwQixSf1uy-icqMaBoJig.text: I often complain about the lack of good eats in the depths of SW Las Vegas.  Sure, we have a few decent spots on Rainbow but i feel like we deserve more place in my neighborhood.  I've probably eaten at about 8 different Hawaiian places in the vegas valley - I give my local place, Island Flavor, the GOLD !  First of all, the employees are great - great attitudes, great services and consistent food.  The space is pretty simple - i'm pleased that they recently remodeled the space that resulted in adding more table space.  I've been told by a couple of the employees they make more $$ on catering than the restaurant itself.  I've been in a few times while they've prepped the food for catering events - it's a sight to see !  Anyways, the food - large portions, very reasonable prices and good 'ol stick to the ribs style grub !  My personal favs ?  The pork loco moco ( awesome !! ), the korean ribs,  the mac salad,  i REALLY dig the gravy ! and most of desserts.  It' all good !!

_FKIQKIZqKKLuQl-nm7FFA.text: Seriously the best place in Las Vegas. Awesome staff even better food! The chicken Katsu is where it's at. Everything on the menu is bomb.com one visit and you'll never go anywhere else!!!

6ZYcYZdLPGC2raZjtQb0yA.text: Any Hawaiians looking for great local food in Vegas should definitely come here. Portions are HUGE but you must must must save room for their dessert (which is huge as well). I personally like to get the combination plate with kalbi and furikake chicken. The guava cake is also to die for. Also have great service!

xB2lfz0BtVn_C1ap1THqAg.text: Definitely the best Hawaiian place in town. Seriously, I can't eat chicken katsu anywhere else anymore. And if you feel like eating oxtail soup during normal hours and don't want to go all the way to California Hotel, this is the place to be. Thanks for ruining every other Hawaiian place for me, Island Flavor.

QB1g5b4bNVtnNaElfEI92Q.text: This is our second time at Island Flavor. I'll be honest, our first trip was nothing spectacular nor memorable. We ordered the special of the day, but the flavors just weren't for us. After a year, we decided to give this place another try since we were craving Hawaiian food.   I am SO HAPPY we came back! We ordered the Furikake Chicken which was so delicious and crispy and the Kalbi Short Ribs which had great grilled flavor. Portions are huge so come hungry or ready to share. Amongst three of us, we could only eat half of each entree so had to pack the rest. Definitely looking forward to those leftovers later.   If you've saved room for dessert, the Chantilly Cake is a must. Chocolate Chiffon cake with butterscotch frosting. Need I say more.   Service-so friendly and attentive-5 stars Food-very flavorful and huge portions-5 stars  We will be back!

hMgukEGVuvhbqhckkqd-Ew.text: Very impressed. Moving from a city where we had one Hawaiian place to LV where they are abundant I had to try most of them, and this is my favorite by far. It was busy when we went but that wasn't an issue. We were seated rather quickly. The portions are HUGE, the Mac salad was amazing and the staff was very friendly.

h3LHZK0fyZm4Dp6Q5amccA.text: Had this for the first time tonight and oh man! We will be back. I had the furikake chicken which comes with 2 big scoops of rice and a big scoop of macaroni salad. This is the best Mac salad I've had. I could eat a bucket of that. My BF had the mixed plate with teriyaki chicken and Korean chicken. This also came with the rice and Mac. He loved it so much he ate the whole thing! Portions are huge, food is soooo yummy and staff is really nice. I came home with enough for another meal!! Mahalo Island Flavor!

hbCQ5Kddhw26qecWiM8o0g.text: This was our second time, brought the kids (18-20) with us. To experience a new place. Last time we were greeted by an amazing hostess, they were busy but you'd never know it by the way she treated us. She was even our waiter, and answered many questions along with some awesome suggestions. The food and service was 5 star. However. Hate to say it but this time... Wow! Not a good Wow unfortunately. Not busy tonight we walked in and barely got a "hi" and led to our table. Menus dropped off and she left to Visit with the table next to us to a flurry of hugs and conversation. The waiter came by got our drinks order, have us time to order and delivered the food in 15 minutes tops. We all specified rice, but maybe didn't say rice ONLY NONE of us like macaroni salad. When we asked about a plate to shop it on to we got a sigh, but we're asked if we would rather have salad which was very nice and we took it. The waiter came over to say we didn't specify it. I said no problem it was taken care of. This was the lady time we saw him. All of us had no drinks, I asked the hostess for some refills during her other conversations and was rushed of, saying be right with you. Witter came back no talking took the drinks filed them up and walked away.  Not sure what happened but the good was still very good, but the service alone may keep me from returning. Ashame people can ruin an experience. Maybe we will try again at another date....maybe

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 way poke...soooo good

VXY6WQgohrIHsRym3tamsA.text: So I have given this place numerous tries and he food portions are always huge which is nice. The service is just sub par. I usually call in my order and the people who answer usually are not in a good mood. Sometimes when I come in, I will come across some nice servers but its not consistent. I haven't tried anything at this place that is outstanding. I usually go here for the convenience of location to my house. My default order is the kalbi ribs.

bpc1_IpOSb4ZWjTbjDVlWg.text: I love this place. Food tastes great and the portions are huge. The kalbi ribs are my favorite!

xJ1ftlUH0PcgYRcv-SRgJA.text: Love the Hawaiian atmosphere... always feel like I'm at home when I come here.    I get full just thinking about the amount of food they give you for the price.  The staff is always full of aloha... even the tita's. Lol.  I've had everything on the menu even the specials they have going on everyday and  I love everything.  It makes it so hard to decide when I go there.  They put their own Big Island twist on Hawaiian Food that gives it that extra wow factor. I was going to explain each dish but I can't write anymore bc im making myself hungry.    Try it and you'll love it.  I'm gonna go grind there now. =)  And for the locals 411 they got GUAVA CAKE!!!

W3PsvYuk7igiyBHHTSvGhw.text: All I'll say is that I was never really a boasting fan of Hawaiian food because it seemed way too simple to be considered it's own food. Now, I don't come here to eat spam, eggs, and rice because anyone can cook that at home. It's like buying cereal at a restaurant.  Nevertheless,  I will always be a fan of the Hoison glazed ribs! The Korean chicken, fried chicken, and katsu are also good too. But if there is something worth drooling for here, it is certainly the ribs. It is more pricey than everything else on the menu but the portions of this dish will make you feel every penny of that $14 you spend here.

Zu9vVMyzxokZ8MCBSELbMw.text: Positive - Amazing food! Large portions and good prices. Try the Furikake style Poke!  Negative - None really

RnJTuYGCdRQ_lJAXChkfig.text: Coming off the highway Yelp told me Island Flavor was closing in 10 minutes. I got there with 5 minutes left and the guy working the cashier greeted and treated me like they had just opened. Friendly, gracious, and even let me buy the spam Musubi he had set aside for himself. I ordered the Chicken Furikake. The kitchen staff, working like a well oiled machine, got my order out in less than 10 minutes. The cashier, still friendly and still helpful bagged me up and got me out the door.   I'm moving more than 20 minutes away from Island Flavor in a few days. I will be driving back just to give them my business and to enjoy their wonderful food.   Highly recommend this gem.

5slGPCzXK3PP01f0ltNmnQ.text: Garlic noodles with chicken. Get some of that and forget about your diet for one meal.

TtLM-_GOi0AZpud6QoAzZQ.text: I love Chicken Katsu and Kalbi short ribs. Their foods are so good and huge portions for $10. You guys should try :) they have good food and good service. So we can't go wrong for that. And Bradley is the best server :)

v5M5S8Mv7ixlvwk1ibuDNg.text: Love the service and most of all the food! When I crave for local Hawaiian food... Island Flavor is the place to go!

WOzS4DgXI1nseqv0_lYzzA.text: Our favorite Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.  The roasted pork and mac salad are amazing!!!   We try to come down every few months

rNQJE7g-r2c8Aiot2dZyGw.text: Food and service is excellent. There's no better place to get Hawaiian food. This is one of my top favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

gesIVgNoL7EYSUjMCYmpDA.text: Awesome experience.The management on staff are dedicated to making all feel welcome and appreciated. Great ambiance and delicious food.  Wonderful wine list. I can only rave!

6waCNYMMxCL__dSVxccldg.text: Service is great, food is great( kind of Americanized ) but prices aren't fair when you compare other Hawaiian places . A little expensive. But you miss the taste of a little paradise you can always visit them .

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki burger

34rLISF7Sy2KyJi4RJ7HwA.text: New and upgraded. Moving on to bigger and better things. We first started going to island flavor 4 years ago when it was a small little restaurant with white walls, now it has grown up with an upgraded decor and live band. Great food is what brought the crowds. Now they have broken down walls and expanded the area, looks amazing. The food is still the same.  We always start with the poke Hawaiian mix. The wife and I always share the mix plate, which comes with your 2 choices of entrees. I do not believe you can finish the mix 2 plate entree alone unless you are a giant.  We usually get the furikake chicken, kalbi short ribs, & upgrade and get the fried rice. I believe this is the best spot for Hawaiian style food. I always leave in a food coma state.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

_cyKvSKEmEhGN8TPgZ_Ypg.text: They changed owners and it shows. The wait time is extremely long and the food tastes different. It's very disappointing because Island Flavor used to be my favorite Hawaiian spot.

ig35a07mlkwy6_NetjCNog.text: I like this place! Ordered some for delivery the other  night because i didn't want to go out and drive.   Island Flavor is one of those local spots that offer food that you can't taste anywhere else. They're not your typical franchise restaurant. They're food tastes more like you're actually in Hawaii.  My favorite is the Furikake Chicken. It's sweet like teriyaki but it's made of crispy chicken. I also love their desserts but it's been awhile since I've had them. I'm going to be honest, i don't frequent this place as often as I like but because they have their specialty dishes I know their the only place that can satisfy my cravings when it hits!

6slp5eSBKybr_85Nl--JTA.text: Our go to Hawaiian place.   Love that they updated the restaurant. Found out that they have a new owner.   Must get the oxtail soup. I do miss the old recipe that had peanuts on it.   The garlic chicken is good. Combo plates are big!!! Must save room for dessert. They used to have coco puffs. But current dessert selection is good.

XA2-zv3VWg0ALogtIjfF3A.text: Hands down, this is one of the best authentic Hawaiian restaurants in the valley of Las Vegas. It's very welcoming and cozy. The good food, dimmed lights, and relaxing music-- I'm ready for a nap!!   I ALWAYS come back for the furikake chicken and it never disappoints. It is BOMB and they give you a hefty serving. I'm honestly afraid to try anything else! Lol. The chicken to rice ratio is perfect and the side of Mac salad hits the spot.  My friend got the teriyaki chicken and like what I said, THEY WILL NEVER DISAPPOINT YOU.    Come and try this place when you can. You'll not regret a coin!!

yQrIaIAk0H90PX2Gnsdhng.text: Whoa!  I'm accustomed to large portions compliments of my friends from the Pacific Islands of Guam but Island Flavor portions are on a new level of generosity! I ordered  Furikake & Panko Shrimp $11.50 not my favorite Pescatarian dish to be honest. The shrimp was bland and blah. The poke is delish especially the Korean $17.95 (1lb) definitely recommended. My favorite unfiltered dame is a carnivore and was satisfied with her combination plate. The service is pleasant but the food didn't knock my socks off.

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Shrimp $11.50 Cucumber Kimchi is amazing $2.00

SCEOu4BSxz33BpnCRnrS0Q.text: I have been to this place a few times now, and everytime has been consistently good. Having tried a few different Hawaiian places in the Vegas area, this one is my favorite. The customer service is always good, the food portions are good, and the taste is delicious. The furikake chicken, kalua pork and cabbage, and katsu are probably my favorites. The last time I went I had the Teriyaki beef which was good, but too much sweet teriyaki sauce! Oh but the other sauces, they have tons of different hot sauces that are all consistently delicious!   You also get the option of subbing rice for brown rice, fried rice, or mac salad. Usually I go with the mac salad and brown rice combo which is amazing. Their Spam musubis are good too and they are known for their avocado fries. I think theyre ok, not worth the hefty price in my humble opinion, but my 'mates swear by em!

n8A89X8iTz8cz9WQ64Ffzg.text: [SERVICE] Came here on a Saturday afternoon and the store was really busy, they also seemed really understaffed and the whole store was chaotic. Other than the issues with a slightly slower service due to such a large amount of customers, the servers were really kind and friendly; the host may come off a bit rude but it's probably because there were so many customers coming in at once. Overall, I really enjoyed the service from my server, I forgot her name but she was really nice.  [PARKING] Located inside a plaza so there was plenty of parking, shouldn't be an issue!  [FOOD] Portion sizes were huge and the food was pretty good. For the price you're paying, I thought the quality and portion was definitely worth it. The only issue is that I believe they messed up my order because I ordered the chicken katsu but got the furikake chicken instead. It was fine, I didn't want to wait an additional 45 minutes for my food to come out. We got the Monstah Plate and its definitely enough food to share for 2 people in my opinion.  [TLDR] Try to come at an off hour or not the weekend, can get super busy; the service and kitchen will probably get backed up.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

enVq6mk7NN9MWkDng8vm4A.text: Drove 30 minutes to pick up dessert and grab to go plate. I only came for the dessert which is always good!  I was so confused with the new staff. Very unfriendly and it was like I was bothering them to order food. Good Luck to the new owners because they will need it.

pP1Q1TRYAyQgRwT7wHzLZQ.text: Long time supporter of this restaurant from the original owners from the Big Island.  Been coming here for the past 7 years and although the renovations and expansion of the space is great, I have to say the service has gone down since the new owners took over.    Today, the service was absolutely terrible.  Saturday's have typically been busy but Owner needs to staff accordingly as they were slammed and didn't look like they were able to handle the demand.  Customers look either irritated, felt sorry for the staff or both.    Our waitress Lei was apologetic but definitely needs a lot of improvement when it comes to hospitality.  She didn't ask if we needed anything or any refills on our drinks the entire time until we asked for the check.  It took over 40 min after we ordered to get our food served.  After she brought my wife and kids plates out, she told me she's just waiting on my food to be done.  My plate literally after she said that was put on the counter by the cooks.  I watched my dish sit on the counter for over 15 min before it was brought to me cold.  Lei, my server not only looked at my plate but touched it 5X and my wife and I sat their shaking our heads why she wasn't bringing out my dish to me!  I finally got up and told her that my dish has been sitting there for quite some time.  They offered to remake my dish but to wait and additional 20-30 min to bring it out, no thank you.  What's even more laughable is she said she'll give me a 10% discount on my meal.  In my opinion, that meal should have been comped.  Lei, did apologize but definitely did not come across sincere.  Due to time, I asked my daughter to give her our check along with our payment and my daughter said she was rude in saying to wait.  Not cool...  She was more than capable of accepting my payment since she was not carrying anything at the time.    When customers are growing impatient and having to assist in Bussing tables so that they can sit down and support your restaurant, there's something wrong here.  They shouldn't have to that or feel compelled to.  Where's the Manager or Owners?  I'm from Maui and I'm all about the Aloha Spirit.  There was none of that today....  they hired some locals from the islands but where's the Aloha guys???!!!    Compliments to the cooks as the food did taste good although my food was cold but that's not their fault.  There's a middle aged Hawaiian lady that has blonde hair, she was not in my section and she was hustling and doing a great job in my opinion.  Can't say anything good about the rest of the team.  The 2 stars are for cooks and the Hawaiian lady with blonde hair.  My overall comment on this experience is, if you like Hawaiian Plate Lunch food that taste good but don't mind getting it cold when it should be hot and don't mind bad service, come to Island Flavor.

-BbQvDTFiRRNh4suhdnHzA.text: First time here and a good place to try if you are shooting for a spot where the locals go. They have a wide variety of options on their menu.  Ordered the monstah mix plate which comes with a choice of 3 meats, 3 scoops of rice and a side of mac salad. We tried the Kalbi short ribs, furikake shrimp and korean chicken (choice of drums or thighs). Kalbi short ribs have a great flavor but are very tough and not tender. Furikake shrimp comes in a panko style breading and deep fried. Korean chicken is boneless and fried. Shrimp and chicken were good but would probably opt for another option next time.   Also ordered a side of their Portuguese sausage which was really good in flavor. I love musubis which is a seaweed wrapper stuffed with rice and a choice of meat, as the only option they have is spam (sad face). Also sauces not included, $1 each. The teriyaki sauce is the best one, similar to a sweet and tangy eel sauce!  Service can be a little slow. Not the best Hawaiian food I've ever had, but it's a good try if you want something different off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monstah mix plate with furikake shrimp, korean chicken and kalbi short ribs + 3 scoops of rice and a side of mac salad. Mac salad is good!

pccyHm86NltCmeX__2TWhA.text: Island Flavor is simply the best Hawaiian food I've had in either Vegas or SF.  Ok maybe not the best best Hawaiian but  it's still pretty up there.  By the way, what is it about Vegas  and all these Hawaiian spots  and taquerias and ayce sushi and KBBQ spots and Pho . . .  man, there's hella places to eat in Vegas.  But I digress yet again  The food at Island Flavor has a freshness and love that puts the other Hawaiian places to shame.  Seriously, almost all items on the menu will satisfy.  I mean their food finds that fine balance between salt and sweet and spicy and savory.  And the portion sizes are quite generous.    I'm a fan of their Chicken katsu and Furikaki shrimp - what can I say, I'm a sucker for deep-fried deliciousness.  And don't even get me started on their desserts.  Overall, a must try when in Vegas.

-SF7vOXlJZOLrT7aDzW2gA.text: I always to to make it here when we are in town! To food so yummy and flavorful!!! Everything in my picture is to die for! (Mix plate, fried rice is the best) & spam musubi was delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6vWoc9s6ZuC9iTGNFhf4sA.text: Island Flavor opened a location in Torrance, CA which I went to, but I wanted to try the original location here in LV. This weekend was the yearly Dodger basketball tournament and my fiancee and I knew that it would be busy coming here but we didn't mind. The food was pretty good and the service was okay. We waited 45 minutes for our food, but that was okay because we expected it.   Here's where the 2 star review comes in. We were first on the list to get a table and 2 other parties of 2 got seated after us, an elderly couple and 2 guys. The elderly couple complained about the wait twice and the server said she has to wait 15 minutes because we (my fiancee and I) ordered before them and our food was going to come out before theirs. They then asked for the check after 30 minutes of waiting. 5 minutes later, the server brought out their food. On top of that, the large table next to us got charged for things that they ordered and never received.  My problem is that the elderly couple next to us complained about their food and that's why they got theirs before ours. By doing this, you (the restaurant) are showing people that they can complain a lot and get what they want and I refuse to eat at an establishment that supports this. I gave a second star because the food wasn't bad and she comped us a to go refill of POG..

K3-4s_-MGghlJ-1HvEcU9Q.text: Best place to eat, very clean and nice people great bomb food.. I would highly recommend this place on point  with great ALOHA   Had to box half my plate great food I can enjoy later. The experience was amazing and could have not been better.  The Kalbi ribs must have and the fudakaki chicken. You can get a Mix plate anything with the palm trees of your choice and must get the fried rice.  The fried rice is BOMB with awesome portions

rSuNr8j8cUuDXdw5Ots-_w.text: When did the latest owner take over? I've been coming here for 6 years and always found the service to be ok at best. Friendly but often kinda slow. I've noticed a definite improvement in the service lately.   Stopped in the other night and had the hamburger steak for the first time. It did not disappoint. The Teri Beef and Chopped Beef never disappoint.   My server Tyler was excellent. Friendly, attentive (much more so than I've experienced in the past) and totally on top of it. He stopped by multiple times to make sure everything was ok, a noticeable difference from the past and an indication to me that ownership cares and is trying hard.

9UkScHmifRY1MujY9xhdjw.text: Love this place! First off, gone here multiple times. I always get the Portuguese sausage and egg with rice. Since living in Vegas for 2 years and missing Hawaii like crazy, eating here makes me feel like home again. Personally, this place is the closest I can get to Hawaii Mcdonalds platter for the Portuguese sausage which I absolutely love dearly.  Service was excellent and staff is very friendly and welcoming. Hawaiian music is playing in the background and the entire restaurant and bathrooms are very clean. To me, portion sizes are huge. Overall experience is a 10 out of 10 for me!

ynS13EGatphNb05ZtmhyPg.text: Island Flavor was my go to place for Hawaiian food. The always got the Kalbi ribs. Now they are $18 and so thickly cut! That is so expensive and chewy now! I  am so disappointed. Looking for a new place with more reasonable and tender kalbi ribs!

ZcIRAHEo_F-XoAAIgIgrrw.text: I want to order the other stuff on the menu but I always end up getting the Loco Moco or Oxtail soup! It's that good and I don't see myself getting tired of ordering the same thing anytime soon. Guess one day ill get to order the rest but for now I recommend those two dish if your not sure of what to get! Portions are huge so go hungry!

8_XCpx-MZj_tUk9G406pbA.text: My go to place for bomb.com Hawaiian food. Great service , great food, great dessert. Big generous Hawaiian portions, for the poor people like me . Well worth the money. My favorite is definitely the chicken teriyaki salad. Loco moco is delicious , best gravy in town.

pJDIf1YcXkeXki9zjNjxMw.text: after a late night of board games.. (cuz that's what i do when i come to vegas lol).. my friends were hungry and we decided to pick up some food from island flavor. it was between this and thai and the pictures of the food won me over.   between the 7 of us we had 6 plates and the total was $62. i thought for a combination plate, $9.75 was a bit on the expensive side.. until i saw the portions. my mixed plate came with 3 pieces of short rib and at least 4 furikake shrimp.. possibly 5. i could have easily split my plate with someone.   the shrimp was the better of the two choices i had. not that the short ribs were bad... but i liked the unique flavor the furikake gave the shrimp. minus points for using mae ploy sauce as a dip for the shrimp. don't get me wrong.. i like mae ploy sweet chili sauce.. but i like it when restaurants take the opportunity to create their own awesome sauce instead of opting for pre-bottled stuff.   the mac salad was just okay IMO. i'm in love with L&L's mac salad i dont think its fair to take away points if i can't tear myself away from their version.   service was good over the phone when i ordered and very nice when we went in to pick up the order. it was all ready for us on the counter.  overall.. 3.5 stars.

QMiAGzMYEZpDlJIUyR6bXQ.text: We were around the area and yelped local restaurants. This place was 4.5 stars out of 200+ reviews. It was definitely a local favorite and one of mine as well. Portions were large (as we saw other customers local moco) and good.   We ordered the poke and korean BBQ ribs. Poke was market price ($16), but it looked like we got about $25 worth. They were large slices and great tasting. The BBQ ribs ($11) were great tasting as well. There were four pieces along with mac salad and rice.   If anyone is in that area, Island Flavor is definitely a place to visit.

pANIMWS3rWFPIof66dfVcA.text: I love the food here and I am never disappointed. The teriyaki chicken is delicious and the kalbi ribs were delicious too. I usually get the pork with gravy which is yummy too. You know it's good when you see a lot of Hawaiians in here. The Chantilly cake is my personal favorite of their desserts. You get really large portions here and I always have left overs. Service is always nice too.

repoFiij_Xg1tSMHAq1gSA.text: Before we found this place, we have already been to 2 other Hawaiian restaurants in Las Vegas. We have only been here once and so as the other 2, but this place is the best of the all. I ordered the mixed plate -  2 scoops of rice, mac salad and two choices (I picked Kalbi and Korean chicken). Man, something about their recipes here that makes their food so much better. My friends and I suggested that we come here every weekend...its that good!

5jowqQiifKaaq2nZphcYEQ.text: Grew up on Hawaiian food, and lived on Big island and Oahu, despite I'm a Cali and Vegas boy. This is the best in town. Been to almost every one. Forget the nearby L&L and Ohanas.. Go here! One time they gave me free chantilly since my order took ridiculously long. I declined, but they insisted! I just wanted the food!!! Only once the LauLau was too salty, but other than than never had a problem, and food was always good..

bXWE0Cf-COwUFuJ51mFjug.text: Um...yum!  I went quite a ways out of my way to eat here. All the reviews gave me hope for a good meal. I ordered a combo plate of chicken teriyaki and kalbi short ribs. To order the ribs in the combo is an extra $1. The plate came with 2 scoops of rice, 1 scoop of macaroni and a mountain of meat. I could not finish it all so now I have leftovers for later. The ribs had great flavor but they were kind of fatty, though that is where the flavor is... The chicken teriyaki was moist, not too sweet nor too salty.  All of this was $13 and change plus tip. Oh, and the waitress was good at refilling my water when I needed it and she brought be sriracha when I asked for it so she's good people in my book.  If I am in the area I will certainly go back. Check it out for yourself

KdrluRUqlrkp2XdfrfBmnA.text: On a total whim, I decided I wanted kalbi. And haupia anything. I was about to leave work and checked Yelp (which is practically my best friend at this point) and found out Island Flavor was only five minutes away. Called and ordered to go. It was ready a few minutes after I got there. Had the kalbi and haupia cake and they were both AMAZING. Fresh and delicious. The prices were pretty good and everyone there was super friendly and helpful. This is my new "after work on a Saturday" place to go.

T6VZfYut0JtlkAL6wsoG5A.text: THE INCIDENT I found Island Flavor by mistake one day while getting gas at the local Short Line Express.  It just so happens while I was at the pump, I miraculously look away from the ever-changing numbers of the digital LCD and see "GRAND OPENING" for a Hawaiian themed restaurant.   It must have been fate that I saw it or close enough for me to see since I'm near blind as a bat.  Hmm, Hawaiian sounded good to me that night...yummo!  So, since I paid for my gas w/my debit card, I trudged my rear end into the Short Line Express for a pack of cigs and to ask the store clerk if she thought the restaurant was any good.  In her thick Asian accent, "Oh yes!  Vewwy goo!!!  Goo, goo."  Sho'nuff, she was right!!    THE PARKING LOT Because I'm lazy, I drive from the convenience store to Island Flavor, which is in the same parking lot, possibly 100 feet away.  HEY, they made cars for a reason!!!!!  Island Flavor is on the right side of a strip mall next to Short Line Express convenience store.  The strip mall also houses a dance studio, massage parlor, Familia Pizzeria (I just posted a review for this one), and some other small businesses.  If you are looking for an easy way to find it while driving, look for Bomas Bar & Grill.  Island Flavor is fairly new, in fact, I had to "Add a Business" on Yelp to review it.  When I got into the restaurant the server told me it just opened back in October 2008.  THE DECOR Anyways, once inside there wasn't much ambiance.  I think they're still trying to find their niche to whom they will identify with.  Though, the waitresses did wear floral blouses with dark trousers.  In the center of the restaurant sits a large square granite bar which looks like it was supposed to be a hibachi grill or regular bar.  There's no alcohol back there or any cooking utensils.  Who knows?  I only know this because I chose to sit up there while I waited for my (take out) food; I didn't want to disturb any of the waitresses' clean tables.  Around the bar, there sits about a dozen or so plain dining tables.    THE MENU Ahh...this is what you really want to read...They serve all of the traditional island fare from...ahi, burgers, chicken katsu, KALUA PIG, kalbi ribs, loco moco, mixed plates, saimin, teriyaki.  For my fellow SPAM lovers, I did NOT see musubi.  Maybe we have to ask?  Okay, so this is how I judge Hawaiian restaurants...kalua pig.  Theirs was EXCELLENT, BOMB SHIZZLE, FANeff'NTASTIC!  The downside...their prices are a tid bit higher ($1-2 more) than your other Hawaiian restaurants.  To me, it's still worth it.  I guess you figured out what I ordered for take out, Kalua Pig (no cabbage) w/rice and a side of brown gravy.  The total was $10.51 w/tax included.  THE HOURS TO COME BY Monday-Friday 11am-9pm Saturday           11am-8pm Sundays & Holidays Closed  THE CONCLUSION When we dine or get take out here again, I'll update this review to include more of their menu.  Support the locals, this place impressed me with their food.  Oh yeah, my bf who had my leftovers thought it was EXCELLENT, BOMB SHIZZLE, FANeff'NTASTIC as well!

VjeU16iJST6Nk4qvvtAWKg.text: I know island food. I'm a samoan girl who grew up in New Zealand & lived in Hawaii. This is as good as it gets! So glad my co-workers introduced this place to me :-D

D9je6k4nb3OuucjTmwZKhQ.text: Truly authentic Hawaiian food!  This place is wonderful, from the food to the service.  The Chantilly cake is Mmm Mmm GOOD, definitely a must have!

L69GT6GTqT4pWRhrPIOdQg.text: This place is right down the street from us just past Rhodes Ranch coming from the freeway.. we ordered to-go.  Order 1 Kalbi ribs entree and an order of Hawaiian pork.  Both came with rice and mac salad or toss salad.  They didn' t have mashed potatoes or spam musubi when we went.  The ribs were delicious, but some of the ribs were mostly fat (4 in total) Hawaiian pork, huge portion, tender and with lots of gravy! Mac salad- I've had better but still good salad with papaya dressing - dressing was creamy and sweet, some of the salad looked wilted  cheap prices too $9 for each, def be back soon!

uUdV_j6_qMdzwJk8AEcqiA.text: Island Flavor was a palce that I would definitely go again. The atmosphere was great, the portions of the food were unreal, the food was very unique and original and the service was great. 5 stars for Island Flavor!  Also I am not a big sweets fan but the desserts were to die for!

WEUBQHvZ6xNhOF11dbG9YQ.text: if you want a taste of real hawaiian food this the the place to go..any local from islands will free right at home here. There is no haole inspired terriyaki chicken with pineapple at this place..True katsu, authentic short ribs, home made mac salad..and the portion size arein True hawaiian tradition...I have eaten here over a dozen times and the place is familly run..so you feel like you are going to a bbq at an aunties house rather than a formal dining place..which is awesome for family dinners with a 4yr old..the ladies that work the night shifts call my daughter by name and treat her like their own little neice..letting her order herself and occasionally getting a free ice cream if she is a good girl The food here is not low-fat by any means..but if you want some amazing hawaiian comfort food here you go..this place is run laid-back island style..so go here to just cruise and relax not if your on a time schedule..this is not the place to get in and out for a quick bite..its a place to bring the whole ohana and talk story of some ono grinds...its a place to remember that a meal is a time to make memories and share family values while breaking bread..not a place to just feed your stomach when your hungry..i feel like I am back home in da islands everytime we come here  gotta try the short-ribs mixed plate ribeye steak korean chicken katsu dip and the chantilly cake..omg  nothing on this menu is small portioned or prepared wrong..you can tell the food is made with family love..so go enjoy some Aloha!!

u67cfEM62f8XFcH9jTeuEQ.text: We love Hawaii & of course the food.  This is so authentic & no one will go away without leftovers.  So many people came in for takeout & as the plates came by with other people's food, I gawked as everything looked good & huge.  We came behind 6 other groups so it took a little longer for our food to come but when my kalbi with salad & rice ($9.75) & my son's furikake shrimp & chicken teri with mac & rice came ($9.25), all was good.  We had enough for a whole next meal.  Mahalo.

urh9VNfKkQgEpmPb0Tph-Q.text: I've only eaten here once, but I'm already a huge fan.  I had the Hawaiian plate, which consists of Pork Lau Lau, I think it's called Ahi Poke salad, some other salad, haupia... and of course rice and mac salad.  Everything was top notch and tremendously enjoyable.  To top it off, the people working there are just extremely friendly and welcoming.  I must eat here more often!

H_wgzdebOojKTVfL_FevjA.text: Update: I'm giving this place 3 stars so far for the effort of trying to fix the problem, but still haven't tried the food yet (again) so I still can't update that issue. More update to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the food we got...it&#39;s bleeding!!

u4dJ_cC7mj27lY0IOT_r4A.text: Amazing food, friendly staff, great prices.  I would definitely go back here, hands down!

drzjHjb4cCMiBSqk3AGhhQ.text: Great prices for ginormous portions. Moco Loco is made up of a 1/2 lb homemade burger patty topped with two eggs over white rice and the whole thing covered in brown gravy. Looked soo good. I didn't order it but my friend had it and he was sitting across from me. I was waiting for him to offer but he never did and 15 minutes later not a trace remained. So, I assume it was good. I did try the oxtail soup which was full of tender oxtail, and vegetables. The broth was a little too salty for my taste buds but i enjoyed the large, tender oxtail pieces and how they just fell apart when I touched 'em with my spoon. I will definitely make this a pit stop before I had home to SD and you will not be disappointed if you are craving for that Island Flavor.

7nv3fjfmw0vL-UfwZoKQZg.text: Was very disappointed went there twice since the new owners, wanted to give them a chance .  Food was dry, not sure what they did with the Mac salad, it was junk.   The atmosphere is not welcoming like how it used to be, no aloha spirit .    So sad it was a good go to place but I'm not going to waste my money anymore.  We had 4 plate lunch and one avocado fries, our bill was $92.00, and that was takeout .  Waiting for zippys or gonna go to the other local places.  We won't return .

Che064EYspA599W4j5PiaA.text: If your in the area, this is the best Hawaiian food you can get. Very good deals for huuuuuge portions. I love the Korean chicken and the Kalua pork. All the sides really fill you up too. So, so if you want a lot of good food for a low price, come here!

9Ubja15xdnOK8UAhJ6ynKg.text: All I can say is wow!! The portion here is HUGE!! You are really getting your money's worth. Everything was so delicious!! We were a group of 13 people so it was good that the portion was huge. We got spicy avocado bowl, oxtail soup,Kalbi and chicken, fried noodles with teriyaki chicken. It was so filling and yummy. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for some authentic Hawaiian flavor!

3CPCQtjN7rX0AHssQ0bwEA.text: This place never disappoints!!! Been here when it was smaller, and now under the new management and it's still great!! HUGE portions and even though you're full, your mouth will still wanna keep eating! For my local people, majaaaahhhh kanacks! ALWAYS get the furikake chicken and the kalbi- I just wanna suck on these all day. Full of flavor!!! And the service is just as great! We'll always stop by before we go back home

4z4zENOahllegF28zQsPEg.text: Food was great! Being from Hawaii reminded me of home. Portions were massive and the friend rice addition to the plate well worth it. Had their Korean chicken plate and was bomb.

gILpXaOrJAcRY89YhfzlTA.text: This is a local favorite of mine! Located southwest of Las Vegas about 16 min from the Vegas strip. It's definitely worth the drive if you want good Hawaiian food. See my short video review of the food we ordered here at JensVegasReviews.com. The plates are HUGE and warning you will be stuffed. My favorite is the Furikake Chicken and for dessert don't forget to share or not share an Island Mud Pie! Yummmm The servers are always super friendly with quick service. Price is just right. Wait time is not long on weekdays but it can get busy during weekend especially with a live band. Definitely a must visit if you have never been here!

MiT8oRBYrFhOc39UdKFu9g.text: Food was very good and served in a timely manner extra hot big portions service was speedy and was ready in a timely manner waiters had acceptional service

3sewkvZnBEKiVjRlRc-50A.text: My family and I have been ordering appetizing Hawaiian fare from this dining establishment for quite some time. We have been very satisfied with the quality, portions, and delectable meal offerings. It was disappointing to have had an unpleasant take out experience last time we ordered here for an incomplete dinner. However, the owner Bruce contacted me right away regarding this. I am delighted to have such a warm local business with delicious meals so close to home. We will definitely keep ordering from here and highly recommend. Move over Aloha Kitchen and L&L! :)
