pCIGjWPRUgAQ1rS2apaltQ.text: Absolutely love, love this place! so happy it's in my neighborhood. Hands down, the BEST furikaki chicken!

FbKiymA2Wi9j5HQmkz5l2w.text: we came here on a monday lunch. not much people on there. not much wait. we ordered three mixed plates and it was a good portion for the 5 of us. the portions are a hit and miss, sometimes they give a lot more, sometimes not too much. the quality of the food is always good though. very flavorful and would definitely come back again

dyuBbKUi-afSoCongeOY0g.text: Great place to eat. Goos food great service. Great decorations. Bringing the islands to Vegas.

HqmLZS15UcHMqq50YRkpcQ.text: Since new Owners took over, service and food have changed dramatically.  Food orders can take up too 45 minutes or longer.  Food is burnt, not very friendly or personal like before!!  My personal recommendation, stick with what works. You're representing a Hawaiian restaurant,with the word ALOHA!! involved. A place for too OHANA GATHER!!

sW101P62ey-eOKlaagS7gA.text: Arrived for dinner with the family . We were super hungry and we usually go to this spot because of the portions. They are now under a new owner as the previous owner had sold it to another family . Portions are now smaller and prices went up . Food is still the same but the service has changed . Put our order in and half an hour later we followed up with our order only to be told they forgot it so they asked to take it down again. We left promptly following such a stupid question by the server .

60Bbi9CGC-rebNlbPy8uAw.text: Don't usually write a review but very dissatisfied.  I ordered take out, and very appalled at the portion size of the plates now.  I understand that this establishment is under new ownership and it shows.

E13qSd1KzA5LY3rxnBPTzA.text: Probably the best furikake chicken I have ever had in my entire life. After eating everything I could fit in my stomach, I'm still sitting here with more than half of my plate still present. Needless to say, this food is AMAZING.

lW5NMdGc8nsqykw8D_Y1CA.text: I've been going to Island Flavor for 5 years. It was my favorite restaurant. Recently, the owners sold to a group which has destroyed Island Flavor in the quest to make it more profitable. My favorite waitress-that-became-my-friend, Lei was let go, along with the original staff. The Big Island feel is gone. The new staff ignored us and didn't fill our "lemon" water often enough (we live in a desert), the lemon was 100% rind, the recipes for Furikake chicken and Hawaiian pork have changed to be much spicier, the costs went up, the walls are gray, there are some kind of rusted metal slats over the windows, and there's a whole bunch of TVs with sports games on them. It's like eating in a dark prison, with service that fits that setting. Sadly, Island Flavor is ruined. I'll miss the Hawaiians that made me feel like a family member there. And Lei, we will always miss you. -Kit and Amaris

dqc8_KAXwQ8MRCAB-5qQeQ.text: My family and I have been coming here for years! We always loved it. But since the new owners it has been so different. There is no Aloha spirit when you go there anymore your lucky if they acknowledge you with a smile! We recently ordered dinner to go and one thing that stuck out was their toss Salad! When we got home and opened it, it wasn't  a fresh salad. The lettuce was brown all around the edges throughout the whole salad, the tomato was cut into 3 pieces which looked like their eyes were closed when they cut it. I didn't bother to call them about and just not going back anymore.

qgN8HgB2r-UKqJyz5Y0GvA.text: We can't keep away from this place. It's a 45 minute drive from our house, but it's worth it, especially when they have live music. We have never had a dish we don't like. My favorite is the Furikake Chicken. My wife's favorite is the guava cake. The new renovation is very nice and thankfully decreased the wait time, which was still worth it beforehand.

uEAaOW3XRfgQWOg8VCcurw.text: I have been coming here since they've opened. It's a place that never disappoints! The meals are largely portioned that leftovers are always great the next day and for the price you'll never go wrong. The atmosphere is family friendly and reminds me of home.

CFdJpBR_rGyttiIz9jokNw.text: Waiter Forgot Some Things , Either Than That Everything Tastes Great ! If You Get Haupia Make Sure To Get It Without The Syrup. Pretty Sweet

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BXnF76V34_t6uvUOG7v2jQ.text: Came by via Nelson's UYE/B-Day and had the kalbi with 2 sides which had good flavor, nice little char along with the traditional mac salad and a huge side of salad. Had some of the fellow Yelper's poke and it was all pretty good. As you would expect at a Hawaiian joint, there were tremendous portions, I took nearly half my meal home. Pretty much the only concern I had was the heavy mayo like dressing for the salad and a couple of complaints of other Yelper's katsu and roasted pork being (and looking) pretty dry other than that, I don't mind heading back here again. 3.5 rounding up.

f1D1j-nDyETO7c5u9sXysw.text: A displaced local buddy (who now lives in LV, i guess it makes him a LV local) took me to this place and walked out with a smile on my tummy.  A little off the beaten path from the Strip, but stepping into this place I felt if I stepped back into Hawaii.  Even the people eating here had some connection to the islands.  I had the Kalbi and the Chop Steak.  Mmmm so ono, even by local standards.  My buddy had the fried chicken and always gets it so I know that gotta be a winna.  I will make it a point to stop here whenever I am in Sin City.

YkTRLkpExQBhWdoww7681w.text: The portions are pretty big - my bf and I usually share a combination plate of beef teriyaki and kalbi short ribs which also comes with rice and salad, or get our own and have enough for 2 meals each.  The beef teriyaki and short ribs are super tasty!  I've also tried the fresh ahi poke and pork won tons - both are really good.  I wasn't a fan of the chop steak or chicken katsu but that could just be me.

LPqwmO3KV8ffnv0cGpC7Dg.text: Went here for lunch last week. I had the loco moco which was HUGE and super Yummy! My friend had the fried poke which was also very Yummy. Staff was super friendly and provided quick service. Restaurant was also clean.

3Jyy8VT4DObTyKHzOO3Whg.text: i can't get enough of this place!! reminds me of back home!! chicken katsu loco moco bomb good, ahi poke, and every friday they have the hawaiian plate i can't get enough of it, good prices and biug portions and service is great!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup &amp; mahi salad

luFygJrBwCW0u4zrQtQF9g.text: Okay, I absolutely love this place! It feels like home so much! The staff is amazing, always friendly and very welcoming. BIIIIIGGG portions!! I love their salads.. It's big and hearty and the dressing is just sooo yummy. All the salads are the same.. lettuce, thick slices of tomato, cucumbers, okinawan sweet potato and topped off with won ton chips with the creamy sesame dressing and then you can either pick the teriyaki chicken (which I really like) grilled opakapaka, fried poke or the katsu. Anyone you pick, they are all good!! Another thing I really like is the roast pork.. Omg so tender and salty, just how I like it. I don't know why I never ate the roast pork loco moco before but it all just make sense!! Amazing!!!! I guess it just really big and I can't eat as much as I used to. Korean fried chicken is another one of my faves. Kalbi is also tasty and meaty. And if you like fish, try the opakapaka with the miso plate.. Soooo good!! I've tried their desserts before too.. Fantastic!! Try this place if you want some bomb ass local food from hawaii, you won't be disappointed.

sn1a6mGSLwgkRvxDbDEZdg.text: A bit off the beaten path of the strip, but worth the drive. The food was fantastic. Reminded me of being back in Hawaii. Don't forget to try the guava cake. I will be back next time I am in Vegas ..

4BrR0tDvYy0qDv5JzuGOkQ.text: Chantilly cake!!!!! SOOOO GOOD!!!!! really liked the Kalbi short ribs!!!  Definitely worth checking this place out when in Vegas!!  It's a little bit of Hawaii in Vegas!!

0-vwnuE3bpE04XeMRK1syQ.text: Located in a strip mall with plenty of parking, this place appears to have expanded from one store front to two.  The photos on the wall don't appear to be the same kitchen pass through window.  I can see why this place has 200+ reviews and a high average.  This is no fluke. This is not 200 friends of restaurant yelp-up this place.  The food is just incredible and it's not that expensive.  I had the kalbi and slow cooked pork combo with a side salad.  I knew this was going to be good when the side salad rocked.  The freshest romaine lettuce I have ever seen in Vegas with fresh tomatoes, cucumber and a slice of bean cake.  A creamy sesame dressing with crispy wonton chips made a starter for what's to come.  The mac salad was very good.  The kalbi was tender on the outter region and nice and flavorful chewy near the bone.  You get 9 bones in this order.  The bbq is really good and has a slight char for more flavor.  The slow cooked pork was tender on the inside and chewy on the outside where the heat dries out the meat into a nice chewy texture. Not quite a chicharone texture, but almost.  The table next to me got the pokii and it looked fantastic.  I'm definitely coming back with my friends who are arriving to Vegas later.  This place is for real and the chef is doing things right.

6MawXD-28ZanQaaCjbo0oQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to grab some local Hawaiian grinds. It's always good for the price and the social experience. The tables and chairs are spaced moderately from each other so while your party is still granted some form of privacy it's still close enough to catch parts of the conversation going next to you. Normally I don't like to eavesdrop but here you can't help it. You hear stories about places back in the islands, memories growing up, uh-oh's from the party last night, grandma's funny joke, the usual gossip, and loud bursts of laughter just to name a few. Bottom line is, everyone is enjoying themselves and that's the atmosphere you would expect here. The menu has a good selection and if that's not enough, throw in a page of the day's specials and homemade desserts. The only bad part about this experience is trying to figure out what you want to order. Make sure you come with an appetite because the portions are huge! More power to you if you can throw it all back but I usually leave with enough leftovers to last for the rest of the day. No extra star only because it took a while before the food came but it was no one's fault. The place was busy and I was starving. (o.O)

YVB7yPfS3ZEj72ghHBFJEA.text: Went to Island Flavor for lunch food was great.

gPikGGYU_ziQdMBTYZuCvg.text: My favorite place for Island flavor , huge portions , authentic taste, guava juice on tap, desserts specials, one of the best if not the best loco mocos in town, they know how to do it right .

ZUkp12kshUIZttmVtzkSSA.text: Tasty dishes + Huge portions + Low prices = Happy tummy & even Happier wallet. To top it off, staff is so friendly... Treats you like family!

_PWqH7CSRMzTGyKZPjQ83Q.text: This is the 3rd time I tried to go to this place. They closed early twice! Still, after eating here, I have to say, it's awesome. We ordered Chicken Katsu Loco Moco, Kalua Pig, a Meat special with cabbage and Fried Poke. We then got a Mud Pie desert. Also huge. Also delicious. One desert was enough to share for all of us. The bill came out to $50 for 4 people. Very reasonable. The portions are huge! The food is delicious! I will be a regular here.

UITJj1q5gKdUco0pWw7fsA.text: This place seriously has some of the best Hawaiian food I have ever tasted!  The portions are hearty and leaves you wanting more the next day.  I love this place, the only downside is the slow wait and service....but definitely worth it.

ciYzV0lkv4-aSgweyM0Bdg.text: Food was really, REALLY good, but I wasn't feeling the aloha spirit.  Server was a bit rude.  LOVED the desserts... I got Pineapple Coconut ice cream and enjoyed it so much I went out and found it in pints at the store.  My date bought the chantilly cake which was amazing.  This place is on the other side of town, so I'll prolly come back occasionally for the food and maybe just get it as take out.

2N1oYqQ4_nRRSzXAN5RICA.text: What's with the 4.5 stars ? Food is so mediocre ....I had fried rice omelet ( how could you messed this one up ) unevenly cooked,  taste terrible .

vg8XmkstLV6NaPAwLcfA0Q.text: The entrees are plentiful and tasty.  The desserts were fabulous.  Last but not least, aloha is evident in the service provided.

aL4loJOyK19rBXfj9HjNIw.text: My family came here a few days ago, and for myself and my sister, it was our first time having Hawaiian cuisine. My sister and I had the loco moco and my mom had the hoisin sauce ribs. The portions are just HUGE. My loco moco had huge scoops of rice, a good sized beef patty, the fried egg and a pool of gravy. I loved it. My mom's ribs were juicy and tender it was so much that we ended up eating the leftover's for dinner that night. The price was right for the portions as well, a little under $9 for each entree. My mom also said her coffee was the best she'd had in ages.

wTUgVOQ8GmdWFA42-1nKIA.text: The best Hawaiian BBQ in Vegas period! I know my Asian BBQ because I personally cook them all the time and these are the best. They use real grill not like other franchise H BBQ who just fry them. Chicken is perfectly marinated and Kalbi is cooked well too. Taste reminded me of the BBQ in Maui.

YpDamWSGLutwPb8WMDpT5Q.text: When in Las Vegas, and If you are missing the local foods found in Hawaii, or if you want to immerse yourself in the flavors of Hawaii without venturing outside of the "ninth island" , this is the place to go.  Often, the flavors of food from different regions are adjusted to fit the tastes of the people living in the area.  It's as if they teleport their foods from Hawaii!  I was amazed to see kulolo from Kaua'i in a case next to a case of spam musubi on my way out!   It's just the spot to go to especially if you have a craving for chicken katsu!  I need to try those tall yummy looking cakes that they seemed to purposely hold at eye level as they slowly passed our table.  But, like plates in Hawaii, the portions are huge!  You need to purposefully leave room for dessert.

1RG2ZylY-dF2J_H-j2OXUQ.text: terrible service, hair on food, they screw up your order on the phone and dinning in.

_L4aBSaYEEObxSy7QssAxg.text: Furachi chicken (sorry spelling) is so good!! We always have our food delivered and it never disappoints. Our favorite Hawaiian spot

krdVbqp82RL0yr03esxR3w.text: My boyfriend and I were on our way from vegas to Death Valley, and this is the only place that opens at 10:30 around this area, so we decided to come here for a early lunch. We ordered 2 mixed plates, which allowed us to choose 4 kinds of meat. We had furikake chicken, the pork with cabbage, the kalby short fibs, and the Hawaiian roast pork. Like the server guy suggested, the portions were huge. We only finished half of what we ordered, but everything was just soooooo tasty (except the chicken. Many people seem to like it on yelp, but the meat is dry and to me it tastes similar to Panda Express orange chicken, so I don't recommend it).In addition to the two plates, we also ordered sesame poke, which was also very fresh very delicious. We were both very happy that we came here, especially after three days eating overpriced hotel food. Solid five star!

KO8Va1EJDqMNJCm0gP5rCQ.text: SAD! I was straight up looking at my order just chill for  20MIN just waiting for it to get bagged. Wasn't even BUSY!

sZTyTl1iXLfaraxlAD097w.text: So I had never had authentic Hawaiian until island flavor. Man the furikake chicken is something else. So many flavors. The portions should be called sumo sized. Will definitely eat here anytime I visit Vegas again.

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki chicken and fried noodles
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken

rHq853Uy3nl5lNrdZdvBcg.text: There's a lot of restaurants here in Vegas that serve local food but this place.....YUMMM!!! I'm so happy we found this place (through Yelp)! Been to several areas in Vegas but not this area.   Service was excellent, waitresses were very friendly AND THE FOOD!!! ONO!!! We had Mini Chicken Katsu, Fried Rice, Furikake Panko Shrimp and a Kalbi & Roast Pork Combo!   Oh and they also serve local desserts (Coco Puffs, Guava Cake etc) AND they have live music on Friday nights!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi and Roast Pork Combo
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Panko Shrimp
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Chicken Katsu and Fried Rice

9ZgmKLR4J-w49zzA4LLghA.text: Strangely, I've only eaten Hawaiian food one other time in my life. Weird, considering how much I love Hawaiian pizza ;) My boyfriend wanted to try this place out since it's close to our house and he used to live in Hawaii and was craving it. The place is super clean and the service is fast and friendly.   We ordered the Ahi tuna, furukake style. Not sure what the difference is in styles, but it came out with huge chunks of tuna, like 3/4 an inch cubed mixed with sliced white onions. It was very flavorful and fresh, but it was a tad bit salty IMO, but the bf loved it and said it was perfect. He ordered the kalua pig with cabbage, and I had a mixed plate with kalua pig and cabbage and katsu chicken. We also got a side of the kimchee cucumbers. The portions are huge, but the food is on point. I felt like the kalua pig could have used a little more salt, but everything was really good. We barely made dents in our plates and took a lot of left overs home, which were just as delicious heated up later on. I also got a spam musubi to go, and that was soooo yummy.   I'm really excited to go back and try more things!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna poke shoyu style, WAY less salty than furikake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fave, Kalua pig
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi ribs and Katsu chicken. The ribs are super fatty. :(

0VOkAkvNxkrPqJCRSF71Ew.text: Island Flavor is always a good choice! The Loco Moco here is the best!  It's creamy and so huge, you can easily split it with another person.  The spam masubi is warm, big, and delicious!  Tried the Kona Mud Pie and was super stuffed after lunch!!  Good service, good food, just wish the decor was a little better.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona Mud Pie

jaaGPI1tcRW-FSyrOXXFMw.text: Just went here for the first time with some friends. Go here if you like Hawaiian food. Best teriyaki bowl around. Blows teriyaki madness out of the water. The inside is small and always busy so I would make a reservation for a guaranteed place to sit. They just opened a place up in Henderson can't wait to try it.

fVIeuyPELmuBgYNzhQC4dQ.text: Every time I'm in Vegas, I always stop here to get my hawaiian food fix! You can get lau lau, kalua pork, tripe stew, kalbi, chicken katsu, & roast pork to name a few hawaiian dishes... Even spam musubi & loco mocos!  All completely authentic!   Plus, the atmosphere in there is just like back home. Hawaiian and Island style music fills the air! And on some occasions, they will also have live music!  The servers and staff are friendly and definitely spread the aloha spirit! I will always come back whenever I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Ribs mixed plate with rice &amp; mac salad.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Roast Pork with rice &amp; mac salad.

nYrDeopT8qU1HfrMdjoqGQ.text: Haupia cake is bomb! One of the best mac salads I've had. Great food at an awesome affordable price. Highly recommend furikake poke and their korean chicken

8ZPbEJ6ebVFiGnLAnQpj4w.text: Don't mind me I'm just going to start listing items you just got to try here.  Fried Rice Omelet plate is huge perfect for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Comes with a large portion of fried rice with pieces of char siu mixed in, topped with an omelet of who knows how many eggs, and also thick slices of Portuguese sausage.  Kalbi short ribs mighty tasty and probably the thickest cuts of Kalbi here. Not the best for those who are dieting.  Shoyu ahi poke very tasty perfect on it own or with beer on a hot day while grilling.   Katsu loco moco, I know weird huh. I've seen it all over the place but never thought of trying a non-hamburger loco moco. I've been missing out its actually pretty good. I guess whenever I'm feeling like loco moco I'll order regular hamburger most times and every other time swap out for a non traditional loco moco.  Huge slice of Kona Coffee Mud pie and other cakes and desserts. If you still have room for this congratulations to you.  Just like their plates, their desserts are big and delicious.  Last but not least the Hawaiian plate which is only offered Fridays, is the best way to end the work week and to start the weekend. The only day of the week they have lau lau on the menu. It comes with two scopes of rice, lau lau, lomi lomi salmon, ahi poke, mac salad, and haupia. This is probably the best Hawaiian plate you can get in Vegas and it's getting so popular that they sometimes run out, from what I've heard, thankfully I haven't ran into that problem yet. Reason why I mentioned it last, I want mine LOL.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi short ribs plate
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese sausage, egg, and fried rice
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making up for lost time

1WwpQ5fYqwn2tfzYK0jpbA.text: I wish we had this place back in LA! Such amazing local food that I did not expect to find in Vegas. There were so many options I chose to order two mixed plates with two items and a side of rice and macaroni salad.   I ordered the roasted pork with gravy, the Korean chicken wings, kalbi, and chicken katsu. The portions were large and easily sharable. All we're delicious, except next time I think I would just order the chicken wings and kalbi because they were my favorite, hands down. Even after all of that food, I managed to leave room for dessert and ordered the chantilly cake. Please get the chantilly cake. It was so light, moist, and will really change your life.   Prices were decent and the service was quick and friendly.   I miss this place already.

T-UkU1sDbp-LrSmtqu1Oqw.text: Oh my Hawaiian! This is owned and ran buy Hawaiians restaurant who are so sweet;)!  The flavors were great!  Worth the 20-minute drive from the strip to have great food from the island!

mvkWM-Bbp1UwfWYFhD_j3g.text: I have to give this place a HUGE THUMBS UP in my opinion! My family and I have been ordering food from here for quite some time now and we have not had one disappointment in food or service yet! :) Being from Hawaii and moved out to Vegas I thought finding a good loco joint was going to be a challenge, until we found this little gem in town! If you have not been here I suggest you get your butt up and go eat some great food! The Atmosphere is pretty laid back (which kind of reminds me a little of home) and the portions of the food will not disappoint you. Island Flavor will make a faithful customer out of you :D   The poke, I am left speechless! It was the most delectable thing to hit my taste buds! We have practically tried everything on the menu and my ultimate favorite is the Beef Teriyaki Steak. It is just drenched in just the right amount of flavor and the mac salad...don't even get me started on how delicious that is! (My mouth is watering)   I better stop reviewing because I'm getting quite hungry right now but if you are in desperate need for amazing Hawaiian food come here its no joke!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Poke!!!

2cTOkIHfIxIkwozyX85FGA.text: You'll feel like you've won the jack pot when taste anything on the menu. They do get busy but the wait is worth the delicious food. The extra for fried rice is bomb. The steak was juicy and the chicken was yummy. I would definitely want to order desert but I was over come with the portion sizing. This will npw be a must stop by when ever we go to vegas

LFwQrYCzMhyzUFmtK2nH1w.text: I got the Furikake chicken and my bf had the roast pork loco moco both were really tasty and came in large portions!

S6O168NMg87BOa0lIfTzOw.text: Love the food here. The teriyaki beef is like no other. They actually use good cuts of beef. On occasion though they can go overboard with the sauce on the beef and you'll need extra rice to tone it down. All their cakes are delicious as well. My husband loves the furikake chicken and my kids love the chicken katsu.

Zf9H_JTLls0NLEs96bT6Dw.text: BOMB.COM my wife and I come here all the time and it never fails  definitely a loyal customer...

lp-2M8RTF_9aYUQSxuk11A.text: This will be my go to place for Hawaiian food in Vegas. Since moving over from Hawaii, I've been looking for a Hawaiian food place. After trying couple other places I finally found one that hits the spot! Very generous portions and the food is great. The best thing was the service...thank you for making me feel the aloha spirit of Hawaii!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pig plate

fDFv_41YsJgrM2LTwripUw.text: Updated review 9/30  So my love for their furikake chicken is unwavering.  I always accompany my meal with a some shoyu poke which tastes oh so good.  Swear every time perfectly done, fresh taste.  Definitely one of my go-to's for poke and only place I trust for furikake chicken.  Just recently went in and sat down and got served by Sunshine, if I recall correctly and no doubt loved her service.  My meal was perfect again with my aforementioned meal consisting of said furikake chicken and a 1 pound of shoyu poke "appetizer".  Loved the crunchy, flavorful, perfectly seasoned chicken and both meals had a simple arrangement with a very flavorful and great tasting kick.  I have to thank Sunshine because when I originally ordered I had forgotten to ask for my mother's opakapaka to be broiled instead of sauteed... I asked her and she said her food was being plated, but that it would be no problem and they ended up remaking it which I greatly appreciated.  After my mother's surgery she'd been advised to cut down on oil and therefore broiled was the way to go.  And I have to tell you the aroma off the opakapaka was phenomenal.  I love my raw fish, but have to admit when that plate of broiled opakapaka came out, I wanted to to take it from my mom lol... I did end up tasting it and by far I can say it will be the onlyyyyyy cooked fish I would not mind eating here in the valley.  I'm not a cooked fish fan (whether it's fish tacos, fried fish, baked fish), but this definitely made me reconsider that choice.  All in all thanks to Sunshine and the other servers who were just kind and attentive, thanks to the cooks for such great fare.  Thank you Island Flavor for everything, definitely 5 stars!

idAUlwi_2-xl9GoRPe3ZpQ.text: Love the food.  Always great and service is always good even when they are packed.  Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Lxnnett3jfGb5CKSwpjx8A.text: Aloha bradah and sistah's! This place is serves food like it just travelled from Hawaii. Nice atmosphere, live music on Saturday evenings and man you can grub on some good Kalbi Ribs. Don't forget to order their specials, it changes every time I go there. Also try the Spicy Poke Avocado, you wont regret it. Enjoy the food and then call a flatbed to scoop you up.

c9WE0yMwhHvLLDVwXUFhuA.text: 4 stars because l have to try one more time with a more complex dish. I ordered the 1/2lb. Poke and it was the freshest tasting poke that l had in Vegas.  Bit on the too salty side but was good and cold, just right.  The veggies chosen had a good crunch to it and was all cut in perfect slices and or cubes.  Scenery was nice.  I will post pic of the poke.

CCdT-Sskc4jhHyyppgFFWQ.text: pretty good....  Fave thing i always get is the Furikake Chicken.   Pretty good service and good local vibe of the Restaraunt. Poke pretty expensive but its understandable.  Fridays there's usually live music and gets pretty busy so come early.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken! Soo Ono! Broke da mouth!

qtd830V7aa5Y_M8ugPwbDQ.text: 4 star service. 1 star food. Came here last night on a friend's recommendation. Did it live up to it? Not by a long shot.  Poke trio: All poke lacked flavor. Poorly dressed/seasoned. Saku block tuna. Furikake chicken: Too much sweet sauce and batter.  Roast pork: Was actually decent. Tender. Gravy was good. But inconsistent. Again, loved the gravy. Kalbi: Either really burnt, or just charred. Not a lot of flavor.  Fried rice: Not so good. Poorly made. Don't get me wrong, it was a generous portion. Chasiu pork was overcooked. And there were lots of parts where there was just white rice and it wasn't evenly tossed together.  Now for the nitty gritty: The pork chops were a disaster. Overcooked would be a nice way to put it. It's as if someone went out of there way to sabotage these.  In my career, I've seen med, med well and well done, even x-well. But these chops-2 entrees worth, were a disaster. I felt bad for the person who made these. Whoever taught person how to cook should really re-evaluate what they are doing.  When we ordered another entree since 1 of theses orders was sent back, it took an eternity for it to come back out.   Our server was great though. Thru some miscommunication, a combo came out incorrect. She kindly brought out some teri-chicken to make up for it.   They were kind enough to remove the two pork chop entrees from the bill. Nice of them. And of course they added gratuity to the bill. Maybe they thought we weren't going to tip accordingly?  Simple rule of etiquette: When a restaurant has a lapse in food or service, they should never add gratuity. It's like adding fuel to the fire. A major slap in the face.   BUT, in this case, they actually saved us some money. We would have easily tipped based on service, and in this case, we would have tipped in addition for the items they removed from the bill. But they didn't give us the opportunity.  I chalk it up to every kitchen has a bad day. But in this case, it was awful, but saved with some nice service.  And it amazes me no owner, manager, or other came by to address the issue.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chop: horrific. Rice almost equally bad. Go Aloha Specialties instead.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken. No-too sweet, over cooked and heavy batter.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu app. Pass on it.

PuGdK4eqUN916Q7QVEWxjQ.text: Found this place on yelp and seen that it had great reviews, they were right food was amazing. The portion was huge, took a whole plate home to go. I would highly recommend. They also have live island  music playing.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food was amazing !

mkY2ZiUmilky8XWEPVjcog.text: I now only come here for the sole purpose of their ahi poke, furikake style. I freaking love that stuff.   I'm basing this review off of my recent visit a few days ago:  When we walk in, we are immediately seated. Get our drink orders, take a few minutes to decide and all that jazz. Finally we go with an order of ahi poke for me, oxtail soup, a mixed plate of chopped steak and onions and chicken katsu, and a bowl of saimin (can't remember the name).   Ahi poke - 5/5 like always. Huge chunks of fresh fish. I can never finish the last few pieces of the regular order but I'm still hungry when I do the half order. That furikake style is the way to go though. I'm never going to order anything else!  Oxtail soup - 0/5 which was very disappointing since it was $11 of pure saltiness. At first I was in denial and blamed it on the ginger in the soup but as I continued to sip on it I couldn't even eat it anymore. SO SALTY! The meat wasn't very tender. Very disappointed with this one.   Chopped steak and onions & chicken katsu - 3/5 because the chicken katsu was incredibly bland. There was really no flavor at all and not even the katsu sauce could save it. They should have transferred some of the salt from that oxtail soup to that chicken. And usually I can never go wrong ANYWHERE with chicken katsu but wow I was disappointed since this place is a bit more pricier than Ohana Hawaiian BBQ. The chopped steak and onions was good though. Very greasy but it was good. Those onions even taste better than the katsu.   Saimin - 3/5. It was just OK nothing too special. At least this wasn't salty like the oxtail so that was a plus I guess. I dunno maybe I'll give this another try one day.   Service - 3/5. Does anyone ever smile here anymore!? I used to love the servers here because they were very friendly and welcoming but geez can you all at least pretend like you're in a good mood? It's a huge turn off when I can tell that workers hate their job. At least pretend like you want to be there! Our server especially was giving off a rude vibe. For the oxtail we asked for extra bowls so we can all share (there was 4 of us) and he only comes out with one. When we asked him again for more bowls he was like "more bowls? Okayyyy but there's one right there." Fool I'm not blind, I know how to count. Don't try to pull it off like were stupid or something. We obviously are asking for more so we can share and we told you twice. That set me off a little.. but I wasn't going to make his day worse so I let it go.   I was really disappointed during this visit because I usually love coming here. Aside from the excellent poke, the food and service was just ehhh. Well I guess as long as I keep coming here for the poke, I won't be disappointed! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu loco moco. My two favorites in one :o
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi poke furikake style

7W6XFsGe7mcJmd70Ub1gxQ.text: YUM!  ARE YOU LOOKING FOR HAWAIIAN SOUL FOOD????  Every one of my Hawaii-Vegas relatives has recommended Island Flavor.  Its the food you ate at your Aunties house.....but only the good stuff, lol!  We regularly order a pound of poke and the chicken katsu - its enough for hubby and I to share and also have a few bites the next day.  SO MUCH FOOD!  Occasionally they have signs for pre-ordering kulolo amd poi, flown in fresh weekly from Hawaii.  Next door is a Hawaiian shop carrying favorite drinks and snacks - even Locals slippers!

hVtkJr_iOcMstC-kWy9P-A.text: My favorite hawaiian food in town. If i could id eat it at least once a week. Actually for a moment i think i was lol. Cant believe im barely writing a review after all this time.  This place stays busy during evenings and especially on weekends. However the staff is friendly wether u dine in or take out.  I usually get a mixed plate with Kalbi and katsu or kalbi and teriyaki chicken. The macaroni salad is also on of my fave that ive ever tried.  Prices are great.

EVxuvncNiO1kcwmEPbsH8A.text: Found this place on Yelp went to try it the portions are huge the fried rice is amazing they have somebody playing music on Saturday nights which was super fun the Kona mud pie for dessert was delicious along with everything else we tried

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate with fried rice amazing

yYUOhQ_6h0DCf-RNV5J_yw.text: The food here is amazing. There were places in Hawaii that didn't even compare. It is definitely authentic Hawaiian style food.   Sometimes there is a bit of a wait, but it's always worth it. I use a delivery app for delivery from them all the time. That way I can stay at home and enjoy.  The portions are pretty big, so you could do a bit of a family style and just order a few different things and share. You will want to order an extra macaroni salad though. That stuff is way too good to share.

erWruR1sZwZimtP2zn67Jw.text: I saw over 900 reviews with 4 1/2 stars so I had to check it out. I got the teriyaki chicken with brown rice and it was delicious!  Next time I'm in the area for awhile I'll definitely come back.

Gd82wnfSTfXwJm0OsBrBJw.text: This is my go to spot for Hawaiian food. The portions are enormous! No way I can finish everything in one sitting. I end up sharing with someone or eating half. I love their teriyaki steak, teriyaki chicken, & Furikake chicken. I really, really love the Furikake Chicken. I can't believe I've never tried this amazing style of chicken! Where have you been all my life?! Other favorites are poke, macaroni salad, and spam musubi. I have a sick addiction to their guava cake which I heard they get from the bakery next to them. It's one of my favorite cakes and I find myself thinking about this cake often.   Some of the dishes I didn't care for are the Korean chicken wings & galbi. I'm picky with Korean chicken wings and galbi. I'm not a big pork lover so I don't usually order pork dishes but my husband enjoys them.  Definitely a good choice to stop by to satisfy your Hawaiian food cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Galbi &amp; Furikake Chicken combo w/ mac salad. I need to go to the gym.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damn, they hooked it up today! This is way more than the usual amount. Teriyaki steak &amp; Furikake chicken combo.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haupia Cake

KHWg2g7UP0omH7FI-zzs5Q.text: I'm so glad I found his gem in Vegas ! The staff was super friendly and the service was great and quick! The food came out so fast and it was delicious! My bf and I shared the combo plate with chicken furikake and short ribs with fried rice which made us both stuffed and it was only 14 bucks! The chicken furikake was seriously the best fried chicken with a sweet tangy sauce. The chicken was still so deliciously crunchy when we ate it. Definitely coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken furikake with the short ribs and fried rice...all this for only 14 bucks !

YqBOPb6AvLAYXvax0Q2x_w.text: The best service ever. Came here on a Sunday for lunch and the whole place was packed. Prompt and friendly service though it was so busy. Bf ordered teriyaki chicken. I ordered the raw ahi poke plate, but when it came it was actually the cooked version. I didn't say anything and started eating. I was already almost done w the food when the same server noticed and said, "they cooked it? I wrote raw on it." And insisted that I get a new plate, corrected, and prompted took the rest of that away and delivered the new plate, with Mac salad and everything. Probably the best service I've gotten in Vegas! Love the aloha spirit :)  For dessert we ordered the kona coffee mud pie... And I was surprised at how big the slice was. It was easily like three normal slices. T was delicious with good toppings, and needless to say, we both walked away with food coma. Will definitely be back again!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona coffee mud pie :) simply delicious and humongous

lXz-3Yeu3uO5Q7adbvCZqQ.text: This place is not a bad place. The food is good, however, the service isn't good. I had to call someone's attention to get my water refilled and it took over45 min. to get my food. The place wasn't as busy and it still took a while for my food to get handed out.

A6xEdhQuLxW_l5a7YyHXNw.text: Ok so I see this place every time I drive by but never ever stop to eat here. This past Friday I did and man oh man was I glad I did!!!   You you live near here and never been this us a must. The cafe is a little under attractive but the food, the vibe and the people well makes up for that and in all honesty it's not a bad looking or gross place at all there are just no decor and it's just a room with tables and a few island pictures and arts on the wall nothing fancy but who cares. I think it makes you feel like you are in Hawaii.  I happen to go on a Luau Friday when they have a little band set up for entertainment. I was greeted oh so warmly by everyone one with Hughes and back pats i mean it was as friendly as it can get.   We order the Chicken katsu with gravy on the side and the Chicken Furikake and Kalua Pork with cabbage and their churi fried rice and OMG let me tell you the Furikake chicken is (like most Yelpers have claimed) life changing. You must try to know what I am talking about and the Kalua port and cabbage I wish was a little bit more flavorful and juicy never the less was very good as well but man the Furikake chicken! The chicken katsu and gravy was amazing and the guava cake. Let's just say I'm not a huge guava liver and this cake was moist, tasty and the hint notes of the fruit with the semi sweet frosting was just perfect.   I am now a ginormous fan of this place and glad I finally tried it and now I'm telling everybody about it!

G-yGs3s-nMj7tVYzIhuFIA.text: I've eaten at a few Hawaiian plate restaurants in Las Vegas and Hawaii and this was the best I've had so far.  We went on a week day for lunch, some other customers were coming and going but not too busy. Staff was excellent, we waited for some friends before ordering and they kept checking back with us until we were ready to order our food. Prices were great for the amount of food you get. I got the special of the day which was Mahi Mahi grilled in an egg batter. It was good but a bit bland. Their macaroni salad was not the best, a bit disappointing since I like macaroni salad. My husband got a Combo platter of Beef Teriyaki and Chicken Katsu with Korean Sauce (recommended by the waitress) they use on their Korean Chicken. All of his food was delicious. We decided to get a slice of  Haupia Cake...OMG! One of the best cakes I've ever had.  I will definitely go back again.

I ordered the spicy avocado poke and its sooooo good especially with rice. My husband ordered chef's loco moco and my gosh! The serving is huge! Its actually good for sharing. Definitely, we will be back here, food is really good and parking lot is big, shares with other businesses, plenty of parking tho.

B4NvTI4iBLQaqjmZecKoVg.text: Bomb ass kalbi ribs and furikake shrimp. Love their guava juice and the Hawaiian music they play. The vibes are homely and pleasant. Plus the portions are crazy big. Highly recommend

DipNe68ylS9QM8l5nEaT_A.text: Really? What's with all these hypes? I've had their furikake chicken it was way too sweet for me. I could not even finish it. The balance of flavor was not just right. Plus, I had some malasadas for to-go, because I've seen so much ad on instagram (foodies') thinking that it must be very good , but it was misleading. Probably they pay those instagrammers to advertise their food for them. Those malasadas had a very bad after taste- some kind of old used oil, cannot describe it but it was not even fluffy and fresh. I would be better off with other Hawaiian places.  Sorry I would not go back to this place.

Z5iqPaF9vDh7x74p23odQA.text: SLOW SLOW SLOW service.   They had to make rice. You'd think the rice would be the staple. It was 7:30pm, way before closing.     The oxtail was tough but the broth was flavorful.   Odd that the Kalbi was cut up.  It's not like we need need help with a knife.

OneJSw_HLNQLSMdjL0xN7Q.text: Christine was great she was Fast and diligent food was awesome and will come Back very soon

YKJGrcJ5YOcZR2n1Dsj_-w.text: I bookmarked this place the second I got to Vegas (which was a year ago, #facepalm). If you've read other reviews I've written about Hawaiian restaurants I always say that I'm Hawaiian in my heart and my belly.   The spot is super dark from the outside due to the the tinted windows but inside it's well lit and ready to serve you. When temperatures rise outside, it gets a bit cramped in the entrance. The decor is nothing special but that's okay because the shining star is the food.  The servings are very generous, which is great for my hunger and bad for my waistline, and the food is delicious. They were out of spam musubi (insert crying emoji here) but I ordered a mixed plate with their pork and katsu. Holy Hawaii batman. The gravy on the pork was the real MVP and the mac salad was heaven.   I convinced my dining buddy to share the mud pie with me and although it was beautiful - it was the one dish that left me wanting a little bit more. It was tick icy and not as creamy as I would have loved.

7IYpfLuy-yvFFYCpDpGsvQ.text: Amazing food! Everything was so fresh and hot! The chicken katsu was crispy but still juicy and flavorfull Korean chicken is sweet and lite spicy awesome. I will be back many times

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu, korean chicken

gQPYgktS75Do3PUnN2FXUw.text: This place is definitely not the same but it is still a must hit spot when in town. Service is great. Food is still well portioned and tasty. I mainly come here when people are in town and want something off the strip.

pKyM7bRFmBIcREC_jNygpg.text: Great place to feel the Ohana and Aloha of Hawaii, both with the employees and through the food. This is a really good place eat  'plate lunch'  but in a upscale way. The choices are really good, the quantity is plentiful, the flavors are authentic and the service is full of Aloha.   There is a daily special, Friday's is my favorite, the True Hawaiian plate, includes Laulau ( come early they do run out). The regular menu includes all the Hawaiian specialties and you can make a mixed plate as was our choice tonight.   I got the Furikake Chicken--Boneless chicken deep fried and tossed in a furikake glaze and Kalbi Short Ribs--Tender short ribs marinated in a Korean sauce and broiled to perfection. Two scoops rice and Mac salad finishes it off. The chicken was crispy chunks with lots of flavor, the kalbi was tender and so good!   My husband got a mixed plate as well, Teriyaki Chicken--Boneless, skinless chicken thighs marinated in a homemade Teri sauce and broiled, he also got Hawaiian Style Roast Pork--Cooked local style w/Hawaiian salt, cracked black pepper, sliced thin and topped w/rich homemade brown gravy. Also came with two scoops rice and Mac salad. Both so good. Teriyaki sauce is well flavored and the pork tender.  Of course we had to have dessert, tonight's choice, Chantilly cake, Chocolate cake, Chantilly frosting (evaporated milk, sugar, egg yolks, butter, vanilla extract). Moist, rich frosting, good choice!  Service is always excellent, they treat you like family and ensure you have everything you need. On Fridays and Saturdays they have live music but, you might have to wait for a table so plan ahead.

1GeY8AM9qCM00pbpoQmC3A.text: Yelp  challenge! #1  Came here for the first time! Ordered poke ahi, sweet potatoes, Korean chicken, and eggs  The poke was delicious! I wanted something light since I've been eating horrible! Poke was perfect because it made me felt light. I ordered the furikake sauce with spicy mayo on the side. It was perfect, and would definitely order again.   Korean chicken was delicious because the flavor of the sauce was flavorful. It was very yummy, and the chicken was juicy.   Wish I could try the Hawaiian plates, but I just couldn't eat so much! I would definitely come back again.

EesbuJ0i7nnwpULiJp4ywQ.text: I like their Chicken Katsu, I like the menu options. My husband likes it too. When I asked was furikaki chicken a roast chicken with furikaki or was it fried chicken? I was a bit put off when the waitress Silviya decided to explain to me what furikaki was made of. Then when my husband asked for fries instead of rice. She told him, " you  have to say French fries, it sounds like rice , if you don't say French fry." The food is wonderful and the last time we ate here the waitress was prompt, friendly, and courteous. When I paid with my debit card , the option came up visa debit or us debit I went to push Us and the waitress moved my hand and pushed Visa debit. When I said I don't want visa debit. She ignored me and said thank you good bye.

IXkhRXqXbzc95lfy3UetAA.text: Really wanted to like this place! I've had it bookmarked for ages and was excited to finally give it a go. My wife, her dad and our three kids (all under 5 with a baby) came here a few weekends ago. I would say they were moderately busy, as we were seated without a wait and the restaurant was maybe half capacity.   - They took nearly 10 minutes to take our order. - From the time they took our order it was an additional 43 minutes before the food was ready, yes, 43 minutes! So as anyone with young kids can qunderstand that is a very long time to keep them entertained and quiet. - After they brought the food to the table we didn't have silverware! We waited about 5 minutes (they disappeared) until my wife finally went to find someone and ask for it. And then they only brought two sets without even an apology! - The actual food wasn't even good! Ridiculously oily and no mention that the fried rice is actually pork fried rice (we all ordered non-pork dishes).  All aspects of our experience was bad, food, customer service (not saying anyone was mean or rude just very inattentive or not caring), and the extremely long wait. You should probably have the courtesy of letting your customers know that they will be waiting 45-1hr at the table before getting food, especially if they have kids. And where's the silverware!? Terrible overall experience.   I will be sticking with Makai Hawaiian food. Very fast service, good food, and a little cheaper.

7dIzdZGNcmjUjhT55GkMBw.text: One of the better Hawaiian spots in Vegas. It's a little far for me since I'm in the North but worth it when around the area. The servings are generous and the prices are great. There's also a good amount of seating, and wasn't too busy during lunch hour on a Wednesday.  Try out the guava cake! It's very tasty and the serving slice makes Cheesecake Factory's cheesecake serving look small.

f8mPtD4QxXpFIi4E5tev-Q.text: Haven't been here in years and because I am now Pescatarian the 9th Island Samplah was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I haven&#39;t been here in a really long time, got the 9th Island Samplah because I&#39;m Pescatarian and goodness was it AMAZING!!

_LACLoe0yKFvpnY-wS15Fg.text: First time here...suggested by family who reside in Vegas...to meet for lunch. We were greeted by friendly staff & seated immediately. While looking over the menu, a lovely lady came around to offer samples of her freshly made malasadas (Hawaiian filled donut). Well, I must admit that they were delicious and my cousin bought us 6 as a gift  It was so hard to decide what to order as everything sounded so good. So...I ended up ordering the combo plate with kalbi beef & pork  roast, gravy, rice & macaroni salad. My husband had the special of shoyu chicken. I can't tell you which dish was better...their food is THAT good. I immediately marked this restaurant as one of my favorites and will be going back there a lot!!  Don't miss out on this treasure that's hidden away in a strip mall. Those are usually the best places!!!!

UP9KUwySXfKbN-hjq4yQkg.text: This would have been 3 1/2 stars but rounded up.  When I am I vegas I usually go to the eastern location and since I was around the area decided to pick up a couple of plate lunches for the trip back to California.   As usual I got the Kalbi plate and the fresh catch of the day was opakapaka.  To my surprise I on ly got 3 short rubs and the tips were burnt (I did not find out until stopped in Baker to eat). I was at the eastern location on week of 3/11 and went there a few times and usually got 4 ribs and cooked perfectly;the flavor was okay. The opakapaka was lightly battered and the piece was a good size .  The sauce light but okay.  The service was excellent ;5 stars the girl in front was helpful and help pack the haupia cake in ice for me.

Hpv8SgVVts7p7uPoFQ-WzQ.text: This is my favorite Hawaiian restaurant!! It's my boyfriend's tradition to go to this restaurant every time he visits Las Vegas and now I think this is going to be mine as well. Everything in the menu is so insanely good, but if I had to pick one thing to eat here, it would be the furikake chicken. It's really crispy and has a ton of savory flavor while being not too sweet. And you have to pair this with the fried rice as an upgrade. The rice comes with marinated pork (chashu) and it pairs so well with all the meat dishes. This time, we ordered a poke sampler as well to get something light as well and oh my goodness.... this also blew our mind away. It came with 3 fried half avocados topped with different pokes and sauces. Wow. Just look at the picture I attached of it, and it looks amazing but it tasted even more amazing... Do yourself a favor and go here next time you're in the area. Also, there was live music on a Saturday night! A nice touch to an amazing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo plate: kahlua pork with cabbage, furikake chicken, hamburger steak, and fried rice
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke 9th Island Fried Poke Bombs Sampah

chTNbgNqriJbC0UwwHJjyA.text: This was our first visit and let me tell you, it won't be our last. You know a place must be good when there's a line forming before the place even opens. Always a great sign.   Upon entering, the place is something straight out of Hawaii. Calm, relaxed atmosphere with awesome Hawaiian reggae music playing. The restaurant is not large but they make good use of the space they have. The restaurant is SPOTLESS. Everything is nice and clean and well kept which is a big deal for me at eating establishments.   We were served by a sweet and friendly lady named Kim. She took EXCELLENT care of us and preanticipated our needs by keeping our drinks full, checking on us in a nonintrusive way and offering expedient service when we needed something.   Their island offerings are plenty. I ordered a mixed plate with Korean Kalbi and chicken katsu while my husband ordered the "monstah" plate with kalbi, katsu and kahlua pork and cabbage. Both plates were very HEFTY portions and they come with rice and Mac salad. The meats were excellent. Nicely prepared, moist, juicy and flavorful. The mac salad was meh and a bit underwhelming which was disappointing because I look forward to this as this is one of my favorites. We also ordered the spicy avocado poke and that was BOMB! Omg! Nicely marinated ahi tuna with sliced red onion, diced avocado and crispy wonton strips all envelopes in a creamy spicy siracha mayo. Yum-my!!!!  We are from out of town but will definitely be back when we are in town again. Thanks again to Island Flavor and to Kim and the rest of the staff for  great experience. Keep up the great work. Mahalo

Njb1b-mx24s4h4S_nUj5Og.text: When we come to Vegas, we always visit the local grindz. So when this place was close by, along with about 14 other hungry friends, this was the place for us.   We waited about 35 minutes for a table. Actually, a LOT of tables and trying to combine into one long strip. There was a bit of confusion as there wasn't enough chairs at first. We had problems finding servers to help us finding chairs and the lack of help seemed to be the re-curring problem we had here.   It was a hot day, not any different than the usual Vegas dry heat. We were parched and everyone ordered. 15 minutes later, first of the foods started to come out and some people were getting the wrong items at first. But slowly and surely, food sporadically came out one by one.  10 minutes into eating, we were still not served water nor any of our drinks we had ordered. It was a little tough hailing someone down for water. I do have to note there were 2 kitchen staff visible, and maybe 3 servers the whole restaurant.   As to what we ordered, the furikake chicken was too saucy. I had ordered the korean fried chicken and were only given the choice of wings and drums as thighs weren't available. It was tasty, but really would've loved to have thighs instead. Had also ordered the saimin soup noodles and the dashi tasted like hondashi and water.   We also got the big Loco Moco they had on the menu that had spam in it. Requested the eggs over easy and it was way well done. So overall as to the food, it did all sound so good, but with the exception of the KFC it did not live up the island food standards.   Sylvia told our large group that we can only divide up the checks into 4 different cards. That was fine with us, but she accidentally charged our card to one of our friend's bills. So after dealing how difficult it is to get water, service, and now this we figured that we'll just manage the bill among ourselves. So I charged our bill as well and our friends paid me in cash. Service of 18% was already added onto the bill for ease which was fine, but again hailing anyone down here was work in itself.   The little ordering pads I believe only takes menu orders for the kitchen I believe. The drink orders I think the waiter or waitresses have to be entered manually by them. Hence, we never got our POG but we were never billed for it either.   Sigh.  I sure hope this place change for the better.

F3nySGS8QmStYnK7tOp1Gw.text: Used to be one of my favorite Hawaiian food spots.  I was eating at Island Flavor since they first opened up, but have now lost love for their food ever since the original owners handed over the business to someone new.   Their portions have fallen smaller than from what they used to be and their taste in quality and in recipes have fallen as well. The food is still decent and you can still feel the culture and aloha that the restaurant gives (it's nice to see a restaurant that is truly meant for 9th island locals).   The new expansion they have is an improvement; there's a bigger and better waiting area, it's much easier for big parties to be seated (which is often when your customers are island oriented), and you can tell how much it has improved the restaurant's efficiency.   This place is still worth eating at but it gets 3 stars from me just because the food is not as good, hearty and plentiful it used to be.

XD4K6mkaCwsD_m73sc5DbQ.text: SAD that this place USED to have 5 Stars and there's SO Many 1 Stars now. I was contemplating giving it a 1 Star but decided on 2, ONLY because they get the desserts from the lady who does Pa'Ina's (you're welcome). And since I didn't want to drive all the way to Spring Mountain, I opted Island Flavor.  Like a lot of the reviewers, I've been coming here since 2013, when this place was rocking with happy customers and workers. There was always a wait to come eat here. I've been in here a few times since the changeover to see how it's going. (I didn't want to believe what other Yelpers wrote.) It wasn't spectacular, but it wasn't as bad where I 'Had' to write a review too. Until last week...  So here it goes:   I come in on a weekday at 2pm. The place was sparsely packed with customers and I was seated promptly by Sylvia. (Yay!) We ordered our drinks ( iced tea, Coke, Sprite and water with lemon on the side). She brought out the drinks a few minutes later, MINUS the lemon. We asked her for the lemon and she looked irritated but went and got it.  Sylvia disappeared so Tina came and took our orders on some little tablet. While we were telling her what we wanted, she took a deep breadth and sighed while looking at the cooks. I'm like WTF, so I said, 'Is everything ok?' She kinda shook her head, waved her hand and said, 'Nothing.' So we continued with our order. It was then,  that we realized she either didn't speak English well or didn't know how to input it. We had to talk reaaallly slooow for her to get it.   Here comes Sylvia, she I'm assuming disappeared because it was probably her lunch break, but never told us she was leaving so when she passed by, I said 'Hey Sylvia, when you get a chance, can we get a refill please?' (Hey it was 106* out there!!!) She didn't answer but rolled her eyes, took a deep breadth, looked at our cups, turned around and brought us a refill.  I was about to confront her!!!  But I have Aloha. Hahaha  A minute later she's eating at the table. Ok I get it, she was probably clocked out. I overheard Tina asked if she can have a try. Hey, I like try too!   Tina comes and drops off our food after 17 minutes. We thank her and we start eating. I couldn't help feel that negative vibe from the two of them. I asked my friends if it was me feeling it or them too. They ALL agreed that both Sylvia and Tina were not being aloha.   Dessert time. The main reason for coming here was because I was impressed with the new marketing  director with his creative pictures. (Yes, I gave him a title haha) HE made me want to come in and check out Island Flavor again and to order chantilly cream puffs. So kudos to that photographer!   Sylvia totally fucked dessert up. We ordered 3 desserts but changed one of them. She came out with FOUR....oh well, after Mgmt sees this, Sylvia and Tina will either be fired or thoroughly trained.   My question is, WHY hire servers who know nothing about your restaurant and have NO Aloha?  I was really surprised that you didn't hire a local, but from another country? Come on!!!   To be honest, Island Flavor should be relocated closer to the strip because this place seems more of a 'tourist' place than a local restaurant. I really DID NOT enjoy my visit here and with my Yelp review and word of mouth, yeah.....Good Luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Although it was good, you can taste it sat in the fridge more than 2 days and it&#39;s smaller in proportion to the ones at Pa&#39;Ina.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s Sylvia eating her food while we wait for her to deliver ours....

BbXUr19hxdqLdvDM9TdXwQ.text: Places like this are why Yelp totally rocks! Who would have ever expected aweseome Hawaiian food in a random Vegas strip mall? I was starving after a long flight and had a huge serving of Hawaiian roast pork with gravy and Kalua pork and cabbage with a mountain of rice and a huge tossed salad for less than the price of a mediocre burger at one of the strip mega-casinos. Of course, I had a Kona Longboard Lager to wash down tmy massive Hawaiian feast.  I'll check this place out again if I'm in the area and I'll have to check and see if there's a Hawaiian restaurant a bit closer too.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Roast Pork and Kalua Pork and Cabbage
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tossed Salad

dW5wO3Qn3Cfk7RpjiNNmxw.text: Came to this place and it was just so satisfying.  5 stars to the food.   We came on a Monday night it looked closed no cars when we arrived there was one car parked when we left.  Owners: you need a open sign when it is dark for those who do not know.    The service was good but we were the only people eating at first.    The roast pork with gravy all over. 3.00 stars for me.  Chicken Teri 5 stars just so much flavor.  Chicken katsu 3 stars light but it was kind of sry and just not anything special.   Kalbi beef/ 5 stars so full of flavor unlike the last time I wrote a review.   Furikaki chicken 3 stars flavor alone is 5 stars but the chicken was day.  Sadden they have sold but the food still hasn't been compromised.  The fruitcake  The furikake chicken was kind of dry but ok.   I think I came when they changed ownership the last time and found it average not a mouth craving taste.  This time was different.

EDlMXXnkoPxL4LTXfI9S8A.text: been here many times so we pretty much know what to expect foodwise...this review is ONLY for the service...we know service is tantamount to repeat business & here is no exception...service is hit & miss here & this visit was a COMPLETE MISS...I should have read Bryson K.'s review before I set foot there because we ended getting Tina as our server...he was absolutely spot on with his review of her...ZERO ohana vibe & never once checked up on us or topped off our drinks...she was so AWOL, we had to flag another server, Edna to get us our bill because we were on our way home to Cali...  Alisa P.  you better take heed to these reviews & actually address these issues or you will lose a portion of your customer base...

Qi-hiHDqw08yN5Ar_nS0Zw.text: So this is the first time that I have been back since they remodeled this location. Definitely a lot bigger and I like it a lot. Unfortunately there was no band this evening but the vibe was great.   I ordered the salad with teriyaki chicken. I think I just found me a new favorite salad. Was bomb!!! Super delicious, chicken was super flavorful, I loved the purple sweet potato, and the dressing was the the BEST!  Thinking of coming back here again soon to order the salad again.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad with teriyaki chicken (super delicious)

NaH_DZPbO2Cn5xrUUfG77w.text: First time here and I had a lot of questions. I wanted to get poke but the menu and website don't explain what the different pokes are: Hawaiian, sesame, spicy avocado .... I couldn't tell if they were toppings you added or those were the types of poke. The woman at the counter said there were too many ingredients to list on the menu which was not helpful. I'm obviously ignorant and need to be educated. I ordered the Hawaiian poke which she said came with seaweed. My husband ordered the kalbi which looked beautiful from the pix online.   It turns out the poke doesn't come with rice so I added a side (I think it was $2.25 for two scoops) and a side of macaroni salad. My husband asked for teriyaki sauce or whatever sauce they may have for the kalbi, but the woman said they don't have sauce. "It doesn't need it because it's marinated"   If this is authentic Hawaiian then I guess I prefer american-adulterated Hawaiian. The poke fish was good, but I missed all the toppings you can get at a poke counter. The kalbi was good but a little dry.  The one truly delicious item here is the guava cake! Do light and fluffy - it's like flavored angel food cake with whipped cream filling. Luckily we got two giant pieces so we didn't have to share!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Mac
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Short Ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork wontons w/sweet chili sauce

UfMz0wzUffMgU_PBHbC6nQ.text: Decide to come here after the new owners took over. The place is renovated and looking good! We got seated and it was not very busy, only four other tables and one other couple had been seated the same time as we did.    The server came over and took our drink order and app, I got the pork won ton. He brought out drinks back and asked we were ready to order. I got the roast pork and my friend  the Korean fried chicken.   The app finally showed up 10 minutes later? My drink was half way gone by now. We watched as food was coming out from the kitchen, they were bringing food out one order at a time!! I thought  this was strange I get that food has different cooking times but the food going to the same table and now you have one person eating and the other person watching you eat??!??????  One by one I painfully watched this occur to table after table, mine included. I got my roast pork and my friend watched me eat!!! I normally would wait as this is proper dining protocol. I was hungry sorry, and some of the roast pork was cold???? Wth   10 minutes later the korean chicken came out to our table, I asked about why so long? Well chicken takes a long time to cook..... ok I guess but the food should still arrive at the same time or even a little  closer together.  Now I have the pleasure of watching my friend eat as I am almost done!    The server is now taking orders of other tables and has not come back over to check on us yet? My drink was empty 10 minutes ago??!?!? Still no offer for refills... he finally comes over and asks if we need anything else?? Really,,,nope the check will do just fine. Sad because I really wanted dessert !   I miss the old owners and the way things used to be, maybe instead of spending all the money on renovations how about some training for the workers?? Kitchen needs help and so do the servers...... sad really the food was not bad, the portions are smaller and the rice was dry.  All in all come guys you can do better.

do0LFnGk3B4H4p_AZyt-mQ.text: We came here today and was served with an old hard rice so we had to ask for fresh one, even the table behind us, did the same thing. I'm Asian so I would know if rice is fresh or not. Anyway, kudos to our server, Tyler, he was very accommodating and fast.   Portions a lot smaller too. I hope this is not the start of the decline on their food quality as this place is one of my faves.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My idea of a perfect dessert  zoom it up to see that chocolate sauce literally dripping down the cake...such a sweet treat!

xsb4ssrrm67RHG9hsdRolg.text: I used to love coming to Island Flavor for fulfilling and flavorful meals, but the quality has definitely gone down while the prices has gone up. I recently came here and ordered a few different plates:  Teri chicken/teri beef  -Smaller portions and beef was dry  Kalua pork -A lot smaller portions and not as flavorful  Furikake chicken  -This is the only dish that was still good and the portions matched the price   This used to be my absolute favorite Hawaiian place in Vegas, but I will probably not come back. There are other Hawaiian places that have bigger portions for the same price as here.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ackvdwHgnJSE32jtJQWKSg.text: I've seen ownership go down before so not surprised it would happen since it's changed. Especially with quality of the food that is too. Was willing to give this place a try but man Alisa really needs to work on doing better. This is NO island flavor vibe as it was for me back in 2012. Shouldn't have asked for chef darcy since he's prolly shady too. All of these employees have something to hide like Tina, Tyler, or Christine. Servers don't need to be rude or so brash. This place has changed dramatically and with every single person saying she's referred to "You Hawaiian's" or "Get the FUCK OUT" to  good employees is shame on the owner. You think you're doing you're job but NOPE. You haven't learned shit. Putang inaba.   To Chef Darcy: you need to shut the fuck up and get off your ass and rub it old man, cause you don't know shit asshole. I don't have a girlfriend and she sure as hell wouldn't work for you dipshit. lol nice try but no. You suck. -YOU CAN'T FUCK OR COOK

0Oz7zqIW3g8v2p-C3MsSqg.text: Island Flavor doesn't disappoint... ever. We came to celebrate a friends bday on a Wednesday afternoon. As always, the food was delicious, service was on point and portions were enough to take home for dinner.    The icing on the cake was the sweetest Gal, Annette who made our friend's bday cake! It was BEAUTIFUL AND DELICIOUS. She personally brought it out to us.. sang happy Birthday with us and cut and plated the cake slices for our party.   Thank you Island Flavor and Annette for your hard work and love!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite dish - Kalbi Beef
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful presentation and so Ono!

t_9-5VHiDcXYIsPIR46d7A.text: BS+++ Still one of the best authentic Hawaiian restaurants in NV.  Everytime I visit Vegas I never go anywhere else.   The restaurant upgraded a lot.  I'm so happy this place is still thriving the way they are.  I've seen so many places come and go but this place is the bomb.  I highly recommend this spot.  Right off Durango.  This place is a good to homey place.   Prices are good and portions are bada$$.  Of course I had to get the famous loco moko also ordered the new combos.  The food changed a lot.  New management is obvious.  Love it. All my elites come here!!  Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

qjsp459DLyCD6KeGuv_BmA.text: So we gave Island Flavor another shot and Darcy and his team did a great job! My wife had the Saturday Special (Beef Stew) and I had the Furikake Chicken and Teriyaki Steak mixed plate.   Beef stew was so tasty and the meat was so tender!  Man... the furikake chicken and teri steak had lots of taste and the steak was very tender.   Thank you very much. We shall return!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saturday Special : Beef Stew
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teri steak &amp; Furikake Chicken mix

7AtP4JpmmivgjCkKxLR8Nw.text: Ono grindz!  Recommended by my current boss, we came here WITH my boss! The three of us walked in and were greeted by the owner? (I think) with an "Aloha!" and asked us "tree?" (that's "three" pronounced da kine). We were seated immediately and given menus. So hard to choose from the list of grinds. So many good local eats I was almost drooling. After "studying" the menu for sometime we got the Kalbi Short Ribs. My boss ordered the Chef's Loco Moco.  The servings were "choke" (meaning a lot or large amount)... hubby and I shared the plate of Kalbi Short Ribs (over 1-lb of marinated kalbi goodness). It came with two scoops of rice and one scoop of macaroni salad. It was incredibly satisfying... you knoh, brok da mout kine! I love Kalbi and the meat was so tastefully delicious and soft. The Chef's Loco Moco my boss ordered came shaped like a volcano (mushroom & onion brown gravy on rice, topped with beef & pork belly patty, 3 (tree?) eggs, Spam and Portuguese sausage with green onions to garnish) ohmygaahhhh! I feel a food coma coming on!   This isn't L&L, that's for sure. This place is sure to bring me back to Vegas soon! I still want to try the Furikake Chicken that fellow Yelper, Patrick Y, recommended as well as their desserts! Curious to try some avocado fries too. The dining room is a good size. That's good so it can accommodate the crowd... the restaurant seems to have a large following, and our server was the nicest! I almost called her 'Aunty'   We pau foh now... JR (or as they say in the Islands, Juniah! for Junior), please take me back again to Vegas soon!  Review #1334

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 03.30.19 Chef&#39;s Loco Moco
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 03.30.19 Kalbi Short Ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 03.30.19 Macaroni Salad

vn2XWre8CoWDecl7BUj3fA.text: Not a bad choice for Hawaiian food overall.  We decided to drop in and grab some food to go.  The inside is cool and has lots of Hawaiian-themed decor; there was even a live band singing and playing Hawaiian tunes which was cool.  The interior was clean and simple and didn't seem too crowded.  We decided to try the chicken katsu and the beef teriyaki and kalbi.  The katsu was OK.  It was crispy outside, but the chicken didn't seem to be of the best quality though it seemed like it was breast meat.  The teriyaki and kalbi were both quite good.  Tender and flavorful and not too much fat on the kalbi which is sometimes a pet peeve.    Someone was passing around samples of malasadas which were quite good, but they didn't seem to have any on display so it was unclear how to actually buy them.    Staff overall seemed friendly.  Overall this was a perfectly decent place we might try again though nothing really stood out too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef teriyaki and kalbi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

HOLYi-6mz6Yd7z0xveeNLQ.text: I'm not sure if it was a bad day for them or if they were trying out a new system, but it was a MESS placing our order.   My group of 10 waited almost an hour to get our food because the waitress said "it got lost" in the orders. One waitress took our drink and food order on her tablet but then a second waitress came to take our drink orders again on a note pad because she said it did not come through on the system.  Our waitresses seemed very unorganized and were running around trying to get our order out. On the plus side, they kept apologizing for the delay and seemed genuine.   On a positive note, the food is good!! I couldn't decide what to order because everything on the menu sounded so delish.  Overall, the major con in my dining experience was the poor technical part. The waitress also had a hard time getting our check and then swiping each of our cards on her little tablet.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean Chicken

84Z8cU0d7dkRhIEFzs22JA.text: THEY HAVE BEER *cheers* First timer here! I hear all the buzz all the time about this place from all my family members who eat here. I'm from over the border aka CA so I knew the next time I'm in Vegas to try ISLAND FLAVOR to see for myself.   Immediately greeted and welcomed by Kehau who is just the sweetest! Def felt like I was in my Auntys house getting ready to eat bc of her. Even the other servers were so good about refilling our drinks and being communicative. I was trying so hard not to call Kehau "Aunty" she is just that awesome!  The place is SUPER CLEAN & I can tell they've done A LOT of remodeling and upgrades in which someone who LOVES interior design/home decor like me, will appreciate. It's a good enough space for everyone to have plenty of room to relax a bit after eating lol.  The Food was BOMB.DOT.COM! Okuuurt! I LOVED how big the servings were. I got the Monstah Mix Plate which comes with 3 meats, 3 scoops of rice and 1 scoop Mac salad. I was HUNGRY when I came, didn't eat all day just to save myself up for this place. We got here at like 8pm lol and I tried so hard not to order appetizers bc I wanted to try the infamous Furikake Chicken. So I got 2 servings of Furikake Chicken & Short Ribs.  Furikake Chicken was on point! If you are not a fan of seaweed I would suggest you ask for them to not add that on as they sprinkle the seaweed bits on top of the Furikake. Boneless tender chicken bits dipped in sweet yet tangy sauce with chopped green onions. Short ribs is good per usual.  GUAVA CAKE! Okeehhhh this slice of cake is huge! I love guava cake so just looking at that slice of heaven I already knew, that's the one! you def have got to try the guava cake or take one to go bc it's no joke man lol.
