Overall, it was a GREAT experience. Had a great time with my fam, shared laughs and most importantly enjoyed AWESOME FOOD in a great environment. I would def come back here next time I'm in town. I knew prior to coming here they had changed ownership, and everything in the restaurant is up to date and is catered to people from all walks of life but of course to us islanders. I encourage you to try it out & give these new owners a chance! You won't be disappointed at all & if you are then something is wrong with your tastebuds lol. Thank you Island Flavor!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brothers Monstah Mix Plate! Kalbi Short Ribs, Furikake Chicken &amp; Chicken Katsu
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My plate! Double serving of Furikake Chicken, Kalbi Short Ribs!  Mom stah Mix Plate is no joke

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was just nice to look at lol I didn&#39;t even want to eat it bc it was displayed so nicely. But y&#39;all know I couldn&#39;t resist. Guava cake

WVi767yjGaKuNM6oCa3joA.text: Good food even greater service! My go to place if I have people from out of town! Roast pork loco moco best rice combo! Poke salad is the bomb! order the fish fresh! Oxtail soup will hit the spot! Love this place! Love the staff very friendly and accommodating!

AhZMoIcb6noEAl-Kq3KxmA.text: The owner is amazing! Very friendly and always checking on the guests! The good is good, my favorite is the oxtail soup! big portions! and oh the chantilly cake is to die for!

1kSDaGUvW4Q9xoKduYcYQw.text: Great food. Awesome service. Priced right. Always a family feel, full stomachs, and a big smile.

uy1T4S2K3ISexjkq1UanHw.text: 3 Words  Fan Tas Tic  Best Hawaiian food in town.  Huge portions!  Only downfall is food coma.  LOL.  The wifey and I try to go once every week, especially fridays for the lau lau.  Its a little bit pricier than Aloha Kitchen but the quality is much better.  The beef teriyaki is EPIC, you gotta try it.  Oh and for desert, Banana bread pudding!!!  Like the natives say sooo "ONO"  (hope i got that right)

SB8JcECx5-x2I4EW7rudNg.text: Never had Hawaiin food before and won't be the last time. Friendly Hawaiin staff and the food is very generously portioned. I can recommend the mixed plate with Hawaiin roast pork and steak and onions with fried rice. I'm from NY and when I come down to Vegas I will be coming back.

jchlODnzTJDgbyc-TEo41w.text: This place blows L&L and other Hawaiian food I've tried in Vegas out of the water. The wait staff is also very friendly on top of that!

LUej4piMNBvJ_YwShQU0mw.text: The one star is not because of the quality of the food, the food was great. We started out with ahi poke, it came out in decent time, huge chunks of ahi, seasoned well with sesame.. delicious! My boyfriend and I both ended up getting the breakfast with rice and eggs, his with Portuguese sausage and mine with spam. Again, both very good.. but then again, how can you really mess those up? haha. Ok, now to the one star.. Upon walking in, there was a lady at the register right next to the door, she didn't say anything. She didn't even budge to maybe attempt to acknowledge that we walked in. My boyfriend then asked her how SHE was doing, she answered and then nothing! He then asked if we just seat ourselves, she said 'sure'.. no menus, nothing.. So I took it upon myself to grab two menus and we took a seat. (mind you, we were the only two in there besides the employees). Someone eventually came over and took our order.. "are you two ready yet?".. uh, yeah..sure.. sorry for the inconvenience. Just when we thought we were in the home stretch, the lady at the register starts making this god awful clearing of a throat noise every 45-60 seconds. Over and over and over and over...(fast forward to us leaving..) and over again. It wasn't just a little ah hem, it was like she had something seriously stuck in there and I was completely surprised she didn't end up spitting a chunk of something each time. It was so bad that it got to the point where my boyfriend was going to ask her if she needed him to get her water or something for her throat. Overall, food was good, but the service..I will NOT be returning because it was just THAT bad. I'm sorry to inconvenience you with my patronage, I won't be doing that anymore.

PvyHPpqvwiih-Mlzq7mnXg.text: Love love love this place. Make me wish we were back on the islands. Come early because it fills up fast.

hLz1ZERdzlKaHPW5EPpjyg.text: HOPEFULLY THIS IS THE RIGHT SPOT!  I enjoyed eating here with my friends. The staff made me feel like I was back home in hawaii.   The one thing about this place I loved:  THE PORTIONS WERE BIG! Just like back home in hawaii!  Most Hawaii BBQ spots are pricey and don't give much. This place the price was okay, but at least it was big.   I'm sure to go back, its just far from where i live.

bxtq9-8uP-N408vncJd7Gg.text: The portions are huge, the food is great and the people who work here are very helpful and friendly!  I drive by this place all the time but have never noticed it because of the pitch black tint they have on the windows.  The parking lot is also kind of dark. Thanks Yelp for letting me know about this place!

PPYUV9jjd-QEcTQea1XiIw.text: Went here one weekday just to test the yelp reviews that I've read and I'm glad I did. They food is delicious! Just like what you'd get in Hawaii. Very authentic and flavorful. The restaurant has a very laid back feel to go along with that "island style" of living. I went back later that week on Aloha Friday and there were food specials and live music. The place was packed and I'm glad I even got a table. All in all, the place is definitely a place I would go back to time and time again.

3go_PlEindm9x4SiK9D70w.text: If I lived a little bit closer I would probably eat here at least once a week.  The service is always great and friendly.  The laulau is great and the haupia cake is a great dessert.    When I crave good comfort food I always stop by.

jYkXBfJG7kjXN2GfaZ5Heg.text: This is a first for me two 5 star reviews in a row. What the hell is the world coming to? A co-worker of mine recommend that we go there for lunch today. As I am writing this I am slipping into a food coma from the aftermath of lunch. It is bliss, I had the loco moco which was just huge. I lost against it. My buddy had the Hawaiian sampler, which he thoroughly enjoyed.   Another reviewer was right about this place, it is going to spoil you and you will not be able to do some of the lesser quality Hawaiian food we have in the valley.

smoAdc7zv4wkWR45zh6_5w.text: My all time favorite place to eat when I want GOOD Hawaiian local foods. No ka oi! (The best!) friendly service, owners work and cook there too. Family place, love love love it!!!

BbKttx5It3SlzrilhwQ_sQ.text: From OC. First time here. Friday night. Surprised to see live Hawaiian music and hula. Was tempted to dance when the guitarist asked if there were any other hula dancers out there but didn't want to embarrass myself since I'm so rusty.  Ordered the roast pork loco moco. The serving size was huge!  I couldn't finish it so I doggie bagged it. 3 girls from a local halau did a nice hula auana. Made me want to do hula again. Anyways this is a great place to eat with friendly people and a friendly atmosphere.

oGtWBiMrhvXNaV_0oMNqLg.text: It seemed really popular given how many "locals" were eating there but our food was way too salty and a few dollars more expensive than other Hawaiian places we've tried.  I still get a little sad that they replaced the aptly named Pho 777 that used to be here. Sniff, sniff.

fNKHcQTHyLWjGeNLefpbWw.text: The only thing bad about this place is that it will ruin other Hawaiian places for you. I can't eat at L&L or Aloha Kitchen anymore... They always seem seriously lacking compared to Island Flavor.  This place makes me glad that Vegas is the "9th island"  Also get the banana bread by the cash register (when they have it)

AwrxnhMelXzx4cr91hlhaA.text: Oh Island Flavor, I love you so, but hate you at the same time.  My experience with eating a loco moco will never be the same.  Your roasted pork loco moco was absolutely to die for!  Even after my boyfriend and I split the one order that arrived in a huge pho bowl, we still were absolutely stuffed!    Their poke is also good as ever, I recommend getting it furkake style.

ChXATrmGBF1xUv6mcSxlJw.text: Former Hawaii residents that now call Vegas home recommended that I try Island Flavor. Well I did, and it lived up to every review I've read. I don't know one person that didn't like their experience or food at the restaurant. It's True, IT IS THE BEST HAWAIIAN /LOCAL FOOD IN LAS VEGAS. (I've tried several others) I ordered the Hawaiian plate with kalua pig & cabbage (lau lau was sold out) it was good, they give ALOT of food, however I'm here to rave about their desserts. THE KONA MUD PIE IS THE BEST I HAVE EVER TASTED. Food Orgasm is an understatement, also the GUAVA CAKE omg...THE BEST. The Poke...hella fresh. It's sad we have to go to Vegas to eat the best poke, kona mud pie, and guava cake. I'm from Maui and we have nothing that comes close to that. I'll definately go back to Island Flavor whenever I go back to Vegas. HANA HOU!!

xsMc9cyAG90Gf7t55Hj2yA.text: i drove across town to try this place out . and im a fan. hugh servings! i ordered the mix plate with kalbi and chicken katsu. bomb. when we arrive there was people dining and people paying their tabs. we waited a few minutes before a staff sat us. it was nothing special as for service. no ahola or mahola here haha. no biggy but id def would be back to try other dishes!

CgrBkUejJTouD8ryUkvlfA.text: Best oxtail soup in town!  Only place I've seen carry chantilly cake.  Furikake shrimp is bomb!

Zjj2hfdIKi0dvY8CZgyF5w.text: Love this place! Awesome korean chicken and kalbi. Yum!

97OEeGnyR-y3d-qxdpiH3g.text: Still as great as I remembered! I'm in love with their portions and I don't think there is a lack of quality with those portion in my opinion.  I took my aunty and uncle, who I believe would know the diff and were visiting from Hawaii, and they agreed that this place is awesome. My uncle said the oxtail soup was ono, but little bit different from how he usually gets it because the ginger is usually grated on the top.  He also said that compared to Maui the oxtail here is couple dollars cheaper. My aunty liked her order of kalbi too.  It was an extreme portion and she finished it all.  I got kalua pig and cabbage, which was an awesome portion too.  My auntie's looked the best though.  Afterwards we got chantilly cake and I got to say this was one of the best chantilly cakes I've had.  We weren't expecting such a big piece and I took it home to my boyfriend, who never had chantilly before and liked it.  When I come back here I'm definitely getting kalbi and sharing the cake.  It was all so good and it got my family's approval!

4KEhxDD4-YR8-MFfwuuj4g.text: After a whole day of watching my nephews baseball tournament, a group of us were starving for some real food. We decided on Island Flavor and I saw that it closed at 10pm. Cool, we still had a half hour. WRONG! We got there and the sign on the door had their new hours.... closed at 9:30pm. NOOOO!!!! Wait, what's going on? What the heck? We were going in the door. They said yes! They took us all at closing time without hesitation or an attitude. We sat down, ordered and ate. One of the waitresses worked at the same location as my friend (at her other job). What a great staff! The food was ono and the portions were frickin' huge. I ordered the fried rice which came with egg on top and a few pieces of the biggest Portuguese sausage EVER! Everyone really loved the food and most of us had to take the leftovers to go. The Chantilly cake is awesome! It seems like the hours have changed again according the their website. Go early, be hungry. Thank you to the staff that night for taking us in and being great about it.

-YzkZ3IqF-6yB4gA-Avb9w.text: tasty food and good size portions, homemade presentation and flavor.

-ccfFhyx7Y3w5glGA_ZXYQ.text: I thought I had died and gone to heaven when I had my first meal here.  Seriously, the food is really good and they give you HUGE portions.  I had been going to L&L before I discovered this hidden oasis and it is really incomparable. They also know what Aloha Spirit is - the staff is super friendly even when my boys are screaming or making a mess.  It's nice to know I can get authentic Hawaiian Food in the desert.  My favs are the Korean BBQ shortribs, Korean Chicken (mmm..seriously yummy), and the Haupia Cake!

9ffXHQohftWHlrL5S2o1Ag.text: i was craving for some good island food today and i wanted to try this...OMG its freaking awesome! whoever gives this less than 3 stars are probably just hard to please because when i was there, it was packed and we all know what that means. the staff were very friendly, esp this one younger waitress who was so kind i just had to give her a 35% tip. i felt so bad how she was running all over the place trying to tend to everyone while still having a smile on her face. food was delicious and at first i thought it was a bit steep but it was worth it because it was so yummy and theyre not stingy w/ the portions either. that was some freaking great teriyaki steak! and i was sooooo glad they cooked it perfectly for me w/out even me asking for...it was served medium rare w/ their delicious sauce all over it. i wish the service was a little faster but it seems everything here is made fresh. i would definitely go back.

b0LMK79E4IR9bY0MQWqhmA.text: i wished they had  opened a little closer towhere the bus goes through, coz they are the BOMB...ONOLICIOUS!!! everything they had was good, the price is a little to pricey but for what they serve and cook, it is well Worth buying!!! keep it up guys.

PLVbUwU5mhiARcbJaJkzKQ.text: I love the food here.  Reminds me of being back home on the Big Island of Hawaii.  I'm working my way through the menu and have tried almost everything on it including some of the specials.  I LOVE THIS PLACE.  It isn't your normal main land Hawaii food place.  If you go to hawaii, our menus are not made up of just teriaki, musubis, katsu, and native Hawaiian food (lau lau, kalua pig etc.) Of course not! We have roast beef and hamburger steaks and all kinds of things from around the world.  The thing is, we have our own way for cooking them with our own flavor.  Thats what this place is all about!  It takes foods from different cultures in Hawaii and gives it that made in Hawaii taste.  So from misoyaki opakapaka to korean chicken to ox tail you can get a real Hawaii restaurant feel (Big Island style anyways).  The best Hawaii food spot in vegas I've eaten at so far.  Aloha kitchen is a joke, L & L is imitation, Ross J's is GREAT, but this place this the BEST! (Note: sometimes the gravey salty, meant to be eaten with lots of rice, sooooo gooood!)PS dessert is good too!

LZ2Hkc3K9a86BAECIkxUnQ.text: My boyfriend brought me here and I LOVE IT!! I cant wait to go again, food was great!! No doubt about it, you have to try this place!!

ptW5DUNQrxDRH0QH98oQJg.text: This establishment has a very casual mom and pops feel to it. The food has the same kind of vibe.   I stopped by only because i was airing up my tires and gassing up at the Chevron.  The menu doesn't have much of a selection which hurts variety but the prep time was pretty fast.  I've never had authentic Hawaiian food so i didnt know what to expect but the beef and the korean chicken i ordered had a very home style taste.  I'd likely not return due to personal preference but would recommend this place to others

dzHf2Fh_M5sOo040-UmaLg.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in all of Las Vegas. I am not Hawaiian but love Hawaiian food. Since living in Vegas, Ive eaten at tons of different Hawaiian restaurants. Most of the time when one opens the food will be really good, then all of a sudden the quality goes down the tubes and it becomes just like the rest of them.   Island Flavor is the shiznittle bam. It reminds me of north shore shack in Honolulu(which isn't on north shore. The Kalbi is the best in the city. Its hard to find good kalbi. The only thing is the musubi, its always gone when i get there. One day though. The service is always really good, even on busy nights. Personable and relaxed. If you don't know, now u do. If you haven't been, then you should!

8TNLIQSUmmqsgTPN-AAFeg.text: Had to try because of Yelp reviews. Food is pretty good. Had Furikake Chicken and wife had Oxtail soup. Huge pieces of tail. Will go back to try more.

XE55vVrGgH0UDwF4tWrN1w.text: This place may be small, but their portions are HUMOGENOUS. I order the loco moco chicken katsu and I only ate about an eighth of it. The prices are reasonable when you consider how much food you're actually getting. Can't wait to go back to try some other things bc everybody's dishes looked amazeballs!

V_3zlI0WITP4tFeumf8kgw.text: The food and portions are good. As for customer service and "aloha" atmosphere..did not see it or feel it from the staff. Seemed not friendly and no smiles. Sorry I would have rated this better if the staff was more customer service friendly. Other Hawaiin restaurants have  better customer service.

GCjOyZL5IOmcD73sEg_MXg.text: Probably the best local food in town.  HUGE portions that i always have to take home and enjoy the next day.  the Friday special of Lau Lau poke rice and mac salad with haupia cannot be beat. Even the basics like Loco Moco was delicious. one of the very few places in Vegas that seasons the meat patty.   Although the korean fried chicken was a little too sweet theres not much i can complain about with Island Flavor. a little on the pricey side of local food but the portions are huge so it makes up for it.  recommended if you want some local hawaiian food

87-9RrLLkpUTYMhFYGMNRA.text: Island Flavor is the best place for Poke' and they have the best teriyaki mixed plate in town.

fhAMcQ5L9d06X2m3qmBhkw.text: Never going anywhere else for Hawaiian. I come here to cheat on my diet once a week. Always worth it. It takes all my strength and will power to not order more than one plate and I have the toughest time deciding on which dish is my favorite. So good, it's ridiculous.  Fyi, BEST AHI POKE IN TOWN. Ever.

u8nYDAKLKcTQ0ziyhY1yvg.text: Delicious. I can't decide if I like this place more than Ross J's however. I have to try more dishes before I make the judgment. Food: I had the Chicken katsu/ hamburger steak mix combo. The chicken katsu was definitely better than what you'd get at L&L or Aloha kitchen. Juicy white meat pieces and a good sauce. The hamburger steak was the real winner for me. The patty was well seasoned, but the brown gravy was what made it. You could tell that they made their gravy from scratch not not a box like some places *cough*L&L*cough*. Service: The lady was really nice and attentive. She seated us and took our order right away. I did wait a little bit for a drink refill though. Misc: Its pretty nice inside. They have a bar eating area with a flat screen TV to watch. We used a coupon from Restaurant.com to get our food for cheaaaaap which made this meal even better. I'll be back real soon. -1 star however because the mac salad here sucks. Its like they put boiled egg yolk into it. Weird taste and texture.

P-uQmY64ZOrP60KYqF2Lgg.text: HUGE poke salad with sweet potato, cucumber and tomato on a bed of romaine with a tasty dressing and garnished with orange.  The fried wonton skins might not be the most healthy, but they added texture and flavor, so an extra few minutes cardio is a decent price to pay.  The "boss" is a nice fellow and seems to be nothing but helpful and grateful for his customers.  The one review about bad take-out seems out of character. I plan to make this a regular lunch stop, being close to my office and the menu is extensive.  Must try Kaluha pig next time.  Modern local Hawaiian music (kinda reggae) passed the time nicely while reading the WSJ.  Crowded for lunch - best to drop in after 1:30pm.

39c3PWtsOc0eLRABHfbU5g.text: I went last Friday night (12/18/15). They had live music and it was AMAZING!!! We arrived at the perfect time, 6pm right when the music was about to start. I ordered the Mixed Plate: Furikake Chicken and Chicken Katsu with brown rice and mac salad (my friend ordered the fried rice, I am getting that next time). IT WAS THE BEST FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD IN TOWN! Now, typically when I consume that much food all I want to do is go home and lay on the couch until it digests.... Boy was I wrong!!!! I found myself not even wanting to leave. After attempting to eat all of our food (it was huge). We decided if we wanted to stay and watch the rest of the performance it was only necessary to try some dessert. Well, we couldn't narrow it down to just one, so we tried 4 different desserts. We ordered the Chantilly Cake, Guava Cake, Haupia Cake, and the Coco Puffs! We couldn't decide if the Chantilly or the Guava was our favorite, but they were all delicious. Like I said in the beginning, we arrived at 6pm but fell in love with everything about this restaurant and the atmosphere that we didn't end up leaving until 9. NEEDLESS TO SAY I WILL BE BACK & A REGULAR, WHEN I COME BACK FROM OAHU.

U-0yDSH2PyLkVUA6pJZC_A.text: Ok.... This is by far the place to go if you want authentic local food.  Their ox tail is to die for and their Chantilly cake and cocoa puffs just like liliha on Oahu.  I'm very picky when in comes to food...... And I rate this the best!

fzfcKwAPKcFFPhKNvEuJAA.text: Best Hawaiian food in town. I love the pork chops. They bring you huge plates. Everything we ordered there was more than one person can eat. Great prices to, so you cant beat it. A must try

IEEO-0n5yWPCOoVUETMCeA.text: So great to find a taste of the islands in the middle of the desert. Shoyu ahi poke and spam musubi. Da Kine!

Z1kcscgW-jTT95FfUQmp4Q.text: Absolutely the best place I've ever had plate lunch.  Yes, we'd been working out and yes we were starving, but I still know good food when I taste it.  The furikake shrimp were perfectly crunchy on the outside and perfectly moist on the inside.  The mac salad MIGHT have been as good as mine.  The kalbi ribs were... Kalbi ribs.  Honestly with the bottled marinades these days even chain restaurants have a tough time screwing those up.  I don't venture near Vegas very often, but I'm ready to go back.  You just don't get food like this around here!

1GHeXaBlXJ-vjw-K8NPtOw.text: This place is definitely a gem in Las Vegas. The food is absolutely delish, especially the gravy! The portions are definitely HUGE! We ordered 2 dishes to take out for the 2 of us and lasted us 3 meals. Wish we tried this place earlier as it is so close to our home.

TcstSY2GZXTJsKcP9GNITg.text: This place is amazing. So friendly, such amazingly authentic food. I couldn't be happier knowing you guys are down the street with the best kalbi ribs in vegas.

6uiXMO3B40ZQiEz4KMgkkg.text: When my craving for Hawaiian style food is larger than what L&L can handle, this is where you'll find me. Large portions at fair prices and the owners are very friendly. Check out their daily specials. One daily special, Beef Curry, is just terrific and too bad they do not serve it on their regular menu. Mud Pie anyone? Better bring a couple of your friends to share it.

_dJ1cuYgugblKuXGoHMFDQ.text: Very good, the short ribs are awesome.  I wanted to order a dessert but was to full.  I also had the roast pork also and it was good.  The only problem with the roast pork was that it was on the same plate with the great short ribs.

XlwWJdYGHjoGp4Q3eW5lDg.text: Came here for Nelson's B-day UYE, got here rather late so i figure i'd order something quick to save my beloved fellow friends the agony of watching me slowly eating the same dishes that they have just finished eating.   On that notion Lynn warmly recommended the hawaiian Ahi poke, the one with sesame, she suggested.  Ahi poke it is, big chunks of deep red and raw goodness nicely marinated with shoyu, green onions, sesame oil and more sesame~ To keep the ahi entertained, i also ordered some french fries along with a side of macaroni salad to satisfy my secret urge to eat fries with mayonnaise.  This combo initially raised a few eyebrows but after some effort on my part to promo the mayo-fries duo, there were empathetically accepted.  Although this joint does not fall on my normal route of commute, i will not hesitate to go back and try out a few more items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fries &amp; macaroni salad keeping the ahi poke company
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ahi poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi poke, paired with macaroni &amp; fries

N04_dr5-LdoufiLJm3tqwQ.text: Wow. It met and exceeded our expectations.  We ordered the poke, oxtail soup, lau lau, katsu, fried rice omelet, katsu loco moco and the haupia ice cream pie. That was just for our family of 4. We were there with 20 people so we shared everything.  The portions are quite large. Oxtail soup could have fed all of us. We took home the leftovers and enjoyed them all later.  We enjoyed everything and the haupia ice cream pie was a nice surprise. Our server did a great job taking care of our big group. There was live music that night and added the ambiance. The server told us she was from an "exotic island." Turns out where from the same exotic island, Guam.

Hz_ICGdE20FYCjGwnvgpyQ.text: Love this place! Great food, friendly service and big portions! Furikake chicken, beef teriyaki, kalbi short ribs and the BBQ baby back ribs are among my favorites. Since I'm originally from Carson, California it definitely  reminds me of home with its chill islander atmosphere and the soothing reggae music that's always playing my jams! Winner of urban-spoons best restaurants for 2014. Defiantly a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava Cake FTW!! #dessert

QHCbhnhq3bt2E4Zg19riRg.text: This is my one and only go to place if I ever want hawaiian food, which is like any time. haha They give large portion sizes, so if you feel it might be two expensive, just remember each dish is good for two people. I have never ever finished and entree there.  For starters they have the best Poke' in town that come in different seasoning, Furikake and Shoyu, Sorry I forgot the other flavor. But all our good just depends on which you like better. I recommend sharing this though tis too much for one person, well at least to me.  I have tried every dish, and all are great. no joke. The have the best roast pork loco moco in town. It's like a loco mock, but no hamburger meat just lots of tender pork. They're loco mock is also bomb with huge serving. The kalbi ribs and korean chicken wings are so delicious, like finger licking good. I think they're fired rice is the best in town because it gives me flash back of my childhood, when my aunt first cooked and served me the first time i ever ate friend rice. Like that critic from ratatouille, when he took a bite and he remembered his mom making it for him. haha If you can ever make it on fridays nights, they have the best LauLau to me in town, this dish really reminds me for hawaii. I wasn't born in Hawaii but i do go there yearly, so this food is as good as it gets to hawaiian dishes.  Lastly, if you can save room for deserts. They are all great,a dn from what i heard they are made by the bakery next door to it. You must eat Huapia cake and Chantilly cake, I would say a slice but they way they serve slices, its like a small cake. haha  the staff is always friendly, never had a bad encounter, just don't be shocked how fast they move, because they do everything, there are no busers or food runners helping, just the waitress.

Dn3Jyb5fsYHpCR4wS7JzxA.text: Oh this place is like back in Hawaii! Great food! Excellent prices! And remember save room for dessert!  Coco puffs, haupia cake, guava cake and lot more! Highly recommend this place!

ZdtCNXA3C6HnyiI8m2OtbA.text: Came here on a packed Friday, but we were still seated fairly quickly and got to enjoy some chill island music and vibes from the person performing that night. He did a great job making people laugh, having some playful banter and just keeping the overall mood light and fun. Be sure to tip the performer too if you find yourself grooving along :D. I got the Laulau which is usually only available on Friday nights. It contains haupia (coconut-flavored) and smoked fish flavors, but I happen to be a really big fan of those seemingly conflicting tastes and would definitely order it again. The other Hawaiian staples all look delicious here and their portions are huge! You'll definitely have enough food for breakfast or lunch the next day and I would recommend everyone at the table getting something different so you can get a taste of everything. I've also been craving POG since I was last in Hawaii, so I was excited to see that they give 50 cent refills here! I was super appreciative that the owner took time to talk to us on a busy night and welcome us since it was our first time here. He even apologized for the not-so-long wait, which was actually the most enjoyable wait I've ever had at any restaurant. This is definitely a great place to bring friends and family, without the hustle and bustle of the strip.

B1NGp7YdtosMSlMw6aCZPw.text: When that craving for some food from the island hits, there's no escaping it.  It's a hunger like no other. Luckily, over at Island Flavor, they give some of the largest portions that I have ever seen. It's like Hash House A Go Go-portions for Hawaiian Cuisine, except the food here is actually good.  The place was a bit on the empty side around 11am on a late Saturday morning. Seeing an empty place on a weekend always leaves me a bit hesitant to eat somewhere. But, I had a gut instinct telling me to eat here anyway. I'm glad I did. Here's what we went with:  Fried Rice Omelet - When this dish is served to you, it looks like a majestic mountain pile, capped at the peak with a generous amount of scrambled egg. Along with it, comes three giant pieces of Portuguese sausage, nestled around the edges of the plate. The fried rice, packed underneath, has to be some of the best fried rice that I've ever had in this town. It had a bit of a unique sweet flavor to it, mixed in with some small bits of diced pork. I'm pretty sure this serving was good enough to feed 3-4 people. I stared at this modern marvel for a few seconds before I dug in. It was beautiful sight.  Loco Moco - Another heavily portioned dish with a likewise amount of brown gravy, to boot. I sampled a bit of it. Not bad! the hamburger patty included with it was humongous, as expected. Loco Moco is much too heavy a dish for me to conquer on my own. I'd probably come back for this if I wanted to drown a day of depression in gravy.  Huge portions, great flavors, friendly staff.. there's isn't much more I could want in a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Rice Omelet

vAUn6iScKcgYaU2LvlP9mw.text: This place is amazing! The staff is super friendly and I love their Hawaiian accents! The food is also really cheap for the amount that you're getting. I tend to order the half orders because one full serving is way too much! The only time I ever get a full order is if I'm ordering to-go so that I can eat it throughout the day.   My favorite dish is the loco moco plate. The meat is huge!! They probably pack it there themselves because I rarely ever see such big portions anywhere else. It's a nice change from seeing the single beef patties on top of the rice like most other places. They're also very generous on the amount of gravy they pour over everything. Oh and the egg was cooked perfectly. I always get my eggs sunny side up and they have never messed it up here. Another one of my favorite items here is the furikake ahi poke. It used to be a lot cheaper per pound but now they sell it by market price. I believe it was around $14/lb last time I was there. Not too bad but it was definitely a lot cheaper before. They can do half orders for the poke too if you don't wanna spend too much. Another one of my favorites here is the katsu curry plate. Although last time I got it, the curry was a little salty. Not overly salty but I had to eat more rice to compensate.   I've heard their oxtail soup here is to die for. I haven't tried it yet but it's on my list of things to try along with their guava cake. I can't wait! Island Flavor is my go to hawaiian food spot. Cheap food with giant portions... can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full order of furikake poke ~$16

FbMuMjznkl9uSZZQYp5Bog.text: Very good food with generous portions for a reasonable price.  My favorite is their kalbi ribs and oxtail soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G5hrQo1YZdr5WB6Gyt7C6w.text: Oh amazing. We were looking for the best hawaiin place prior to our vacation. Place was packed but wait was minimal. Windows are tinted so dark it looks closed even at night. All of our food was amazing. Huge burger on top of mashed pots with eggs and gravy. Wish we had room for dessert. They looked amazing. Will be back.

yz3xgc_LMiV3Cro-ywd4Ow.text: Their furikake chicken and garlic chicken is bomb! Customer service is always on point too. Can't wait for our next trip out there!

AMiV0O2NqTzWFKRrObU2KA.text: The orders reflect the size portions as you find in Hawaii. HUGE also known as regular and the mini does the job for me. Like other have said the furikake chicken is a great choice. Heard one of the daily specials, the sweet and sour spare ribs is real good, I'll have to try that next. This is my spot for when I need a taste of home.

N8TcA0zrWmmq4sYM7n8J7Q.text: A few days later we called in for pick up and got teriyaki chicken and kalbi ribs. Not only was the food delicious this time, they gave us a free piece of some ridiculous strawberry like cake. Yummy! Thanks Bruce for going above and beyond to make me a happy, now repeat customer.

bhBVtEJz4RmTzS37_KVSMA.text: One of my favorite local spots for Hawaiian food in vegas.   The reason is bc of their chicken katsu Loco moco. Its basically a Loco moco but instead of the beef patties it has chicken katsu. This is amazing and only place that I have seen this dish.   The spam musibu has way wayyyy too much rice imo.

WiAcSLbA7bGijH9K02vAbg.text: The food here at island flavor was amazing! Great experience with the staff here. This tops off L&L Hawaiian barbecue. If you are looking for some real Hawaiian food, go here!

WybCCjWETWtw6-uGybC_nQ.text: It's not often that you find a place that reminds you of home. When you do, you know it's a keeper. I've had just about everything on their menu, from the Furikake chicken which is their best seller to local favorites like Loco Moco, Chicken Katsu, Saimin, Roast Pork and lots more. Prices are up to par with the food quality and service. So whether you're from the islands or not, this place is definitely a must try when in Vegas!

vYn0baB0J2u6O83RzjqgAQ.text: This place has great reviews from Yelpers, so I went with Chad S. to see what was up.  We arrived around 7:30pm on a Thursday night and there were only two tables open, as the place was busy, always a good sign.  I already knew that I wanted Kalbi, so no need to really peruse the menu.  Our friendly waitress took our orders and then our food arrived quickly, which was a great thing because we were hangry.  I was very pleased that I got four big pieces of Kalbi and there was meat on them bones, not a lot of fat, which can happen with this dish.  There were also two big scoops of white rice and a scoop of mac salad.  I ate one scoop of the rice and didn't touch the mac salad, but only because I am trying to be more protein-oriented and eat less of the bad carbs, but you gotta have some rice with your meat, right?  The kalbi looked and tasted like it just came off the BBQ in someone's backyard; after three pieces, I was fully satisfied.  I'm just sad that we couldn't get any of the Spam Musubi before we left.  They have musubi in a warmer next to the cash register so you can buy some to go; they sold out while we were eating.  Oh well, it just gives me an excuse to go back.  Aloha!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi, rice, and mac salad (hidden)

_BTOsdUHkDz6Q1utDRc0sw.text: This restaurant is definitely worth a try everything had big portions and the food was delicious and fresh.service was great food was affordable and my family that enjoyed it very much.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This poke was so delicious and fresh must try!! The serving size was very generous.

TMXZqedbxMJ5QQK6EYW-Dw.text: one of the best local kine grindz in vegas.  the portions are huge and price is reasonable.  usually i can only fish half my meal and have the rest for dinner.  roast pork loco moco is a definite winner.  korean chicken and roast pork mix plate is also awesome.  whatever you order, you can't go wrong.  but i did come in for the hawaiian plate on friday and i was sadly disappointed.  the lau lau was super dry, haupia was more like a grainy runny pudding.  for hawaiian plate, kauai cafe is much much better.  but all in all, island flavor is a really good place to eat.

i6MRnSsz44M4Uc9Xy0malw.text: Super chill ambiance & friendly service! I had the chicken teriyaki salad and it was delicious,  and massive. My husband had the HI roast pork & devoured it.  Definitely check out this spot. They have take out too. :)

CBWFWGUjHN5KCLN261R9eg.text: Best Hawaiian restaurant in town. Their food is tasty and the portion is huge! I can get three meals out of one entree haha. Love the kalbi here; very flavorful. They give you nice cut kalbi too. Their kalua pork is good as well. Very tender and juicy. Even their macaroni salad tastes better than other places. Their prices are very reasonable. Most entrees are around $9. They get real busy during lunch or dinner hours, so try to get there earlier to secure a table or be prepare to wait. Friendly service all around. They also have another location on eastern and pebble. A must try if you love the island flavor! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate with kalbi and kalua pork

68oTuJVS345xPrNo6s88aQ.text: Absolutely hands down da best Local food in Vegas!!! The furikake chicken and Korean chicken is super moist and tasty. The roast pork has the right amount of salt/pepper on the edges which also seeps into the middle too. The kalbi is huge and thick.  This is a must stop!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork and gravy, furikake chicken combo. Will order w fried rice next time

clT-7-FB_pdFyrF8ZdXU_w.text: The front is all blacked out. When you enter it's a little run down family owned business. Standard looking for a Hawaiian place. Took forever for my food, got the order wrong too. If this had a better rating system  Service 1 Environment 1 Food 4

5a3ZKioUmmNO8WxM01kbBw.text: This is one of my favorite Hawaiian restaurants... No, correction: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!  Their portions are HUGE, food is very delicious, prices are very reasonable (very cheap for their serving size, if you ask me.. but I'm not complaining), and it's a nice family owned restaurant that gives you that "Ohana" feeling.  My favorite dish is the Furikake Chicken. I eat a lot of food, but I always have left overs enough to satisfy my appetite for my next meal. Their Kalbi BBQ is also really good.  Their bathroom is very clean. For a restaurant whose been around for several years, I was expecting a not-so-clean bathroom. However, I was totally wrong.  The servers are friendly. However, every time I come here, they always miss 1 thing we order or they forget to bring something we asked for.... And it happens all the time!  Nonetheless, I still love coming here & am definitely a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava drink, Furikake Chicken, and Ahi Poke! Deeelish!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken w/ Guava Juice... Yum!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken! $9, but could fill 2 people

ah0V4qh-KqZKhvXiEPt2vw.text: This place is always so great. The services is always on point. The food is always delicious. I love the chicken teriyaki plate, moco loco, and today I'm trying the shrimp furikake for the first time and I'm sure it'll be amazing.   I love the portion sizes here. I can hardly finish my food so you definitely get your money's worth. This place is doing it right. Will continue to come here as long as the service stays strong. Definitely recommend this place.

l-2yQ9KJ4rRA7apja-vggw.text: If you haven't been here and you live in this area you are sorely missing out. If you don't live in this area there is another location at eastern and pebble. If you don't live near either then find a reason to go to one of them because I've been coming here for years and it has always been fantastic. Why are you still reading this? Go there and enjoy! Aloha!

dHufTmAkYNxsZ40rXWJPJQ.text: You have to try this place at least once.  You will keep coming back once you do.   Awesome food, great service.   Recently remodeled and expanded.

keIkm5Od4iiFP3SF6hr_gw.text: I have a friend (hi, Garrett O.) who can eat an inordinate amount of food. If I have yet to clean my plate, I can knowingly pass my leftovers along to him to finish it off. At Island Flavor, he'd be an invaluable asset to me.  The portions here are fit for a proper luau. You get an inordinate amount of food for most humans to consume in a single serving, so I highly advise splitting dishes unless you're the type to go HAM at buffets - which, in Vegas, wouldn't be hard to believe.  Mixed plate is my jam: 2 meats with 2 scoops of rice for about $12 is unbeatable. With kalbi (an extra $1) and furikake - my tummy is rumbling just thinking about how good it was.  Did I mention how much food you get here? I left a couple pieces of chicken on my plate because I was about to burst, and my hotel room didn't have a fridge for leftovers. Garrett O., where are you???  The overall environment is what you'd expect of a Hawaiian restaurant - friendly, laid back, chill. You feel like a part of the family by just dining here.  Island Flavor is a definite pit stop the next time I'm in Vegas. And Garrett O., you're coming with me!

_gprVDm6691HWW50SbYEcQ.text: What a find. I've heard a lot of great things about Island Flavor and I finally got to try it. I ordered the Loco Moco to go. It's fantastic. The meat is a very large portion that is perfectly seasoned. Two perfect sunny side up eggs on top. That all sits up on a nice portion of rice and it all gets covered in a rich brown gravy. I'm in heaven. Can't wait to go back and dine in. Staff is superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco

Zlcds4QSGe20KfvYSYDX5A.text: My husband and I came for lunch on Saturday for lunch time. We waited about 5 mins to get seated. The waitress was very nice took our order and got us our drinks. I don't know for some reason that day the wait on food was horrible we waited for almost an hour for our food to come out. I don't know if it was short staff in the back but that's ridiculous.  We were so hungry when we got there but by the time the food came out we weren't as hungry anymore ate half of the food, paid and left.

W5ktTuOhwdlgl3AkUTDxKQ.text: We came here for an early dinner.   Furikake Chicken & Kalbi with BBQ Pork Fried Rice - I liked this dish a lot. The chicken at first was a unique taste, but it grows on you. The kalbi was good. The fried rice was a bit more wet than I like.   Loco Moco - I thought I would like this because of the gravy, but I actually didn't really care for it. I thought the flavor was a bit weak. My sister said she can see why people would like it.  We were so stuffed we couldn't even try dessert.  If I return, I would get the mixed plate and something else. Also, hopefully we can save room for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken &amp; Kalbi Combo with BBQ Pork Fried Rice

mAMipugO_pkRc9bBkfOIxg.text: Definitely one of the hidden gems of Vegas! We got the furikake chicken, honey bbq hoisin baby back ribs and Kalbi ribs! All were amazinggg! Highly recommend this place when you're in vegas!

9WCPP8-BDU-JIvHzMX6jag.text: Favorite spot for island food! Serving is reasonable for the price they ask. And very traditional island restaurant they play Island local music . Love the atmosphere

lgQZdu4SE4fBIGu4cm_SqA.text: Island Flavor is my number one go to place in Vegas. Along with the food, the staff here is great. They are always friendly and attentive. Depending on when you come it can be pretty busy since it kind of is a smaller restaurant. If it is busy my usual wait time to be seated is usually 10-20 minutes.  Their food portion sizes are on the generous side compared to other restaurants and isn't pricey at all. I'll usually have enough leftover to have a small meal for another time as do most people that I've seen eating here. My usual order is the Furikake Chicken, but change it up now and then. I like the classic staple of the Loco Moco and the flavor of the Korean Chicken.  Ideally I'd like to see this location expand in size as well add more locations. They have another location on Eastern and Pebble is that location is closer for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco

tFce6J9TxWQOwbBbsWTaLQ.text: This is easily the absolute BEST place for local style Hawaiian food in Vegas!  My family and I have tried other places and Island Flavor has everyone beat!  We've been living in Vegas for more than 10 years (born and raised in Honolulu) so we have a very good idea at what makes up good "local kind grindz"!  The food is so ono (delicious, for my non Hawaiians) and the portions are, as President Trump would say, YUGE!!! I had my usual mixed plate consisting of furikake chicken and steak and onions!  Yummy!  Wife had the same chicken and kalbi, younger kids shared a chicken katsu and older son and his girlfriend had two different versions of the loco moco.  Her loco moco had roast pork and his had chicken katsu.  Yeah, they were all good!  Wife and I shared a large slice of haupia ice cream pie for dessert. The whole meal was a festival of flavors in our mouths!  Along with the food, the ambiance of the place is worth mentioning too.  It always brings us home to Hawaii.  There's Hawaiian music playing in the background.  The place is decorated with Hawaii themed memorabilia and the workers are friendly, just like the people back home.  Bottom line: don't waste your time with the other places, they just don't stack up.  If you're craving truly authentic local Hawaiian food, then this is the place to be, period!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy! Haupia ice cream pie!!!

BKCgNOfFTaJ4ImU13z2P5Q.text: Food is ono, while In town we wanted some local food from Hawaii. Well this is the spot, not to mention we knew the the Executive Chef and Executive Sous Chef Alika & Koa Ambrosio.  Our waitress Kim is amazing her service exceeded our expectations. Will definitely let all our Kamuela families that are in town this week know where to get some ono food.

rTwnMdRIg4G6cX2OvEJZBA.text: We came here for lunch very disappointed this was one of our favorite place for hawaiian food. Got our food which was Kimchee fried rice with Korean chicken and my daughter ordered furukaki chicken but they brought teriyaki chicken I told the gentlemen that my daughter ordered furukaki chicken so he changed it. While we were waiting we had our other order on the table and I asked for and extra plate and he never gave us even if he saw us sharing our one plate .   I told him just make the furukaki plate to go cause we were already disappointed. I mention to the gentlemen how come our kimchee fried rice was cold along with the cold Korean fried chicken and his response was he doesn't why the food cold.. Disappointed with his response.

dd0pId49e731JuOJkEhM9w.text: Huge portions. I had the short ribs. A bit fatty but tasty. The Korean chicken sauce was extremely spicy. Don't think I'd recommend it to others. The mac salad was really good. I'd come back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SHFbdr7Xrfp_3CidA2DaaQ.text: Kalbi and Furikake Chkn was our fav. Da Fluffy took a while but the grilled cheese "buns" were great.

DF68D5RhsbQO2-lB5e5xGQ.text: Authentic local food found here! I've dined here a few times and each and every time, I've always tried something new and it always hit the spot! I've been wanting to come on a night with live music but my Fridays have been consumed with school stuff so hopefully, I can make it happen in the near future! We ordered the roasted pork and furikake shrimp! So ono, made our opus happy! It was flavorful, definitely living up to their name. They have daily specials for specific dishes so you know I wanna come back on a day they have beef stew! I'm so glad they are now open on Sundays and Mondays! We did have to wait for a table but I see this as a good thing since the food is good! The service is just like I'm back home and not that franchise feel. Always clean and always too full to try dessert. Portions are huuuuuge so share or expect to take some home.

A1DQUL1YZUrEurb_d63Dpg.text: Not the same. They fired most of the originals and portions got smaller ever since new owner took over.

p6aigDLoUbg-I8Sa-15QBA.text: Bad to worse! A friend wanted Hawaiian Food this past weekend so decided to give it another try....please 9th Islanders do not go here. The food had no flavor and there was hair in my food. So disgusted didn't even want to address it as there is no need for compensation. I am not dinning here ever again. Better off driving to Ross J's, 2 Scoops of Aloha or Cinnamon's. Ohana BBQ has much better Hawaiian Food than this establishment. It's such a shame as this was a staple restaurant for locals now living in Vegas. Wish I could give them negative stars.

yXo-34fpv1PVoDtjow2P0w.text: You expect to exit and instead of Durango you're looking at the ocean off Ala Moana Blvd. That's how authentic this place is. Tasty food served with the spirit of aloha. Mixed plate will give you your best value but everything is always delicious and plentiful.  Also. If I am to be stranded on an island with only one thing to eat the rest of my life, let it be their spicy avocado poke. Amazing.

mh8gIYfK8csf3RBGgq1e5w.text: Ordered ahead of time for my take out only to find out the cashier did not punch in the order. Have to wait to for 30 minutes more. Very poor service.

ZQN9AaaMi0QMJEYkKOj98w.text: This place has good food and great portions. Had a great experience. Everyone was nice. And foid was fresh and hot.

2v3azdg0KhxlwhGT-CWB4A.text: No Aloha! No Ohana! Mistreating Employees! Pilau business practices! Not eating here ever again...

yFZJuWxnp2bH3vP9NL-E7A.text: A True piece of Hawaii right here. Excellent food and our waiter, Wes, was fantastic!!!  Keep up the onolicious work!!!

C7x7xr32va80lvcyJES9UQ.text: I didn't realize how much I'd be back here since my last review, but that furikake chicken keeps me coming back.   I've also tried the oxtail soup. It is heavy on the ginger, and the meat was a bit tough, but the broth was above average. Don't expect the same type of flavor as California hotel. I think they use bouillon cubes or some heavy MSG, so it isn't as salty.   The beef stew on Saturday's is super popular, but I didn't like the taste too much. It sorta seemed like they added a lot of cornstarch, flour, gelatin, or something to thicken the sauce and I was not enjoying the flavor.   Still yet, for the service as well as their standout items like the loco moco, furikake chicken, and their chicken katsu, this place is a solid win when it comes to bang for your buck.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef stew- I didn&#39;t like it very much
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup- has a more ginger flavor but very good.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo plate- furikake chicken and hamburger

vFo8Vu0Hk9lYM4wPShACsA.text: Service was slow. Food took about 40 minutes. Portions have gone smaller (picture) and food quality has gone down. Not a big fan of the new management.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sdeG6xMaZXuU1f57QXRvWg.text: STAY AWAY IF YOU ARE CARB FREE!! Today we tried to place a take out order. I had been a customer for at 4 years. No MORE! We were informed that you can no longer get 2 vegetable sides. Ironically the way the order was being placed, there would have been a double vegetable side and a starch and vegetable side w the two dinners. Of course this was figured out after we left. For years this request had been accommodated. But now because of "cost" the chef won't do it. No up charge was offered for 2 vegetable sides either. I've been carb free for several months and can now cross this place off my list of eateries. I'm very disappointed by this! If you are fine w losing customers that don't want to eat carbs, I'm fine with frequenting someplace else.

kyhoR5k9gHUGwg4TLC0arA.text: First time here! Food good but the wait time to be seated is super slow. Lots of open tables yet the hostess chooses to take phone orders first! I was very irritated. But I'll be back despite the slow service.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KdoZY6T5VSChs789tkvgJw.text: What an amazing atmosphere and Silvia our server added much value to our dining experience thank you Island flavor and Silvia!

fHrYvnDBS4Xnd0_MZ-HldQ.text: Haven't been here since they remodeled. I would've written this after I got my food but it's already been 50 minutes since I walked in sat and ordered. Nice decor however service sucks. It just sucks. Look out for my food review. If I ever get to eat probably by the middle of next week at this point Just Hangry!

fkeTXxiZh-wgnN59oeoCkQ.text: Sunday lunch day at Island Flavor.  I am not a stranger to island flavored dishes, so I decided to try this place out base on the reviews.  Cozy restaurant, and clean.  Come early to avoid a wait because this place gets packed!  I decided to order to-go their Sunday Lunch Special Kimchi Fried Rice, and Korean Chicken.  Portion was exceptional.  A generous serving of Kimchi Fried Rice enough, for lunch and dinner.  You'll enjoy the sour kick from the kimchi, slices of chashu pork, onion, and soy sauce if it was not destroyed by over salting; which, was unfortunately disappointing.  Furthermore, the Korean chicken was sweet, and crispy, but like its Kimchi Fried Rice partner it's just too salty.  Unsure if the chef  was having an off day, but I expected to be blown anyway from the reviews.  Fortunately, the Macaroni salad was delicious.  It was creamy, yet light, and deliciously worth ordering on its own.  My rate in order is based on atmosphere, cleanliness, presentation, taste and overall satisfaction.

3VlhFhzMGlXx9SebVlfrcA.text: With so many reviews I procrastinated in writing mine.  Clearly, the food is LOVED!!    Though my family pretty much stayed with our trusted favorites, I do regret not being more adventurous in trying other favorites.  We live only 5 mins away and became quick weekly patrons.  Our favorite is the teriyaki beef w/ fried rice.  The fried rice alone is a meaty meal!!  If you like Hawaiian BBQ, this is a must go!  Lacking 1 star for the location and lack luster restaurant.  The staff is friendly but seemingly always rushing because they're constantly busy!   It's ambiance gets zero stars.    * I think that they'd forgotten about our take out order once which kept my husband there for approx 20mins.  They made up for it by sending a dessert for each entree - and they were GOOD!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z4ZB8pRxoz0lxiYMJ8DdtA.text: Leftover paradise. Order your lunch here, and your dinner is covered too. I love the furikake chicken and also the garlic rice omelette with Portuguese sausage. My wife always gets the kalbi ribs or the poke.

-2GkoJT_RA96DPuB8SwKAA.text: I feel really bad for giving them 1 star but there service sure does deserve it. It was terrible! This is the second time this has happened here. We came around 6:50 and waited 15 minutes with no one to ask if we wanted food or water. Two groups of 4 came after us and got served and still NO ONE came to our table! They'd look at our empty table and walk away. We got no apologies! That's when we decided to leave. The lady in the front said, "thanks for coming in" she didn't even acknowledge that we didn't get any service. It wasn't busy, but somehow NO ONE took their time to do their job. Something needs to change when it comes to your serving staff.

_210SFROaH4Cmx8mecI9yw.text: This place is literally ran by monkeys. I stopped going to their other location for having some prison rules but this location wasted 40 minutes of my time. I called and placed an order over the phone, they said the order would be ready in 25 minutes. I show up 25 minutes later and paid for my food and asked if they could check on it. She then came out and said my food will be another 35 minutes. If that was the case you should have told me an hour for my food be me wasting my time sitting there like a idiot for 35 minutes. I immediately canceled my order and will happily cut ties to this location as well.  The business owners reply is trash. You guys suck.

xWnP2lI-T0uLp0pXhg4_Ig.text: Consistently good, great portions. Authentic island food with great service. Great for take out and dine in. Will come again.

4mNcB5K_W-1z9KfC3rjNjQ.text: Well it doesn't get more authentic than this!!!  From their food to their island attitude and hospitality.   I have to say their food is so flavorful and their portions are unreal.  Whether you eat here or order take out, you get a really good portion of food.  I love their ribs!!!  The price is great, atmosphere is fun and the people are so sweet.  I love the Hawaiian accent so I love hearing them speak as much as possible.   I can't get enough of this place!!!  You've gotta try it if you've never been.  I highly recommend it.  10 stars!!!

V1dg1qiufXXNxw2AhTb1dA.text: Super nice and friendly staff.  I love their food.  Their portion sizes are huge.  Island vibe is strong within the restaurant.  If my waistline didn't hate me so much, I'd be eating their weekly instead of monthly!

z720LhMW1_CihaM2LfwvjQ.text: I am in love with this place. They don't fool around here, it's the real deal.  I thought they had my mom back there cooking.  No cookie cutter, out of the box recipes here.  I had the Sweet & Sour Spare Ribs which were awesome!  I felt like smothering everything on my plate in that sauce it was so good.  The spare ribs were nice and tender with no gamey aftertaste so you know it was cooked with love.    The sides were really good too.  The Mac Salad was also very tasty, quite possibly my favorite Mac Salad now, and the Rice was nice.  For dessert we had the Haupia Cake, and they are serious about their dessert too.  A nice mountainous slice of fluffy Cake and the Whipped Cream looked like an avalanche..  It was great.  The restaurant was nice and clean.  Nothing on the floors and the countertops and tables were all clean and clear.  The service was fast and friendly.  I think the quality of the food outweighs the price by far.  I have found my new favorite Hawaiian food restaurant.  Even if it is a bit far from home for me, I don't mind driving across town to eat there at all.

HovMUAX3w0DtQzSEhFWEdQ.text: WARNING. The portions are GIGANTIC and can feed 2-3 people. The dinner was pretty good but what makes this place a must come back for us are the Chantilly and Guava cake. I have said enough.   Also staff is very laid back and friendly people

UKeyjL2o870nMXXgKb20_A.text: Awesome. Best Hawaiian food I've ever eaten and great portions for the price. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu

nKt7kCBdbEX3Rc6YFCD-pA.text: Absolutely the best place for eat for Hawaiian grinds . I would recommend island flavor over any other Hawaiian spot in town .

q2O4n41bmi0s-bKNYFegyg.text: This has to be the closes quality Hawaiian food in LV. All the other Hawaiian restaurants don't compete to this level. And from a boy coming from the island I can say this is good quality food and the portions are worth the price.

QIgi_GtPy-S9T5cyc0gQDA.text: Honestly this place is actually pretty good. I've heard from mangy people to come here but never had a chance to. The restaurant had a look to it with friendly service.  The only thing I didn't like about this place is the loco moco. The gravy is a tad bit too salty. Taste like salt to me. But it's just my opinion idk.  Overall this is a good place to eat! I'd definitely come back!

s-Oh2ZEsJb3BndW2qPJEKg.text: This is the closest Hawaiian place to us and I was so happy that they got such great ratings on yelp. Although I didn't feel like it was mind-blowing, Island Flavor will now be our go-to Hawaiian place whenever we have the craving for it.   Furikake Chicken- I have never had Furikake Chicken before this and first bite was AMAZING. It was crispy, sweet, and cooked just right. After about the third bite, it was getting to be too sweet for me so I stopped.  Kalua Pig- Every time we try a new Hawaiian place, I ALWAYS order their Kalua Pig first. (i don't know why) There's was good but I feel like I could use a bit more of the juices. The meat was tender and the cabbage was cooked just right, but I would have wanted some of the soup to moisten my rice with  Chicken Katsu- pretty standard. Their sauce with the katsu was delicious. Finally, a katsu sauce that hasn't been watered down!  Roasted Pork Loco Moco- I know there are a lot of amazing reviews on this but I thought it was just 'meh'. The gravy was a little lighter than I would like and it lacked a bit of flavor. Maybe it was just an off night? I feel like loco moco is a hawaiian staple, so to mess it up would be blasphemy.  I mean they didn't "mess it up" but I have had and (made) better. Again, it may have been an off night and it definitely won't stop me from coming back.   Spam musubis- these were awesome and even had a layer of extra flavor in between the spam and rice. I'm not sure what it was but I know it was green and may have had sesame seeds? Whatever it was, we loved it!  Chantilly cake- DELICIOUS! it was as if chocolate cake and tres leches had a baby.   Guava Cake- So good and so PINK! it wasn't overwhelmingly guava-y and not too sweet. Just right!  Our first impression was not as good as I would have liked. We ordered our food to-go and when we got home, we realized we didn't have the right order. Thankfully, it only takes less than 10 minutes to get there from our house. My bf drove back to get our order and he came back with a complimentary piece of guava cake. They were all really nice when we were there, so not mad at all. Definitely coming back!

IypKbxA9Jv8wtEo4mEqo8Q.text: Best food in Las Vegas!!!  Authentic Hawaiian food. Not only do you get a lot of food the prices are great too. It's definitely a destination place for us every time we go to Vegas.

zNv78_rY85YYg5gUu4BHOA.text: I stop by at least once a week for the poke. They also serve an amazing loco moco, chicken katsu... I could go on. Great spot!

RAsVYfiC8eAbZodFULM2yg.text: We went on a Friday and they provided live Hawaiian music! It was packed, and yet they still had plenty of time to tend to our needs! Pro tip: Ask for Leilani, she will take care of you! She knows the ins and outs and had our dishes come out perfectly! The furikake chicken was the best and everything we had was cooked to perfection. The cherry on top was the guava cake, so light and delicious you could eat fifty of them! I was most impressed by how much the owner and staff cared about the customers in the end!  Pros: 1. Amazing waitress 2. Spectacular customer service! 3. Furikake chicken ftw 4. Delicious guava cake 5. Live music!!!  Cons: 1. Took two tries to get it right 2. Food was so good you have to eat it all

hkCZMETYJ9f6HegVDlz9Mw.text: Mahalos to Island Flavor for coming to the 9th island and sharing what good Local food is all about. Island Flavor does local food right...Thank God!!!  If you have a craving for local food this is the go to place in Las Vegas. Its a sit down restaurant but they also have counter service. The place is clean, everyone is always friendly. and the food is ONO!  Not many Hawaiian restaurants in the mainland make me feel like i'm back at home but Island Flavors does exactly that every single time. I've tried a lot of their menu but my favorites are:  1. Love their Oxtail stew- Its ONO period. 2. Any of their Loco Moco's- hard to finish off its a mountain. 3. They got good poke...best on Fri/Sat when fish comes in 4. Pocho Bean soup...very good, almost like my Aunty's-almost 5. Roast Pork...melt in your mouth!  6. and of course their hand wrapped Laulau's- I think its served only on Aloha Friday. Its a good thing they only serve it on Fri or I would have to buy new pants. 7. Their mixed plate is like the Zip pac on steroids! So much food...and much better.  This place is a winner in my book. They would put a lot of local restaurants in Hawaii to shame. What are you waiting for? Stop Yelping for a minute and drive your okole to Island Flavors. And don't forget to bring your appetite because they pile it on. Trust me, you'll be taking food home unless you are sharing your plate with 2 other people.  Aloha to you too!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Flavor

JAmJTxCaMDC9JyWy32Ha2g.text: They have the best service ever. It didn't feel like we were waiting a long time, we didn't even noticed & they came out with a free appetizer and they apologized. They are awesome!

PCltaCnlCpAIXxsoyv3vuw.text: OMG I have dreams about this place. I can't wait to get back to Vegas- this'll be the first place I stop. I had a little bit of everything and it was ALL good. The Furikake chicken was great, as were the desserts. Plus they have Meadow Gold POG!!!!

QvzTWds9O6-ntqAZU7HQeA.text: YAyyy!  We found our favorite Hawaiian food spot here in Vegas.  Aaand you know this city has a million to choose from lol.  I lived in hawaii for about a year, and i've never had oxtai soup until recently at Island Flavor.  I was apprehensive at first, the thought of eating oxtail and all.  But I must say, i'm glad I gave it the benefit of the doubt, because it was delicious.  The broth  was so comforting, the meat of the oxtails were so tender, and the order is huge.  Now, i'm an avid oxtail soup eater at Island Flavor.  My husband swears by their korean chicken.  I've tried it and it's pretty good.  My 4 year old grubs on their barbecue chicken, which tastes ten times better than other hawaiian restaurant bbq chickens.  I also like how their beef is an actual steak.  None of that thin sliced beef teriyaki allllll the other mediocre hawaiian joints serve.

StL0gKm1_JW1IlE9fzDdUA.text: Best Hawaiian food in town!! Lau lau , poke ,  chicken katsu , and kalua pig are my favs! Mac salad is on point! They even have coco puffs!! ( for those of you who know what they are! ( not the cereal) . Must go!!!

Ej424rIE7Zsc8pvA7D7fCQ.text: The food here is amazing and the portions are huge! The furikake chicken is a must try and the fried rice is the best I've ever had.

m5LlzDYUgbQMqdt0Robqhg.text: Growing up in a Samoan family it's hard to find a place to make island foods like grandma does and today I found this perfect place! I went for spam and eggs and ended up with Kalbi short ribs, Portuguese sausage, Mac salad and delish Mona coffee!! Definitely looking forward to going back asap!

UMWOJrSY_pqUcq4jAs4vPw.text: Four stars for decently cooked food with large portion sizes. Nice staff. However, I wanted to try the tuna poke salad and it was listed as "market price" - ended up being $16. Was so disappointed. :(  I wouldn't mind coming here again but I do wish that the tuna poke was more reasonably priced.

9S-1sfed-_LSg0eRoiQBlQ.text: Very poor customer service.  The server was a total bitch and we ended up leaving before getting our food.  I usually dine at island flavor at least twice a month because I love the teriyaki steak but I was treated so horrible that I will not be back!  Extremely disappointing.....

wekhkodb0IhwRNigG7DDiA.text: Authenticity? Well, this place seems to be a go-to place for Hawaiian natives Pricing? Plates average $9-$11 and can easily feed 2.  Makes this place a frequent option for our family. Service? Pretty darn good Kids? Kids always love teriyaki and the Kona Mud Pie Food? It's hella hearty and comforting.  Wife loves the macaroni salad.  Recommendations:  Poki salad, Tonkatsu w/ Gravy, Steak Teriyaki,, Loco Moco, Fried noodles & Teri chicken. I have yet to try the haupia cake since I'm the only one in my family who loves coconut, but one of these days!

2Q4dIh3b7BusqXMKCkEeKA.text: For casual Hawaiian in LV, this is the place.  What I had: I was in the mood for greens (after eating too much fried food and pizza), so I tried their salad, mixed plate of cabbage & pork + ribs.  My friend had fried noodles.   We couldn't even try dessert.  The salad was very simple just cut romaine with a couple of slices of some type of sweet purple potato (?), cucumber and tomato.  The dressing was really good and it was topped with all these crispy fried wontons.  nothing special, but pleasing.  The meals were really enjoyable.  Cabbage & pork is my comfort food, and this was perfectly seasoned and moist.  The ribs are to die for:  really must have.  And the fried noodle special was thoroughly enjoyable.  Can't wait to go back and explore more of the menu.

8bI-crhvwRfVTyEOnZVWPA.text: Had the Friday special and it was pretty good. Also had a slice of guava cake and not bad. Hopefully we can come back and try some different dishes. Overall, pretty good food. Not bad for Hawaiian food in the middle of a desert.

267ToVmWeE6Uyls3Hhdizw.text: 5 stars for portion size.  If you like to eat a lot, this is the place.  However, found it to be quantity over quality.  The teriyaki chicken dish was good but could have had more flavor.  Loved the portion size though.  My bf I think ordered the wrong dish. Laulau I think it is called - with all of the leaves and meat.  I tried it -- and perhaps it is just not my thing- but what a strange flavor!  i could tell he didn't like it either and was almost forcing himself to finish half the meal. We couldn't even touch our macaroni salad the portions were so huge.  Fun/different for us to try since there isn't anything like this in NYC.  Perhaps other certain dishes really are better, but ours were just average.

CmrvaUpPVP94B_cpP66nGQ.text: Bit far off the strip but I wanted to give it a go.  I ordered Poke, Hoisin rib and Saimen.  Rib was freaken awesome.  Tender, fall off the bone awesomeness.  If this was a BBQ place, there would be line out the door just to get a taste of the ribs.  5 stars for the Rib.    Poke was good.  I don't think you can immitate the freshness that you get from Hawaii.  You purchase by weight and we were allowed to place a mix of 3 types of poke to come out to a pound.  Saimen was descent and I'm sure that it's the authentic flavor but my taste is skewed from Aloha Factory in Alhambra's char siu saimen wonton soup.  After eating Saimen in various places, I'm deducing that Aloha Factory's saimen wonton is not authentic but I still love it nonetheless.

919LbBwJIfVvEHSKjJUJwg.text: Hands down the best Hawaiian restaurant! No other place compares to this place! The food just feels so authentic the staff is super friendly they make you feel at home! And make sure you order the guava juice!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu loco moco

EjMLy12RWoAm5JUcKkl-7w.text: Found out about this spot from a friend who is Hawaiian and man, we can't stop thanking here. EVERYTHING here is so freakin tasty and delicious. It's food heaven! This is definitely our go to spot. After eating here, no other place can even compare of satisfy the craving for some island food. The service is always so friendly and helpful, and the food is always big portions. You definitely get your moneys worth. My favorites are the chicken katsu loco moco, and the furikake chicken....though everything else is delicious too. All of the desserts are soooooooooo yummy too!!!!! GO HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

sQLS3IWwNXaMqnnrmtCCbw.text: The best Hawaiian food that I have had. I had the chicken katsu and Kalbi short rib mixed plate ($12.49)  Chicken katsu was crisp and good. Kalbi short ribs had a charbroiled flavor. Hubby got the Laulau, the special for Friday night, which was very good too ($11.99) Large portions at reasonable prices.  We were there on a Friday night and they had live Hawaiian music. I really wanted to try the Huapai cake but was way too full but it looked great. It was very busy though but only a short wait, maybe a few minutes, but it was worth the wait. We will definitely be back.

uwOjZcdpEGDb5jSGfAHYYw.text: One can say the portions are huge, but the same can be said of most Hawaiian places.  And that said, Island Flavor is also your standard Hawaiian fare.  If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd certainly go there, but as an out of towner, I don't think I'll make a special trip just to eat there.  I had the Korean chicken, and it was good - the texture was great, and it was extra crispy, but although it had a kick to it, it could have had more of a kick, and it was a little bit too salty.    The macaroni salad was also good, but still within the range of what you'd expect.  The rice, and if you have read my other reviews, I am picky about steamed rice, and here, they had the same issue as I have with  a lot of other places, and that is I found the rice to be too soft, and though I ate 75% of the two large scoops, I was not able to eat it all.   I sampled some fries and I thought they were your everday run of the mill "thick" fries.   On the specials menu, they had cucumber kim chee for $2.00.  The taste was good, but we only got like a small sampler cup full, which would be about 1 1/2 banchan dishes at a Korean restaurant.   Overall, the food was filling and enjoyable; the service was friendly, the people are nice.

Dm8UZLj_kDFfnzAX5uSbhA.text: We ordered take out from this place, so I didn't get to experience the ambiance, but we were pleased with the food.  In order of yummines, must eats in BOLD:  CHICKEN KATSU LOCO MOCO - Breaded chicken over rice, under sauce and egg.  Very tasty.  Large portions.  Chicken teriyaki salad - We ordered this just to get some greens in the mix.  The salad part was just OK.  But the chicken was super tender and flavorful.  Ahi tuna poke - Basically a huge mound of tuna sashimi.  I liked it, but sure what makes it so special.  ===  Would I come off the strip for this place?  Probably not.  But I might hit it up again if I'm visiting family in the area and craving Loco Moco.

jZStP5re-Jp0vrPv-D9kQg.text: Reminder, you better go there hungry! Big portions of island plates. We had furikaki chicken, my fav! Huge. Locomoco, huge(okay gravy)! Fried rice (eh), huge! Mix plate(yum), you know...huge. Mud pie...definite yes! Poki was delish ( wish they made one spicy) Food flavor, was okay on some, but great on others.   This place packs it in, plus live music Friday! I think they need to expand. Will come back to try different items on menu.

2gRKVe0MkRDq_xtEMHccWw.text: This place was really good. I had the BBQ ribs special. My only concern is they put cold BBQ sauce on hot ribs which made the ribs cold. The flavors and amount of food was awesome though. My wife had the Kailua pig sandwich which was good as well. The service here was awesome. I will definitely be coming back especially since it's right next to Rhodes ranch. Great place to bring your family for a bite to eat.

6i_dwuvfDfb6EAn6euGNHg.text: Hands down: one of the best things to ever happen to Las Vegas!  I seriously got on YELP and was browsing through all of Island Flavors pictures because I miss the food so!  The orders for our party: Oxtail soup, chicken katsu, kalbi short ribs, and shoyu chicken. When those orders came out, my jaw dropped! The portions are huge! Everything was flavorful and delicious. I have a grand feeling that everything on that menu is just as delicious as the meal I had that night.   Now, what really made me cry tears of joy was the kona coffee mud pie. That thing is huge! It easily fed our party of 4. The yummy coffee ice cream, whipped cream, oreo cookie crust and macadamia nuts was marvelous!   The service was also great! She was friendly and made sure to serve us with a smile.   Island Flavor, you won a place in this girl's heart!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kona coffee mud pie

fiCN0dE-9YwDABaIvFDO0g.text: I have come to this establishment a numerous amount of times, and swore i had wrote a review, but when I went to "update" my review, I see now that it looks as if I haven't!  As always, the staff is friendly. Me and two of my best girlfriends went around 1 in the afternoon. It wasn't as busy as I thought it would be, so finding a seat was not hard at all.   It didn't take long for our waitress to get our drink orders, and bring it in a timely matter. I've noticed tho, that the prices has gone up quite a bit since the last time I was here a couple years ago. I was about to order the usual mix plate when I noticed the Daily Specials Menu placed inside the Menu Booklet.   Menu Specials when I went there Last Week... My Order: Kalua Luau. side order of sweet potato with sesame sauce Friend 1: Furikake Chicken  Friend 2: Pork Chop (on regular menu)   The kalua luau was good, its different type of luau to my family luau. Our luau is more creamier, but this one was a bit more on the roughage green leafy side. But it was still so ono. I opted for brown rice and it also comes with mac salad. THe mac salad was a little too "mayonaisy" for me, but if my palate didn't change since i moved from the rock ten years ago, it would've been right up my alley! I ordered up a side of cooked sweet potato and the dipping sauce was divine. Just a great amount of sweet and salty to compliment the potato.   The Furikake CHicken was broke the mouth. As much as i LOVED the Luau, I was picking the chicken off my friends plate just as much as she was picking the luau off of mines. We should've just switched our plates.
