I was under the impression it was a full chicken breast, but they came out as nuggets. Sweet and savory, with bits of furikake all over! Now i'm not a big fan of any kind of fried chicken, but I couldn't control my hand. It kept reaching over to her plate to grab more!  A definite must try!!   Last but not least, the pork chops with smothered onions. Now what is NOT to like from this all time favorite. Now I've had charbroiled pork chops, teriyaki pork chops, char siu pork chops, apple pork chops, etc. But I love having just a regular, salt and pepper seasoned home style pork chops once in a while. That brought it all home. It was served with two scoops of white rice and a side salad with your choice of dressing.   I didn't opt out for dessert this trip, but from previous visits, I do recommend the Chantilly cake and the Banana Bread Pudding! I tried the Kona Coffee Mud Pie, but when I got it, it was just a oreo crust with three inch high of ice cream and stuff drizzled all over it. Not exactly what I call a mud pie, but it was delicious as just Kona coffee ice cream! (It was still Ono! )   I hope to be back soon!!!

zXSyPvqY29djJ172lpt62A.text: This is now one of my fav Hawaiian spots! Always great service and always, always good!!! I've tried their Korean chicken (sorry but aloha specialities wins this one but it is still good), chicken Katsu, roast Pork, kalbi ribs and the guava cake! Let me just say wow to the guava cake!!!! I only wish they had a location closer to me!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava cake yummmy
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pig &amp; chicken Katsu
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork, furikake shrimp &amp; fried rice

jMnH4iEGTNZa90FIrpdznQ.text: Whenever I'm stuck on the 9th island for all work (no play), I visit Island Flavor. Almost...almost...makes me forget I'm in the desert and instead right back at home. :) What's cool is the guy who runs it is from the Big Island. So if anyone is going to do local food right in Vegas, it's going to be this guy.  My friends had mixed reviews, but I've not been disappointed. I stick with the teri chicken or the chicken katsu loco moco. Always large portions.The only thing I would recommend if you don't like to drink gravy, is to ask for it on the side. They give a BEEEEEEEEG vat of gravy. :)   Depending if there's room, you can't go wrong with the mud pie or haupia cake. YUM!  And of course, when paying the bill at the counter grabbing a spam musubi for the road. Good local eats when I'm away from home.

fb60tU8cnPix9XauvHRklg.text: Ordered the Kalbi Short Ribs and the Teriyaki Chicken. The beef was bland but the chicken was so over salted and drowned in teriyaki sauce, I couldn't eat more than 2 or 3 bites. I also opted for the brown rice and it was so overcooked and mushy almost like mashed potatoes. I'm not sure what all the hype is about this place. Definitely not a place I would recommend since the quality is so low. Perhaps I ordered the wrong dishes, but how do you mess up grilled chicken, short ribs and rice? Big FAIL!

wZPUF0h2YU9N4gBt-3EmhA.text: I love this place! The food portions are so generous at a really reasonable price, you'll probably get at least two meals out of each order. What's good here? The lau lau, mac salad, kalbi, chicken, oxtail soup, loco moco, korean chicken, kahlua pork, pretty much everything. Don't forget their desserts either!! The mud pie is amazing! You'll definitely leave feeling 5 lbs heavier, which I think is comforting every so often :)  Of all the places outside of hawaii, so far this is my favorite place to get hawaiian food.

RRuu8PAtIU4MNXMrTboQ3Q.text: Very disappointed! If I had reviewed this before I'm sure they would of gotten 5 stars but after tonight's visit they deserve only 1 for overall service. I used to be quite a regular here, so much that the waitress already knew what I was going to order and she welcome me with a glass of lilikoi as I walked thru the door.   Today's visit was quite the contrary; as I walked thru the door the older lady turned her back to us but I simply went straight to an open table. A few minutes passed as we waited and another couple walked in thru the door, the older lady was delivering food to a table and she stood there to have a 6 minute conversation with the table (I was looking at my watch) not giving any aloha's that we were going on almost a 15 minute wait and that there was customers standing at the entrance.   After the long conversation, the older lady decided to sit down the couple and hand them some menus. My mom had to get up and ask the older lady for some menus after she sat back down the phone rang and she totally forgot about us. The younger waitress that's always there came out from the back and I calmly asked her for menus for a second time - let me just state that there was only two other tables that were already eating, the place was not packed for such lack of customer service! - still no menus came! The older lady walked to the back twice more and brought the table next to us a to go box and even decided to take the couple's order that had walked in after us.   Finally! She decided to bring us the menus. I ordered a lilikoi and my mom a sprite, the older lady looked at my mom like she was dumb! She turned to me and tapped my menu with her hand and asked what my mom had said like she was non existent and she didn't know what Sprite is AND to tap my menu as I was reading demanding to know what she wanted!!! How freaking rude??? Apparently, they don't carry Sprite but Sierra Mist. Either way she could of said that, my mom looked at her like ok? where are your drinks on the menu? She snatched the menu off my mom's hand and turned it to the back but that menu was missing the back page! She didn't even apologize!   My blood was boiling at this point. I opened the menu and realized that the ahi poke I'm a regular for is now $18 from the $8.95 it used to be! If you can't afford an item on the menu, take it off don't double the price. The price was modified with a piece of tape. I about had it so I grabbed my keys and we walked out the door made me lose my appetite!

ZP8rF9nh51AADI7jR44aLg.text: I eat here all the time because the first day i visited i had my money's worth and the services was awesome.the food is great,you can't go wrong.

OYSrXYCb0fizIfJfuD2PNQ.text: I have gone to this restaurant before and after new ownership took over and I have to say the service and decorations are 100% better with the new ownership! before the new owners came in, service was sooooo bad. It took forever to get our drink and even take our orders. Some of the waitresses were rude and always seemed busy with everything but the customers.   I just went in a week ago and what a difference! AMAZING service and the place looks so much cleaner and more inviting. And the food is even better than before! I'm obsessed with Kalbi ribs they're so yummy but anyways..  can't wait to return again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k0czQjfP5-xAxDDvSz85sA.text: If your looking for some great island flavored food I recommend island flavor.   The food is fantastic as the chef is from Hawaii.  Friendly staff relaxed environment and great food.  I recommend the monsta mix.  It a little bit of everything.

y-mo7mFKpFJSSxpizEwgug.text: Portions at this place are massive! You will be leaving with leftovers. Food is flavorful and very affordable. I had the mixed plate with furikake chicken and kalbi along with fried rice. 2 people can share this plate and there will still be leftovers. Furikaki chicken is delicious. The kalbi and fried rice were good but a bit too salty for my taste. I was too stuffed to try any desserts but they all looked great. Service was wonderful also.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cklsIf-DsT7fxayDBYLoBA.text: My go to place for Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. Huge portions and consistently great food. Love their furikake chicken and chicken tonkastsu. If you have room left after your meal, be sure to order desserts. I have never had a disappointing experience here. To go order portions are consistent with their dine in as well.  Noteworthy: After an amazing diner here, I miscalculated my bill total after adding in tip (I blame the always imminent food coma). Checked my card statement later to find that they had only charged me for the amount I had intended (as opposed to the amount I had written and signed with..which was several dollars more).

qlkeJ541CA58Ahbqw_9yxg.text: Wonderful Hawaiian BBQ!!!  The avocado fries were amazing. It was super busy for Fathers Day so service was a little slow but so yummy.

rnSmJJgGWZK-QoMDlYXksA.text: Best authentic Hawaiian food in Las Vegas! The furikake chicken is one of my favorite dish.  I love the poke as well.   The staff is very friendly and you can actually feel that your in Hawaii.

DI2EMc6eofciFSriOCWeew.text: Recommended by a friend, so we made a special trip to try it out. V yummy tasty Hawaiian food. Great service!

zyOEl10XDHIIB4N79bzTOw.text: The food and service is really good! They also have live music! Really nice vibe and ambiance!

XjChJ4fcyEyEFXAmu061sw.text: Good Hawaiian food outside of the island. Lau Lau is good ot like the frozen one you get from other Hawaiian place. You get Hawaiian music on Friday night. Have to try when you are in Las Vegas.

qlDwGOwKs_tZWgSMF58Q6A.text: Came in tonight. I've been here a few weeks ago too. The Tenant Improvement to this place is fantastic! The food I had a few weeks ago was good. I did notice there was a slight difference in portion and taste. New management after reading previous posts. However I don't recall the furikake chicken being that greasy. It was way too greasy this evening. It was jammed packed, and live music made up for the night I guess. I may be back again. Staff was attentive but they did forget about a meal on our menu and had to wait again. Didn't even comp it for their mistake.

Q9fjAdTewJhvUMmTEQqXeA.text: Ughh! I came last night ordered loci moco and kalbi. Food was undercooked and did not taste the same. No service to me after I didn't agree to leave a positive review mentioning how great the new owners were. Who blackmails the customers and dictates them into what to write in a review? I don't know if is because I didn't agree to do the review or what not but my food and the service was horrible! Why did one of my favorite place turn into one of the worst place in Less than one year. This use to feel so welcoming and Hawaiian. Now it is so cold . I miss the old island flavor so much. It's turning into Las Vegas flavor and I can only say people who haven't had True Hawaiian food this may be appealing. But it is no longer feeling like a Hawaiian restaurant . It feels so fake and nothing like before

85dhiuUk-9MORGvSE2TKeg.text: This place is my favorite spot. Every time I am here In Vegas I make it a point to stop. This is the best island food in Vegas. I brought my fiance to Vegas this week and she is from Oahu. I wanted to see if the food compares and she said it absolutely does. Couldn't be more happy to share a little piece of home with her!

GDrfE4IoL9qJnM9tc47Lkw.text: I just got back from hawaii and this restaurant is the closest thing to hawaiian flavor in the city! So many different options that gives you a sense of variety and wonder. The service was excellent and quick. I absolutely loved my experience at this restaurant!!

UXzybMBvfcJDXwGjcM9X4Q.text: Great service and awesome food.   The Furakaki chicken is to die for.  Our server Ty, attentive and great service.  Checked in on us multiple times   We are stuffed  but coming back here for the Guava Cake!

mca6zulZdT9P_QcriHrDpA.text: We live less than 2 miles from Island Flavor & have no excuse not to frequent more often! Ty was our server and provided friendly, courteous service. Great food & menu variety! Island Flavor no ka oi!

sxmauwMk6JWN7Vw6ECL8mQ.text: I ordered "Da Fluffy" & it was pretty good. The food portions are on the larger side and the service was friendly  overall, it was a good experience!

uj74VzPWyk8nFABRtce6_Q.text: This place suck now food was good before but not anymore. I can't believe how small portions I been getting I been going here for 6years I think this place is a rip off now. Time to find somewere else to eat Hawaiian..it funny to in the restaurant it dose not feel like home anymore feel like white person restaurant.

TGs7r50tmXPisXZ09OOjqw.text: Came here last night 8/4/18 around 8:30pm. We waited probably 25-30 mins and our food wasn't fresh, it was like room temperature. You would think If you waited sometime it would be hot but nope.. Anyways ever since the place has been remodeled with new workers it just has not been the same.

436Eg_wdL2mHCKszs08ZNg.text: I've been going to this restaurant for 5 years. Things have changed and unfortunitly it's not good. Portion sizes are smaller, mac salad doesn't taste the same. It's sad because I loved  this place.

VBIDxqbTVMUcqVM6qae7YQ.text: I love hawaiian food and always come here but maybe the food needs a new cook or new recipe/flavors. Just never really satisfied with the taste.

qJDv1485wpyUeQ_dyA8o0g.text: Elevated Hawaiian food in a casual and spacious setting. Macaroni salad was excellent along with all of the entrees we enjoyed. I especially loved the roast pork, furikake shrimp and chicken and the teriyaki steak. The Kona mudpie and Guava cake are delicious! Thanks Christine!

9ZdtNky7XJ2otWlaKiAcng.text: Big portions and lots of good flavors.  Glad to see they expanded - always busy at this location.

BVGZYjLoSXIzyQQ1vFRP6g.text: Best Hawaiian food I've had in Vegas. Fried rice is a mountain with delicious marinated pork pieces inside. Furikake chicken is exploding with flavor. If it was closer to me I would be there at least once a month.

avfKE9jUBfg-7HL6bg2COA.text: Furikake chicken was really good. The tocino pork was really dry and chewy however. Chop steak was great.

O1TP_uv_mTmKCbfYfSH8Ow.text: Good food!!! I will continue to come here to eat. Service can be slow, but is usually worth the wait. Waited over a half hour for poke then another 30-45 minutes for ice cream and a slice of guava cake.

g-sGmsX8Pjt7UXB9_B-b5w.text: The furikake chicken was the best chicken I've ever had! The plates are huge and the atmosphere and customer service makes me feel at home. I would definitely recommend coming here for some great food and a full belly.

KXlrIyeVZ4B-1c4nEX1UhA.text: My husband and I are the biggest island flavor fans in the world. We are usually the first people in the Pecos location every sunday. Lol The pecos location although not as pretty is WAAAAAAY better than this one. Service is a bummer and make you wait on the phone for 7minutes, and when you get there, they say no one is one the phone. Uhhhh i'm still here waiting. Food is good but not the same as the pecos location. Thanks for reading

Y_zR8dH0eBmBMtuwrVY9uw.text: Had the ox tail soup and short rib kalbi.  Flavoursome without being exceptional, the meat was quite a bit tougher than the meat I am used to having with kalbi.  Good flavor on the marinade and decent soft rice.  The ox tail soup was different, lots of ginger and a fresh taste. The ox tail fell apart and was filled with delicious vegetables.

3iICozgxhZRSGLdRwlrxeg.text: I ordered there Kalbi, hoisin ribs, and ahi poke. Food is good and portions are good. Poke with avocado were a bit salty.

jCYtqu0Od4k2bUmToTT0KQ.text: We went here after all the hype we've heard around it. The service was good, everyone has the island friendly mentality which was nice and inviting to be around. We weren't impressed with the food, which took a long time to come out. I got chicken katsu and short ribs with fried rice and Mac salad. I loved my short ribs, slightly tough and overdone but so delicious and full of flavor. The chicken katsu was mediocre and not the best I've had but it wasn't terrible. Mac salad tasted more plain than usual but I finished it anyway. My boyfriend got the teriyaki chicken. I didn't get a chance to try it but he definitely voiced not liking it. I definitely would not recommend the fried rice. It did not taste anything like fried rice, which to me ALWAYS tastes the same. I couldn't even eat it. It was literally rice saturated in soy sauce. It had some pork pieces in it which were okay but we couldn't stomach the overwhelming flavor of soy sauce (and FYI we always put soy sauce on our rice anyway)... I think it is a cool place to check out, other people seem to have enjoyed the food, however we will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu, short ribs, Mac salad and fried rice.

HxFg7CNzLHH5Kuz-JZt96w.text: Came in on a Friday for lunch.  We were seated right away.  I ordered the furikake chicken based off of Yelp reviews.  My husband ordered the 2 item plate- chicken katsu and hamburger steak.  Service was great and offered help with the menu.  Restaurant was clean and loved the Hawaiian music.  The food came out prompt and hot.  Portions were big.  My husband and I weren't able to finish our plates.  All the food was really good, especially the furikake chicken.  We would definitely come back whenever we are in Las Vegas.

5iK1cqNBi63X4bybWMOGqw.text: Been to this place multiple times. Food is good but the wait time is ridiculous. I've been when it's not busy and for a Kalbi plate and beef stew waited 40 minutes and had only 2 other small parties. Didn't mind cause the food was good. Today I placed a pick up order for 1 lau lau plate. The girl said 25 minutes it will be ready, and I'm here waiting at the restaurant still and it's been 45 minutes still no food. Very disappointing wait time for a simple order.

v6jIJnFaNJnWrnFXoLlBcw.text: Great comfort food! Awesome customer service and huge portions of food. Try the bread pudding!

n13tfMAN82nPgljkbGFT8Q.text: Food is still good. But ever since new management came in and took over service has really tanked. Been sitting here for 45 minutes now and waiter says food will be out in 15 minutes.  Not a busy night either.

1OCVz7rpNT0ezbIls3eaLQ.text: This places is so good. I was here a few years ago before the remodel, and I don't remember it being this great! Definitely my favorite place in Vegas to get Hawaiian food now. Oh and Lilikoi juice!!! Onolicious!!

0K4nKtv4fCfahuzGdAD3KA.text: This place is a slam dunk, and truly achieves the criteria required for 5 stars.  Price, taste, service (except when their tiny place gets overrun with locals waiting for a great meal), are all on point.  If I didn't care about my health, I'd eat here 3 times a day and 4 times on Sunday.  Disliked:  the wait on busy days.  Line can and does go out the door because the locals know how good this place is  Liked: FURIKAKE CHICKENNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN, the musicians that come in every now and then to play live music, mac salad, fried rice, hamburger steak, kalbi short ribs, the portion size, loco moco, anyone that works there  Meh: Furikake shrimp, korean chicken  Island Flavor would be in my top 3 last meals on earth (along with Pho Dac Biet Xe Lua with Thai Tea and egg rolls, and the most bougie burger on earth with A5 Wagyu meat, edible gold and black truffle everything)

hWnzBSfW3MOOX-fGIH7YyA.text: I have heard so many good things about this place. I finally visit it and the service is absolutely horrible. The server who's name is Kehau was unnecessarily rude to us. I waved at her to come and answer a question and she completely ignored me. I had to walk up to her and ask her my question and her response was, "Im cleaning tables right now, ill get to you when I'm done." Sat us down and made us wait almost 15 minutes to bring us our waters. Multiple parties were sat down after us and the server put us on the backburner and went on to take other parties' order before ours. On their defense, I will say they were very understaffed but that doesn't call for crappy service. Server even bad mouthed a product that is sold here. Overall food is great and portions are great but I highly recommend you take your food to go because the service is absolutely crappy. Great customer service should stay consistent ALWAYS. Island Flavor, please do something about this problem if you expect longevity.

XwfOrjSpPR1REtlICPQ4gw.text: I hate to be negative, I used to work in hospitality, and I used to be a server too. But I was too disappointed today. I wanted to have some poke (everybody knows that poke is a RAW fish), so I spent almost 40 minutes waiting for it, till my boyfriend got his chicken Katsu, and the people that came like 10 minutes after us got THEIR POKE. Like really? Demi, that was serving us, after I asked how all the people around me can have their food, and I'm not, went to " check on it" and was chatting several minutes with people on the big table, that were obviously her friends. That was our first time not tipping the server. Not ok.

HKFcKtFyb9hC_tgwfoKc1w.text: Solid Hawaiian cuisine and a family run business.  The amount of food is almost obscene but still high quality.  The place was slammed when we were there and they were turning them fast.    The service is a bit haphazard but they got the job done.  When the food arrived and we all were like WHOA that is a lot of food!     No complaints and we will go there again.

1RjUwwCVtpZS2dp6QjRabw.text: Awesome food menu and service. We're from the Bay Area, and will definitely come back here. Huge portions for a really good price. POKE plate definitely a plus

40vIC1nr9KO8tRQuvoOlIQ.text: Very good food! The Kalbi short rib will make you come back over and over again. Food is amazing. But what really might send people away is the service. The waiters have a "what you want?" attitude. If you are easily butt hurt then don't dine in. Just order to go and call it a day!

_hpsVhezrxCdtwno8F9tjQ.text: I am Hawaiian, & that has nothing to do with my one star of this place. We went there based on The Las Vegas Weekly review & Yelp. Boy were we disappointed. We ordered a combo plate of the chicken katsu & the roasted pork. The katsu was just breaded chicken with no flavor & the 2 sauces it came with were like sweet ketchup... YUCK! Then the roasted pork was so salty & dry. DOUBLE YUCK. We also ordered the Korean chicken wings, they were okay, that's it & the pork fried rice was bland & funky tasting. There was plenty of food, but it was horrible. We figured they may be able to redeem themselves with the Haupia cake.... .nope, it sucked too.  All the waitresses seemed distracted & there was only 3 tables filled. Whoever gave this place 5 stars, needs to get their taste buds examined... DON'T SAY I DIDN'T WARN YOU.

cf5N4iTyFPj77HRI2v2dMw.text: Best Hawaiian food on the mainland!!  We ordered the mahi mahi special, chicken katsu loco moco, and oxtail soup.  Portions were huge and everything tasted great.  Save room for dessert!  We couldn't resist trying the chantilly cake.  Very moist and light chocolate cake with condensed milk frosting.  You must try it!  Very friendly staff!

i8XmB6y2RYRKAS50DekLmg.text: Hands down, the best Hawaiian food I've had. Big portions and friendly staff who easily remember you!

AeylF8rGlfZhn3GrVJrepw.text: Really authentic food. Good price. Great service. As close as you can get to Hawaii in Vegas.  The waitress was one local girl and was really cool.  Nice to see some Aloha spirit made it out of Hawaii intact.  Aloha is dying everywhere, but not at this place....

avtw4nrkEGjs5QwDmKe3nA.text: You walk in and immediately feel like you're in Hawaii.  The food is great and portions are huge!  It's a ways away from the strip, but worth it if you're craving local food.

rQqOPxt-i_V-sE8ewliVoA.text: Born and raised in the 808 definitely gives me the right to let everyone know whats the real deal about the food from Island Flavor.  The terms "broke da mouth" or "ono" are used when you have consumed foods that are so delicious, full of flavor that you can eat it till you go into "polynesian paralasys" hahahaha! This place cooks and serves their food as if they were still back on the island, plated with "choke" (lots) of food and with lots of local flavors.  All the other restaurants out there in vegas attemp to serve you what they call "hawaiian bbq" but Island Flavor doesnt sell theirselves to be a bbq spot, they stick to their name and serve you exactly what you want, Hawaiian food and more. The best Kalbi, well-done everytime and their chantilly and haupia cakes are just like home, maybe even better. Poke is fresh and the loco-moco's, three scoop rice, huge hamburger patty and choke gravy witht the mac, winner! Go in for the authentic Hawaiian plate on a friday or saturday night when they have live hawaiian music. Very laid back, everybody is family; auntie, cousin, uncle. You wont be disappointed

ay7-CFQ9phtUUlmybA37bg.text: Awesome food. Furikake chicken was amazing. If you're in a hurry I don't suggest coming here. Portions are huge!

wF3whUUK-jANTiMJU5GOKQ.text: yes yes yes, big island ono grinds!!! my cousins and i got three plates and shared everything. and i had to get my ultimate fav: lilikoi passion fruit juice to chase everything down with. mmmmm! my mouth waters just thinking about that juice!  now onto the food: i ordered the hawaiian plate which included lau lau, rice, mac salad, haupia, salmon lomi lomi, and tako poke. and my cousins ordered the chicken katsu loco moco and two item plate special with kalbi ribs and teri chicken. the loco moco gravy is like no other i've tasted before, and with the chicken katsu, to die for! the teri chicken was standard, but not dry to a plus in my book. the kalbi ribs were just right, and the lau lau made my freakin' trip! a little bit of pork for the fattyness and flavor and chicken for variety. add some hot sauce on everything, and i was damn good to go!  if there is one complaint, they were a little slow. but since i now live in nyc, i'm used to being super rushed. i've forgotten what it's like to be laid back and relax! i def need to fix that one, maybe a trip back to visit nanang and tatang in kalihi?!  all the food was delicious and i would eat here all the time if it wasn't for these three factors: i don't live in las vegas or anywhere near it; if not eating it all day everyday would make me a fatass, literally; and i need variety in my life when it comes to food. i can't just have hawaiian food for the rest of my life. but it's not to say that if it was all there was left to eat in this world, that i wouldn't be happy as all hell!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

FJ-D5LRJmZCf9d8ZFSqe1A.text: Yummmmy good!!! Really good island food, big portions, great prices, and lots of aloha. Desserts are huge & oh so yummy (Try the guava cake :)! I come here several times every time I'm in Vegas =D

M4bNMDDmKoh9fMNwCGX6_Q.text: I love everything about this place!  The loco moco is as good as you get in Hawaii.  The cake options here are also awesome.

VcgVFVAatDZO4xvL0Q0cow.text: Very good Kalbi & Chantilly cake! Deducted 1 star because I couldn't eat the Korean chicken - it had ginger BUT that was my fault because I don't like ginger =) Highly recommend this place!!!

OcyVnsWaI7_QnkFWUvbxQQ.text: Searching for authentic Island Flavor cuisine? This is your place. The L&L and other fast food Hawaiian spots can't compare. This is my first visit and the staff was very welcoming. These are real Hawaiian from Kona they tell me. This is not like the other places that are mostly Korean owned. This place takes pride in their food and it shows. The Kalbi ribs and fried shrimp is what was suggested. The owner hand cuts the ribs himself and marinades them. He said he never freezes the meat so its always fresh. The shrimp is hand cut and breaded with furikake sprinkled on it. I haven't had Hawaiian food this good since I was there last year. I kept driving by this place cause it by the house and now I'm glad I stopped in to try. I will be back.

3G62dTl5ZAPebri4uJNtHQ.text: this place reminds me of hawaii.  When you're sitting down, it feels like the beach is just outside... but its not.  I'll keep dreaming for now.  The portions are huge and pretty good.  What makes it Hawaiian is the workers.  They're all probably from there and just seeing them interact makes you feel you're back at the islands.  I don't know what it is but the aura they give off is very authentic.  Of course, its really good food.  Reminds me of a Hawaiian place I ate at back in Maui.

dO5qtckT9hfwiElPChSXVQ.text: Definitely the bomb. If you like meat and hawaiian style meats this is the place to go. This place is just like Da Kitchen on Maui except better. After a long day of hiking at Red Rock, hubby and I stopped by here for dinner. When you walk in, you're not immediately greeted. Instead I got the feeling that you're supposed to be like family and seat yourself. The environment is pretty laid back. I actually felt like I was in Hawaii. I ordered a combo with Korean short ribs and Hawaiian style pork. It included a fat piece of the tender pork and 5 pieces of short ribs. SO good and very very very generous portions. Flavor was all there. I didn't touch the two scoops of rice. Macaroni salad was typical. Hubby ordered short ribs and katsu. Katsu was well fried with a crispy outside. I would definitely come back here again. Don't forget the restaurant.com coupon!

8NbZ3BZhRzWP9ZupmZK9kw.text: Friend of mine suggested we try out this spot due to positive reviews on yelp. Negative! Horrible decision ever made!  I ordered the Kalua pig and cabbage and I order the loco moco for my husband.  My kalua pig and cabbage was so bland. I couldn't believe it! My husbands loco moco was burnt and the gravy tasted weird. My first and last time eating here!!  HORRIBLE FOOD. GOOD ON PORTIONS BUT FLAVOR IS TOTALLY A ZERO!!!

g0bHcGPnksaI6PS7MapOfA.text: This ain't no L&L, this is the real deal! Every time I've eaten here the food has always been fresh and tasted authentic. I think their oxtail soup is as good as it gets when you don't want to trek to Downtown and visit the Cal. Honestly I feel the oxtail is much better here than the Cal. ;) Portion size is everything here, so you get what you pay for that's for sure.  Now this place is located near Rhodes Ranch. I would say that 90% of their business is take out so the restaurant is never really busy. But if you do decide to eat there, it's a pretty laid-back place no fancy decorations. The owners add their own personal touch but displaying pictures of friends and family on the wall.

EfckcZoTpm75OpY5C4PXUg.text: After reading the reviews in LV Weekly, decided to try..although it is about 25 miles away from home.  From Hawaii, and miss the food back home.  Portion size varies.. On the mixed plates, they were generous but BF ordered Teri beef and portion was small.  Laulau had lots of meat but missed the taste of the butterfish that you get back home. Ahi poke was very fresh.  Korean chicken wings were not crispy. Macaroni salad disappointing. Service is slow and waitress is missing the aloha spirit. Prices are higher than the other Hawaiian food places.  Would return there again for the poke but for the rest of the menu...I can find it closer to home.

3WnkCjsoRMeGj6jZd4oIRA.text: furikake chicken is on point! huge portions

SfbxGeE8LKWcR9jNRgqC_g.text: I came here recently due to a coupon from restaurant.com which by the way was on sale for $1 with the promo code "ninety" 9-13-09 will be the last day I believe! Everyone should take full advantage of it! Food was simply AMAZING! This place will not let you down and I definitely will be back! KOREAN CHICKEN: I HiGhLy recommend the Korean Chicken. Although this place is Hawaiian based, do NOT be discouraged by the word 'Korean' on the menu you will NOT be disappointed. The Korean Chicken is coated fried chicken wings with some flavorful meat that will burst in your mouth! I kid you not my first bite was over the top! FURIKAKE SHRIMP: I also tried the shrimp which was part of my plate combo...It was also pretty good but nothing to rave about.. I think I'll stick to my tempura shrimp at the Japanese restaurants. But do not be discouraged about trying it I am extremely picky when it comes to shrimp! TERIYAKI CHICKEN: It was also pretty good although I'm not too much of a fan of teri chicken in general. I personally get tired of it easily after a few bites. You need not worry about the flavor here as well, the teriyaki sauce is glazed with generous amounts all over and the portions once again are tremendous. PORK WON TONS: Pretty good way to start off the meal although not necessary because you will be full by any of the plates that you order. Pretty much your typical fried won ton complimented with the sweet chili sauce that kicked it up a notch. MAC SALAD: ehh the mac salad was nothing special to me I've definitely had better. So what we gonna have DESSERT or disaster? Dessert was definitely not a disaster... the portions are very generous in this aspect as well... definitely something to share. MANGO ICE CREAM: Hmm couldn't know how to describe this but it being mango ice cream. It's so hard to pin point what I can compare this to because any mango ice cream I've ever tried is always so different in taste, yet always delicious. It came with about 3-4 scoops of ice cream. KONA COFFEE PIE: This delectable dessert was great! Especially me being a fan of coffee ice cream... the slice was huge and the consistency of the ice cream was perfect. TROPICAL ICE TEA: Just to warn you all this is unsweetened. However, on my second refill I asked for 1/2 raspberry ice tea + 1/2 tropical ice tea= an EXCELLENT combo... not too sweet not too bland I would definitely get the same for when I come back!

4ZQjW_46gFs6CGVgWNI3jA.text: Great food and great service!! Love the chicken katsu,the portion size is generous. We order to go a lot and our order is always correct, hot and ready to eat! Love this place and wouldn't go anywhere else for some good Hawaiian food

50ycGSm4x6YVFcyxMM0lYA.text: Went here twice in two weeks.  I have no idea why people like this place.  Sick both times from the food.  I guess compared to Aloha Kitchen or L&L they might be decent.  What is also bs is that the first time I did not get mac salad.  So the next time I ordered it as a side thinking this was an add on, but later find out that it was supposed to come with the meal.  Portion sizes are big?  Huge portion sizes of crap.  You do not have to be from Hawaii to rate this place as good or bad.  Apparently they are popular, but the food sucks.  Pork Loco Moco - Pork was dried out to the point of cardboard.  Gravy bland and tasteless.  Loco Moco - Whatever they used for the burger was the cheapest ground beef you will ever see.  Looked and tasted like ground up cat food.  Poke - What kind of Hawaiian serves pre-frozen cheap Ahi for poke?  Fried Rice - This was a joke, mushy rice with some sauce mixed in.  Even the egg and sausage didn't help.    Portuguese Bean Soup - Mediocre, tomato soup with too much flour, no smokiness, very disappointing.    Lau Lau - Dried out and tasteless, might as well get the same frozen one from L&L because it is cheaper.  SERVICE - "Oh my God this is great"

MYlHwEVTmhxu99eqxa-omw.text: Staff here are fantastic when they see me come i. They already know what i want and put in my order

WyPs4Zl8K15J7IQ9WYdtZg.text: I'd probably go with 3.5 stars instead of 3. This place is one of the better Hawaiian restaurants we have here in Vegas. When I lived on that side of town I would frequent often because of the thick and juicy Kalbi ribs and big portions. Now that I live further away I get their food delivered from roadrunner.com. My favorites are definitely the oxtail soup, although the flavor isn't consistent. Some days it can be the best oxtail soup I've ever had, and other days not as tasty. Again, they make my favorite Kalbi by far. Their spam musubis are great because they add Furikake to them. Their dessert portions are huuuuuge and delicious especially the guava and chantilly cake. The Kahlua Pork and the Roast pork are definitely not one of their better dishes. They both lack flavor that I come to expect from hawaiian food and a little on the dry side. Other than that, I really don't think you can leave this place hungry and anything on the menu. Oh and I forgot to mention, you can get brown rice instead of white. But we all know Hawaiian food always tastes much better with sticky white rice !

1t4vyPAo-dBGT6FhDsVUyA.text: Best place to grab Hawaiian food! I grew up in Hawaii and whenever I start to crave for Hawaiian food I stop here. Considering the fact this place is literally right down the street from where I live it's really convenient. I always get the loco moco or Kalua pork and it's always cooked to perfection! Definitely a returning customer.

Cq4skh3qcmD4CCygqgEwqw.text: This place was outstanding!!! For folks that think this place was kind of pricey, I would think again. The amount of food given for the price charged is more than generous. My family had the spam musubi, furikake chicken, chicken katsu, and mixed plate (kal bi and teriyaki chicken). I was especially happy that they had the fruit punch normally served in Hawaii. Again, definitely a bang for your buck and I appreciate it that they had a military discount. Thank you for supporting us. Only downfall (in general) is I wish this place was closer to where I live (Northwest LV). Thanks again for the great experience and excellent food.

vdL1QfJ4UJv1F08VdmM-Eg.text: I am originally from the Big Island.  Hilo to be specific.  I grew up with food like this and have been trying to find some type of local food in Las Vegas.  I've been to most "Hawaiian" food places in Las Vegas.  None that I have been to have got it as well as Island Flavor.    We ordered the Poke (Shoyu), My wife had the Kalua Pig and Cabbage and I had the Combo Korean Chicken and Kal Bi.  The portions were enormous.    Service was ok.  I don't go out to eat for service.  They make their money from the service they give or not.  So the service does not affect my score.

KCFXZuAJVRrPVEQgj6I7IQ.text: Super delicious food!!! Friendly staff.. My new favorite place. I love the furikake chicken and kalbi, per order is good for two person, just depends how you eat

2__Cn8n2ER6HHIfvzxtZ4A.text: It was me and my boyfriend's first time coming here, and let me say we will definintly be coming back. The service is fantastic, very friendly people. The enviroment makes you feel you're in Hawaii, it's very relaxing.   Now the food, wow. We had the Furikake Ahi Poke and it was delicious. The portions of the food is 2x bigger than we expected. One plate can feed two people. If it's your first time, I would suggest a mixed plate. But be wary, the place gets busy very often. So try and make a reservation if you can. 5 stars!

zHNuxZ3VC6I9WhBmZ1fCkQ.text: The staff: I wish I caught her name, she was incredibly friendly, especially towards the end.  It wasn't busy so I think she was actually the only server working.  But she was able to tend to our table and a few others, very efficient.  The goods: AMAZING.  I got the mixed plate with teriyaki chicken and furikake shrimp.  i was in heaven.  The meat was so tender and I could just pull it apart with my fork.  Sounds of food ecstasy kept coming from the other side of the table; my friend was really enjoying her meal as well.  And the portions were huge!  We ate a good amount and still had to get a to-go box for the rest of her Kalbi and my chicken.  The atmosphere: It reminded me so much of home.  They had satellite radio playing Hawaiian tunes; a very nice touch.  It wasn't done up all crazy, just a few pictures here and there, a wall fixture of the islands.  It had a very personal feel to it.  It reminded me of places we would eat when I was younger in Waianae; the same fading color scheme and plants, same kitchen layout.  It actually made me quite nostalgic.  After Aloha Grill closed down and Aloha Kitchen kind of went downhill, I thought my only hope for Hawaiian food would be the Marketstreet Cafe at the Cal, and I only go there for the saimin anyway.  But my "haole" friend as he refers to himself, instructed that it was CRUCIAL I check out Island Flavor.  I am so happy that I did.  Amazing food, and great quality for the price.  I was afraid it would be more on the pricy side because of other reviews, but that wasn't the case at all.  I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the bill. First experience there was brilliant, it definitely won't be my last.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate with teriyaki chicken and furikake shrimp. Heaven

qSzbUKTlKI0P4TZJy1IMRQ.text: The food is really good. Family owned business with authentic food. Their portion sizes are soooo huge!

Y4KZq6AV04TCQhLwvq0hsA.text: We consider Island Flavors on the top of the list of very good local (Hawaiian Asian Fusion) restaurants.  It always hits the spot when we're looking to eat good local comfort food.  We almost always order the kalbi ribs (barbecue short ribs) and the miso glazed opakapaka and they never disappoint.  Soo good!!  The portions are very generous but somehow we end up eating most everything on the plate.  They also have great desserts so make sure to go when you're extra hungry!

VL5P6H7Es_MsoL0zv3-hOg.text: We usually order take out because the seats aren't too comfortable. I like the kalbi short ribs and the teriyaki chicken. Each order comes with rice, macaroni salad and salad. Portion was big that we always have leftover.

jZVJRKRgQ396xDgTkwe4Ug.text: This is place is awesome. The price is reasonable considering the portion size of the meal. I'm 5'10" 210 lbs. and I'm getting full half way through my plate. Love the atmosphere,  down to earth. ... The food is great. ..

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. furikake poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. furikake chicken

9zdcvyHFGz1KRxqmrsRD3Q.text: I found out about this place through the shining recommendations of my Hawaiian friends. I can't quite agree with their praise, perhaps I'm missing out on some special Hawaiian taste buds, but the experience here is lackluster.   Strangely, the portion sizes were uncharacteristically average, the service was downright cold and bitter, and the food flavor wavered from tasteless to over-seasoned. The saimin had crisp ingredients, but it lacked flavor overall - the broth really was like water, and it was lukewarm. The poke had great fish quality, but it was so over-seasoned with onions and garlic that the quality of the ahi was obscured. The galbi was solid, but just that - good, and nothing more. The saving grace of the day was their perfect guava cake and chantilly cake - nice, generous sizes, and delicious layers of distinct flavor without being cloying.   Thanks to their amazing cakes, I will be rounding the 2.5 stars to a 3. But it's a close call - the service is in serious need of help. We were not greeted by anyone upon entering. The waitress was curt, not very accommodating, and very impatient, and the only warmth I ever saw from her was with the delivery of the check. Pre-tip, that is. While I can't know what she was thinking then, that always makes me suspicious, particularly when the service was so lacking for the rest of the time... And for such a casual, laid-back place, especially a Hawaiian place, the service (and saimin!) should be at the very least warm.

qo2-vO8FotHEdT2Y1MLj-g.text: Thought I've already written a review for this place! I eat here at least once a week if not several times and it has been amazing every time. This is some of the best Hawaiian food I've had in vegas better than aloha kitchen and L&L for sure! Their quality of meat is good hardly any fat or just bone which I get a lot of at aloha kitchen. Ever since I found this place this is where I go for Hawaiian food every time. Their customer service is good too I've never actually ate in the restaurant only Togo but the one time there was something wrong with my order they remade it no questions asked and even let me keep what I already had. Their portions are pretty big the loco moco is bombbbbbb and so is their fried rice!

CVz_j7CVBus3bDimUDN5eA.text: repeatedly order the chicken katsu loco moco.  last time, eggs were overdone, not enough gravy.  But, I didn't send back as I was hungry.   poke' is good.   they were slow to my order and serve (sat next to the cashier), but very quick to collect bill paid.    - food 4 stars - service - 3

labjgI38cLmTMgzQtM5MLg.text: This is my favorite Hawaiian spot. There food is delicious and the service is very friendly. Love the Khalua Pork, Furikake Chicken, Katsu Chicken, loco moco, pork roast, Teri steak, haha I love it all! Get a spam musubi just for starters.

oDPk8v59NfwtoFt_EFDfjg.text: The best Hawaiian restaurant in Las Vegas, hands down! Each time never disappoints, no matter what I order. Normally I order the Ox Tail Soup served with rice. Occasionally, I'll switch it up with a Mix Plate that allows you to choose two different meats. I stick with Teri Chicken, Kalbi Short Ribs, or Chicken Katsu, although there are several other options as well.   The staff is extremely friendly and never in a bad mood; always a plus. Definitely one to check out.

xFk-8uuq_IUEsDYNHsqslw.text: Found this incredible local restaurant on Yelp and come back every time I'm in Vegas.   Hubby loves their oxtail soup and their Kalbi plate and macaroni salad is my fav. Don't miss out, Island Flavor is worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Plate with brown rice and macaroni salad
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup

MxgsTcQKQFWwPBl-CWpDdA.text: This place is in Rhodes Ranch or on Durango a couple miles south of Warm Springs on the East side of Durango.  Had the fried chicken.  Came with a scoop of mac salad and two scoops of rice.  The chicken was perfectly cooked.  Got a wing, drumstick, thigh and breast.  All was tender especially the breast.  I expected the coating to be sweeter but it tasted great anyway.  Everyone in my group loved their food.  Poke was excellent.    They serve a lot of food so prepare to take some home.  Oh, heard the cakes are great.  Heard they are made by the cake store in the same shopping center.  So, take some leftovers home and enjoy the cake.

-Op0Dq2RVGi-jrByE5bM6A.text: Not much more needs to be said. This is some of the best plate lunch I've had on the mainland and I think the quality is better than Ross J's however for local kind breakfast I still prefer Island sushi if you're near 215/eastern. For lunch though I think Island flavor has them all beat!

kfAjIpNfj2Y-LwOTTmDfpQ.text: Served with rice or mashed potatoes and macaroni or tossed salad include beef or chicken teriyaki, chop steak and onions, kalbi short ribs yummy, hawaiian style pork roast with hawaiian salt and cracked black pepper. Yummy Boil or sauteed opakapaka 9snapper0 Kalua pig and cabbage, 12oz  ribeye and loco moco, a half pound hamburger patty on rice but i like ground beef but only patty on rice topped with eggs and gravy.

fyp1rrAZtxjd9rWqnD95WA.text: We used our restaurant.com certificate here and I gotta say I would come back even without the coupon. We're from California where there's plenty of Hawaiian joints including L&L and we gotta say this place is awesome. Of all the Hawaiian places we've eaten including those in Hawaii, this has been the best so far. The Korean chicken and the shrimp were our favorites. Mac salad was not our favorite but Hawaiian food is not all about mac salad. The restaurant was very clean and our waitress was awesome. I wish we have a place like this in San Jose.

xWECt4Dz90JXGIArZKFY1w.text: We were visiting LV for a week on a movie shoot and I heard great reviews about this place so we decided to give it a try. I was raised in Hawaii, am half Haw'n and my mother was a caterer and an awesome cook so naturally I became a caterer too. After the 1st meal here, I was sold and so was the other 4 people with me. During the week we tried to make it there everyday, but filming a couple of long days kept us away. We all tried different things and I got to try various dishes and they were all great. The sauces were not to over powering, but just right. Even the desserts are amazing. I wish there was one of these in San Diego or Arizona. I met the owner and he is like ohana (family). Awesome...awesome....awesome.

eyT1IdwQSkqkXW9TiJAZzQ.text: LOVE! LOVE! Island Flavor. All the food is GREAT! The service is excellent! They make you feel like family. I bring all my friends and family there and I tell everyone if they are in the mood for hawaiian this is the spot!

UIHr63ip-4zYK9xlpDk5EA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  The service is good although sometimes that I have been here i waited longer than usual but it was all worth it.  The food is good and they give you huge portions and best of all it is cheap.

ZGgCQ5yNkeKO6VteZJ4jVQ.text: The Bkgd - Tired of usual food options..so thanks to yelp arrived here... The Point - Good, simple, heavy, large potion food =) A perfect fix for lunch & leftovers for dinner. Nice friendly/chill ppl along w/ nice music. ~The Order~ Hawaiian Plate - $9.75 * Homemade Lau lau, 2 scoops rice, ahi poke, salmon, haupia & mac salad. Take that! * Real good portions and a nice mix of food. The Poke & salmon was my fav. * The Lau lau (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La...) had pork I think & fish? was good portions a bit dry but still good. *And so was the desert thingy..(en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ha...) i usually don't like coconut..but my taste buds made an exceptions because I finished it all. * Perfect leftovers Mixed Plate of Shrimp & Teriyaki Chicken ~ $9.75 * BF got ~ 5 fried shrimp & ~5 chicken thighs w/ yummy sauce * he can eat and he still had leftovers Overall reminded me of a local place my friend's family took us in honolulu...but here Def. will be back to try to ribs & Ox Tail next time....

NIgW7K2oSF-Si2JKOUMcoQ.text: Island Flavor really is a great find for my Hubby (who is Hawaiian) and me!  The food here is as authentic as it can get without flying to Hawaii :)  We'll have to try their menu slowly since we have to share one item each time because the portions are just Humongous! Love love love  the Chicken Katsu Moco :)

x-wyhm5C3LHQhqzE-QiYUg.text: Wow - some of the best Hawaiian BBQ I have had in some time.  This is not near the strip and we were only here because my daughter had a friend move to a house within a few miles.  A mini mall location, but the food is amazing.  The loco moco came in a soup bowl made for a table for 10!  I had the Korean Fried Chicken - small drums and wings in an amazing sauce.  I swapped the regular rice for fried rice for $2.00 and it may have been the best Hawaiian BBQ fried rice I have ever had.  They obviously make their own BBQ pork (char siu) because the mountain of fried rice had some nice juicy pieces.  It was a flashback to some Sam Choy fried rice where they prop the bacon up on the sides!  I had some of my wife's lomi salmon (great) and the poke (amazingly fresh big chunks of tuna).  If I lived in Vegas, I would travel 20+ minutes to eat here!  Lots of to go orders so this place is not a secret.  Friendly in that island way with good service (even when crowded).  Food takes some time to get our of the kitchen but well worth it.

g8Zm3SDWAXZdZxfmA9zn2g.text: island style portions for my rhino appetite. i would rate this place for having the best hawaiian food in lv.

Gm05cXT4wMPr6w8ARPXeFw.text: This is now my go-to Hawaiian place. I have tried the loco moco, the katsu loco moco, the ahi poke furikake style, short ribs, and the kalua pig and cabbage. All are better than what I've had at L&L BBQ or Aloha Kitchen and the portions are triple what you get at the other places. Great Service as well.

jcu1fRwgd3PEsjJIBxH3Sg.text: best Hawaiian food in Vegas period. everything on the menu is delicious, but if you're going there for the first time I recommend that you get the combo plate so that you can try multiple things at once. if you have room for dessert their Kona cake... wow.  they also sell spam musubi and banana bread at the counter. grab those when you can because they sell out quick! in addition to the food very friendly service. it's definitely a must try. you won't regret it.

CdW7gr4KWdouFEatnBij-Q.text: i went to this place from a suggestion from a friend of mine.  The hours has changed so please be mindful of the new hours of operation.    i went their for lunch since i'm from hawaii I'm always looking for a good place where they have hawaiian food.    I have to say this place does not live up to the hype of my friends and everyone I asked about this place.  i ordered the mix plate where you can choose 2 main item from a list so I picked teri chicken and roast pork  which is a basic item for hawaiian restaurants.  First their menu is very limited, they didn't even have spam musubi.. anyways.  when they food came out it looked good. Nice big portions just like my firend said.  but when i started eating  the gravy was turkey gravy and not pork gravy.  the mac salad was too sweet in my opinion.  although the chicken was cooked perfectly, there was too much sauce on it and ruined the chicken..  the rice was over cooked and mushy.  i didn't want to anymore of that so I ordered the saimin.  which is another staple of hawaiian food.  when it came out it looked very nice.  it had wontons, fish cakes, bok choy, teri beef, scrambled egg.  but again when i tasted it i was very disappointed.  the soup was a instant soup bases.  the noodle was s&s saimin.  i asked for chinese hot mustard so I can dip the wontons in it.  what came out was wasabi and shoyu already mixed together.  right then and there i lost my appetite.  the saimin is not worth the $8.75  you can't have mustard with your saimin.  Oh!! they don't even have Aloha Shoyu..  I would really like to see this restaurant do good but they have to change their flavors and stop advertising like they have hawaiian pride when the flavor of the food clearly states otherwise....

LW-9X08lIi6WBRsqKUI4vw.text: We loved this place, I had the shoyu chicken and my husband had beef ribs both dishes were onolicious, very large portionsand the poke was winnas, .  We will be back in April to try the desserts.

BhdcnV2wW48mOMpgDGqG3Q.text: real ono, noka'oi hawaiian food in vegas...!! good portions, price, atmosphere, and real hawaiian cooking in the kitchen!!!

L0MGk-civydJQkBLODRSog.text: Imma keep is short and simple. This place rocks. Best hawaii cuisine in Las Vegas. Period.

Au5gOZI0yJt0p9JQCPkWfQ.text: Comparing this place to the other hawaiian places on this side of town, this one is by far the best in the west. (Ross J's is best in the east). The portions are large and the choices are many. I have a few friends that are familiar with True hawaiian cuisine and this place is their favorite.   I typically have the mix plate which gives you the opportunity to try the teriyaki, short ribs, chicken katsu, spicy korean chicken........etc. All the meat choices have been fantastic.   I have gone there for breakfast a couple times and the french toast and loco moco are tremendous.

cG9BRm4J-QqlduSkhTjtOQ.text: I had the hawaiian platter with lau lau, lomi lomi and haupia.  I liked the flavor on all three, but the pork in the lau lau was salty.  I did like how the pork was nice and tender though.  Nothing like the fatty pork in Hawaii, but well done for what they have to work with.  They do serve big hawaiian sizes so there was a lot of pork compared to the luau leaves.  The haupia was comfortingly good.  We also had their Portuguese bean soup.  While it isn't like my mom's (my mom's is still the best), it is pretty good.  There is a slight spiciness to it (I didn't notice it at first, but my son did).    We will definitely be heading back to try more.  Yum!

by0HfIeGrAGZCcKsWiXHKQ.text: Took my 7 year old to Island Flavor after picking him up from school yesterday. Overall have to say I was pleased. Having been in Vegas for ten years, I've seen 'local' food places come and go, and I hope this place sticks around awhile. Friendly island folks in the front of the house AND the kitchen (which is a rarity). Had the sweet & sour spare ribs off the daily specials menu. Didn't know what to expect, but first bite left me nodding in approval. Son liked the mini chicken katsu plate he ordered. Mac salad was good as well. We both shared an order of the coconut-pineapple ice cream, served with whip cream. Will definitely be back even if it is a bit of a drive from Summerlin.

3C2tASoXQlOUS87kVT3bBA.text: Authentic Hawaiian food. Style, flavor and gargantuan portions will take you back to the islands.   *Korean style chicken wings - crispy, sweet and spicy. Very nice.  * Kalbi - big portions and nice flavor.   * Teriyaki beef - good flavor on tender pieces of beef.Perfect with rice.  * House salad - super good dressing!!!!!  *MAC salad - tasty; it's coma time!!!!!!  *Oxtail Soup - If you're in the mood to slurp. Go for it. Fall of the bone goodness.   Places like this will always be a crowd favorite due to the excellent value for your money. To the owners of Island Flavor...I love this place. Keep serving it up.

O9MRbvdRyGgLMSbp5Xus8A.text: So Ono!! It's weird that you have to go Vegas to get the best Hawaiian food. The service is always amazing. When your there you feel like your eating in Hawaii. Come with an appetite because you will be stuffed because the serving sizes are huge. But no complaints here. If you have room for desert order anything. They are all good but my favorite is the Haupia cake. At first I didn't wanna go but I'm sure glad I gave it a try.

Ujh8CVbUBJ3ZzwOi0biy8w.text: This place has all the local dishes just like back home and their portions are definitely generous! I ordered a local staple, Loco Moco. It was just as good as anything I've eaten back home. I judge Loco Moco by the quality of the brown gravy. Their gravy was the consistency just how I like it, not too thick and not like soup. I ordered my eggs over easy and it was cooked to perfection. As easy as it may sound, many times eggs aren't cooked as actually ordered. I look forward to returning and ordering their kalua pork and cabbage, another local staple. The service was friendly and I recommend this place to try

xhQNHE1GHe50o4xZ_CIGHw.text: As I opened the door, a wave of sound exploded in my face unexpectedly. I have never been here before so I didn't think that such a small place can have a live band playing. How awesome is that?! I always wanted to try this place because: 1. It's right around my area, 2. I heard a scrumptious amount of pleasant reviews on the food here, and 3. It's Hawaiian food dude! Unfortunately I could not stay and eat inside the restaurant, but I did get to experience the ambience of the atmosphere while I was waiting for my order that I made to-go.   First thing that caught my eye that made me happy was the size of the portions of the food when I looked around at people's plate. Second thing was that I could order a mix of the two entree! The menu also gave an option for brown rice too, hellyeah. There were other healthier options too in replacement of the macaroni salad, but that is too good to replace. So when I got my order, I bolted over to my friends house and opened my treasure box of satiation. The portion size, good. I like it. I can eat a whole cow and maybe half a horse, yeah it's kind of a curse sometimes. So I got the chicken katsu and half with the chicken teriyaki. I didn't expect the brown rice to be more of a mushy texture, but I didn't really mind it. It went well with the food in my opinion. The chicken was good, chicken teriyaki was good, and the macaroni salad, too good. I also ate the remaining 1/4 of my girlfriend's food cause she didn't finish it. It also came with a sauce; I think it was for the teriyaki but I just used it for everything lol.. It tastes good so why not.   As for the first impression if trying this place, I regret not getting the loco moco to try but there will definitely be a second time.

LVj7zxFIu_OwKqzySB1N6w.text: I guess for a place with so many 5 star reviews I was expecting to be blown away and definitely wasn't. The Loco Moco was fine but I've had better. I've never had Chantilly cake before and it was ok too but not anything I am dying to have again. Overall everything was GOOD but absolutely not GREAT. Much better than the horrible Hawaiian place in the Vons shopping center but not 5 stars. 3 stars for a very adequate experience but I need quite a bit more for a 5 star review. Sorry.

RNcK0oy9j7lVqTz-3HVpgA.text: Awesome place to eat! I highly recommend coming here with your friends and family. I live all the way down in the east side and its worth the drive. I usually get the chicken katsu, my favorite.

_G0IAJh9DTJTa5dpYBZTzA.text: I can't say I have ever tried big island Hawaiian food but decided to do so while looking for something different over the casino buffets and Asian offerings in Vegas Chinatown (or Asian strip malls) - and what a great place.  Great Hawaiian welcome, service, food, and greater portions.  Ordered the Kalbi short ribs and it was delicious.  My boys (about 8 of us) were also all happy with their selections, service, and portions!

kzmm3IrgoWf_plU9W_W6sg.text: I should order something else other than the Terriyaki Chicken. I can't help it, I really like the taste. Oh, and if the Opakapaka fish is available (seasonal), try it! Like most fish, it's expensive, but it's my favorite. And yes, big portions.

Czhw8QZRUr9HWPwk4wO7bw.text: Came here again the day after I visited Island Flavor for the first time.  Had the kalua pork and cabbage -- great!  However, the topper was the chantilly cake!!!!  SO GOOD.  4 layer chocolate cake with cream filling and a butterscotchy icing reminiscent of the icing for German chocolate cake....swoon.  Drool.

piOSI_F9z7vRFZKUImcg8w.text: My 4th week in a row coming here and can't get enough of it. The Hawaiian plate is off the hook!!!
