Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chop Steak &amp; BBQ Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Plate

nQC9bcpli3IsnmCmSXiodg.text: Best Hawaiian restaurant in Vegas, hands down! Portions are ginormous! Furikake shrimp is a must. Poke appetizer is to die for and you get such a generous serving for the price!

EaXImnGenHUsga6HIeegUQ.text: Terrible service. We waited 50 minutes to be seated then the waitress was rudeeeeee.  Just so you know we did not wait that long because there were no seats. We waited that long because the did not call our name on the waiting list. I'm sorry but bad service makes all food taste bad.

j1XWy7bDdxFxQM8KecfVRQ.text: I was supposed to go to another "Island" place but ended up coming here and boy....that was meant to be!!!  My son and I sat at the counter area and the sistah server was so warm and nice and I felt like I was home.   I was not sure what to get but she helped me decide and I made a great decision!!!  I had to get my fave-anywhere I go I always get BEEF TERIYAKI.  I had to try the POKE....three types to choose from and sistah helped me choose the shoyu type.   YUM! YUM! YUM! YUM!  My son chose CHICKEN TERIYAKI and he loved it, also.  Not only did it taste good but  the portions were "Man-size!"  We were not able to finish...which is fine so I have a meal for the next day.   My son still was craving some GREEN TEA ice cream and when the bowl came....it was a giant portion.  We are used to getting one scoop when we go to sushi places.    This place will be one of my favorite places to go to from now on.  I still need to try their OXTAIL SOUP....then I will have to update my review.

jJhdpq4kIYwYZOr_24uCjw.text: Best Hawaiian restaurant in Las Vegas. Hands down.

slzP4d3xBHXbsqNvgJK1Pg.text: As others have mentioned this review is long overdue!    Hubby and I have been here several times and it is one of the friendliest restaurants I have ever been to - the service is amazing and you feel like you are your server's only customers even though everytime we have been there the place is rockin' and packed!    Unfortunately I tried L&L before coming here and that experience almost made me not try this wonderful little gem in the southwest.  I know... lumping L&L to all Hawaiian restaurants would be like comparing McDonalds to In-n-Out - my mistake :)  I love the traditional Loco Moco - the gravy is like a culinary orgasm and the eggs are always cooked perfectly!  The hamburger patty is always moist and juicy and the seasoning is perfect too!  It is mind blowing...  Plus they provide so much food (with a side of the best mac salad I've ever had) each time I have had to take over half home with me (and it is just as amazing the next day!)  Hubby gets something different each and every time and he has always been very pleased (and too busy mmmmming to talk much during our meals there!)  Make sure you grab some of their amazing banana nut bread when you are leaving - you will be way too full to have some during your visit...  I was thinking while I was writing this that I should keep my mouth shut and not share my experience - this restaurant may be even more crowded my next visit and when Loco Moco is calling my name - I do not want to wait any longer than absolutely necessary!

V-5WQXYczPszkcdNSsyU5A.text: This place is definitely a good chowdown place (although in general, Hawaiian places tend to be chowdown places).  When you come here, it is not a fine dining experience. I mean, this is grubbing, stick-to-your-ribs, need-to-wear-pants-with-elastic-band-before-coming kind of food.  There are a couple of things are worth mentioning.   The salads - most notably the fried poke and teriyaki chicken salad are excellent. It's hard to get tuna cooked right - meaty, tender red on the inside, seared perfectly on the outside. Those luscious cubes of fish really made this dish shine. Grilled teriyaki chicken thighs had a nice char on the outside without making it too dry. Perfection. Served on a bed of romaine with a side of tomato, cucumber, purple sweet potato  and fried wonton chips- this salad is not a light affair with its creamy sesame dressing. Normally, I order this salad with the dressing on the side and leave most of the chips next to it.  Chicken katsu was crispy on the outside, moist on the inside. The amount given is rather astounding - 3 fillets served with scoops of rice and macaroni salad. (One of our friends who loves to eat very light, was addicted to the macaroni salad. It was like watching a crack addict after a long period of abstinence.)  Steak and onions were packed with flavour. The steak was juicy and perfectly cooked to a medium to medium rare.  The only thing I didn't find that appetizing was their roasted pork dish. The gravy was overwhelming although the pork did have a nice flavour to it. If it wasn't for the gravy, the dish would have been infinitely better.  Portions are really big - bring friends. I'm serious. 3 dishes could easily feed 4 really hungry people or 5 not-so-hungry people.

vTxqfKbFYM5jRNZJu9lJoA.text: My fav Hawaiian barbeque on this side of town! The BBQ mix plate is amazing...each item has distinct flavor and marination. This meal usually lasts me for 2-3 meals, because they provide so much food.  The staff is friendly and accomodating. The atmosphere is similar to other Hawaiian BBQ places, but the food is pretty incredible.

z7J0qH6EMcLRuO-voeQ94w.text: Great service and HUGE bomb portions  a must try. My island girls recommended me here.

YXiCjzP2_j-e24qPTIZ8FA.text: Food was delicious. Service was good but they could be a little more friendly. Prices weren't that bad.

75BS-Gu40y7wjm_sOgZNiw.text: This is the place I go when I'm craving Hawaiian food. It's a nice little mom and pop place that gets packed pretty quickly. I've introduced this place to a lot of my friends and everyone loved it. In fact, I took one friend here about 2 years ago and she came to visit recently and still remembered this place and wanted to eat here again. Service is good most of the time but can be inconsistent at times. I love getting the mix plate whenever I'm here. The ox tail soup is pretty good too but I can't justify ordering it and mix plate without having to share it with a friend or two because the portions are huge.

xeFfy5cBaSrKM2XYAERTiw.text: I love the food here! Service is not the best. I've had serval bad services from here, but the food is always fantastic. Tyler, the server, wasn't attentive and very forgetful. Didn't get our drinks til we asked for it 10 minutes later. Always wanted to charge for something. I wanted my cabbage on the side instead of having it under my chicken and charged me for kimichi cabbage AND when the food came out.. it wasn't correct. No refills. Took my food to go and wanted a sauce for my chicken and again, was going to charge me and insisted I got the sauce barely left over in my sauce ramekin. Will be finding a new Hawaiian place. I drive here for 40 minutes or more, but the service is always bad. Not worth the drive anymore. I use to recommend this place to everyone. Too pushy on the upcharges, doesn't feel like home or welcoming. Straight business now. Chef that responded is very rude and immature.

BmeTBJM1JGjPd7402S7Zjg.text: I've been coming to Island Flavor ever since they opened and gave it a 5 star review on Yelp under the previous ownership. I ate there again today for the first time since the new owners made changes to the restaurant.   First thing I noticed when I walked into the restaurant was the plain gray walls with no pictures on them. There were  3 TVs showing pictures of food. There was music playing but it was generic hawaiian music. Knowing the atmosphere of the previous ownership, the new decor seemed cold and generic. They got rid of the market and expanded the seating are which I felt was a plus.    The food portions are noticeably smaller than the previous ownership and the new ownership seemed like it removed some items from the menu. I was disappointed as my daughter was told they didn't have any Hawaiian Sun POG.Hawaiian Sun is on the menu but I didn't know if they were all out or they didn't carry that flavor anymore. They were also out of Arizona Tea.  The quality of the food appears to be the same.   I gave them 3 stars because Island Flavor seems to have lost some of the little things that made it feel like being back home in Hawaii and because of the noticeably smaller portions. Hopefully the food quality doesn't change because right now that is the only thing that has stayed the same from previous ownership. I want even going to try the Poke under the new ownership since the new owner couldn't pronounce it correctly in a video I watched after the new ownership introduced themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New decor
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New smaller portion mixed plate

NwMo6798fy7nA2nx1QmwdA.text: This place is amazing THE OWNER ALLY IS THE SWEETEST PERSON! Many more blessings on your beautiful island Flavor location! Tha food was bomb 5 star! Customer service was 5 star! Just like home (HAWAII)!! we will definitely return on our next visit

Ij42bVxXY75CdFINA8NB1A.text: We were so impressed with this place!  It came highly recommended by one of our friends.  The food portions are huge and the service was amazing!  You won't be disappointed!    Don't forget to order dessert...guava, haupia or chantilly cake!!!

gEufIa9B1PIAcnY9vx2TFQ.text: We have been going to island flavor for the past 10 years everything is the same everything on the menu is the same and everything tastes the same also a lot of new items which is a plus they renovated the place for a bigger crowd you will not be disappointed it is probably the most legit Hawaiian food in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 item mixed plate

0xerHVmHCnD0cqXpZpQHtw.text: Not as good as it used to be. Portions are smaller and taste different. We got the roast pork and it was mostly fat.. usually we get a bunch of meat with the pepper crust but not anymore. Also the salad they charge extra for is not worth it.

sy4pWY7zdsKXghny3FhcWw.text: Furekake chicken is the bomb!!! And kalbi ofcourse! Love the place it newly renovated.. the servings are huge!!! It almost never that we dont have a to go box, not because the food is not good, but the servings is really big.. love the staff..

YMUo4ADpvxUibJpuV7l4zA.text: I got the pork adobo as part of a Monday special they were having. The flavor was so rich and delicious I am definitely getting it again. We also got the furifake chicken which was delicious, as well as the Hawaiian style poke! Definitely coming back and recommending to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork adobo, furikake chicken

Btx4bAoBG2hour8EYedrWA.text: Big portions and great food. I had the Korean chicken plate and Haupia ice cream cake. I would definitely recommend. Just make sure you have plenty of time to dine it gets pretty busy.

MDkw9Kn-Fz8hJGtkZXSo0Q.text: Gigantic portions that you can easily eat for dinner later. I ordered the teriyaki chicken salad which came with freshly fried wonton strips, tomatoes, small slices of purple potato and cucumber.   I liked my salad and if you ignore the strips and use the dressing sparingly, it can be quite healthy!  I want to come back to try their Kailua pork, furikake shrimp and more.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki Chicken Salad

1me-xDG5TEjz43yQUT0zMQ.text: Don't waste your time on the malasadas! They are tiny, not fluffy at all and filling was dull. I paid $5 and some change hoping it would be as good as the pictures and reviews but sadly disappointed. If you want good malasadas, go to Island sushi on Eastern! Worth the drive and cheaper too!   The hype was NOT real

ZTzXyfEm0iDJSlX45qUtAQ.text: This is the best Hawaiian food we have had in vegas! We have had multiple things on two different occasions and all was delicious. The Mac salad is really good too. It is far from where we live so we don't get to go as often as we would like but we're told they will be making one in the NW sometime. The location is really clean and staff is friendly.   The only thing about this visit is that we ordered the avocado fries as a appetizer and received it close to when we were done eating so we only tried one each and had to take the rest. Not sure how well it will be reheated.

4F-ZMioCExjgAIi0yR8Xmg.text: This place is a piece of heaven! The food is sooo good! Serving is big and my kids loved it here too. I highly recommend this place, specially if your hungry, you will definitely leave so full.. Great costumer service too.. Two thumbs up! We will definitely be here often now.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taste of everything  YUM!

nlRY8UMoccIL2zqD0QJ6iQ.text: I ordered chicken teriyaki to go and they gave me chicken katsu!i ordered 5 plates and one of them wrong! I called and the supervisor Kehal? said that  she will call me back. Never got my number and hung up! So different frm the old management/owners. We used to love going to this place but now no

qEUJqrpBMEjusquU64vIHw.text: Been here several times the kalbi ribs and the teriyaki steak is amazing as usual. Tried the poke today and it was so fresh that it melts in your mouth. Took a while for the food to come out but it was worth it. Will come back soon!

UA9lA959Sk2lAV295gUMYw.text: IT IS NOT OK TO HAVE YOUR ORDER TAKEN AFTER 20 MINUTES OF BEING SEATED. AND IT IS NOT OK TO WAIT AN HOUR AND 15 MINUTES TO GET YOUR FOOD!!!!!!   YES YOU READ THAT RIGHT, 20 MINUTES TO GET YOUR ORDER TAKEN AFTER BEING SEATED AND ANOTHER HOUR AND 15 MINUTES FOR THE FOOD TO ARRIVE.   I was the last in my group of 4 to get my food but even the first person in our group to get their plate still took over an hour! This is unacceptable!!!  I think we witnessed one table even walk out of the restaurant. Sad part is by the time we got seated, only half of the tables in the restaurants were occupied so I don't understand how the heck this happened.  I will never recommend this place to anybody anymore and you guys have lost me as a customer.

SXtFsM_4TKpKtITsGF1Rpg.text: Do not order from their online ordering website by chow now. It's a big joke. So you go to order online and will receive an email that your food will be ready for pick up in about 40 mins. When you go to pick up your food they have no idea about your online order and will start making the food right then which will take about another 40 mins. So what was the whole point of the ease of ordering online on their website? You're just gonna be disappointed when you get there to pick up your food and it's not ready.

qXJ2dDXP-9W2g2fia1yrAA.text: Awseme staff! Great atmosphere. Large portions. More that your money's worth. My first visit, Edna & Kahua made us feel like we've been coming forever. Food taste great.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s Loco Moco!

3bUKAPx50L1i0xLTUNV2Pw.text: JoAnn m.                                     5/7/19  Good food and friendly service  You have to give them a try when you come to Las Vegas !!!

psdyWhqLKzcEFLVPbRVwlA.text: Customer service was great! Order to go.. first timer and the food was okay! I don't know what the hype was about but not all that! It smell good but short ribs were under cook which made it very hard to chew due to it being raw the specialty chicken was whatever nothing I would want I rather have orange chicken from panda lol the macaroni salads was delicious! Customer service and macaroni salad 2 stars!

sFBHtzUlLduGX8r-7ql2og.text: Best Hawaiian food! It's so authentic and the vibe and music makes you feel as if you are on the island.

kFYKEHW44OI4C5ytymCttw.text: Like others have stated, this is the best place to get your Hawaiian fix. Although I haven't been to Hawaii yet, I was told that it's the closest you'll get on the 9th island.  Portions are massive here. So massive that even an appetizer can get you full (well for me it can)- but even that wouldn't stop me from over ordering every time I'm here. The Tuna Poke with Furikake is AMAZING so be sure to start every meal with that, the entrees are all good (I always tend to get the mixed plate with Steak & Onions and Kalbi Ribs- also comes with a side of rice and Mac salad) while the boyfriend feasts on his Loco Moco with sunny side up eggs and a side of Spam Musubi since this place makes it the best according to him.   I'll admit that I haven't ventured out to try new things since I'm always craving that one thing every time I visit, but I'm sure it's all good nonetheless. The reason I knocked down a star is that I used to be OBSESSED with their Haupia (coconut) Cake only to find out that it doesn't taste the same; perhaps a change in bakeries I guess. To what was once creamy, light and fluffy now tastes overly rich, gelly (with a lot of gelatin substances) and heavy.   The hospitality is amazing here too. Everyone do love spreading the "aloha" around to make you feel like you're at home, or that you've known them forever.

Jfc0qm8lxI3_Er0nHkqpLg.text: I love this place!!  My only complaint about this place, they don't have a location in Houston.  The place is laid back, portions are stupid big, and the food is excellent.  If you are in Las Vegas and think the strip is the end all for food, you are dead wrong.  Make a trip out to this place, you will not de disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi

CP3X9AJ-Wbaz3bmacb1mcg.text: OMG the best Hawaiian food ever! The portions are huge and the flavors are strong. I usually get the mixed plate with Teriyaki Steak and Furikake Chicken. The wait can be long and the service slow but the food makes up for it.

HPPcWugSfdNnfY9vTYPCdA.text: YESSSSS. Must have while in Vegas, but no offense to Aloha Kitchen.   Portions are huge. Packed with flavor. Prices are great considering what you're getting and how much. Authentic Hawaiian family atmosphere.   I've gone here twice already and was never disappointed with the food. A friend and I shared the Mixed Plate with Kalbi short ribs and Furikake chicken: WOW. Seriously.   Any plate can be split between two people or you can take a little bit of Hawaii home with you. And the dessert! I think it's called the lava cake...anyway, it's stacked! Must have and share. Even their green tea ice cream is yummy.  My last visit was on Sunday, March 1. For whatever reason, when we first walked in, it was hot and stuffy in the restaurant. While waiting for a table to become available, I actually had to step outside to catch a breather, but when we actually sat down, the temperature dropped and I got cold. When I went to wash my hands in the women's restroom, I felt like I needed my jacket whereas my guy friends said it was like a sauna in the guys' bathroom. Weird.   DO NOT LET THIS HINDER YOU FROM COMING IN. You're there for the food remember?  DEFINITELY COMING BACK.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate: Kalbi Short Rib and Furikake Chicken

GoqVWQu6rUfvSH-FLDJH9A.text: Been going here for years since it's down the street. But the food has been a little inconsistent. My little brother's furikake chicken had some raw pieces, and the portions are significant smaller while the prices have gone up. It used to be five kalbi pieces, now they give three. I'll probably still go here because it's close, but will probably start trying the newer establishments. Heard there is no management, which probably contributed to the change in portion and size.

uq-gE_Nfxbe1qtaYAVXD8A.text: ISLAND FLAVOR, you have my heart!  Large portions of authentic Hawaiian food. Words can't describe how ono this place is!  If you're in Las Vegas and don't make time to swing by, you're seriously missing out!

he-GJ_RwPabk3G8nPJVUJA.text: Absolutely fantastic food!!! The avocado poke is delicious and hubbs loved his food too.

KKlwxaN2Q-CABYjGoyIeuA.text: Parties of 6 or more BEWARE!!!**  I have eaten here many times with co-workers and have always enjoyed the food.  I brought my family (party of 6) and ate, then paid the bill and left.  It wasn't until the next day that I noticed that they had put an 18% automatic gratuity on my check...the waitress didn't point it out to me when she brought me the check, and I even had problems with the machine so had to try to put it in multiple times while she stood there and still no comment about the added gratuity.  My fault for not looking first, but I am very rarely charged an automatic gratuity for 6 people and I would know because we eat out quite a bit.  So I ended up paying a 40% tip - sorry, the service is not that great.  I had forgotten my credit card so went back the next day to get it and when I brought it up they said there wasn't anything they could do about it since the bill had already been run the previous day.  Not cool.  Now I'm not sure if I'll go back, the food is good but the experience leaves a sour taste.

JiVD7fbm8k_RHFnS7OU3QA.text: The food was very good. We ordered the short ribs, pork and teriyaki beef. The quality of the meat is outstanding. The Portuguese bean soup was also very good. Service was fast, the place was clean. Food is very cheap compared to its quality. Would definitely go back.

l6__hE8MCitIbioDB-qD8Q.text: One of the best off-island Hawaiian places Ive been to!! Service to Food was absolutely amazing :)  You wont regret your visit!!

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco

V_ph0qnPMWFCuicvGYgGnA.text: Best Hangover Saimin ever !! Not to mention service was awesome! I also had the mix plate : furukaki chix and kalbi ribs which was also very good !  I've been to a lot of Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas but Island Flavor is by far the best one !

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saimin

uiHv9520brM6YDoD5qoxOQ.text: Our usual brunch spot was too long of a wait. So husband and I tried this new spot. I ordered my brunch favorite the loco Moco and he got the Katsu loco Moco.  Both pretty good. Lots of rice tho! The ratio of rice was too great for me, but the handmade party tasted delicious. The Chicken Katsu was also a new take on the loco Moco, husband liked it.  Kona coffee is amazing and it comes with free refills! Delicious. Must take advantage.   We also ordered a side of macaroni salad. There is something about Hawaiian macaroni salad that trumps the store brands ones. We can't place it, but the one they have here are definitely a must-try!

6gSa3CrlILc46mp48Yo2cw.text: We used to come here often. Food not so great and service went down hill. Disappointed.

vNdBzw76j2arz-OoyIpumA.text: This place is hands down the best Hawaiian food in town. I have eaten at many other locations and this one has them all beat.  We come here a couple of times a month minimum since moving on this side of town.  The prices are very decent as well and the portions are huge.   Keep up the good work.  -Brian (Vegas native)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Hawaiian in town!

gd5NhIdHYArOdt5XZFmPPA.text: We haven't been back ever since my "Kanak Attack" UYE, so we decided to pay another visit for some onolicious grindz. "Wow! the counter space is gone, place looks more open" I told wifey...Aunty behind the register says "Yeah, Small Kine, Small Kine"...meaning yes, we made a few changes and the place looks a little different. Just love it when I hear local transplants talking pidgin to da max(NOT the bird!) and KCCN is playing on the stereo. Makes me feel I've never left home.  perusing the specials, I come across something that is only found on Maui(up until now) Guri Guri(pronounced goodie goodie) which is basically sherbet. I asked Aunty if its made, or if they got it from Maui, and she says "Nice try bruddah, I not gonna tell you!" LOL!!!!..they offer Strawberry and Blue Vanilla and for $4 it comes in a half-pound size poke container...That's dessert, but back to the food....  We got The Fried Rice Omelette and Furikake Shrimp and they were Onolicious as usual. Can't go wrong with any of the food here, just come with an appetite because one entree could seriously feed two people.  Still wanting dessert, we were gonna get the Haupia Cake but it wasn't on the menu. what they did have was a Haupia Ice Cream Pie, so we tried that and also got a Strawberry Guri Guri. The Pie was okay, but not as good as a cake and the Guri Guri was good, but slightly harder from being prepacked. Service here is always great, everyone checks up on you and always making you feel welcome...ALOHA!!!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2013-(5/100) "Get Your Guri Guri Here!"

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guri Guri!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZXDVfoG0G9MUjQfaVfkWIA.text: My favorite Hawaiian restaurant. Portions are huge and flavor is on point. Need to come here more often but eat less

LenRcVIKUXvTKIYB8W7UEQ.text: Went here for the first time yesterday. Got 2 pounds of poke and a pork plate to go.   Service: Bad. The lady at the register in front of the door wasn't pleasant. She took our order then ignored the rest of the time. We sat at a table waiting for the food. My friend then went up to get two drinks, and it took them 10 minutes to get them for her and ring her up. Then it took 15 more minutes to get the food. We were there for 25 minutes waiting.  Food: poke was too salty. Too much soy sauce. Can't even taste the fish. The pork plate my friend got was good, she said, so that's good, I guess.  I'd rather go to Ohana across the street. The people there are nicer and the food has never been bad once.

xpftECxnEw2_aQXZEPK_5Q.text: I won't even begin to explain.   If you like Hawaiian food,  just go.  You won't be disappointed...

J3bMbACPUKghviQWM92UMw.text: First off let me say that this place is exactly what the word Ono means!!! This place is legit! Bottom line! No where in town are you going to get big island style Hawaiian food and they even have ox tail soup seven days a week?! No place in town has that?!? Everything from the teriyaki beef to the furikake chicken, this place  never ceases to satisfy. A lot of Hawaiian places seem to give you the normal low-grade teriyaki beef but this place makes teriyaki beef the way it should be! simple delicious hearty and more importantly should represent the flavor of the Islands. I had an order that didn't come out very well because I ordered it last minute on a Saturday night. It wasn't very edible because it was the end of the day food, and I called the next day to let them know that I wasnt satisfied and they made sure that I got the same meal waiting for me when I went down to pick it up at no additional cost. This is the meaning of customer service!!! I love this place and would recommend that anyone who wants to try Hawaiian food here in Las Vegas make a trip to Island flavor!

cA0VW0xhm3qkLETUks4VYg.text: First time trying Hawaiian food and it did not disappoint. Service was good. They serve a lot of very good food. The tuesday special- teriyaki chicken and fried noodles were exquisite. And the furikake chicken was just as amazing. Cant decide which of the two is my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki chicken and fried noodles

cjuQwUVn3v2MQfX0pmD98w.text: First time here, but not our last!  Furikake chicken was so tasty!  A little rich and very filling.  Most servings were large portions big enough for 2 people to share.     We'll have to go back to try the other menu items.

WA3g2LQET2u3h2T6F5EODw.text: Came here for lunch with my sister. Ordered the furikake chicken and kalbi ribs combo plate because I saw it on someone else's plate and it looked really good. It was good, but it was just slightly over-cooked. I ordered it again a few days later, and it was better. I suppose some days are good; just depends on the cook, maybe? But I'm not complaining. I was satisfied.

eFeJJbtXKjx5iy1hZciZNg.text: This place was so good! And it was packed and busy the whole time I was there. You can tell it's authentic island food when the place is filled with "locals". The staff was friendly and was very helpful at making suggestions and describing the menu items. I will definitely be back here very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Opakapaka-I think that&#39;s how u spell it. In white wine and garlic sauce

nbh_s7AFmeT23nsquW_sHQ.text: Good portions, wonderful service and staff. Furikake Shrimp and Oxtail Soup are my fav. Ask for Mark the server, he's super on top of it and sweet!

S4Tr4K97GKkaO2xEbAkEXg.text: Came here a few times and every time I come here staff is always nice. Most of all the food is good and very good prices. Not really a big place to have a party but good to bring the family when you want some island food. Music is good as well playing in the background just makes me miss home more lol!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got my poke fix and fish was buttery
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi and beef stew was winnah
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikaki shrimp was Ono to

Ux-Scxk1-94FlW3tEgFYtA.text: Yum! Huge portions freshly prepared delivered to your table by friendly and efficient staff. Delicious and tender roast pork and savory teriyaki chicken for my combo plate. Spouse had ribs and pork with cabage for his. We enjoyed all of our choices. The place itself is simple in decor and seating comfort. Furniture is a bit worn but serviceable. Nothing to deter us from going back for more island goodness!

11J0LBxGbUE3ugqyomxi3w.text: Definitely worth the quick drive from the strip to enjoy authentic Hawaiian cuisine and aloha. The food is so fresh and Delicious. Not to mention extremely authentic. The staff is very kind and the service is quick. The poke is great!! We also got kahlua and fruikake chicken. So amazingly delicious. We will come back!

5UvZHiwOz-ytNDe1Y5PXvQ.text: Great quick food.  The sesame poke is awesome here, and at a good price(14$ish per lb) for the amount.  The teriyaki and furikake are also awesome.  I'm only a few visits in, but I plan to come back to try more.  I'm not usually a macaroni salad fan, but theirs is a really good little side.  I'd skip the fried rice, but that's just my personal opinion, because there brown rice is good and plenty.  Best Hawaii food off the island.  Warning, big portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is amazing...  Spicy avocado poke.

OZnZnIgbDPUUGUy_fVHbyQ.text: It's hard to ignore raving reviews claiming the best Hawaiian food in town (of course, I was skeptical). I haven't found a single place that emulates the Hawaiian dining experience I miss about home. I understand the appeal of Island Flavor with its large portions and seemingly bold flavors, however, it's simply not comparable to Hawaii eats (specifically, Oahu). Surprisingly, it's not even the best Hawaiian food I've had in Las Vegas.  The Spam Musubi was good. They add sauce and furikake around the spam and have an acceptable rice-to-spam ratio. I'm not a fan of adding other flavors, especially sweet, to my Spam Musubi, but this was subtle enough to still enjoy it.  The poke was sad. I ordered a pound of their Shoyu Ahi Poke (MP; $14.50) and I was rather disappointed. There was way too much soy sauce (yes, this is possible) and it made the poke salty. Also, the ingredients didn't have enough time to mingle their flavors together and the raw onions were too sharp (and I love raw onions). All things that could possibly have been avoided had the poke been made earlier. This is one of the worst poke I've eaten.  For my entree, I got a Mixed Plate with Kalua Pig & Cabbage and Furikake Chicken ($11.25), plus Fried Rice (add $2). I normally wouldn't order something like Furikake Chicken, but it seems to be a favorite here. It's deep-fried boneless chicken tossed in a Furikake glaze. Pretty tasty, albeit salty, but not something I desire to eat again. The Kalua Pig was so MEH. The pork was slightly dry and it needed A LOT more of that Hawaiian salt. This is one of my benchmark dishes since it's a personal favorite and this one made me very sad. The silver lining is that the pork and cabbage helped cut the saltiness of everything else! I'm torn about their fried rice. It's not the Hawaiian-style fried rice I was yearning or expecting, BUT it has an appeal. I don't like the prominent and slightly overbearing soy sauce flavor of their fried rice, however, it was still enjoyable (as long as I forget my Hawaiian-style expectation).  I also tried the Furikake Shrimp and Kalbi. I'm almost certain the shrimp is the frozen breaded type tossed with Furikake after frying. Shrug. The Kalbi, on the other hand, was pretty good!  Yes, the portions are HUGE. You can definitely share a mixed plate (especially with that enormous addition of fried rice) with two people and still be stuffed. Service was wonderful. All three servers on the floor helped us (yay teamwork!) and were extremely attentive - though they didn't refill waters.  Although there were many disappointments, I wouldn't write off future visits (must try other favorites) and I need to try their desserts!

R8m5scgrpOYO0_-wnW0YAg.text: My go to spot for authentic homemade Hawaiian food. Portions are huge so I would recommend you share. Don't even try to finish your meal, I don't know anyone who has ever finished one of their plates in one sitting. Staff is super friendly and are very accommodating with large parties. Splitting the bill was simple. We ordered the Furikake Poke (prices vary based on fish market value), Loco Moco (with amazing gravy), Mud Pie, and Lilikoi drink ($0.50 refill). You can't go wrong with any of their dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke Furikake

uEMzEbUeRo5S6nArHVlmvg.text: sending everyone i know your way!! the food at Pure Aloha was terrible! ok I get it, lets charge ppl $10 for 1 teaspoon of food & fill up the plate with rice! NO! Ill gladly pass!   My 1st visit to you guys was over a month ago with my little family! OH.. HUGE portions, well seasoned meat & HUGE portions! we all had leftovers to take home! food was authentic && even tho its a restaurant, felt & tasted & is 100% homemade! Poke plate takes the trophy tho! now that? we ate all of lol   Dessert was the best! As full as we were, i had to try the Guava cake!! ONE MONSTER SIZE CAKE arrived at our table & tasted sooooo good!   This place is a little bit more than your regular "hawaiian" style dive...but u get all your moneys worth and will leave with a very satisfied palate!!  Ill be back! with all my friends lol  YES THAT GOOD! alofa atu!

sWpYIbtVFUSBXyj5z3a6FA.text: Had a frustrating experience the last time I dined with this restaurant but Bruce (owner) convinced me to return and give it another shot. Staff was phenomenally kind and understanding of the previous situation. Food came out hastily and hot. Waited no more than 10 minutes for a takeout order. Food tasted absolutely delicious and exceeded my expectations.  Will definitely be coming back again!   Definitely made up for my previous visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor is very reminiscent of the islands. Comfy and an at-home feeling.

AmXAV2V_F-L77pSNB1LesQ.text: One of the best Hawaiian places in town! I ordered the mixed plate that came with rice and macaroni salad and it was delicious. First time here and I live down the street. How have I not seen this place. Will definitely be a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam and eggs, Katsu chicken and mixed plate

GZcFH1IlgSId8CUsy_lIeg.text: I have to say among the Hawaiian places I've tried all over the valley... This bar far is the most and most authentic! Portion sizes are huge and more than enough to eat there be full and take plenty home. I've had the Korean garlic chicken, the hamburger loco moco, Katsu chicken loco moco, kalbi spare ribs and the spamasubi. I have never been disappointed food wise.   The place on the outside looks nothing short of standard and not anything special or impressive at all. It's rather spacious inside and average amount of seating for a family owned establishment. It's always a good sign when you see islanders eating coz you know the food is legit. Always people in here eating and always at least someone from Hawaii inside enjoying the grub there.   The most recent time I went tho, I have to say the service was on the poor side. Granted, it was really busy that day, but we waited for our check and refill on drink from at least ten minutes. A server or cook from the back came out to help seat people and saw someone she knew eating and got caught up talking to that table for a while. We kept trying to get her attention until finally the customer that was talking to this server told US that WE should just go up to the counter to get someone's attention... Excuse me?! Poor form. That person should told the employee "hey we'll talk later you have customers" and directed her to us.! So naw we sat there and waited. And poor form on that server for having a ten minute conversation with a table when the placed is packed and we can't get anyone to notice that we want the check and to go boxes to dip outta there.   Normally neglect of service is something I hold highly to food and dining establishments and take off a whole star for that. But dam this place is so bomb with the food... I'll let that one time slide. The customer service can make or break a dining experience for a person. And if the service is exceptional or good like it's supposed to be... It can sometimes make the meal all the more enjoyable. Tighten up on that customer service... Then it's top notch best Hawaiian food in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu loco moco very generous Katsu servings
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Saimen
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $2 spam masubi

e8G0YUmIiUqgyCWhACJIIg.text: I'm giving them 2 stars because the food was great, but the service was terrible.  I told 3 different folks there how many people were in my party and was still kept waiting to be seated an inordinate amount of time (there were empty tables BTW).  I was within seconds of leaving when they finally seated my party.  Once my party ordered we got the food quickly, but once we were ready to pay it took forever to get the check and then another forever to get somebody to the cash register to actually take the money.  And while that was happening the line to be seated was growing fast.  They seemed very disorganized.  Again, the food was great, but due to this horrible service I won't be back.

SNhN7sO5GQ1iSrFD7nrhIA.text: The place is nice, clean, food was delicious! We tried the furikake chicken and kalbi combo. Coffee was ok, nothing special but wasnt bad. Portions are huge, plenty of parking outside. Service was okay-ish....they didnt have togo cups and lids to take our leftover drinks...so how do they put drinks if people ordered togo?

2i0_T6afcc7Oc_Hz5-vY8A.text: I would drive all the way back to Las Vegas, just to come eat here! It was such a random find...we were driving to Vegas and I was really craving some poke and somehow found this place because it was still open by the time we reached the area. Located off the strip, in a small strip mall with plenty of parking. Upon walking in, I knew we were going to have a nice hawaiian meal. Almost everyone there was hawaiian and there was a guy singing and playing his ukelele. First and foremost, the service here is beyond amazing! The lady running the place is the sweetest. She's fast and efficient, makes great suggestions and she cares so much about her food! And the food...oh my goodness!!!! So yummy. We ordered the shoyu poke as an appetizer. And it was such a large amount...I definitely had my poke fix: yelp.com/user_local_phot... I ended up ordering the chicken furikake, which I've never had before but it was suggested: yelp.com/user_local_phot... It was probably the best thing I've ever had in a long while. It was so good!!! My sasquatch ordered the kalbi short ribs: yelp.com/user_local_phot... He was so hungry he started eating them quickly. The nice lady who was running the place saw that the short rib was slightly undercooked. She was so concerned, even though he didn't mind much. And she ended up putting in a nicely cooked new piece into our to-go boxes. She was so sweet. So definitely it was a 5 star experience for me. The food. The service. It's worth the drive! I miss this place already and wish there was something like this in LA!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Furimake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyupoke

gMszu2aWytViF0IpB84qjQ.text: Broke da mout! Amazing food and awesome portions! It's hard to find places where you find good local kine food similar tasting to back home. This place comes really close! The vibe in this place is similar to what you'll feel back on the islands. Very welcoming, but full of energy and a lot of other folks from Hawaii. They can get pretty busy, so seating might be tough. I like their loco moco here, but I get the oxtail most of the time! Been meaning to try their furikake chicken and I will sometime soon! Haven't gone here a lot because it is quite the drive from my house. The pricing is your usual $9-$20 range, but they give good portions! Back at home I was used to the generous portions... they definitely live up to it! If you live on this side and crave local food give this place a try! Promise you will like it.

4yGHuCNW5e8lBoHSl8vidQ.text: If you want the real deal Hawaiian style food in Vegas this is the place to go. Huge portions just like in the islands. All items are authentically Hawaiian style. I had loco moco with a side of mac salad. All I can say is 'ono'!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aloha shoyu on the table is the only way to go.

VNAhxgGy5yqOZMQilhkoDg.text: Food is legit. The portions are good, prices are fairly reasonable. My favorites are the bbq short rib and the shoyu poke.   My only gripe is the wait time when there is a crowd. The wait time seems to be a little longer than desired. Other than that, for take out, I always call ahead and food is usually good even when I have it at home.

XD6pmD4lzNOYSexVoH4S_Q.text: You have to go to thus restaurant if you like local food! Price is very good and portion is humongous! Go you'll love it!

7kt9lBjQns8zYV77jwFj-Q.text: The food here is amazing! Huge portions and authentic flavors.   Whenever I go to a Hawaiian restaurant I begin my experience with an order of spam musubi, just to kick off my meal. I ordered the furikake chicken and it's truly a mouth watering experience. Fried chicken glazed in a sweet and savory sauce with fried rice and a side of Mac salad.  We didn't have to wait too long to get seated, but there were plenty of people coming in and out. The only down fall was they seemed a bit short staffed, so getting our drinks and ordering took a little longer than what we were used to.  If you're going to eat here, you're going to have to be patient. They also do take out, if you're not the patient type. All in all food is great and customer service could be better.

h--QSlV4fgs0uJGKQSQ3mg.text: This place never disappoints. Customer service is outstanding, and their food is always on point. If you're looking for Hawaiian comfort food this is the place. I'm a big fan of their chicken papaya (served only on certain days) and their furikake chicken. Their portion sizes are huge! Though I would love it if they offered mini portions, I always have a good amount left over to take home.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled mahi mahi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken papaya and furikake chicken

oPKyLMvOWoWGyElK65W87w.text: In the back of my mind, I thought it was another Hawaiian food restaurant with your normal menu... I was wrong! Island Flavor is awesome! I seem to be coming to this place at a weekly visit, when I'm not busy. The commute here is a distance... But it's worth it when you have their infamous furukaki chicken! The waiters/waitresses are very knowledgeable about the menu, and they suggest that you try something that you've never tried. Leilani is always there, and loves to joke and make trouble. Each item that they bring out the kitchen window seems to draw every patrons eyes! Not to mention their portions!   Their kal-bi is awesome, and I never did like beef stew as a child, yet, these guys managed to change my mind! It's delicious! I love their Portuguese bean soup, and their fried noodles! I always gawk at their fried rice omelette with the Portuguese sausage. It's a inverted large bowl of fried rice! I believe I've tried a fraction of their menu, and the items that I've chosen so far aren't a disappointment!   Then there is the DESSERT.... Even though some of the items come from next door which is a bakery, the Hawaiian desserts are top notch!! Guava cake, Cocoa Puffs.... etc... To die for! I think I'm heading there next week again!

Nli9HwT1WNKxx-gAA2y5hg.text: Wow!!! We were in Vegas for a few nights visiting family and I had bookmarked this place on Yelp a few months ago just for the guava cake. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and seated right away.  Our waitress was super friendly, she was busy but laid back, felt like home (Hawaii). The menu was filled with so many familiar options it was hard to choose. My husband ordered Kalbi and my cousin, her husband and I ordered a mixed plate with furikaki fried shrimp and hawaiian style roast pork. Both came with rice (I had brown) and Mac salad. We also ordered fresh made Ahi Poke, mix of shoyu, sesame, and furikake style.  Everything was sooooooo delicious!!! My husband (whose from CA) was laughing at me because he said he has never seen me get so excited and enjoy my meal so much before. After dinner I was so full but could not leave without getting a slice of guava cake! They also had chantili cake and coco puffs which I wanted but could not eat because I was stuffed. We got the guava cake and it did not disappoint! It was so good I kept eating even though I felt like I was going to explode!   We will definitely be back when we are in town again! Enjoyed the entire experience from the friendly staff, the hawaiian music playing in the background, the local feel and the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I1Q3Ah_aHO7TBFqIrPhVmg.text: Island flavor always satisfies my Hawaiian food cravings.  A home away from home from the food to the people.  To me,  the servings are large and good enough to share.  Must order: Furikake Chicken My husband's favorite.  Deep fried bite sized chicken with a sugar glazed furikake sauce that's grinds!!!  Poke is also a hit.  Not fresh from the ocean like back in Hawaii, but it's pretty close....

nHmUA6ZiptB7VOnVEUnJvQ.text: This was my first visit for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon.  They were located on S Durango Dr/W Windmill Ln in Las Vegas.  I ordered Spam Musubi and Kalbi Short Ribs.  The server brought out the Spam Musubi on a little plate right away still wrapped in plastic wrap.  She could have at least unwrapped it. The Spam Musubi had a layer of seasoned seaweed sprinkles on the spam which gave it a little more flavor.  This was of the best Kalbi Short Ribs that I have had in a Hawaiian restaurant in Las Vegas. There were 4 thick, tender, juicy, perfectly grilled slices of Kalbi.  Just a little fatty.  It came with a steak knife.  The Kalbi was on a bed of rice and raw cabbage with a scoop of rice and macaroni salad on the plate.  The macaroni salad was good.  I asked if they had a Military discount and they gave me a generous discount.  Many of the Hawaiian restaurants in town honor a Military discount.  I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Short Ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Musubi

Dwpi9wv0Xxi87o_AnRaGiQ.text: Love love this place. The food is amazing and the portions are huge. I've been here so many times that I've lost count. My favorites are the Kalib ribs, furikake chicken and chicken Katsu. Their Portuguese bean soup is also really good and large portion.

gI8fc6CwyPoFKASuz8w3tQ.text: Food was absolutely fantastic and generous portion (we had loco moco). My only complaint is that my boyfriend and I ordered two sides of the macaroni salad for $2.25 each and the serving was TINY!  I expected more for that price. It came in a small plastic cup the size of which would hold sauce or salad dressing.

17xuEMJipHsPOU3MqrQlYg.text: This review is long overdue but this place is amazing.  Better than a lot of local joints in Hawaii too. Everything was so flavorful, fresh , great portions, and so reasonably priced . The menu has all your typical dishes and a couple  of poke variations . I  Ordered the poke , loco loco, and kalua pork . My plate also came with a Mac salad and coconut haupia pudding cup . oN point! I wish Seattle had Hawaiian places like this. Sigh. Next time I'm in vegas, this place is a must .

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pork , Lomi salmon cup,  coconut pudding, Mac salad plate and a loco moco. Delicious

EiyqL_FRmuWsIz9blv7g_w.text: The BF and I were near a friends house and about to beer fest so we needed some food to buffer it.   We shared a combo plate of Korean chicken and the Hawaiian pork w/ gravy (which we added a egg to make it into a loco moco). The korean chicken are crispy little wings and drumlettes with a really tasty sweet and tangy sauce. That would be awesome if you can order a bucket of these like how chicken wings places serve it because we could definitely eat more of these. The pork wasn't shredded like I expected but slices off a big roast. It was a bit dry, but the flavor was pretty good. Wish we ordered just the Korean chicken, but we've never been here so wanted to try more than one thing. The serving was plentiful for both of us so the portions here on the heavy side of things.   I read a lot of positive reviews for their cakes so we decided to get a Haupia cake. That was really delicious. the layers of cake was moist and light, had a good custard, nice coconut flavor that wasn't overpowering. If this was a place near our house I think I would come more often for cake than food.   The server was full of Hawaiian hospitality and checked on us often.   I can see why people like this place but it is far for us to ever make a point of coming here more than once in a while. If you're in the SW area though, this is better places to eat in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haupia cake
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken and Hawaiian pork loco moco

uLRSMW2wrSMPEP4nvOy3OA.text: Great food, good service, a True taste of Hawaii for those who have never been. I am definitely a fan and will be back soon!

3f7Y_EKXjAAWUlLY_BfM0g.text: Be ready for a plate large enough for two meals. It might be a good idea to share with someone...nah! Just unleash the beast within.  I tried out the mix plate here with chicken katsu and and chop steak with onion. The katsu is fried to perfection and comes with a delicious katsu sauce. The chop steak with onion was a little tough but very good as well. I also got a chance to try the kalbi here and I would get that next time along with katsu if choosing options for the mix plate.  I didn't know it's not listed on the menu, but you can order coffee here! It's pretty good and comes with free refills.  Excellent service, reminiscent of the hospitality of the islands.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chop steak and katsu mixed plate

fCTWNmUnF7sIW7V1KnTUdw.text: I never would have thought of having food that reminds me being back on the island. This place has the authentic island vibe. I like how they stream the local Hawaiian radio station.  My Kalbi lunch plate was huge as expected. Fresh grill marks and charbroiled taste. Not Kalbi cooked on a flattop with a rubbery chewy texture. Will return again on my next excursion off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh off the grill

xIXYVPWh8cKDdAeLsAS-qA.text: I've tried twice at this place. This place is 3 stars. Nothing seemed so special. I'm from LA and had much better Hawaiian dishes with better prices. Today I ordered oxtail soup Togo with no spoon...ummm how am I suppose to eat this?!  The cashier guy was inattentive although it wasn't busy.  Conclusion: I wouldn't go back when I'm in Vegas. I would rather try different Hawaiian places.

BRu6j5oXhUm6yslOaqNm8w.text: YUMMY GUAVA CHIFFON CAKE = 5 STARS!!!!  Andrea's World of Cakes located right next door to Island Flavor makes the cakes that are sold here.... So, if you would like to order more than a slice go next door because you can get a good sized cake for a good price.  Guava Chiffon Cake is easy to come by on the islands but so rare to find here in Vegas so I'm so happy that if I'm craving a yummy slice of Guava Chiffon Cake I can just come to Island Flavor (just not on Sundays and Mondays- Boo Hoo )....  **Inside Island Flavor they removed the sushi bar (from the previous buisness) from the middle of the room and it's much more spacey - Good call Island Flavor**

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chop Steak and Korean Chicken

wvjUdW81HWvB0bw44JAqWw.text: I've driven past this place many times not knowing what it was. I finally decided to stop by one day and it is the BEST Hawaiian Food I've had in Vegas! Not only are the portions big, but the flavor is fantastic! Expect to get the ITIS and fall asleep after eating

hkPotupvyDVrijq2qi5ccw.text: I've been here a couple times and I think the first time was better. The one thing that brings me back is the furikake chicken. So good and and I haven't ever seen this item at any other hawaiian restaurant. Definitely need to order that entre. The mac salad is also very good. Service is always good and it feels like a local restaurant in hawaii.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua and cabbage and chop steak
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken and furikake shrimp

RAhYjZSBrpOZoRaFFYG1wA.text: Food is very tasty. The amount of food served is plentiful. Good for big eaters. Employees very friendly and personable. Definitely will eat there again.

Bp_HFbVYnCW4KhKjYBHv6g.text: They definitely dont skimp on portions here, so come hungry. I ordered food to go on my most recent visit 6/13/16. The guy on the phone was super helpful. I ordered a mixed plate combo with furikake chicken and teriyaki chicken. The plate comes with 2 scoops of white rice, and a side of mac salad. I also added on 2 orders of spam musubi. My total was $18.49. Island Flavor is located in BFE aka Durango and Windmill, right next to World Of Cakes.   The food was really good. The furikake chicken was something I have never had before but I enjoyed it. It's chicken pieces breaded then deep fried and tossed in a sweet sauce and sprinkled with furikake. Something new for my taste buds for sure. The teriyaki chicken was okay. The problem was it was literally swimming in teriyaki sauce and it was sooo salty. I love teriyaki sauce, but would for sure ask for the sauce on the side next time. Especially since I had leftovers. Reheated teriyaki gets thick and goopy, and is not the business. The spam musubi were decent size and still tasted good the next day. They wrapped em in saran wrap so all I had to do was pop it in the microwave and I was good to go. I enjoyed the mac salad. It was creamy and just about perfect, but I did add a dash of salt and pepper to it. All in all, everything was pretty ONOLICIOUS!   This is not an area I am in often, but when I am in the area and craving Hawaiian food, I will stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac salad and spam musubi
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake and teriyaki chicken combo

0r73pP5ShkKx1NjMZfE1mw.text: THE place for some great Hawaiian food!!   We came for lunch and they were just starting to pick up. The ladies who were working saw us come in said mahalo and were really inviting. We were seated right away and immediately our drink order was taken.   We had the loco moco and furikake poke. Bomb!!! The loco moco is huge!! This is definitely something tjay can be shared. The gravy smelled so good I could smell it while it was being carried to our table. The sunny side up eggs were a delicious and cooked just right.   The poke was fresh and good sized pieces with onions. The serving portion of poke that they give is very generous for the price. Definitely the spot for some great poke!
