Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco

AP1Aim-M1xCS3uaGpyNj-Q.text: Jewel in the desert. This place brings me back to the islands!!! The Furikake Chicken is to die for! I brought my daughter and niece here and they loved every item they ordered. Come here hungry. Their servings a huge!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mud pie: Kona coffee ice cream drizzled w/ raspberry, chocolate and passion fruit sauce
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu Chicken, macaroni salad and white rice
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate: Furikaki Chicken, kalbi spare ribs, bbq pork fried rice and macaroni salad

5pbN-x7uMYnAAxsQxQogOA.text: One of our favorite places to get our Hawaiian/Island food in Vegas!! Everything we've tried here is so good... you really can't go wrong! Loco moco, chicken teriyaki, Korean chicken, roast pork, oxtail soup, chantilly cake!! Service is always great and welcoming as well!!

3qCinZ005X7Eoxwv2AUH4g.text: This is the place to eat while your in Vegas or if you live there too lol. The food always on point. You feel at home. The customer service always great. I ran into one of my childhood friends last time server Christina. She's The best. Sad she wasn't there this time around. Good to see aloha spirit even while on vacation. Keep up the great work.

7fyGwRUnd65JbZDahyHCdA.text: First time eating here. It was ok I had the Saimin noodle soup. For me it was too much carbs. Most dishes were served with rice and macaroni salad not much greens on menu. Everyone else (8 people) enjoyed it. But we shared a piece of the Haupia ice cream cake which was absolutely out of this world!  I would just come for desert next time. It was coconut pineapple ice cream with graham cracker crust whipped cream topping with chocolate sauce and nuts and about 8 inches high.

atsI2xTyABUmwAf6giwZ6Q.text: Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. We have been eating at Island Flavor since 2008. When we lived near the restaurant, we ate there 3 times a week... you could experience a new flavor every night. When friends come to visit we drive all the way across town for them to have the Island Flavor experience. Recently, there was an ownership change and the new owner has kept Island Flavor the same! We discussed them opening a restaurant on the n/w side of town.... we are on the lookout for a location! Bring it on! Do not hesitate....  go in and experience it for yourself!

vu3yyyW75v_4VHNR-wyJDQ.text: UPDATE!  Wow, Incredible customer service.  Ok, so we got sick  from eating the food at Island flavor.  It sucked and it was what it was.  Literally minutes after writing the previous one star review I got a message from the owner Bruce.  He was so kind and apologetic that he offered to give us a full refund on said dinner.  He continued to guarantee that all of his food is prepared fresh daily and that the turn over on food is so quick that food never sits.  I believed him.  This particular situation prompted him to look deeper into the problem as far as checking in with vendors that supply his restaurant to try and find the source of the problem.    Due to the overwhelming amount of concern, professionalism and care that he has given me and my friends...I think I'm gonna write this off as a fluke accident.  It happens to the best of em. Besides that Furikake chicken is too good to ignore!    Again, thank you Bruce for the amazing customer service and I definitely won't give up on Island Flavor.

fggF9l-7guvtAzsI4xXI9A.text: Food here is amazing! Chef Darcy does a fantastic job, very authentic Hawaiian food. I would definitely come back whenever i'm in Vegas.

2t8OHqB_uBctE-G5q3OXpQ.text: I'm from Hawaii. I might say the plate lunch I had at Island Flavor might be better than most places in Honolulu? wha? sacrilege?  Ok, they don't have fountain fanta fruit punch (which has a strawberry accent) like in Hawaii... but everything else--delicious.  The service is of a local flavor--the friendly kind. I wanted to try two things not typically ordered together, and the waitress was super flexible about it.  Yes!  The teri beef was delicious--and if it was salty--i only noticed it after the meal. But what I most appreciated was that it had a good char from the grill they have in the kitchen. Also, the cut of meat was not tender in itself (skirt or ny?) but it was handled perfectly. It had both a solid beefy taste and with the slices of meat going across the grain, each piece was mouth tender. It was a beautiful, expert touch. The teri sauce was solid--not like mainland style teriyaki--but local flavor. The sweet sour spareribs--also quite good--a tiny bit oily. big piece of ginger, and turnips, carrots--it was good and hearty--like what you'd make at home.  not as good as the teri beef though. I ended up finishing all the teri beef and taking the SSS home. And PS--it tasted great as leftovers later that night. mac salad was solid Haupia cake--also world class. Reminiscent of Napoleans (Zippy's) in terms of the lightness of the cake.  I would not be surprised if the owner's used to run that bakery or someplace like that. All that cake for only $5!    I'm so full again. Two meals in from one plate lunch (and a piece of cake)  Clearly these people know what they're doing. I have to really search to give any suggestions at all: * Is it possible to make slightly better rice?  Pressure cooker might make the rice stand out too? The steamed rice scoops were pretty dense and was the weakest part of the meal.  * I found myself waiting to pay for quite a while at the register.  It'd be nice if the wait staff took the payment--but hey, I won't complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The teri beef is cut expertly across the grain for a mouth tender, minimum chew goodness! Well done

SMt4eyzkkCV_TzqjwRP27A.text: been coming here since my daughter was 5 years old. she is now 16. the owners may have changed but the flavors sure didn't. bigger place, less wait. same great food, big portions and warm people. i'm glad that i live so close to here. loving the live relaxing music after a hectic day at work!

5Z0f_BffY5Xtu_4BDx-aoQ.text: I wish I lived out here, because I'd be back to visit Island Flavor. It was my first time having food at a Hawaiian restaurant, and I wasn't disappointed. I had a chicken special (sorry, forget what it was) and it was very good. You get quite a bit of food so you won't be disappointed with what you get.  The place is a little drab, but it's not a big deal. The food more than makes up for it.

JcMsCUjh2HnYknT11Yf2_Q.text: My friend from work have been raving and raving about this place and she always comes here after church so one night before we all hung out we was like let's all go to dinner so we suggest it Island flavor and oh my God out of the park I loved everything about it they gave you big portions of food it's very inexpensive the food is taste fresh it was just awesome way way way way way better than Aloha Kitchen I had the combination plate  and it was amazing. We will definitely make this our favorite food place.

V4hCPwNy_wWNNZIsL6-J_A.text: Went 5 years ago. The poke was phenomenal. Some of the other items were a little fatty, grizzly or slightly over cooked. Will definitely give it another shot, but with so many other poke options, it may be a while before we try it again.

YYmq8uO_Ka3EpZGEsfhXlw.text: Came here upon a referral from a buddy of mine from Honolulu.  It's about a 15 minute drive from The Strip, but it's well worth it.  The staff were very friendly and courteous.    My wife ordered the friend noodle special (Tuesday).  This is quite possibly the best friend noodle/saimin I have ever tried.  It's loaded with Cha Siu, Kamaboko, spam and topped with grilled Chicken Teriyaki.    After talking to the owner, I ordered the Furikake Chicken which was fabulous.  It was crispy and full of flavor.  I also enjoyed the scoop of Mac Salad as well.  In fact, the flavors here are as big as their portions "BIG".  I'm going to have to try their Kalbi Ribs upon my next visit.    I wanted to order the Guava Cake or Mud Pie for dessert, but I was just too full.  I guess that will have to wait til my next trip as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried noodles with Teri Chicken (Tuesday Special)

xnHMfGRnSNYItI1nHZmtag.text: I love this place.  The service is great and the food is amazing!  My favorite menu items are the avocado fries, short ribs, and the pork fried rice.  I have been there many times and I have never had a bad experience.  If you are looking for a great place to eat that is not your normal sit down restaurant,  this is the place.

PyfMyRCajNQ_ycjcOi05aA.text: According to my husband, Dave, "Island Flavor" is one of the 2 reasons one should move to Las Vegas. The 2nd reason is "Buldogis Gourmet Hot Dogs". :)  This is a local favorite. "Island Flavor" is not on the Strip. The waitress told us that they have been in this location for about 8 years. I'm glad Dave found "Island Flavor".  We ate here twice during a 10-day stay, in Las Vegas. I ordered the Furikake Chicken and Poke both times. Absolutely delicious.   Don't think, too much...just order the Furikake Chicken and Poke...Oh wait !!!!...then, make room for the To-Die-For Guava Cake!!!!!!!!!!!! If you can't make room for the Guava Cake, no problem. That means that there's more for me. :D  The Guava Cake and the Chocolate Cake look really delicious, but heavy. Surprisingly, both cakes are very light...and flavorful.  It is definitely worth the Uber or rental-car ride to have a wonderful meal at this restaurant.

5Cp9zZRgt_mex3eaOOprKw.text: Waited 45mins for our food.  This place has not been the same since it expanded.  Service is soooo slow.   So disappointed.  Use to be our favorite place

-rf8Ke02aTbWRCvSgFezSQ.text: Furikake poke!! I could eat this all day and not get fat! I was full of this stuff as it was the first thing served.   I've been wanting to come here for years! We ordered two mixed plates. One with furikake chicken and Kalua pig & Cabbage. The other with kalbi short ribs and chopped steak and onions.   After staring at photos of furikake chicken for years, my dream came True and was able to try it. Honestly, was a bit diappointed in the taste which is like something  you get a Chinese restaurant without the furikake. The Kalua pig and cabbage lacked the saltiness and smoked flavor you typically get. So, that was diappointing as well. The portions weren't a disappointment. Large enough to feed 2 people with mac salad. Can't believe I almost finished my plate. Oink..    The kalbi short ribs were just like most. Good but not great. The chopped steak was decent and had a slight sweetness to it (sugar).   Wish I had space or made space for desserts. The guava and chantilly cakes looked pretty good.   Service here was just average and appeared shorthanded on a busy Sunday afternoon.   I'll stick to Aloha Specialties next time for my garlic chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped steak and kalbi short ribs
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pork and furikake chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake poke

b_guw_RvIEAzvbioFcb2GQ.text: This place is freakin delicious, we ordered the furikake and short rib plate and it was good. The short ribs are the best I have qhad in a really long time. The furikake was okay, I'm used to a more tender chicken that has crunch, but this one tasted like it was just over cooked chicken with a soy glaze sauce. I still ate it because some parts were good and not so dry. The Mac salad is how it should be, I grew up eating L&L mac salad so if it's not better than that then it is what it is. Lastly the guava cake was mediocre at best, I thought it was way too dry and the flavor seemed off. Maybe they gave us old cake? I heard how good it was but it did not exceed my expectation. I will come back for them short ribs

muj3W-jvuuqqMVDjkYracQ.text: We lived very close by to this Hawaiian spot and one day decided to come try it. Since that day this had always been the spot we go to when we want Hawaiian food. The inside is kinda small but the food well worth coming here. On Fridays there's a family of 3 that sings which is awesome. Everything we've tried here is great from the appetizers of the poke took the desert. Everything is very big portion sized. My husband go to drink is their fruit punch. I like the pog juice since it's something I grew up drinking. When I'm with my husband we usually get the mixed plate since the portions are so big and we add Mac salad so we each can have one. My go to is their chicken Katsu and my husband likes to get the Kalbi or furikake chicken.   They do get busy sometimes and the wait could get long. The service is great though. I've brought my parents here and they loved it. Overall, we love this place and come back every so often.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bLh7qu1D3zDHy5qhZ6gYLQ.text: Great staff and amazing food!  They are located an a nice area and their dinning room is very clean.  The staff are very friendly. We will be back soon!

MUW0c1uZVxOFHR4M76iy7A.text: Furiake chicken and kalbi - so good! They give you huge servings and food is delicious. We always try to make it a point to stop here whenever we visit Vegas. Will defintiely be coming back!

LMj8aQ_LXKLq0REiUL1_-A.text: Food was amazing.  Staff was friendly and welcoming.  Atmosphere was clean and reminiscent to the islands

WnXnEl-c0Wcw9e0TK8X_Lw.text: I'm so disappointed.. This used to be my favorite place to bring friends from out of town and my go to Sunday take out spot. This place was going strong for years! But now the food is so blah. It sounds stupid to say but it tastes like there's no love put into it anymore. The furikake chicken is dryThe loco moco was so over cooked that the burger felt chalky in my mouth. Definitely not coming back anymore :( or at least until it goes back to how it used to be

gj6F0ewh0tb2SXDY0kWtdg.text: First time here and would definitely come back the next time we're in town. We ordered the chef's loco moco and the monstah plate with roast beef, furikake shrimp & kalbi and the Kona Mudpie for dessert. Everything was fire! Service was great too!

Pyz6T4SKduuCiwx1DK5PQw.text: If you're really hungry and craving Hawaiian food, you have found your go to spot! I've been to this restaurant a couple of times. I usually get the furikake chicken, because you can't ever go wrong with that! The flavor is on the sweeter side, which is what I like. Recently, I haven't been into the super fried chicken because it doesn't make very good leftovers, so I recommend sharing it because the portions are huge!   I knocked off a star for the furikake shrimp. I was hoping for the same type of flavor, but the shrimp didn't really have any flavor and most of whatever flavor you get is from the chili sauce you dip it in. At first i thought the shrimp wouldn't be enough but I just got tired of trying to eat it and didn't finish it. I was kind of disappointed and wish I tried the loco loco katsu, but atleast I don't have to wonder about the shrimp!  You can never go wrong with a loco moco though!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake shrimp

-CtKcXc2LEaThfgPeW-3Jw.text: Staff is so nice always been since I moved here love them they literally treat us like family you know us Hawaiians. Food Ono as always!!! Renovation is nice and modern!!!

bl-Gd7SxdbdYFAluR-lBxg.text: We ordered MUNSTAH with furikake shrimp, pork belly tinono and Korean chicken. It was very tasty and it seemed not very big (if you are used to the old management serving size). It was sufficient for 2 and delicious. We went on a Sunday and it became busy but service was quick and very pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3QcL2EZbj0zddCJA_3PRVA.text: LOVED IT! Was craving Hawaiian food on the way out of Vegas and found some really good food here! The Hawaiian Roast Pork and the Furikake Chicken is SOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOOOOOD!!! Customer service was great and made us feel at home at this restaurant. Will definitely be back the next time we're in Vegas...

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Roast Pork with an upgrade of Fried Rice

RUOVrpMraf75oUqiPtBxMA.text: This is the best Hawaiian place in Vegas. The furikake chicken is my favorite and the guava cake is bomb

R4AHmvQquNvZVPkaQCM57Q.text: Recently sold and under new ownership.  Recipes/food seems to be the same, restaurant has expanded next door with more seating. Remodeled inside, a bit dark, but may still be in process of finishing the remodel. Said they have applied for a liquor license, but not available yet.  Servings are much smaller than before with the mixed plate and the loco moco dishes we ordered.  Was told the new plates make the servings look smaller, but we've been here way to many time for that mind game. The feeling of "Ohana" is gone with the staff change and reduction of live music to one day. No music on Friday nights any more, only on Saturdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dhbfVYuwthguVZMMcmaFDg.text: Just came in for a late lunch today. We got the teriyaki steak and chicken with veggie fried rice, and macaroni salad. When I tell you it was ah-ma-zinggggg!!!! It was more then words can even describe. Our waiter Lei was a sweetheart. She took excellent care of us and couldn't have been more kind. They made it feel very Island Like and I loved the fact that they put the bill in a Spam can. It's always those small details that make an experience extraordinary. I will absolutely be back.

BOc7sLvvJrzyL6bELgKb7A.text: Island Flavor needs to CHAIN UP! Much better than L&L.   The portions are definitely ISLAND portion and it's good too.   This is the hawaiian family originally from Big Island's favorite. That itself should say something to whoever is looking at this.   This last time we were a 8 top and service, bless her heart, was a lot on the slow side. It's ok-we forgive since the food was so ono.   I had the Kalbi & Katsu plate. Both ono. The kalbi was cooked perfect and can't complain about the Katsu.   Get the coffee.  Get the Guava cake.  Be aloha.   Do it.

QaBJmYUPZm15TRbK_zAN6A.text: Our go to spot here in Vegas.  Big Island Grill was our go to spot when we lived in Kona so naturally we loved the food at Island Flavor.....  Walked in, and as always, was greeted by a friendly worker and seated right away.  Service was friendly and quick.  Ordered our food and it was out within 10 minutes.  Food came out hot and fresh.  I had the Loco Moco.  Perfectly cooked rice.  Thick Beef patty was juicy and nicely seasoned.  I ordered over easy eggs but came out hard, no biggie...  And the gravy, Can't get enough of that stuff.....  I wish they offered the B.I.G. Loco Moco.  Choice of 3 different meats!  Wife got the Saimin.  Standard Saimin with the usual toppings.  Char-sui, kamaboko, eggs, green onions, etc....  The broth was a bit under seasoned.  Nothing a little shoyu couldn't fix.   The dumplings were good though....  Daughter got the furikake chicken.  She usually pounds her food but she barely touched it.  I finally tried a piece and it was hard and dry.  It's as if it was cooked, sat out, then refried to heat it up.  The sauce was good.  Son had the Korean Wings.  This is his go to plate.  He always orders it and it's always BOMB!!!!  Big freshly cooked chicken wings and dipped in a nice shoyu/sesame sauce.  Perfect every time.....

XxyRnSrpZlPRARB92ESFLA.text: A fantastic spot. It was recommended by a co-worker/friend of mine who had some amazing things to say about it. Naturally, I had to come witness  it myself.  I'm a beginner when it comes to Hawaiian dishes, but so far I'm quite impressed. I had their Hawaiian style pork with gravy as well as terriaki chicken, with rice and mac as the side.   It was both filling and satisfying--the pork being the highlight of the meal. The rice was a perfect texture and complimented everything. A complete dish that will have me coming back for so much more in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A view from outside

VoAyrdQWCmLzlUynJNrhkA.text: Slow service. Super salty food. I was excited to come her after reading the yelp reviews. And we had family fr CA arrive this after noon so we were all hungry.  They just need more servers. Although the server we had was nice. After almost an hour getting our food. Initially food was good while eating it (maybe because I was hungry and I had 2 kids to feed), towards the end I had a horrible taste of waaaay too much sodium in my mouth. I order 2 combo plates. Kalbi and Korean chicken with fried rice. It might've been from the Kalbi ribs or fried rice. Because I enjoyed the korean chicken. I seriously had a huge headache after and literally the rest of my day was ruined. I had a bad salty feel all day. I felt my face blew up. Horrible experience. I'm pretty disappointed. I doubt I'll ever come back.

3kdMFFhaThUs5uU35CPeqg.text: Here on Friday July 6th at 8pm. The Friday special is Lau Lau or Kalua pig and cabbage. I loved the Lau Lau here and have even ordered it by the pan (dozen Lau laus). Was advised that there were no Lau laus today... WAIT, WHAT!!?  Was offered the kalua pig special instead and I declined causing the server to roll her eyes when I said "hold on."   Not sure what happened to this place but that has never happened in the last 8 years I've been coming here.  The next thing that struck me weird, where are the locals. It was packed yet the number of locals in the restaurant could be counted on one hand.   Waiting on our food now, however this may be our last time coming here...  Too bad, this was the place to go...  Update: wife received her plate and they forgot the Mac salad. Not a big deal however the waitress never came back to check on us. Our drinks were empty and I really wanted more guava juice. Although one of the big bonuses to this place is the deserts, we decided to leave without getting any because we didn't want to wait any longer for a server.   Not the review I wanted to leave....

wFualqRDKvuZXetQZaL6Hg.text: Can i just say big portions and affordable prices? Hell freakin Yes!!  My boyfriend and I were looking for some dinner options and stumbled upon this restaurant via yelp (thank you )  He orders the furikake chicken and i order the teriyaki chicken salad (watching my girlish figure.. pssh not really)  Anywho  Furikake Chicken portion basically can feed 2 ppl (yup that huge of a portion) and my salad was huge as well  both of us ended up eating only half of our dinner entrees and the rest was eaten for lunch the next day.  Taste wise? Furikake chicken is so yummy! (yes i took a lil bit from my bfs plate cause it looked so appetizing) So crispy, soy saucy and sweet all at the same time  Teriyaki chicken salad came with a huge amount of creamy dressing - i only used half of it. It tasted of sesame oil/ garlicky goodness  The salad had lettuce, tomatoes, crispy wontons and taro/ube in it! so satisfying!! wouldve liked more tomatoes though  Overall.. bomb food.. reasonably priced. This restaurant is here to stay

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kqRebGATg4QUc0dzc4dnCw.text: Delicious food coupled with top notch customer service. Unsurpassed..."belly aching portions of food"....so "ono" it brought back old school memories. The days of listening to Kalapana...back in da day...sippin' on Primo beer

ot59nkDXjN4TOCdKr4PETA.text: Ono! It was so nice to visit Vegas and have some delicious island food. You just can't get that where I live and miss it. Place is casual and has the local vibe. The mixed plate is awesome because there is so much to choose from. I suggest you get it with the fried rice.

2qQYp4yNXdAoYoyty_MZGw.text: Oh. My. Gosh. All your reviews on Yelp have compelled me try this place out and now I am afraid that no other place in Vegas will do what this place does for me. It's Friday and today's special was the "Hawaiian Plate" which consists of: - Two large scoops of rice - Macaroni Salad - Lau Lau ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La... ) - Ahi Poke in Shoyu ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Po... ) - Haupia ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ha... ) - Lomi-lomi salmon ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lo... ) I am completely ruined from other places. The serving size is awesome, the service was as good as it gets, the atomosphere made me feel I was in Hawaii. I never tried this place sooner because it's kind of far from home and work. I considered "far" from work anything past Warm Springs. Far doesn't seem so distant anymore. I highly recommend this place to anyone. I'll be dragging my significant other to this place in the next few weeks whether she likes it or not. And I know she's gonna LOVE it!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friday Special - the  &#34;Hawaiian Plate&#34; - 2 generous scoops of rice, macaroni salad, lau lau, poke, haupia, and lomi-lomi salmon.

mfDAKw5kNkJ01V_F-bbo3w.text: Food was great! Staff and place is really fun to be at! It's not like your everyday Hawaiian style restaurant because the servings here are huge! A friend of mine brought me here and I fell inlove with the Beef Kalbi! Love the staff because they were very accommodating.

NzbaZpEqmkg3-3g3jIJ8kg.text: Food was legit. Reminded me of home. Service was kind of slow but I think it was due to lack of staff. Poor thing they were swamped with people and only say two people working the dining area.

8kik3S1mDLGpKQxevMiaiw.text: I went with my group of guys and my boyfriend and as soon as we walked in the decor was very nice. It took a bit longer than expected for the server to take our drink order. When we received our menus I noticed the prices to be a way higher than the usual Hawaiian style joint. The menu was plain and had no pictures and the descriptions leave you wondering if it's going to be worth it or not.   My dudes ordered the Loco Moco and I ordered the mix plate with my boyfriend. My rice was a few hours old. My third bite into it I found a mustache hair or small black hair. I was disgusted because none of my dude friends have black hair, we are all blondes from California, so we can't be a suspect. I was disgusted not only because the hair wasn't on the top of my food, it was in the middle meaning it was mixed and cooked into the rice. That is extremely unprofessional for a kitchen staff. They have strict rules and regulations out here especially with the tourism out here. The manager came and said he has 3 restaurants 2 in Hawaii and this "hair in the food" issue has never occurred. I find it hard to believe as a former manager for Pizza Hut  and to never find any random item in food. The manager kept trying to get me to order something else from the menu but my stomach was in complete turmoil from this situation I only could drink my fruit punch, which the only good side was the free refills.   I came up to the manager and told him that I am going to just walk out and drop this issue and I left without paying because I don't feel my health is worth the price of the meal. He will be hearing form the health department soon.  Just please be careful people and check your food before you put it in your mouth.

WkyoShJQsaZVWX3xCsSLow.text: Amazing! Nuff said...L & L Hawaiian BBQ on steroids. Great food, huge portions, friendly staff. Place was packed.

jFRep4YGw-VsmPM1t2vJqQ.text: Best Hawaiian food in Vegas.  The food is delicious.  The prices are reasonable for the huge portions you get.  The service is awesome and the staff is friendly.  I would recommend going when they open, or in between lunch and dinner because the place gets pretty packed.

SlTnxBfz1mwKKx8amusNgQ.text: Delicious food, very reasonably priced and great friendly service.  We're looking forward to the live music on Friday nights!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mud Pie #Nom

5_JSGjLAFtdwGv4VzpCL2A.text: Wow. This place is amazing!   A few people at work keep telling me about this place. I swing by on a Thursday around early evening time to try it out. The inside of the restaurant looked like a place I would see in Hawaii. It wasn't over done but it was nice. The place looks like it could fit 100 people easily. What did scare me was the place was empty. Well, when I first walked in, I did see some ladies sitting on a table... but to my surprise they were the cooks and help just sitting around waiting for hungry patrons like me.  After telling them I wanted to order to go, they handed me a regular menu menu with daily specials and let me at it. They had the typical things you would see on any Hawaiian restaurant menu. What thing I did notice is that they didn't have any Spam entrees. After a good five minutes of looking over the menu, I decided on the following:  Beef Teriyaki Steak - (Bottom sirloin marinated with our special Asian sauce then broiled to perfection and sliced thin - $8.75) Wow. When they say Steak, they mean it! I have never seen Beef Teriyaki so large. Its like regular Beef Teri on steroids! Check out my pictures on how huge the portions are. The beef was tender and flavorful. I would definitely order this again.  Hawaiian Style Roast Pork - (Cooked local style with Hawaiian salt, cracked black pepper, sliced thin and topped with our rich homemade brown gravy - $8.25) Yum! What makes this dish work is the homemade brown gravy. The roast port was tender and soft. Large portions as well. Great dish. I would definitely order this again as well.  Korean Chicken - (Golden fried drumettes $ wings tossed in our delicious Korean sauce - $8.75) Yay! This dish was awesome as well. When I first cracked open the box, I just saw crispy chicken wings. I scooped some rice and pick up a piece with my fork and placed the chicken on my plate. I licked my fork and damn.... it was over. Just the taste on the fork was really really good. I had to dig in. So many flavors hitting my taste buds! I love this dish! Would definitely order again.  Each dish comes with two scoops of rice and a side mac salad. The mac salad was good as well. Overall.... I love this place! The food is awesome. The portions are large the price is comparable to other Hawaiian joints. I would seriously recommend this place to my friends and everyone else who reads these reviews. You will not be disappointed.   Pictures included!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Style Roast Pork up close
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Style Roast Pork
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Teriyaki up close

nIQ3hOoFtNpb_R0V9SSfsA.text: Choke food, and not that bad of a price.  Island Flavors plates kinda of reminded me of Masu massive plate lunch on Oahu.  So pretty much you'll be taking home leftovers when you come here.  The entire staff is very cool, but service can be very much like a bottle neck from 95 going to the spaghetti bowl during rush hour, but what the heck, this is a Big Island restaurant....we all take our time, and get it right most of the time.  When I come here, I usually get the teriyaki beef, and Korean chicken combo.   The portion is are opu-busting, and teriyaki is very good.   The chicken was a pre made fried chicken, but the Hawaiian style Korean sauce this chicken is dipped in made it a keeper.     Why the four stars, the Portuguese bean soup is too darn sweet, and have way too many beans, and not enough meat.  Also the mac salad was a bland Oahu style mac salad...not too impressive with those two items.  Only once, i made it out there for the Friday night for their Hawaiian combo plate, and the Lau Lau is pretty killer.      I highly recommend this plate, but I hate this drive on a Friday night from Henderson.

G6btfH3eUMrJe0pNCP7Dkw.text: I was told by a good friend of myne that this place was awesome! He said that they served choke food! So I went with my ohana to check it out for myself. We were greeted by the nicest people you'll ever meet and the place was very clean too. We ordered da chicken katsu moco,chicken katsu, Portuguese bean soup, and to top it off... Chantilly cake! Everything was ono!!!! I will definitely pass the word about this place and I will be back for the laulau next time!  Update: Da Lau Lau was so ono, I try to go every friday for my LAU LAU fix!

TMw8LobZLx_K_0yccwL1lA.text: The hoisin glazed beef is cooked to perfection. Even my picky daughter enjoyed it so much. We cannot finish the whole 8 rack but we are happy to take the rest home and thats the only left over that did not reach the next day.  And service was great too! Keep it up!!

om3WBn6nP5RkLVuwl1Mo8w.text: I always eat at this place when I come to Vegas with my family!!  I'm glad they serve brown rice with there meals that's a plus  for me!  Their bbq chicken is tasty and their ribs! The serving size is huge especially their desserts!  Guava cake and pineapple ice cream are ONO!!!  My kids love eating their spam musubi!  I would recommend this place to everyone got to try it!

2C7FvO7yKsgObyHIVtnIPw.text: Food was very good, but service was terrible. Took about 10 minutes to get waited on, once we did get waited on, i didn't have my water glass once. And it took forever to pay the check.

1V423vQ00XDdkoS-Vt6P7w.text: This place is honestly the best! The service you receive here is that of a home town hero shop back on the islands! They are so friendly and seriously greet everyone that walks in by name, that's just the least this place has to offer. The food is amazing here! The Korean chicken and fried noodles with chicken are delicious! Prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get and they always have great specials!

uCWTQ9uJUEL1tdxqcOwamA.text: I came here to meet up friends for lunch and I tried their ox-tail soup.  I have been on the hunt for delicious ox-tail soup that is available during the day (because I'm always going to The California hotel for ox-tail soup but it is only offered after 11pm there)   I have to say that their ox-tail soup is a-ok the broth was good and they gave a lot of hunks of the ox-tail.   I did however try the loco moco that my boyfriend had and the gravy was reaaally good!   We also ordered the guava cake and that was also really good! and the portion was gigantic -- definitely sharing size for 2 or more people.   Overall, we had a great experience. I'm a little biased because all I had to rate was based off their ox-tail soup and I love the california hotel's ox-tail soup.

yxVOQwAACkrOccAtCE_qWA.text: First time we came here, it was because I was craving poke and our regular place was already closed for the evening.  Now I can't imagine going to Vegas without hitting this place up for a meal.  It's about 5 miles from the strip but soo worth the drive.  The ladies who work there are super friendly and the food is delish (I've tried the pork chops, chicken katsu loco moco, and roast pork).  They have specials on Friday nights as well as entertainment (at least on the Friday we were there.. Our last trip we went on a Saturday and they seemed to also have had entertainment then but not when we were there).  Anywhoo, I don't have anything negative to say about this place.... it's just good Hawaiian food.  Oh, and definitely order the gravy.  Maybe 2 of them.  You're welcome.

s2C6mzFXEsNfRdey4kdPiQ.text: Great customer service.  Katsu loco moco....Awesome!  I'll definitely be back again and again.

xfrmh-qbOpf0nT8QlWvPSA.text: We were in Vegas a week ago and a friend of ours told us to try this place out, food was awesome and the service was great. I would recommend you try it out if you're in Vegas its a little far from the stripe but worth the drive.

3HT8uGkKOPywdM08dx_yBA.text: MIssed local Food So Much. Been away from the Islands for to long, so when I moved to Las Vegas from New York my friends brought me here. Let me just say In Pigeon "Broke Da Mouth! Aunty from Big Island I heard own dis place winas winas chicken dinna" Trying everything on the menu, Thanks so much. I go at least once a week now!!!

cW_Sk7DuUyAcIuJ8lBYJCw.text: Honestly the best Hawaiian food place to eat at in Las Vegas, hands down! Great customer service. Fast and always friendly. Joslyn packed my To go order and was very friendly. She hooked up with extra salad dressing, which is literally the best dressing in the world. Thank you again Joslyn, now my chicken katsu is going to be extra good....

I ordered the Portuguese bean soup, my friend ordered the mix plate, it was good but the soup was kind of salty, the portion is huge!!!!:)

VTv-SB9-L2-c-GVBZStVfQ.text: Great food always friendly and large portions. Busy but worth the wait for sure. Would recommend to anyone.

Vwat5m-WYsXC8Ze1sbpSHg.text: Ok, I'm not sure what the hype is, maybe not all reviewer people know what "local" food tastes like?  Maybe the restaurant's having an off day? I don't know because this is our first time here. With friends who've been here before, but not born and raised in HI. I had the loco moco, the gravy is not your stereotypical brown gravy, this was a tan gravy that was very bland. Our friends say it wasn't that bad last time, but uh, not good. However, the hamburger patty was good and homemade. One of the kids we were with said he liked the loco moco from Aloha Kitchen better. The furikake chicken was ok, looks really good but the taste didn't match the look. It was on the sweet side. Maybe we'll try it again, but there are a lot of other good places in this area to choose from, this wouldn't be a first choice for me.

OZaCynxnNT7cIAIYsMUMlQ.text: Can't go wrong with Hawaiian hospitality! Great food, huge portions, and great prices...what more can you ask for? While you're there, ask them about their Hawaiian music!

5KeYd4X4XmM3yK5ib6slZA.text: Probably one of my absolute favorite local spots in Vegas. Portions are huge, staff is very friendly, low key atmosphere, amazing prices and the food is incredible. Will be back many more times.

J9czC25ycWQS6SGkgx2_Sw.text: ALOHA LAS VEGAS yelpers!  just moved to Las Vegas and I found myself craving Hawaiian food!  Found I.F. on yelp and got super excited! Called in my order and picked it up.  I had the mix plate- pork/kalbi, kona coffee mud pie, and shoyu poke. It was my guys 1st time having hawaiian food so I talked him into getting the hamburger steak. I grab 4 spam musubi's at the counter.  We loved the food!   I'll def come back for more!   Take out or dine in. casual. indoor seating.  Big serving!   My whole order came out to around $50 fpr 2 people.  If you love Hawaiian food, stop by Island Flavor!  Aloha! - Miss Yelp 2011

i6tzxxUw8W2OVTqdzapFZA.text: This place is worth the small drive from the strip! Best Hawaiian food I have ever tasted hands down!  All the food that was ordered was amazing in it's own way.  Kalbi short rib  Chicken Katsu loco moco Furakake chicken   I honestly can't decide which one was better .   If the amazing food isn't going to convince you to come here, the hospitality definitely will. The lady helping us was so friendly and make us feel like we are lifelong friends. IXSILVCmQ7N4u69SgKf-4A.text: This Hawaiian food is as good as it gets!! My favorite is the mixed plate where I usually get the spare ribs, chicken furikake, and/or chicken katsu!! And can't forget my spam musubi!!

81oNZ1T9R2QMG8G_tPIAbA.text: I got the ahi poke plate from this place.. Was the worst tasted like the fish came out of a bad part of the ocean or they may have had left overs that they needed to get rid of.. Service was good but I will say the cooks/whoever places the food order for the restaurant need an evaluation.. No disrespect but I should have took my money over to 808 sushi.. Island flavor you take the L for my meal you served me today.. And Yelp! this is facts.. Good day my friend

2_fk_TWoShlRQgKoCle3hQ.text: Went there to eat tonight with my family. It was my husband,  myself, my 8-year-old, 5-year-old, 3-year-old, and our baby. it took forever for them to come and take our order. I sat for a good 40 minutes waiting for a refill on my water. They never brought one of the things that we ordered and yet it was on our final bill. And I was very surprised to see that they had included the automatic gratuity at 18%.  I was even more surprised to see that they kept the gratuity amount the same even after they removed the item that they didn't bring us... We normally tip well over 15% but in this case I don't feel that the service warranted an 18% tip... I'm glad that we looked over the bill because they never mentioned the automatic gratuity. The food wasn't as good tonight as it usually is either so all in all I have to say it was a fairly poor experience.d

zFH5NdJdX8ua4LnDhiftfQ.text: The only Hawaiian BBQ place I'm used to from Cali is L&L Hawaiian BBQ but that place has no comparison to Island Flavor. HUGE portions! Super fresh food. Prices are definitely decent.   What I tried: $12 for a combo plate with two diff types of meats. (meals come with 2 scoops of rice (they have brown rice), & a scoop of macaroni salad. I tried the furikake chicken X kalbi short ribs. Short ribs were good, not chewy & not too fatty. Chicken was a little on the sweet side but super crispy. $9 chicken katsu loco moco. I had the gravy put on the side so my chicken was super crispy.  $14 furikake ahi tuna. Fresh & big chunks. Flavoring was really good but just a little too smokey.  Can't wait to go back to try more!

BxTgrRhrhSJfV6L03ym8Kg.text: Amazing food, big portions and nice people. I highly recommend the Kalbi ribs and furikake chicken.

csH2tXdhmzhJTKEQnjSfog.text: This one is worth the drive. A coworker told me about this place but I live in NW Vegas and this seemed out of the way. I happened to be in the area last night an stopped by. I am glad I did! I got the mix plate with the roast pork and hamburger steak. My wife had the Furikake chicken. It was all great! Staff was friendly and the portions are HUGE! We will be back!   The live Hawaiian music was a welcome surprise.

2ZapgzDLLlJZZzBVQlPsSA.text: This place is amazing. The Poke was amazing. Though I have to say when ordering it make sure you know what your doing cause one mistake and you'll be paying an arm and leg. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh ahi poke. This shit is da bomb.

DxHMzWMBk5i3gUWsy1-zYg.text: Must try this place best island food in town.. Craving for good hawaiian food visit island flavor southwest area..

FmxDvNYEuazSBz9J6nDbmg.text: We tried this place about a month ago and had a pretty bad time. Firstly, we went with a group and the food took a very long time to come out. Of course longer waits are expected with a larger party, but it was a slow night and we waited much longer than anticipated. Then I had an extra wait because there was a mistake with my order (not the correct rice).  I wasn't really fond of the roast pork loco moco. I enjoyed the first bite but after that all I could taste was gravy. I only managed to get through about 1/3 of my meal because it was extremely filling, which brings me to the topic of our server.  Our server was the reason I was so irked after our visit here. After we got our food he commented on how little I was eating at least 2-3 times, and then again when we were on our way out. I thought it was very rude. The portions were huge and I actually ate all that I could eat - I am a paying customer, do not criticize me for how much of my food I decide to eat. It would have been one thing if I had wasted my leftovers, but I was taking it home anyway. On top of that, I thought he had an overall condescending and judgmental attitude while taking our orders and whenever he spoke to us throughout the meal. I am generally an easy going guest, honestly I can't even think of another time where I have ever disliked a server aside from the guy we had here.  Our last issue came when it was time to pay the bill. One person in our group paid the entire bill and didn't realize until after he paid that gratuity had already been added on the price. He said it didn't show on the receipt that he signed, and he didn't realize until we were on our way out that he had paid two times more tip than he should have. I didn't see the receipt myself so I can't pinpoint the issue here - but it added to the overall negative feeling of my experience here, especially because it was a large bill (and subsequently a large tip).  On the plus side, the hostess who greeted us on our way in/out was very nice. And again, portions are huge and gravy is plentiful - so if that's what you're into then I can see this being a nice place for that, but for us it was an awful experience.

k6VYbeuABvBXhVmdAZJX1A.text: So the first time I ever walked into this place, I noticed one thing.  Hawaiian people working the kitchen and Hawaiian people eating in the restaurant.  I knew I was in for a treat.  Unlike your run-of-the-mill fast food Hawaiian joints, Island Flavor stands atop my Hawaiian list of restaurants that are a must visit whether you're local or from out of town and craving that island fix.  The spam musubi is always a must for me to start, and my favorite two item plate is the Chop Steak and Furikake Chicken (this dish is so good, it will literally change your life or make you slap yo' mama, one of the two).   The Loco Moco and the Kahlua Pork are also staples if you're in the mood for something more savory.  Either way, everything here is top notch and you won't be disappointed.  The service here is also so friendly and fast! Mahalo!

O-1ACowEO8frKvUjNfjzxQ.text: This is What happens when new Management come in I guess!?!? We've been coming for years! And now that the Restaurant has been bought out the Service is bad. We ordered our normal Friday special plate, salad, etc. No Lomi Salmon, no won ton chips, AND all our server kept on saying was that they ran out of it! Are you kidding me? Then when I asked an Old timer server there (short portugese girl with a pony tail) She completely ignored us as well. WOW! What a sad way to leave a first impression on your clients with "new Management" Business will close with this type of Service. Sorry, but there is too many Hawaiian places that we can patron at and get better Service!

DRO-XlI_4wRbzKAPvQZqog.text: Another Gem in Las Vegas! The food here was delicious! We tried chicken katsu, furikake shrimp and chicken, fried rice, spamasubi, and Korean fried chicken! All so yummy! The service was also great! Very fast and friendly!

ZWgR1uCWmeHbEYAUx3QZzg.text: Made another trip here still the best Hawaiian food anywhere, and the friendliest people.  It's a must have when we come to Las Vegas.

BUWPM5fYjCukD7hxEcOzBw.text: I love and appreciate the amazing food as well with the big portions but the waiting time needs a big upgrade. As well as better customer service!

TgdAuaLK0W5fATlbSQIFiw.text: So far the best Hawaiian restaurant I've tried in Vegas!  The Furikake Chicken...still can't talk, broken mouth :). We tried to go back on Sunday but they closed early. This is one spot I will always visit when I'm back in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu :)

4mphN1aESlOIOQBf4US0Jw.text: I give it a 2 star because of the new management.  I've been going there for the past couple years and never had any issues I live way on the other side of town and it's a long drive there . They charge more for refills and they don't serve the same way they use to it's a shame that people buy a good restaurant and then want to change things up that's when you lose clients !   I don't if I'll go back there last time it was not worth the drive .

6ljXi-zAKjKNFuyWGLkWkg.text: Everything I've ordered here has been A1! From the poke choices to the korean BBQ. And the hospitality is as if we stepped foot onto the islands. Food is always amazing! Definitely would recommend this place to anyone looking for real island/Hawaiian style food.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DZiIJupZKzpscQYfh4EdkQ.text: Born and raised in Las Vegas , and I have to say, ever since the new management took over , the restaurant looks AMAZING! Customer service is top notch, and food and prices are better than before. Love this place and can't wait to go back!

LBZktROVbMI4E7ecYpzNFQ.text: Great HAYN STYLE FOOD if you no then you no can can also a small store next door for the thing you may not be able to find only thing that I didn't like was the prices of the shirts 30+ and the unavailable sizes always

qNRJA3knzsTwu379E3yYRw.text: My wife and I don't gamble, our clubbing days are in our rear view mirrors, and watching Las Vegas type shows are a little too pricey for us.  So, what the heck are we in Vegas for?  Our daughter and her club volleyball team are here for four days competing in the SCVA 30th Las Vegas Classic Volleyball Tournament.  Since we don't do any of things most people do while in Vegas, what else is there to do.  Well, I didn't mention the other thing people do, which is what we did here at Island Flavor.  EAT!!!  There are several Island Flavor restaurants in Vegas, but the one you have to visit is the one off of Durango.  Island Flavor resides amongst other tenants in a small strip mall.  We visited Island Flavor for dinner and from the outside you would think the restaurant is tiny, which it's not once you walk inside.  It's also dark from the outside because of tint they have on their windows, which is probably due to the scathing sun during the Las Vegas heat.  Once we entered, the restaurant was jam packed, meaning that we were about to embark on some good eats.  That was an understatement.  Our group of 5 had to wait a little while because of how popular this place is.  There's not much of a waiting area.  The decor is Hawaiian themed through and through with island decor all over the restaurant.  The staff worked hard to turn tables and provided decent customer service, but did the best they could considering how busy they were.  Island Flavor represented Hawaiian food really well.  As we walked into the restaurant, you are greeted by a display case filled with spam musubi, which should tell you what to expect.  I ordered the loco moco and ahi poke furikake.  Boy was I happy!!!  The ahi poke furikake was divine and tasty-licious.  It was fresh, seasoned just right, and combined with sliced vegetables.  I can say that Island Flavor's ahi poke can compete with the best of them.  I ordered half a pound, which was less than $8 and was a great appetizer.  When my loco moco was brought out, my group and I were amazed that it came out in a huge bowl.  Coming out in a bowl should tell you how much food you're getting.  It was massive and I didn't finish half of that dish.  It was doused with gravy, with cooked just right hamburger patty, had a bounty of rice, and was topped with two sunny side eggs.  Once I broke the yolk and watched it flow onto the gravy, hamburger, and rice, I was salivating before I took my first bite.  The conglomeration of everything really satisfied me except for one minus.  The gravy needed either salt or seasoning, but that meal with its massiveness is what I call True value for your money.  For my family of 3 and the amount of food we ordered, I really thought we got our money's worth and we were able to bring home leftovers.  I definitely recommend ahi poke furikake and the loco moco.  Although we don't do most of the usual Las Vegas things to do, we always do what Las Vegas is also known for, which is stuff your face until your belly hurts.  Thank you Island Flavor for doing this in spades.  Yummy-licious Big Time!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Flavor&#39;s Loco Moco is tasty and yummy-licious in spades.  You get soooooo much food that they have to place it in a humongous bowl.

StER0OFBmbNfDqcKB32I0A.text: I love this place... Feels like home. The Aloha Spirit is alive & well within these walls... There's no bettah compliment I can give a Hawaiian restaurant. Island Flavor is located in an unassuming strip mall on Durango. It's probably a good 15-20 minute drive via freeway from the Las Vegas strip. It is worth the drive. Trust me... Drove up and I knew it was gonna be good cause there were people waiting outside to be seated and also I could hear a small group (3-piece band) inside singing Hawaiian music. It was great. I felt at home... It's kind of how Hawai'i makes you feel. Aloha all around.   I ordered the chicken katsu loco moco after seeing photos of it by other Yelpers (mahalos!). It came served in a giant bowl. Let me just say that I feel classic loco moco dishes or any variation of a loco moco should be served in a bowl. It's only fitting. The katsu was delicious. The batter was light and chicken was not dry. The gravy that was generously poured over tasted great with the katsu and the bed of white rice. SO ONO... Sadly I was a weakster and could only finish half of this heavy handed portion of a meal. Even our waitress was giving me grief saying I cannott leave if I cant even eat half. HAHA.... Apparently, I didnt hit the required quota. I will make sure to represent mo bettah next time.  And of course we couldnt leave without having the coco puffs... I havent had them since when I was fortunate enough to attend my coworker's wedding on Oahu in which she had Liliha Bakery supply coco puffs & green tea puffs instead of slices of wedding cake... It was so good & so appropriate. Quite possibly one of the more delicious sweet things I've had in my life. Now Island Flavor's coco puffs are not exactly the same as Liliha's original version but they are delicious in their own right. Totally worth the $6 or so for the half-dozen. They top it with whipped cream too but that really isnt even needed. They are great and are a taste of Oahu for sure.  I will make sure to eat here next time in town which is thankfully enough next weekend... I'm gonna bring some of my friends that havent been there before & I'm sure they will like it as much as I do and spread the word as I have.

tm08z6AkAmJEwTc0nFFZ6g.text: This is hands down by far my favorite Hawaiian food in Vegas. I judge all others we try against Island Flavor. You cannot beat the authentic food and portion size they offer here. Come hungry, because they will definitely fill you up. The loco moco is one of my go to's. The hamburger patty is fresh and has great flavor, along with the gravy. Other favorites are their korean chicken and roast pork. You will not be disappointed no matter what you try here, I've never had anything I didn't think was great. Even their desserts are fabulous, if you can make it to dessert with the amount of food they give you. The staff is friendly and the place has that local vibe.

71g3GbjGE2mcG9LR2NfCug.text: This place is my favorite Hawaiian place! Portions are extremely large and you can add a second entree for a dollar or so ( perfect for left over nights at home). Really great value for your money.  The place is very simple looking, decors are very outdated.. Has this third world country feel. They are always always understaffed thus expect to wait long yet, the servers are really really nice. You have to be there very early to beat the crowd.  Aesthetics aside, I will Always always come back to this place. I adore the food and the price! I plan to try all their specials.   Try their guava dessert too, always moist!

Y47K1adKmoUt8-lqki-uyw.text: Went here this morning (6/1/14) because I didn't have all the ingredients I needed for ossobuco. I decided to pop on over to this place by myself before I headed off to work. With nearly a 5 star rating, my expectations were through the roof.  You know those movies where token "not whatever race everyone else is," walks into a bar and everyone turns around and looks at them and a soundtrack of a disc stopping plays in the background. Umm, yeah, that's what it felt like when I walked in. I was the only white person here and everyone turned around when I walked in. Super strange. Plus, two tables of people kept staring at me during my meal and trying to make eye contact. Whatevs.  Anyway, I guess I was channeling Michael U. and decided to try more than one item off of the menu. This is how I wound up spending $34 (including tax and tip) on a meal just for myself that consisted of soup, salad, and a piece of cake. Yeah, I can't order like that on the regular, regardless of the fact that I walked out with enough leftovers for another large meal.  I ordered: Hawaiian Style Saimin $8.75 I am convinced that the egg had to be rancid in this soup. It smelled and tasted off. Noodles were very grainy tasting and the broth was bland. I picked around the egg. Would not get again and would suggest you refrain from ordering this.  Island Flavor Salad $13.95 The Opakapaka (pink snapper) was great! This salad comes with a TON of dressing on the side and luckily, it is delicious. Loved the combo of flavors. The only thing that would have made this better is if it had some chunks of citrus thrown in to the salad. Would get again.  Guava Cake $5 BLAND. Tasted like nothing with Cool Whip for frosting. I was served this in a to-go box for whatever reason, but it worked out because I didn't eat the whole thing so it was already ready to go.  Service was whatever. I would have loved a water refill at any point in the meal. Seems as if there are a bunch of regulars because the waitresses were chatty and friendly with everyone. While the salad was good, I don't know if it was good enough to warrant another trip back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava cake $5 6/1/14
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;ll just have soup &amp; salad alone, for lunch... And eat for days! Saimin &amp; island flavor salad. 6/1/14

kHsAgYloHeIJfl5-mFmAmA.text: Best Hawaiian food in the South West! Cant get enough of their BBQ Short Ribs as well as their Loco Moco. Many of my friends order the Furikake Chicken but I'm not a fan of anything with seaweed. I've also tried their Chicken Katsu and it's pretty amazing! The staff is super friendly, on busy nights, you will have a little wait for your food BUT it is worth the wait! Price is really good for the quality of the food. If you are craving for some Hawaiian, definitely check this place out! Yummm!

TAIbUckqeh3VE8WKs-Pnag.text: Far away from the downtown but worth to go for sure. The food is tasty, especially after days on stripe

WivGvyFCIgDu6lWp3wigGA.text: Totally surpassed my expectations for yet another Hawaii comfort food place in Vegas. So far, based on my multiple visits, ordered dishes have been good. Most recently, I tried the Portuguese Sausage with 2 eggs, Hoisin Baby Back Ribs, and Furikake Fried Chicken. Everything, I mean everything was good. The sausage plate came with rice and mac salad. The sausages were sweet and not too salty. The rice and mac salad just sealed the deal. Drizzle that egg yolk and mix with the sausage and rice, and get ready for some hit the spot goodness.   The baby back ribs were near perfection. Pork meat nearly dropped off the bones and the Hoisin glaze was quite a unique sauce experience. The glaze was sweet but not that overly sugary taste you would find at a traditional bbq joint, but more of a refined sweetness. Not sure how to describe in words. Just order the rack.  Furikake chicken was delicious. The texture was crunchy and no where near soggy. Sweet, but not overly sweet. Paired that rice, and my goodness. You can't stop!  The location is off-strip, but on the way to Red Rock. In fact, it's nice to get away from strip madness on a Vegas strip. Regardless of the location, this is one of my to-go places on every one of my Vegas excursions.

Rgh4TqdMCkYARQkq6r5Hdw.text: Island Flavor (Durango) definitely deserves a 5 star rating. I recently moved to LV from CA and have eaten here many, many times. This is our go to place for our visitors as well. The food is excellent and tastes just like the authentic local food in Hawaii!! The Furikake chicken and spare ribs are delicious. The beef teriyaki is cooked perfectly with the right amount of sauce, and loco moco is tastey. Their desserts are amazing, especially the ice cream mud pie and the guava cake. Customer service is also excellent. Whether we dine in or order via phone, they are always so pleasant and embrace the Hawaiian family culture.

cgAPK_tI6pGre8esm40qmg.text: This was a recommendation from a friend who said the Hawaiian food out in this area is pretty good. I went with a classic chicken katsu, and you have the option of getting either katsu sauce or gravy. I asked for both, and they charged me extra which is lame because katsu sauce should be free meh. My friend ordered a mixed plate of kalbi and Hawaiian style roast pork. TBH I thought my friend's meat options were better. My chicken katsu was not as crispy as I usually like them, but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt because it was a to-go order. Also, they forgot my macaroni salad which is a muuust with any hawaiian dinner plate. However, this place redeemed itself with the gravy. WOW you can put that gravy on everything...your rice, the chicken katsu, my face...it was that good!!! I'm open to giving this place another try.

dnWxreujnpJgblXs4u_dxA.text: The quality and flavor of the food has really dropped since the change in ownership. Under the original owners, the food tasted much, much better and you could really feel the aloha. Whenever you went here to eat you made sure you brought your appetite because of the taste and large portions. Now, you don't even get mac salad standard and have to pay for extra gravy. The burger steak is saturated in pepper and herbs to the point where you can't fully taste the gravy and beef. It's sad to say but L&L has better food at this point. Alisa, your ownership and direction really destroyed a great restaurant. I suggest reaching back out to the original owners and learning how they did things coz the new way isn't working. I will no longer be eating here unless word of mouth reveals that things have changed.  Update: New owner says my review is not accurate. Let's be specific here. She means I was inaccurate about my statement that Mac salad isn't standard anymore but she didn't dispute the rest of my review. I will take that as an acknowledgment from her about the degraded quality of the food at Island Flavor. I also will state that I did not receive mac salad with my order. The new owner's response definitely confirms that there is no more aloha here. Alisa, sell this business before you drive it into the ground. Sell it to someone from Hawaii that really loves cooking and serving up good island food.

OR0vB9ghE4ETGYJh_986OA.text: My favorite Hawai'ian spot in Vegas! I LOVE going here. (Prefer this location over the express location near me, in Henderson.) There are a variety of local kine grindz to choose from that are a unique to this place.   You wouldn't really think about going to a Hawaiian restaurant for a burger, but I LOVE their Big Burger! You're probably wondering, "Really?! Why?" There's a unique seasoning they use in the ground meat that makes it one of the best burgers I've had so far in Las Vegas. The patty is thick and seasoned well, served with thick cut fries.   My go-tos are the furukaki chicken and furikake shrimp. They usually have the Hawaiian plate on Fridays, and other daily specials. Check out their white board near the front.  You can also make your plates low carb by asking for mixed veggies (sliced and sauteed squash) instead of rice and macaroni salad.   Make sure to save room for dessert or take it to go ;-). They have an amazing Kona Coffee Mud Pie, which is my go-to. Goes great with the Kona coffee they serve. They have a great list of other desserts as well.   In December, they had Punalu'u French Toast!!! So ono! (So good/delicious!) It's definitely a must try. It's made with bread from the Punalu'u Bakery, the Southernmost bakery in the USA, on the Big Island at an area called South Point (the southernmost point in the USA.) They also sell loaves of it next door, at the Island Flavor Market.   ** Note: Or they use to! :-( Found out on my last visit they don't sell Punalu'u bread anymore. (Please bring it back, if can! :-) )   TIP:  Also check out their market next door for Hawaiian food, snacks, slippahs, 100% Kona coffee, chocolates, t-shirts, hats etc.   There's always that Aloha service here from all the staff and it definitely makes me feel like I'm home.  **I noticed on my last visit a week ago, that the portions were smaller, and some prices went up. I hope they go back to the serving size they had before. Mahalo. Still my favorite place to get Hawai'ian local kine grindz!  2018 Yelp Challenge Review #3

8w-AItAV2GLCFS4bhQx7fA.text: Food keeps getting more and more expensive and wait times keep on increasing. Sucks, I used to be a loyal customer to this place. The food is still amazing; but 45 minute wait time for takeout? And now $15+ (pre tax) for a mixed plate? Yikesss  Edit: I order the mixed plate online through yelp(usually carries no surcharge) Teri beef and chicken katsu with rice and Mac. I remember when the mixed plate came out to $12 AT MOST. But the prices slowly continue to creep up. I highly recommend others to try Ross J's; they give you your money's worth.

p-rFcb-A90c-AAehPN5Hdg.text: I saw their post on Instagram about their ube cream puffs and had to visit while I was in Vegas. Made a trip to their other location, found out they didn't sell desserts there and was told to come here. Came here and was told that they don't sell it anymore.  But since I was here, I order their Hawaiian Poke plate.  It was way too salty and I didn't finish my plate because all I tasted was their shoyu sauce on the poke. I couldn't stop drinking water because of how salty it was. This was a disappointing visit.  Don't advertise something if you don't sell it.

oopDD3uUczsTqXh0Foqgvw.text: Being from the Big Island (Hilo) this place is a good reminder of the home style food I grew up eating!  The portions are very generous and the dishes make me feel like I'm down Keaukaha eating a plate lunch while watching the cruise ships dock... oh the memories!  The recent remodel and small changes to their amazing menu are great!  Usually a creature of habit but the food is still bomb and everyone is always so ALOHA when assisting guests.  My go to order is the combo plate with furikake chicken and chop steak... also gotta have a side of poke and if you're not stuffed to the gills with your meal- SQUEEZE IN that dessert!

G3c1yQ6zliIdGJ7v5PLrNA.text: Amamzing food, staff is beyond friendly and we ordered enough food to feed a nation too. Well worth the drive and I'll be coming back again very soon

7E3YPg4shFtaEqNKRu4akQ.text: Hard to find good poke on this side of town! Island Flavor completes southwest vegas! Be prepared to spend a little more than other places in town but worth it for quality. Chicken Katsu is another favorite of ours.

4ncaU6jJpyr3-xOTTBlRNg.text: This place is an absolute joke. We sat down and ordered immediately. We waited for our food for 50 minutes. Our server made eye contact with us maybe twice during this time and mumbled that 'it's coming'. After almost an hour, I let our server know that if our food wasn't going to be ready within 5 minutes, we would have to leave. At this point, our server casually informed us that actually, our order had never been put in and that we could just leave. No apology, no sense that they cared whatsoever. Literally the worst customer service I've ever had. I was so shocked that we just walked out in a daze.
