Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday special. Kimchee fried rice with garlic chicken and a side of spicy avocado poke!!

ulPz3GB8AQabznPw8VFCMQ.text: Definitely my favorite brunch by far. The prices are great, the food is phenomenal, and the service is absolutely uncontested. Feel like I'm back at home and I couldn't ask for more! Da Fluffy and Loco Moco is definitely the perfect post-club food!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da Fluffy

KyMslXChgvajxL0XkIDeuw.text: So yummy!! I definitely recommend the furikake chicken and avocado fries! The chicken was so soft and flavorful - loved it! Edna was best

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken and chop steak
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado fries

G0xsUA_GuQ5he7b7YVPACg.text: Ono grinds cuz!  Try the kalbi, one of the best in town!  Cool staff, always friendly and smiling!  Christine helped us tonight and she was the bomb!  My one lightweight complaint is I'm not a huge fan of aloha shoyu, I'm a kikkoman soy type. But the food here is delicious. Always a box to take home cuz the plates small kind big cuz. Thanks island flavor for existing!  If your in the mood for local Hawaiian food try check em out!!

W4Sv_KIYzjETK9_E5oOfqA.text: Great food! Portions are really big. Wish we could have gotten more macsalad. The furikake chicken is to die for. Just. Get. It. I got it with the Hamburger steak and it didn't disappoint!!! Mixed plate for $11.50? You can't beat that price. They also have POG (passion, orange, guava juice. If you haven't had it, please order it). You definitely get a lot of food for the price, and I have to say, I would choose this over L&L. Which says something because who can beat L&L Hawaiian BBQ? Next time I visit Vegas, this is definitely a must visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front menu.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken &amp; hamburger steak. In the back, furikake chicken &amp; kalua pig with cabbage.

rwYrqNYqlj0NuGzXmuzWUA.text: This is the best Island food here in Vegas. Furikake Chicken and Guava cake is a must. Definitely worth the trip. Ohana

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Min stah Mix Plate x 2!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monstah Mix Plate

dR2S5HUJPPKon82T_K4O8Q.text: This is probably the best Hawaiian food in all of Las Vegas! The food, staff, and atmosphere at Island Flavor bring me back to my vacations in Hawaii. You definitely have come here hungry as the portions are big enough to share or to have left overs. I always get the poke appetizer which is very fresh tuna. I usually also get a mixed plate which lets you get 2 different local favorites (either chicken katsu, beef teriyaki, chicken teriyaki, hamburger steak, shrimp, kalbi ribs, roast pork, chop steak, or korean chicken). The Loco Moco is also very good and on Fridays you can get the Hawaiian plate special with lau lau. Come hungry, hang out and relax to traditional hawaiian food that makes you feel like you are back on the islands.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken katsu and kalbi rib mix plate
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shoyu ahi poke
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hamburger steak and roast pork with gravy, Mac salad and side salad

Z1eBs0kNgD5pk5bwMHLsrg.text: Island Flavor is one of the best spots to eat Hawaiian food. They have great service, huge portions (really great to share but even better to eat by yourself), reasonable prices, clean, and what else can I say the food is delicious. My all time favorite is the oxtail soup; the taste is just perfect. If you never tried fried poke you are definitely missing out. Make sure you save room for dessert because I highly recommend trying the bread pudding and the mud pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mud pie yummy
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup

FzNsFI5VhQWCr1RmDxwItg.text: I LOVE this place. Friday's are always my favorite days to go so I can get the Hawaiian plate, but you have to substitute steamed rice with fried rice. Buggah is ono! Not only is it tasty, but the portions are HUGE. That's one thing I love about a place....the portions! They have some other island favorites Kalua Pig and cabbage, Chicken Katsu  and Kalbi Short Ribs are just a few to mention. Top if off with some haupia cake and you've got a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian plate Friday

QVxbfLUBnCJLiNMjAkVHEA.text: You can't go wrong with island food!  Dishes cost a little more than the commercial Hawaiian food joints like like L&L or Ono's, but the love in the food makes up for it.  And so do the portions!    I had myself a combo of Hawaiian roasted pork w/ gravy and chicken katsu.  The pork had just the right amount of salt and pepper and although the gravy was an added touch, I could probably just eat the pork by itself.  Oh wait, no, with rice.  Gotta have the rice.  The chicken katsu was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  Sampled the poke' and it was fairly good.  I say "fair" because I've tasted better homemade poke'.  I'm not really a fan of macaroni salad, but their macaroni salad is a level up from L&L's.    That day I "broke da mouth" but I probably also broke some skin and gained another stretchmark.    Hawaii is always a stopover for me when I travel to and from my island home of Guam.  Island Flavors is definitely going to be a stopover for me everytime I go to Vegas!!

BmPRwh2JL0XaDNgjLyn_wQ.text: Sorry, even the decor and friendly servers just can't mask the taste of awful food!  This doesn't taste like food back home. I tried a lot of things on their menu and everything but desserts disappointed. Their desserts don't count since most of them are baked by Andrea's World of Cakes?  Roast Pork: Where's the meat? Why is there so much fat?   Chicken Katsu: Why is it burnt?   Korean Chicken: Where's the spice? Why is there chicken fuzz still on it? Eeewww!  Kalbi/Short Ribs: Why so stingy and too sweet?  Portuguese Sausage: What is that weird after taste?   Lau Lau: Why is it so dry? Almost like shredded wet cardboard.   Furikake Shrimp: What's so special about breaded fried shrimp with furikake sprinkles on it? Come on, lets get more creative here.  Loco Moco & Hamburger Steak: Sure, it's big but why is it so bland?   Mac Salad: No, no. (shaking my head) So salty.   Spam Musubi: How can you sell cold musubi left for hours on the counter?   Kikoman "cheap stuff" soy sauce? You know everyone back home favors Aloha Shoyu!   UGH!  I gave this place so many chances and I ALWAYS left disappointed. Hey, shame on me for expecting the inevitable from this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Josephine G. is a dumb @$$. (LMAO)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Pork, mostly FAT! WTH?! Disappointed!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large but Disappointing!!!

dmGSdRoUOa0MYx4sAlrZ1g.text: Awesome Hawaiian food. The teriyaki beef is amazing! Actual chunks of steak instead of just cheap red meat. I'm all about customer service and this place is the best. You can't go wrong with the loco Moco!!

O2oxtA_exa91jVLvAkhPnQ.text: Best musubi in town! Everything I've eaten here has been so delicious! Huge portions absolute comfort food. My new favorite Hawaiian restaurant! I'd recommend the roasted pork smothered in gravy or the loco moco breaded chicken on a bead of rice smothered with gravy and topped with an egg. Sooo good!

mPX0LyXu5v9Ron5l64LxCg.text: Love this place! Everytime I come here from L.A I always make it a point to eat here.   You have to eat the Loco Moco the best I've ever had and it's "HUGE" also the Kalbi is great also. I am a huge Hawaiian food fan and there's nothing like this in L.A!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi and Loco Moco combo plate

1AvENEAPN_KQiHx4eDNEMw.text: Best hawaiian food in town, the food is so awesome here. Very large portions and the service is GREAT.

upw4LTnme_-w3_ZM-iTxGQ.text: The vibe is good, the employees are nice, the food is great, but what's worth it is the portion! Large meals for a great price!

3Zu64Qqw4aWUffHrXfMQsw.text: Island Flavor and I have gotten to know each other pretty well over the past year or so.  Always in search of good local food, Island Flavor has become king of Las Vegas as far as I'm concerned.  First L&L...then Aloha Kitchen...and Ross J's...it was like climbing the ladder of local food with each one being better than the last.  And at the top was Island Flavor.  Entrees under $9.  Gigantic portions that will feed you for two meals.  Delicious, consistent food.  Make you feel-at-home service.  This place really has all of the ingredients for creating a regular customer out of me.    My favorite dish to order is the mixed plate with Chicken Katsu and Teriyaki Beef.  Each plate comes with two scoops of rice and macaroni salad.  The katsu is breaded just right, not too thick, with the chicken still moist inside.  The teriyaki beef is out of this world!  Honestly, anything beef on their menu is amazing (from the hamburger to the teriyaki, from the steak and onions to the loco moco) and is highly recommended.  I've also had some of their pork dishes and was very impressed with them as well; I don't really like pork, but here is a place where I'll order it.    No joke, I'm getting some intense cravings for their food as I write this review.  Yes, I was just there a week ago...but for a good 6 months or so I pretty much came here once a week!  Highly recommended.

U2hYrxU9oVYOmuh0zr9GDg.text: Possibly the best Hawaiian food you will find in town! The portions are huge!!! Loved the oxtail soup and the kalbi ribs were just delicious. oh and did I mention the portions are huge?? The atmosphere is great as they sometimes have live music playing in the restaurant. I just wished it wasn't so far away from where I lived though or I would be here all the time.

quKrY1JkAbo1cghi8Im3rw.text: first time i went to this place was about a year ago, and LOVED it!!! its a lot closer to where i live now, and we go at least once a month.  service is great! food is delicious! and the vibe there is super laid back and it makes you feel like you're at home, and they definitely treat you that way also.  roast pork loco moco, beef steak, hamburger steak (which is HUGE! see picture), spicy korean chicken, portugese bean soup, fried poke salad...soooo good!!!  portions are HUGE, so you'll definitely have left overs or you could share. they have a 1lb t-bone that i keep telling myself to try. and im going to!!!  they have, by far, the best gravy!!! i dont know what it is about it, but you know its made from scratch. its not that really brown looking gravy that looks and tastes like its a store bought packet.  if you've had all the other "island" food out here...you MUST try this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. portugese bean soup
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried poke salad
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spick korean chicken and furikake shrimp

WVf-IBV0lA-LJIzZ78nPgA.text: Be careful if you come here, they have HUGE PORTIONS! I ordered the chicken teriyaki for lunch. Two to three chicken breasts, two scoops of rice and a scoops of macaroni salad all for less than $10.  The chicken was well cooked, not dry, but the homemade teriyaki sauce was really salty. The rice helped, but only so much. The macaroni salad was a little bland, but there was a peppery finish. The white rice, was white rice, not too much you can say about it except it wasn't Uncle Ben's. I do wish there was more of it to help with the teriyaki sauce and I wish there was an option for brown rice.  The waitress was very attentive and made sure my ice tea never stayed empty for too long. The only other drawback other than the salty teriyaki sauce is the location. I wish they had a location closer to where I live!

zuoFYlnFTlvMyozS5H8sHg.text: Are they giving away free food for five-star Yelp reviews?  I have been a here a few times for lunch and yeah it is good, but "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" ?!?!  The spam musubi is premade and cold.  The portions are large but the prices aren't small either.  It's the typical spread and an adequate atmosphere, but I'd be hard pressed to say it is any better than L&L or ... whatever the name of that place by my old job was.  I'm calling this one what it is.  Average in every way.

hZAmI60N2K3TUPvnesATeA.text: The best Furikake Chicken, Lau Lau, and Kalbi!!!

o2UTi5sKBkxxjLdQ95BDoA.text: Big portions and the food was just like how I remembered it in Hawaii. Too bad the lau lau is only available on Friday so I didn't get any before I left.

RX1gf8W8GDK2H96trQHaBA.text: Gotta eat here once or twice a month. Can't get chantilly cake anywhere else that good. The food is awesome not to mention the servings.

BDsa49E9mSAh9t2msc_IXA.text: Went here about 2 months ago and had great food worth 4-5 stars. Unfortunately went back again today for takeout. I got the Shoyu Poke and Teriyaki Beef plate. The beef and the rice were fine. Unfortunately the poke was horrible this time. Only time anywhere that i have gotten that dish where the fish was dull in color and smelled and tasted very fishy, not fresh at all like poke should be. Was very dissapointed because it was for my wife and she could'nt even enjoy it. I won't be going back again.

xaHAaxPulZ6EGwdJvxXR0A.text: Great food, great service...brings me back to Grama' house on the  Island. Prices are low and portions are plentiful. Def gonna be a regular, ALOHA

RUIGgDr36n4tZhlzplF_2g.text: Come hungry , be prepared for great food and the buttons off your pants to pop off! You will be reminded of the taste of the island!  A friend recommended this restaurant and without a doubt this is one of the best recommendations!  We are hooked on Aloha Fridays (the only day lau lau is served).  Once they run out their out!  The Kalua Pig and cabbage, Chicken Katsu  and Kalbi Short Ribs are one (and many more) of our favorites.  The Hawaiian Style Saimin soup comes with everything (not like other places that charge extra for wontons or vegetables, crazy!?).  Island Flavor also caters to customers who rather have steak.  The top sirloin and rib eye are served to perfection (tender and juicy) as though it was cooked in a gourmet steakhouse.  Now if you have a sweet tooth for good dessert, this is also the place!  Their Chantilly, Hopia and Guava cakes are to die for! Kona Coffee Mud pie and banana bread pudding are also a must to taste.  You will savor every taste by flavoring each layer of awesome goodness.  The servings are mammoth and the price is worth every penny, especially when you have enough for another meal the next day!  Island Flavor has such a welcoming atmosphere.  The staff is extremely friendly and attentive!  As often as we eat here, we came in as customers and leave as their friends.

YMSpPPkW1A7LCGbm-knuhw.text: Not a fancy place, but good food!  I like the teriyaki beef.  For about ten dollars you get a very generous amount of tender beef that looks like sliced steak, 2 scoops of rice and one scoop of macaroni salad.  We also like the Loco moco.  Talk about a gut bomb though!  Is dense and tasty, and no way will you be hungry after.  The service is hit or miss depending on who you get.

4DuFVhYNlaiDDmnOuJ_Bfw.text: Pretty yum food.  I had the korean bbq/chicken katsu plate with mac.  korean bbw was a bit well done and chewy, and katsu was katsu.  Service was awesome and would definitely return due to this.  As for desserts, I would recommend the guava cake.  Had Chantilly cake which was 3 stars and coco puffs with chantilly cream= 2.5 stars.  guava was 4 stars!

iXa1tLnHBmGUCwJqT-52uw.text: Your $$ is worth it, The portions served are for 2 people instead of 1.The sushi OFF DA HOOK!! Ain't no SMALL KIND here..lol. They don't skimp on the ribs. There THICK, JUICY & TASTY!! Their macaronI salad is to really good too.   The girls that work there are nice, But I think they could SPIFF up their customer service skills.... smile a little more. =). We live about 20-30 minutes away but this place is worth the drive. Gotta try there desserts too..BOMB!!!! If you like to EAT a lot, love tasty food, and get the BANG for your BUCKS... this is your place.   LAST visit on 10/11 -ALMOST everything is good here .. except for chicken katsu..(not my favorite) there's no seasoning.  I was so excited to bring my cousin that was born & raised in Hawaii and so sure she was going to LOVE and appreciate it especially because it wasn't on the main land what she ordered was really bad. The chicken katsu loco moko. The gravy was lumpy and thick it didn't look like gravy. It looked more like mashed potatoes. really tho!!! The chicken has no taste at all. I felt so bad because I raved, and raved about this place and the ONE TIME I take a family member there it was BAD. Really upset. I was so embarrassed.   As I read in another post, please go back to what you use to do and how you use to make it because SOMETHING definitely CHANGED. Change is good but it must be for a better OUTCOME.

SZ_IyO_KHEcgi6fEPC5UNA.text: I love this place! My local friends introduce me to Island Flavor and I have to say, the grinds = AMAZING! Plus the aunties are wonderful. The best in the mainland!!!  My favorite dish is the Loco Moco. They're very generous with the gravy and the hamburger is enormous!  LOVE LOVE LOVE Island Flavor!

6JUx5rT7oFhQ3Xtf2fCRtA.text: Everything about Island Flavor is great.  Reasonable prices, friendly service, excellent food, and great atmosphere.  People dine here reguarly and for good reason.  I enjoy the poke (furikake style) and I usually get the oxtail soup.  You can get a 2 meat combo for under 10 bucks.  Tonnnnss of food.  The qualiy of their food is really good.  Kalbi short ribs, katsu, shoyu chicken all very good.    I believe on Friday nights, they have specials such as Lau Lau, etc.    I also like how they play Hawaiian music in the background.

2xC4EhLHfZNS0HP4AUdQIg.text: I loooove this place! Their ahi poke is delicious. My favorite dish is their furikake chicken and portions are huge too! This place is a must try and one of my favorites.

WDaocfYxJlAs6Bv-4p2Chg.text: Got the roast pork Loco moco. It was really good. Only qualm I have is when I asked if they could add a burger patty to it, I was told that it would cost an extra 7.50... $7.50???? MIGHT AS WELL GET ANOTHER FREAKIN LOCO MOCO. GG. Regardless, food was still really good.

FFTxruMWZMKMP3VL9k6KOQ.text: Although this is about 6 miles away from the strip, it is totally worth the drive if you are looking for something different from the strip-type of food. We loved their poke, which comes in 3 versions. The one I got was with furikake, and it was a bomb! We got the one pound order and it was gone between my hubby and I. Hubby had the meat combo - pork with onions and kalbi ribs. He liked the pork a lot. And how many Hawaiian restaurants serve haupia? This one does! A testimony that it's authentic from the islands! Haupia was so good and my little one loved it after his fried chicken feast. We even ordered their oxtail soup for to go. It was a stomach-hearty way to start our Las Vegas day!

DSWH8loSgr5FLkb5izkX-Q.text: I overuse the term food boner, but unghhhhhhh, food boner.  I got the mixed BBQ plate; it was real teriyaki steak and teriyaki chicken. I picked up 2 20 oz diet pepsis, and my total was $14. Yum. Cheap AND delicious!  Ohana BBQ is down the street. I love Ohana, but Island Flavor was better quality. It's also closer to my house, so I think I might be sad to admit that Ohana might not be getting as much of my business anymore!  Definitely recommend going here for food. Portions are enormous; 1 dinner is actually 3 dinners.

S9n3pFtsuFiLXHr_plSyvA.text: The atmosphere feels like you were back home, excellent tasting food, Hawaiian sized portions, and our server Lei is one of the nicest servers there is!

fPC34aIe2muM7cyEY5BjEQ.text: Everyone is so nice and food is amazing. I always crave for the ahi poke and this place is simply the best for satisfying it!

NfDwSDmTdVhfbuF1aYj9nA.text: We have been here a few times!! Every time it's better and better. Best Hawaiian food in Vegas. The Hawaiian pork roast is amazing.

i9U71BFRW2cqQGGTvvS82A.text: Was excited at trying this place for the first time. Got seated in 5 mins & was waiting for someone to take our order. About 30 mins went by & no one took our order. Some people that came in 20 mins after us sat down, got there drinks & ordered. At this time I was really upset. Stopped one of the workers & told her that we've been waiting about 30 mins for someone to take our order & I see people that got seated way after we arrived ordering. She was telling me they have a phone order & I said no they came in after we got here. We were so ready to walk out but my kids were hungry. After this happening we are "NEVER" coming here again. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

543wC8nkidBlFXdQ8zSuwg.text: Just had the fried poke here for the first time and it was amazingly delicious. Got some mac salad and 2 scoops of rice to accompany it. Oh my! I only finished half of the order so I was happy with what I paid for and most definitely eating my left overs for dinner.  This was only my second time eating at Island styles and it has lived up to its reputation of being the best Hawaiian restaurant  in Vegas. I would come here more often if it wasn't soo out of the way for me.  Can't wait to try more of their menu. :)

vW1Ik_xoJEtwBJyyznJydg.text: Really good poke! I like that they offer fried poke too :-) I ordered the Kalua Pig, but it was really dry :-(  Overall, this place is more legit than other "Hawaiian" places I've tried :-)

FyaX2m6-oPyuynGZwl6e9w.text: Love this place. I come here almost as a weekly routine. One of the best Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas. Excellent lau lau. If you're trying have some great island food and vibe this is the place to go. I personally love the mix plate with the kalbi and tery chicken.

jU9wmkOiaO-VOIFzjOPB0g.text: Long over due to write a review for this place. I've gone here for breakfast, lunch and dinner plenty of times. Its a tradition now, to take guests visiting, for at least one meal.  The interior is fully decorated island style and staff are all hawaiians as far as I can tell. Staff members are also very friendly and easily make you feel at home. They always got local island music playing that just adds on to the experience.  My Favorites:  Chicken Katsu Loco Moco: Perfectly breaded chicken cut into strips, white rice, pair of over easy eggs and they're rich and thick homemade brown gravy (they're gravy is what sets them apart from every other hawaiian bbq eatery)  Loco Moco: Same as above except for the chicken, its a grilled homemade hamburger patty  Kalbi Short Ribs: Charbroiled, quite tender and soaked with flavor. If the bone was edible, there would be nothing left..  Korean Chicken: fried little drumsticks and wings tossed in their special sauce. Mild and uniquely flavorful, I can put these down!  Pork Chops: 2 pieces of grilled bone-in pork chops, topped with mushroom and onions. I always get a side of their gravy and pour it over and smother the chops. So So Comforting!  I've also tried their teriyaki beef and chicken, fried rice.. everything is great!  **Portions are HUMONGOUS!! As the hawaiians say "Don't eat until your full, eat until you pass out"   **Full Entree Orders Will Easily serve 2! Prices are very reasonable! Service is great!  One of My Favorite Hawaiian BBQ Spots!!! (and yes, I've been to L&L, Ohana, Shakas, the one in the California Hotel, Aloha Kitchen.. to name a few.. Not to mention some places in Hawaii itself)

3nvXqxxUAG6hlXyVKbTO6g.text: This place is B.A.*  loco moco vs. Portuguese omelet. Whichever I want, I can not finish it. Huge portions. Bigger than your average spare tire. But the wait is long enough to start looking at other people's food while waiting. Long waits mean steak and burgers, no? But compensated by the sweet, genuine service.  And the bill, is ridiculously small. Had to whip out my magnifying glass to realize how cheap the tab was.    I deeply recommend the mud pie dessert, which is also sharable.  *B.A.= bad ass

6GYkUv1Lp_OiIgmiRYjiDg.text: First stop for lunch on the way to Las Vegas with friends. I don't usually eat Hawaiian food so I wasn't sure what to expect. The portions were HUGE and the food was SO delicious. I ordered the Chop Steak & Onions, and the sauce was so good with everything! My boyfriend ordered the Furitake (?) Chicken and that was AWESOME as well. The food took about 15 minutes to come out but that was fine because the kitchen was taking their time to prepare it for us, and we all know that when it comes to food, quality over quantity (which in this case, Island Flavor had both!!). :) This is a must-try if you're around Vegas!!

UpOX_48LzdHgsvAud0wDnA.text: As we were driving around, throwing out ideas on what to eat, our Vegas local residence suggested and made the executive decision to come here.  Nobody who was familiar with the restaurant complained so I was down, I love Hawaiian food and I wasn't in Vegas to eat healthy.  I wanted carbs.    The place was fairly empty when we got there and the menu is pretty straight forward.  We ended up ordering family style plus three spam musubi's.   We got the loco moco and then the mixed plate (furikake chicken, teriyaki steak and galbi) substituting mac salad for rice and then a guava cake for later which we ended up eating at the restaurant. So my fatass pretty much ate a little bit of everything and loved it, especially their mac salad since I love mac salad.  We were trying to limit the amount of food we were ordering because we were planning on getting Mexican food later, but the 5 of us pretty much chowed down and polished off all the food.  The consensus at the table was that the teriyaki steak was a bit too sweet but the guava cake was really good, except Vince thought he was eating a strawberry cake....I don't know. My personal favorites were the furikake chicken and the mac salad.  The rice helped soak up all the sauces of the meats but I highly recommend swapping rice out for mac salad.   All in all, one of the better Hawaiian restaurants I have been to outside of Hawaii.  The food is much better than your generic, chain Hawaiian restaurants that are everywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pnTRrMRUQRrNFIdUaa-4bQ.text: Last night me and 4 of my friends decided to eat here because it's local food . First off We got there in time so there was no wait to BE SEATED that was the only good experience I had.  It took an hour to receive our food when it was received all of our food was cold.    Giving it an hour to receive our food I've noticed there wasnumerous tables that only had drinks and still waiting for there food and makes it worse they were there before us.  There was a gentleman by himself sitting down I felt bad for the waitress sat him down to a 4 seated table, then a couple of 2 walks in and she moved the gentleman from a 4 seated table to a 2 seated table so the couple could sit down but where the waitress had seated him there was a bigger party then came in and they needed that 2 seated table to connect to a bigger table to fit the party so within an hour the gentleman was moved twice that was such bad customer service.   ~Miss you aunty maile and uncle Bruce ... keep Hawaiian restaurants in Hawaiian hands!

JXEv8TB8BRghL8UDlm10uw.text: I remember coming to this restaurant when they just opened. It's a great restaurant located in the southwest area, the complete opposite side of town from where I live, but the 'ono local grinds makes the drive worth it.  The service is quite good, but they get hit pretty hard on Friday nights and the weekends so prepare yourself for long wait times. They usually have a live Hawaiian music jammin' on Friday nights.  This place is my go-to for authentic Hawaiian food. I make it my mission to eat there every Friday for their Aloha Friday Special which consists of pork laulau (with butterfish), rice, mac or tossed salad, lomi lomi salmon, and haupia. All their dishes are made there and seasoned to perfection which come out smelling savory and appetizing, unlike other places that serve frozen laulau.  A family favorite is the mixed plate with furikake chicken and kalbi ribs.  The prices are reasonable and servings are big.

sqf-_Vv3GmNunrwEtHJY2Q.text: As soon as we walk in, we're greeted with genuine Aloha from the staff, specifically Aunty Edna! The food was on point. We had the fried rice omelette & mixed plate with Korean Chicken & the BEST roast pork everrrrr! We couldn't eat the entire fried rice plate, so we took it to go, along with their famous Guava Cake. Besides the food, we come back for the service. The type you cannot get anywhere else, because their employees were born & raised with that Aloha.  Mahalo!!

yDPco_E-wqvwRMzR4YBB7w.text: Always something good from island flavor. It use to be just a small spot but after the renovation, there seems to be opening almost at anytime.  The food is fantastic- had the ribs and pork with cabbage and could go back everyday.    Service is always quick, clean restaurant, and good eats ! Highly recommended

_NeMLbX-xlJAwD9dH28_2Q.text: I can't believe I have yet to review Island Flavor. I don't have many pictures because I've only dined in maybe once here before they expanded to make the restaurant bigger. It's also on the way home so I love taking this place to go on the way home when I'm rushing.  This is our staple go to place for work lunch runs! We have given other Hawaiian places a chance but always come back here. I can tell you if I say I'm going to Island Flavor, all my co workers at least 5 of them will request to have me pick up food. Don't waste any time! Just come here!  My favorite is always the kalbi short ribs. They're nice and thick and full of sweet saltiness! They're also a bit fatty but that's why they're good!  I'll occasionally order the furikake chicken and the katsu which have always been on point too!  I have ordered the kalua pork with lettuce and they separated it for me from my other food to avoid it getting soggy on my to go order!   The portions are always huge and I recommend sharing or if you intend to have leftovers for next day then just prepare yourself. Don't go anywhere else. This is the place to be!  I've given others a chance and this is still the place!

vHOoHjyl0RxCPB6vds7yCg.text: The food was pretty good HOWEVER we waited for 1 hour for our food after we were seated. 45 mins between appetizer and main dish which was pretty odd especially when it wasn't that busy. I will try the place out again hopefully not a long wait.

ffkITbS7aS3bVMwAb2_WeA.text: LOCALS BEWARE. This is NOT the same Island Flavor anymore!!!  This place is horrible. We haven't been here in a long time since the new owners. Mind you prior to Aunty and uncle selling the place we was here on a weekly basis.  We came back to give it a shot. NOT THE SAME! get all haoles working with NO ALOHA spirit what so ever.   They also charge you extra for EVERYTHING even for the sauce that goes on the Katsu salad. Like they expect you to eat your salad dry unless you purchase the sauce for a extra fee.  And when i asked for sauce bc I wanted to dip my fries in it, she gave me my fries with the sauce poured all over it! LISTENING SKILLS LACKING!  we for sure will not be returning. I will be sharing this on all social media platforms.

x9MMOlNGPnb6jxdQwCdgqA.text: I've ordered from here many times and never had an issue. I love their food options and even dining in the food is always great.   Although today I ordered take out and got the Loco Moco and received burger patty very charred on the outside but some parts very pink.. I wasn't too pleased with this and did not finish.  I also ordered the Furikake Ahi Tuna Poke, this side dish I was pleased about, but if you have ordered here before new management ask for no chili flakes, that have recently started to add that to the poke.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordered the loco moco &amp; received my burger pink w/ black char mark. Seems very undercooked in some parts

cqLmt_VOr_urojyfpa_yNA.text: Been here a few times since the last review!  Food is still ono! Service was super fast today, just beat the lunch rush!  Portions still generous! It is hard to argue about portions when I have to take food home!  Spice Avocado poke never disappoints! Furikake chicken still ON POINT!  Laulau was super moist and ono! The Mac salad still the best of all the local restaurants around!  The mountain of fried rice is always too much to finish makes for a great snack !  Still worth the drive across town when we are craving some solid local food!  Keep it up Island Flavor!  Mahalo!

nr58-P-4oxZ-SHU0Ft7y6w.text: Fantastic service!  Clean space! Delicious desserts!  Thanks for nostalgic moments of my childhood!!

JSBl1TD6q0kgSJutbHL0dg.text: The most popular dish here seems to be the Furikake Chicken and I can tell you why.  I came here on the weekend and it wasn't too busy, they seem to be expanding as there was some renovation going on along the right side after you enter in the restaurant.  The windows are tinted so from the outside you can't see in, and it keeps the restaurant nice and cool.  The Furikake Chicken plate, undeniably delicious.  It's basically pieces of chicken with a nice thin layer of breading and sauce (the perfect amount of both).  Of course, it's topped with a bit of furikake.  Each bite is savory, lightly crisp, and full of flavor.  Accompanying the chicken is a macaroni salad and 2 generous mounds of sushi rice.  This plate is shareable and my girlfriend and I ordered a side of rice (they give you 2 more huge mounds of rice) and shared the plate.  Service is good here, everyone is friendly.  I would try other dishes here but man, that Furikake Chicken though.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Chicken.

_YOsyfAlzy2QCgeUDWVuBQ.text: I was really excited to go eat the boneless shortrib plate after seeing pics of it online. When I received the plate it looked really good but was very disappointed by the flavor. It was so salty and one of the pieces was all fat and sinu. I also ordered a side order of cucumber kimchee boy was that also salty. Was so disppointed. I had gone to their express restaurant  on eastern and that one blew me away, so surprised but the difference in taste..

Bu7ASDvdqe2OohVMb6Sqsg.text: Was really excited to try this place last weekend, pictures looked really good and portion sizes looked very big.  Ordered the tuna poke for appetizer, tuesday noodle special, and the furikake chicken.    When the food came out my mouth was watering and was ready to dig in.  Couple bites into the poke we noticed that it was very very salty.  There was way too much sauce and it tasted like the sauce had extra salt in it.  We felt bad to have expensive tuna re-done so we just ate it as best we could.  Was very disappointing to start the meal off with really salty poke.  How can you over sauce poke to the point where its just drenched in salt??  At this point our taste buds had so much salt in it everything else just tasted like salt.  Furikake chicken was good, but the glaze just tasted salt because of the poke we had eaten.  Noodles were good but that was salty too because it had pieces of spam in it and also was seasoned with some kind of sauce that was salty.  It was supposed to come with teryiaki sauce on top but I ordered it without it (thank goodness).  Overall, portions are big, the food looks great but be aware that it can be very very salty.  I have never had hawaiian food taste so salty, maybe that is how people like it in vegas, I am not sure.  The only thing that wasn't salty was mac salad which actually was really good.    Advice to the chef and the owner, please please PLEASE taste the food before you send it out, or offer the sauces on the side.  Once it is all on the food it will be too late.  I would love to try other thing on the menu next time I visit, I will just keep in mind to order everything on the side.

7NTDmHNL9SYpoqvcjUVxLA.text: It may look like your average Hawaiian joint, but Island is anything but. I wandered in with my boyfriend on a Friday night and was immediately greeted by the friendly staff and the aroma of the amazing food they had cooking. The service, staff and family atmosphere were amazing. A++ on the amazing food!!! We are still talking about how amazing the food was almost a week later. This is my new favorite Hawaiian place in town!

cIsVBFdftHd6xghXmhrHCg.text: I finally have some time to update my review after my busy tax season.....  I wanted to give an update to what happened after I submitted my review while waiting for my food at Island Flavor.  The owner Alisa P. must have received a notification that someone wrote a review on Yelp, because she called out "Who's Henry H?!",  I raised my hand thinking my food was ready since I had been waiting an hour or that she had read my review.  I walked up to her and said I am Henry H. and she asked me if I wrote the review and I said "Yes", she said she would be more than happy to refund my money without giving me my food since I was so unhappy based on the review.  I said I would still like my food and I wrote the review to indicate my displeasure of waiting so long for my food and that she should address the wait times since there were other reviews that complained about the wait times or she should inform customers that the food will take longer so that customers can wait at home instead of the restaurant.  Alisa responded with "I can't just go and make you your food right now!", which wasn't the type of response I would expect from a manager and especially from an owner when the customer is still waiting for their food.  I asked her what time it was so she could compare the current time and the time on the receipt of when the order was taken.  It had been over an hour.  Alisa took offense to my comments on the review and I told her it was coming from a place of constructive criticism to help her.  Alisa continued to discuss my review and how she doesn't like it when people write negative reviews online instead of asking to speak with a manager or supervisor.  Keep in mind that this all occurred inside the front entrance and I am sure all the customers could see, if not hear everything.  I responded and told her that our current interaction is the reason why people don't ask for the manager or supervisor; some people don't like confrontation and the fact that the restaurant looked really busy.  I have been a manager of a restaurant and have received complaints and I have also been a customer complaining to the manager, so personally I am comfortable with confrontation if necessary, however other people are not.  Based on my negative experience of waiting over an hour for food when I expected it to be ready in 20-25 minutes and also the undesirable personal interaction with the owner, I can no longer support this establishment.  If the owner is willing to speak to a paying customer with so much disrespect in front of other paying customers when she could be helping out her "team" during a busy time, I don't want to imagine how she treats her employees.  I hope you enjoy the positive reviews and take the negative reviews as constructive criticism.

ZKDyE_xt0gSIM6cTusEvXA.text: Great food.  I'm always here for good food. Good value for the price. I'm a local and a regular.  I always get the chicken katsu & shrimp furikake.

Xu9-Q9DhNuH9JfuIiSmaEA.text: The best Island food in Las Vegas! We always have to stop and eat here. I ordered a combination of everything from Poki to Kalbi to furikake chicken. So satisfying and delicious. We will always come back and visit when we are in Las Vegas.

IL1BsUnJLvZIYsTTuoz67g.text: Came with a big group and we all enjoyed our meals. Friendly service, good portions, and Kalbi is must try!!

QyI7DTDcnV4wj1O-j8RYsg.text: I use yelp as a tool to see what others are saying about an establishment or ideas on what to order.  NEVER did I think that I would be writing a review like this.  I have always been a loyal customer here, even when I heard that new management took over.  I overlooked all the negative remarks that I heard throughout the "Hawaiian Community" and continued to give the new owners a chance.    UNTIL TODAY!!! As I sat down for a late lunch, I witnessed the owner "Alisa" approach one of her employees - a female server and walked her to the back into a office I assume. What I heard was appalling and heartbreaking!  I heard this grown women that is supposed to be a professional business owner screaming at the top of her lungs "GET THE FU@K OUT" and  continued to scream at her employee and kept repeating "GET THE FU@K OUT" I watched the girl walk out teary eyed and embarrassed and yet still managed to smile at me, grabbed her belongings and left .     How dare she speak to anyone in this manner, an adult behaving like an immature child!! She is clearly unprofessional, ignorant, and a disgrace to the ninth island community as I found out today from a friend...that she refers to us as "You Hawaiians" in a demeaning fashion as if we are beneath her.  I am WOW'D and OUTRAGED and will make sure that the entire HAWAIIAN community hears about this!!! Alisa, you have a lot to learn about the Local Community....remember where your bread and butter comes from!

4F81fH6NpKaAOxZ2IhzU3g.text: Every time I'm in Vegas area this will be a go to spot for me. For someone who has family from Hawaii and who live there, these flavors remind me of my grandma's home cooking. When I come I try something new. And let's say, no matter what you end up trying you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake shrimp &amp; Teriyaki Chicken. Their Mac salad is the best.

PnDrlA2iYO8-j9n9rUi0TQ.text: I used to love this place... please look through all of the recent low-star reviews. Many of these are repeat customers for years. Even if the owners have "owned it" for the last 8 months, I can certainly tell you that prices have changed and portions have changed. They used to give you 3 Kalbi short ribs laid uncut across the plate. Now they chop them up, and it's really only 2. Also all other portions have been reduced. Don't believe the lies when the owner says they increased the portions. They just changed the plates!! Maybe not ALL portions changed, but most protein did. Being honest $15 is a lot for a mixed plate with smaller portions.   The ambiance is GONE and doesn't feel like anything special now. I don't recognize many of the staff as I used to. Going to try other places. Makai up the street has a better feel and pretty tasty food, with lower prices.   Disappointed overall and not going to buy the owners canned replies and fickle replies... saying they didn't raise prices, then saying on another post that they did... saying they didn't change portions when sooooo many people noticed they did!!! And don't get me started on the recent reviews of cold owner replies and the barrage of management issues with employees. :( sad.   Previous review.... sadly, I no longer agree.  We always love the food here. Can seem pricy compared to other Hawaiian places, but the portions are large to compensate for that. We often get two or more meals out of one plate! Never had any issues with the food, and every time our family is in town they like to go here. The staff is always friendly and treats you well. I often order ahead and pick it up to take him. Very satisfying food to a crazy work day!

IXUM9d2hdsC2-0qFiy5NIA.text: Can't believe I've never stopped by here! With all of it's great ratings, I can see why. I'm not Hawaiian but feels/tastes/looks like home-cooked meal in an affordable price range.   Quickly greeted and sat (I hear it's lucky to be sat so quickly) and the server was kind. There are many different selections and most of it being TASTY, SAVORY, and LARGE portion of food. I got the mixed plate which comes with two scoops of rice and a small side of macaroni salad.   Everything was very tasty and it comes at a reasonable price. I'd highly recommend to anyone. Don't pass up on this gem.

QHJHLNjw8FfrHUS1HlvPgg.text: Just walking in the door and having people smile at you and greet you makes all the difference in the world. Especially when you look around and see a full house. If I were to base my review just on customer service alone it would get 5 stars, if it was possible to keep adding to that from being in a clean environment and having excellent food, I'd keep adding. Never had oxtail soup before but it was the bomb. I came with an appetite, chicken and shrimp furikake was on point. Almost lot my mind eating the avocado fries. I was already full but couldn't put it down. Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

4POAtb_bIdU9ah3jkYpOPw.text: Brings back memories whenever I eat at Island Flavor when I use to live in Oahu. Everything is great and authentic! I would recommend the Spicy Avocado Poke 1/2 lb for a great pupu to start. As for something to drink....it's not on the menu but I mix their their special unsweetened Ice tea with the Pog guava juice which gives a nice refreshing taste blending the flavors together! Please keep note that this place gets busy and the food wait time may be long but worth the wait when you get your food! Silvia was a great server!

mZsFbuMqctCwbaaQ0ID6TQ.text: Terrible service made a to go order came in 10-15 minutes later when they said it'd be done and they didn't even have my food or order on file acted like I never even called. Asked my name 20 different times and spoke to me like I didn't know what I was talking about and said I probably called a different place. I'm like no I live across the street I come here all the time and have number saved in my phone. Since this place was sold apparently went downhill and service is incompetent.

kFAL6IBNpF1-u6L_ZcYWbA.text: I have been avoiding this place for quite some time It's  a little out of the way for me and the place had dark tinted windows on it which was kinda a turn off  I understand that place faces west and they get a lot of sun but I just didn't like it cause I couldn't see inside the restaurant   I walked in and was pleasantly surprised with a  home like feeling restaurant I was greeted by a hostess or cashier and a server Both had smiles and was very welcoming  I ordered the mixed plate that is served with 2 proteins and a side I started with teriyaki steak the sauce looked pretty thick and it was sooooo good Finally !! a place that actually gives you steak rather then beef and then I tried the furikake chicken and it was also very good It was tender and juicy My only challenge with this meal is that I couldn't taste the furikake If there was I couldn't taste it ?  There was also the macaroni salad which tasted a little different then most of the other salads that I have tasted It had something different or flavor in it In a good way though I'm so happy  in how good this place is and was super unfortunate that I did not visit this place earlier But that's going to change I will be visiting this place ASAP!

eUHfOdRkJJcow3osw7nZkg.text: The portions of food are huge! Definitely worth the price. The vibe is great, the staff is friendly. I would definitely come again. Food taste amazing as well!

RImqf_p0v-d_fJoLux1IFQ.text: First time dining here and it was really good. Big portions and very flavorful. Attentive service.

Xf6DPML-KhwXXMAPqVljyg.text: Food is delicious ! And the portion sizes are over the top ! I Had lunch and dinner the next day , that's how generous the portions are . Loco Moco is the best that I have ever had !! You must try it :)

oqFtSqks775sPFVtfNkw1A.text: This is probably my favorite lunch spot in town. It doesn't look like much from the road considering it's in a plain shopping center, but trust me this place is a diamond in the rough. Awesome atmosphere when you walk in with a nice island vibe and laid back tunes playing at a comfortable level. The food is amazing here and no matter what I've ordered I've loved it. The portions are huge! Usually when portions are big they skimp out on the quality but not this place. All the chicken and need dishes are amazing and the Mac salad is one of the better Mac salads I've had. This place can get busy though so make sure you have a little time to wait. Trust me the wait is worth it and you won't regret stopping in!

OA8qMYBZNmPd1-ShVF-yFw.text: I absolutely love this place! The food is always delicious! Love the Kalbi, Poke, mac, Chicken  Katsu, fried rice, everything! The people make you feel like family. Even us Haole's, Lol!  Save room for the bread pudding!

h_f3eymrKRs6ON2wzuH5yw.text: Best Hawaiian food in town. Large portions for a good price. Original owners are from big island and I've been to that restaurant and the food is the same.

_9CuCr_KeYIwZN578Ql1aw.text: After a nice dinner out with my friend, we decided we wanted a little dessert to top off our evening. Thinking about all our options in the area, we finally decided to head to Island Flavor. I had never been before, but my friend kept raving about their cakes, so I was excited. I opted for the guava cake and my friend ordered the Haupia cake. I also ordered a kalbi plate to-go for my fella.  The guava was delicious, but the Haupia was my real favorite. Both were incredibly fluffy and light. Delicate flavors, I can't wait to come back for their desserts alone. Service was quick and refills were plentiful.   Our takeout order was ready quickly and we were on our way. I couldn't resist taking a bite or two of my fella's kalbi plate as well. The meat was flavorful and cooked well. It had a nice smoky flavor and the mac salad was one of the better versions I've had. Not overly creamy and complemented the meat and rice perfectly.  The food was great and I look forward to coming back to try the rest of their menu.
