RIvCx2LTk7y-hXnslhSvUQ.text: We have enjoyed coming here the past few years. However, in the last few visits, the service has been sub par. We literally just walked out of this restaurant. After we were seated no one came by to acknowledge us. We waited and waited. Long enough for someone to come by and take our drink order and even our food order (because we've been here so many times we knew what we wanted). Time to go somewhere else. On the way out I said to one of the cooks that the service was poor and he had a stunned look on his face. Then I noticed in the hall, two female servers in the back just standing there talking. Very disappointing.

l2MWvaneQL8VL6shoyWjgg.text: awesome service delicious food good variety of menu items! live music! because of the following i will always have island flavor as one of my top restaurant choices here in las vegas! feels like im home every time!

bsvRMv8kV4yRo2Z_NbE04A.text: Wish it was closer to my Northwest side of town . Always enjoy their portion and prices! Best one I always order is Kalbi and furikake chicken mixed plate! Taste and feel just like home!

TQbT6IWfouw7XQoC4c7Lsg.text: They have HUGE portions. I ordered their Katsu Chicken and its like 2 meals in one for only 9 fucking dollars. Shit is so good, their mac salad is fucking . Their teriyaki steak is  too. Everything here is fucking bomb

OmxtKxrkp_vUbuRNaMKEXw.text: Wow what more can I say about this place! Probably my favorite place to eat. Great combo plate that's well worth the price.

OJvirQdOm6K5PRTjX5l-Vg.text: The closest thing to feeling like you're on the islands back in Hawaii. The staff here really brings out the Hawaiian vibes. Compared to the food back on the islands this is as close as you can get. The portions are very generous and you can always take it home for later if you can't hang with it at the moment. Over all this place is onolicious!

FYBu3Z5Qn0PXR_yNnYMuoQ.text: Food was great and super flavorful but honestly the guava cake it's what did it for me! Try the cake and you will be obsessed!!

Lw73CtSC2ljYWbu75eAyAg.text: I love Island Flavor!!  Two of my friends recommended this place so I went ahead and gave it a try.   I ordered combination short ribs and chicken katsu with brown rice and macaroni salad and half a pound of ahi poke with the japanese seasoning.   My ahi poke was fresh and nicely seasoned. Their servings were huge!!! You may want to try to share a plate with a friend. The short ribs were cooked perfectly, as well as the chicken katsu. I liked how the batter was crispy, yet the chicken was still moist. The brown rice was overcooked, and I did not care for the macaroni salad.  Overall, still a great Hawaiian joint! I'll be back for more!

WN9euVdIF9r0TJrLM85B7g.text: PROS:      Portions - you could easily share with someone if you aren't into leftovers       Hours - open late!       Quality of food - everything I had here was delicious. The better half did a "pick two" with the shrimp and Hawaiian pork and I had the chicken katsu. We would have ordered more if we weren't stuffed with leftovers in hand  already.  CONS:       Service - very wishy washy depending on the staff working that day. One of the girls is extremely friendly while one of the other servers always has a confused look on her face and doesn't bother asking if you'd like the green salad or macaroni salad, which I think are extremely different and can make or break a meal.   VERDICT:       While the service here sucks, the quality of food (taste and portions) will keep me coming back when I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu - HUGE portions!

SHa_QDuhoVxtAzZg6ETkqA.text: This is the best Authentic Hawaiian spot in Las Vegas! L&L is authentic Chinese now, not that I don't like Chinese, but you can cook Chinese and call it Hawaiian. The vibes @ Island Flavor are super chill, staff is very humble, no rush added after we pay. Air conditioned for us big islanders but the food was on point! Furikake Chicken/ Kabli plate w/ fried rice and mac salad. So good!!!! Oh and the Poke so fresh! The best tho is the Guava cake. My wife gets the Chantilly cake! So good

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Poke 1/2lb

yoZxEtCZ0VZyWN5bFcaEPQ.text: Great food. This is pretty all about the food. Which is why we're here, right people? First off, if you're a couple you can usually be seated immediately. If not, you may wait half an hour until your party is seated. Now, food. Let's taco 'bout food. It's amazing. THE END  Pros: casual, clean, dark, delicious food, price  Cons: hours of operation, no wifi, smal,   Overall: The decor is cute. It feels like you're eating in your Hawaiian grandma's dining area, AKA the couch. Their is a bathroom, and there is also Apple Pay. Two thumbs up in my book. The location makes it easy to find parking, as well as see from the street. The sign is green. The chain of operations in east. Walk in, wait to be seated, order from the double sided laminated menu, enjoy the food the cook worked hard to prepare, order dessert (I enjoy the Kona Coffee Mudpie), pay, day thank you, coke again. Lol! It's really good! And on your way out you can grab a couple of spam musabi for a feeble price of $2-$3 each. What's not to like? Mahalos!

tl1HsifT-XRuwICo5KUk4g.text: Was in the area around lunch time and I mean literally in the area because this place is really out there. About a couple miles west of the 215 off the Durango exit, you will find a little bit paradise at this location. Well, foodwise anyway.   As you come in, you will see that they have plenty of tables. Since it was lunchtime it was a bit busy but I was still able to get an open table. I was greeted warmly and was sat down right away.   Looking over the menu, I decided to go with the mixed plate combo of Kalbi Ribs and Kalua Pork. I went with Brown rice for no extra charge which is a plus. Lastly, it comes with a side of Macaroni Salad.  I got 3 nice pieces of Kalbi Ribs. I thought they were a bit on the salty end but still ok. The Kalua Pork came in a cup mixed with cabbage and basically in its own cooked juices. Good flavor. The Macaroni Salad was really good. I can taste the pepper that has been mixed into it. The Brown Rice was a bit dry like they cooked it early in the morning and it has been on warm the whole time. Overall I think the Ribs could have been a little less salty and the Brown Rice maybe could of had some kind of teriyaki sauce on it so that it wouldnt of been so bland.  Service was pretty good. Got everything I needed in a timely manner. I spent a total of 13 bucks and some change because the if you get the Kalbi Ribs as one of your choices, its a dollar extra.   Overall, its not a bad to place to eat especially if you are in the area. Next time I am thinking of trying their Poke Salad although people have said that it has doubled in price. I guess I missed out on those days then. Once I try it, we will see if its worth the price.  Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #107 "Island Flavor in the boonies, literally"

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Address, phone number, and hours.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Plate with Kalbi Ribs and Kalua Pork.

-7KLLCDAOuuqkvoOLiK1rw.text: Island Flavor is the best Hawaiian food in LV. The chicken Katsu and roast pork are great and the portions are large. The restaurant gets super busy because it really is delicious food. The wait at the front is long sometimes and it gets a bit confusing when some people are there to be seated and others are there for pick up. This is my one hesitation.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5ZPNfjkFiUXCvVXiOGuVdQ.text: So went here for a late lunch on a Wednesday... It was around 2pm, and the place was packed! Luckily we were seated right as the extra people started coming in... At first, the lady working was a little intimidating, like a tough older sister. My family joked that we didnt wanna ask her for anything! Later on as the things settled down, she became more friendly, and her big sister attitude stayed (love it!)...   Anyways...   Oh my goodness... I had the furikake chicken... To be honest, I tasted just a tiny hint of furikake on the glazed pieces of chicken. It mainly was a sweet taste that was yummmmy!... I also got hamburger steak that comes smothered in gravy with a little bit of onion and mushroom. A super heavy meal, those plates are good for sharing! My husband had the chicken katsu loco moco. Again, A huge serving that comes in a big bowl, also tasty... I later tried my moms leftover chicken teriyaki.. That too had a good taste that wasn't too sweet or salty, but full of flavor.   I love the family vibe I get from this place. Big sister (aka our server) even told my husband she'll give him a slice of cake for free next time we visit! (After seeing him eye every slice of cake that came out of the kitchen)... We were too full to get a slice at the time.  Pls come check this place out!..

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake chicken and hamburger steak
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu loco moco

tmU3lvY5Ffj4WceSI-6lmg.text: Believe the hype. If you are craving comforting, onolicious cooking then this is the place to go.   SERVICE Fast, attentive, helpful and friendly. Awesomeness.  FOOD I ordered Loco Moco: 10oz homemade hamburger patty on steamed rice topped with two eggs any style and brown gravy. Choice of original, roast pork or chicken katsu. Patty was good but my gravy felt like it had too much butter in it.   I do want to point out that their serving size is HUGE. It seemed that all the other table asked for a box to take the left overs home. When my server handed me the order, I immediately started to wonder if I accidentally ordered triple mega extra large or they mistakenly thought I was participating in some kind of eating contest. Honestly, the dish that loco moco came in look like a bathroom sink. I could dive in and swim in this. What even.  No complaints because left over means you get to enjoy more. Plus the price is really cheap considering the amount they give you.   CONCLUSION Island Flavor is as good as it gets. Easily my top favorite Hawaiian restaurant!

3L8475QZ73Ku9LKUsG8wRA.text: Of course I got the loco moco but instead of hamburger I swapped for spam. The brown gravy on point, rice cooked perfect. I was a little sad though because I asked for over easy eggs and they were cooked all the way, no runny yolk for me. Plus I like a little more crisp to my spam not burnt but a bit more browned. I'll be back and next time I'll let them know about the type of cook I want and to make sure my yolk runs. Lol!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think I forgot to say the size of my meal was amazing!

3I3lTFKb1d7frUSzWm2YQw.text: Went here when my family is in town. We loved everything that we ordered. The service was fast and always with a great smile. They are always willing to help you with your order. That day was my third time going in there but it was my family's first time. They want to go back again when they visit me.   Sweet and sour short ribs was the special for the day and it was AMAZING!!!  Chicken katsu and shrimp furrikake was so crunch and stayed that way until the next day when I was eating leftover.  Kalbi was great since it was so tender!!!  Can't wait for my next visit!

VU6q6ytYKxM8K6hhxs2G0w.text: Came here on a Sunday morning on a good hangover.  Some good local friends assured us that this place was the BEST Hawaiian food in town.  I haven't had any other Hawaiian food out here in Vegas but it sure is better than the few I've had in San Diego.  I ordered the Loco Moco and the serving was like home (Enough to feed 4).  You know how us islanders do!  Chicken Furicake was full of taste and hit da spot on point, as the Kalibi Ribs were big cuts and good as expected.  Of course I had to try the Poke, it didn't disappoint for being a whole state east from the Ocean. Overall if you on an empty stomach, make a stop here and expect to leave with a full stomach feeling more than satisfied.  Its DA KINE!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco, Kalbi Ribs and Chicken Furicake, Poke

TPKe_FPOJcL-RY97CF9vfg.text: I've never been to Hawaii, but I adore their food.  It's a great balance of comforting calories and guiltless raw fish, playing with Asian flavors of sweet and salty.  And just as I imagine the warm culture of Aloha, I can taste the love, the bear hugs and coconut massages in the food of Island Flavor.  It's a tiny space, usually PACKED on weekends, and even if they have live music on Friday nights, the place remains to be a low key, well lit family restaurant.  Go here with family, with good friends and a HUGE appetite.  Hubby and I always get the same thing - half a Furikake ahi poke order, and we share a combo plate of Kalbi ribs and Korean fried chicken.. with extra macaroni salad and fries.  Real tasty stuff, and a good bang for your buck.  Our bill always stays within the $30 range.  Their teriyaki chicken, steak and onions hit the spot, and their Chantilly cake ROCKS.  It's also the first time I've ever tried a loco moco.  To the Filipinos out there, it tastes exactly like a burger steak meal with thick gravy, except it's served with egg.  Perfect hangover or stoner food.  Go go go.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi and Chicken Katsu (I get it with loco moco gravy on the side, yum)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Poke Furikake!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco

F8C0WEr-ONhgeJoYSXvESA.text: Feeling blue..homesick?...walk in and you feel like you are back home..  Big portions. ..all the classics...roast pork..Chantilly cake

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DYIHvr0kEVouZ205fcoUmw.text: This is sit down Hawaiian restaurant. My friend and I were searching for a place to eat while we were in Vegas and  saw the good reviews of this place. We were wondering why it had two  $ signs and realized that it was a sit down restaurant. Don't be scared of the two $ signs when you come here. The serving size more than makes up for the couple bucks more you pay. Most of my friends paid about $11-$12 and had half a meal to spare. I, on the other hand, devoured my food, partly because it was delicious  and partly because i was so hungry. I ordered the chicken Katsu plate and it kept me satisfied for the rest of the day until late night for dinner.

e5TaNLG75QXYrlx0qftXIw.text: We were interested in finally trying Island Flavor, so I arrived here in a party of three one weekend. We stood waiting at the front without being noticed for who knows how long. The cashier woman and the three servers went about their business acting unaware we were there. Not one glance and not a single 'Hi, just a moment please' or 'Have you been helped yet?' (you know, those simple phrases that every other restaurant uses to greet incoming customers?). After standing idle up there for an indefinite period of time we were miraculously sat down.   So we quickly ordered realizing things would take forever if we didn't take action immediately. The food was good and they do give you fairly large portions for what you pay for. However, the restaurant's bizarre ongoing neglectful behavior ensued. As we were eating, another party sat down next to us and I witnessed as all three servers took turns coming by this table to give their happy undivided attention within a brief time span while we were barely serviced by our lone server during our entire stay. We thought of trying the Chantilly Cake, but after realizing what we'd have to put up with we just decided to pay. After not being able to get someone's attention again (even when calling out!) we got up, paid at the cash register, then drove off to find dessert elsewhere.     From the moment we walked in to the moment we left it felt like we weren't wanted there and the people working could care less. When I read through Island Flavor's other one-star reviews on Yelp I found out that those people's experiences were very similar to mine. I don't understand this restaurant. It's like they deliberately ignore and sacrifice certain customers just so they can give everybody else the VIP Hawaiian treatment. Okay fine, I don't really expect to be given the same amount of attention the regulars get, but when it gets to a point that they start ignoring the basics of simple service (just to prioritize some customers over others) then that's not right.   For those of you who were able to enjoy yourselves and give this place a glowing review, I hate and envy you very much.

sNtEpJS_zy2QcMyVrffNEg.text: This place has delicious food! Amazing service! The portions are huge! My boyfriend and I often share a combo plate. The fried rice is the best ever and the teriyaki steak is so yum!

TQ3wp2TNXMm5deRcHYjWyA.text: My favorite Hawaiian place to eat in Las Vegas.  My favorite entrees are the teriyaki chicken, kalbi, and poke.  Have yet to try the saimen soup but will do so when it gets cooler.  I didn't like every item.  Loco moco is not the greatest in my opinion and I thought the oxtail soup is way too salty.  Doesn't matter though, I pretty much stick with my favorite items when going there.

_mSgPssrVC9a7r2FC8P6Cw.text: Choke aloha here....very friendly kine staff...food ONO...Teri beef and furikake chicken broke da mouth...a vegas must  Mahaloz

2cor3KG_8SZfW0Ym1UvY6A.text: Hey, pretty good! Got the combo plate of Furikake chicken and the Korean style chicken. The Korean style chicken was delicious!  To work on: -Furikake chicken had too much breading:chicken ratio

DEA9mSuCR_UmuIAOJsHHJA.text: Been coming here since I moved to the SW part of LV and has never failed in comfort and flavor! Love this place

qzXtbUXavgFD2842abIaqw.text: I dont see the reason for the negative comments...After almost 8 years in Vegas I finally decided to try it because I needed my Kalua Pig fix...I called in my order and it was ready in 15 minutes (had to go back to work) it was so convenient and they are very friendly. The food was hot and fresh and it was so much food I have half the plate left over for dinner...I will definitely be eating here again and trying to sample everything on the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua Pig plate

xBqvfLIGQMCNRm06E5XxKg.text: Whenever I walk into Island flavor, I feel a sense of being home.  The Aloha spirit and hospitality the staff at island flavor shares with their guests are hands down what sets them apart from the rest.    Their food is amazing.  I love to get the korean chicken, kalbi combo with kalua pork, ahi shoyu poke and of course their chicken katsu loco.  I occasionally get their specials... which are amazing! In the past I've had their beef stew special, shoyu chicken special and their smoke meat special! Portions are massive, so come hungry! I really wish their oxtail soup had a bit more taste to it, because driving to the cal downtown is a bit of a drive to get my fix.   Definitely one of the spots I have cravings for every now and then, and would recommend it to anyone looking for good Hawaiian food in Las Vegas!

hrhYYGaXv-tS9fWYRRnyQg.text: I find it quite hilarious that I thought I was calling in an order to the Hawaiian takeout place that's in the same shopping center of the Vons at Warm Springs & Durango (I had ordered takeout there before but had forgotten the name). I called the order in and then, when I saw the address, realized I had ordered from a different place!    Being a business owner myself, of course I didn't want to leave my order uncalled for so I went down a few blocks and retrieved my order from Island Flavor. What a pleasant surprise!  I only ordered two plates: chicken Katsu and kalbi beef (?). The question mark is there because I swear when she confirmed the order it sounded so different than how I had pronounced it.   That beef was insane! So tender and delicious. The Katsu was good as to be expected at other Hawaiian places I've been.   I will definitely return and I'm glad I made that mistake! I actually hate macaroni salad because I hate mayo, but this was decent and had great onion flavor.

s8TsXH6JIlecKeGOrEmAwA.text: Our family's favorite Hawaiian style restaurant in Vegas. All the employees are so full of Aloha! Very helpful and welcoming.  Our favorites are Furikake Chicken, Shrimp, Kalbi, Teri Beef, Fried Rice, Chicken Katsu Loco Moco, Ahi Poke and of course the Hawaiian Plate on Fridays.   Desserts are awesome as well. Kona Mud Pie and Guava Chiffon. They have live music on Fridays as well and the ambiance is just like being in Hawaii.  Also important, they have Poi on deliveries Thursdays. It sells out fast.

TaBeKH6yNO-iqGGSt2kBPA.text: Usually like this place but, they need a more than less crunchy furikake chicken. I know it is double deep fried, but for it to be SO crunchy is unnecessary. You cut your mouth up just eating or your jaw hurts from chewing so much on the first bite. It's so unbearable. SOMETIMES it is good when I order, but most of the time, it's like a dig gnawing at a bone. They should have like different levels of how to deep fry the furikake chicken. Somethings like when ordering a steak. Where they ask if you want it medium, rare, or something like that... I don't know about this place...

QtBCybgJW7LSRUViUKGdEQ.text: What I had: Mix plate = Roasted pork (w/ gravy) (left) + Souyou Chicken (right) + 2 scoops rice + Mac + drink = $14+  The waitresses are nice and attended to me 3-4 times. The "big one" has a strong Hawaiian vernacular which I liked  THE GOOD: Better roasted pork then most other hawaiian places, covered with gravy loco moco style while other Hawaiian restaurants actually use hamburger patties for their loco moco. I prefer this roasted pork, reminds me of turkey and gravy and will PUT YOU TO SLEEP - I saw someone on here complaining about it being mostly fat - He must've gotten the bottom of the barrel because mine was mostly meat with only 1-2 pieces of fat - HUGE Portions - bring a toothpick ;)  The Souyou chicken is like a bowl with ACTUAL chicken breast and leg pieces in the soupy teriyaki-like thick broth. Not too sweet which is good cause teriyaki can make or break a dish... teriyaki taste was perfect, not too sweet, not too salty - This was on special because it was thursday and it was $9 by itself - but the waitress was kind enough to suggest i get the mix plate with that on it instead which was only $13 (before drink(s) - the chicken skin fat was ACTUALLY EDIBLE... unlike L&L BBQ which is veiny, super fat and makes me gag. Great food period  The mac and rice were decent but nothing to brag about  THE BAD: The "Tropical flavor" ice tea was disappointing because I was expecting something NICE - it was REALLY just passionfruit ice tea and it was bland and not even sweet. I had to add a couple Splenda packs to make it good  All-in-all I would highly recommend this place. It may seem pricey but the portion size will leave you stuffed and makes it well worth the money - You could NOT eat all day, then eat one $14 meal here and be stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you walk in the front door and sit in the left corner, this is what the restaurant looks like inside :)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I couldn&#39;t even finish my plate the portions are so large - Roasted pork (w/ gravy) (left) + Souyou Chicken (right)
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My receipt = Roasted pork (w/ gravy) (left) + Souyou Chicken (right) + 2 scoops rice + Mac + drink = $14+

grDhKPVrLG7mnyZDFPNiCg.text: I've tried a number of Hawaiian restaurants in the valley and by far this is my favorite. The expectations of this place really lives up to the hype with everyone on yelp and word of mouth. Service was pretty standard the day we visited and there was a good sized crowd eating lunch. My mom and I brought the little girl we babysit throughout the week and we ordered fried poke stack, mahi mahi salad, and grilled chicken.   Fried Poke Stack- this had a really good flavor. I'm guessing it was cooked with sesame oil and soy sauce. The portion was plenty enough to share which is why my parents were able to taste it. My parents enjoyed this as well because they believed it had a very homemade like-taste to it.   Mahi Mahi Salad- really delicious dressing is all I can say. The only thing I would ask for is it would have been better if they used cherry tomatoes instead of slicing a tomato into quarters. But loved the dressing once again.   Grill chicken- didn't get to try this because we ordered it for the little girl. But it came with three fillets.   Banana bread- I was really excited to try this because Ursula U. had raved about it in her review. It was pretty good, but not the best that I've tried or anything I would crave for. It could be because it's made with Cinnamon, which is something I'm not a big fan of.   TIP: everything is ENOUGH TO SHARE. Even if I'm a big eater, the portions here are huge!  Can't wait to come here to try more. Absolutely love it and recommend to anyone no matter what side of town you live on especially if you're into Hawaiian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried poke plate
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. island flavor salad... so good!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. teri chiecken

Z4dK8TYBqIaOMkUrJFEJ0A.text: Awesome place, great portions, good taste! Cashiers were friendly and attentive. Ordered through yelp and food was ready when I arrived.

10ZikzT9l4uR4FNO-Np4gQ.text: Second Hawaiian bbq place we've tried here in Vegas so far. Food was okay, but not memorable. What keeps me coming back though is their amazing Chantilli cake... $5 for an enormous slice! Totally worth it!

9kOCnjpD5Dn9Dh-sRk3QUA.text: This place is amazing.  I've been coming here for a little over a year now and have been meaning to review this place.    First off Momma at the counter is a fun and funny as anyone I've ever met.  The service is a bit slow so I factored that into the rating but not in a bad way.  Just in a you need to ask them for it if you want it way.  But they are always, always happy to get it for you.  My favorite is the Chicken Katsu Moco Loco.   My girl likes the Kalua Pig and Cabbage.  We have also tried the  Moco Loco, Chicken Katsu, Kalbi, Chicken Teriyaki, and Poke.  Everything is magnificent.  I have to admit, somedays the seasoning seems to be off.  Either not salty enough or too spicy.  This only tells me everything is being made fresh and it shouldn't bother me but it does.  Still I give high marks to this place and like I said I've been hitting this place up 2-3 times a month.

ENrknE6dDaZDfrE6bd5g9Q.text: I haven't tried a single thing here that I don't enjoy. The chicken and kalbi are my regular order but the katsu tastes great too. Portions are huge.

h5M59f8ESYOydl5eXVMmpg.text: I have eaten at a lot of mainland Hawaiian places, with most all of them not much more than mediocre and some of them a lot less than mediocre.  I have eaten at some of the best places in the islands, including Helena's where I have gone multiple times.  I gots to tell ya that the food at Island Flavor is AT LEAST as good as Helena's, and in some respects even better.  Everything was fresh, and real, and traditional.  The place is family owned, with the family being from Kona on the Big Island.  Portions were huge.  The oxtail soup was to die for.  Even the macaroni salad, which I normally hate, was very good with not too much mayo.  This place is awesome, Brudah.  Mahalo.

UOmyUKZ5AgXN6QKTNdvOiA.text: I love this place mainly for their large servings and flavorful dishes. I often get the mixed plate, which allows you to choose two courses from the list. I highly recommend the BBQ kalbi, furikake shrimp, and Korean chicken wings. All their orders come with rice and macaroni salad. As far as service goes, the staff are all very friendly, however, on busy days they seem to just focus their hospitality on their "usual" or Hawaiian customers. To me it doesn't bother me as long as I get my food but it would be nice if they were consistent on their good service. Overall, this place has great island food and you should take the time to try it.

lOehFeai4ucAefAYGOIiWA.text: We waited awhile for our server and our food. I ordered the steak and onions and the quality of the meat was unbearable. They were good with my kid but it's not my type of spot to eat at. My friend had read all the great reviews but honestly... I don't get it. Maybe Hawaiian food is not my thing. I gave three stars because they were nice.

kQKCUj215x4KfUFpnBURuw.text: My favorite Hawaiian BBQ Yet in Vegas.   Super Friendly and considerate family owned business.  You can tell they take pride in all areas of there business.  I regularly watch Bar Rescue, Hotel Rescue, ETC. and as a promoter for Marquee NightClub here in Vegas I am very Good at reading people.   THIS FAMILY CARES.  :)      The place is very clean as i showed up to get takeout like the other Hawaiian BBQ Places out here and when i walked in I thought it was DINE-IN only.     I almost felt weird waiting for my food as i was not dressed appropriately.  LOL  Food came and the helping are HUGE.   It took three sittings to eat the KALBI RIBS and KATSU CHICKEN with Macaroni Salad and Rice.     Great Quality Compared to all other Hawaiian BBQ's out here.    And the location is great for me right down the street.  I will be back many more times and i will add to this review.  :)

2yrGs6RMH_N8uw_YFIFThw.text: This place is right down the street from us.  I accidently found it on yelp and we decided lets go get some. I got a mixed plate. Teriyaki chicken and beef. I took one bite of the beef and I was in Heaven. (Usually a chicken girl) It was so amazing. I'm only going there from now on. Very friendly there too.  We got it too go so not sure if you get more when you dine there. Portion was plentiful.

uGunje1zpUhTcNnDEd3Wew.text: I really don't know why some give this place a one star? What are you comparing this place to? This is my third review because I love this place. It is the Best "local" Hawaiian food place in Vegas! I don't think you would find a better value for the portion size of food they serve. Overall, most of their food is awesome. Can you find better food in Oahu? Of course you can, but we are in Las Vegas.

8NP6QEMNumBjtss91RVU1A.text: I wish I could give a zero star from our experience on how my family and I were treated last night.  We got to the restaurant about 730pm and had to put our names on the waiting list because it was a Friday night and a little crowded.  We were told there was two parties a head of us and it's going to be around 20 minutes or little longer which is fine since we drove all the way down from  northwest las vegas.  We waited outside with the other two parties and  ten minutes had past and one party was called.  About twenty minutes later a young couple arrived and went inside but never came out so I'm guessing they must have tables available.  Its about 8:15 and we have been waiting for 30 minutes now outside in the  mid 90s heat so my wife went inside to check how much longer the wait would be but come to find out our name was crossed off the list and the couple  who had came 10 minutes after us was already seated.  So I asked the gentlemen at the counter the one I had talked to when i first put my name on the list why my name was crossed off and he said that someone said you had cancelled....REALLY!  Someone else had said I cancelled not I   but someone else.  I was shocked that I was told someone had cancelled our names that was not me. And the young man tries to blamed this on us and then says that there was still a bigger party ahead of us which I knew but that wasn't my point.  If you are running the front counter and the list pay attention to who comes first and who is waiting especially since you have a big window and can obviously see outside because there was no room inside to wait.  My point was that the customer who came 10 minutes later were already  seated on a table seating for four when they were a party of two.  Our name was put back on the list but we never got I'm sorry we made a mistake so we home.  I wish I was writing a review on how good or bad the food was but we will never get a chance because my family and I will never go back.  We are from Hawaii and always support Hawaiian own business but never been treated like that before.    B.D

4TMHBlV_9gsubaUo9Cq1_w.text: One of the main reasons I started to be proactive with reviewing on Yelp was because of this place. Over a year ago, after my first visit here, I was so pleased with my dining experience at Island Flavor I felt this place deserved to be found out about.   I've been here now well over 30 or so times, and have tried about 90% of the menu. Everything has remained consistent including the food and service. Only change is they are now getting busier, it's often hard to get a seat!   My favorite dishes to date are the kalua pig, chicken katsu, korean chicken, Lau Lau, oxtail soup and the poki is great.   Things I personally have come not to like are the roast pork loco moco and the fried rice with Portuguese sausage, both a little too salty for my tastes, but many other people seem to enjoy them.  Perhaps my favorite part of being a regular at this restaurant is the overall family atmosphere which is very welcoming and relaxing. I'm always treated like I'm one of their own.  If you still haven't been here, there's a serious problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu and teriyaki chicken. Simplicity wins.

9gwgQD8Oj1IJAdeNX8cRdA.text: Had the shoyu chicken was delicious! The staff were so friendly I will definitely be back. They also have a nice little Hawaiian market right next door.

P7sDzVQtcrStZcYQdz4xdQ.text: Great food, fast service, reasonable prices.  What more can you ask for?

q21Dhchukl-cFuIR26p1Kg.text: Favorite Hawaiian place to eat in Vegas. Portions are huge, good is a great price, and service is friendly. Highly recommend!

2zrfouVVmgHCQRqz_9kEsw.text: Awesome Kalbi & fried rice omelet! This place never disappoints! Friendly service and delicious desserts!

wVvkgIszWLOxaDIJhqTLpA.text: I stopped in yesterday for my pickup of Loco Moco. However when I got home I checked and my hamburger patty was burnt. I called and they offered to  redo my order. Wonderful customer service and the good is great. I love love love the Chantilly and Guava cake.

CeqdCiP32MKCAU7wBHMHLw.text: After trying a few different hawaiian places I would recommend this one out of all of them.   There is plenty of parking available and the staff is very friendly.   I would recommend their Kalbi ribs or Kahlua pig with cabbage.  They both cone with macaroni salad on the side.

ul7kChEQkIh-yq9ZxBASTQ.text: Why am I am giving this establishment a meager 2 stars? Short story: OK food doesn't make up for bad service. And bad service should never be present at a hawaiian restaurant. Chinese, OK. Hawaiian, no.  Long story: My sister was visiting with her baby and I wanted to take her, the baby, my dad and my brother somewhere near my area for a quick lunch. I found Island Flavor on my Yelp app and liked what I saw. It wasn't very packed when we came in and they had enough room for our small stroller. Immediately noticed our waitress seemed perturbed that we had brought the stroller in. As we sat down, my sister noticed that her child needed a diaper change so she asked the waitress if they had a changing area in their restroom. Nope. But that was ok, not all restaurants have this luxury. So she took her baby back to the car to change her there. She was back in around 10 minutes and as soon as she sat down, our waitress came by and asked if we were ready to order. We look up at her quizzically because I was sure that she saw my sister just sat down. The waitress scowling then adds, "Are you ready? Yes or no?" I chose to ignore her curt behavior at that moment. My sister quickly made a decision and we got our food.   The portions were very plentiful. My dad and sister's order of kalbi ribs was pretty good. My porkchops however were bland and were not grilled as how I imagined porkchops would be. My brother's chicken barbecue was just OK but not as good as other hawaiian barbecue places. After we all got a drink refill, our surly waitress never came back to check on us. I even had to ask for the check from another waitress who I overheard talking to another customer. I believe she said that the owner was at the cash register and that our sour waitress was apparently the owner's daughter. Well, after what seemed like forever, the entire restaurant is almost empty and no waitress to take our credit card, we all get up and I hand our payment to the cashier/owner. I believe we have been perfectly reasonable customers and the baby didn't even make a big fuss so I'm very perturbed by this place. More unforgivable that an owner shows bad customer service at a hawaiian restaurant. The aloha spirit has left this building, folks.

bX6FauMFg1K1lIOV1P5GWg.text: Food was mediocre I've had better Hawaiian food.  The service was slow seemed to only care about their regulars.

oi5KSa05slUTnrLxIbmEeQ.text: Tried this one out to satisfy our oxtail soup craving for dinner, since California Hotel doesn't start serving theirs till after 11pm.  It's 1 less star for the wait.  We read reviews that lines could get long especially at night and we were so prepared for that.  Just a little disappointed that we saw 3 tables empty but they couldn't seat us.  They just didn't have enough servers to actually accomodate the people.  All the servers were stressed, kept running around.  Nevertheless, food came out great.  It was as good as we expected and yes, oxtail soup craving satisfied.  DH had the kalbi and steak combo and it looked more like a family meal to us.  Furikake chicken and poke bowl was bomb.  I'd come back definitely, but probably at an odd time next time.  I wish they had a bigger place too.  Maybe it's time to expand! ;P

Defn6M5tsbYQfz7USp660Q.text: The food is always good. Our go to is Chicken Katsu & Furikake Chicken!!!! The atmosphere is always amazing, & sometimes they play live music as well. The food is savory & sweet at the same time. Honestly, they have the best Hawaiian food on this side of town!!!

VEIPD7YHoYJFVWP2tMzlVQ.text: This has probably become my favorite Hawaiian restaurant. I usually try to order new items I haven't tried from a restaurant's menu but I had to order the Furikake Chicken and their Katsu again  their Katsu is perfect, golden outside super juicy and tender on the inside, I can't get enough of it.

5kxs8NG3t8BfC3QQ4z3ncQ.text: I've been here several times while visiting Las Vegas and it's always so good. It's a great spot to come to when you don't want the hustle and bustle of the Strip. The service is always great and friendly. I've gotten the the shoyu poke which always tastes fresh and it's served in big chunks of fish, the furikake chicken is my go to favorite. It's always so flavorful and the chicken is juicy. Their Mac salad is probably the best I've had in my experience with having Hawaiian food. I can't wait to come back when I visit again!

Mr10Rokj2s-opH2KOAXH5Q.text: Bought a cake from next door, hubby and I decided to have our lunch here since we never really drove on this side.   The food was great!  Flavors of Hawaiian local dish was spot on!  Service was good, but omg!, it took 25 minutes just to get our food!    Not sure if the cook skipped our ticket?, they were short of cooks?, or was the cook stuck on the Hawaiian Island time?  Unfrigginbelievable!

CARMWEFV5xcB8-lrGKMJZA.text: Another lunch and another trip to Island flavor. This time the original location in Durango. Today I had the chicken katsu loco moco. It is too good. It has rice, gravy, crispy katsu fried chicken and two eggs on top. My son had the kalbi ribs again and fried rice with a side of Mac salad. The portions are huge! Come hungry. Two dishes fed my family of four and we still have enough leftovers for another meal. The ribs were juicy, the heaping pile of fried rice was delicious and the Mac salad is always consistently good. I honestly have never had a bad meal here. The place does get busy but we were served quickly and the whole staff is always friendly and helpful. My coworkers like coming here every Friday and I join them sometimes, so at least twice a month we are here.

wtu9wPUbOuYJsq7kz3umAQ.text: We love island flavor and have been a consistent customer throughout the years. It's been great to see them expand the restaurant eating area and update the place. My husband loves the katsu chicken salad.  And if you ever have a chance to save room for dessert, you won't be disappointed. You might need to share though!

8lDaX98uRUfPIlj9auJkKw.text: Great food. Was super hungry and the food came out quick. Like the fact that they added more tables.

Ujc86fKRTvWs1Bqz8OMmdw.text: Tried this place out with my clients just the other day for lunch....I'm still questioning in my head about the 2 servers , one that brought us to our table and the one that's named on my receipt with the M name. Anyway, it was obvious that it was our first time being there and our server seemed to be rushing us, she didn't try to explain any of the specials or anything really. She seemed to be more occupied with the girl at the register and seemed like gossiping. Food was so so, some on point, others salty. We listened on her as she handled other newbies and my client says, "wow, that gal is great, now why weren't we treated like that, weren't we good enough to eat here?" We already live in a place that racially profile...didnt think this place would do that.

nSR1CSxGGSmPRiweWwoxRA.text: Came here for the first time with my family.  We each ordered something different so we can try it all.   We got the Teriyaki burger, Fluffy special and the chicken Katsu.    Everything was so delicious.  I would definitely return here and recommend coming here.

0i-dnoTS62Bq4AJxazyM6w.text: I don't know why it took me so FRIKKIN long to try this place. My boyfriend took me, for my first time. I was a bit sus, to be honest. a3CFbJUFZCcoio5q56NSfw.text: Great food.  Great staff.  Have to have the mix plate with Kalbi and Katsu.  Kalbi fried rice is also great.

tv99E5P2b23ZTAwoxRwuqw.text: It's something when all 12 friends and family you know from Hawaii who now live in Vegas tell you this is the best place for authentic local Hawaii food in the city. The place is the real deal, best Hawaiian food I've had anywhere outside Hawaii. The crowd of people from Hawaii patiently waiting for a table in the Las Vegas summer heat at this unassuming strip mall of storefronts is testament to the quality of their food.  The people are sweet and friendly. Service as quick as can be with the crowd they manage along with the steady stream of phone-in orders coming in. When we came there was live Hawaiian music which set the perfect luau, sit diwn fir dinner with family mood.  The poke is the authentic kind, four flavors: sesame, spicy avocado, shoyu, and Hawaiian style - not the overly trendy kind popping up all over the mainland. Available in half pound or full pound.  Their laulau was is moist and perfectly seasoned and balanced - not too salty or fatty. Proof that it is fresh and made inhouse not frozen or reheated. Their kalbi has that great savory charbroiled flavor, not the overly sweet teriyaki that most Asian lunch joints try to pass as kalbi. The rest of my group shared the loco moco, chicken katsu, Hawaiian roast pork, and furikake chicken and wiped it out!  The servings are huge! Suitable for sharing by more dainty appetites but just right if looking to have a kanak attack!  Quick tip: avoid Friday dinner hours. Lines and waits are the longest then.

jdD93LHOXTiOdce3gu-qzg.text: Beef Stew on a Saturday was a perfect way to start my day.  The server on the other hand was questionable.  I felt awful that the owners had to take our order and after hearing her repeat to the server that was no where to be found after waiting almost 5 plus minutes for drinks with only 2 tables in the restaurant I was hoping that it would get better, but seconds later she had to come back and and ask us again what our order was.  I told her that that someone took our order and she went to give it to you and she replied that she forgot.  If I was in her position I would have asked the same woman that took my order in the first place to repeat it once again or WRITE IT DOWN!  Food was amazing, but Christina definitely needs a little bit more training on service.

O9ObMuMAZO05b7ctB-hcag.text: Giving it a solid 5 because of Price, Proportions, and the Furikake Chicken.  Second time eating there, first time checking in with the Yelp app. Their Furikake Chicken is reason enough for you to be a regular at this place. Whenever I see a customer not eating the Furikake Chicken, I think, "Come on maaaang" O_O.  I did try the other stuff too. The Roast Pork is nothing spectacular and their fried rice is soy sauce with char siu pork. Again, nothing spectacular.   Their Kalbi though is amazing. Tasted way different that any Korean or Hawaiian kalbi I ever tasted.   So heres the dream team mix plate you want to order everytime: Mix plate with Furikake Chicken, Kalbi, and white rice.   Friendly Staff, Great price, Atmosphere is meh but if you're going to get the chicken and the kalbi, who has time to look around?

urkIUPjNABeUpEVnGop54A.text: Been  going to the S. Durango location for years... Tonight unfortunately will be my last. The change in staff has been a rude awakening but we gave the food a chance. I changed my usual order of the Hosin Baby back ribs to the Kalua pork. Which isnt bad but led me to miss the menu change. The wife noticed the Loco Moco tasted different with the meat.   Tonight I went to order my favorite ribs. I get home open my containers and have some kind of dry supposed honey hoisin ribs with onion rings on top. When I call back thinking there must be some kind of mistake . I am told they took the old ribs off the menu and these are the replacement dish and how they come.   Gravy per the wife still the same but so far we notice small things are missing and food isnt as good and no love in the reastraunt anymore.

FczQSGW6SfTNE69Nfnhdiw.text: best Hawaii bbq forsure   Their Kalbi ribs are nice and tender and their teriyaki sauce is on point!   Lovin their Mac salad

m7wfPNbK8UtKi5s7KERayA.text: This place is pretty damn good! Def coming back! Get the Hoison baby back ribs  i wanted to order more!

9-_CNfPPt7rGXUfvof8Z9w.text: Lunch today Beef Stew and mixed plate with teriyaki chicken  and Hawaiian pork. Delicious with  large portions full of flavor.   Served piping hot. Service was good friendly and welcoming. They were pretty busy.   So happy we tried it out will definitely be back.  Definitely a shareable meal!

bBgUYiTwRz9Un8Vwfrz6Cg.text: I love days like today. I love it when I discover a fantastic place that serves tasty and flavorful food, with generous portions, providing friendly service, .....and all at a good price. Today we discovered Island Flavor!   In an effort to try as many different things as we could we each ordered a Mixed Plate Combo (which comes with your choice of 2 meats, rice/or fries, salad/or mac salad.) ($11.25 each, with an added charge of $1.00 for kalbi). I ordered the kalbi and teriyaki beef while my friend ordered the furikake chicken and hamburger steak. We both had the white rice and mac salad as sides and also ordered a side of fried rice with portugese sausage.  - Portion sizes are very generous! We actually ended up taking some of the food to go because we quickly realized how much we had ordered! lol Very filling and very satisfying! - I tried all 4 meats and have to say that all 4 were tremendous! The teriyaki beef and kalbi certainly stood out for me in  big way. These are going to be two items that I will be ordering quite frequently in the future! So juicy and each item packed so much flavor! - With that being said, this was my first time trying furikake chicken and I was not disappointed at all! Very crisp outer layer and juicy, meaty, and tender inside! The hamburger steak was also some of the best I've had in recent memory! - Service was fantastic from the word go! We were acknowledged and seated right away. Refills were taken care of in a friendly and expeditious fashion. Everyone I interacted with was friendly and smiling. I can't think of a way it could have gone better from a service standpoint. Very, very satisfied.  This is a slam dunk as far as I am concerned. You can bet that we will be here many times in the future for both dining in and taking orders to go! What a great find!  I love days like this! Now I'm ready to lay down and take a nap after eating all that  delicious goodness!  5 stars.  As good as it freaking gets!

It is a busy place so I recommend calling in your order and picking it up, the tables are always filled. Prices are decent and service is good. I have had their food twice. The chicken furikake was a good texture when I first had it, the 2nd time it was way over done or fried. Too hard to eat or enjoy, but I will give it another go, at a later time. Love the Hawaiian store next to it!

RT5Z1-J2hi5bjofdDBuxZg.text: I tried island flavor express in east side and it was really good so i decided to try this place since i moved to west side.  Howerever, the food was not that good as much as it in east side.  Short ribs were all burnt and the portion was smaller. Will not go back.

hdNrvYks_mMHJUq49d-xsg.text: I am extremely disappointed in Island Flavor. I literally just left the Durango location because of the amount of time I spent waiting for food and the horrible customer service. Upon getting there, we weren't even acknowledged until the party that arrived after us were. We spent 15 mins waiting for someone to ask if we needed a table. In addition to that, my party & I waited for over an hour for our food. By the time I got up to tell a waitress we were leaving, the waitress advised my order ticket STILL hadn't made it to the cooks. To make matters worse, somehow my order was not filled but tables that were seated after us, had their order taken and got their food before us. It would make sense to me if my order was complicated, BUT IT WASN'T. You know it's bad when those other tables around you take notice and say, "eh, you guys came first, ah?" OR "you guys never get your order yet?" The cherry on the sundae was not even getting an update on the status of our order. Our waitress disappeared and finally a host came and asked if we needed water. Since we had been waiting I asked the host for musubi's to which she said, "to go?" because she thought we finished eating!!! I had to tell her we didn't get our food yet and had been waiting. It's not a large restaurant, the fact that our table was overlooked throughout most of our time there is just ridiculous. I don't know what needs to be done on the restaurant/owners end but, something needs to change.

fFtSYiG5YBb84kMDJS866A.text: Best Hawaiian food not on the islands.  I live in L.A. and the "Hawaiian Food" we got over there pales in comparison to this spot located in the 9th Island.  Been here many times on our Las Vegas excursions. The Lau Lau is to die for.  The chop steak is good. The roast pork is good. The whole freakin menu is good.  And the portions are huge.  Customer service rocks!  They treat you like you're a cousin.  Open up a location in So. Cal.....PLEASE!!!

87C0Lt08sOWNfvzd4DZChg.text: Like the expansion, always thought expanding the restaurant portion made more sense than the small store, but you have to try to always improve your business.  Glad the new owner kept the same style of cooking.  Enjoy the oxtail soup during these cold nights in Vegas.  Very clean, staff has that Aloha Spirit keep it up.

gDES_vA2YxMGpin08wekQg.text: Didn't get what I ordered. I drove 20 minutes to get there and 20 back to find out the guy gave me the wrong order. Now they won't answer the phone. Go to the one on eastern.

e-y9vepF938XCTPQZrUGzQ.text: I don't see any of the original servers and staff. There is no Aloha feel in this place anymore. I went in and asked where she was, she got let go! Lei was there for almost 14 years! I didn't see Lei, so I left. Lei was always the server I had for the last 6 years I have been coming. After seeing these new reviews I understand why. In the past you could feel the Aloha from everyone. They were a family and you could see it, they treated the customers as if they were family. It's so sad how many of the staff that were there for years were not there. They made the restaurant comfortable, just like home in Hawaii. We go to Island Flavor for the Hawaiian food and the comfort of Ohana that the staff had. Even though you are the owner of the restaurant, without your loyal employees, you will not have a business. Employees make the money for you to have a business. The employees are the back bone of any business. How can you treat them so disrespectfully? As a Hawaiian, or as I have read in another review "You Hawaiians" have the best work ethic and customer service! For the servers that lost their job, they are the reason we come to eat and enjoy the place that makes us feel like we are home. This is why people who do not know and understand the Hawaiian Culture should never buy a Hawaiian restaurant. I will never come back!

lxZzsg8bAZSwyP79yR-X1A.text: The restaurant had been renovated and expanded. They did a great job. The food was good as usual and portions were generous. It's worth the wait in line and for your meals. The kitchen is small and things take awhile. The staff is always friendly and attentive. We met Fluffy, the comedian, there. Great guy. Super friendly. Kim, our server, was wonderful.

trKFsirxkvrjy3DFqNjPsQ.text: Nothing really nice to say other than the service I received from the young hawaiian waitress. She was very attentive and caring to our table. I ordered the furikake chicken and it tasted like complete s***. The last time I ordered this it was literally the scraps from the bottom and I thought I'd give it another try and was very disappointed, the chicken isn't cooked and it had a very bland taste. Its like they don't care how it turns out because they don't eat it. I wouldn't even feed this to my cats. Never again giving my money to this business.

azqaRCAks9o8ub3QqSuOaA.text: This is becoming our go-to place when heading into or out of Las Vegas. I've loved every dish I've ordered here , from the Loco Moco to the furikake chicken.    I'm also really impressed by their mac salad and all their desserts... Yes I have tried all their desserts!  There's nothing fancy here Kama just good Hawaiian food... And when my husband is happy with his ahi poke, then I am over the moon... And this has become his favorite spot for that.  We will continue searching out great Hawaiian food while in Las Vegas, but this is becoming one of our staples.

DUSQAqQagaVhw53jGG1lnw.text: Huge portions love furikake chicken but I always order that so I changed it to Korean chicken and now back to furikake shrimp!!! xzPSl4Lapxp4fJ9BjxdIHA.text: My favorite island food !!! Can't beat the Hawaiian hospitality !!! I go here at least once a month. The food is so ono !!! They also play live music. Absolutely the best !!! Be prepared with a huge appetite the plates are amazingly huge enough to feed two people, Love this place. Been coming here for years !!!

hzImz_YMWzFt_3AbfNnMQg.text: Yesterday was an epic random celebratory luncheon.  Try saying that 5 times. LOL.   We all know how I feel about this place.  Love it.  The food is total comfort.  The staff is AH-MAZE-ING.  I truly feel like I'm back home in Kona, Hawaii when I come here.  Partly because the owners and most of the staff is also from my hometown.    The ONLY suggestion I have for this place is to expand.  Either expand the current location or expand to another location on the east side of town.  When we arrive, there was a wait and the entire restaurant was filled.  Maika'i Island Flavor!  Business is booming.    I got the mix plate for 10.50- In my mix, I chose the chicken katsu dip and roast pork.  The chicken katsu is perfectly breaded and then drenched in their Korean sauce.  SOOOO GOOOD!!!  THE BEST chicken katsu I've had.  Every time.  The roast pork.  Believe me when I say that the roast pork outshined the katsu for me.  Tender, marbleized and served with a light brown gravy.  I didn't want that dish to stop for me!  For dessert, I got the Kona coffee mud pie slice for $5.50 and the Chantilly cake slice for $5.00.  The price sounds a little steep but trust me, you get your monies worth.  These cakes are served with whipped cream and both, a raspberry and lemon drizzle.  I'm in heaven.  The Chantilly cake is like a German chocolate without the coconut and the mud pie is an orgasm in your mouth LOL.  The Oreo cookie crust held this monumental slice of heaven together.    Although everyone at the table got so many different things, my cousin got the shoyu poke which I have to rave about.  This poke was accompanied with onions, green onions and soy sauce.  If you've ever had the fortunate opportunity to try poke, you need to get this dish.  The raw chunks of tuna were fresher than fresh.  The soy sauce was perfect for the dish. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.  This place always does it for me.  It's a shame I never go as often as I should because of the travel time.  When I do though, I'm always confident that my entire experience will top notch!

_LWMr9dbhvaOhgmBXF6QWg.text: My brother took us to this wonderful little family style Hawaiian home cooking. The food was delish!

7i2mBNE46bND4hbR0S8SJg.text: I do enjoy the food here . Finding good island food like how you would get in Hawaii is state find in Las Vegas. My favorites are the Kalbi, Fried rice and the weekly specials. My wife insists we come every Tuesday for the Fries Noodles. All dishes are ample portions. Most like you will have leftovers for the fridge tomorrow. The Chantilly vale is to for. The live music on the selected weekend is a treat. Service here is always on point. Keep up the great work it's like you on an island in the middle of the desert.

JG4ucoQSERsJMW5Zok4kbw.text: Musubi good poke good Kalbi good but the chicken furikake taste good but I wish they would drain the extra sauce it was too greasy but they have my favorite which is guava cake which made my day will be retuning to try other things..my nieces aunt owns this place so I must show support

AFViD8I_MBVbGBtSzTj1YQ.text: My wife and I moved here from Hawaii in December, and one of the things we really missed was local-kine plate lunch. We drove all over Vegas checking places out but only so-so--no flavor or too salty, too expensive and manini portions, no can cook rice--whaaat? So when we found Island Flavor only a few miles from our house in the southwest part of town--oh, yeah! Generous portions for the price, great variety and taste, local dishes on-point--Zippy's should get lessons from these guys! Even the sides are great, like the mac salad and green salad--the dressing is some secret recipe and supa ono! Crew working there are really friendly and make you feel like you're ohana, even crack jokes with us, which is so welcome. Wife loves the furikake chicken and Korean chicken, while I like everything but their beef stew is broke da mouth (special on Saturday only--made me wanna lick the bowl!) and the Hawaiian style roast pork (gravy all over--awesome!). We bring friends from Hawaii here, and they all agree that Island Flavor is aurite!! So go check'um out!

iQqmKUF9xUprB_uFSGvNpg.text: Their Furikake chicken is addicting! Always on my pick up order list. After your meal you must order the Kona Coffee mudpie! It's delish!

eixJWneKgpabCHwRkFksRg.text: First time here. Just moved here from the Big Island a couple of weeks ago. My boyfriend and I have been looking around for some local hawaiian food and found this place on Yelp (and also recommended from some guy that we met at another island food restaurant, who is also from hawaii too).   Anyways, we were not disappointed. FOOD WAS AMAZING and plates were HUGE. We were only able to finish half of our plates. I would recommend ordering the FURIKAKE CHICKEN, AHI POKE, FRIED POKE & BBQ KALBI plate. Looking forward to coming back and trying other dishes, and hopefully save room for dessert this time haha.  Other than that, it made us feel like home with the island music and friendly staff^_^

VmPCaqC2boCbjhElUbSnNA.text: This is my favorite Hawaiian spot. Their specials are delish. I had the hoisin babybackribs and that was yuuuum! It fell right off the bone.  It was such larg portion that I saved the other half for lunch.  Even better as left overs!!!!  We came in at a perfect time right before the rush and were seated quickly and while we ate we listened to some live Hawaiian music. For dessert since I couldn't make up my mind my fiance and I shared the haupia AND we took home the chantilly and guava cake. Yup, their dessert is that good!

I had an awesome waiter, he refilled our drinks, always talking to is with a huge big smile. My family and I had a awesome lunch.

SL8-bd9JD2ed6TyQQ4FelA.text: This place is a gem! The food was wonderful. We ordered furikake chicken, khakis pork, furikake shrimp, and teriyaki beef. So. Much. Food!  Service was great. The wait time to get a table was long, but it's because this place is super busy on Sunday.  I would definitely come back.

YocBnoTTVIaaU00ig8gavQ.text: When your appetite demands island size proportions; Island Flavor has your fix. This neighborhood delight has everyone leaving properly satisfied every time. Bring your loved ones and your appetite and get fed well at Island Flavor. Try and share the Furikake Chicken!

hoUkP0pW86vYWUqwdlfBEg.text: Came here today at the recommendation of another yelper Anthony P. I've been here before and ordered the normal kalua pig or kalbi and It was pretty good. Anthony recommended I try the Hoison glazed ribs and holy shit he was right. They are fall off the bone perfect and for the price I think they are losing money. Most places charge $20 just for the ribs but for $14 you get some great ribs and 2 sides. Suffice to say I have a new rib place.  Don't think they are being rude if you don't "feel" the service, They treat you like family which feels really good. Aloha spirit is all over this place and it feels pretty good.

FiWUTXZ6M_zQAIAF9ncpBA.text: First time here and loved the food and service. Had the Pork Adobe. A lot of reviews recommend the Katsu chicken so I will have to try it on my next visit

RNIAzk7QmcF4Ga1ClR98Aw.text: My kind of place. Love the portion and the food is delicious. I go here at least couple times a month. Roast pork and Korean chicken is bomb

al6avDohx4GJAcLtlhS2LA.text: The best Hawaiian Food in Las Vegas so far.  The Mac salad is very authentic, like from the islands.  The Lau Lau is good and not too salty.  I usually get the Chopped Steak w/onions and Korean wings.  The taste is very sweet and savory.  The chicken is crispy.  The Ox Tail soup is also very flavorful w/o being too salty.  The Guava Cake is extraordinary.  I know they get it from next door, but it's Island Flavor's recipe.  The guava is infused in the cake batter and you can taste a hint of it with every bite.  Not too over powering.    The service is great and they also refill your Guava or POG juice!  If you are feeling homesick and miss island food, this the place to go!
